42685489|The relative growth supporting values and also the effect on endogenous respiration of carbohydrates and amino acids were determined in the case of Fusarium solani f. sp. pisi (Jones) Snyd. et Hans. Out of the nine carbohydrates mannitol and sucrose increased the rate of respiration considerably. Ribose, mannose, raffinose and dextrose showed stimulation in the rate of respiration while three disaccharides i. e. maltose, cellobiose and lactose inhibited the rate of respiration. All the carbohydrates were utilized well but dextrose, maltose and raffinose gave more weight of mycelium of the pathogen as compared to sucrose. Out of twenty amino acids, proline and hydroxyproline very strongly stimulated both the processes. Leucine and isoleucine were not well utilized for mycelial growth but stimulated the rate of respiration. Glycine, threonine, serine, tryptophan, tyrosine, alanine, phenylalanine, histidine and methionine though showed good mycelial growth yet strongly inhibited respiration. Valine and lysine showed moderate utilization and increase of respiration. Arginine, aspartic acid and glutamic acid stimulated the respiration and were very well utilized for mycelial growth by the pathogen. Cysteine and cystine were moderately utilized for growth, negligibly inhibited the rate of respiration. Sono stati determinati l'accrescimento del micelio e la respirazione di Fusarium solani f. sp. pisi (Jones) Snyd. et Hans, in presenza di vari carboidrati e amminoacidi. Fra nove carboidrati, mannitolo e saccarosio hano indotto un considerevole aumento nella respirazione. Ribosio, manosio, raffinosio e destrosio hanno stimolato il tasso di respirazione mentre tre disaccaridi: maltosio, cellobiosio e lattosio, lo hanno inibito. Tutti i carboidrati sono stati bene utilizzati dal fungo; destrosio, maltosio e raffinosio hanno favorito un aumento di peso del micelio rispetto a saccarosio. Di venti amminoacidi, prolina e idrossiprolina hanno stimolato entrambi i processi. Leucina e isoleucina non hanno indotto incrementi di peso del micelio ma hanno favorito la respirazione. Glicina, treonina, serina, triptofano, tirosina, alanina, fenilalanina, istidina e metionina, pur favorendo l'accrescimento del micelio, hanno fortemente inibito la respirazione. Valina e Usina sono state moderatamente utilizzate e hanno moderatamente favorito la respirazione. Arginina, acido aspartico e acido glutammico hanno stimolato la respirazione e sono stati ben utilizzati per l'accrescimento del micelio. Cisteina e cistina, moderatamente utilizzate per la crescita del micelio, hanno inibito in forma trascurabile la respirazione. On a dtermin l'accroissement du mycelium et la respiration de Fusarium solani f. sp. pisi (Jones) Snyd. et Hans, en prsence de diffrents carbohydrates et aminoacides. Parmi neuf carbohydrates, manitol et sucrose ont caus une augmentation remarquable dans la respiration. Ribose, mannose, raffinose et dextrose ont stimul le taux de respiration tandis que trois disaccharides,  savoir, maltose, cellobiose et lactose ont inhib le taux de respiration. Tous les carbohydrates ont t bien utiliss par le champignon; dextrose, maltose et raffinose ont favoris une augmentation de poids du mycelium par rapport au sucrose. Sur vingt aminoacides, proline et hydroxyproline ont stimul les deux processus. Leucine et isoleucine n'ont pas caus une augmentation de poids du mycelium mais ont stimul la respiration. Glycine, threonine, serine, tryptophane, tyrosine, alanine, phenylalanine, histidine et methionine tout en favorisant l'accroissement du mycelium, ont pourtant inhib fortement la respiration. Valine et Usine ont t peu utilises et ont modrment favoris la respiration. Arginine, acide aspartique et acide glutammique ont stimul la respiration et ont t bien utiliss pour l'acroissement du mycelium. Cysteine et cystine modrment utilises pour l'accroissement du mycelium ont peu inhib la respiration.
42683726|Four different isolates of Fusarium responsible for vascular wilt of Egyptian Cotton have been compared as regards their morphological characters and physiological behaviour under varying cultural conditions. Preliminary pathogenicity experiments proved variation in the pathogenic potentialities of the four isolates towards susceptible Egyptian Cotton varieties. Morphological and physiological variations among the isolates were shown on a variety of agar media, as well as on varying temperature, pH value and carbon and nitrogen sources of liquid culture media. The four isolates were identified as Fusarium oxysporwn Schl. f. vasinfectum (Atk.) Sn. et Hans., F. solani (Mart.) App. et Wr., F. vasinfectum (Atk.) f Wr. strain Fahmy, and F. vasinfectum Atk. Wr. souche Fahmy et F. vasinfectum Atk. 43872358|Surveys for virus and virus-like diseases were carried out in commercial vineyards in the provinces of Rahovec and Suhareka of Kosovo. Samples were collected at random from 306 individual vines for laboratory testing. Leafroll and rugose wood symptoms were commonly observed in the field, whereas fanleaf symptoms were very rare. A total of 68% of ELISA-tested vines (208 out of 306) was infected by one (40.9%) or multiple (27.1%) viruses. The highest infection rate was found in Suhareka province (75%). Grapevine fleck virus (GFkV) was the most widespread (52.0%), followed by Grapevine leafroll-associated virus 3 (GLRaV-3, 18.3%), Grapevine leafroll-associated virus 1 (GLRaV-1, 15.7%), and Grapevine virus A (GVA, 11.1%). Other economically relevant viruses occurred rarely, i.e. Grapevine fanleaf virus (GFLV, 1.6%), Grapevine virus B (GVB, 1.0%) and Grapevine leafroll associated virus 2 (GLRaV-2, 0.3%). Arabis mosaic virus (ArMV) was not found. Some of the most important grapevine varieties cultivated in Kosovo, i.e. Smederevka, Vranac, Prokupac, Italian Muskat, Muskat of Hamburg, and Italian Riesling, had average infection rates that ranged from 63% to 85%. In RT-PCR, Grapevine rupestris stem pitting associated virus (GRSPaV) was detected in 80.4% of the vines. Vein mosaic and vein necrosis symptoms were detected in graft-inoculated V. riparia and 110R indicators. At least one virus-tested candidate clone of 19 different grapevine varieties were identified, that could represent a potential primary source for a grapevine certification program in Kosovo.
42685834|Field isolates of Botryotinia fuckeliana (Botrytis cinerea) which displayed high resistance to benzimidazoles accompanied by insensitivity to diethofencarb were crossed with reference strains carrying Mbc1S or Mbc1HR alleles of the Mbc1 resistance gene to determine the genetic basis of their unusual phenotype. Genetic analysis of meiotic progeny showed that all field isolates were allelic with reference strains. Thus, in B. fuckeliana alleles of the Mbc1 gene cause high resistance to benzimidazoles but do not cause hypersensitivity to diethofencarb. Therefore, protection strategies with the mixture of carbendazim and diethofencarb should be aimed at reducing the selection pressure which favours mutants which are not controlled by both fungicides. Isolati di Botryotinia fuckeliana (Botrytis cinerea) che mostravano alta resistenza ai benzimidazolici accompagnata da insensibilit al diethofencarb sono stati incrociati con ceppi di riferimento portatori degli alleli Mbc1S o Mbc1HR del gene di resistenza Mbc1 per determinare le basi genetiche del loro inusuale fenotipo. L'analisi genetica di progenie meiotiche ha mostrato che tutti gli isolati erano allelici con i ceppi di riferimento. In B. fuckeliana, quindi, alleli del gene Mbc1 possono causare alta resistenza ai benzimidazolici senza causare ipersensibilit al diethofencarb. Le strategie di protezione con la miscela di carbendazim e diethofencarb dovrebbero pertanto mirare a ridurre la pressione di selezione che favorisce i mutanti non sensibili ad entrambi i fungicidi.

An investigation for detecting the presence of Fusarium moniliforme Sheld. within Maize (Zea mays L.) kernels was carried out on samples drawn out from silos at sea ports, from feed manufacturers storehouses (15 samples) or supplied by seed Companies (83 samples). F. moniliforme was consistently present in all samples from feed manufacturers either in washing water, or in the seed fragments (calculated as 7% in weight), or in the meal prepared from apparently healthy kernels. In the seeds supplied by Companies (generally constituted by hybrids), F. moniliforme was successfully found in 97% of the samples in spite of the presence of fungicide dressing. Percentages of infected kernels ranged between 1 and 30% in 50% of the samples; between 31 and 70% in 36% of the samples; and between 71 and 100% in 7% of the samples. Attention is called on the risk to use infected kernels both for quality and quantity of Maize productions or for damages to animal fed with Fusarium-infected material. The importance to use healthy seeds in areas new for Maize cultivation is pointed out. It is also suggested to process the seeds in a mixture of steam and air as done for other internal pathogens, before dressing with wide-range action compounds. 42683740|La gravita e la diffusione del  mosaico  del Mandorlo (Prunus amygdalus Batch.) nel Mezzogiorno d'Italia ci ha indotto a dare inizio ad una serie di osservazioni e ricerche nel tentativo di: 1) identificare piante sane in campo e 2) risanare parti di pianta e/o piante intere con acqua e aria calda. I risultati del primo biennio di ricerche indicano che l'agente delia malattia  spesso latente in moite delle cultivars pi comunemente coltivate in Puglia. Ci, pur rendendo la selezione visiva, intesa quale mezzo di identificazio ne di piante madri sane, molto laboriosa e di non sicuro affidamento, non eselude tuttavia la possibile esistenza di piante indenni. La termoterapia con acqua calda non ha dato risultati apprezzabili, essendosi ottenuto un notevole danneggiamento degli organi trattati, ma non il loro completo risanamento. Incoraggianti, invece, sono apparsi i risultati della termoterapia con aria calda. Sembrerebbe infatti che con l'esposizione di piante intere a 38  1C per 3-4 settimane si riesca ad inattivare il virus localmente nelle gemme e che, in qualche fortunato caso, con esposizioni pi lunghe sia forse possibile ottenere il completo risanamento dei soggetti trattati. The mosaic is one of the most widespread and, probably, the most serious virus disease of Almond trees (Prunus amygdalus Batch.) in Southern Italy where it is not uncommon to come upon orchards where up to 95% of the plants are manifestly affected. Such an unfortunate situation has suggested to undertake a series of investigations aiming to secure virus-free propagating material through: 1) identification of healthy plants in the field, and 2) heat-therapy of whole plants and/or bud-sticks by means of hot-air and hot-water treatment. The results of the first two years studies indicate that the causal agent of the disease is often latent in many of the Almond cultivars commonly grown in Apulia. In fact only. 2 out of 11 symptomless trees of 10 different cultivars did not induce symptoms when indexed on apparently healthy Almond seedlings. Hence visual selection, as a means of identification of healthy mother plants appears undependable and exceedingly laborious. Hot-water therapy produced considerable injuries to the treated organs without yielding recovery from virus. Results of hot-air treatment were encouraging for the virus was locally inactivated within the bud by exposing whole plants at 38  1C for 3-4 weeks. In addition, indication are that, in some instances, whole plants may be completely freed from virus by extending the exposure to hot-air up to 2-3 months. Further trials are now under way in the hope that the encouraging results obtained up to now will be confirmed by further experimental evidence. La gravit et la diffusion de la  mosaque  de l'Amandier (Prunus amygdalus Batch.) dans le midi d'Italie nous a incit  commencer une srie d'observations et de recherches visant : 1) identifier des plantes saines en champ et 2) assainir des parties de plante et/ou des plantes entires avec de l'eau ou de l'air chaud. Les rsultats de deux ans de recherches indiquent que l'agent de la maladie est frquemment latent dans plusieurs des cultivars plus communment cultives en Pouille. En effet des 11 arbres apparemment sains de 10 diffrentes cultivars deux seulement n'ont pas caus des symptmes, lorsqu'ils ont t greffs sur de petites plants de semis apparemment saines. La slection visuelle pour l'identification de plantes mres saines semble donc trs laborieuse et ne donne pas de garanties. La thermothrapie  l'eau chaude n'a pas donn de rsultats apprciables, car elle a caus un dgt remarquable des organes traits, et non pas leur assainissement complet. Au contraire, les rsultats de la thermothrapie  l'air chaud ont t encourageants. En effet il semblerait que, avec l'exposition de plantes entires  38  1C pendant 3-4 semaines, on russit  inactiver le virus localement dans les bourgeons et que, en quelque cas heureux, avec des expositions plus longues, il soit possible d'obtenir l'assainissement complet des sujets traits.
42684495|Following electron microscopy observations performed on thin sections from different floral portions of Gladiolus with twisted floral spikes and virescent flowers, mycoplasma-like organisms (MLO) were found. In control material, MLO were not observed. No virus-like particles were found in the tested samples. The MLO were observed either in sieve tubes or in the cytoplasm of phloem parenchyma cells. Next to normal forms, MLO with morphological modifications, such as the presence of granules and accumulations of irregular contents in the cytoplasmic matrix, were observed. Such ultrastructural alterations are interpreted as being a result of a degeneration process. A seguito di osservazioni al microscopio elettronico effettuate su sezioni sottili di diverse porzioni fiorali di Gladiolo con sintomi di spiralizzazione dello scapo fiorale e di virescenza dei singoli fiori, sono stati rinvenuti dei corpi riferibili a micoplasmi (MLO). Nel materiale di controllo che non presentava sintomi essi non sono stati riscontrati. Nessun virus  stato inoltre evidenziato nei campioni in esame. I MLO sono stati osservati nei tubi cribosi e nel citoplasma delle cellule parenchimatiche del floema. Accanto a forme normali sono stati osservati MLO con mrcate modificazioni morfologiche quali presenza di granuli e di ammassi di forma irregolare all'interno delle matrici citoplasmatiche. Tali alterazioni ultrastrutturali vengono interpretate, in base ai dati bibliografici, come risultato di un processo degenerativo.

The strain of AMV isolated had a thermal inactivation point of 54-56C, a dilution end point of 10-10 and a longevity in vitro of 34 days. The virus was purified by homogenizing infected leaves of Cucumis sativus L. with chloroform and carrying out differential centrifugation cycles. In 10-40% sucrose density gradient three components formed by particles of 28 nm in diameter were observed. The top component appeared to be made up of non-infective particles deprived of RNA, whereas the middle and bottom components were constituted of infective particles with varying RNA content. 42685554|La rsistance au Stemphylium contrle par le gne Sm est de la plus grande importance en pays tropicaux, et pourrait le devenir dans le bassin mditerranen et des pays plus nordiques, en cultures sous serres, o la Stemphyliose a fait son apparition rcemment. 43872338|Erwinia amylovora was detected on pome fruits in the Aragn region (North-Eastern Spain), in a ca. 5 km radius area located in the mid Jaln river (mid Ebro Valley) in the province of Zaragoza, during 2000-2003. Eight years have now passed since this pathogen was last detected, without new infections being reported in the same area. The bases for surveys and rapid eradication performed have been analyzed in detail to understand the reasons for the success in removing fireblight. The results demonstrate that intensive surveillance, risk assessment, plant analyses using accurate identification methods, and, especially, rapid total or selective eradication of infected trees in the plots have been very effective in preventing the generalized spread of fireblight and in delaying economic losses associated with this disease. Eradication and compensation to growers, estimated to cost approx.  467,000, were clearly counterbalanced by the economic value of apple and pear production in the 2000-2003 period (approx.  368 million). Fire blight risk-assessment, using the MARYBLYT system, showed that climatic conditions in the studied area were favourable to infections during the analyzed period (1997-2006). Molecular characterization of E. amylovora strains had revealed their homogeneity, suggesting that these fire blight episodes could have been caused by just one inoculum source, supporting the hypothesis that there was a unique introduction of E. amylovora in the studied area. Spatial spread of E. amylovora to trees was analyzed within six orchards, indicating an aggregated distribution model. This Spanish experience demonstrates the success of scientificallybased prevention methods that lead to the deployment of a fast and strict containment strategy, useful for other Mediterranean areas.
42685582|Nel corso di tre anni,  stata studiata in Sicilia l'influenza esercitata dalla temperatura sulla germinazione delle oospore di Plasmopara viticola (Berk, et Curt.) Berl. et De Toni. Ooospore raccolte in autunno e poste a svernare in condizioni simili a quelle naturali hanno germinato, nella primavera successiva, a temperature comprese tra 10 e 28C, con optimum a 20-22C. La germinazione  stata pi rapida a 22-24C e piuttosto lenta alle basse temperature. I risultati di queste prove vengono discussi in relazione alla loro implicazione nella previsione delle infezioni primarie della peronospora della Vite. During a tree-year trial, an investigation on the effect of temperature on oospore germination in Plasmopara vitcola (Berk, et Curt.) Berl. et De Toni has been carried out in Sicily. Oospores collected in autumn and overwintered in near natural conditions, in the following spring germinated from 10 to 28C, with an optimum at 20-22C. Germination was rather slow at low temperatures, reaching the shortest lenght at 22-24C. Finally, considerations on the implications of the results obtained in this investigation on the forecast of primary infections of the grapevine downy mildew are made.

Several species or varieties of Cupressus from different sources were tested for their comparative susceptibility to C. cardinale canker under heavy field inoculations provided by an infected cypress wind-screen hedge. All the species were intected but relative susceptibility appeared quite different between sources or even between individual trees from the same seedlings. C. macrocarpa, C. abramsiana and C. goveniana were the most susceptible species while C. torulosa and C. dupreziana showed promising relative resistance. C. arizonica and C. sempervirens had intermediate behaviour with noticeable differences between sources. From a practical standpoint, selection of resistant or tolerant varieties must take in consideration such a big genetic variability in cypress populations and a survey of pathogenic variation in C. cardinale. Investigations in this way need improved and fast testing methods and an international cooperation.

42683999|The cytology of Eggplant and Tomato leaf tissues naturally and artificially infected with the agent of Eggplant mottled dwarf (EMDV) and the fine structure of virus particles were investigated with the electron microscope. Tissues were processed with both conventional procedures (primary aldehyde fixative followed by osmium tetroxide postfixation) and the uranyl soak method. Infection by EMDV did not appear to induce strikingly severe cytological changes in either of the hosts studied. Also the different fixing procedures caused cytological modifications of no consequence. Virus particles occurred in groups of several elements, sometimes arranged in paracrystalline aggregates, in perinuclear position between the inner and the outer lamella of the nuclear envelope. The particles were either bacilliform or bullet-shaped. The former occurred free in the perinuclear gaps and are considered to be mature virions whereas the bulletlike elements were, in most cases, attached to the nuclear membrane from which they were apparently budding. The fine structure of the particles revealed that they are probably made out of an inner component, helically arranged, likely with a nucleoprotein nature, surrounded by an envelope containing osmiophilic material, possibly lipids. 42684022|Stomatal transpiration of Dogwood cuttings increased and leaf water potential decreased on absorption of a 10 M (about 7 ppm) solution of fusicoccin, a phytotoxin produced by Fusicoccum amygdali Del. The stomatal transpiration was also increased by fusicoccin in several other plant species. Stomata were induced to open widely by spraying or painting leaves with the same solution, both in the light and in the dark. The effect of light conditions under which plants were kept before and after treatment on stomatal opening was also investigated. The observed changes in transpiration are discussed on the basis of the known effects of fusicoccin on water absorption, plasticity of cell walls, oxydative metabolism of tissues, and permeability of cytomembranes. Stomatal opening in toxin-treated leaves probaly takes place as a consequence of the different effects of fusicoccin on the hydration of epidermal and guard cells. 42685912|Major developments in breeding for durable genetic resistance to crop parasites are examined in relation to the devastating experiences with phylloxera in Europe and California. From these studies, which include an analysis of the ongoing phylloxera epidemic in Napa and Sonoma valleys, it is concluded that the resistance of 'Rupestris St. George' is still effective against all forms of the parasite, while that of the hybrid 'AxR#1' is no longer functioning. This strongly suggests that phylloxera resistance is horizontal in 'Rupestris St. George' (and other American rootstocks) and that this is operating at close to a maximum level. This is not the case for the susceptible 'AxR#1' rootstock. Some of the reasons and evidence for this conclusion are presented. The need for comprehensive horizontal resistance in grape rootstocks to all major soil parasites is emphasized.
43872353|The course of 'flavescence dore' (FD) and 'bois noir' (BN) diseases can result in either recovery or death of affected grapevines. When farmers observe symptomatic grapevines, they must choose whether to replace or maintain the plants. To establish whether there is an advantage in replacing symptomatic grapevines, data were collected on the costs of replacing them (removing the diseased plants and planting new grapevines, with resultant yield loss during the rearing period) and growing them on (yield losses in symptomatic grapevines over the following years). To calculate the cost of maintaining FD-infected plants, the possibility was also considered that symptomatic grapevines may be sources of phytoplasmas for the vector Scaphoideus titanus Ball. symptomatic course of BN was observed in 'Chardonnay', and of FD in 'Chardonnay', 'Merlot' and 'Perera' grape cultivars. The costs of replacement decreased with the increase in the productive lifetime of the vineyards. The cost of maintenance was greatly influenced by the course of the diseases, and in the case of FD, also by the risk of new infections due to the fact that S. titanus acquires phytoplasmas from infected grapevines. The replacement of plants affected by BN is not profitable when recovery is the most frequent course of the disease, particularly when it is considered that replantings can, in turn, become infected. The replacement of plants affected by FD is not profitable for cultivars with a recovery near to 100% ('Merlot'), whereas it is necessary for cultivars where the course of the disease is frequently lethal ('Perera'). For cultivars with intermediate sensitivity, the decision varies in relation to agronomic / economic factors and to the risk of new infections ('Chardonnay'). For FD, both replacement and maintenance strategies need to be associated with S. titanus control inside and outside the vineyards. In the case of maintenance the infected plants can be sources of phytoplasmas, and in the case of replacement, the vector can also inoculate the new grapevines.
42684139|Flower organs of eggplants naturally or artificially infected with the mottled dwarf virus (EMDV) were studied at the fine structure level. The particles were located in perinuclear gaps between the nuclear lamellae where they accumulated after budding at the nuclear membrane. Budding took place with virus particles oriented perpendicularly or, more rarely, parallel to the nuclear envelope. Anomalous particles with membranous swellings at one extremity and viral rosettes arising from virions inserted around a same circular membrane, were also encountered. Cytoplasmic localization of EMDV was not uncommon but the virions were always contained within swellings of the endoplasmic reticulum. 42685734|The action of the two surfactants, an anionic synthetic detergent, alkylbenzene sulphonate (ABS) and a non ionic surfactant, arylalkylpoliglycol ether (Citowett) was evaluated under laboratory conditions on durum wheat (Triticum durum Desf. cv. Cappelli). The substances were given at different concentration for 14 days, as spray. Four parameters were studied: I) seed germination; II) coleoptile growth; III) leaf elongation; IV) development of first leaves. Seed germination was not affected while development of coleoptile, leaf and root was inhibited by Citowett and ABS. ABS had an inhibitory effect stronger than Citowett at all concentrations tested. A scanning electron microscope (SEM) analysis carried out on leaves treated with the surfactants at high concentrations showed alteration and a reduced number of epicuticular wax projections in comparison with untreated leaves. These compounds also caused changes of guard stomata cells and trichomes morphology. The results are discussed also in relation to a previous report where a different experimental procedure was used with the same substances and with the same test parameters. L'azione di due tensioattivi, ABS (alchilbenzene sulfonato di sodio) e Citowett (arilalchilpoliglicol etere)  stata valutata in laboratorio su piantine di Triticum durum Desf. cv. Cappelli. I tensioattivi sono stati somministrati ai semi e successivamente alle plantule in crescita in forma spray. Dopo 14 giorni sono stati rilevati la percentuale di germinazione e l'allungamento dei coleoptili, delle prime foglie e delle radici. Mentre la germinazione non ha risentito alcuna influenza negativa, la crescita delle plantule risultava ridotta dalla presenza dei tensioattivi. Le osservazioni al microscopio elettronico a scansione (SEM), effettuate sulle prime foglie raccolte casualmente, evidenziavano, in seguito ai trattamenti, una riduzione del numero delle fibrille cerose sullo strato cuticolare ed alterazioni ai peli e agli stomi. I risultati sono discussi anche in relazione a precedenti prove nel corso delle quali le stesse sostanze furono applicate con diverso metodo.

42685209|Epidemiological observations were made on grapevine enation disease in a large plant population of a cv. Trebbiano Romagnolo clone. Over a 7-year period (1988-94), the incidence of affected plants varied from 23.2% to 7.2%. Besides varying degrees of disease severity and inconsistency of symptom expression in individual plants each year, it was possible to identify the following host categories: a) asymptomatic vines in 1988, showing symptoms in some of the years that followed (21.1%); b) vines that were diseased in 1988, also showing symptoms in some of the years that followed (12.8%); c) vines with symptoms in 1988, but asymptomatic in the years that followed (10.8%). During the observation period, 55.2% of the vines were always found to be asymptomatic. The distribution pattern of the diseased plants in the vineyard, using Van der Plank's doublet analysis, was generally random. This strongly suggests little or no infection spreading from vine to vine and the probable outside localisation of inoculum sources.

In essa si distinguono Ire porzioni: interna, o strato cellulo-sico, costituita da cellulosa e pectina; media ed esterna, che insieme formano lo strato cuticolare e sono costituite da cellulosa, pectina, cutina e cere. La porzione media (strato cuticolare interno)  poco cutinizzata e sembra avere rcazione acida; quella esterna (strato cuticolare esterno)  fortemente cutinizzata, e pi ricca di cere e sembra avere reazione neutra o subalcalina. La parete cellulare c protetta verso l'esterno da una spessa cuticola e da un sottilissimo rivestimento ceroso superficiale. Esaminando alla luce polarizzata sezioni dell'epidermide, gli strati cellulosico e cuticolare interno appaiono otticaniente anisotropi e positivamente birifrangenti, rispetto al piano della parete; lo strato cuticolare estenio  negativamente birilrangente; la cuticola  isotropa, ma mostra birifrangenza positiva, se da essa sono asportate le cere con solventi organici. Alla luce ultravioletta, la cuticola e lo strato cuticolare mostrano fluorescenza primaria. Spilocaea oleagina forma tipicamente colonie subcuticolari, immerse e raggiate, nella parte pi esterna della parete, corrispondente allo strato cuticolare esterno. Il micelio degrada i vari costituenti di questo strato e induce una leggera decutinizzazione dello strato cuticolare interno. Le ife conidiofore perforano la cuticola, dissolvendola al loro passaggio. The outermost periciinal wall of the upper epidermical cells of the Olive (Olea europaea L.) leaf is considerably thick, and it appears to be partly cutinized. Three layers may be recognized in it: the inner, non-cutinized stratum or cellulosic layer, the components of which are cellulose and pectin; the middle layer (inner cuticular layer), which is poorly cutinized and seems to be acid; the outer layer (outer cuticular layer), which is heavily cutinized, is rich in waxy components, and seems to be neutral or subalkaline. The outer periclinical cell wall is protected outward by a thick cuticie and, above it, by a very thin superficial wax layer. When sections of the upper epidermis are observed with polarized light, the cellulosic and the inner cuticular layers appear optically anisotropic and are positively birefringent, with reference to the plane of the wall. The outer cuticular layer shows negative birefringence. The cuticle is isotropic, showing positive double refraction after cuticular waxes have been extracted with organic fat-solvents. Cuticle and cuticular layer become fluorescent with ultraviolet light. Typically, Spilocaea oleagina forms subcuticular, immersed radiating colonies, whichdevelop mainly in the outermost part of the cell wall (i. e. in the outer cuticular layer). The mycelium of the leal-spot fungus degrades the materials of this layer and induces a slight decutinization of the inner cuticular layer. Its conidiophores dissolve the cuticle in the immediate area of penetration. La partie moyenne ( couche cuticulaire interne ) est faiblement cutinise et semble avoir une raction acide; la partie externe ( couche cuticulaire externe ), fortement cutinise, est la plus riche en cires et semble avoir une raction neutre ou subalcaline. La paroi cellulaire est protge du ct extrieur par une paisse cuticule et par un trs mince revtement cireux superficiel. Lorsque on examine des coupes de l'piderme  la lumire polarise, les couches cellulosique et cuticulaire interne apparaissent optiquement anisotropes et positivement birfringentes par rapport au plan de la paroi; la couche cuticulaire externe est ngativement birfringente, la cuticule est isotrope, mais montre birfringence positive si les cires sont limines par des solvents organiques. 43872334|The European Community Directive 128/2009 on the Sustainable Use of Pesticides establishes a strategy for the use of plant protection products (PPPs) in the European Community so as to reduce risks to human health and the environment. Integrated Pest Management (IPM) is a key component of this strategy, which will become mandatory in 2014. IPM is based on dynamic processes and requires decision-making at strategic, tactical, and operational levels. Relative to decision makers in conventional agricultural systems, decision makers in IPM systems require more knowledge and must deal with greater complexity. Different tools have been developed for supporting decision-making in plant disease control and include warning services, on-site devices, and decision support systems (DSSs). These decision-support tools operate at different spatial and time scales, are provided to users both by public and private sources, focus on different communication modes, and can support multiple options for delivering information to farmers. Characteristics, weaknesses, and strengths of these tools are described in this review. Also described are recently developed DSSs, which are characterised by: i) holistic treatment of crop management problems (including pests, diseases, fertilisation, canopy management and irrigation); ii) conversion of complex decision processes into simple and easy-to-understand 'decision supports'; iii) easy and rapid access through the Internet; and iv) two-way communication between users and providers that make it possible to consider context-specific information. These DSSs are easy-to-use tools that perform complex tasks efficiently and effectively. The delivery of these DSSs via the Internet increases user accessibility, allows the DSSs to be updated easily and continuously (so that new knowledge can be rapidly and efficiently provided to farmers), and allows users to maintain close contact with providers.
42685922|Foot rot of Banana ('AAA Cavendish' subgroup: 'Dwarf Cavendish') grown under glass was observed during 1990-91 in Crete. Fusarium compactum was mostly isolated from infected root and basal corm tissues, followed by F. oxysporum and F. solani. In the pathogenicity tests, carried out by dipping young banana roots into conidial suspension before transplanting, F. compactum induced leaf yellowing and death of the plant, whereas the other two species of Fusarium after 10 days caused no symptoms. The pathogenic strain of F. compactum (ITEM-1289) was able to synthesize neosolaniol (NEOS) (50 g/g) when cultured on autoclaved maize kernels. The methanolic extract from these cultures induced chlorosis in a banana leaf bioassay. Such activity was mostly correlated with the presence of NEOS. As far as we are aware, this is the first report on F. compactum as causing disease of Banana.

42685949|A three-year study was conducted on the natural infection of Triticum aestivum 'Centauro' by Microdochium nivale (the dominant species), Fusarium avenaceum, F. graminearum, F. culmorum and Drechslera sorokiniana (in order of decreasing importance). These fungi followed one another during the growing season. In consequence they were continuously associated with the ontogenic development of wheat and influenced various yield components, especially the number of heads/m. The lower head number was caused by a smaller number of plants/m (correlation coefficient between disease severity and plants/m equal to -0.68, P0.01). Even if the plants had a greater tillering (r=0.36, P0.01), many tillers were unproductive (r=-0.75, P0.01) and the number of heads/m was lower (r=-0.71, P0.01). A smaller number of kernels/head (r=-0.64, P0.01) and a lower unit kernel weight (r=-0.81, P0.01 were also produced by affected plants.
42685384|The root-knot nematode, Meloidogyne incognita, is a sedentary endoparasitic plant pathogen with a very wide host range, which causes annual crop losses amounting to millions of dollars. The small number of available nematicides and restrictions on the use of non-fumigant nematicides due to high toxicity to humans and non-target organisms hinder effective nematode control. A possible alternative to chemical nematicides is the use of biological control agents for the management of this nematode. In the present study, the efficacy of four biocontrol agents was tested against M. incognita at different doses. The biocontrol agents Pasteuria penetrans, Pochonia chlamydosporia, Paecilomyces lilacinus and Trichoderma harzianum were mass produced and mixed with the formalin sterilized soil at the rates of 2  10, 4  10, 6  10, 8  10, and 1  10 endospores/chlamydospores/cfu per g of soil. Okra seeds (cv. Sabz Pari) were sown in pots of soil amended with the different agents, and 10 d after emergence, the plants were inoculated with 2000 freshly hatched second stage juveniles of M. incognita. Data on plant growth parameters and nematode infestations were recorded 7 weeks after inoculation. The antagonists varied significantly in enhancing various growth parameters and reducing nematode infestations in a dose-responsive manner. Both P. penetrans and P. lilacinus were equally effective and caused maximum reductions in number of galls, egg masses, nematode fecundity and build up as compared with T. harzianum and P. chlamydosporia. Reductions in these parameters at the concentration of 8  10 were statistically similar with those caused at the concentration of 1  10 chlamydospores/endospores/cfu. Our results indicate that application of antagonists can suppress galling and reproduction of M. incognita resulting in enhancement of plant growth.

42685959|Common bunt (Tilletia laevis and T. tritici) isolates from naturally infected wheat spikes, collected in the main wheat-growing areas of Syria, were characterized on a set of 26 spring and winter wheat differentials for 11 Bt resistance genes. The 18 isolates tested were grouped into nine pathotypes based on their virulence against the differentials. Four pathotypes failed to infect any of the differentials, including the universally susceptible differential, Bt0. Two pathotypes were characterized as races T-ll and L-9. The remaining three pathotypes did not resemble any known virulence against common bunt differentials. This indicates the presence of previously unidentified races. New race designations for these common bunt pathotypes are suggested: T-31 of T. tritici, and L-18 and L-19 of T. laevis. Since none of the tested common bunt isolates were virulent against differentials containing genes Bt5, Bt6, Bt7, Bt8, Bt9, Bt10, Bt11 and Btp, these genes can be used in wheat breeding programs to develop common bunt resistant cultivare. This is the first record of the prevailing pathotypes of common bunt in Syria.
42685992|Forty-eight isolates of Fusarium oxysporum and 19 of Verticillium dahliae were obtained from tomato plants with wilt symptoms. Only two of the F. oxysporum isolates were pathogenic to tomato, while 46 isolates were non-pathogenic. Our data demonstrated that wilt of tomato in Greece is caused mainly by V. dahliae, not by F. oxysporum. Twelve of the 19 isolates of V. dahliae were assigned to vegetative compatibility groups (VCGs), using nitrate nonutilizing mutants, which were generated from single spore wild isolates by selecting chlorate-resistant sectors on minimal medium amended with potassium chlorate 25 g/1. The mutants were tested against tester strains of known VCG1, 2, 3 and 4. Eight isolates belonged to VCG2, one to VCG4 and three could not be assigned to any VCG.
42684598|Otto su 15 ceppi di Fusarium produttori di zearalenone, di cui 3 di F. culmorum e 5 di F. graminearum, isolati da cereali raccolti in diverse regioni d'Italia, hanno prodotto le pi elevate quantit di tossina a temperatura costante di 27C. 42685411|Fungi of the Ilyonectria genus are the main causal agents of black foot disease of grapevine. These pathogens cause necrosis in the basal end of the rootstock, leading to the early decline and the death of vines in nurseries and young vineyards. In the present study a collection of isolates of the genus Ilyonectria obtained from a vineyard located in the Alentejo region, Portugal, was characterised. This vineyard was established with planting material originating from three different nurseries. To assess the inter- and intra-specific variability among isolates, morphological, cultural and biomolecular characteristics were evaluated. Morpho-cultural and molecular data (RAPD and ISSR markers and histone H3 nucleotide sequence) identified I. estremocensis, I. europaea, I. liriodendri, I. macrodidyma, I. torresensis, I. vitis and "Cylindrocarpon" pauciseptatum. Ilyonectria torresensis was the most common species found in the survey, representing more than 50% of the isolates.
43872344|Barley net blotch, caused by Pyrenophora teres f. teres (Ptt), is one of the most important foliar diseases in north western Algeria. The disease causes appreciable yield losses under favorable environmental conditions. Studies on pathogen variability and distribution of virulence in Ptt are essential to identify effective sources of resistance to this disease. In this study, pathogenic variability in 48 isolates of Ptt, collected from different barleygrowing areas of north-western Algeria, were evaluated using 22 barley genotypes as differential hosts. Trials carried out under controlled conditions confirmed the large variation in the virulence of this fungus. The genotypes exhibited variability in response ranging from complete resistance to high susceptibility. This is the first report of pathogenic variability in Ptt in north western Algeria. The 48 isolates tested were further differentiated into 12 pathotypes. Eight differential cultivars were resistant to all isolates tested, but others were susceptible to one or more of the isolates. The variability in the pathogen and the resistance identified in some genotypes used in this study are being investigated further to develop superior, adapted germplasm for use in barley breeding programs in north western Algeria.

42685452|Four viruses were isolated from diseased plants of Lentil (Lens esculenta Moench.) in various areas of Iran. The viruses were: Alfalfa mosaic (AMV), Bean yellow mosaic (BYMV), Cucumber mosaic (CMV), and Pea leaf roll (PLRV). Methods utilized in virus identification were symptomatology, host range studies, physical property tests, vector-virus relationships, serology, and electron microscopy. Virus symptoms commonly observed were mottling, stunting, leaflet deformation, dwarfing and twisting, shortening of the internodes, and proliferation of the axillary buds. Microorganisms were seldom isolated from the roots or stems of virus-infected lentils, and disease symptoms were not reproduced in controlled inoculation tests with various fungi. In field inoculation studies with the four viruses, infection resulted in decreased yields of 46 to 94%. Largest yield reductions occurred when lentils were infected in the seedling stage. In yield trials over 50% of 30 lines were heavily infected under natural conditions by BYMV and CMV, and yields were greatly reduced. Several high yielding, small-seeded lentil types were resistant to both viruses in the field and in greenhouse inoculation tests. Aphids which usually colonized lentils in nature and were vectors of the four viruses were Aphis craccivora Koch, Acyrthosiphon pisum Harris, and A. sesbaniae David. AMV, BYMV, and CMV were transmitted in a styletborne (nonpersistent) manner, whereas PLRV was transmitted in a circulative (persistent) way. None of the viruses appeared to be seed-borne in L. esculenta. Annual and perennial plants in 41 genera from 16 families were alternate and overwintering hosts of these viruses and some of their insect vectors. 42685935|In previous studies, a nonpathogenic strain of Fusarium oxysporum (C14) was shown to induce protection in cucumber to F. oxysporum f. sp. cucumerinum. Strain C14 induced protection whether roots were wounded, or intact, when inoculated with the nonpathogen, whereas another strain (C5) required wounds. Penetration of cucumber root and colonization of root tissue by the two biocontrol agents (strain C5 and C14) and F. oxysporum f. sp. cucumerinum, were further investigated using scanning electron, light and epifluorescence microscopy. In all the trials, no hyphal growth was detected inside, or outside, the noninoculated control cucumber roots. Strain C5 penetrated indirectly through the wounds but rarely through intact epidermis and hyphae were only observed in root tissues exposed to injury. Strain C14, which previously was shown to induce soil suppressiveness to the wilt pathogen significantly higher than strain C5, was similar to F. oxysporum f. sp. cucumerinum in the formation of penetration-like structures on intact cucumber roots. However, hyphae of strain C14 were found at discrete locations through the entire depth of the cortex but without extending towards the vascular bundles. Hyphae of F. oxysporum f. sp. cucumerinum were found, exclusively, deep within the cortex near the stele and usually completely surrounded the xylem vessels. From events presented in this and previous studies, we suggest that penetration and colonization of living intact root tissues by strains of nonpathogenic Fusarium spp. are necessary for efficient biological control of Fusarium wilt pathogens.
42685276|Phoma sepium f.s. arvensi, a pathogen of Convolvulus arvensis, produced in vitro metabolites which caused, when supplied through the vessels to C. arvensis stem cuttings, phytotoxicity symptoms similar to those characterizing the disease. Filtrates or extracts obtained from liquid or agar cultures of the fungus were highly phytotoxic to C. arvensis stem cuttings, slightly phytotoxic to C. altheoides, but non-phytotoxic to crop or weed species tested. The phytotoxic component has a high molecular weight, is polar and relatively heat stable. More than one metabolites produced in culture by the fungus seem to be responsible for the phytotoxic potential of the fungal preparations.

This pathogen causes root decay and spreads within the plantation through root contacts. Two types of damage may occur as a consequence of the growth of H. annosum in host tissues: a) tree mortality particularly among pines but also among Suvertir and Norway spruce, and; b) root rot which is especially damaging on Silver fir and Norway spruce. 42685347|The influence of two values of light intensity on the foliar compartmentation of bitertanol applied by aqueous droplet on upper surface of leaves of potted courgette (Cucurbita pepo cv. Storr's green) plants was assessed. Plants were grown for 3 weeks in a climatic chamber at two values of photon flow rates (200 or 1000 E). The compartments (leaf surface, cuticular waxes and internal leaf) were arbitrarily defined. The amount of the fungicide in these compartments was evaluated by GC analysis after 12 and 36 h from the application. In addition, the development of the epicuticular waxes and the structure of the internal leaf tissue were examined by SEM and by video image analysis. The amount of fungicide in the leaf compartments varied with the light conditions: at the assessing, bitertanol detected on the surface and internal leaf compartments was higher at 200 E than at 1000 E. However at 36 h after treatment, the amount of chemical found on surface of leaves exposed to low light conditions greatly decreased. Conversely, leaves of plants grown at 1000 E were able to retain the fungicide, so that the percentage of bitertanol compartmentation did not vary in the time. On the whole, light growing conditions influenced cuticular wax production and this, in turn, had an important role in fungicide uptake and loss.

42685410|Esca and Petri disease, two of the most important fungal trunk diseases of grapevine, are responsible for significant losses by causing premature decline and dieback in vineyards worldwide. The Portuguese Do wine region is no exception. Local winegrowers' knowledge on Grapevine Trunk Diseases (GTD) in general and of esca and Petri disease in particular is incomplete. The real scope of those problems has been based largely on individual perceptions rather than on a methodical evaluation of the situation. In order to get a full picture of the diseases impact, a leaflet with color pictures was produced and issued to winegrowers, accompanied by a simple questionnaire. The results of this survey represent a first indication of the extent of grapevine trunk diseases in the Do wine region, specifically its economic impact and relevance to the local wine industry. In conjunction with the survey, several samples of wood collected from esca and Petri disease symptomatic vines, identified during the survey throughout the entire region, were processed and a collection of isolates of Phaeomoniella chlamydospora obtained. To determine the intra-specific variability among these isolates, morphological, cultural and molecular characteristics were evaluated. A protocol to study the pathogenicity with P. chlamydospora was conducted, consisting on the inoculation of cv. Touriga Nacional's spurs with a previously studied P. chlamydospora isolate.
42685975|A total of 450 accessions of Triticum boeoticum and T. dicoccoides was screened in the field for resistance to the most important wheat diseases in the West Asia and North Africa (WANA) region: common, bunt, yellow rust, leaf rust and Septoria tritici blotch. Most of the accessions of T. boeoticum showed good resistance to the individual diseases, but T. dicoccoides mainly to common bunt and Septoria blotch, being rather susceptible to rusts. 43872368|Fusarium proliferatum has been reported on garlic in the Northwest USA, Spain and Serbia, causing water-soaked tan-colored lesions on cloves. In this work, Fusarium proliferatum was isolated from 300 symptomatic garlic bulbs. Morphological identification of Fusarium was confirmed using species-specific PCR assays and EF-1 sequencing. Confirmation of pathogenicity was conducted with eighteen isolates. Six randomly selected F. proliferatum isolates from garlic were tested for specific pathogenicity and screened for fusaric acid production. Additionally, pathogenicity of each F. proliferatum isolate was tested on healthy seedlings of onion (Allium cepa), leek (A porrum), scallions (A. fistulosum), chives (A. schoenoprasum) and garlic (A. sativum). A disease severity index (DSI) was calculated as the mean severity on three plants of each species with four test replicates. Symptoms on onion and garlic plants were observed three weeks after inoculation. All isolates tested produced symptoms on all varieties inoculated. Inoculation of F. proliferatum isolates from diseased garlic onto other Allium species provided new information on host range and pathogenicity. The results demonstrated differences in susceptibility with respect to host species and cultivar. The F. proliferatum isolates tested all produced fusaric acid (FA); correlations between FA production and isolate pathogenicity are discussed. Additionally, all isolates showed the presence of the FUM1 gene suggesting the ability of Spanish isolates to produce fumonisins.

42685393|In this study, 34 apricot orchards in south-eastern Spain planted with the Spanish cultivar 'Blida' and showing "viruela" symptoms were studied for 2 years. Leaf and fruit samples from four trees in each orchard, either with or without "viruela" symptoms, were collected and analysed by multiplex RT-PCR for the detection of American plum line pattern virus (APLPV), Apple chlorotic leaf spot virus (ACLSV), Apple mosaic virus (ApMV), Apricot latent virus (ApLV), Plum bark necrosis and stem pitting-associated virus (PBNSPaV), Plum pox virus (PPV), Prune dwarf virus (PDV), and Prunus necrotic ring spot virus (PNRSV). In addition, molecular hybridization assays were performed for the detection of Hop stunt viroid (HSVd) and Peach latent mosaic viroid (PLMVd). All fruits showing "viruela" symptoms were infected with ACLSV and HSVd, suggesting that these pathogens may be responsible for "viruela" disease. Other viruses including PNRSV, PBNSPaV, ApLV, PDV, ApMV and PPV, were detected to a lesser degree. Detection of ACLSV and HSVd in samples without symptoms could be explained by the influence of environmental conditions and/or the physiological stage of fruits on the expression of symptoms.
42685382|Gummosis is the most important disease of pistachio trees in Iranian orchards. The principal cause, Phytophthora pistaciae, is a recently described plant pathogenic oomycete from pistachio trees. This species is very similar, probably due to convergence, to some other non-papillate High temperature species, especially P. megasperma. A PCR based method was developed to provide a reliable molecular tool for the identification of P. pistaciae. A collection of isolates from different locations representing a diversity of species was examined for unique coding regions as well as for non-coding gene sequences including the internal transcribed spacers (ITS1 and ITS2) and the 5.8S gene of rDNA, the heat shock protein 90 gene and -tubulin. Eight PCR primers specific for P. pistaciae were designed. Annealing temperatures and extension times were optimized for each set of primers to maximize both specificity and amplification efficiency. Each set was tested against purified DNA from other gummosisinducing Phytophthora species from pistachio trees as well as 28 other Phytophthora species from different hosts. In conventional PCR, the limit of detection of different primer sets ranged from 10 ng to 50 pg of purified DNA. The best candidate for identification of P. pistaciae isolates was the ITS-S1 primer set which was a combination of ITS-SF1 and ITS-SR1. The ITS-S1 set did not amplify purified DNA from other Phytophthora species tested. The combination of ITS-S1 with ITS6 and ITS4 universal primers could detect up to 100 fg DNA in nested PCR and also can amplify the specific band in infected tissues, infested soil and water.
42685685|Bean plantlet (Phaseolus vulgaris L., var. Topcrop), raised in growth chamber, were stressed by partial restoration of transpired water. The decrease in water potential, which fell to -12.5, -16 bar within 6-8 days, led to a progressive and marked decrease of both water conductivity and photosynthetic activity, tough the last resulted less sensitive to water stress. Since the fall in stomatal conductance was more marked in the abaxial than the adaxial surface, the underside of the leaf seems to be mainly responsible for water economy, particularly in stressed plants. Intercellular CO partial pressure also fell progressively until water potential reached about -12.5 bar, than it rose fairly rapidly. The changes of CO assimilation versus intercellular CO relationship have been commented. Since the shift from decrease to increase occurred at reasonable constant water potential, it would seem to be a reliable index of water status, worthy of particular attention. Cambiamenti nella conduttanza, nella potosintesi E nella pressione parziale di CO intercellulare, indotti da stress idrico, in foglie Primarie di Fagiolo cv. Topcrop. In 6-8 giorni il Potenziale idrico diminuiva fino a circa -12,5,-16 bar: lo stress, piuttosto intenso, non  innaturale per piantine dotate di ridotto apparato radicale e scarsa capacita di adattamento. La diminuzione del Potenziale idrico delle foglie primarie stressate ha indotto una diminuzione progressiva della conduttanza stomatica e dell'attivit fotosintetica che raggiungevano valori assai bassi quando il Potenziale scendeva oltre -12,5 bar. La piu marcata diminuzione, in valore assoluto, della conduttanza stomatica della pagina inferiore, indica il suo ruolo preminente nell'economia idrica delle piante stressate. La fotosintesi appare meno sensibile della conduttivit stomatica allo stress idrico: fra -8 e -10 bar, essa scende dal 90 al 60%, mentre la conduttanza passa dal 55 al 30% del controllo. La pressione parziale di CO interna diminuisce progressivamente a potenziali idrici compresi fra -10 e -12 bar, poi aumenta bruscamente, raggiungendo valori talvolta superiori a quelli del controllo. Poich nelle foglie stressate l'aumento di CO interna si verifica a Potenziale idrico piuttosto costante, esso potrebbe essere un indice attendibile dello stress idrico della pianta e appare pertanto degno di particolare attenzione.

42685964|Serological reactivity of Lebanese tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV) isolates collected from several locations were studied using 29 monoclonal antibodies (MAbs) prepared to particles of African cassava mosaic virus (16 MAbs), Indian cassava mosaic (10 MAbs) and okra leaf curl (3 MAbs) geminiviruses. 43872355|The effects of temperature, pH and water potential (s) on mycelial growth, sporulation and chlamydospore production of Cylindrocarpon liriodendri, macrodidymum and C. pauciseptatum isolated from grapevines was studied. Three isolates per species were incubated on potato dextrose agar (PDA) under different temperature, pH, and s conditions. All isolates were able to grow over a range of temperatures from 5 to 30C, with an optimum temperature between 20 to 25C, but they did not grow at 35C. Active mycelial growth was observed over a range of pHs, from 4 to 8. Regarding the effect of s in general, mycelial growth was greater on amended media at -0.5, -1.0 or/and -2.0 MPa compared with that obtained on nonamended PDA (-0.3 MPa), and was reduced at s values lower than -2.0 MPa. Most of the Cylindrocarpon spp. isolates were sporulated at all temperatures, pHs and water potentials tested. In all studied conditions, C. liriodendri had the greatest sporulation capacity compared with C. macrodidymum and C. pauciseptatum. In general, chlamydospore production was not much affected by temperature, pH and s. Chlamydospores were observed in PDA cultures of all isolates at all pH values studied, while some isolates did not produce chlamydospores at 5 and 10C or -4.0 and/or -5.0 MPa. These results improve understanding of the biology of these important grapevine pathogens.
42685962|Twenty four Chinese bread wheat cultivars were tested at the seedling stage with 7 Italian Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici isolates. Three selected cultivars (Guinong 22, Wan 7107 and Xuzhou 22) and one Italian bread wheat cultivar (Elia) were inoculated with two isolates of leaf rust and grown at 15 and 20C to evaluate the components of their partial resistance. The bread wheat cultivar Irnerio was used as a check. The expression of the components of partial resistance were greatly influenced by host genotype and temperature. Among the tested cultivars, 'Wan 7107' and 'Elia' showed a longer latent period, a lower spore yield and a shorter sporulation period, which revealed that the two cultivars possess good partial resistance and may be useful in future breeding programmes.

42685568|Il rallentamento della crescita  il primo sintomo di verticilliosi in giovani piante di peperone inoculate artificialmente. Il nanismo  seguito, nell'ordine, da appassimento, dapprima parziale e reversibile, del lembo fogliare; da arrotolamento dei margini fogliari verso l'alto; da appassimento irreversibile e da filloptosi. Il contenuto idrico relativo diminuisce nelle foglie in misura sensibile solo in coincidenza deh" appassimento ma l'aumento della resistenza stomatica denuncia che le foglie sono sottoposte a stress idrico gi da 3-2 giorni prima dell'appassimento. Il patogeno  isolabile dai piccioli delle foglie apicali di piante inoculate per immersione radicale sin dal quarto giorno dopo l'inoculazione. Taie rapidit di colonizzazione  favorita dal trasporto passivo dei conidi nel fluido xilematico a partir dalle ferite radicali. L'espressione dei sintomi  nettamente preceduta da estesa colonizzazione dell'apparato vascolare dei piccioli e delle nervature fogliari, accompagnata da abbondante gommosi e, raramente, da tillosi. Le pareti dei vasi risultano tappezzate da strati superficialmente vescicolosi di materiale di probabile natura gommosa. Growth reduction was the first symptom of Verticillium wilt (V. dahliae) in artificially inoculated young pepper plants. Dwarfing was followed by wilting of the leaf lamina  at first partial and reversible , upward rolling of the leaf margins, irreversible wilting and leaf abscission. Relative water content of the leaves did not decrease before the appearance of wilt symptoms but increases of diffusive resistance indicated that the leaves were under water stress since 3-2 days before wilting. The pathogen was isolated after 24h from the petiole of the first leaf of plants inoculated by the root dipping method. The colonization appeared to be favoured by the passive transport of conidia in the xylem stream. Symptom expression in the leaves was markedly preceded by extensive colonization associated to gummosis of xylem vessels in the petioles and veins. Tyloses was unfrequently observed. Walls of Verticillium infected plants appeared at SEM to be coated by superficially blistered materials. Infection of V. dahliae in intact roots of aseptically grown pepper seedlings occurred with the addition of sucrose, but it was a slow process, hindered by abundant formation of papillae (lignitubers) in the epidermal cells.
42685421|Stolbur phytoplasmas were detected in 116 out of more than 200 samples from nine plant species collected in 2009-2010 in Serbia. Phytoplasmas were detected and identified by restriction fragment length polymorphism (RFLP) analysis of polymerase chain reaction (PCR) amplified 16S rDNA. While all strains were identical on the level of 16S rDNA sequences, one strain represented a unique variant of stolbur phytoplasma with a SNP producing a new Tru1I restriction site. RFLP analyses of tuf gene amplicons, using HpaII restriction enzyme, showed profiles identical to tuf type II profile in all stolbur phytoplasma strains from Serbia. Seminested PCR for amplification of the rp gene yielded aspecific amplicons with nearly half of the samples examined. However, in the 23 samples which yielded amplicons of expected size, RFLP analysis with AluI restriction enzyme showed profiles with some variations. RFLP analyses of the amplified complete secY gene, using Tru1I and AluI restriction enzymes, showed profiles indistinguishable from each other. In phylogenetic analyses of secY gene, strains belonging to tuf type I formed a lineage separate from the strains belonging to tuf type II. To our knowledge this is the first report of stolbur phytoplasma in valerian (Valeriana officinalis) adding a new plant species to the already wide natural host range of stolbur phytoplasma.
43872349|In Morocco, tomato gray mould caused by Botrytis cinerea Pers: Fr. is a serious threat for postharvest storage of tomatoes. Fifteen halophilic bacteria were evaluated for their antagonistic activity against B. cinerea: 11 Gram positive strains assigned to the genera Bacillus (9), Jeotgalibacillus (1) and Planococcus (1) and four Gram negative strains assigned to the genera Salinivibrio (1), Vibrio (2) and Photobacterium (1). In in vitro screening, 12 antifungal isolates secreted diffusible compounds, hydrolytic enzymes or volatile compounds. In vivo screening of the isolates, Bacillus safensis CCMM B582 and Bacillus oceanisediminis CCMM B584 showed permanent antagonistic activity on tomato fruits, with 100% inhibition of B. cinerea after 7 days. These two strains may offer potential for biological control of tomato gray mould.

42685917|The inhibitory activity exerted by allopurinol [4-hydroxypyrazolo(3,4-d) pyrimidine], a xanthine oxidase inhibitor, on the biotrophic growth of Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici, Uromyces phaseoli and Uromyces fabae was investigated by applying a solution of the inhibitor to specific host plants either as soil drench or by foliar spray. The allopurinol inhibition concentration curve, the minimum time before inoculation allopurinol must be applied in order to reach the inhibitory effect and the persistence time of the treatment were determined. Four principal findings emerge from our study. First, the allopurinol concentration which must be used as soil drench for 7-days treatment before inoculation to obtain a reduction of fungal growth is considerably different in relation to host plants (10-40,100-200 and 20-200 M for wheat, bean and broad bean, respectively). Second, the minimum time that allopurinol must be absorbed by roots to obtain the maximum inhibitory effect was 2 days in all cases. Third, if treatment was performed by root absorption for 7 days before inoculation and then stopped at the moment of inoculation, the inhibitory effect persisted for several days (up to 12) without any loss in effectiveness. Fourth, allopurinol sprayed daily on both leaf surfaces from 4-5 days before and up to 9 days after inoculation was absorbed by leaves and exerted an inhibitory effect comparable to that obtained when applied through roots using a 1600 M concentration. Furthermore, leaf treatment greatly reduced the toxic effects connected with the systemic absorption of allopurinol by the roots. A practical application of allopurinol against various rust fungi is envisaged and the application modalities for practical purposes are outlined in this study.
42685290|Soil solarization for nearly seven weeks significantly reduced or eliminated inocula of Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. dianthi added to soil as a conidial suspension of a chlorate-resistant mutant prior to the application of mulching in two greenhouse experiments in Greece. Effective control of Fusarium wilt of carnation was obtained during the experiment period. In the first experiment the disease incidence was 1.7% dead plants in solarized plots, while disease percentage reached 75% in control plots. The disease incidence in the second experiment the following year was 6.2% for solarized, and 53.4% for non solarized control plots. Soil disinfestation with a 50 g/m dose of dazomet in the first experiment was less effective than solarization in reducing fungal propagules, while a 60 g/m dose of it in the second experiment was equally effective to solarization. Similarly, the percentages of dead plants in dazomet plots were 38.3% and 0.0% in the first and second experiments, respectively. Effectiveness of soil solarization was more pronounced particularly in the first year, indicating effectiveness of the method in controlling Fusarium wilt of carnation in greenhouses.
42685837|The influence of sprinkler, drip, sip and subirrigation methods on both the degree of feeder root infection (RI) and the inoculum density (ID) of Phytophthora spp. in the rhizosphere of citrus plants was investigated. During the irrigation season, significantly higher ID values were found in June and September under subirrigation and sip than under sprinkler irrigation methods; RI values showed lesser increases under drip and sprinkler than under sip and subirrigation methods. In particular, from June to August and in October, significantly higher RI values were found under sip than under drip and sprinkler irrigation. The results obtained point out the different influence of irrigation method on Phytophthora root rot and seem to indicate that sprinkler and drip irrigation, as carried out in the experimental field, induces less favourable conditions for citrus root decay.  stata svolta un'indagine per studiare l'influenza di alcuni metodi irrigui sul grado di infezione radicale (IR) e sulla densit di inoculo (DI) di Phytophthora spp. nella rizosfera di piante di agrumi. 42685716|The tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV), a whitefly-borne geminivirus, is one of the most serious pathogens affecting tomato cultures in many tropical and subtropical regions. TYLCV is not always easy to identify because of the variety of symptoms associated with the disease. We show here that TYLCV can be diagnosed by hybridizing tomato leaflets squashed onto a nylon membrane with a virus-specific DNA probe. Tomato squashes were collected from countries in the Mediterranean Basin, the Americas, Western Africa and Southeast Asia. The squashes were hybridized with the DNA probe and the samples positive for TYLCV were scored. The geographical area covered by this study is now wide enough to allow a first assessment of the worldwide spread of TYLCV. Si ritiene che il monitoraggio abbia interessato un'area suficientemente vasta per una valutazione sulla diffusione geografica del virus.

42685457|The IAA oxidase activity of healthy and Fusarium infected tomato plants was compared by working in situ with stem slices, and in vitro with crude or partially purified stem extracts. The infection was always associated with increased IAA oxidase activity in the stem slices and in the purified extracts but with lowered activity in the crude extracts. This suggests that cellular compartimentalization in vitro prevents the higher concentration in the infected plants of inhibitors such as chlorogenic acid from interfering with IAA oxidase. It appears, therefore, that increased inhibition of this enzyme does not account for the hyperauxiny in the Fusarium wilt of Tomato. 42685509|A phytotoxic metabolite was isolated from the culture filtrate of Drechslera maydis (Nis.) Subra. et Jain causing leaf blight of Costus speciosus (Koen.) Sm. The toxin was purified by column chromatography and by preparatory TLC. It was found to be chromatographically pure when analysed by TLC. At a concentration of 100 g/ml the toxin induced necrosis and chlorosis on C. speciosus leaves followed by severe yellowing and defoliation. The symptoms produced by the toxin were similar to those following a natural infection by the pathogen. The toxin also showed a strong growth inhibiting activity. It caused complete inhibition of root elongation in germinating wheat seeds at a concentration of 50 g/ml, 82% in 25 g/ml and 53% in 10 g/ml. The toxin is non-specific as it could produce necrosis and chlorosis on a number of mono and dicotyledon plants. It might be a new phytotoxic metabolite of D. maydis. Alla concentrazione di 100 g/ml la tossina ha indotto necrosi e clorosi delle foglie e, successivamente, grave ingiallimento e defogliazione delle piante. I sintomi prodotti dalla tossma sono stati simili a quelli riscontrabili in natura. La tossina ha manifestato anche una forte attivit inibente la crescita. In particolare, a 50 g/ml ha inibito del tutto l'allungamento delle radici in cariossidi germinanti di grano; mentre alla concentrazione di 25 g/ml e di 10 g/ml ha manifestato tale attivit in ragione dell'82% e del 53%, rispettivamente. La tossina non  specifica poich produce necrosi e clorosi su diverse piante mono-e dicotiledoni. Potrebbe trattarsi di un nuovo metabolita fitotossico di D. maydis.
42685427|Spain is the largest European Union producer and exporter of pomegranates. More than 85% of Spanish commercial plantings are located in the Elche area (Alicante Province, SE Spain), where cv. Mollar de Elche is the most important cultivar. The incidence and etiology of postharvest pomegranate diseases were determined in local environmental conditions. Commercially-grown pomegranates cv. Mollar de Elche from two orchards were assessed, during two consecutive seasons, for latent and wound pathogens causing postharvest diseases. Healthy pomegranates were either artificially wounded in the rind or surface disinfected and placed in humid chambers at 20C for up to 15 weeks. Additionally, decay was periodically assessed on commercially-handled pomegranates stored at 5C for up to 27 weeks. The main causal agents of wound and latent infections were Penicillium spp. and Botrytis cinerea, respectively. The same pathogens were also the most frequently isolated from cold-stored fruit, but decay at 5C was only significant after 19 weeks. Another relatively frequent pathogen on fruit incubated at 20C was Aspergillus niger. Among the fungi isolated, Penicillium expansum, P. sclerotiorum, P. glabrum and Pilidiella granati were pathogenic on inoculated pomegranates, whereas P. minioluteum and Cytospora annulata were not. No decay caused by Alternaria spp. or Colletotrichum gloeosporioides was observed.
42685923|The effect of ABS (sodium dodecylbenzene sulphonate) sprays on the epistomatal waxes of seven Italian provenances of beech (Fagus sylvatica L.) was studied by scanning electron microscopy (SEM). Trees were treated twice a week with 50 ppm sodium dodecylbenzene sulphonate ABS for 10 weeks in a self-operated rain-exclusion shelter. Control trees were either sprayed with a deionised water or were left untreated. Damage to the stomatal waxes was assessed by SEM and stomata were scored for wax degradation according to an arbitrary scale. On the basis of these scores, damage indexes were determined for the various provenances before treatment, after treatment with ABS, and for the controls. Wax degradation was attributed partly to natural leaf aging and partly to the treatment with ABS. The twenty ABS treatments separated some of the provenances statistically.
42684493|Un campione di semi di Cucurbita pepo  risultato, alie analisi di laboratorio, fortemente infetto da Fusarium solani. Il patogeno, gi noto per essere trasmesso per seme,  stato rilevato, dopo opportuna incubazione, sia sulla base dello sviluppo su mezzo agarizzato, sia attraverso Tesame dei sintomi sui germinelli. La caratterizzazione della forma specialis e del patotipo  stata fatta su un ceppo monoconidiale isolato da seme; sulla base dei caratteri patogenetici anche in confronto con ceppi noti,  stato possibile riferire il ceppo isolato a F. solani f. sp. cucurbitae r. 1. Lo stesso campione, seminato in serra, tunnel e pieno campo, ha in ogni caso mostrato una alta percentuale di trasmissione dell'inoculo dal seme alia pianta. Tuttavia, la coltura protetta ha fatto registrare un basso tasso di mortalita in post-emergenza per una esaltata capacita delle piante malate ad erneuere radici avventizie. Una minore emergenza, peraltro,  stata notata soltanto in tunnel per il verificarsi di basse temperature durante i primi giorni dopo la semina. Questa condizione, rallentando maggiormente lo sviluppo della pianta in confronto a quello del patogeno, probabilmente ha giocato, per i semi pi infetti, un ruolo determinante consentendo una precoce uccisione dell'ospite. Prove di concia del seme con Benomyl, Benomyl + Thiram e Thiram, hanno indicato nella miscela il solo trattamento valido. Following severe losses of Cucrbita pepo in the glasshouse caused by Fusarium solani, an investigation was undertaken into the role of seed-borne inoculum of the pathogen, its pathogenicity, the effect of cultural practices on the disease and fungicide control measures. A sample of seeds which had given diseased plants was tested for F. solani by four methods: on PCNB agar either with or without pretreatment; on blotters in petri dishes and on the Jacobsen apparatus both without pretreatment. On agar 85.7% of untreated seed and 12.0% of pretreated seed (deep seated inoculum) showed infection; after 15 days incubation on the Jacobsen apparatus 89.5% of seedlings showed symptoms but after 8 days on blotters only 23.7% showed fungal growth and seedling symptoms. A monoconidial strain of the fungus isolated from infected seed of C. pepo was used in inoculation experiments. Inoculating healthy seeds of Pisum sativum, Lupinus albus, Phaseolus vulgaris and Vicia jaba gave no disease while similar inoculations on Cucrbita, Cucumis, CHrullus and Lagenaria species gave symptoms on roots and hypocotyls of seedlings and plants, showing the fungus to be F. solani f. sp. cucurbitae, race 1. This was confirmed by inoculating seed of certain cultivars and varieties of C. pepo in comparison with two known strains of F. solani f. sp. cucurbitae, race 1; there were no differences in reaction. Diseased plants show yellowing and wilting symptoms, increasing progressively from seedling emergence; some plants collapse and die. In the present experiments, seeds from the infected sample, sown in the glasshouse, or in the field either under plastic tunnels or in the open, gave rise to similar amounts of post-emergence disease after 42 days (no significant differences in numbers of diseased and dead plants between the cultural conditions). However, tunnel cultures also showed pre-emergence losses: 17.8% unemerged plants compared with 8.3% and 7.8% respectively in the glasshouse and in the open in the field and 8.0% ungerminated seeds in the laboratory. This was possibly due to low temperatures (9.1  C average) in the tunnel during the first 10 days after sowing, compared with 16.7C in the field and > 20C in the glasshouse. It was concluded that seedlings from seeds with deep seated inoculum died before emergence in addition to seeds which failed to germinate. Emerged plants in tunnel showed symptoms later than those in the glasshouse and in the open. Estimating pre-emergence losses due to the pathogen at 9.5% in tunnels, the total disease incidence (unemerged plus post-emergence diseased and dead plants) was 65.6% in the glasshouse, 77.3% in tunnels and 66.7% in the open. The ratios of  seed infection/diseased plants  based on the data obtained on the Jacobsen apparatus, are respectively 1/0.73, 1/0.83, 1/0.75. Thus under all the cultural conditions the rate of seed transmission of disease was high. Glasshouse and tunnel cultures, however, both showed less post-emergence plant failure: 7.8% and 2.2% dead plants respectively, compared with 47.8% in the open. This was possibly due to enhanced development of adventitious roots allowing plants to recover from underground infection. Benomyl, Thiram and Benomyl + Thiram seed treatments were compared on the Jacobsen apparatus and in the glasshouse, giving both short-and long-term trials. On the Jacobsen apparatus, both Benomyl 4-Thiram and Thiram were more active than Benomyl alone. In the glasshouse, post-emergence disease incidence was greatly decreased by Benomyl + Thiram, while Benomyl and Thiram alone gave only a partial reduction. The two fungicides showed different effects. Benomyl, which was initially the more effective, gradually lost its efficacy and as plants grew more become infected. Thiram, on the other hand, appeared to be effective against superficial inoculum only, as a limited number of post-emergence diseased and dead plants, corresponding to the percentage of deeply infected seeds (12.0%), appeared within a relatively short time and remained constant.
42685835|Four out of 628 (0.6%) Periwinkle (Catharanthus roseus) seedlings connected by Dodder (Cuscuta campestris) to shoots of cv. Caveccia and cv. Chardonnay. The etiological and epidemiological significance of these findings is discussed.
