43871738|Field experiments were conducted for 2 years to determine the effectiveness of combined use of two biocontrol agents, Bacillus firmus and Aspergillus versicolor for control of Macrophomina phaseolina induced charcoal rot of cowpea and Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. cumini induced wilt of cumin. The lowest level of plant mortality (3-4%) due to charcoal rot of cowpea was recorded when bacterium coated seeds were sown in radish compost amended soil compared to the non-amended soil (13.8-20.5%), but this was not significantly better than some other treatments. Cowpea roots from B. firmus coated seeds had better nodulation than any of the individual A. versicolor treatments. Although B. firmus coated seeds + A. versicolor + farmyard manure resulted in maximum nodulation this was not significantly different to B. firmus seed coating. Root colonization by the combined biocontrol agent treatments was better than the individual biocontrol agent treatments. Combining A. versicolor with farmyard manure supported the maximum populations of total fungi and actinomycetes. In both winter seasons, the lowest incidence of wilt (1.0-5.2%) on cumin was recorded when A. versicolor was amended with neem compost compared to the non-amended soil (5.7-10.5%). Maximum colonization of A. versicolor on roots was observed in B. firmus + A. versicolor + farmyard manure amended plots. During both years, the treatment combination of A. versicolor in neem compost amended plots resulted in maximum populations of fungi, bacteria and A. versicolor in the soil, which was greater than in the non-amended soil. Significant increases in disease control were not recorded after single or repeated delivery of A. versicolor. These results suggest that combining B. firmus as seed coatings with A. versicolor as soil applications gives improved control of M. phaseolina and Fusarium induced diseases on legume and seed spice crops in arid soils.
42685993|The conventional blotter method for detecting Pyrenophora gramnea was improved to the cold blotter method in the Seed Health Laboratory of the International Center for Agricultural Research in the Dry Areas (ICARDA). The superiority of the improved method was assessed by comparing it with the standard freezing blotter and growing-on methods, using naturally-infected seeds of three barley cultivars, Arta, Roumi, Faiz, and the accession CI 06944, collected from plants showing symptoms of barley leaf stripe. The cold blotter method provided quick and reliable detection when seeds were laid on moist blotter paper with the dorsal side down. It revealed a high number of infected seeds within three days of incubation at 8C in the dark, and favored the development of conidiophores and conidia of P. graminea on the apical half of the ventral side of infected seed, with limited mycelial growth. The cold blotter method is recommended for use in seed health laboratories that test for P. graminea in barley seed.
42685550|Fire blight disease of pears was first recorded in Egypt in 1962. The pathogen was isolated from a few pear trees in an orchard at Mamal El-Kezaz, Behera Governorate that was subsequently removed in 1966. It seemed that the removal of that orchard had helped in eradicating the disease up to 1981. However, sudden severe outbreaks of fireblight disease on pears took place at Alexandria and Behera Governorates, Egypt during 1982 and 1983 seasons. Imported propagating pear plant materials are probably responsible for the introduction of the pathogen to Egypt, where the prevailing environmental conditions during 1982-83 seasons favoured the epidemic spreading of the disease in the mentioned governorates. Seventy authentic pathogenic isolates of Erwinia amylovora (Burrill) Winslow et al. were obtained from diseased samples collected from different localities within the two governorates. 42685404|Black-foot is one of the most destructive grapevine trunk diseases in nurseries and young vineyards, causing necrotic root lesions, wood necrosis of the rootstock base, and a gradual decline and death of grapevines. Causal agents of the disease are included into the genera Campylocarpon, "Cylindrocarpon", Cylindrocladiella and Ilyonectria. Recent taxonomical studies of Neonectria and related genera with "Cylindrocarpon"-like anamorphs based on morphological and phylogenetic studies, divided Neonectria into five genera. Thus, the current taxonomical position and classification of the causal agents of black-foot disease, mainly "Cylindrocarpon" / Ilyonectria, comprises one of the main topics of this review. The review also provides an update on geographical distribution, epidemiology and management strategies of the disease.
42684747|Further ultrastructural investigations have confirmed the presence of phloem-limited virus-like particles in vines with leafroll symptoms, including plants indexing positive only for leafroll. Attemps to extract the virus-like particles from naturally infected grapevines were carried out. Virus-enriched preparations were obtained by grinding Grapevine tissues in an extraction medium made up of phoshate buffer 0.05M containing 5mM mercaptoethanol, 5mM DIECA, 5g/l polyethylene glycol 6000, followed by enzymatic treatments with cellulase and pectinase and differential centrifugations. Bien que l'espce E. chrysanthemi soit capable de synthtizer et d'excrter in vitro des enzymes pectinolytiques, cellulolytiques et protolytiques, les quantits de ces enzymes produites par les diffrentes souches employes diffrent notablement.

42685789|Populations of Thielaviopsis basicola (Berk. et Br.) Ferr. were determined in six tobacco fields in a large 'Virginia Bright' growing area of Umbria (central Italy). The fields, having similar physical-chemical characteristics, had supported tobacco monoculture for many years. The concentration of propagules of T. basicola was quantified at 110 propagules/g soil in fields with only two years, while lower populations were found in fields in which monoculture had been practiced for many years. Moreover, pathogen populations were negatively correlated (r = -0.728, P = 0.01) with the number of years in tobacco. Marked differences in susceptibility to T. basicola were observed in ten tobacco cultivars tested by 'chlamydospore test' and in greenhouse trials. Cultivars Bright VB 44, Bright F.B. and Coker 48 were more tolerant to the pathogen in both assays. However differences in the results obtained using the two techniques to evaluate resistance were noted. Notevoli differenze nella suscettibilit a T. basicola si sono osservate saggiando dieci cultivar di tabacco al 'test delle clamidospore' e in prove in serra. Le cultivar Bright VB 44, Bright F.B. e Coker 48 sono risultate pi tolleranti al parassita. Tuttavia, nella valutazione della resistenza utilizzando le due tecniche, si son talvolta ntate differenze nei risultati ottenuti.
42685799|Nel corso di due anni  stata saggiata l'influenza dell'umidit del terreno sulla maturazione e sulla germinazione delle oospore di Plasmopara viticola. I risultati ottenuti sembrano indicare che i processi sono favoriti da una condizione di umidit variabile pi che da un livello di umidit costante. During a 2-year trial, an investigation on the effect of soil moisture on oospore maturation and germination in P. viticola has been carried out. On the base of the results obtained, it seems that such processes are improved by a condition of variable rather than constant moisture.
42684424|Dans le prsent travail, nous tudions in vitro quelques aspects de la biologie du Diaporthe phaseolorum (Cke. et Ell.) Sacc. var. sojae (Lehman) Wehm. (forme conidienne: Phomopsis phaseoli (Desm.) Grove) parasite du Soja (Glycine max (L.) Merr.). Le pathogne montre une croissance myclienne aise sur plusieurs milieux natureles et synthtiques. C'est un champignon thermophile  croissance myclienne nulle  10 C et 34 C, non ngligeable  15 C et 32 C, leve entre 25 C et 30 C, optimale  28 C. Il peut germer, par ses conidies a, et crotre sur une large zone de pH comprise entre 4 et 7 et plus specialement entre pH 4,5 et pH 6,0. La germination des conidies  favorise par une haute humidit relative (R.H.) (80  100%), est encore capable de se produire  un taux lev lorsque l'R.H. est relativement basse (92% de germination  43% ou 65% d'R.H.). Sur le milieux courants, la formation des pycnides (sporulation) ne s'observe que lorsque les colonies fongiques sont exposes  la lumire (2500 lux) continue ou discontinue (hmropriode: 12 h/24 h). Utilises comme source de carbone, la farine de tiges ges de Soja (tiges, riches notamment en pectine et en lignine, sur lesquelles se diffrencient en grande abondance les pycnides dans la nature) et la pectine purifie favorisent, outre la croissance myclienne, le processus de sporulation  la lumire en l'acclrant et/ou en l'intensifiant. Soulignons qu'en prsence de certains composs phnoliques tels que l'acide frulique, le conifrol, la vanilline ou le gaacol, la pathogne parvient  sporuler  l'obscurit. Some aspects of the biology of Diaporthe phaseolorum var. sojae (conidial state: Phomopsis phaseoli), a Soybean parasite have been studied in vitro. The pathogen grows easily on several natural or synthetic media. It is a thermophile fungus showing reduced mycelium growth at 15 C and 32 C, high growth between 25 C and 30 C and optimal growth at 28 C. There is no mycelium growth at 10 C or a at 34 C. The pathogen can germinate, through its -conidia, and grows on a wide range of pH (between 4 and 7) especially well between pH 4,5 and pH 6.0. The germination of -conidia is favoured by a high relative humidity (R.H.) (80 to 100%) but still occurs, at a high rate, when R.H. is relatively low (92% of germination at 43% or 65% R.H.). In usual media, pycnidia formation (sporulation) is only seen when the fungus colonies are exposed to continuous or discontinuous light (2,500 lux: 12 h; darkness: 12 h). When utilized as a carbon source, the flour of old soybean stems (stems rich in pectin and lignin, on which pycnidia are profusely formed in the field) and purified pectin favour, besides the mycelium growth, the course of sporulation in the light, thus accelerating and/or intensifying it. Phenols, such as ferulic acid, coniferol, vanillin or gaiacol, induce the pathogen to sporulate in the darkness.
42685223|Mutants of Nectria haematococca var. cucurbitae moderately to highly resistant to terbinafine (resistance factor up to 150 in liquid medium), could be isolated in the laboratory at high frequencies (1 to 5  10) after UV mutagenesis. Mutations leading to terbinafine resistance seems not to carry apparent fitness, penalities, such as reduced rate of growth and virulence on squash seedlings. Mutants were not cross-resistant to morpholines fenpropimorph and tridemorph and to DMIs fenarimol and triadimenol. Gas liquid Chromatographic analysis of nonsaponifiable lipids from terbinafine-treated wild type mycelia showed that the primary action of terbinafine in N. haematococca var. cucurbitae, as in other fungi, is the inhibition of squalene epoxidase activity. However, similar studies with the terbinafine-resistant strain TF-411 showed an accumulation of squalene in mycelia grown in the absence of fungicide. A lipid unrelated to 2,3-oxidosqualene, was accumulated in mycelia of mutant strain grown in the presence of terbinafine in growth medium. These results provide an evidence for a target site change of squalene epoxidase as the resistant mechanism in the mutant strain and for a secondary action of terbinafine at a step previous of squalene formation on sterol biosynthetic pathway.

The age of infection and the temperature effect were evaluated on virus preparations from Lupin and Squash. The B/(B + B) ratio obtained from Lupin increased with the infection age and decreased with the temperature. 42685672|Vengono descritte alcune fasi dello sviluppo di Seiridium cupressi non ancora studiate al T.E.M. e S.E.M. Nelle nostre osservazioni tali cellule mantengono inalterate per lungo tempo il loro citoplasma. II distacco del conidio  regolato sia da forze meccaniche sia da attivit enzimatiche. L'appendice basale si sviluppa dopo il distacco del conidio dall'ifa. Questo processo  simile a quello della germinazione dei conidi di molti altri ascomiceti e basidiomiceti. Data la note vole variabilit morfolgica e autogenica esistente all'interno delle specie S. cardinale, S. cupressi e S. unicorne, viene discussa l'opportunit di effettuare ulteriori ricerche a livello ultrastrutturale, confrontando isolati dei funghi provenienti da aree geografiche diverse. Some ultrastructural aspects of the developmental changes in the life cicle of Seiridium cupressi, not yet studied at T.E.M. and S.E.M., are described. Further informations on the structures of acervulus, hyphae, conidial growth and germination are given. In the conidium septa originate from invagination of the inner layer of the wall. Therefore each conidium cell is surrounded by a new inner wall layer except apical cells that maintain the wall structure of the hyphae. In our researches the basal appendage always originates from the basal cell of the conidium after its release. In this cell the cytoplasm is always recognizable during all the period of the observations. Enzimic activity and mechanical forces are applied in the release of conidia. Germination and formation of basal appendage is similar but in the germinating hyphae a septum develops readily. Because of controversy and variability inside and among the three fungal species causing Cypress cancker, the need of further ultrastructural and chemical researches, on isolates of different cultural characteristics and geographical distributions, is discussed.

42683945|The results of a survey for possible nematode vectors conducted in several Hungarian viticultural districts where virus diseases spread through the soil, are reported. Two dagger nematodes (Xiphinema index Thorne et Allen, 1950 and Xiphinema vuittenezi Luc, Lima, Weischer et Flegg, 1964) and a species of Paralongidorus temporarily identified as Paralongidorus maximus (Biitschli) Siddiqi, 1964 were found. Of these X. vuittenezi seems by far the most widespread, occurring in all but one site of collection. X. index was recovered only in two localities. Virus transmission trials proved that Hungarian populations of X. index are able to move Grapevine yellow mosaic virus from diseased to healthy vines. The results of this preliminary study indicate also that in Hungary there are two soil-borne  diseases  (yellow mosaic and chrome mosaic) characterized by symptoms virtually indistinguishable in the field, but very likely induced by two entirely different viruses, transmitted by different vectors. Some epidemiological observations were carried out on rusts and powdery mildew infections on 30 cultivars of durum Wheat in 3 areas in Southern Italy (Foggia and Gravina in Apulia, and Policoro in Basilicata) during 1983 and 1984. Moderate infections of brown rust (P. recndita f. sp. tritici) and stem rust (P. graminis f. sp. tritici) were observed in 1984. The collected data indicated that a change of virulence in the populations of P. recndita and P. graminis, probably occurred during the last few years. Race 77 and 34 of P. recndita and P. graminis respectively, were the most frequently occurring physiological races in 1983 and 1984. Some Wheat cultivars, such as 'Belvedere' and 'Karel' showed good resistance to rusts; others, such as 'Pepe 64', 'Sansone 201 P 'and ' l'algerardo' were resistant to both rusts and powdery mildew.
42684352|Carbohydrate metabolism of Sunflower (Helianthus annum L.) leaves of the culture EC68413 inoculated with Alternaria helianthi (Hansf.) Tubaki et Nishihara was studied. The leaf spot lesions were separated into necrotic, halo and pre halo regions. Respiratory activity increased in the halo and pre halo regions; the necrotic tissue recorded an initial increase in respiration followed by a rapid decrease. The halo zone recorded a very high catalase activity while the enzyme activity was low in necrotic tissue. There was no significant change in catalase activity in pre halo zone. The photosynthetic rate and the content of photosynthetic pigments chlorophylls, carotene and xanthophyll decreased in the three zones of the lesion. Starch content also decreased in necrotic, halo and pre halo tissues, while  amylase activity increased. In general, total soluble sugars, glucose and fructose decreased in the necrotic and halo regions, while there was no significant change in sugar content in the pre halo tissue. The sucrose level was significantly low in the necrotic tissue, and the halo region had an increase in sucrose content. Investigations on the presence and density of winged aphid populations were carried out in ten different localities in the mountains of Friuli-Venezia Giulia, northeastern Italy, with the aim of detecting eventual areas suitable for seed-potato growing. 42685846|When leaf discs of Chenopodium amaranticolor Coste et Reyn, where floated right after Tobacco necrosis virus (TNV) inoculation in suspensions of either vitamin A acetate or retinoic acid of different concentrations (20, 200 and 2,000 g/ml), an increase of TNV biosynthesis up to 1.5 times for 200 g/ml was obtained. Giving retinoic acid by vacuum infiltration resulted in a higher stimulation (up to 1.8) of virus biosynthesis.When retinoic acid was vacuum infiltrated at different times after inoculation, stimulation of virus replication decreased with increasing time from inoculation. In our TNV-inoculated plants an inhibitor of virus biosynthesis (AVF), with chemical characteristics similar to those of interferons, is present. It is thus conceivable to hypotesize that vitamin A, being a suppressor of interferon production, acts in our system by depressing AVF formation. 42685677| stata studiata la produzione di siringomicina (SR) e di siringotossina (ST) da parte di due isolati (B359 e B427) di Pseudomonas syringae pv. syringae nel substrato liquido IMM contenente concentrazioni di fosfato inorganico (Pi) di 0,8, 1,6 e 10 mmoli/l. I risultati ottenuti hanno indicate che le due fitotossine sono sintetizzate gi durante la fase di moltiplicazione dei batteri e che la quantit accumulata nel substrato aumenta all'aumentare della concentrazione del Pi. The production of syringomycin (SR) and syringotoxin (ST) by two strains (B359 and B427) of P. syringae pv. syringae has been studied in the liquid medium IMM containing 0.8, 1.6 and 10 mmol/l of inorganic phosphate (Pi). The results showed that both phytotoxins are in part synthesized during the growth of bacteria and that the amount accumulated in the medium increases with the increase of Pi concentration. Other experiments made on potato-dextrose-agar showed that concentrations greater than 100 mmol/1 are needed to completely inhibit the synthesis of SR and ST. The bacterial longevity seemed to be favoured in the conditions in which the synthesis of both toxins was stimulated.
42685300|The ability of Russian wheat aphid (Diuraphis noxia) and the green peach aphid (Myzus persicae) to vector Moroccan isolates of barley yellow dwarf virus (BYDV-PAV) was evaluated. Oats, Avena sativa 'Clintland 64' were used as test-plants and results of virus transmission were checked by direct ELISA. No evidence of biotype variability in virus transmission efficiency among 5 different clones of the Russian wheat aphid was found when BYDV-PAV isolates derived from 5 different sites were used. Longer periods of virus acquisition and inoculation were required for the Russian wheat aphid when compared to those of Rhopalosiphum padi, R. maidis, Sitobion avenae, and Schizaphis graminum. The incubation period of BYDV in test-plants was 16 to 19 days for R. padi and S. avenae and 22 to 25 days for R. maidis, S. graminum, and D. noxia. After 72 h of virus acquisition, transmission rates, using one aphid/test-plant, were 93%, 62%, 22%, 18% and 16%, respectively, for R. padi, S.avenae, S. graminum, R. maidis and D. noxia. After an inoculation access of 72 h, the maximum rate of virus transmission was 82% for R. padi, 53% for S. avenae, 22% for S. graminum, 16% for R. maidis, and 13% for D. noxia.
43872346|Chalara fraxinea, the cause of ash dieback, is present in many European countries and constitutes severe threat to Fraxinus spp. in forests, urban areas and nurseries. This study investigated tissue colonisation strategies of the parasite in Common ash at ultrastructural level and demonstrated that C. fraxinea develops intracellularly, moving through the cells and easily colonising the phloem, paratracheal parenchyma and parenchymatic rays. However, damage to either the plasmalemma or cell walls was not observed under our experimental conditions. Furthermore, the presence of intrahyphal hyphae was frequently detected, which are likely associated with a regeneration mechanism.

Le diverse specie di Fusarium hanno prodotto in coltura le seguenti micotossine (n. di isolati tossigeni/n. di isolati saggiati): F. culmorum (6/6) ZON, -and -ZOH, DON e 3-AcDON; F graminearum (7/7) ZON, DON e 15-AcDON; F. crookwellense (1/1) ZON, -e -ZOH, FUS e NIV; F. equiseti (1/2) ZON e -ZOH; F. avenaceum (5/5) MF. Gli isolati saggiati di F. moniliforme (2), F. proliferatum (2) e F. semitectum (2) non hanno prodotto alcuna delle micotossine ricercate, anche se in alcuni casi gli estratti colturali sono risultati tossici verso le larve di A.salina.

42685387|Five tobacco cultivars responded to Meloidogyne incognita inoculation with a 1.0-3.0 gall index. Inoculation with Pythium aphanidermatum resulted in a 0.33-2.66 root rot index, except cultivar RK-12 P3, which was without symptoms. The root rot symptoms became more severe in the plants concomitantly inoculated with fungus and nematode. The root rot symptoms also developed on cultivar RK-12 P3 in the presence of root-knot nematode. Soil populations of P. aphanidermatum were significantly greater in the presence than absence of M. incognita. Rootknot nematode population, however, showed a reverse trend, being less in the presence of root rot fungus. The fungus and nematode individually reduced the leaf pigments and plant growth of all cultivars except RK-12 P3 (P<0.05), being greater in concomitantly inoculated compared with single pathogen inoculated plants. Phenol and salicylic acid contents of tobacco leaves gradually increased up to 15-20 days after planting, and thereafter, decreased. The greatest phenol and salicylic acid concentrations were recorded in tobacco plants concomitantly inoculated with the fungus and nematode.

42684196|A comparative immunological study of pectic lyases produced on polypectate by soft rot coliform bacteria was carried out. One hundred and ten strains belonging to Erwinia carotovora (Jones) Bergey et al. var. atroseptica (Van Hall) Dye (14), var. carotovora Dye (21) and var. chrysanthemi Dye (78), according to Dye's classification (1969), were tested. Two PGTE isozymes produced by a Carnation strain (IPV-BO 380) were used as antigens for immune serum preparation. These antigens were purified by means of ammonium sulfate and cold acetone precipitation, and by Chromatographie separation on a Sephadex G-100 column. Analysis of the immune serum demonstrated that the two PGTE isozymes induced the formation of specific immune -globulins and that the immunological system was bispecific. The immunodiffusion tests were carried out using an antigen-antibody ratio corresponding to the equivalence zone of the homologous antigen. Heterologous antigens were made up of pectic lyase extracts partially purified by ammonium sulfate precipitation (60-90% of saturation). The extracts of pathogens belonging to atroseptica and carotovora varieties did not give precipitation lines in the immunodiffusion test. On the contrary, the strains of chrysanthemi variety gave an identity or partial identity reaction with at least one of the two isozymes of the homologous strain. The most common isozyme-antigen was that with pI = 9.4. The presence of a common immunological marker in pathogens of nine different host plants, suggests a relationship among these microrganisms and the probable derivation from a common ancestor. On the basis of these serological relations, the position of pathogens included in the chrysanthemi variety among the other soft rot coliform bacteria is discussed.  stato condotto uno studio immunologico comparativo delle liasi pectiche prodotte su polipectato dai batteri coliformi agenti di marciume molle. 42685671|A mutant marked with two antibiotic resistances (Rifr-Chlorr) was selected from a virulent wild strain of A. tumefaciens biovar 1, originally isolated from Paris daisy. Following crown inoculations, the mutant caused large primary tumours. 60 and 120 days after the inoculation, reisolation on selective medium was attempted from inside the stems at various distances from primary tumours. After 60 days the mutant was reisolated at all distances up to 45 cm in the stems inoculated in November, but only up to 5 cm  and with a low frequency  in the stems inoculated in March. After 120 days, the mutant was not reisolated either from the stems inoculated in November or from those inoculated in March. The mutant was reisolated after 60 and 120 days from primary tumours, and also in 10 out of 15 cases, after 235 days. Failure to reisolate the RiFr-Chlorr mutant from the stems, cannot be explained by an endophytic survival of less than 120 days. It is hypothesized that, in certain periods, internal stem tissue of the Paris daisy becomes an unfavourable environment for agrobacteria, leading to a decrease in their population or inhibiting translocation. 42685892|Tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV) causes major yield losses of tomatoes in Egypt and other parts of the Mediterranean region and Thailand. Isolates of TYLCV are known from Israel (ISR), Sardinia (SAR), and Thailand (THA). Our study characterized four isolates of TYLCV collected in Fayoum, Giza, and Ismailia governorates of Egypt. Polymerase chain reaction (PCR) using degenerate geminivirus primers which anneal to either C1 or V1 were used to obtain various sized fragments. Also, specific primers designed from the sequence of TYLCV-ISR were used to amplify the whole genome of the TYLCV from Egypt. Nucleotide sequence comparisons of the C1 regions of the four isolates from Egypt showed 98% to 100% identities revealing that they are the same strain. Further nucleotide sequence comparisons, showed the TYCLV isolate from Fayoum to be nearly identical to TYLCV-ISR, but not closely related to TYLCV-THA and TYLCV-SAR, or to the tomato leaf curl virus (TLCV) isolates from India, Taiwan, and Australia. A recombinant plasmid (pEGFMM) with a 1.3-mer insert of TYLCV from Egypt was constructed using two cloned PCRDNA fragments, and was effectively used as a DNA probe in hybridization assays to detect geminivirus in crops from Egypt. In addition, a strain-specific TYCLV-EG probe was constructed from the 314-bp intergenic region.

42685921|Characteristics of separated and dual culture of seven species of Fusarium (F. solani, F. tricinctum, F. sporotrichioides, F. moniliforme, F. oxysporum, F. culmorum, and F. graminearum ) with five strains of Enterobacter cloacae (EcZP101, EcZP102, EcZP103, EcZP104 and EcZP105), incubated for 2,4 and 8 days on potato dextrose agar (PDA) and nutrient broth agar (NBA) at 25C were studied. Fusarium species and bacterial strains were isolated from rotted and healthy maize roots, respectively. Bacterial strains were found to induce changes of pigmentation and reduction of growth of Fusarium cultures, particularly on PDA. Culture discolouration was associated with poor growth of surface mycelia. The bacterial strain EcZP101 reduced growth of F. oxysporum and F. solani after 8 days of dual culture incubation on both media. No difference in colony characteristics of Fusarium species were noticed on either media in interaction with the bacterial strain EcZP104. E. cloacae strains caused decay of onion bulbs and carrot slices depending on temperature and strains, but no one caused decay of potato slices.
42684722|Comparative investigations of Grapevine yellow vein (GYVV) and a Grapevine isolate of Tomato ringspot (TomRSV) viruses were carried out on a biological, physocochemical, serological and ultrastructural basis. Reactions of the herbaceous host range were nearly the same. Purified virus preparations contained isometric particles ca. 30 nm in diameter with angular contour which, in the analytical ultracentrifuge, sedimented as two components at 64 S(T) and 124 S(B). B fractions of both viruses, at equilibium in CsCl, banded as two components with a slightly different RNA content. In polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis the RNA of both viruses migrated as a single species with molecular weight of ca. 2.2  10 daltons. Cytological alterations of infected cells were the same and similar to those typically elicited by nepoviruses. The two viruses were serologically related but distinguishable. I componenti B di entrambi i virus all'equilibrio in CsCl si sono separati in due subcomponenti con contenuto di RNA leggermente differente. Inoltre, gli RNA di entrambi i virus hanno migrato come singola specie con peso molecolare di ca. 2,2  10 daltons in gel di poliacrilamide. 42683556|In parecchi pescheti emiliani  comparsa gi da alcuni anni una dannosa alterazione dei frutti prossimi alia raccolta. Essa consiste essenzialmente in una maturazione precoce e anormale dell'apice del frutto pendente, accompagnata da intensa pigmentazione rossa delle parti lese e seguita a breve scadenza dal disfacimento di esse. Essa  stata finora segnalata su numerse variet di pesche a pasta bianca e gialla, precoci, medie e tardive ; sembra tuttavia che esista qualche cultivar capace di restare indenne in mezzo a pescheti da lungo tempo assai danneggiati nel prodotto di tutte le altre piante. La malattia ha somiglianze pi o meno strette col red suture, e con altre virosi americane del Pesco; col peach-suture spot, ora attribuito ad anormali condizioni del terreno; coi sintomi prodotti sul frutto dalla deficienza di boro; coll'internal browning, attribuito a raccolta troppo tardiva; col blacktip, riferito ad intossicazione da fumi; con due tipi di ustioni da antiparassitari; col soft suture, che secondo alcuni  prodotto da intossicazione da fluoro; col quadro sintomatologico prodotto suile pesche da intossicazione di 2,4-D; col warty suture del pesco, una alterazione di presunta origine genetica; ma non pu identificarsi con nessuna di tali affezioni. L'unica ipotesi che corrisponde completamente ai sintomi e al comportamento della malattia in campo senibra essere quella di una malattia contagiosa, a grande rapidit di propagazione e grande facilita di disseminazione, prodotta da un nuovo ceppo di virus, appartenente alia famiglia dei virus del peach yellows, del little peach e del red suture. For some years now a trouble has occurred in the fruit near harvest-time in various Peach orchards in Emilia. This consists basically in a premature and abnormal ripening of the calyx end of the hanging fruit, accompanied by an intense red discolouration of the affected parts and followed soon afterwards by the breakdown of these parts. In at least one cultivar a fairly similar trouble has been noted, but without anthocyanosis, that has been tentatively identified with the red-coloured type. The other parts of the plant do not seem to possess any symptoms. The trouble may attack almost all the fruits of one plant and may spread to all the plants in an orchard, with no exception. This disease has been noted up to now in numerous varieties of white and yellow fleshed peaches, early, midseason and late; however, it seems that there are some varieties capable of remaining unaffected in the midst of peach orchards where the fruit of all the other plants has been considerably damaged for a long time. The disease bears a more or less close resemblance to red suture, as also to other American virus diseases of peaches ; to peachsuture spot, now tentatively attributed to abnormal soil conditions; to the symptoms shown by fruit of a boron deficient tree; to internal browning, attributed to an overdelayed harvest; to black tip, consequent to air pollution; to two types of spray injury; to soft suture, which, according to some authorities, is produced by fluorine; to the injury produced on peaches by 2,4-D; to warty suture of peach, a trouble supposed to be of genetical origin ; but it cannot be identified with any one of these diseases. The only hypothesis which corresponds entirely to the symptoms and to the progress of the trouble in the orchard seems to be that of a contagious disease, characterized by rapid progress through the tissues and by great power of spreading from tree to tree, produced by a new type of virus of the group of peach yellows, of little peach and of red suture. Dans plusieurs vergers de pchers de l'Emilie on a observ depuis quelques annes une altration des fruits proches de la cueillette. Elle consiste essentiellement dans la maturit prcoce et anormale de l'apex du fruit sur l'arbre, accompagne d'une intense pigmentation rouge des parties endommages et suivie  bref dlai de leur dcomposition. Dans au moins une varit on a remarqu une altration tout--fait analogue, mais dpourvue d'anthocyane, et juge pour le moment identique au type principal. Il ne semble pas qu'il existe des symptmes interessant d'autres lments de la plante. L'altration peut frapper presque tous les fruits de chaque plante et peut s'tendre  toutes les plantes d'un verger sans exception. Elle a t signale jusqu' prsent sur nombreuses varits de pches  chair blanche et jaune, prcoces, moyennes, tardives; il semble toutefois qu'il existe des varits, qui peuvent rester indemnes au milieu de vergers de pchers endommags depuis longtemps en ce qui concerne les fruits de toutes les autres plantes. La maladie a une ressemblance plus ou moins stricte avec le red suture et d'autres maladies  virus amricaines des pchers; avec le peach-suture spot, actuellement attribu  des conditions anormales de terrain; avec les symptmes produits sur le fruit par le manque de bore, avec l'internai browning, attribu  une cueillette trop retarde ; avec le black tip, attribu  l'intoxication due  des vapeurs; avec deux types de brlures dues  des substances antiparasitaires; avec le soft suture, qui d'aprs l'opinion des quelques personnes serait produit par une intoxication de fluor; avec le tableau symptomatologique de l'intoxication de 2,4-D ; avec le warty suture of peach, qui est une altration prsume d'origine gntique; mais elle ne peut s'identifier avec aucune de celles-ci. La seule hypothse correspondant compltement aux symptmes et au comportement de la maladie dans les champs parat tre la suivante. Il s'agirait d'une maladie contagieuse, ayant une grande rapidit de propagation et une grande facilit de dissmination, produite par une nouvelle souche d'ultravirus faisant partie de la famille des virus du peach yellows, du little peach et du red suture.
42685691|A triparental mating system has been used for the introduction of the cosmid pVK102 into Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi. The technique utilized was that of Ditta et al. with some modifications to overcome the refractority of the bacterium to conjugation. Mobilizing functions were provided by the helper plasmid pRK2013. The donor strain was Escherichia coli HB101. Bacterial matings were then made between HB101 (pVK102), HB101 (pRK2013), and a recipient. Of the 7 strains of P. s. pv. savastanoi utilized as recipients in the conjugation experiments only two, NCPPB640, and ITM601, acquired plasmid pVK102 at a frequency ranging from 0.83x10 to 6.3x10 transconjugants per recipient cell. The Kanamycin, tetracycline resistant phenotype in P. s. pv. savastanoi was stable in presence and absence of antibiotic selection indicating that plasmid pVK102 can be used in the genetic studies concerning the causal agent of the olive and oleander knot disease. Un sistema di coniugazione triparentale  stato utilizzato per introdurre il cosmide pVK102 in Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi. La tcnica utilizzata  stata quella messa a punto dalla Ditta et al. alla quale sono state apportate alcune modifcazioni per superare la refrattariet del batterio alla coniugazione. Le funzioni coniugative erano sul plasmide pRK2013 mantenuto nel ceppo di Escherichia coli HB101. L'incrocio batterico  stato quindi HB101 (pVK102) HB101 (pRK2013) ricevente. Dei 7 isolati di P. s. pv. savastanoi utilizzati nel corso del lavoro solo due, NCPPB640, e ITM601, entrambi da oleandro, hanno acquisito il plasmide pVK102. La frequenza di coniugazione  variata da 0,83x10 a 6,310 transconiuganti/cellula ricevente. La resistenza a kanamicina e tetraciclina, portata dal plasmide pVK 102,  stabile in P. s. pv. savastanoi anche in assenza dlia pressione selettiva degli antibiotici indicando che questo plasmide pu essere usato in studi genetici riguardanti l'agente dlia rogna dell'olivo e dell'oleandro.

The development of rhizomania infection was assessed in four Sugar-beet cv., with varying susceptibility to this disease. 42685213|A rapid and sensitive assay for specific detection and identification of barley yellow mosaic virus (BaYMV) and barley mild mosaic virus (BaMMV) was set up using the polymerase chain reaction (PCR). Three primer pairs were chosen to discriminate between the two viruses. PCR fragments of ca. 2000 bp were obtained using two primer pairs designed on BaMMV RNA1. The third pair, designed on BaYMV RNA2, primed amplification of a 752 base pairs DNA sequence. Subsequent restriction fragment length polymorphism analysis of the amplified DNAs, after digestion with several endonucleases, allowed rapid identification of both viruses and also suggested that the most common isolates in Italian barley crops are related to the German isolate of BaYMV (BaYMV-G) and the isolate Ka of BaMMV.

The influence on Phytophthora root rot was assessed by rating root weight, percentage of infected feeder root segments, and inoculum density on plants transplanted in a soil artificially inoculated with chlamydospores of a virulent isolate of P. nicotianae. 'Tarocco'. The investigations on the influence of a scion on sour orange Phytophthora root rot gave the following results compared to the control: i) a higher number of propagules of P. nicotianae in the rhizosphere of the sour orange/clementine and the sour orange/N. L. 'Tarocco' combinations, ii) a higher rate of root infection in the sour orange/N. L. 'Tarocco' combination. The correlation coefficients between inoculum density and root infection were 0.574 and 0.677 for sour orange/clementine and sour orange/N. L. 'Tarocco' orange combinations, respectively.

The ability of Phoma (Deuterophoma) tracheiphila (Petri) Kane, et Ghik. to produce pectolytic and cellulolytic enzymes and -glucosidase was tested in vitro. The enzymatic activities were evaluated on cultures of different age (7, 14, 21, and 28-day old), incubated at different temperatures (12, 19, and 26C). P. tracheiphila produced pectin methylesterase (PME), polygalacturonase (PG), polygalacturonate trans-eliminase (PGTE), macerating (MA) and cellulolytic (Cx) enzymes, and -glucosidase. The cultures incubated at 12C gave a higher activity of PME, PG, PGTE, and MA. However, -glucosidase and Cx were more active when the fungus was grown at 19 and 26C respectively. On a valu aussi l'activit enzymatique dans des cultures d'ge diffrent (7, 14, 21 et 28 jours), avec incubation effectue  diffrentes tempratures (12, 19 et 26C). 42685739|Mycoplasmalike organisms (MLOs) were detected in naturally infected plants of Gladiolus, Ranunculus, Brassica, and Hydrangea by dot hybridizations using six different biotin-labeled cloned DNA probes. Nucleic acid extracted from diseased plants of Gladiolus and Ranunculus hybridized with all of the probes employed with the exception of probe pEY11, which contained a fragment of elm yellows MLO DNA. Nucleic acid from Brassica failed to hybridize with probe pEY11 and probe pBB115, the latter containing a fragment of tomato big bud MLO DNA. Nucleic acid from diseased Hydrangea hybridized only with probes pBB24, CN40I, and pAY18 which contained DNA fragments from tomato big bud, periwinkle little leaf, and the Maryland strain of North American aster yellows MLO, respectively. The results indicated similarities in nucleotide sequence homologies among the MLOs in the four genera of naturally diseased plants and between these MLOs and some MLOs from North America. The results also distinguished the MLOs in diseased Brassica and Hydrangea from one another and distinguished these MLOs from those in the diseased Gladiolus and Ranunculus examined. Nonradioactive probe detection of MLOs in naturally infected field-grown plants raises the possibility that such probes might facilitate the indexing of nursery crops and tissue cultured plants for the presence of these pathogens. Organismi del tipo dei micoplasmi (Mycoplasmalike organisms: MLO) sono stati individuati in piante naturalmente infette di Gladiolus, Ranunculus, Brassica ed Hydrangea utilizzando il metodo della ibridazione molecolare con sei DNA ricombinanti specifici ("probes") marcati in maniera non radioattiva con biotina. Gli acidi nucleici estratti da piante infette di Gladiolus e Ranunculus hanno dato ibridazione positiva con tutti i ricombinanti saggiati ad eccezione di pEY11 che contiene un frammento di DNA proveniente dall'MLO associato al giallume dell'olmo. L'acido nucleico estratto da Brassica non ha dato ibridazione con pEY11 e pBB115, quest'ultimo ricombinante  stato ottenuto da un frammento di DNA dell'MLO associato al "tomato big bud". L'acido nucleico estratto da Hydrangea infetta ha mostrato ibridazione solamente con pBB24, CN40I e pAY18 i quali contengono rispettivamente frammenti di DNA provenienti dagli MLO associati a "tomato big bud", "periwinkle little leaf ed all'isolato del Maryland del giallume dell'astro ("aster yellows") nord americano. I risultati ottenuti indicano la presenza di sequenze nucleotidiche omologhe negli MLO dei quattro generi di piante naturalmente infette, nonch fra questi MLO ed alcuni nord americani. Dai risultati ottenuti  inoltre possibile distinguere fra di loro gli MLO present in Brassica ed Hydrangea e differenziare inoltre questi da quelli present nei campioni di Gladiolus e Ranunculus infetti esaminati. Il successo dell'impiego di DNA ricombinante nonradiattivo nella indiviaduazione di piante naturalmente infette da MLO permette di prevedere l'uso di questa tecnica in futuro per saggiare lo stato sanitario relativamente a questi patogeni, di vivai e di piante ottenute tramite colture di tessuti.
42685248|Progeny of Phytophthora parasitica derived from the pairings between metalaxyl-resistant MET.1 (A2) carrying homozygous dominant resistance and S1 (A1) wild-type consisted of selfs from each parent and hybrids carrying heterozygous dominant resistance. Similar results were obtained when dimetomorph-resistant DT.1 (A1) carrying homozygous dominant resistance was paired with wild-type S2 (A2). Progeny from the pairing between homozygous Str resistant (A1) to streptomycin and A2 resistant to metalaxyl consisted of selfs and hybrids resistant to either streptomycin or metalaxyl but not both. These results suggest that streptomycin-resistance is cytoplasmic. Progeny from the pairing between homozygous metalaxyl-resistant MET.1 (A1) and homozygous Str (A2) resistant to streptomycin consisted of 28 selfs from A1, 32 selfs from A2, 2 hybrids resulting from the union of A1 oogonium with an A2 antheridium. Progeny from the pairing between homozygous dimetomorph and streptomycin-resistant DT.1 (A1) with wild-type S2 (A2) consisted of 22 selfs A1, 14 selfs A2 and 12 hybrids, two of them resulted from the union A2 oogonium with an A1 antheridium.

42684551|Les eaux utilises pour irriguer les parcelles de tomate dans trois rgions du littoral atlantique marocain sont des eaux sales (1,71 mmhos/cm - 4,77 mmhos/cm) et  pH basique (7,2 -7,9). Dans ces conditions, la fusariose et la verticilliose vasculaire de la tomate dues respectivement  F. oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici et  V. dahliae ont un dveloppement important. L'influence de ces qualits du sol et des eaux d'irrigation est discute sur la base, d'une parte, de l'importance des taux de flerissement et de colonisation des plantes observes dans les parcelles d'tudes, d'autre part sur les donnes de la littrature. Irrigation water used in three tomato growing areas along the Moroccan atlantic coast is high in total salt content (1,71 mmhos/cm - 4,77 mmhos/cm) and pH (pH 7,2 - pH 7,9). Soils are also saline (0,23 mmhos/cm -0,78 mmhos/cm) light (loam, fine loam, sandy loam, loamy sand) and have a high pH (pH 7,1 - pH 8,35). The influence of soil and irrigation water qualities (pH, salinity for water and soil texture for soil) on the severity and occurrence of tomato Fusarium and Verticillium wilts in different areas in Morocco is reported and discussed in light of field observations, laboratory analysis and litterature.
42685356|The effect of calcium treatments applied to table grape cv. Italia during the growing season on the development of postharvest decay and on the biochemical changes in the cell wall of the berries are reported. Calcium treatments increased calcium content both in the whole berries and in the peel, resulting in a reduction of total rots and Botrytis rots in the bunches left on the vines under plastic covering for two months after the harvest season. Moreover, treated bunches stored in the cold room at 0C for 50 days, followed by 7 days of shelf life, showed a 50% reduction of Botrytis rots compared with the controls. Calcium ions also lead to some biochemical changes in berries in response to Botrytis cinerea infection. In the cell wall of infected berries treated with calcium an increase in cellulose was observed as compared with the control, but there was no difference in pectin or in hemicellulose content. Furthermore, the evaluation of the pectic fraction in the cell wall of samples treated with calcium and infected with B. cinerea showed higher amounts of both oxalate soluble and alkali soluble pectins. A higher content of the cytoplasmic pectic fraction was found on samples treated with calcium and infected with B. cinerea while there was a decrease in alkali soluble pectins and an increase in oxalate soluble pectins. These results, and particularly the higher quantity of protopectins in the cell wall of berries treated with calcium and infected with B. cinerea and the decrease of the same cytoplasmic fraction, indicate the involvement of calcium ions in the stabilisation of the cell wall structure and hence an increase in resistance to pathogens, and particularly to B. cinerea.
42684917|Puccinia carthami Cda., a seed and soil-borne pathogen, causes the principal Safflower (Carthamus tinctorius L.) disease in Italy. A high correlation (r = 0.76; P = 0.01) was shown between seed contamination by the pathogen and the incidence of disease (% of infected seedlings). The number of teliospores in seed samples can be determined by a washing test. Seed treatment fungicides, especially with carboxin + thiram or fenfuram, successfully eradicated seed-borne inoculum. Use of healthy seeds, seed dressing and crop rotation are recommended for production of rust-free seed lots, especially in countries where Safflower has recently been introduced. Puccinia carthami Cda., agente causale della ruggine del Cartamo (Carthamus tinctorius L.),  il principale patogeno in Italia. Indagini condotte su diversi campioni di seme hanno messo in evidenza una correlazione significativa (r = 0.76; P = 0.01) tra il grado di contaminazione del seme e le percentuali di plantule infette. Il numero di teleutospore presenti sulla superficie dei semi pu essere determinato analizzando l'acqua di lavaggio dei campioni di seine. La concia con carbossina + thiram o fenfuram eradica l'inoculo presente sul seme. L'uso di semi sani, la concia e la rotazione sono pratiche importanti per la produzione di lotti di seme esenti da teleutospore di P. carthami in particolare in Paesi dove il Cartamo  stato introdotto di recente.
42684675|In leaves of C. maranticolor inoculated with Tobacco necrosis virus (TNV) a reduced rate of virus biosynthesis occurs, and a systemic resistance towards a TNV challenge inoculation is acquired by upper uninfected leaves. The same resistance is also acquired by plants HgCl-sprayed in the lower leaves. Determination of cytokinin actvity of both TNV-inoculated and HgCl-sprayed leaves, as well as that of upper resistant leaves, demonstrated a noticeable increase of such activity. Chromatographie separation of cytokinins extracted from both TNV-infected and buffer-rubbed leaves allowed to estabilish that absolute increase was maximum for zeatine-like substances followed by that o kinetine-like ones. To find out whether or not systemic resistance was attributable to such increase, exogenous cytokinin treatments were carried out. Leaf discs were floated in zeatine and kinetin solutions of various concentration (5, 25, 50 g/ml) before (12h) or after virus inoculation (0, 12, 24, 48, 72, h). Kinetin was also administred by rubbing attached leaves 8 times daily, either before (96, 12h) or after (0, 12, 24, 48, 72 h) virus inoculation. In both types of treatments, kinetin induced an increase of virus replication with a maximum (2.2 that of control) at 12 h after inoculation for the former treatment, and right after inoculation for the latter (1.6 that of control). Zeatine increased even more virus replication, and exerted the maximum effect (3.3 times virus increase) right after inoculation. It seems, therefore, that increased cytokinin activity could not be retained responsible of acquired resistance towards TNV infection. In piante di Chenopodium amaranticolor inoculate con virus della necrosi del Tabacco (TNV) era constatabile una riduzione di biosintesi virale e l'acquisizione di resistenza sistemica, contro una successiva inoculazione del virus, da parte delle foglie superiori non infette. La stessa resistenza era acquisita anche da piante trattate con HgCl nelle foglie inferiori. L'attivit citochininica delle foglie virus inoculate o trattate con HgCl e quella delle foglie superiori resistenti era notevolmente incrementata rispetto alle foglie sane di controllo. La separazione cromatografica delle citochinine estratte, ha permesso di stabilire che il maggior incremento assoluto si verificava per sostanze zeatino e chinetino-simili. Per verificare se la resistenza sistemica fosse attribuibile a tale incremento, sono stati effettuati trattamenti con zeatina e chinetina. Dischi fogliari sono stati immersi in soluzioni di varia concentrazione dei due ormoni (5, 25, 50 g/ml), prima (12h) e dopo (0, 12, 24, 48, 72 h) l'inoculazione virale. La chinetina  stata anche applicata direttamente sulle foglie delle piante 8 volte in 12 ore prima (96, 12 h) o dopo (0, 12, 24, 48, 72 h) l'inoculo. In entrambi i tipi di trattamento la chinetina ha idotto un aumento di replicazione virale con un massimo (2,2 volte quella del controllo) 12 ore dopo l'inoculo, per il primo tipo di trattamento e subito dopo l'inoculazione per il secondo (1,6 volte). La zeatina incrementava la replicazione virale in misura ancora maggiore, con un effetto massimo (3,3 volte) subito dopo l'inoculazione. Sembra perci che l'aumento di attivit citochininica non possa essere ritenuto responsabile dell'acquisizione di resistenza sistemica verso l'infezione da TNV.
43871740|The aim of this study was to compare Mycosphaerella graminicola populations at the field and lesion levels. The evolution of M. graminicola populations from a single field in the Morbihan county (France), between 2005 and 2006, was first investigated for 37 strains using molecular fingerprinting by microsatellite markers (ST1A4, ST1E3, ST1E7 and ST1D7) and SSCP analysis of partial actin and -tubulin encoding sequences. Similar gene diversity was observed in the 2005 and 2006 populations, with no common clones between the two years. This indicates frequent sexual recombination by the fungus. When considering each marker independently and comparing marker genetic variability for the two populations, differences in the genetic variability were detected in 2006 population compared to the 2005 population. ST1A4, ST1D7 and the partial sequence of actin presented a decrease in genetic variability of the 2006 strains, while for ST1E3, ST1E7 and the partial sequence of -tubulin showed an increase, revealing the importance of the chosen markers. In addition, 29 strains collected in 2006 from three distinct lesions on the same wheat leaf in the Nord county were also investigated for genetic diversity. MAT1-1 and M ATI-2 were found in the same lesion offering opportunities for sexual contact.

42685666|The growth was studied of a homologous (Pseudomonas syringae pv. phaseolicola) and a heterologous (Pseudomonas syringae pv. pisi) bacterium in bean leaves in vivo, 48 hours after intercellular infiltration of extracellular polysaccharides (EPS) extracted from the same bacteria. In the treated tissues the growth of the two pathogenic organisms always differed from the controls. The growth of P. syringae pv. pisi was strongly inhibited, especially in tissue treated with the EPS of the homologous bacteria. This EPS also inhibited the growth of P. syringae pv. phaseolicola, although to a lesser extent. From a qualitative point of view, in the heterologous combination, the inhibitory effect consists in a delay of 18-24 hours in the appearance of the hypersensitive confluent necrosis, which was also less intense. In the homologous combination, a delay of 30-40 hours was observed in the susceptible reaction. Inhibition was assessed by measuring the bacterial growth in the tissues pretreated with EPS and by comparison with the control tissues. The protective effect induced by EPS was measured in the different combinations and correlated to bacterial growth. In the pretreated tissues this growth was reduced, by a minimum of 15 to 20-fold up to a maximum of 200 to 800-fold, as compared to the control tissue. The induction of this protective effect if discussed.  stata studiata in vivo la crescita di un batterio omologo (P. syringae pv. phaseolicola) e di un eterologo (P. syringae pv. pisi) in foglie di fagiolo, 48 ore dopo la infiltrazione intercellulare di polisaccaridi batterici extracellulari estratti dagli stessi batteri. La crescita dei due organismi  awenuta sempre in modo diverso nei tessuti trattati rispetto a quelli di controllo. La crescita di P. syringae pv. pisi  stata fortemente inibita, soprattutto nel tessuto trattato con l'EPS del batterio omologo. Questo stesso EPS inibiva anche la crescita di P. syringae pv. phaseolicola, seppur in minor grado. Dal punto di vista qualitativo l'effetto inibitorio si manifesta va con un ri tardo di 18-24 ore ed una ridotta intensit della necrosi confluente ipersensitiva nel caso della combinazione eterologa. Nel caso della combinazione omologa si osservava un ritardo della reazione suscettibile di 30-40 ore. Questa inibizione  stata quantificata misurando la crescita batterica nei tessuti pretrattati con EPS rispetto a quelli di controllo. A seconda delle combinazioni questo effetto protettivo indotto dagli EPS  stato misurato e correlato ad una crescita batterica nei tessuti trattati con EPS diminuita di 15-20 volte fino a 200-800 volte rispetto ai tessuti di controllo. L'induzione di questi effetti protettivi  stata discussa.

42683950| stato studiato l'efetto della fusicoccina, la tossina del Fusicoccum amygdali Del., sulla germinazione delle cariossidi e sull'accrescimento delle plantule di Riso anche in confronto con le ofioboline (cochlioboline) A e B, due tossine che sono ad essa correlate chimicamente. L'accrescimento dei germogli  stato stimolato da minime concentrazioni (da 1 a 10 ppm) di fusicoccina e poi sempre pi ridotto da concentrazioni superiori a 70 ppm. L'accrescimento delle radichette  stato invece progressivamente ridotto con l'aumentare della concentrazione della tossina nel mezzo. In confronto alla fusicoccina, le ofioboline sono state pi attive nel ridurre l'accrescimento radicale a dosi elevate (125-250 ppm) che a dosi minori (10-20 ppm). The effect of fusicoccin, the toxin of Fusicoccum amygdali Del., on the germination of the kernels and on the growth of the seedlings of Rice has been studied. This effect has also been compared to that of ophiobolins (cochliobolins) A and B, two toxins chemically related to fusicoccin. The growth of the shoots has been stimulated by low concentrations (from 1 to 10 ppm) of fusicoccin, whereas concentrations above 70 ppm have progressively reduced it. On the contrary the growth of the rootlets has been gradually depressed by increasing the toxin concentration in the medium. Compared with fusicoccin, the ophiobolins have been more active at high doses (125-250 ppm) than at low ones (10-20 ppm). The ophiobolins proved also less active in reducing the growth of the shoots. 42685587|Vengono riportati i risultati di prove in camera umida e in cella climatica volte ad individuare le condizioni pi favorevoli alla produzione di fialidi libere di Phoma tracheiphila, (Petri) Kanc. et Ghik., agente del mal secco degli Agrumi.  risultata ottimale una umidit prossima alla saturazione e una temperatura di 20-25C. In tali condizioni la produzione di fialoconidi si  avuta con regolarit dopo un periodo di 2-3 giorni dalla realizzazione delle lesioni che hanno messo a nudo il legno di organi infetti; eccezionalmente tale periodo  stato di un solo giorno. Sono discusse le possibili implicazioni di carattere epidemiologico di tale produzione fialidica, in relazione alie infezioni della chioma che si verificano nel corso dell'estate e del primo autunno, quando i picnoconidi del patogeno in pratica non germinano pi. Results of trials carried out in moist chamber and in growth chamber to determine the conditions for the production of free phialides of Phoma tracheiphila (Petri) Kanc. et Ghik., the causal agent of Citrus mal secco, are reported. A relative humidity near the saturation point and a range of temperature between 20 and 25C were the best. Under these conditions the phialoconidia formation was obtained consistently two or three days, sometimes one day, after wounding infected parts of the plants. The epidemiological implications of such phialidic production are also discussed with reference to the infections occurring on the canopy during summer and early autumn, when the pycnoconidia in the practice do not germinate.
42684013|Slices of Tomato fruits 'Best of All' and 'Marglobe' were inoculated with three isolates of Phoma destructiva Plow. Vitamin C and carbohydrates content was depleted within 5-6 days of incubation. Both qualitative and quantitative changes occurred during this period in carbohydrates of inoculated slices. No correlation between the in vitro and in vivo utilization of the carbohydrates by the pathogen could be established. 42685668|Diseased cotton leaves with angular water-soaked spots were collected during 3 years (1985-1987) in different regions of Turkey (Adana, Antalya and Izmir). More than 100 isolates of the pathogen Xanthomonas campestris pv. malvacearum were obtained. For characterization of races two methods were compared. During the variable conditions in the greenhouse some compatible interactions (according to the scheme of Hunter et al., 1968) were changed to incompatibility. Therefore, race identifications were only performed under the standardized conditions of a growth chamber (day: 12 h, 20.000 Lux in plant height, 26.5C, 75% RH; night: 19.5C, 85% RH). Six of the ten differential cultivars of upland cotton (Gossypium hirsutum L.) reacted susceptible, which characterized all the bacterial isolates as race 7. After the isolates had been stored for several months on YDC-agar they infected only 5 cultivars, this reaction being characteristic of rare 6. Ca. 1/10 of all isolates split into mutants when inoculated in the incompatible cultivar Stone ville 20. These mutants caused water-soaked spots on Stone ville 20 and, thus, belogend to the highly virulent race 10. A few plants of some differential cultivars reacted susceptible instead of resistant. This was explained by a certain heterozygoty of these breeding lines so that the progeny was not completely uniform. The 12 most important Turkish cotton cultivars, including 'Deltapine 15/21' and 'Caroline Queen 201' were highly susceptible towards the Turkish isolates of X. malvacearum. In order to reduce losses by this disease it is suggested to incorporate resistant genes into the Turkish cotton cultivars. The disease incidence can also be minimized by delinting the cotton seed with sulphuric acid and by growing cotton in rotation with other crops regularily. Foglie di Cotone affette da maculatura angolare, con macule idropiche, sono state collezionate in differenti regioni della Turchia (Adana, Antalya e Izmir) nel corso di tre anni (1985-1987). Sono stati cos ottenuti pi di 100 isolati del batterio patogeno X. campestris pv. malvacearum. Due metodi sono stati comparati per caratterizzare la specializzazione razziale. Questa differenziazione  stata possibile solo operando in condizioni standardizzate di fitotrone (giorno: 12 h, 20.000 Lux, 26,5C, 75% RH; notte: 19,5C, 85 RH). Delle cv differenziali di Gossypium hirsutum L. impiegate, sei su dieci hanno manifestato suscettibilit, cos da caratterizzare tutti gli isolati batterici quali esemplari della razza 7. Allorquando gli isolati venivano conservad per vari mesi su agar YDC, risultavano virulenti solo su cinque cv., cos come si comportano gli isolati della razza 6. Circa 1/10 di tutti gli isolati si differenziano quali mutanti se inoculati sulla cv. incompatibile 'Stoneville 20'. Questi mutanti inducono macule idropiche su 'Stoneville 20 e, pertanto, vanno iscritti alia razza ipervirulenta 10. Le 12 pi importanti cv turche di Cotone, comprendenti anche 'Deltapine 15/21' e 'Caroline Queen 201', sono risultate altamente suscettibili a X. malvacearum. Per ridurre le perdite di raccolto dovute alia malattia viene suggerita la introduzione di geni di resistenza al patogeno nelle cultivar turche di Cotone. L'incidenza della malattia pu essere ridotta rimuovendo le fibre dai semi di Cotone con acido solforico e coltivando il Cotone in rotazione con altre colture, regularmente.
42685898|Phage F was used during summer 1992 in experimental trials in 3 orchards to prevent or reduce fruit spot caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. pruni (X. c. p.) in peaches cv. Elegant Lady. Phage F was selected for its wide host range among X. c. p. strains and for its 10-day survival on leaves in the orchard. The 3 orchards had natural and experimental primary sources of inoculum; supplementary sources of inoculum were also created in 2 orchards. The experimental sources of inoculum consisted of leaves on single branches, that were inoculated with the same virulent X. c. p. strain used to propagate phage F. This study compared the effects of weekly, ten-day and fortnightly spraying of peach trees with phage suspension (10 plaque-forming units per ml). Weekly phage treatment significantly reduced the number of diseased fruits (55%) as well as the area (34.6%) and the percentage (35.2) of infected surface per fruit in only one of the 3 orchards. There were no significant differences between the 3 treatments. The reduction in diseased fruits was not significant in the other 2 orchards. Protection was obtained in the orchard without supplementary sources of inoculum, under a minor disease pressure. Only one out of 53 reisolates obtained from counted fruit spots from all orchards was not lysed by phage F and this came from a control tree. Phage F alone seemed to reduce fruit infection at low disease pressure, therefore it should be integrated with other control measures.
42684406|The Olive leaf spot disease, incited by Spilocaea oleaginea (Cast.) Hughes, is a serious threat to olive production in Lebanon. The present investigations were carried out to study: Inoculum density and viability during the different seasons; and effects of temperature relative atmospheric humidity and leaf wetness duration on conidial germination and the infection process. Conidia production on disease lesions varied with the season of the year. A high inoculum density, expressed as number of conidia per cm of leaf lesions, was detected during October, November, March and April. The viability of conidia did not vary greatly among the different months of the year. A slight decrease in percent germination of conidia occurred during the month of June. A high relative humidity was important for conidia germination. Conidia germinated readily on wet olive leaves. Percentage conidia germination was highest (62%) at 100% R.H., 5% at 90%. Temperature influenced conidia germination and appressoria formation. The conidia germinated, on wet olive leaves, at temperatures ranging from 8 to 24 C. The optimum temperature for conidia germination and appressoria formation was 20 C. Appressoria formation occurred at temperatures from 16 to 24 C. The leaf wetness duration period required for infections to occur varied with temperature and was 48 hours at 16 C, 24 hours at 20 C, and 36 hours at 24 C. 42685543|A three year survey of Cucumoviruses, in crops of economic importance to the principal producing agricultural regions of Spain, has been carried out. About 30% of the field crop plants with virus-like symptoms were found to be infected by cucumber mosaic virus (CMV) alone, or in combination with Potyviruses or Tobamoviruses. No other cucumovirus such as peanut stunt virus (PSV) or tomato aspermy virus (TAV) were found in any of the samples collected. All the CMVs isolated had the same virion electrophoretic mobility and DTl serotype. None of the CMV isolates, after a first propagation in tobacco, contained an associated satallite RNA (CARNA 5) detectable by polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Durante tres aos se ha realizado un muestreo de Cucumovirus, en cultivos de importancia econmica en las principales regiones agrcolas de Espaa. Alrededor del 30% de las plantas cultivadas, con sntomas de virus, se encontraron infectadas por el virus mosaico del pepino (CMV), slo o en combinacin con Potyvirus o Tobamovirus. Nign otro Cucumovirus, como el virus del achaparramiento del cacahuete (PSV) o el virus de la esterilidad del tomate (TAV), se encontraron en ninguna de las muestras recogidas. Todos los CMV aislados presentaron la misma movilidad electrofortica del virin y el mismo serotipo DT1. Niguno de los CMV aislados contenan, despus de una primera propagacin en tabaco, ARN satlite asociado (CARNA 5) detectable por electroforesis en gel de poliacrilamida.
42684732|The present status of knowledge on leafroll disease is outlined and the relevant new findings relative to its etiology, epidemiology and sanitary measures are reviewed. 42685381|Late wilt of maize, caused by the fungus Harpophora maydis, is one of the most important fungal diseases in Egypt. The disease has also been reported from India, Hungary, Spain and Portugal. The pathogen survives for long periods in soil. Late wilt is currently controlled using maize varieties with reduced sensitivity, but virulent variants of the fungus may threaten these varieties. Common disease symptoms have been documented over 20 years in Upper Galilee (northern Israel), particularly the Hula Valley. Recently, prevalence of the disease has increased. This is the first confirmed report of the direct and primary cause of the disease in Israel. Isolates of the pathogen obtained from wilting maize plants were morphologically identical to those of strains found in Egypt and India. We modified a molecular method as a diagnostic assay of disease progress in an infested field in northern Israel. The assay identified the pathogen 50 d after seeding, before the emergence of disease symptoms, both in susceptible and partially resistant host plants. DNA assessment was consistent with the disease progress in a susceptible maize variety, and the pathogen also spread in partially resistant plants that showed no symptoms. Seeds of apparently healthy, partially resistant plants may therefore also spread the disease. A modified molecular method presented here is a preliminary step in developing a seed health assay.

42684719|A virus isolated by mechanical inoculation from a Tunisian vine with fanleaf symptoms was compared serologically and ultrastructurally with ordinary isolates of Grapevine fanleaf (GFV) and Arabis mosaic (ArMV) viruses. The Tunisian virus was serologically related to but distinguishable from both viruses. However, since it was more closely related to GFV and showed an intracellular behaviour akin that of GFV, it was identified as a strain of the latter virus. This appears to be the first record of a clear-cut serological variant of GFV. Un virus isolato meccanicamente da una Vite tunisina con sintomi di arricciamento  stato paragonato sierologicamente ed ultrastrutturalmente con isolati comuni del virus dell'arricciamento della Vite (GFV) e del mosaico dell'Arabis (ArMV). Il virus tunisino  risultato essere sierologicamente correlato ma distinguibile da entrambi i virus in questione. Tuttavia, poich esso  apparso pi prossimo a GFV e ha mostrato comportamento intracellulare identico a quello riportato per lo stesso virus,  stato identificato come un ceppo di GFV. Questa sembra la prima segnalazione di una variante sierologica naturale di GFV.

42685409|Phaeomoniella chlamydospora (Pch) is one of the main causal agents of tracheomycosis in grapevine. We characterize how this fungus affects the response of Vitis vinifera cv. Cabernet Sauvignon to bark and xylem-tissue wounding after six weeks post-treatment. A histological investigation shows that, in xylem tissue, cell-wall modifications in response to wounding are related to suberin deposits rather than to lignin-induced wall thickening. The xylem response does not appear to be disturbed by Pch infection. Therefore, cell-wall modification strongly inhibits the development of wound-closure tissue (WCT) but does not prevent the differentiation of the necrophylactic periderm. Hyphae localization in tissue surrounding the wound or inoculation sites indicates that Pch colonizes all cell types, such as vascular tissues, paratracheal parenchyma cells, fibers and rays. The results also suggest that efficient compartmentalization separating fascicular xylem portions is assured by thick suberized cell walls bordering the ray parenchyma.
42685702|Three-year old seedlings of Acer campestre L., Ulmus leavis Pall., Fraxinus ornus L. and Quercus ilex L. were subjected to simulated acid fog (pH 3) with and without the addition of the surfactant ABS. 42685591|A purification procedure was developed for the two potyvirus isolates (52-82 and 53-82) recently reported from Lebanon. Virus isolates were propagated in Phaseolus vulgaris L. cultivars Sutter Pink and/or Black Turtle Soup and harvested around three weeks after inoculation. Infected tissue was extracted in 0.5M KHPO containing 0.005M EDTA, 0.02M NaSO , 0.01M DIECA, and 3% Triton X-100 pH 8.5, clarified with 25% chloroform +25% carbon tetrachloride, and concentrated by high speed centrifugation. Pellet obtained was suspended in 0.5M sodium citrate buffer pH 7.5, and further purified by centrifugation on sucrose density gradients prepared with the same buffer. Virus concentration at the different steps of the purification procedure was monitored by ELISA, and the final purified material was assessed for purity and recovery of non-aggregated virus particles by sucrose density gradient centrifugation. Virus yield was estimated to range between 20 and 30 mg/kg of tissue. The purified virus (53-82) was injected into a rabbit. The antiserum produced was used for virus detection in infected bean leaves by ELISA. The A 40 5 values obtained for infected tissue were high (1.5), whereas those for healthy bean were 0.1 after a 90 min substrate incubation, an indication that the procedure followed produced a fairly purified virus preparation. Viene descritto un metodo di purificazione per due isolati di potyvirus (52-82 e 53-82) trovati recentemente in Libano. Gli isolati virali sono stati propagati in Phaseolus vulgaris L. cv. Sutter Pink e/o Black Turtle Soup e raccolti circa tre settimane dopo l'inoculazione quando la concentrazione virale era massima. 43872362|Mycotoxin risk in the grape product chain is primarily due to ochratoxin A (OTA) occurrence in wine and dried vine fruits. Aspergillus carbonarius and the A. niger group are the main agents of Aspergillus bunch grape, and they, especially A. carbonarius, are responsible for OTA contamination worldwide. Fumonisin B (FB) represents an additional potential mycotoxin risk in the grape-wine product chain and A. niger/A. awamori were recently reported as the FB producers in grapes. A deeper understanding of the species diversity of black Aspergilli, together with specific knowledge of their ecology and epidemiology, can help to predict their occurrence. From this perspective several studies have been done regarding prevention and control of black Aspergini and reduction of mycotoxin risk at all stages, from vineyard management to wine-making procedures. In this review a comprehensive overview of all these aspects is presented.

42685312|Successful eradication of PVX and PVS by chemotherapy in vitro (ribavirin + DHT) of potato stem cuttings is reported. Results depended first of all on the virus involved and secondarily on size of cuttings and treated cultivar. 42685399|Ascochyta blight (AB) resistance reactions were studied in 23 chickpea cultivars, mainly advanced lines and Tunisian varieties from the Tunisian chickpea breeding program, growing both at two locations and under controlled conditions. Two co-dominant markers both associated with AB resistance were also used in this study; the CaETR marker tightly linked to QTLAR in combination with the SCAR SCY17 marker linked to QTLAR to explore their usefulness in discriminating between resistant and susceptible chickpea genotypes. These two markers contribute efficiently in the selection of new chickpea varieties with better combinations of aleles to ensure durable resistance to AB. The advanced line V10 presenting the resistance alele for CaETR, but being still heterozygous for the SCAR17 was characterized as resistant to moderately resistant in field studies and under controlled conditions. This line could be very useful for developing a new variety that is fixed for both resistance aleles and expresses good levels of resistance to AB in different chickpea cropping environments. These markers are very useful in assisting chickpea breeding programs, especially thanks to their robustness, their co-dominance and their utility across different genetic backgrounds.

43872337|Citrus tristeza virus (CTV) is the causal agent of the most important virus disease of citrus. CTV isolates differing in biological and molecular characteristics have been reported worldwide. Recently, CTV was detected in Syria in citrus groves from two Governorates (Lattakia and Tartous) and several CTV outbreaks have been reported in Apulia (southern Italy) since 2003. To molecularly characterize the CTV populations spreading in Syria and Italy, a number of isolates from each region was selected and examined by different molecular approaches including: Multiple Molecular Markers analysis real time RT-(q)PCR, single strand conformation polymorphism (SSCP) of the major coat protein (CP) gene (P25), and sequence analysis of the CP (P25), P18, P20 and RdRp genes. SSCP analysis of CP25 yielded two distinct simple patterns among the Syrian isolates and three different patterns in the Italian isolates. Based on MMM analysis, all Syrian CTV isolates were categorized as VT-like genotype, whereas the Italian isolates reacted only with the markers specific for the T30 genotype. These findings were also confirmed by RT-qPCR and by sequencing analysis of four genomic regions. The Italian isolates had nucleotide identities which varied: from 99.5 to 99.8 for the CP gene; from 97.4% to 98.3% for the P18 gene; from 98.6% to 99.8% for the P20 and from 97.8% to 99.1% for the partial RdRp sequenced. High sequence identity was found for all genomic regions analyzed between the Syrian isolates (from 98.9% to 99.6%). These results show that the CTV populations spreading in Apulia and Syria are associated with different genotypes, indicating different potential impacts on the citrus trees in the field. Since in both areas the introduction of the virus is relatively recent, infected plants resulted to contain a single and common genotype, suggesting that CTV is spreading from the first outbreaks by aphids or local movement of autochthonous infected plant material.

Quando l'intervallo di tempo fra la somministrazione del prodotto al terreno e la successiva inoculazione  stata di I mese o meno, la malattia non si  manifestata per i 5-6 mesi della prova. La sostanza ha invece esercitato un'azione sostanzialmente ritardatrice, quando  stata somrninistrata dopo l'inoculazione. Sembra dunque che esistano possibilit di impiego del Benomyl nella lotta contro il  bayoud  della Palma da dattero; ma, pare che bisognerebbe insistere nella ricerca di metodi di trattamento al terreno e alle foglie, che permettano di superare le difficolt teeniche e soprattutto economicne che oggi si presentano The uptake and transport of Benomyl into plants of Date palm (Phoenix dactylifera L.) have been investigated vestigated using Penicillium expansum Lk. ex Thom as test organism in the bioassays. Benomyl was uptaken by roots and leaves, became distributed in the plant and persisted in the plant and the soil for several months (Surico, 1976). In in vitro assays, Benomyl inhibited the germination of Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. albedinis (Malenon) Snyd. et Hans, chlamydospores and microconidia. Benomyl was also assayed on young plants of Date palm grown in the greenhouse. When the interval between product application to the soil and inoculation was 1 month or less, the disease did not appear for the 5-6 months of duration of the experiment. On the other hand, Benomyl applied after inoculation substantially delayed the progress of the fungus.
