42685881|Some epidemiological experiments on the Melampsora pulcherrima (Bub.) Maire infection of Mercurialis annua were carried out. The following were studied: 1) the spread of the infection on M. annua in relation to an artificial source of basidiospore inoculum made up of germinating rust-teliospores on Populus alba leaves; 2) the possibility of transmission of the infection by the infected M. annua seeds even with the observation of the spread of the mycelium in them; 3) the evolution of the infection on M. annua plants infected naturally and after artificial inoculation. The following were highlighted: 1) there is a close relationship between the basidiospores production from germinating teliospore on P. alba leaves and the outbreak of the infection on M. annua ; 2) the infection does not seem to be transmitted by the seeds of the infected plants to the new M. annua plants, so much so that the embryo sac of the infected seeds is not invaded by the mycelium; 3) the M. pulcherrima infection process on M. annua begins in the leaves and it progresses in a wide-spread manner to the branches and into the stem, with a slow systemic behaviour. These results allow some particular characteristics of M. pulcherrima behaviour previously observed to be interpreted.
42685627|Two Tobacco streak virus (TSV) isolates from imported Gladiolus (Gladiolus sp.) 'Peter Pears' were biologically and serologically compared. The first isolate: TSV-1, was found in Emilia-Romagna (Northern Italy), the second one: TSV-2, in Sicily. All the gladiolus plants infected by TSV-1 and TSV-2 showed shorter flower spikes (mosaic, ringspots and necrotic streaks were sometimes present on the leaves of stunted plants). In rate-zonal density gradient centrifugation both of them sedimented as three components: Top (non infectious), Middle and Bottom (infectious by themselves); they were also serologically indistinguishable (no spurs in cross-reaction tests) and appeared identical in the electron microscope (size between 25 and 30 nm). The two TSV isolates differed in host range, in the symptoms of infected plants and in some properties in crude sap. In fact, TSV-1 infected 17 of 22 species tested and TSV-2 only 11; TSV-1 usually induced only local symptoms, whereas TSV-2 primary lesions followed by systemic invasion; in crude sap TSV-2 was less stable than TSV-1. This is the first report of stunting of spike flower associated with TSV in Gladiolus. Due isola ti del virus della necrosi perinervale del Tabacco (TSV), provenienti da Gladiolo (Gladiolus sp.) cv. Peter Pears importata, sono stati biologicamente e sierologicamente confrontati tra loro. Il primo isolato: TSV-1,  stato rinvenuto in Emilia-Romagna, il secondo: TSV-2, in Sicilia. Tutti i gladioli infetti con TSV-1 e TSV-2 erano caratterizzati da un vistoso nanismo della spiga fiorale; le foglie mostravano a volte sintomi di mosaico, piccoli anelli cloro-necrotici e striature necrotiche. Purificati in gradienti di saccarosio, i due isolati erano costituiti di tre componenti: Top (non infettivo), Middle e Bottom (infettivi); essi apparivano inoltre identici sierologicamente (nessuno sperone nelle reazioni incrociate in agar) come anche al microscopio elettronico (diametro fra 25 e 30 nm). I due isolati di TSV differivano invece nella gamma di piante ospiti, nella sintomatologia da queste evidenziata e su alcune propriet nel sueco crudo. Infatti TSV-1 infettava 17 di 22 specie inoculate, mentre TSV-2 solo 11; TSV-1 generalmente determina va sintomi locali, mentre TSV-2 sia locali che sistemici; nel sueco crudo TSV-1 si mostrava piu stabile di TSV-2.  questa la prima segnalazione di nanismo della spiga fiorale associato alia presenza di TSV nel Gladiolo.

42685688|La reazione di alcuni vitigni ('Caveccia', 'Fortana', 'Sangiovese', 'Lambrusco Salamino', 'Chardonnay') all'infezione naturale dell'agente di una malattia simile alla flavescenza dorata,  stata studiata in cinque vigneti localizzati in tre diverse localit (Ravenna, Bologna, Reggio Emilia) della regione Emilia-Romagna. Pluriennali osservazioni hanno portato all'individuazione delle seguenti categorie di piante: a) ammalate che risultavano tali anche l'anno precedente, b) senza sintomi che risultavano ammalate o risanate l'anno precedente (risanate), c) ammalate che risultavano sane oppure risanate l'anno precedente (nuove infezioni). Il numero delle viti precedentemente affette che evidenziavano il fenomeno della remissione dei sintomi o risanamento, variava in generale dall'8,6% all'85%; in un vigneto di 'Caveccia' e 'Fortana' sottoposto alla capitozzatura di tutti i ceppi, esso raggiungeva invece il 91% ed il 100% rispettivamente. L'analisi della gravit sintomatologica effettuata particolarmente in piante di 'Caveccia', 'Sangiovese' e 'Chardonnay' che risultavano risanate oppure ammalate l'anno precedente, non ha pienamente dimostrato un'evoluzione dell'ampelopatia sull'ospite classificabile come del tipo 'Baco 22A'. E' risultata comunque esclusa, per la riscontrata presenza del risanamento in tutti i vitigni considerati, l'altro modello di evoluzione che in letteratura  stato riportato sul 'Nielluccio'. Gli effetti della malattia sulla produzione e sullo sviluppo vegetativo sono stati valutati in un vigneto di 'Sangiovese' con sistema di allevamento a G.D.C., confrontando piante con infezione grave (sintomi su un numero complessivo di tralci 15), piante con infezione leggera (sintomi su un numero complessivo di tralci da 5 a 10), piante risanate e piante sane. Nel 1987, il decremento medio di produzione di uva nei ceppi delle prime tre categorie considerate risultava rispettivamente del 45,9%, del 17,2% (P=0,01) e del 14,5% (P=0,05); quello di produzione di legno era invece del 50%, del 33,3% e del 27,8% (P= 0,01). Nel 1988, nell'ambito dei medesimi gruppi, le viti che mantenevano la stessa condizione sanitaria considerata l'anno precedente, producevano rispettivamente il 48,1% (P= 0,01), il 24,9% (P= 0,05) ed il 7% in meno di quelle sane; il decremento riferito al peso dei sarmenti risultava invece del 43,8% (P= 0,01), del 12,5% e del 6,3%. L'attivit vegetativa e produttiva dei ceppi con il livello d'infezione piu grave si differenziava statisticamente da quella dei ceppi con infezione pi leggera il cui comportamento non era invece diverso da quello delle piante risanate. Queste ultime poi, in confronto a quelle sane, risentivano dell'influenza negativa dell'affezione solamente il primo anno, facendo registrare una differenza significativa nei riguardi sia della produzione di uva (P= 0,05) che del peso di legno (P= 0,01). The reaction of some cultivars (Caveccia, Fortana, Sangiovese, Lambrusco Salamino, Chardonnay) to natural infection by the agent of a flavescence dore-like disease, was studied in five vineyards in three different areas (Ravenna, Bologna, Reggio Emilia) of Emilia-Romagna (Northern Italy). Observations, made over a period of several years, led to the identification of the following host categories: a) diseased vines, also infected the previous year; b) asymptomatic vines, infected or recovered the previous year (recovered); c) diseased vines, healthy or recovered the previous year. The number of diseased plants that recovered varied from 8.6% to 85%; but in a 'Caveccia' and Tortana' vineyard, where the vines were cut-back to the grafting point, this variation was 91% and 100% respectively. Disease severity, analyzed in 'Caveccia', 'Sangiovese' and 'Chardonnay' vines, recovered or infected the previous year, did not clearly demonstrate an evolution of the disease which could be classified as 'Baco 22A\ It was, however, possible to exclude the other evolution model ('Nielluccio') reported in literature, due to the occurrence of the recovery phenomenon in all the cultivars examined. The effects of the disease on yield and vegetation (weight of pruned canes) were assessed in a G.D.C. trained ' Sangiovese' vineyard. Infected vines with symptoms on  15 canes, infected vines with symptoms on 5-10 canes, recovered and healthy vines were all compared. In 1987, the mean grape yield per plant in the first three categories was respectively reduced by 45.9%, 17.2% (P= 0.01) and 14.5% (P= 0.05); the mean weight of pruned canes was reduced by 50%, 33.3% and 27.8% (P= 0.01). In 1988, in the vines maintaining the same sanitary state and disease severity level, mean yield was reduced by 48.1% (P= 0.01), 24.9% (P= 0.05) and 7%; weight of pruned canes was reduced by 43.8% (P= 0.01), 12.5% and 6.3%, as compared to the healthy plants. The difference in yield and growth between severely and mildly diseased vines was statistically significant, but not that between mildly diseased and recovered ones. The latter, as compared to healthy vines, showed a significant difference in yield (P= 0.05) and weight of pruned canes (P= 0.01) only in the first year of recovery.
42684423|Corn debris and growing plants sampled from a no-plow plot were examined for the presence of pseudothecia of Mycosphaerella zeae-maydis. Pycnidia were numerous in leaf debris and many conidia were found in them. Ascospores developed in these pseudothecia were pathogenic to Corn. Pycnidia were also abundant in necrotic tissue of the lower leaves of Corn plants and could be found in all necrotic leaf tissue throughout the season. Ascospores in the air were trapped continuously from May 31 to August 31, 1974. 42684127|Transfer of Phytophthora infestans (Mont.) d By from blighted tubers to the emerging stems was studied under controlled conditions. It was found that small sprouts became infected, however, they did not develop in either healthy or infected stems because they deteriorated before reaching soil surface. On the other hand, well-developed sprouts were not infected because the pathogen was unable to pass through tissue surrounding their base. Consequently, in neither instance was P. infestans able to pass directly from a blighted tuber to an emerging stem. Infection of stems was found possible by contact between them and blighted tubers below the soil surface; by mycelium spreading from blighted tubers to soil; and by air-borne sporangia which originated from the soil-borne mycelium.  stato studiato, in condizioni controllate, il passaggio di Phytophthora infestans (Mont.) d By da tuberi infetti ai germogli che da essi si sviluppano.  stato osservato che i germogli possono infettarsi ma da essi non si sviluppano comunque piante, sane o infette, poiche essi marciscono prima di emergere. D'altra parte, i germogli ben sviluppati da tuberi infetti non hanno mostrato infezioni perch il patogeno  stato incapace di superare i tessuti sani basali. Di conseguenza, in nessun caso P. infestans e stata in grado di passare direttamente da tuberi infetti a germogli emersi.  stato visto che l'infezione dei fusti  possibile quando essi, prima di emergere, vengono a contatto con tuberi infetti o con micelio che si sviluppa da essi. L'altra possibility di infezione  quella derivante dagli sporangi differenziati sul terreno e dispersi dall'aria. On a remarqu que les pousses peuvent s'infcter mais ne donneront pas naissance  des plantes saines ou infectees, puisqu'elles pourrissent avant d'merger. D'autre part, les pausses bien developpes sur de tubercules infects n'ont pas montr l'infection parce que le pathogene n'a pas t capable de pentrer  travers les tissues sains autour de leur base. Par consequent, dans aucun de ces cas, P. infestans n'a t capable de passer dirctement de tubercules infects aux pousses merges. L'infection se produit aussi par la prsence de sporanges disperses dans l'air qui ont leur origine dans le mycelium prsent dans le sol.
42683742|Addition of increasing amounts of nitrogenic fertilizer (calcium nitrate) to Gladiolus, increases the percentage of corm infection by Fusarium oxysporum Schl. f. sp. gladioli (Mass.) S. et H. Addition of increasing amounts of phosphoric fertilizer (calcium superphosphate) decreases the percentage of corm infection. Addition of increasing amounts of nitrogenic fertilizer to soils containing 33 kilograms potassium sulphate per feddan (= ha 0,42 or 1,038 acres) and with low and moderate levels of phosphorus fertilizer (200 and 400 kilograms per feddan respectively) increases the percentage of infection. With the high level (800 kilograms per feddan) the infection decreases in  Snow Princess  and  Sunny Boy  varieties and increases in  San Souci  variety. The percentage of diseased tissues of artificially inoculated  Snow Princess  corms taken from the previous fertilizer experiment increases by addition of the potassic fertilizer and also by adding increasing amounts of the nitrogenic fertilizer whereas it decreased by addition of phosphoric fertilizer. Addition of increasing amounts of nitrogenic fertilizer to soils containing 33 kilograms potassium sulphate + 200 or 400 kilograms superphosphate per feddan increases the percentage of diseased tissues, whereas it decreases when 800 kilograms are added. These results are in positive correlation with the ratio of nitrogen/phosphorus (N/P) in the corms, i.e. when the ratio increases, an increase in the percentage of infection is noticed and vice versa. The percentages of moisture or potassium in the corms and also the pH value appear to be of little importance as regards their susceptibility to infection. L'aggiunta di quantit crescenti di concimi azotati a terreni contenenti kg 33 di solfato di potssio e kg 200 o 400 per feddan di perfosfato ha fatto aumentare la percentuale di tessuti malati, mentre l'ha fatta diminuir con 800 kg di perfosfato. Tali risultati sono positivamente correlati al valore del rapporto tra azoto e fosforo (N/P) nei bulbi. Quando il rapporto aumenta, si rileva un aumento nella percentuale di infezione e viceversa. 43871737|Studies were conducted to determine damage potential of Meloidogyne graminicola on the commonly grown rice cv. Sugandh-5 and to devise an effective management strategy. The nematicides were applied through root-dip (200 ppm solution) and soil application of 2 kg ha phorate 10G (25 mg a.i./pot), carbofuran 3G (83.3 mg a.i./pot and 1 L ha), carbosulfan 20EC (5L/pot) and chlorpyriphos 20 EC (6.25 L/pot) in both nematode infested and non-infested soil with five modes of application viz., root-dip, single soil application (15 days after transplanting), root-dip + one soil application, two soil applications, and root-dip + two soil applications (15 and 30 days). Application of nematicides did not cause any toxicity symptoms on rice plants. In nematode infested soil, terminal and spiral galls developed on the rice roots, and plants suffered 20-31% decrease in the plant growth parameters. Carbofuran and phorate through root-dip plus single soil application provided greatest suppression in galling (16-20%), egg mass production (18-22%) and soil population (27.5-58.2%) of M. graminicola, and subsequently increased all the plant growth variables by 9-19%. Root-dip + two soil applications increased plant growth and suppressed nematodes, but was equal to root dip + one soil application. Root-dip treatment alone with carbosulfan also significantly suppressed root galling (10-12%) and improved the dry weight of roots and shoots (7-10%).

42685237|Vascular wilt, caused by Fusarium oxysporum Schlecht, emend. Snyder et Hansen f. sp. lentis, is the most important disease of lentil (Lens culinaris Medikus) worldwide. This study on vascular wilt addressed, firstly, the association of inoculum density and wilt incidence both in the laboratory and in the field and, secondly, the relationship between disease incidence and yield loss in the field. In the laboratory, two lentil lines, contrasting in their field resistance to wilt, were challenged with inoculum densities from 0 to 10 microconidia/ml and disease severity was positively correlated to inoculum density. However, at intermediate densities the lines differed in their disease reaction. In the field in two seasons, inoculum density was unrelated to disease incidence in susceptible lentil lines, precluding the prediction of disease incidence from inoculum density. In six field trials in northern Syria, wilt incidence during the reproductive growth stage was significantly and negatively correlated with percentage yield loss. The mean over field trials of percentage loss in seed yield per unit change in wilt incidence (%) was 0.89  0.06%. This relationship was used as the basis of a general model relating yield losses in the field to the incidence of lentil vascular wilt.
42685249|Tomato yellow leaf curl geminivirus (TYLCV), transmitted by the whitefly Bemisia tabaci, causes a serious disease of tomato and is considered the major limiting factor for tomato production in many geographical regions. The development of tolerant genotypes is considered the most economical approach to control this disease. Among 42 tomato genotypes tested for resistance to TYLCV, four seemed most promising 'TY-King', 'W3093', 'W3098' and 'Fiona', showing milder symptoms and producing significantly higher yields than the susceptible controls. Tissue-blot immunoassay (TBIA) using monoclonal antibodies produced against African cassava mosaic geminivirus (ACMV) was found to be a sensitive and rapid method (4-5 h) for TYLCV detection. TYLCV was easily detected in the invaded phloem tissue; its concentration was highest in the apical region, and could be detected in the apices of a susceptible genotype 6 to 8 days after inoculation. In the early stages of infection, the viral concentration in the tolerant genotypes was lower than in the susceptible ones. These results were also confirmed using a digoxigenin-labelled DNA probe.
42685658|Sono stati saggiati quattro substrati selettivi per l'utilizzazione del metodo SDP nell'isolamento di P. cryptogea Peth et Laff. dal suolo. Le diverse basi nutritive e le varie combinazioni di sostanze antimicrobiche hanno dato risultati differenti a seconda del grado di inquinamento dei campioni di terreno saggiati. Mentre con campioni aventi una carica di microrganismi inquinanti relativamente bassa tutti i substrati sono stati in ugual misura utili per la determinazione della densit d'inoculo del fungo in esame, con campioni aventi carica elevata il substrato a base di PDA + BNPRAH si  dimostrato il migliore. La sua efficacia  stata ulteriormente migliorata aumentando la concentrazione delle sostanze antifungine in esso contenute. Four selective media were tested for use in the soil diluition plate (SDP) method for isolation of Phytophthora cryptogea Peth. et Laff. from soil. The efficiency of various basal media and combination of antimicrobial substances was the same in estimating the inoculum density in soil samples which resulted poor in non-target microorganisms. If, however, the soil samples were rich in non-target microorganisms, the PDA + BNPRAH medium proved to be the best. A further improvement was obtained by increasing the concentration of antifungal agents.
43872363|Dried fruit is fruit that is preserved by removing the original water content naturally, through sun drying or artificially, by the use of specialized dryers or dehydrators. Dried fruit has a long tradition of use dating back to the fourth millennium in Mesopotamia and is prized because of its sweet taste, nutritive value and long shelf life. Traditional dried fruits such as raisins, figs, dates, apricots and prunes have been a staple of Mediterranean diets for millennia. The Mediterranean region is very favourable for production of dried fruits, not only with its climatic conditions, but also its exceptional fertile lands. Additionally, proximity to trade routes historically has allowed Mediterranean countries more access to dried fruits than landlocked countries. Today, dried fruit consumption is widespread. Nearly half of the dried fruits sold throughout the world are raisins, followed by dates, prunes (dried plums), figs, apricots, peaches, apples and pears. Dates, prunes, apricots, figs and raisins are the major dried fruits produced in the Mediterranean area. Dried fruits are not perishable but can support mold growth, some of which can produce mycotoxins. Occurence of toxigenic molds and mycotoxins on these dried fruits can be a problem in the Mediterranean basin, as in the other parts of the world, being a health hazard to the population as well as a trade issue for the export of local products. Although the most important mycotoxins occuring in Mediterranean crops are aflatoxins (B, B, G and G) and ochratoxin A, the type and level of mycotoxins and toxigenic molds vary by crop and also by country and in some cases geographic location within a country. In this review mycotoxin risks and toxigenic fungi in date, prune and dried apricot among Mediterranean crops are reported and discussed.

42685722|Rosette-disease and witches' broom have been found sporadically in Northern and Central Italy in sugar beet (Beta vulgaris L.) and spinach (Spinacia oleracea L.) plants. In the field, the diseased plants were characterized by stunting, yellowing and malformation of the youngest leaves (rosette stage). In greenhouse, the same plants produced axillary shoots with strap-like leaves (witches' broom). Sugar beet grafts reproduced the symptomatology observed in the field; periwinkle (Vinca rosea L.) grafts showed yellowing on the leaves. Observations by electron microscopy and fluorescence microscopy revealed the MLO presence in sieve tubes of sugar beet and periwinkle plants. In particular, in rosette diseased Sugar beets in which fluorescence test was negative, MLO were found in immature phloem cells. RLO were found in ultrathin sections of some of the sieve tubes of diseased spinach plants. This is the first report of natural occurrence of these organisms in Sugar beet and Spinach in Italy. It will be necessary to investigate the spreading of these diseases more throughly and also the presence of the specific vectors. Alcuni casi di rosettamento e scopazzi sono stati individuati in coltivazioni di Barbabietola da zucchero (Beta vulgaris L.) e Spinacio (Spinacia oleracea L.) dell'Italia centro-settentrionale. La sintomatologia in campo si manifestava con nanismo, giallume e malformazioni a livello delle foglie pi giovani: si ave va cio la fase patognomonica nota con il nome di rosettamento. Le stesse piante malate, poi, trasportate in serra, manifestavano abnorme produzione di germogli ascellari e foglie nastriformi: fase degli scopazzi. Gli innesti con Barbabietola rosettata eseguiti su Barbabietola sana hanno permesso di riprodurre la sintomatologia, e quelli su Vinca rosea L. hanno dato luogo in molti casi, a giallume. Le osservazioni al microscopio ottico a fluorescenza, confermate da quelle al microscopio elettronico, hanno permesso di individuare la presenza di organismi di tipo procariote. In particolare, quelli osservati nella Barbabietola e nelle Vinche con giallume potevano riferirsi a MLO, mentre gli organismi osservati nello Spinacio erano simili a RLO.E' questa la prima segnalazione in Italia della presenza di organismi di questo tipo in tali colture: si rende necessario ora procedere a studi epidemiologici per evidenziare la diffusione della malattia e la eventuale presenza di vettori specifici.

42684614|Dopo contaminazione artificiale in due periodi dell'anno (primavera e autunno), la soprawivenza di Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi  stata seguita sulle foglie di due variet di Olivo diversamente reattive all'inoculazione con il patogeno. La soprawivenza  stata significativamente influenzata dal tempo dopo la contaminazione e dal periodo dell'anno, ma non dalla variet colturale n dall'et delle foglie. Inoltre, le variazioni numeriche delle popolazioni batteriche son state influenzate dalle interazioni tra il tempo trascorso dalla contaminazione e gli altri fattori, in tutte le combinazioni saggiate. The survival of Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi on the leaf surfaces of two Olive cultivars, differently reactive to inoculation with the pathogen, was studied after artificially contamination in two periods of the year, i.e., spring and autumn. The time after contamination and the season affect significantly the survival of the pathogen, but no effects are due to the cultivars and leaf age. Moreover, numerical variations of bacterial populations were under the influence of interactions between the time after contamination and the other factors, in all assayed combinations.
42684558|Comparative studies on the development of Meloidogyne javanica on five leguminous hosts in relation to syncytial growth were carried out. On Common bean, Cowpea or Pea the nematode developed and reproduced better than it did on Broad bean and Soybean. Syncytia were formed in the cortical and stelar regions of common bean, cowpea and pea but only in the stele of broad bean and soybean roots. The quantitative growth of syncytia was positively correlated with the nematode development. Syncytia of common bean, cowpea or pea possessed the highest values of syncytial length, width, and boundary. Sono stati condotti degli studi comparati sullo sviluppo di Meloidogyne javanica in radici di cinque leguminose, in relazione alia formazione di sincizi. Su Fagiolo (Phaseolus vulgaris), Vigna (Vigna sinensis) e Pisello (Pisum sativum) il nematode si  sviluppato e riprodotto meglio che su Fava (Vicia faba) e Soia (Glycine max). La formazione di sincizi  stata osservata nelle parti corticale e stelare delle prime tre specie, ma solo nella stele delle altre due. Lo sviluppo in grandezza dei sincizi era direttamente correlato alio sviluppo del nematode. I sincizi formati in radici di Fagiolo, Vigna e Pisello erano di dimensioni maggiori di quelli osservati sulle altre due specie.
42684436|Eight isolates of Watermelon mosaic virus (WMV) from Mediterranean countries were compared with one another and with authentic isolates of WMV-1 and WMV-2 from the United States of America. Four Mediterranean isolates proved to be WMV-1 and four were WMV-2. It was confirmed that WMV-1 and WMV-2 can be differentiated serologically and because of the host range reactions. A further point of differentiation lay in the presence in all WMV-1 isolates of amorphous cytoplasmic inclusion bodies, which are considered of diagnostic importance. WMV-1 and WMV-2 are two different entities for which the use of the same vernacular name is hardly justifiable. Un ulteriore punto di differenziazione consiste nella presenza, in tutti gli isolati di WMV-1 di corpi d'inclusione amorfi localizzati nel citoplasma che si considerano di importanza diagnostica. WMV-1 e WMV-2 sono pertanto due entit different! per le quali Tuso dello stesso nome volgare sembra non ulteriormente giustificabile.
42684442|The following points were investigated in relation to the spread of cucumber mosaic virus (CMV) in pepper crops in northwest Italy: 1) natural CMV reservoirs; 2) progress of infections and 3) density of winged aphid populations inside pepper crops; 4) seasonal virus burden carried by winged migrant aphids (air-borne virus); 5) aphid transmission. CMV was isolated from Beta vulgaris L. (Swiss chard), Capsella bursa-pastons Med., Viola tricolor L., Anagallis arvensis L., Cardamine hirsuta L. and Lamiwn purpureum L. Of these species the former three only were found infected before peppers were transplanted to the open and can be regarded, in our conditions, as potential CMV sources. The majority of natural virus hosts were symptomless. Where virus sources were present close to crops, virus spread was positively correlated with the total number of flying aphids. In the absence of virus sources, the progress of infection was related to the virus burden carried by winged aphids, as suggested by the results of CMV infection on pepper bait-plants exposed periodically in the open. The following conclusions are drawn: 1) pepper crops having primary sources of infection nearby can be infected during short distance flights by aphids of different species which are not necessarily efficient vectors of CMV. This is supported by the results of transmission experiments, showing that CMV could be transmitted by 7 of 11 local aphid species tested; 2) in the absence of close CMV sources, crops, particularly in open fields, can be infected after long distance flights by migrant aphids of species which are likely to be efficient vectors of the virus. This is suggested by the fact that, in such fields, bait-plants were infected in high proportion even during periods of low aphid density. Sono state svolte indagini epidemiologiche sul virus del mosaico del Cetriolo (CMV) in Piemonte, per quanto riguarda la sua diffusione in colture di peperone, considerando: 1) sorgenti naturali di infezione; 2) progredire delle infezioni e 3) densit di afidi alati nelle colture; 4) carica di virus portato da afidi alati migranti durante il ciclo colturale; 5) trasmissione con afidi. CMV  stato isolato dalle seguenti specie coltivate e spontane: Beta vulgaris L. (bietola da coste), Capsella bursa-pastoris Med., Viola tricolor L., Anagallis arvensis L., Cardamine hirsuta L. e Lamium purpureum L. Di queste, soltanto le prime tre sono state trovate infette in epoca antecedente il trapianto all'aperto dei peperoni e possono considerarsi potenziali sorgenti di infezione del virus nelle condizioni esaminate. La maggior parte degli ospiti naturali di CMV non presentava sintomi evidenti di infezione. In uno dei campi presi in esame, ove era stata riscontrata la presenza di piante infette da CMV in prossimit delia coltura, l'incremento di infezioni nella stessa  risultato chiaramente correlato con il numero di afidi alati migranti. In un altro campo, dove la presenza del virus non era stata rilevata nella circostante vegetazione spontanea prima del trapianto, l'incremento di infezioni  risultato apparentemente in relazione con la carica di virus portato dagli afidi migranti, rilevata a mezzo di piante-esca. I risultati ottenuti suggeriscono le seguenti considerazioni: in vicinanza di sorgenti di infezione, la diffusione di CMV  verosmilmente dovuta a diverse specie di afidi (non necessariamente vettori efficienti del virus) ed avviene durante i loro movimenti migratori a breve distanza. In effetti, trasmissioni sperimentali effettuate in condizioni simulanti quelle naturali con 11 specie di afidi, hanno dimostrato che 7 erano in grado di trasmettere CMV. In assenza di sorgenti di infezione prossime alia coltura, CMV viene prevalentemente trasmesso da afidi provenienti gi infetti da distanze relativamente lunghe. Poich la carica di CMV portata da afidi migranti  risultata elevata anche in periodi di scarsa densit di afidi alati, si presume ehe in queste condizioni la diffusione del virus avvenga prevalentemente ad opera di specie che ne sono vettori efficienti.
42685030|The activity of three enzymes involved in aerobic purine degradation, i.e. xanthine oxidase (EC 1.2.3.2), uricase (EC 1.7.3.3) and allantoinase (EC 3.5.2.5) as well as ureide concentration were determined in Vicia faba leaves after infection with the rust fungus Uromyces fabae. During the first stage of infection, corresponding to multihaustoria formation and consequent intercellular mycelium growth, all the enzymes and ureides tested were unchanged by infection. Starting from 4 (uricase), 5 (allantoinase) and 6 (xanthine oxidase and ureides) days postinoculation (before and at the beginning of subepidermic stromatic structure differentiation) xanthine oxidase activity and ureide concentration decreased while uricase and allantoinase activities increased progressively, reaching infected/healthy ratios of 0.14, 0.39, 5.6 and 4.7, respectively, at 10 days post-inoculation during uredospore differentiation. Allopurinol [4-hydroxypyrazolo (3,4-d) primidine], a specific inhibitor of xanthine oxidizing enzymes, applied starting 8 days before inoculation to the host by root absorption at a concentration of 400 M, almost abolished fungal growth but had no effect on uredospore germination, probably in relation to the absence of any xanthine oxidizing activity in the extract of germinated uredospores. The possibility that oxidative purine catabolism plays a key role in determining the biotrophic nutritional exchange between the host and the obligate parasite is discussed. L'attivit della xantina ossidasi (EC 1.2.3.2), dell'uricasi (EC 1.7.3.3) e deirallantoinasi (EC 3.5.2.5), tre enzimi operanti nel processo aerobico della degradazione delle purine, e la concentrazione delle ureidi sono state determinate in foglie di Vicia faba infette da Uromyces fabae. Durante le prime fasi dell'infezione, corrispondenti alia fase dello sviluppo intercellulare del micelio e concomitante formazione degli austori, tutti gli enzimi saggiati e le ureidi non subivano variazioni quantitative. Ad iniziare da 4 (uricasi), 5 (allantoinasi) e 6 (xantina ossidasi ed ureidi) giorni dall'inoculazione (prima e all'mizio della differenziazione delle strutture stromatiche subepidermiche) e proporzionalmente al progredire dello sviluppo fungino, l'attivit della xantina ossidasi e la concentrazione delle ureidi subivano un decremento mentre le attivit dell'uricasi e dell'allantoinasi subivano un incremento rispetto al controllo raggiungendo a 10 giorni dall'moculazione (differenziazione delle uredospore) rapporti infetto/sano rispettivamente di 0,14,0,39,5,6 e 4,7. L'allopurinolo [4-idrossipirazolo (3,4-d) pirimidina], un inibitore specifico della xantina ossidasi, somministrato all'ospite per via radicale in soluzione 400 M ad iniziare 8 giorni prima dell'inoculazione, inibiva quasi totalmente lo sviluppo del fungo mentre non aveva alcun effetto sulla germinazione delle uredospore, probabilmente in relazione all'assenza nell'estratto di attivit xantina ossidasica/deidrogenasica. Sulla scorta dei risultati ottenuti viene ipotizzata la possibilit che il catabolismo ossidativo delle purine svolga un rulo fondamentale nel rapporto nutrizionale di tipo biotrofico che si stabilise tra ospite e parassita obbligato.

42685544|'Kagzi' lime seedlings bud-inoculated with Citrus tristeza virus (CTV) or Citrus exocortis viroid (CEV) exhibited a deleterious effect on health and biochemical constituents. 42684437|In two-year field experiments, it could be demonstrated that the incidence of common smut [Ustilago maydis (DC) Corda] on maize was significantly increased by an effective weed control with different herbicides (atrazine, simazine, cyanazine, alachlor). More detailed investigations on the possibile causes for the observed increase in disease incidence led to the following results: (1) By eliminating the cover of weeds the passage of the pathogen from the soil to the leaf-funnel of the seedlings is facilitated. (2) The germination of chlamydospores and the budding growth of the sporidia of the pathogen are not appreciably influenced by the concentrations of herbicides which can be expected under field conditions. (3) In case of artificial inoculation of maize seedlings, the application of herbicides has a disease-stimulating effetct. Especially the percentage of severely diseased plants is increased. This is probably due to a temporary growth retardation of the seedlings. (4) Reduced competition by weeds and a better supply of water lead to a higher disease incidence after artificial inoculation. (5) The proportion of the inhibitor DMBO aglycon in maize plants is not changed substantially by treatment with herbicides. However, it is significantly increased by weed competition. In prove di campo condotte per due anni,  stato possibile dimostrare che l'incidenza del carbone del Mais [Ustilago maydis (DC) Corda]  stata significativamente maggiore su colture nelle quali le erbe infestanti erano state efficacemente controllate a mezzo di Atrazina, Simazina, Cianazina e Alaclor. Accurate indagini sulle possibili cause dell'aumento dell'incidenza della malattia hanno portato ai seguenti risultati. (1), In assenza di coltre erbosa,  facilitato il passaggio del patgeno dal terreno alla pianta emergente. (2), La germinazione dlie clamidospore e la formazione di sporidi non sono molto influenzate dalla concentrazione degli erbicidi presente nelle condizioni del trattamento in campo. (3), Nel caso di infezioni artificiali ai germinelli di Mais, gli erbicidi inducono un effetto stimulante sull'evolversi della malattia. Aumenta in particolare la percentuale dlie piante gravemente danneggiate; ci pu esser dovuto al temporneo rallentamento della crescita delle piante. (4), La ridotta competizione con le erbe infestanti e il miglior rifornimento idrico delle piante porta ad un aumento dell'incidenza delia malattia dopo l'infezione artificale. (5), la concentrazione in DMBO nelle piante di mais non varia molto a seguito dei trattamenti erbicidi; essa invece aumenta significativamente in piante di Mais ehe competono con le erbe infestanti.
42685422|The efficacy of foliage fungicide applications against eyespot of soft wheat cv. Serio was evaluated under natural Oculimacula infection in an experimental area in the Po Valley (Northern Italy). The fungicide treatments prochloraz, prochloraz + propiconazole, and trifloxystrobin + cyproconazole were applied in the years of 2006 through to 2009. Seeds were also treated with a formulated product based on guazatine. All foliage fungicides were applied at the stem extension growth stage (Zadoks growth stage 30-32), and at the manufacturer recommended rates. All tested treatments reduced the disease severity compared with untreated control. Prochloraz alone and particularly in combination with propiconazole gave the greatest efficacy in reducing eyespot. All treatments increased grain yield in 2006 and 2008. The effects of treatments on some yield parameters were also examined.
42685252|Protoplasts were successfully isolated from wild-type and mutant strains of Phytophthora nicotianae var. parasitica using Novozym 234. 42685390|Reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction analysis with two primer sets of luteoviruses was used to characterize an isolate of Chickpea chlorotic stunt virus (CpCSV, genus Polerovirus, family Luteoviridae) (SC402-08) collected from Lattakia, Syria, during the 2007-2008 chickpea growing season. Sequence analysis revealed that the coat protein gene of the isolate shared nucleotide sequence identities ranging from 97 to 98% with the CpCSV isolates from Egypt, Morocco and Syria. The capsid protein was separated as a protein of approximately 20 kDa in sodium dodecyl sulphate polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis, and was visually detected by its reaction with CpCSV monoclonal antibody in Western blot. SC402-08 isolate of CpCSV was purified from faba bean-infected plants, and yielded 112-182 pg of purified virions kg of infected tissue. The purified preparation was injected into a white rabbit, and an antiserum was obtained and used to detect CpCSV in infected tissues by tissue-blot immunoassay. The antiserum obtained was able to detect CpCSV by the immunoassay up to a dilution of 1:1,024,000.

La presenza di Phialophora cinerescens (Wr.) van Beyma nella parte bassa del fusto di piantine di Garofano (Dianthus caryophyllus L.) ottenute da talee, 48 ore dopo aver irrorato il terreno con una sospensione di conidi, porta ad ammettere una penetrazione diretta dei conidi stessi nei vasi legnosi. Nel giro di qualche settimana, lo sviluppo del callo cicatriziale non consente pi la penetrazione delle spore nel legno primario reciso all'atto del prelevamento della talea, poich i vasi sono ostruiti e disorganizzati. Van Bey ma in the lower part of carnation stems, 48 h after infection by watering the soil with a spore suspension, suggests a direct penetration of conidia in the xyleme vessels. After a few weeks, the development of wound callus prevents penetration of spores in primary xylem, which is severed when cuttings are made, owing to occlusion and disorganization of vessels. The site of first leaf symptoms and the consequences of wounding roots at the time of infection, seem both to indicate that spores enter vessels directly through wounds of the root system. The structure of Carnation xylem transport of conidia in the vessels have been investigated. Because of the short length of vessels, spores are freely transported only to a short distance. Such a transport accounts for the early presence of a few P. cinerescens spores in Carnation stems originating from roots wounded near the collar and explains why conidia are found only in the lower part of the stem. This difficulty in the transport of spores hinders invasion of Carnation by P. cinerescens and delays appearance of first foliar symptoms. Faster evolution of the disease in plants with roots wounded at the moment of infection, is probably related to the high number of spores entering vessels.

Snyd. et Hans.) f. sp. cerealis (Cke) Snyd. et Hans, with its three cultivars: 'Avenaceum', 'Culmorum' and 'Graminearum' is one of the most important parasites causing foot rot of cereals, particularly of Wheat. A survey made in the last two years in several areas of Southern Italy revealed that, in particular, 'Culmorum' is mainly present where durum wheat (Triticum durum Desf.) is cultivated, and that in association with other microrganisms it causes a severe rot at the base of the stem. Repeated cropping wheat has greatly favoured the accumulation in the soil of chlamydospores which constitute the major source of overwintering inoculum of the fungus. Due to the non specific reaction of the plant to 'Culmorum' infection and to the contemporary occurrence of other Fusarium species on the infected plant, plating is necessary for the proper identification of the parasite. Pathogenicity tests are also highly recommended for confirming the diagnosis. In fact forms of Fusarium roseum morphologically similar to 'Culmorum' are commonly encountered on Wheat. These forms can compete with: 'Culmorum', reducing the damage to the plant. 'Culmorum' isolates infecting wild Graminaceae proved pathogenic to Wheat in greenhouse tests. Similarly wheat isolates were pathogenic to wild Graminaceae. Although 'Culmorum' may be occasionally seedborne owing to surface contamination of kernels by chlamydospores present in dust, its primary means of spread is by infested soil. So far its epidemiological behaviour indicates the lack of an air-borne distribution (for instance through ascospores) this being in line with the probable absence of a perfect stage. Attacks of cereals by 'Culmorum' can occur: 1) at the pre-emergence stage, causing infection and even killing of seedlings; 2) at tillering, inducing the early or late death of the tiller; and 3) on adult plants. The latter constitutes the most subtle kind of attack as ears are usually formed but they are empty. 42685442|Sono esposti la tecnica ed i risultati di alcune osservazioni preliminari volte alla individuazione della C.M.I. di taluni antibiotici, in substrato solido e liquido, per Pseudomonas medicaginis f.sp. phaseolicola (Burk.) Dowson, e alla caratterizzazione delle manifestazioni di resistenza acquisita, resistenza incrociata e sensibilit collaterale offerte dallo stesso batterio in loro presenza. Nella prima serie di prove orientative in substrato solido, gli antibiotici dotati di maggiore efficacia inibente sono apparsi le tetracicline e la streptomicina, seguiti nell'ordine da neomicina, viomicina, polimixina, tirotricina, cloramfenicolo, bacitracina e penicillina. In substrato liquido, le tetracicline hanno confermato le loro qualit inibenti su tutti gli isolati del batterio. Buona, ma variabile  in funzione dei caratteri particolari dell'isolato di volta in volta proposto   stata invece l'attivit svolta da streptomicina, neomicina e viomicina. Rispetto all'efficacia presentata in substrato solido, la polimixina ha manifestato un notevole miglioramento ; il contrario  avvenuto per la tirotricina (insolubile in acqua). Cloramfenicolo, bacitracina e penicillina non hanno invece mostrato, al riguardo, difference degne di nota. Il grado di resistenza acquisita  stato massimo per la streptomicina; minore, nell'ordine, per neomicina, cloramfenicolo, bacitracina e terramicina; mnimo per penicillina e aureomicina. Fenomeni di resistenza incrociata parallela sono stati messi in evidenza per le tetracicline tra di loro, per streptomicina e neomicina, e per bacitracina e penicillina. Sensibilit collaterale parallela ha avuto luogo fra streptomicina e penicillina; unilateralmente, nell'ordine scritto, fra streptomicina e bacitracina; neomicina e penicillina; cloramfenicolo e bacitracina; bacitracina e neomicina. The technique and results of preliminary observations are reported, which aimed at finding the minimal inhibitory concentration of some antibiotics (penicillin-G Na, streptomycin sulphate, chloramphenicol, aureomycin, terramycin, bacitracin, neomycin sulphate, polymyxin-B sulphate, tyrothricin and viomycin), in liquid and solid medium, and the characterization of the manifestations of acquired resistance, cross -resistance and collateral sensitivity offered by the same bacterium in the presence of some of them (penicillin -G Na, streptomycin sulphate, chloramphenicol, aureomycin, terramycin, bacitracin and neomycin sulphate). The minimal inhibitory concentration in solid medium was found using one single isolate of the bacterium, by means of a particular technique consisting mainly in the macroscopic examination of the bacterial growth in nutrientagar plates, inoculated with drops (having a constant volume of cc 0,01) of the bacterial suspension to which different concentrations of the various antibiotics had been added. In this test, the results of which are shown more in detail in Table I, the antibiotics with the greatest inhibitory efficiency were found to be the tetracyclines and streptomycin, followed by neomycin, viomycin, polymyxin, tyrothricin, chloramphenicol, bacitracin and penicillin. The test made for finding the minimal inhibitory concentration in liquid medium  made using the technique of the consecutive dilutions, and extended to three isolates of the bacterium  supplied results (Table I) which constantly confirm the inhibiting qualities of the tetracyclines. Good, but varying  depending on the special characteristics of the isolates tested each time  was instead the activity of streptomycin, neomycin and viomycin. With reference to the efficiency shown in solid medium, polymyxin showed a remarkable improvement; the contrary happened with tyrothricin (insoluble in water). Chloramphenicol, bacitracin and penicillin did not show noteworthy differences. The manifestations of acquired resistance, cross-resistance and collateral sensitivity (Table II) were examined making  at a distance of 7 days from each other  ten transplants of the bacterium in the presence of sub-inhibitory amounts (progressively increased) of the same antibiotic and, after the last transplant, exposing at the same time the bacterium to a series of dilutions of all the tested antibiotics. The degree of acquired resistance was greatest for streptomycin; smaller for neomycin, chloramphenicol, bacitracin and terramycin; minimum for penicillin and aureomycin respectively. Parallel cross-resistance was observed for the two tetracycline analogues, for streptomycin and neomycin, and for bacitracin and penicillin. Parallel collateral sensitivity took place between streptomycin and penicillin; one-way collateral sensivity, in the mentioned order, between streptomycin and bacitracin; neomycio and penicillin; chloramphenicol and bacitracin; bacitracin and neomycin. 42684068|Leveillula taurica (Lv.) Arn. affects mainly leaves, more rarely stalks, flower parts or fruits. The most common symptom is a yellow spot on the upper leaf surface, and a powdery covering on the lower surface. Shedding of affected leaves is prominent chiefly in Pepper (Capsicum annuum L.). Wide variations, depending on the host species, exist in the degree of endophytism of L. taurica on leaves, in the size of conidiophores, conidia, cleistothecia, asci, and ascospores, and in the number of asci in each cleistothecium. Formation of conidia in chains is common under certain conditions. Hosts grow more susceptible to L. taurica as they mature, and individual leaves are rarely affected in early stages of growth. The hosts of L. taurica comprise more than 700 species. Cross-inoculations have been carried out in many countries with divergent results under various conditions, but in certain cases inoculum from some hosts has reliably been proved not to infect other hosts. Conidia of L. taurica germinate best at 100 % relative humidity, but will germinate freely at 40-95%, and to a lesser extent at 10-30% and even at 0% relative humidity. The geographical distribution of L. taurica varies greatly with the host species; it is widest, in both dry and humid zones, on hosts such as C. annuum, but more or less strictly limited to dry conditions on many other hosts. The fungus is considered to have originated in warm and dry regions and to adapt itself progressively to more humid (but not to cooler) conditions. The existence of host specific races is probable, but needs further proof. In any case some of these races seem to possess very wide host ranges. Differences in varietal resistance of hosts to L. taurica have so far been reported only for Artichoke (Cynara scolymus L.), Tomato (Lycopersicon esculentum Mill.) and Eggplant (Solatium melongena L.). Cultural control measures have to aim chiefly at planting in seasons when crops can escape infection, at reducing concentrations of inoculum by avoiding neighbourhood of older, infected crops, and at irrigation management, e. g. preference of sprinkling to furrow irrigation on Tomato, where L. taurica is favored by low humidity. Timing of chemical control may be guided by establishment of regional threshold dates for mildew appearance, determination of the age at which various hosts are first affected in various seasons, and observation of time and rate of mildew development on previously marked plants. All the materials used in general for control of mildews, especially sulphur, are also effective against L. taurica, and some of the new systemic fungicides promise even better control. Leveillula taurica (Lv.) Arn. attacca principalmente le foglie e raramente il fusto, le parti dei fiori e i frutti. Il sintomo piu comune  costituito da macchie gialle sulla pagina superiore e da una produzione farinosa sulla pagina inferiore delle foglie. Nel Peperone (Capsicum annuum L.)  frequente la caduta delle foglie colpite. In relazione alla pianta ospite, esiste una ampia variabilit del grado di endofitismo del fungo nelle foglie, della grandezza dei conidiofori, dei conidi, dei cleistoteci, degli aschi, delle ascospore e del numero di aschi per ciascun cleistotecio. La formazione di conidi catenulati e comune in alcune condizioni di ambiente. La suscettibilit delle piante ospiti verso L. taurica aumenta con l'etk. Raramente le foglie vengono colpite nei primi stadi di sviluppo. Leveillula taurica ha pi di 700 piante ospiti. Prove di inoculazione incrociata, eseguite in differenti condizioni in numerosi paesi, hanno fornito risultati divergenti. In alcuni casi, per, l'inoculo derivato da alcuni ospiti non ha prodotto infezioni su altri ospiti. L'umidit relativa ottimale per la germinazione dei conidi  del 100%. La germinazione avviene facilmente a 40-95 %, meno agevolmente a 10-30%, ma anche allo 0% di umidit relativa. La distribuzione geografica di L. taurica varia molto con le piante ospiti. La diffusione del fungo tanto nelle zone aride che in quelle umide  massima su ospiti come C. annuum; ma, su molti altri ospiti, viene limitata pi o meno drasticamente agli ambienti aridi. Il micete e considerato come originario di regioni calde e secche e capace di adattarsi progressivamente a condizioni piu umide, ma non piu fredde. L'esistenza di razze fisiologiche  probabile, ma ha blsogno di ulteriori conferme. In ogni modo, alcune razze sembrano capaci di infettare un eleyato numero di piante ospiti. Fino ad oggi, differenze nella resistenza varietale verso L. taurica sono state descritte solo per il Carciofo (Cynara scolymus L.), per il Pomodoro (Lycopersicon esculentum Mill.) e per la Melanzana (Solanum melongena L.). I mezzi di lotta agronomica devono tendere a: 1) seminare o trapiantare in periodi in cui le piante possono sfuggire alle infezioni; 2) ridurre la quantita d'inoculo evitando la vicinanza di colture pi vecchie e infette; 3) impiegare il metodo d'irrigazione piu appropriato, come ad esempio preferire l'irrigazione a pioggia piuttosto che quella per solchi nelle colture di Pomodoro, sulle quali gli attacchi del fungo sono favoriti dalla bassa umidita. I calendari di lotta possono essere basati: sulle epoche di comparsa deH'oidio nella regione, sullo stadio vegetativo in cui gli ospiti cominciano a divenire recettivi nelle diverse stagioni e sulle osservazioni del periodo e dell'intensita degli attacchi, eseguite su piante precedentemente contrassegnate. 42685770|A seven-year field investigation was carried out to evaluate the susceptibility to the grapevine rugose wood disease "legno riccio" of 13 clonal rootstocks grafted with an infected clone of the red grapevine cv. Lambrusco grasparossa (V. vinifera L.). All the rootstock varieties showed the typical symptoms of the disease but disorder incidence was variable, ranging from 26% ('41 B' and '140 Ruggeri') to 100% ('Kober 5BB', 'SO 4') of vines with grooving and or pitting of the woody cylinder of the trunk under the graft union. Disease severity rating on the rootstocks and the productive and vegetative response of the scion cultivar were negatively correlated. The scion cultivar performed better when grafted on the rootstocks with mild or medium symptoms, but large yield variations were observed for the same disease severity ratings. 'Lambrusco grasparossa' registered the best productive responses with the rootstock 'Golia', followed by 'Cosmo 2', '225 Ruggeri' and '1103 Paulsen'. 42685766|A 5-yr investigation, that included trapping of winged aphids and determination of the infection progress of Potato virus Y (PVY), was carried out in contiguous plots of tobacco and peppers in Umbra, Central Italy. Landing aphids were caught in yellow pan water or green tile (=ermine lime) horizontal traps from April or May to the end of the growing season. PVY was always detected earlier and reached much higher incidences in Tobacco (37-94% plants infected) than in Peppers (3-9%). Both yellow and green trap catches demonstrated that, with few exceptions, aphid landing rates were similar in the two crops or higher in Peppers. Therefore, the pattern of virus spread in the two crops was not correlated with catch data. Green tile catches indicated a shorter period of intense aphid alighting (end May-beginning July) than did yellow pan data. The most rapid phase of PVY spread in Tobacco probably corresponds to this restricted period. Per quanto riguarda le infezioni di PVY, tutti gli anni esse si potevano evidenziare pi precocemente in Tabacco che in Peperone e nella prima coltura raggiungevano sempre incidenze molto superiori (37-94% di piante infette contro 3-9% in Peperone). Tranne poche eccezioni, sia con le trappole gialle che con quelle verdi, nei due appezzamenti si sono rilevate circa le stesse densit di afidi alati oppure densit pi alte in Peperone. 43872341|Phoma black stem of sunflower, caused by Phoma macdonaldii, occurs in many countries. The objective of the present study was to estimate the number of markers and genomic regions in sunflower associating with Phoma black stem resistance. Genetic variability among 32 sunflower genotypes, including recombinant inbred lines and their parents, M7 mutant lines developed by gamma irradiation, and some genotypes from different countries of origin, was evaluated using simple sequence repeat (SSR) markers. Eighty-eight markers were generated at 38 SSR loci, with a mean number of aleles per locus of 2.32. Using susceptibility data of 32 sunflower genotypes against seven P. macdonaldii isolates (Darvishzadeh et al., 2007), one to four markers were associated with each of seven different P. macdonaldii isolates. To reduce the probability of false positives, a sequential Bonferroni-experiment-wise Pvalue was used for each marker trait association tested. The identified markers showed a promising trend, although they did not pass the more stringent bar of statistical significance, and should be studied further.

The Cx of E. chrysanthemi appeared to consist of one component and it exhibited a pH optimum of 6.5-7 on carboxymethylcellulose (CMC). This enzyme had a pI of 5.5. The PGTE activity found in infected plants was limited to the lower 5 cm of infected stem tissues. No significant activity could be demonstrated in the upper portions of diseased stems before or after development of severe symptoms of slow wilt or stunt. Cx activity was maximum in the lower 5 cm of infected stems but it could also be easily demonstrated in the upper stem portions. Both pectolytic and cellulolytic enzymes, are associated with pathogenesis by E. chrysanthemi, but the specific role these enzymes play in the development of slow wilt or stunt of Carnation remains to be elucidated. Il ceppo di Erwinia chrysanthemi Burkh., McFad. et Dim. (isolamento 307) che causa l'avvizzimento o nanismo del Garofano, produce in coltura e nelle piante infette una transeliminasi dell'acido poligalatturonico (PGTE) e una cellulasi (Cx). Sottoposto a purificazione questo enzima si  rivelato essere costituito da due componenti con punto isoelettrico (pI) rispettivamente di 9,1 e di 7,9. Il primo (pI 9,1) attacca il substrato in punti pi casuali (endo) di quanto non faceia il componente pI 7,9, che attacca maggiormente la parte terminale delia catena poligalatturonica. I pesi molecolari di entrambi i componenti sono simili e variano tra 30.000 e 32.400. La cellulasi (Cx) prodotta da questo batterio  apparsa costituita da un solo componente presentante una attivit ottimale ad un pH di 6,5-7 su carbossimetilcellulosa e un punto isoelettrico di 5,5. La PGTE  stata rinvenuta solo nella parte basale (5 cm) dei fusti infetti di Garofano. Nonostante la presenza del patogeno, non si  riscon trata alcuna significativa attivit di questo enzima nella parte superiore dello stelo n precedentemente n successivamente alla comparsa di severi sintomi della malattia. L'attivit cellulosolitica si  riyelata massima nella parte basale dei fusti, ma  stato possibile riscontrarla, in quantitativi maggiori che nel controllo, anche nella parte superiore dei fusti di piante infette. Gli enzimi pectolitici e cellulosolitici sembrano perci in qualche modo collegati alia patogenesi di E. chrysanthemi, ma il loro rulo specifico nel determinare l'avvizzimento batterico del Garofano deve essere ulteriormente chiarito. 42685669|Pathological changes were examined in taproots of Beets moderately resistant ('Rizor') and susceptible ('Monomassa') to rhizomania. Beets were grown in infected soil in the greenhouse. Various stages after beet emergence were investigated using light microscopy and histochemical staining procedures. The initial response to rhizomania infection of susceptible and moderately resistant beets was the same. This consisted mainly of necrosis of lateral roots, proliferation of lateral roots and the conversion of affected cortical cells into cells with meristematic activity. Distinct differences between the reaction of moderately resistant and susceptible Beets appeared at more advanced stages. In moderately resistant Beets the reaction to rhizomania was characterized by the appearance of a barrier of suberized cells which completely isolated the altered tissues. In these Beets the affected area was mainly in the beet cortex and there was usually no interruption of ring growth. In susceptible Beets the affected tissue extended deep into the cortex all the way up to the central core, interrupting several growth rings. Le modificazioni istopatologiche riscontrate nei fittoni di bietole della cv. Monomassa suscettibile alla rizomania e della cv. Rizor parzialmente resistente, cultivate in serra in terreno infetto, sono state esaminate, in vari stati di sviluppo dall'emergenza, al microscopio ottico mediante Tuso di coloranti e test istochimici. Inizialmente la reazione di entrambe le cultivar alla rizomania  risultata identica e consiste principalmente nella necrosi delle radici laterali che porta ad un'abnorme proliferazione del capillizio e alla regressione di cellule corticali in cellule con attivit meristematica.In stadi di sviluppo pi avanzati compaiono, invece, mrcate differenze nel comportamento dlie due cultivar. Nelle bietole parzialmente resistenti infatti la reazione alla rizomania appare caratterizzata dalla formazione di una barriera di cellule suberificate che isola completamente i tessuti alterati; in tali bietole le aree alterate sono localizzate principalmente nella corteccia e gli anelli di accrescimento normalmente non vengono interrotti nel loro sviluppo. Nelle bietole suscettibili, invece, le aree alterate si approfondano notevolmente nella corteccia fino a raggiungere il cilindro centrale provocando l'interruzione nello sviluppo delle cerchie di accrescimento.

42685613|The reliability of Elisa in the selection of rhizomania-tolerant sugar beet genotypes is reported. The amount of Beet necrotic yellow vein virus (BNYVV) obtained from sugar-beet rootlet and tap roots, greenhouse grown in infected soil, was correlated to the performance of the same genotypes grown in infected fields. The amount of virus extracted from Sugar-beet roots was determined by ELISA. Sample absorbance was converted into BNYVV concentration with a dose response equation determined for each microelisa plate by plotting the absorbance value of standard concentrations BNYVV against the corresponding virus concentrations. Tap-root extracted virus was found to have a highly significant negative correlation to sugar content and purity, a highly significant positive correlation to sodium, a significant negative correlation to sugar yield and ammino-nitrogen but no correlation to root yield and potassium. By contrast, the quantity of virus extracted from rootlets did not correlate with any of the qualitative and quantitative parameters of the field trials. Nessuna correlazione  stata invece riscontrata con la produzione di radici e il contenuto di potassio. 42685933|An account is given of the latest studies carried out in Apulia (Southern Italy) on grapevine yellows. Infection foci were recorded throughout the region except for the northern viticultural district. Alarming outbreaks with disease incidence above 30% were discovered in the Salento peninsula (extreme South East) in the native varieties Primitivo, Negroamaro and Uva rossa. No infection was observed in cv. Chardonnay, although its acreage is increasing in the region. Bait plants (periwinkle, clover and aster) placed in the vicinity of symptomatic vines became infected, demonstrating that yellows agents are spread by vectors. A number of potential leafhopper vectors were captured in yellows-affected vineyards but no attempt was made to check their ability to transmit. MLO-like bodies were successfully transmitted by dodder from infected vines to periwinkle plants. MLOs were observed in the sieve tubes of experimentally infected periwinkles, in naturally infected weeds and in one of the many infected grapevines that were investigated electron microscopically.

An in vitro study of the activity of several fungicides on some biological phases of Drechslera teres (mycelial growth, conidial germination, sporulation) showed that the form teres is more sensible that the form maculata. Some contact fungicides like anilazine and chlorothalonil were the most active on conidial germination. 42683837|Dopo aver accennato alla rapidit con la quale Gloeosporium olivarum Alm. si  diffuso in Puglia negli Ultimi anni, fino ad interessare una superficie di ha 40.000, si descrivono brevemente i sintomi che il parassita induce negli organi vegetativi dei suoi ospiti. Viene messa in evidenza l'importanza e la gravita della defogliazione primaverile che raggiunge valori altissimi (fino al 99,6 %) negli alberi infetti dal fungo. Si mette in evidenza che, delle due cultivar di Olivo pi estesamente coltivate nel Salento:  Cellina di Nardo  e  Ogliarola di Lecce , a parit di infezione, la prima soggiace di pi della seconda alla defogliazione indotta da G. olivarwn. Si espongono i risultati delle ricerche su alcuni aspetti della biologia del parassita. In particolare: 1) G. olivarum sembra poter infettare direttamente, e le foglie gi presenti sulle piante nel periodo autunno-invernale (da dicembre in poi), quando sono gi da tempo in atto infezioni ai frutti, e le giovani foglie, emesse al risveglio vegetativo degli Olivi. Queste ultime, pero, sono colpite fino a che esistono condizioni climatiche favorevoli aile infezioni e sufficienti sorgenti di inoculo, cio da febbraio ad aprile. 2) Sulle foglie infette, cadute precocemente al suolo, il micelio vegeta solo per periodi relativamente brevi (3-4 mesi). 3) I getti di 2-3 anni di et ed i rami di cm 4-5 di diametro possono essere attaccati direitamente o invasi dal micelio che proviene, at traverso i peduncoli, dalle olive infette e, attraverso i piccioli, dalle foglie infette. 4) Le drupe sono comunemente infettate direttamente ; ma possono anche essere invase dal micelio presente nei rametti, che penetra in esse dal peduncolo. 5) Il parassita vive tutto l'anno negli organi assili dell'Olivo di 2 o 3 anni (diametro inferiore o uguale a cm 4-5). In estate, tuttavia, diviene piu raro, soprattutto sui rami di et maggiore di cm 4-5 o pi di diametro), nei cui tessuti non sembra riuscire facilmente ad approfondirsi oltre il sughero, prima dell'estate. Il fungo sembra non attaccare i tronchi e i rami pi spessi. 6) G. olivarum si mantiene vitale per lungo tempo nelle olive  mummificate  persistenti sugli alberi, dalle quali sembrano originarsi frequentemente le nuove infezioni nell'autunno successivo. Il parassita riesce a sopravvivere a lungo anche sulle olive infette cadute al suolo, in virt dei clamido-conidi che nei loro tessuti si formano. This is a study of some biological aspects of G. olivarum in Puglia. The fungus, which the last few years has spread on about 40.000 hectares, induces a serious spring defoliation especially on the cv  Cellina di Nard  (up to 99.6% of the leaves which were on the twigs in the autumn), which, the infection being equally serious, is much more defoliated by it than the other common cv  Ogliarola di Lecce . The results of the other biological observations are that: 1) G. olivarum is capable of infecting directly not only the leaves already present on the plants at the end of the autumn  these infections occur from December on, while the first fruit infections occur in September  but also the young leaves which unfold from February on. Leaf infections occur until climatic conditions are favourable to the infections and the inocolum is sufficient. They stop by the end of April. 2) On the infected leaves, fallen to the ground, the mycelium remains alive about 3-4 months. 3) Small branches 2-3 years old and older branches of cm 4-5 of diameter, may be infected directly or may be invaded by the mycelium proceding either through the peduncles, from infected olives, or, through the petioles, from infected leaves. 4) Usually the olives are infected directly, but they may be invaded also by the mycelium which enters the petiole and the fruit from the supporting twigs. 5) The pathogen can live all through the year, in the small branches 2-3 years old (with diameter inferior or equal to cm 4-5). In the summertime, however, the mycelium can be isolated with more difficulty especially from the older branches (with a diameter of cm 4-5 or more). It seems that, in these larger branches the mycelium is not able to penetrate the cork layers easily. The fungus has not been isolated from the trunks and from the large branches. 6) G. olivarum remains alive a very long time in the  mummified  olives ( mummies  ), which are not shed by the trees and keep  in situ . 42685405|The National Grapevine Trunk Disease Survey was conducted in France from 2003 to 2008 to monitor grapevine trunk diseases (GTDs), eutypa dieback and esca/black dead arm (BDA). Data collected from seven regions, 329 vineyards and 12 cultivare were analysed. There were great variations amongst regions in the incidence of GTDs. For esca/BDA, two groups were distinguished: vineyards in Jura and Charentes had greater incidence (93-95%) than those of Bordeaux, Alsace and Bourgogne (54-82%). Incidence increased in Charentes over the 6-year survey, with the highest values being recorded during the last 2 years. For eutypa dieback, all vineyards of Charentes were affected, with 17 to 25% of vines expressing symptoms; for the other regions, 52 to 80% of vineyards were affected, with incidences below 3%. Cultivars Savagnin and Trousseau in Jura were especially affected by esca/BDA. Instead, Ugni Blanc in Charentes was most affected by eutypa dieback. One cultivar could be significantly more affected in one region than in another. The global health status of the vineyards was also investigated. (i) For four regions, 82% (Jura) to 87% (Alsace) of the grapevines were healthy, but this percentage decreased steadily (67%) in Charentes. (ii) Plants infected by GTDs were 32 and 18% in Jura and Charentes respectively, and only 2.9% in the Bourgogne region. (iii) The unproductive plants, i.e. dead, missing, replanted or restored, represented a significant part of the losses (6.6% in Charentes to 9.9% in Jura). The extension of GTDs is discussed with regard to the abiotic and biotic factors that may favour the diseases.

42685360|Data on the effect of host resistance and fungicide sprays on Cercospora leaf spot in sugarbeet were gathered from several experimental trials, carried out at 22 locations in the Mediterranean area, under the auspices of the I.I.R.B. (International Institute for Beet Research). The experiments were carried out over a three-year period (1994-1996) in Greece, Italy, Morocco, Spain, and Turkey, under different epidemiological conditions, following a common experimental design: host resistance was considered at five levels, corresponding to different cvs, from susceptible to highly resistant; fungicides were included at two levels, sprayed or unsprayed. Host resistance significantly reduced disease progress at locations with severe or moderate epidemics, where the area under disease progress curve (AUDPC) of the most resistant cvs was less than one half and less than one third respectively compared to that of the most susceptible cv. However, host resistance was not a significant factor when mild epidemics occurred. The disease rating of cvs based on the AUDPC did not vary significantly among locations, showing that resistance is stable over locations in the Mediterranean area. Gross sugar yield from the resistant cvs was significantly higher than that from the susceptible one, but only in severe epidemics. Purity of the juice was higher in resistant cvs when severe or moderate epidemics occurred. Fungicide sprays on the susceptible cv. reduced disease progress significantly, and increased sugar yield and juice purity during both severe and moderate epidemics; but during mild epidemics the fungicides influenced the sugar yield only because of their secondary effect on powdery mildew and rust. An integration of host resistance and fungicide spraying did not increase sugar yield significantly over that of the sprayed susceptible cv., but it did increase juice purity, especially at locations with severe or moderate epidemics.

42684123|In the last few years, the number of declining pear trees of certain scion-rootstock combinations in Greece has been on the increase. The foliage symptoms and the overall poor growth of the trees resemble those described for pear decline and moria. The graft union symptoms, however, vary considerably with the scion-rootstock combination and often, particularly those of Pear on Quince, appear to be the result of graft incompatibility. 42685556|Nel quinquennio 1977-81, nelle regioni dell'Italia meridionale, ove maggiormente si  operato, l'esame di 566 isolati di Puccinia graminis f. sp. tritici ha permesso la determinazione di 24 razze fisiologiche di cui una, la razza 60, risulta nuova per l'Italia. Le razze presenti tutti gli anni e con elevata frequenza sono state la razza 1, 11 e 34; e mentre la prima di esse ha subito, recentemente, un considerevole incremento, la razza 11 si  notevolmente ridotta in frequenza. La razza 34 ha invece mantenuto, tranne che nel 1981, una frequenza pi o meno costante. Con l'impiego di 10 Frumenti addizionali si  messo in evidenza la presenza di diversi biotipi, soprattutto nelle razze 1, 11, 17, 34 e 56. Ottimo comportamento verso tutti gli isolati ha mostrato il gene Sr 9e portato da 'Yuma'. Anche i geni Sr 11 e Sr Tt, portati da' Combination IV'e Sr 5 ed Sr 13, portati da' Combination VI' hanno mostrato un buon comportamento. Inoltre, per le variet commerciali usati come differenziali,'Guasila 593'  apparso altamente resistente a tutti gli isolati mentre 'Creso' ha mostrato suscettibilit verso qualche biotipo del patogeno. Twenty four physiological races have been identified from 566 isolates of Puccinia graminis Pers. f. SP. tritici Eriks, et Henn. collected in Italy (mostly in Southern areas) during five years (1977-81). The race 60 was isolated for the first time in Italy. The races 1, 11 and 34, always present showed the highest frequency. The occurrence of race 11 was gradually reduced during the last 3 years, while race 1 was recently increasing. Except for 1981, the occurrence of race 34 was almost constant. Using 10 additional differential varieties, the presence of several biotypes of race 1, 11, 17, 34, and 56 was put in evidence. Testing some near-isogenic lines towards all isolates, the resistance genes Sr 9e ('Yuma'), Sr 11 and Sr Tt ('Combination IV'), Sr 5 and Sr 13 ('Combination VI') showed high efficiency. Among commercial varieties, used like differentials, 'Guasila 593' showed high resistance towards all tested isolates, while 'Creso' showed susceptibility towards some biotypes of the pathogen.
42684922|Sono stati messi a confronto i metodi SDP e MPN per la determinazione della ID di Phytophthora cryptogea Peth. et Laff. in campioni di terreno infestato. Il primo metodo (SDP)  risultato pi preciso ed  stato perci preso in considerazione per valutarne l'efficacia. A tal fine  stato determinato il modello spaziale del patogeno nei campioni di terreno e sono state accertate la variabilit e la sensibilit del metodo. Poich il modello di distribuzione di P. cryptogea nei campioni  risultato di tipo aggregate, la variabilit pu essere ridotta saggiando un numero maggiore di aliquote per campione. Per ottenere dati quantitativamente validi  necessario saggiarne almeno tre. Cos pure, la sensibilit del metodo pu essere migliorata aumentando il numero di aliquote saggiate, ma non riducendo la diluizione della sospensione di terreno (da 1:10 a 1:5). The SDP and MPN (most probable number) methods were compared to assay the ID of Phytophthora cryptogea Peth. et Laff. in infested soil samples. The SDP method resulted the more accurate. To evaluate its efficiency, both precision and sensitivity were tested, and the propagule spatial pattern in the soil samples was determined. Since the spatial pattern proved to be aggregated, the precision of the method could be improved by testing a greater number of subsamples. In order to obtain good quantitive data a minimum of three subsamples was necessary. Also, sensitivity seemed to be improved by increasing the number of subsamples but not by increasing soil suspension concentration (1:10 to 1:5).

The studies carried out in the Riviera Ligure have yielded the following results, useful for the control of Carnation wilt caused by Phialophora cinerescens (Wr.) van Beyma: 1) The infections and the development of the mycelium in the stem, generally take place between September and November and between February and April, when the soil temperature ranges from 10 to 18-20 C. 2) The incubation period of the disease lasts from 40 to 70 days when the average air and soil temperatures range between 15 and 23 C.It reaches 3-4 months when the temperatures drop below 15  C. 3) As long as the temperature remains above 25 C, infected plants with mild symptoms often recover and never wilt completely. 4) The infections can occur through the healthy root tissues, but more easily when the roots are wounded as, for instance, because of the normal cultivation practices (e. g. hoeing). 5) During a single crop season the disease can spread in patches to all the surrounding plants (20-30) in a radius of 50-60 cm from each transplanted symptomless but already infected rooting. From a practical point of view the following conclusions can be drawn: a) in order to reduce the spread of the pathogen it is very important to use cuttings obtained from indexed mother plants, surely Phialophora free; b) should indexing not be possible, cuttings should be collected from Carnation plants at the end of the spring or in summer when the incubation period of the disease is shorter than in autumn and in winter; c) systemic chemicals should be applied only in the autumn and in the spring when the temperature is favourable to the infections of the pathogen. 42685407|This study investigated terpene synthase (TPS) activity and terpene antifungal metabolites in calluses and cell suspension cultures of Vitis vinifera cv. Chardonnay infected with Phaecremonium parasiticum, one of the fungi associated with the grapevine diseases known as "hoja de malvn" and young vine decline. The highest TPS activity, assessed as tritiated farnesyl pyrophosphate ([H]-FPP) transformed into hexane-soluble radioactive products, was observed in both inoculated calluses and cell suspension cultures (CSC). When tested in inoculated cell suspension cultures the TPS activity was maximal at 8 h after [H]-FPP application and then declined; this was associated with a temporary increase of the sesquiterpene nerolidol. Grape calluses produced: -pinene, nerolidol and squalene whether or not they were inoculated with Pm. parasiticum. As fungal amount raised the relative concentration of -pinene and nerolidol increased in respect to squalene in calluses. The TPS activity and nerolidol and -pinene accumulation was correlated with the increase in the amount of inoculated fungus. Of the mentioned metabolites mainly squalene was identified from extracts of fungal cultures. The results suggest that the response of grapevine tissues to Pm. parasiticum is dependent on the pathogen concentration and is characterized by increasing TPS activity through de novo synthesis.
