42685211|Thirty four isolates of Botryris cinerea Pers. were collected from different tomato greenhouses situated along the Lebanese Coast. Single-spore isolates were prepared and in vitro tests were conducted to study their level of sensitivity to some selected fungicides. Mycelial growth inhibition tests proved that 73% of the isolates tested were resistant to benomyl at 10 g ml, 94% resistant to dichlofluanid at 5 g ml, and three isolates were resistant to dicarboximides at 5 g ml. Practically all isolates tested were sensitive to triflumizole at 10 g ml and to the mixture tebuconazole + dichlofluanid at 5 + 20 g ml, respectively. On the other hand, results of spore germination inhibition tests proved that dichofluanid inhibited spore germination of eight selected isolates tested including isolates showing resistance to 81 g ml dichlofluanid in the mycelial sensitivity tests. The ED for spore germination inhibition of the 8 selected isolates ranged between 0.02 and 0.06 g ml. Similar results were obtained with chlorothalonil with an ED ranging between 0.04 and 0.12 g ml. Dithianon and copper hydroxide were least effective in inhibiting spore germination. Pathogenicity tests proved that some of the benomyl resistant isolates tested conserved their virulence levels while all three dicarboximide resistant isolates showed lower virulence levels. In vivo tests concerning resistance to dicarboximides and dichlofluanid correlated well with in vitro results.

Most of the segments consist of intact short or long particles of virus, others could result from a break of the short particles near their center. 42685327|A total of 47 randomly-selected lentil fields, in the main lentil production regions of South-East Anatolia (SEA), Turkey, were surveyed during May, 1996, for incidence and severity of diseases (fungal and viral), parasitic weeds and insect pests. The lentil growth stage varied from late flowering/early podding to physiological maturity. A total of six fungal and five viral diseases, two parasitic weeds and eight harmful insects were recorded. Amongst fungal diseases, wilt (Fusarium oxysporum Schlecht. emend. Snyder et Hansen f. sp. lentis Vasud. et Srin.), phoma blight (Phoma medicaginis Malbr. et Roum.) and stem rot (Sclerotinia sclerotiorum (Lib.) de Bary) were predominant. The virus diseases detected, based on laboratory tests in samples with yellowing symptoms suggestive of virus infection, were luteoviruses (41% of the samples tested) and faba bean necrotic yellows virus (FBNYV) (15%). Additionally, three seed-borne viruses, namely broad bean stain comovirus (BBSV), pea seedborne mosaic potyvirus (PSbMV) and bean yellow mosaic potyvirus (BYMV), were detected with the former being most prevalent. Orobanche (Orobanche aegyptiaca L.) was prevalent in some production regions. Among insect pests, root aphid (Smythurodes betae West.), ground pearl (Porphyrophora polonica L.) and thrips were the most damaging. These are the first records of Sclerotinia sclerotiorum, Botrytis cinerea, luteoviruses, FBNYV, BBSV, BYMV and PSbMV on lentil in Turkey.

Par consquent, mme ce mcanisme protectif semble ne pas participer  la dfense. La glycolise a donn des rsultats plutt oscillants et des diffrences minimes (Fig. 1); cependant la glycolise tend  tre plus leve dans les cultures les plus susceptibles; spcialement dans les prlvement centraux et dans les feuilles de 2-3 cm et 3-4 cm. Grce  cette premire recherche on a pu remarquer que la respiration, le contenu hydrique et l'azote total sont nettement plus levs dans les cultivars susceptibles que dans les cultivars rsistants: le contraste est particulirement remarquable entre le cultivar le plus susceptible (Vera) et celui que le parasite n'atteint pas (Dolce Agogia). Il semble par consquent que ces facteurs dans leur ensemble participent plus que les facteurs mcaniques que nous avons considrs  la dfense contre S. oleagina. Ces premiers rsultats, surtout s'ils sont confirms sur d'autres cultivars, pourraient nous donner une ide sur les prfrences du champignon, sur certains aspects des mcanismes de dfense et aussi fournir des indications utiles aux gntistes. On Olive leaves (Olea europaea L.) of various sizes (cm 0,5-2, 2-3, 3-4), taken from four cultivars of varying degrees of susceptibility to Spilocaea oleagina (Cast.) Hugh. (Vera, highly susceptible; Moraiolo, susceptible; Dolce del Lago, moderately resistant; Dolce Agogia, immune), glycolysis, respiration, dry substance and total nitrogen content were determined, during the period of spring infections (5.17.1966, first leaf collection; 5.25.1966, second collection; 6.3.1966, third collection; 6.10.1966, fourth collection). Thickness of the cuticle, and the hairiness of the upper surface were also measured. The thickness of the cuticle of a same leaf varies in relation to the presence or absence of hairs. Consequently, it was impossible to relate differences between the various cultivars to resistance. The hairs completely cover leaves up to cm 2-2,5 long and might contribute to their effective protection. These hairs however, thin out earlier in the immune cultivar (Dolce Agogia) than in the others, which show a remarkable uniformity from this point of view. Therefore, this protective mechanism does not seem to be involved in the defense system of the plant. Glycolysis yielded unsteady results and differences of no consequence (Fig. 1). It showed the tendency, however, to be higher in the more susceptible cultivars, especially in the middle leaf collections, and in the leaves of 2-3 and 3-4 cm in length. Respiration is most active in the highly susceptible cultivars, and diminishes gradually with resistance (Fig. 2). In the last leaf collection, these differences are less pronounced, and altogether disappear with the coming of summer (Fig. 6). The respiration-glycolysis ratio yielded rather inconsistent results but tended to be higher in the susceptible cultivars (Fig. 5). Water content is definitely higher in the two susceptible cultivars, during the entire spring period (Fig. 3), whereas no great differences were observed between the four cultivars in summer (Fig. 6). Total nitrogen content (per g of dry substance) is higher in susceptible cultivars, to diminish gradually as resistance increases (Fig. 4). Also these differences disappear in summer when no infections take place (Fig. 6). Through this preliminary investigation, it was possible to conclude that respiration, water content, and total nitrogen content are notably higher in the susceptible cultivars and lower in the more resistant. This constrast is particularly striking between the most susceptible cultivar (Vera) and the immune one (Dolce Agogia). It seems, therefore, that these factors, as a whole, are involved in the defence against S. oleagina to a greater extent than the mechanical factors. These first results, expecially if confirmed in other cultivars, could supply useful indications on the preferences of the fungus, as well as on some aspects of plant defence mechanism in general, and constitute also useful hints for the geneticists.
42684103|A serious stalk soft rot of Maize observed in irrigated fields in the region of San Benedetto Po (Mantova) is described. 42685967|The use of a non-radioactive DNA probe for detection of TYLCV proved to be sensitive and reliable using either dot blots or tissue blots. In dot blots, two extraction methods using either 10  SSC containing 0.01% SDS, pH= 7.0 or 0.4 N NaOH, when combined with hybridization in the presence of either 50% formamide, 5  SSC, pH= 7.0 or 50% formamide, 0.125 M NaHPO, pH= 8.0, proved practical, simple, and sensitive. TYLCV was easily detected in invaded phloem bundles by tissue blots of stem, crown and root sections. The virus concentration was highest in the apical region and was found to be higher in the susceptible variety as compared to two tolerant ones.
43871743|Leucostoma cinctum and L. persoonii are the two species involved in Leucostoma canker, a disease that causes dieback of twigs and branches, bark cankers, gummosis, and tree decline of stone fruit. The aim of this study was to identify the causal agent of Leucostoma canker in Italian stone fruit orchards. More than 200 isolates of Leucostoma spp. were obtained from branches and twigs of sweet and sour cherry, apricot, and European plum trees that showed typical symptoms of Leucostoma canker. These trees were in commercial orchards of two Italian regions, Marche and Apulia, in central-eastern and south-eastern Italy, respectively. Soon after isolation, all of the colonies that grew on potato dextrose agar were white in colour, and after about 10 d they became olive-green. Growth was not observed at 33C, and the pycnidia were larger than 1 mm diam. This information led to the identification of L. cinctum as the causal agent of these Leucostoma cankers. To our knowledge, this is the first report of L. cinctum on sweet cherry and European plum in Italy.
42684011|Sono descritte le alterazioni istologiche e citologiche causate dalla fusicoccina, una tossina prodotta da Fusicoccum amygdali Del., alle foglie di Fagiolo. L'assorbimento di una soluzione 10 M (circa 7 ppm) attraverso le radici, integre di piante di Fagiolo ha prodotto nei tessuti fogliari vacuolizzazione e contrazione del protoplasma per fenomeni di pseudo-plasmolisi e poi collasso e disidratazione delle cellule. Le alterazioni osservate sono interpretate in base all'azione auxino-simile della fusicoccina sulle pareti cellulari e al successivo danneggiamento della permeabilita delle citomembrane. Histological and cytological changes of Bean leaf caused by fusicoccin, a toxin produced by Fusicoccum amygdali Del., are described. Vacuole formation and protoplasm shrink age due to pseudoplasmolysis, and then cell collapse and dehydration, are induced in leaf tissues by the uptake of a 10 M (ca. 7 ppm) fusicoccin solution through intact roots of Bean plants. Amongst cellular organlles, the chloroplasts are most damaged. Primary starch grains of the affected chloroplasts undergo an accelerated hydrolysis. The observed changes are explained in terms of increase of cell wall plasticity, through an auxin-like mechanism, and subsequent disruption of the permeability of cytomembranes. On a attribu les altrations observes  l'action de type auxinique de la fusicoccine sur les parois cellulaires et  l'altration de la permabilit des cytomembranes qui s'en suit.
42685649|Inoculations of tomato roots with an avirulent form of Fusarium oxysporum and treatment with heat or chloroform that increase resistance to the virulent form lycopersici caused increase of ethylene emission both from roots and stems on 3-4 days after treatment. Infection with F. lycopersici did not induce further increase of ethylene over untreated controls in plants with roots previously treated with heat or chloroform. The ethylene releasing compound Ethephon and the ethylene precursor ACC induced resistance to Fusarium wilt in tomato plants only when applied before inoculation. The reduction of symptom severity by Ethephon treatments was associated with a parallel decrease in the production of ethylene induced by infection. The results confirm that the effects of exogenous ethylene on the resistance of plants to vascular diseases depend on the time of the treatment in relation to inoculation and that abiotic and biotic stresses induce increase of ethylene production in plants. They also suggest a possibile preinfectional, but not postinfectional, role of ethylene in the stress-induced resistance to F. lycopersici in Tomato. A Fusarium lycopersici. Preinoculazioni con una forma di Fusarium oxysporum non patogena su Pomodoro e trattamenti radicali con calore e cloroformio inducenti resistenza alla forma patogena lycopersici hanno determinato aumenti dell'evoluzione di etilene da radici e fusti, massimi 3-4 giorni dopo i trattamenti. L'inoculazione con F. lycopersici non ha indotto ulteriori aumenti di etilene nelle piante trattate con calore e cloroformio in confronto alle piante non trattate. L'Ethephon ed il precursore etilenico ACC hanno prodotto resistenza a F. lycopersici solo se applicati prima dell'inoculazione. La riduzione della gravit dei sintomi mediante trattamenti con Ethephon  risultata associata ad un parallelo decremento nella produzione di etilene dovuta all'infezione. I risultati confermano che gli effetti dell'etilene esogeno sulla resistenza delle piante alle malattie vascolari dipendono dal momento del trattamento in rapporto all'inoculazione e che stress abiotici e biotici diversi sono seguiti da aumenti della produzione di etilene. Essi suggeriscono un, possibile ruolo preinfezionale, ma non postinfezionale dell'etilene nella resistenza a F. lycopersici causata da stress nel Pomodoro.
42684624|Seven pathogenic isolates of Streptomyces from scabby tubers, belonging to four species showed considerable variations in respect of morphological, cultural and biochemical characters. The isolates produced both shallow as well as deep type of scab symptoms. The spore chain morphology ranged from straight to flexuous to coiled. Four isolates produced brown ring in litmus milk. The pathogenic isolates represented both melanin positive and negative groups. Fair pectinolytic activity and poor cellulolytic activity was observed in most of them. These pathogenic isolates were identified as Streptomyces gnseus, S. longisporoflavus, S. collinus and S. cinereus. No correlation could be established between the morphological, cultural or biochemical characters and the pathogenicity of the isolates. Da tuberi di patata affetti da  scabbia comune  sono stati ottenuti sette isolati di Streptomyces, appartenenti a quattro specie. Essi mostravano considerevoli variazioni riguardo a caratteri morfologici, colturali e biochimici. Gli isolati producevano sintomi sia superficiali che profondi. La morfologa delle catene di spore variava da diritta a flessuosa o spiralata. Quattro isolati formavano un anello bruno in latte tornasolato. Degli isolati patogeni alcuni erano melanina-positivi altri melanina-negativi. Nella maggior parte di loro era osservata una buona attivit pectinolitica e una scarsa attivit cellulosolitica. Questi isolati patogeni erano identificati come Streptomyces gseus, S. longisporoflavus, S. collinus e S. cinereus. Non  stato possibile stabilire alcuna correlazione tra i caratteri morfologici, colturali o biochimici e la patogenicit degli isolati.

42683928|Acetate (OPPA), isobutyrate (OPPI) and laurate (OPPLa) esters of ortho-phenyl-phenol (OPP), impregnated into wrappers at different concentrations, were tested for their effectiveness in controlling green mold, in  Shamouti  and  Valencia  oranges artificially inoculated with spores of Pnicillium digitatum Sacc. The first two esters reduced substantially the incidence of decay, being superior, in this respect, to sodium o-phenyl-phenate (SOPP) and, in most cases, comparable to biphenyl. The OPPA and OPPI esters caused damage to the peel of  Shamouti  oranges, particularly at high concentrations. OPPLa was not phytotoxic, but its effectiveness in decay control was insufficient. Contrary to biphenyl, esters of OPP, when impregnated in wrappers, have a pleasant odor; like biphenyl, they inhibited the sporulation of P. digitatum for some time. OPPI was, in many aspects, slightly superior to OPPA. There are indications that both esters are also capable of reducing stem-end rots. Mixtures of biphenyl and OPPA or OPPI were found to combine the advantages of each component and eliminate or reduce their disadvantages.  stata saggiata l'efficacia degli esteri acetato (OPPA) isobutirrato (OPPI) e laurato (OPPLa) dell'o-fenilfenolo (OPP) contro la muffa verde dei frutti degli Agrumi. 42685848|Deformed flowers of Lilium  Pink Perfection , showing virescence and alterations of the reproductive structures are described; the diseased plants also showed anomalies in the leaf pigment. In the negative stain preparations of flowers and leaves, two types of virus particles, with lengths respectively of 640 and 740 nm, were seen with electron microscopy. They were identified as respectively the lily symptomless virus (LSV) and the tulip breaking virus (TBV) using immuno-electron microscopy. Mycoplasma-like organisms (MLO), similar to those described for yellow-type diseases, were also found in the phloematic tissue. Viene descritta una deformazione dei fiori di Lilium, cv. Nelle colorazioni negative sia dei fiori che delle foglie son state osservate al microscopio elettronico due tipi di particelle virali filamentose lunghe rispettivamente 640 nm e 740 nm. Tali virus son stati identificati mediante immuno-elettromicroscopia come il virus latente del giglio (LSV) ed il virus della rottura di colore del tulipano (TBV). L'indagine ultrastrutturale ha rivelato la presenza di aggregati di particelle virali caratteristici dei virus del gruppo Carla e di inclusioni citoplasmatiche tipiche dei virus del gruppo Y della patata. 42684561|Nelle estati degli anni 1977 e 1978 sono stati effettuati diversi prelievi di parti di organi fiorali e di frutti, da vigneti allevati  a tendone  , siti in diverse localit pugliesi, per potere osservare le infezioni estive di Botrytis cinerea Pers. ex Fr. alla base degli stili, o ombelico, delle bacche. Nel 1977, le osservazioni sono state eseguite su campioni di sedici cultivar di Vite, provenienti da cinquantadue vigneti, nel periodo di tempo compreso tra la fine della fioritura e l'inizio della maturazione. Nel 1978 sono stati osservati campioni di quattro cultivar di Vite, diffuse nella regione pugliese ('Italia', 'Ohanez', 'Regina' e 'Sangiovese'), prelevati in tre localit che sembravano particolarmente indicative, per essere una sita nel Nord della Puglia, in pianura (Cerignola), l'altra sulla fascia costiera ionica (Castellaneta), e la terza in collina (Fasano), approssimativamente a meta strada fra le prime due. Nel 1978, la raccolta dei campioni si  protratta per un periodo pi lungo del precedente anno (dall'inizio della fioritura alla raccolta dell'uva sono stati effettuati sei prelievi di campioni, anziehe tre come nel precedente anno); inoltre, nel 1978, sono stati osservati singularmente, all'antesi, gli organi fiorali (stami, caliptre, ecc), oltre che i fiori in toto, e poi le bacche intere e i soli ombelichi. Le osservazioni orientative eseguite nel 1977 e quelle pi probanti del 1978 sembrano indicare che l'ombelico della bacca, sulle cultivar osservate e nelle nostre condizioni ambientali, da giugno sino a date posteriori ai primi di agosto,  sede di assai scarse infezioni di B. cinrea, potendo quindi altre parti (fiori abortiti, basi dei frutti, tessuti necrotici in genere) svolgere un ruolo importante nella estivazione e nella successiva diffusione del fungo. Infine, sono poste brevemente in evidenza differenze morfologiehe e di struttura degli stili delle cultivar Italia, Ohanez, Regina e Sangiovese e, con riferimento anche alia bibliografia consultata, viene espressa l'opinione che esse possano contribuir a spiegare risultati divergenti di ricerche sull'estivazione di B. cinrea nelle bacche di Vite, condotte su variet diverse e in ambienti diversi. In the years 1977 and 1978, samples of flowers and fruits and their parts were periodically collected from grapevine arbors. Samples were collected from different cultivars and from different vineyards, scattered throughout Apulia. The observations carried out were especially intended to get some idea on the importance of the infections of Botrytis cinerea at the stylar end ( ombelico , in Italian), during the most arid period of the apulian summer, from the end of June to the middle of August. In 1977, the observations were carried out on samples of 16 grapevine cultivars, collected in 52 vineyards, from the end of anthesis to the beginning of maturation (rather advanced veraison). In 1978, the single samples were larger, but they referred to 4 cultivars only ('Italia', 'Ohanez', 'Regina' and 'Sangiovese'), common or very common in the apulian region; and the samples were collected in 3 arbors which seemed particularly indicative of different apulian environments, one being in the plains in the north of the region (Cerignola), the second on the jonic sea coast (Castellaneta) and the third (Fasano) on the hills midway between Cerignola and Castellaneta. In 1978, samples were collected for a longer period than 1977, i.e., from the beginning of anthesis to full or almost full maturity, and 6 collections were made, instead of 3, as in the preceding year. In 1978, besides examining flowers in toto, during the anthesis, the different parts of flowers (stamens, styles, caliptrae, etc.) were taken into consideration; and, afterwards, more precisely than in 1977, the infections appearing on various areas of the berry were kept apart from those appearing at the stylar end or at the base of the berries around the pedicel. According to the observations carried out in 1977 and in 1978, the stylar end of the berries of the cultivars examined seems to show very few infections of B. cinerea in the environmental conditions of the vineyards sampled, in the period from the end of June (fruit set) to approximately the middle of August, when autumn rains begin. Other organs and tissues (aborted flowers or their parts remained trapped in the maturing bunch, basal ends of the berries around the pedicel, and also necrotic or decayed tissues in general) seem to play an important role in the oversummering, and indirectly in the following diffusion of the fungus. Finally, differences in morphology and internal structure of styles in different cultivars are briefly discussed, and the opinion is expressed that they could concur to explain diverging results on the oversummering (estivation) of Botrytis cinrea in grapevine berries of different varieties, and in different regions.
42685973|In this report we show the results of the antagonism in vitro of 41 strains of Trichoderma isolated from the soil against 5 strains of Rhizoctonia solani. 43872343|A pot experiment was conducted to determine the effects of three inoculum levels (2,500, 5,000 and 10,000 eggs/plant) on the reproduction of Meloidogyne hispnica and M. javanica isolates and growth of the tomato genotypes Easypeel and Moneymaker, and genotypes Motelle and VFNT-Cherr, which possess the Mf-gene, at 25  2C. Shoot and root lengths and fresh and dry root and shoot weights were also recorded. Both species of Meloidogyne reproduced at all inoculum levels on all four tomato genotypes (4GI5 and 3.44Rf317.30). The M. javanica isolate, obtained from an infected potato field, was identified as natural and partially virulent to the Mi-gene (3.71RI20.19). This emphasizes the need for new sources of resistance to root-knot nematodes and for testing Mf-tomato plants for their susceptibility to local populations. Reproduction of M. javanica and M. hispnica on the resistant Motelle and VFNT-Cherr was significantly less than on the susceptible Easypeel and Moneymaker. VFNT-Cherr was more resistant than Motelle, which suggest an influence of the genetic background of the plants on the nematode response. For Easypeel and Moneymaker, there was a trend of decreased plant growth parameters with increasing inoculum level, irrespective of the nematode species, due to damage caused by the increasing number of nematodes that invaded plant roots. However, these values on Motelle and VFNT-Cherr remained relatively stable regarding shoot and total shoot plus root dry weight. The reproductive rate of M. javanica was greater than that of M. hispnica on all four genotypes tested, and tomato plants inoculated with M. hispnica had greater growth parameters. The resistance response of the Mi-tomato plants was independent of the Meloidogyne species, however, because both species gave similar RIs.
42685894|A survey of greenhouse diseases of tomatoes in the Lebanese Coastal area was conducted during winterearly spring, 1992. It revealed that Botrytis cinerea Pers. was the major fungal pathogen causing heavy losses in spite of frequent fungicidal sprays. Twelve isolates were collected from different locations and their mycelial growth was tested in vitro on PDA amended with various concentrations of benomyl, iprodione, triflumizole, dichlofluanid, and dithianon. Most isolates (10 out of 12) were found to be resistant to benomyl with a minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) exceeding 100 g/ml. Three isolates were considered resistant to iprodione with a MIC over 5 g/ml. These same isolates were also resistant to 100 g/ml iprodione and were not completely inhibited at 1000 g/ml. Triflumizole was effective on all isolates; the MIC was  10 g/ml for four isolates and 100 g/ml for practically all the remaining isolates. The effects of dichlofluanid and dithianon on mycelial growth of the pathogen were less pronounced than those of other fungicides. The MIC of dithianon for all isolates was over 100 g/ml, while for dichlofluanid, seven isolates had a MIC higher than 100 g/ml. In view of the above results, the importance of integrated disease management programmes is emphasized.
42684108|Factors conducive to epidemics of the Onion downy mildew [Peronospora destructor (Berk.) Casp.] in Israel have been investigated in field tests. All factors influencing humidity conditions have been found to be of importance: density of the stand, direction of the rows, and age of the plant. Sprinkler irrigation favoured the disease more than furrow or trickle irrigation. The number and timing of sprinklings applied in spring to crops sown in autumn or winter greatly influences extent of mildew development and yield. Ten years' records of weather conditions have been analysed in relation to the dates of Onion mildew outbreaks, in an attempt to determine conditions favoring multiplication of autumn inoculum to the stage when it will infect crops that have reached the requisite age and density. On crops sown in September-October the mildew can be expected to appear in late December or early January in years with (a) mean minimum November temperatures not exceeding 12 C, and (b) at least 7 rainy days in October-November. In fields sown in November the mildew will not usually appears before February. Low temperatures in December-January (minima of 3-4 C in the screen) delay development of the disease in winter. Sono stati studiati con osservazioni di campo i fattori che favoriscono le pidmie della peronospora della Cipolla [Peronospora destructor (Berk.) 42684374|For the last 20 years, a serious disease of apricot tree (Prunus armeniaca L.) has been observed in East Turkey (Malatya-Grn region). It causes cankers, die-back of branches and in severe cases tree "apoplexy". From 1969 to 1975, isolations were made from diseased twigs, resulting in cultures of patho genie bacteria. Physiological and biochemical tests gave typical reactions for Pseudomonas syringae van Hall. When apricot leaves in an orchard were inoculated with these bacteria typical spots on the leaves appeared from which the bacteria could be reisolated. The original cultures as well as the reisolates caused typical cankers on apricot trees after artificial inoculation in autumn. It is discussed that the relatively low winter temperatures in this region of Turkey contribute to development of the disease. 42685707|The biological characterization of the virus isolates, obtained from pepper seeds of commercial cvs. sold as TMV-resistant (L L genotype), showed that most of them belonged to P pathotype of PepMV. La caratterizzazione biologica degli isolati virali, ottenuti da semi di peperone di cvs. commerciali vendute come resistenti al TMV (genotipo LL), ha messo in evidenza che molti di essi appartenevano al patotipo P del PepMV. Vengono poi discusse le conseguenze epidemiologiche di tali caratteristiche.
42685423|Thirty seven bacterial isolates from faba bean (Vicia faba L.) root-nodules were screened for their antagonistic activity against eight Rhizoctonia solani strains isolated from infected potato (Solanum tuberosum L.) tubers. Two bacterial strains (designated as Kl.Fb14 and S8.Fb11) gave 50% in vitro inhibition of R. solani mycelial growth. 16S rDNA sequence analysis indicated that strain Kl.Fb14 exhibited 99.5% identity with Pseudomonas moraviensis, and that S8.Fb11 exhibited 99.8% identity with Pseudomonas reinekei. Greenhouse trials in soil showed that strain S8.Fb11 reduced the percentage of sclerotia on potato tubers and amounts of tuber infection for the potato cultivars Spunta and Nicola. In a field trial conducted in South Tunisia, infection with R. solani reduced potato yield by approximately 40% for 'Spunta' and 17% for 'Nicola'; about 20% of the total tuber production was severely infected. However, when potato tubers were treated with strain S8.Fb11 prior to sowing, disease incidence was reduced to 6% of total production with low infection levels; potato yield was enhanced by about 6 kg per 10 m row in comparison to R. solani infected plants. The second selected Pseudomonas sp. (strain Kl.Fb14) did not affect either the levels of sclerotia on tubers or potato yield.
42685882|In Italia, la ruggine bruna (Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici) e l'oidio (Erysiphe graminis f. sp. tritici) sono le principali malattie fogliari del Frumento. Indagini sono state annualmente condotte in molte aree cerealicole italiane dal 1974 al 1992, per saggiare il comportamento rispetto a tali malattie di molte variet di frumento duro. Nei confronti della ruggine bruna la cultivar Creso, estesamente coltivata in Italia da oltre 15 anni, ha mantenuto una resistenza stabile nonostante l'incremento di virulenza rilevato entro la popolazione del patogeno. Le cultivar appartenenti al gruppo dei "Val" (Valgerardo, Valnova, Valforte, etc.) e tutte quelle da esse derivate, sono risultate resistenti o moderatamente resistenti all'oidio, sin dalla loro costituzione, sia allo stadio di plantula che di pianta adulta. Leaf rust (Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici) and powdery mildew (Erysiphe graminis f. sp. tritici) are the most important wheat diseases in Italy. The behaviour of many durum wheat cultivars was tested yearly in the Italian cereal growing areas, from 1974 to 1992. Among the cultivars examined, 'Creso', the prevailing commercial wheat cultivar over a long period, still expresses high resistance to leaf rust, despite the increasing virulence shown by the pathogen. Concerning powdery mildew, the cultivars of the "Val" group (Valgerardo, Valnova, Valforte, etc.) and the cultivars derived from them, still maintain a long-term resistance to the pathogen.
43872347|Phytoplasmas are microorganisms associated with severe plant diseases affecting diverse agrarian activits worldwide. Since their discovery, conclusive proof of their pathogenicity is lacking due to failure to culture these organisms. This has also hindered studies on their biology, biochemistry and physiology, although significant taxonomie progress has been achieved from study of the 16S ribosomal gene and full genomic sequencing of four phytoplasma strains. The inability to fulfil Koch's postulates severely restricts the understanding of the roles of these organisms in plant diseases and in plant/insect/phytoplasma interactions. Here we show that specific commercial media support axenic growth of phytoplasmas under defined conditions; the identity of the organisms was confirmed by PCR/RFLP analyses and sequencing of phytoplasma-specific genes. We have demonstrated for the first time that phytoplasmas, similarly to mycoplasmas, can grow independently from their host(s). This should assist reduction of the socio-economic impact of phytoplasma diseases worldwide through improved pathogen detection and consequently better management of the diseases they cause. Knowledge of mechanisms underlying the autonomous life of phytoplasmas, that are among the smallest living organisms, should also provide important information about basic mechanisms of life.
42685655|Specific immunostaining was observed in almost all sections of infected roots that were examined. In taproot tissues specific labeling was only present in xylem tissue. Among different tested insects it was found, exept Brachycauds helichrysi Kalt and Phorodon humuli Schrank, that some species of leafhoppers, as Empoasca flavescens F., can transmit the virus. 43872372|The temporal efficacy of three different chemical fungicides (Folicur, Proline, Sportak 45EW) and a biocontrol bacterium (Serenade, B. subtilis) in reducing growth and toxin production by isolates of F. verticillioides and A. flavus was studied in vitro under different water activity regimes (0.99, 0.98 and 0.95). All the fungicides significantly inhibited mycelial growth compared with the control; the most effective treatment, both against F. verticillioides and A. flavus, was Sportak 45EW (approx. 99%). The inhibitory effect of all fungicides generally improved with increasing concentration. Serenade always decreased fungal growth, with optimal results at concentrations of 10 and 10 (70-75% reduction). All the fungicide treatments resulted in a significant reduction in both FB+FB and AFBx production when compared to the control, at the end of the incubation period and with the 2 concentrations used (approx. 99%). A threshold concentration inoculum of at least 10 CFUs of B. subtilis per g was required to achieve a significant control of mycotoxin production. Sportak 45EW and Serenade gave the best control of mycotoxin production with a reduction of 95% compared to the controls. Use of Serenade in the field should include due consideration to its sensitivity to low water activities, when compared to the target pathogens.

It seems that the fungus first attacked petals and stamens still existing on the small fruit, and that it spread from them, by contact, to the sepals and lastly to the pulp of the fruit itself. 42684615|Nous avons test l'activit antimicrobienne d'aldimines furanniques ou thiophniques (non nitres ou nitres en position 5) sur des champignons et bactries phytopathognes. L'activit antifongique sur Botrytis cinrea, Helminthosponum teres, Helminthosporium turcicwn, Phytophthora cactorum et Pyricularia oryzae, est faible ou nulle, les composs furanniques se montrant suprieurs  leurs homologues thiophniques. Test in vitro, le pouvoir bactriostatique des composs nitrothiophniques, suprieur  celui de leurs homologues furanniques, s'est montr satisfaisant sur Erwinia carotovora, Pseudomonas syringae, Agrobactenum tumefaciens, Corynebacterium michiganense, Xanthomonas phaseoli et Xanthomonas pruni, et remarquable sur Erwinia amylovora. Cette dernire activit in vitro sur E. amylovora n'a pas t confirme in vivo. The antimicrobial activity of 5-nitro-furan or -thiophene aldimines has been tested on phytopathogenic fungi and bacteria. The antifungal activity against Botrytis cinrea, Helminthosponum teres, H. turcicum. Phytophthora cactorum and Pyricularia oryzae is weak or zero, the furan derivatives being more efficient than their triophene homologues.The 5-nitro substituent enhances or reduces the antifungal activity depending on the pathogen considered. The in vitro bacteriostatic activity of 5-nitro-thiophene derivatives is higher than that of their furan homologues; it is satisfactory against Erwinia carotovora, Pseudomonas syringae, Agrobacterium tumefaciens, Corynebacterium michiganense, Xanthomonas phaseoli, X. pruni, and outstanding against Erwinia amylovora. The activity reported in vitro against E. amylovora could not be observed in vivo.

Dall'analisi dei suddetti parametri  scaturita una serie di dati: percentuale di germinazione, 80%; lunghezza compresa fra 200 e 400 m nel 58% dei tubetti germinativi; presenza di ramificazioni nel 68% e un andamento rettilineo nel 71% dei tubetti germinativi.

42685380|Aggressiveness of 14 Phoma medicaginis isolates obtained from Medicago truncatula (barrel medic) and M. ciliaris (ciliate medic) growing in Tunisia was measured after inoculation on leaves and roots of M. truncatula. The ability of one isolate to cause disease on M. sativa (alfalfa), Cicer arietinum (chickpea), Pisum sativum (pea), Lens culinaris (lentil) and Phaseolus vulgaris (common bean) was also tested. The pathogen caused dark lesions that enlarged and coalesced causing yellowing and premature abscission of leaves, resulting in decreased shoot fresh weight in barrel medic plants. All P. medicaginis isolates infected barrel medic roots causing collar rot, brown root discoloration, yellowing of cotyledons and reduced shoot and root development. The pathogen colonized the cortex and the stele of plants and produced fertile pycnidia on infected roots. Symptoms on leaves allowed for greater discrimination in aggressiveness among isolates in comparison to symptoms on roots. No correlations were observed between the parameters measured on leaves and roots suggesting organ specialization in this pathogen. Phoma medicaginis infected leaves of alfalfa, pea, common bean and chickpea causing necrosis and tissue yellowing at 15 d post inoculation (dpi). Pycnidium production was observed on dead and dying foliar tissues of alfalfa, pea and common bean, but not on chickpea. The pathogen caused symptoms of collar rot and brown root discoloration on alfalfa, chickpea, pea and common bean, but did not cause symptoms on leaves or roots of lentil at 15 dpi. Phoma medicaginis was more pathogenic on barrel medic, the host of origin, in comparison to the other legumes, suggesting that these species are likely to be secondary hosts for this pathogen.

42685408|Black foot of grapevine is an important disease caused primarily by Ilyonectria spp. and "Cylindrocarpon" pauciseptatum. These pathogens affect grapevine nurseries and young vineyards, causing the decline and death of plants. In the nursery, the primary infections of the grafted cuttings are mainly attributed to soil-borne inoculum, which could infect the roots and the basal end of rootstocks during the rooting stage. The aim of this research was to detect other possible sources of inoculum throughout the different nursery stages by classical and molecular techniques (nested-PCR and multiplex nested-PCR). Results revealed the presence of the I. liriodendri and/or I. macrodidyma complex in grapevine rootstock and scion cuttings, cutting tools, water from hydration tanks, well water, callusing medium, one indoor air sample and soils collected from mother fields and nurseries. "Cylindrocarpon" pauciseptatum was only detected in the callusing medium, nursery soils, rooted-graftlings and on the root pruning machine. Forty four isolates obtained from soils (mother fields and nurseries) and rooted graftlings (six grapevine cultivar/rootstock combinations) were sequenced for part of histone H3 gene to resolve the species. While I. liriodendri, I. macrodidyma and I. torresensis were identified from soil samples, from rooted graftlings it was also possible to detect I. liriodendri, I. macrodidyma, I. novozelandica, I. torresensis, Ilyonectria sp. 2, "C." pauciseptatum and four Ilyonectria isolates which are close to I. cyclaminicola. The results demonstrated that, in addition to nursery soils, mother field soils, rootstock and scion cuttings, water from wells and hydration tanks, callusing media, cutting tools and indoor air should be considered as potential sources of inoculum for black foot pathogens.
42684287|In the Granada district of Southern Spain vesiculararbuscular (VA) mycorrhizal infection was very abundant in Maize, Beans, Grapevine and Olive. About 40% of the length of feeder root in these four corps and 15% of the length of feeder roots in Tomato was infected. The amounts of infection varied greatly from site to site and even within sites. There was much arbuscular development in Maize and Bean roots but little in Grapevine roots. Interna hyphae and vesicles were more numerous in Grapevine roots and hyphal coils were most distinct in roots of Olive and Grapevine. Endogone spores resembling the yellow vacuolate and white reticulate types were mainly associated with Maize and to a lesser extent with Bean and Tomato. Small Endogone spores were most abundant around Grapevine roots. The soils from the 25 sites examined ranged from pH 7.2 to pH 8.1. Those from the five Olive sites and two of the Grapevine sites were very infertile, whereas those from two of the Grapevine sites contained much plant-available phosphate. The soils growing Maize, Beans and Tomato varied within an intermediate fertility range. Much VA infection in the roots from a particular location was not usually correlated with either high or low levels of nitrogen and phosphate in the soil there. Thus although VA mycorrhiza is generally reported to be must abundant in infertile soils, our results indicate that extensive mycorrhizal infection can occur in crops of the Granada region in soils of both high and low fertility. The significance of these findings is discussed in relation to the beneficial effects of Endogone infection on plant growth. A nonparasitic disease of Watermelon is described for southern Italy under the name of  blossom-end rot . In Apulia and Lucania the disease is very common and causes severe crop losses. Tipically it is characterized by a definite, necrotic, flattened or sunken, leathery, dark, brown to black discolored area at the distal end of the fruit. A third of the edible portion of the apical end of diseased fruits is severely damaged; and the fruits are non marketable. The rotten area is attacked frequently by secondary microorganisms that induce extensive soft rot of the fruits. Less frequently the disease develops in the form of an internal browning and necrosis of the distal end of fruits, that do not reveal external blossom-end rot. Light microscopic studies on the structural changes undergone by the tissues affected by  blossom-end rot  were carried out. The thickness of chlorophyllous parenchyma of the mesocarp appears severely reduced, with necrotic and brown-colored cells. The sclerenchymatic fibers, which in healthy fruit lay in a circle in discrete bundles, are brought close together as a consequence of the shrinkage of necrotic tissues, to form a continuous layer of brachysclereids. In the nonchlorophyllous parenchyma of the mesocarp the vessels are frequently plugged by gummy substances and the fundamental tissue exhibits extensive collapse and browning that are more intense toward the sclerenchymatic layer. Par le terme  pourriture apicale  on dcrit une maladie non parasitaire de la Pastque. L'altration est trs rpandue dans le Midi de l'Italie en Pouille et en Lucanie et produit des dgts trs srieux. L'affection est caractrise,  l'extrmit apicale du fruit, par une zone ncrotique de couleur brun-noirtre, dure, aplatie ou dprime. L'accroissement des fruits est rduit ou empch. 42683792|Red blotch disease of Amaryllis and leaf scorch disease of trumpet Daffodil, are described as new disease in Egypt (U.A.R.). Morphological characteristics of the pathogenic fungi isolated from the two hosts, their cultural features and the pathogenicity tests, proved them to be one species, namely Stagonospora curtisii (Berk.) Sacc. Cross inoculation tests showed that there was no physiological specialization within S. curtisii, and that the isolate obtained from one host can infect the other. The pathogen persists from one growing season to the next inside the contaminated apparently healthy bulbs of both Amaryllis and trumpet Daffodil and thus causes the initial spring infection of the emerging leaves of the newly planted stocks. Vengono descritti per la prima volta in Egitto (R.A.U.) i brusoni dell'Amarillide e del Narciso. Gli agenti patogeni isolati dai due ospiti, perle loro caratteristiche morfologiche, colturali e di patogenicit sembrano poter essere riferiti entrambi a Stagonospora curtisii (Berk.) Sacc. Prove di inoculazione incrociata hanno dimostrato l'assenza di specializzazione fisiologica in S. curtisii e che gli isolati ottenuti da un ospite possono infettare l'altro. Il patogeno si perpetua da una stagione all'altra nei bulbi infetti, ma apparentemente sani di Amarillide e di Narciso, producendo le infezioni primaverili primarie sulle foglie emergenti delle nuove piante. On a dcrit pour la premire fois en Egyote les ncroses foliaires de l'Amaryllis et du Narcisse. Les agents pathognes isols de deux htes par leur caractristiques morphologiques, culturales et de pathognicit semblent pouvoir tre rapports tous les deux  Stagonospora curtisii (Berk.) Sacc. Des essais d'inoculation croise ont dmontr l'absence de spcialisation physiologique chez S. curtisii e que les souches obtenues  partir d'un hte peuvent infecter l'autre. L'agent pathogne se conserve d'une saison  l'autre dans les bulbes infects mais apparemment sains d'Amaryllis et de Narcisse en produisant les infections primaires de printemps sur les jeunes feuilles des nouvelles plantes.
42684478|Observations on the germination of urediniospores and on the development of germ tubes on poplar leaves have shown that both these processes are to a large extent determined by the varietal resistance of the host. It was found that poorer germination of spores and slower development of germ tubes on leaves of resistant poplars (P. maximowiczii and P. deltoides B-60) are dependent on a factor of chemical nature. Histological studies on the course of penetration and early phases of the infection process have shown that the growth of the pathogen can be stopped. This inibition of pathogen is accompanied with necrotic reactions of guard and mesophyll cells. Le osservazioni sulla germinazione degli uredoconidi di Melapsora laricipopulina Kleb, e sullo sviluppo dei loro tubetti germinativi sulle foglie di pioppo indicano che tutti e due i processi sono influenzati in larga misura dalla resistenza varietale dell'ospite.  stato trovato che la pi bassa germinazione delle spore e lo sviluppo pi lento dei tubetti germiantivi che si verificano sulle foglie di pioppo resistenti (Populus maximowiczii e O, deltoides B-60) dipendono da un fattore di natura chimica, oltre che da caratteristiche strutturali delle foglie dell'ospite. La penetrazione avviene attraverso gli stomi ed il suo svolgersi  in relazione con la loro struttura anatmica. Gli studi di istologia sul processo di penetrazione e sulle prime fasi dell'infezione hanno mstrato che lo sviluppo del patgeno pu essere inibito dalle reazioni di difesa delle cellule ospiti. Inoltre la compattezza del mesofillo fogliare influenza la resistenza o la suscettibilit dei pioppi, mentre la struttura dei fasci vascolari e le dimension! delle aree da essi comprese determinano la estensione delle colonie dlia ruggine.
42685814|In Sardegna, da piante di Ravanello e di Ravanello selvatico con sintomi di mosaico giallo  stato isolato un virus con particelle isodiametriche. Questa  la prima segnalazione di un'infezione naturale del Ravanello da TYMV. An isometric virus was isolated in Sardinia (Italy) from Radish (Raphanus sativus L.) and wild Radish (R. raphanistrum L.) plants showing a yellow mosaic. It was identified as Turnip yellow mosaic virus (TYMV) on the basis of symptomatological responses of some indicators, electron microscopy and serological tests. This is the first report of a virus disease of Radish by TYMV.

42685659|Several PepMV strains as well as a strain isolated from Tomato, called TMV-P, were morphologically studied, after repeated multiplications on Pepper. The NLs of most PepMV strains were significantly shorter than 300 nm and in many cases their distribution curves were asymmetric with higher percentage of shorter particles. Some of these strains were also studied during their adaptation to Capsicum host. All PepMV strains showed an accentuated trend towards shortening, starting from NLs of around 330 nm to NLs of about 286 nm. In some cases, the shortening was marked by the skewness coefficient <0. In others, the distribution curves were plurimodal, with secondary peaks formed by shorter particles, frequency of which increased in the subsequent measurements, the NL becoming shorter and shorter. The autors suppose that this phenomenon could be correlated to the adaptation of the virus to Pepper, even if more detailed research into its structure should be carried out in order to establish the nature of this process. Molti ceppi di PepMV e un ceppo isolato da Pomodoro, siglato TMV-P, sono stati studiati sotto l'aspetto morfologico, dopo essere stati ripetutamente moltiplicati su Peperone. Le lunghezze normali (NL) della maggior parte dei ceppi di PepMV erano significativamente pi corte di 300 nm ed in molti casi le loro curve di distribuzione erano asimmetriche, con una maggior percentuale di particelle pi corte. Alcuni di questi ceppi sono stati anche studiati nel corso del loro adattamento all'ospite Capsicum. Tutti i ceppi di PepMV mostravano un'accentuata tendenza al-Faccorciamento, pariendo da lunghezze normali di circa 330 nm a lunghezze normali di circa 286 nm. In alcuni casi, l'accorciamento era indicato dal coefficiente di asimmetria <0. In altri le curve di distribuzione delle particelle erano plurimodali, con picchi secondari formati da particelle pi corte, la cui frequenza aumentava nelle successive misurazioni mentre le rispettive NL di venta vano sempre pi corte. Supponiamo che tale fenmeno possa essere correlato all'adattamento del virus al Peperone, anche se sarebbero necessarie ricerche pi dettagliate sulla struttura delle particelle per stabilire la natura di questo processo.

42685332|Yellow rust (Puccinia striiformis f.sp. tritici) of wheat is the most important rust disease in the cooler and humid wheat-growing areas. In Syria the disease has occurred in each of the last 10 seasons, 1987/88-1996/97 especially in irrigated fields and particularly wet seasons. This study reports the severity of infection and reaction type of wheat yellow rust differentials under field conditions during nine seasons (1987/88-1995/96) and the prevailing pathotypes of the wheat yellow rust pathogen and their virulences under controlled conditions during three seasons (1993/94-1995/96) at Tel Hadya, south-west of Aleppo, Syria. The field data over the seasons 1987/88 to 1992/93 showed that the natural population of yellow rust pathogen could overcome the following Yr genes : 6, 7, 10, SU, 8, 2, 18 and A . In 1993/94, new virulences on Yr9 in the line Fed. 4/Kavkaz and Yr9 in cv. Clement were detected; as well as virulence for YrSD in cv. Strubes Dickkopf, Yr6 in cv. Heines Peko and Yr2 in cv. Heines VII were observed. Results of pathotype identification and virulence analysis on seedlings under controlled conditions showed the presence of 10 yellow rust pathotypes 6E0, 6E134, 6E148, 6E150, 20E148, 38E150, 82E16, 38E134, 134E146, and 166E150 representing virulences for the following Yr genes (6, 7, 6 , 7 , 8, 10, 2, 9, 2, SD, 9 , SU and A) in Syria.
42684921|An investigation on the local sources of Potato virus Y (PVY) was carried out in Tobacco and Pepper-growing areas of Umbria, Central Italy. Tobacco stalks were frequently found standing in the fields during the winter and early spring but few of them produced basal suckers seldom infected by PVY. Furthermore, in the surveyed area stalks and suckers are usually destroyed and buried before planting of summer host crops (e.g. Tobacco and Peppers) and, according to present observations, the root fragments of buried stalks rarely produce suckers. It therefore seems unlikely that tobacco stalks are important sources of PVY for summer crops in the area under investigation. Tests for PVY in Potato cultivations indicated that the virus is widespread in this host species at the time when other susceptible solanaceae are transplanted (mid-May or end May). Uncertified home saved seed potatoes are frequently planted together with certified tubers in Central Italy. High PVY incidences were detected by ELISA in samples of locally grown potato tubers reserved for seeding. These results suggest that, in Umbria, the spread of PVY in potatoes mainly originates from seed-borne infections and that the infected potato plants in turn act as a primary source of the virus for neighbouring crops, especially Tobacco. Da un indagine sulle fonti d'inoculo del virus Y della Patata (PVY) in Umbria  emerso che pur essendo spesso lasciati in piedi nei campi per tutto l'inverno e l'inizio di primavera, gli stocchi di tabacco possono difficilmente fungere da riserve del virus poich a) in primavera una bassa percentuale di stocchi produce ricacci basali, i quali sono raramente infetti dal virus, b) stocchi e ricacci vengono normalmente distrutti e interrati prima del trapianto di colture estive ospiti di PVY (es. Tabacco e Peperone), c) solo eccezionalmente i frammenti degli stocchi interrati producono ricacci. Nelle coltivazioni di Patata della regione si sono invece registrate incidenze elevate di PVY proprio al momento del trapianto delle altre solanacee (met o fine maggio); gli agricoltori delle zone in esame usano spesso, come semente di patata, tuberi non certificati prodotti in proprio, che al saggio immunoenzimatico (ELISA) sono risultati frequentemente infetti da PVY. Nel loro complesso questi risultati indicano che in Umbria la diffusione del virus nelle coltivazioni di Patata origina prevalentemente dall'uso di tuberi da seme infetti e che le piante di patata rappresentano a loro volta una sorgente primaria di PVY per le altre colture, specialmente Tabacco.
42684480|The author relates about outbreaks of european blister rust (Cronartium flaccidum) of two needle pine on pine plantations in different parts of Italy in the period 1948-1972. Distributions of the two types of hosts of heteroecious parasite: Vincetoxicum officinale for dicaryotic stage, and Pinus sylvestris, Pinus nigricans, Pinus laricio, Pinus pinaster, Pinus halpensis for the haploid stage of the rust are reported. In Tuscany aecia stage appear on pine during springtime from March to June according to the elevation above the sea. The aeciospore show maximum of germinability in the beginning of aecia opening. Uredo stage occurs on Vincetoxicum from May to the fall. Telia stage production outbreak occurs in July and in September. Telia are able to germinate 2-3 days after their beginning. Pine infection occurs on the primary and secondary needle. First symptoms of infection are yellow spots. The rust cycle is complete during one, two or three growing season, according to the plant age. The collected data on the natural incidence of the blister rust and those of the first trials of inoculations showed: P. pinea was the most susceptible; P. pinaster was less susceptible with a some variability in rust incidence between individual discendence. Between mountain species, P. laricio was the most susceptible, P. sylvestris was almost not intected, P. nigricans had a intermediate behaviour. L'Autore riferisce sullo sviluppo di pidmie di ruggine vescicolosa (Cronartium flaccidum) sulle piantagioni di pini in differenti parti d'Italia nel periodo 1948-1972. Vengono illustrati: 1) la distribuzione e il comportamento vegetativo dei due tipi di ospiti: Vincetoxicum officinale, su cui si sviluppano le fasi uredo e teleutoconidica e Pinus sylvestris, P. nigricans, P. laricio, P. pinaster, P. pinea e P. halepensis, su cui si sviluppano le fasi spermagonica ed ecidica del parassita; 2) il ciclo biolgico dlia ruggine: gli ecidioconidi compaiono sul pino durante la primavera da Marzo a Giugno in relazione alla altitudine sul livello del mare. Gli ecidioconidi mostrano la massima germinabilit quando gli ecidiosori si aprono. La fase uredo  presente sulle foglie di Vincetossico da Maggio-Giugno fino all'autunno. La fase teleutoconidica compare ivi in forma intensa durante i mesi di Luglio e Settembre. I teleutoconidi sono capaci di germinare producendo basidi e basidiospore, 2-3 giorni dopo l'inizio dlia loro formazione. L'infezione sul pino avviene sugli aghi primari e secondari. I primi sintomi dell'infezione consistono in piccole macchie gialle sugli aghi che compaiono da 1 a 4 mesi dopo Pinoculazione. Il ciclo della ruggine si completa in una, due o tre stagioni vegetative a seconda dell'et delle piante.

42684680|Sixty-eight Fusarium strains, belonging to 15 different species, were isolated from cereals in Poland and tested for their ability to produce mycotoxins. Deoxynivalenol was produced by 13 isolates of F. culmorum and 2 isolates of F. graminearum. 3-Acetyldeoxynivalenol was produced by 13 isolates of F. culmorum. 42685226|Activity and isozyme pattern of peroxidase (donor: H O oxidoreductase EC 1.11.1.7) were determined in tobacco plants immunized by tobacco mosaic virus against Erysiphe cichoracearum infection. Inoculation of tobacco leaves with tobacco mosaic virus caused a systemic increase in peroxidase activity which was further enhanced after challenge inoculation with E. cichoracearum. Isoelectrofocusing analysis revealed that these increases were mainly due to the highly anionic (P35 and P37) and cationic (P88 and P93) isoperoxidase. E. cichoracearum infection alone provoked mainly a marked enhancement in the moderately anionic (P43, P44, P46 and P51) isoperoxidases. It is suggested that lignification, mediated by anionic isoperoxidases, may contribute to the induced resistance of tobacco to E. cichoracearum.

This virus could be identified as a strain of the Tomato black ring virus, on the basis of its physical and chemical characteristics, its serological behaviour and the reactions caused in the inoculated plants. Le alterazioni fogliari pi gravi furono osservate su E. botryoides Sm., E. camaldulensis Dehn., E. globulus Labill. e E. trabutii Vilm., specie che sono tra le pi diffuse nel nostro Paese. An infection by Cercospora eucalypti has been detected on the leaves, petioles and twigs of Eucalypt. The disease is characterized by red-brown spots, 2-3 mm long and 1-2 mm wide. The most serious effects on the leaves were observed on E. botryoides Sm., E. camaldulensis Dehn., E. globulus Labill., and E. trabutii Vilh., which are widespread in Italy. This disease does not appear to affect young plants in the nursery; in fact no signs have ever been found on hundreds of 4-5 months old seedlings of these species. A mild parasitic action by the fungus and its presence only on subjects weakened by nonparasitic causes were established from observations in nature and trials of artificial infection. Les observations effectues sur des plants infectes tant naturellement qu'artificiellement ont permis d'tablir l'action de faible parasitisme de ce champignon ainsi que sa prsence sur des arbres affaiblis par des causes de nature non-parasitaire.
42685548|Sono stati saggiati 18 isolati di Fusarium moniliforme da cereali in Italia, per la produzione di pigmenti rossi su cariossidi di mais. Di essi: due isolati hanno prodotto 8-0-metilfusarubina, 8-0-metilsolaniolo, 8-0-metilbostricoidina, 3-8-0-0-dimetilfusarubina e 8-0-metiljavanicina; un isolato ha prodotto i primi quattro di questi pigmenti; 10 isolati hanno prodotto solo 8-0-metilbostricoidina; mentre 5 isolati non hanno prodotto alcun pigmento. Saggiati per la loro attivit antibatterica, questi pigmenti hanno inibito l'accrescimento solo delle specie Grampositive. La resistenza presentata dalle specie Gram-negative potrebbe essere dovuta all'impermeabilit della parete cellulare ai pigmenti stessi. Eighteen isolates of Fusarium moniliforme, mostly from cereals in Italy, were assayed for the production of red pigments on maize kernels. Two isolates produced 8-0-methylfusarubin, 8-0-methylsolaniol, 8-0-methylbostrycoidin, 3-8-0-0-dimethylfusarubin and 8-0-methyljavanicin. Of the other sixtheen: one isolate produced the first four of these pigments, ten isolates produced only 8-0-methylbostrycoidin, whereas no pigments were produced by five isolates. Assayed for their antibacterial activity, these pigments were bactericidal only to Gram-positive species. The resistance of Gram-negative species might be in relation to a specific lower permeability of the cell wall.

Il deossinivalenolo, il 3-acetil-deossinivalenolo, il nivalenolo e il fusarenone sono risultati invece inattivi. Six trichothecenes were tested on the cellular permeability of Tomato leaf discs. The electrolyte leakage induced by T-2 toxin increased with concentration and with the toxin exposure time. Also, diacetoxyscirpenol induced an electrolyte loss, but leakage rates were lower in comparison to T-2 toxin. Deoxynivalenol, 3-acetyldeoxynivalenol, nivalenol and fusarenone were inactive at the tested concentrations. These findings support the hypothesis that trichothecenes produced by Fusarium in infected plants, could play a role of toxic agents in the disease. They presumibly affect cell membrane permeability.

42685316|Four fungicides, benomyl, thiram, prochloraz and tebuconazole, were evaluated for their effectiveness against Aspergillus niger Van Tiegham and Fusarium oxysporum Schlecht on seed in vitro and in vivo conditions. In the in vitro trials fungicides were previous tested for their influence on onion seed germination, their effects on colony growth of both pathogens and on seed contaminations. In in vivo experiments where pathogenic isolates of A. niger and F. oxysporum were seed- and soil-infested, fungicides were examined for their effects on seedling emergence, the pre- and post-emergence damping-off. Thiram (1.35 g ai/kg and 4.05 g ai/kg), prochloraz (0.45 cc ai/kg) and benomyl+thiram mixture at all dosages stimulated the rate of germination of seed as compared with the control. The efficacy of the fungicides varied according to the infestation methods. When seeds were infested with A. niger, prochloraz (0.90 cc ai/kg) significantly reduced the percentage of post-emergence damping-off. It also reduced the percentage of contamination of A. niger on onion seeds in in vitro tests. In addition to its other effects, thiram (1.35 g ai/kg) however significantly reduced the percentage of pre-emergence damping-off when the soil was infested with the pathogen. Benomyl+thiram (1.50+0.45 g ai/kg seed) inhibited the growth of F. oxysporum colony and seed contamination by this pathogen. Such mixture of fungicides also increased the emergence of seedlings and reduced the percentage of post-emergence damping-off when seeds were infested with F. oxysporum. But prochloraz at the dosage of 1.35 ce ai/kg seed, was more effective in infested soil than the other treatments.
42685629|Five single ascospore isolates of Eutypa lata from Apricot were compared for virulence on five apricot cultivars ('Hartier-Colomer', 'Caninos', 'Bebecou', 'Citrina Asinis', 'Luiset'). Measurements of the extension of cankers at intervals of three months after inoculation showed significant differences in virulence between the isolates. Some of the cankers induced by the less virulent isolates were completely healed within nine months, whereas many cankers caused by the most virulent isolates were still active after twelve months. Furthermore, evidence was obtained for differences in the susceptibility between the cultivars. Similar cambial inoculations made on apricot branches with plugs of mycelia from nine single ascospore isolates ex Rosa sp. showed that some isolates were markedly more virulent than others. Inoculations made on Apricot trees cv. Bebecou with three isolates of E. lata from Apricot, Almond and Walnut in different seasons of the year, showed that extension of cankers in Spring was significantly larger. It is concluded that a rapid progress of the disease can be expected after the trees begin the new cycle of growth in March. Sono stati comparati per la virulenza su cinque cultivar di Albicocco ('Hartier-Colomer', 'Caninos', 'Bebecou', 'Citrina Asinis' e 'Luiset'), cinque isolati monoascosporici di E. lata da Albicocco. Le misurazioni dell'estensione dei cancri ad intervalli successivi di tre mesi dopo inoculazione, hanno rivelato differenze significative del grado di virulenza tra gli isolati. Alcuni dei cancri causati da isolati debolmente virulenti erano completamente cicatrizzati dopo nove mesi; mentre svariati cancri prodotti da isolati molto virulenti erano ancora in sviluppo dopo dodici mesi. Sono state, inoltre, registrate differenze di suscettibilit tra le cultivar di Albicocco. Differenze analoghe del grado di virulenza sono state rile vate tra nove isolati monoascosporici di E. lata da Rosa sp. Inoculazioni separate di tre isolati del fungo rispettivamente da Albicocco, Mandorlo e Noce, effettuate in epoche stagionali diverse, hanno mostrato una maggiore estensione del cancro in primavera. Si ritiene awenga una pi rapida ed estesa diffusione dell'infezione nel periodo che segue l'inizio della vegetazione primaverile della pianta.
42685769|The time course of Superoxide dismutases (SODs), peroxidase and catalase activities were determined in tobacco leaves (cv. Havana 425) during infection by common (PVYO) and veinal necrotic (PVYN) strains of Potato virus Y. An enhancement of activity of cyanide-sensitive Superoxide dismutase (cuprozinc-SOD), around 2-2,5 times the control value, was observed in PVYN infected leaves during veinal necrotic symptom expression and in PVYO-infected leaves during vein-clearing and green vein-banding symptom expression. Peroxidase activity, determined at the same time as SOD, was enhanced only in leaves infected with veinal necrotic strain, starting 2 days earlier as compared to SOD, and reached values up to 10 times higher than those of the control during necrotic symptom expression. No variation in catalase activity was observed in PVY-infected leaves. The visualization of enzymatic components of SOD and peroxidase, separated by polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis, confirmed the above-mentioned results. The following hypothetical conclusions were made: i) the increase in SOD activity in both PVYN and PVYO-infected leaves may indicate that enhanced metabolic process involving univalent oxygen reduction could take place during symptoms expression, ii) the activation of SOD by both PVY strains and the activation of peroxidase only by PVYN strain indicate that the two phenomena were independent, triggered by different kinds of host-virus interactions and that the virus determinant involved in peroxidase induction was only expressed by the veinal necrotic strain. Le variazioni di attivit delle superossido dismutasi della perossidasi e della catalasi sono state determinate in foglie di tabacco (cv. Havana 425) in seguito all'infezione del ceppo comune (PVYO) e del ceppo della necrosi nervale (PVYN) del virus Y della Patata. Sia l'infezione con PVYN (durante l'espressione dei sintomi necrotici) che quella con PVYO (durante la comparsa dello schiarimento e della bandatura verde delle nervature), inducevano un incremento di attivit della superossido dismutasi cianuro-sensibile (Cu, Zn-SOD) 2-2,5 volte i valori delle piante sane. Un'attivazione di perossidasi, anticipata di due giorni rispetto all'attivazione della SOD, si  verificata solo nelle foglie infette con PVYN, nelle quali i valori 10 volte pi elevati del controllo si sono osservati durante l'espressione dei sintomi necrotici nervali. La catalasi non subiva variazioni in seguito all'infezione con i due ceppi di PVY. La visualizzazione dei componenti enzimatici delle SOD e della perossidasi, separati per elettroforesi su gel di poliacrilamide, ha confermato i risultati quantitativi precedentemente accennati. I dati ottenuti hanno condotto aile seguenti ipotesi conclusive: i) Faumento dell'attivit Cu, Zn-SOD indotta da ambedue i ceppi di PVY  probabilmente correlato alio stimolo di processi metabolici in cui viene prodotto anione superossido o comunque in relazione con Faumento di quest'ultimo nei tessuti infetti; ii) essendo Fattivit SOD stimolata in maniera idntica dai due ceppi di PVY e la perossidasi solo dal ceppo necrotico, si  supposto che i due fenomeni possano essere indipendenti, owero il risultato di due tipi diversi di interazione ospite-virus, e che il determinante coinvolto nell'induzione di perossidasi venga espresso solo dal ceppo della necrosi nervale.
