43871746|The effect of leaf removal treatments around vine cluster zones on must quality were tested during 2003 and 2004 in Ras Baixas (Spain) in two Albario vineyards infected by GLRaV-3. As expected, the main virus damage was decreased sugar content (2.1 Brix in 2003 and 0.9 Brix in 2004) in the musts compared with leafroll-free plants. Leaf removal improved must quality by decreasing titratable acidity by between 0.5 and 1.9 g L of tartaric acid, depending on the experiment; it also increased the grape sugar content an average of 1 Brix. In vineyards with high incidence of GLRaV-3, partial defoliation at veraison, or 2 to 3 weeks later, had an improved must quality, counteracting the negative impact of the virus. This process is recommended to avoid penalties in wineries during years with poor ripening conditions.
42684718|A leaf disorder akin to vein banding disease occurs in Sardinia in all areas where cv. Cannonau is cultivated. It may reach, in some vineyards, an incidence higher than 25%. The symptoms, which sometimes are very severe, are erratically shown. Selfrooted and grafted (on virus-free rootstocks) vines propagated from plants that were symptomless in the place of origin, developed symptoms when grown in other localities, though in an inconsistent manner. The field symptomatology was reproduced, again erratically, on woody indicators ('Mission' and LN 33) during indexing for sanitary selection. 'Mission' was more sensitive than LN 33 although some negative responses were obtained using material from symptomatic vines. The inconsistency of symptom expression does not seem to depend on the different enviromental conditions under which the vines are grown. In twelve varieties other than 'Cannonau', the disease was present in latent form, as shown by response of woody indicators. No consistent association was found between vein banding-like symptoms and presence of Grapevine fanleaf virus in any of the varieties under study, including 'Cannonau'. This prompts us to speculate that the vein banding-like condition observed in Sardinia may result from the interaction of different factors, among which the one involved in the genesis of Australian yellow speckle, which is considered to be widespread in the world. Further studies are in progess but it appears that international cooperation would represent a most sensible approach for the etiological definition of this and similar diseases. Alterazioni fogliari simili alla scolorazione perinervale (vein banding) sono frequenti in Sardegna in tutte le aree dove  coltivata la cv. Cannonau. In alcuni vigneti le piante affette possono raggiungere un'incidenza del 25%. I sintomi, talvolta molto gravi, sono peraltro piuttosto incostanti. Viti autoradicate e ottenute per innesto su soggetti virus-esenti attraverso materiale di propagazione di piante senza sintomi nelle localit di origine, hanno mostrato sintomi in altre localit ancorch in maniera incostante. La sintomatologia di campo  stata riprodotta, anche in questo caso in maniera incostante, su indicatori legnosi ('Mission' e LN 33) durante il lavoro di selezione sanitaria. 'Mission'  risultata pi sensibile di LN 33, anche se risposte negative sono state ottenute usando materiale di piante mostranti sintomi. L'incostanza dell'espressione sintomatologica non sembra dipendere dalle differenti condizioni ambientali nelle quali le viti vegetano. In altre dodici cultivar la malattia  stata accertata in forma latente con le risposte degli indicatori legnosi. Non  stata trovata una costante associazione tra sintomi di scolorazione perinervale e presenza del virus del complesso dell'arricciamento in alcuna delle variet in studio, incluso 'Cannonau'. Ci consente di ipotizzare che l'alterazione simile al vein banding osservata in Sardegna, possa essere il risultato dell'interazione di differenti fattori, tra i quali quello implicato nella genesi dello yellow speckle australiano che  considerato diffuso in tutto il mondo. Sono in corso ulteriori studi, ma si ritiene che una collaborazione a livello internazionale sarebbe la migliore via da seguire per la definizione eziologica di questa malattia e di altre simili.
42683566|Spilocaea oleagina (Cast.) Hugh,  capace di degradare e utilizzare composti pectici, cellulosici e lipidici di natura varia e complessa. Nei liquidi di coltura del fungo allevato in presenza di pectina sono contenute tracce di metilesterasi pectica (PME) e apprezzabili quanti ta di esopolimetilgalatturonasi (eso-PMG), attiva solo su poligalatturonidi esterificati, con ottimo di azione a pH 7,5-8. Nei liquidi colturali del fungo allevato in presenza di zuccheri o di composti cellulosici, sono contenute cellulasi del tipo Cx, aventi attivit massima a pH 6,5 e 7,5. Su substrati lipidici, S. oleagina produce anche enzimi lipolitici esocellulari, aventi ottimo di azione tra pH 7 e pH 8, a seconda del substrato. Quando S. oleagina  stat a coltivata su una serie di substrati nutritivi contenenti quantit di saccarosio progressivamente crescenti (da 0 a 3 molali), il massimo accrescimento  statp ottenuto con soluzioni 0,15 molali (cipe con il 4,9 % in peso di saccarosio). L'umidit relativa di equilibrio corrispondente a questa concentrazione  del 99,65 %. Lo sviluppo del fungo  stato inibito da concentrazioni di saccarosio superiori a 0,25 m (7,9 % in peso). S. oleagina non sembra dunque essere un organismo osmofilo e avrebbe notevoli esigenze idriche. Sulla base di questi risultati viene discussa la localizzazione del micelio di S. oleagina in uno strato ben definito (strato cuticolare esterno) della parete cellulare esterna epidrmica dlie foglie di Olivo. Tale localizzazione  dovuta alla concomitanza di fattori negativi esistenti nella cuticola (assenza di polisaccaridi e di acqua) e nello strato cuticolare interno (acidit o altre condizioni sfavorevoli al fungo) e di fattori positivi (disponibilit di acqua e presenza di composti pectici, cellulosici e lipidici in forma utilizzabile dal fungo; condizioni di pH favorevoli, ecc.) esistenti nello strato cuticolare esterno, situato tra la cuticola e lo strato cuticolare interno. Spilocaea oleagina (Cast.) Hugh, was tested for its ability to degrade and to utilize pectic, cellulosic and lipidie materials having a different and complex nature. Traces of pectin methylesterase (PME) and valuable amounts of esopolymethylgalacturonase (eso-PMG) were produced by the fungus, when it was grown on media containing pectins. The produced eso-PMG was active only on esterified polygalacturonides, its optimum activity being at pH 7,5-8. Cx cellulases are produced by cultures on liquid media containing sugars or cellulose. These enzymes showed their highest activities at pH values of 6,5 and 7,5. Extracellular lipolytic enzymes were also produced by S. oleagina on lipidic media. The optima pH values for lipolytic activity were between 7 and 8, depending on the substratum. When S. oleagina was grown on a series of media containing different amounts of sucrose, with increasing concentration (from 0 to 3 molal sucrose), the best growth was attained at 0,15 m (i. e. with 4,9 % sucrose w/w. The  equilibrium relative humidity  corresponding to such a concentration is 99,65 %. Growth of the fungus was inhibited by solutions contaning more than 0,25 m sucrose (7,9 % w/w). Therefore S. oleagina does not seem to be an osmophilic organism and it would need water to a considerable extent. On the basis of these results, the exact location of the mycelium of S. oleagina within a definite layer (outer cuticular layer of the epidermical cell wall of Olive leaf is discussed. Such a localization is assumed to be caused by the concurrence of both negative conditions existing in the cuticle (lack of polysaccharides and water) and in the inner cuticular layer (acidity and o the unfavourable factors), and positive conditions (availability of water and presence of pectin, cellulose and lipids in usable forms, favourable pH conditions, etc.) in the outer cuticular layer, wich is placed between the cuticle and the inner cuticular layer. Spilocaea oleagina (Cast.) Hugh. peut dgrader et utiliser des composs pectiques, cellulosiques et lipidiques de nature diffrente et complexe. Dans les liquides de culture du champignon lev en prsence de pectine sont contenues des traces de mthylesterase pectique (PME) et des quantits apprciables de esopolymthylgalacturonase (eso-PMG), qui est active seulement sur des polygalacturonides esterifis, avec un optimum d'action  pH 7,5-8. Dans les liquides culturaux du champignon lev en prsence de sucres ou de cellulose, sont contenues des cellulases C x , ayant leur activit maxima  pH 6,5 et 7,5. Sur des substrats lipidiques, S. oleagina produit aussi des enzymes exocellulaire lipolitiques, contenant des quantits de saccharose progressivement croissantes (de 0  3 molales), le plus grand dveloppement a t obtenu avec des solutions 0,15 molales (c'est--dire avec le 4,9 % en poids de saccharose). L'  humidit relative d'quilibre  qui correspond  cette concentration est de 99,65 %. Le dveloppement du champignon a t inhib par des concentrations de saccharose au-dessus de 0,25 m (7,9 % en poids). S. oleagina ne semble pas ainsi tre un organisme osmophile et il aurait de remarquables exigences hydriques. Sur la base de ces rsultats est discute la localisation du myclium de S. oleagina dans une couche bien dfinie (couche cuticulaire externe) de la paroi cellulaire externe pidermique des feuilles d'Olivier. Une telle localisation serait due  la concomitance de facteurs ngatifs existant dans la cuticule (absence de polysaccharides et d'eau) et dans la couche cuticulaire interne (acidit ou autres conditions dfavorables au champignon) et de facteurs positifs (prsence d'eau et de substances pectiques, cellulosiques et lipidiques utilisables par le champignon; conditions favorables de pH, etc.) existant dans la couche cuticulaire externe, situe entre la cuticule et la couche cuticulaire interne.
42684678|Tolchlofos-methyl resistant strains of Rhizoctonia solani were easily obtained under laboratory conditions. These strains showed a strongly reduced virulence both on Bean and Basil, as compared with the sensitive strains. Moreover they grew less than the sensitive ones on all tested media. All Tolchlofos-methyl resistant strains of R. solani tested were also resistant to Iprodione, other dicarboximides and PCNB, but were still sensitive to Pencycuron, Flutoluanil and Mepronil. The cross-resistance to Iprodione and Tolchlofos-methyl suggests a common mechanism of action of the two fungicides. Resistance to Tolchlofos-methyl and Iprodione would not probably become a field problem because of the reduced fitness of resistant strains and because several fungicides with different mechanism of action can normally be alternated by growers in the field. Ceppi di Rhizoctonia solani resistenti a Tolclofos-metile sono stati facilmente ottenuti in laboratorio: essi hanno manifestato una fortemente ridotta virulenza nei confronti di Fagiolo e Basilico. Inoltre si sono sviluppati meno dei ceppi sensibili su substrati diversi. Tutti i ceppi di R. solani resistenti a Tolclofos-metile sono risultati resistenti anche a Iprodione, ad altri dicarbossimidici e a PCNB, mentre hanno conservata elevata sensibilit nei confronti di Pencycuron, Flutoluanil e Mepronil. La resistenza incrociata a Iprodione e a Tolclofos-metile suggerisce l'esistenza di un comune meccanismo di azione di questi due fungicidi. La resistenza di R. solani a Tolclofos-metile e a Iprodione probabilmente non assumera importanza nelle condizioni pratiche perch i ceppi resistenti presentano una minore  fitness  e sono molto sensibili ad altri fungicidi, che possono essere usati in alternanza.
42685321|In the 4 years period 1993 to 1996, information on the virulence of the Italian Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici (Prt) population has been obtained by testing 219 isolates of Prt on 7-day old primary leaves of nearisogenic wheat lines, each carrying a different gene for resistance to leaf rust. To identify the Prt virulence pathotypes, the Prt nomenclature of Long and Kolmer was used in 1993, 1994 and 1995 while in 1996, the pathotype designation was made on the basis of a triplet code on 15 differentials arranged in order of gene number. A total of 22 virulence pathotypes were identified in Italy over the 1993-95 period, the most common of which were FHT, DGH, DGG, FGT belonging to UN race 3 and 10. In 1996, 10 Prt pathotypes were identified of which 01060 and 00060, respectively belonging to UN race 10 and 1, were the most frequent in all Italian cereal growing areas. The lines carrying the res-genes Lr 9, Lr 19, Lr 24 and Lr 29 were resistant to all the isolates tested while the genes Lr 1, Lr 15, Lr 25 and Lr 28 resulted effective to more than 90% of the leaf rust isolates considered. The differential lines carrying Lr 2c, Lr 10, Lr 16, Lr 21, Lr 23 and Lr 30 were highly susceptible. The data showed that the leaf rust population in Northern Italy appears different from that present in Southern regions, and the virulence frequency of Prt population in Italy does not seem to be considerably changed over the last 4 years.
42684755|Tetracycline-HCI (TC) was shown to be absorbed from solution by roots of young plants of Vitis rupestris Scheele St. George and rapidly translocated to leaves. In rooted cuttings TC showed phytotoxicity, often resulting in the death of plants, at the highest concentrations (1000 and 2000 g ml) used for root treatments. The highest detectable concentration of antibiotic in apical leaves was, after a single application, 3.9 g g fresh weight, when the roots were immersed for 64 h in a solution containing 100 g ml antibiotic. Plants failed to accumulate detectable quantities of antibiotic in their foliar tissues after a single soil drench with TC at a concentration of 1000 or 2000 g ml. After root treatments or soil drenches, infected plants continued to show marked symptoms, with no signs of recovery from the disease. Freezing-microtome cross-section of roots, shoots, petioles and veins of healthy and diseased rooted cuttings of St. George and V. vinifera cv. Sangiovese were examined with a light microscope after treatment with Dienes' stain. All sections obtained from infected Vitis plants were free of blue-stained phloem cells as were their healthy counterparts. Taken in conjunction these results fail to support the concept of a prokaryotic etiology for fleck disease of the Grapevine. L'immersione degli apparati radicali di barbatelle di Vitis rupestris Scheele St. George in soluzioni di tetraciclina-HCl (TC) determina una rapida traslocazione dell'antibiotico alle foglie. A concentrazioni di 1000 e 2000 g ml, TC provoca effetti fitotossici spesso risultanti nella morte delle giovani piante. Trattamenti effettuati per 64 ore con soluzioni a 100g ml hanno determinato una concentrazione di antibiotico nelle foglie apicali pari a 3,9 g g (peso fresco). La somministrazione di soluzioni di TC al terreno porta solo occasionalmente a quantit rilevabili di antibiotico nei tessuti fogliari. I diversi trattamenti effettuati non sono risultati in grado di ridurre l'intensit dei sintomi della malattia, n di ritardarne la comparsa sulla nuova vegetazione. Nessun tipo di colorazione differenziale  stato rilevato osservando sezioni trasversali di organi diversi di barbatelle di V. rupestris sane o affette da Maculatura infettiva dopo trattamento con il colorante di Dienes. I risultati ottenuti sembrano non accordarsi con l'ipotesi di una eziologia procariotica di questa malattia.

The effects of the following fungicides: Captan, Phaltan, Orthodifolatan, Dodine and of the mixture Captan -f Copper sulphate on the alcoholic fermentation of musts obtained from grapes treated in the field against  grey mold  (Botrytis cinrea Pers.) were studied. Captan sprayings at the rate of kg 5 of commercial product per ha, dustings of Captan + Copper sulphate and Phaltan sprayings have showed an inhibitory effect only for the first 4 days. On the contrary Captan, at the rate of g 0,25/kg 100 of grape, Captan + Copper sulphate, Dodine, Copper sulphate and DBTCE had no effect. I these tests also the influence of Captan, Phaltan, Orthodifolatan, and Dodine on the respiration of Saccharomyces cerevisiae Hans, var. ellipsoideus (Hans.) Dekker and Orthodifolatan on that of Kloeckera apiculata (Reess) Janke was tested. Only Orthodifolatan inhibited the respiration of the two yeasts.
42685960|The antifungal effects of extracts and dried materials of clammy inula (Inula viscosa Ait) on wheat leaf spot fungus (Helminthosporium sativum King et Bakke) (Bipolaris sorokiniana) and tomato wilt fungus (Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici Schlecht) were investigated under laboratory conditions. Shoot extract strongly inhibited growth of both fungi. Incorporation of dried shoot material of I. viscosa in the growing media inhibited the growth of both fungi species. However, the effect decreased with incubation period. The fungistatic activity of the weed extract increased with plant age, and the extract was found to possess a strong volatile antifungal effect on both fungi. Shoots showed more inhibitory effects than roots while high temperature drastically reduced the antifungal effects of I. viscosa.
42685633|A series of observations using light and scanning electron microscopy have been carried out on basidiospores and telial stages of Cronartium flaccidum. It has been possible to give more information on the morphological structures of telia, teliospores, basidia and basidiospores and to classify blister rust in two groups: the first, based on the absence of ornamentations of teliospores (group defined as smooth with no ornamentation on the spore surface by Murrill, 1905); the second, based on the production of teliospores in chains (group defined as Cronartiaceous, meristem arthrospore production of teliospores in chains by Hughes, 1970). Sono state effettuate osservazioni sugli stadi teleutosporico e basidiosporico di Cronartium flaccidum al microscopio ottico ed al microscopio a scansione.  stato possibile fornire dettagli sulle strutture morfologiche dei teleuto, delle teleutospore, dei basidi e delle basidiospore, che hanno consentito di classificare la ruggine vescicolosa in due gruppi: il primo, basato sull'assenza di ornamentazioni delle teleutospore, nel gruppo definito come smooth with no ornamentation on the spore surface (Murrill, 1905); il secondo, basato sulla produzione in catena delle teleutospore, nel gruppo definito Cronartiaceous, meristem arthrospore production of teliospores in chains (Hughes, 1970).
42683690|Una malattia della Lattuga che si manifesta con arrossamenti, avvizzimenti e nanismo, e con imbrunimenti ed occlusioni miceliche e gommose dei vasi legnosi del fittone,  stata osservata nella zona orticola di Albenga (Sayona). Essa  prodotta da un fungillo della famiglia delle Pythiaceae, caratterizzato tra l'altro dall'avere oospore plerotiche, di piccole dimensioni ed a parete molto spessa, dalla presenza di clamidoconidi, dalla capacita di differenziare planoconidi solo nei tessuti dell'ospite e dalla tendenza a svilupparsi nei vasi legnosi. Per l'insieme dei suoi caratteri il fungillo  stato riferito al genere Pythium. Non collimando la sua descrizione con quella di nessuna dlie specie conosciute esso  stato considerato corne una specie nuova con l'appellativo specifico di P. tracheiphum, in considerazione della capacita che esso ha di svilupparsi nei vasi legnosi. La sua patogenicit su Lattuga,  stata pi volte confermata in prove di inoculazione artificiali ed  risultata di gran lunga superiore a quella di due isolamenti di P. debaryanum Hesse e di P. ultimum Trow. Con forti cariche di inoculo esso determina estesi marciumi di radici e foglie di giovani piantine, mentre determina sintomi di tipo tracheomicotico con inoculi molto diluiti e su piantine pi vecchie. La prevalente localizzazione del patogeno nell'apparato vascolare delle piante di Lattuga in campo potrebbe trovare spiegazione nella esigua quantit di inoculo presente nei terreno, e nella spiccata capacita dei tessuti corticali di reagire al patgeno che troverebbe condizioni favorevoli per penetrare e svilupparsi nei parenchimi solo negli strati pi profondi del terreno. Une maladie de la Laitue qui provoque le fltrissement de la plante et le brunissement des vaisseaux du pivot, obstrus par des mycelium et des gommes,  t observe dans la rgion d'Albenga (Savone, Italie). Cette maladie est cause par un champignon de la famille des Pytihaceae qui presente les caractres suivants: conidies terminales ou intercalaires, sphriques ou subsphriques mesurantes  14  36, en moyenne  25,6, de diamtre, avec une paroi qui devient paisse dans les cultures ges; oogoniums mesurantes  13-18, en moyenne  15,5, de diamtre, terminales, lisses; antheridies paragynes mono-et diclines, de forme irregulire, un ou deux par oogonium; oospores plerotiques entoures d'une paroi assez paisse. Il forme des planoconidies, dans une vsicule ou  l'intrieur mme des conidianges, seulement dans les tissus de l'hte. Sur Laitue il est beaucoup plus virulent de P. debaryanum Hesse et de P. ultimum Trow. Le champignon a t consider comme une nouvelle espce de Pythium et dcrit sous le nom P. tracheiphilum, a cause de sa capacit d'envaihr les vaisseaux. C'est seulement avec des inoculums de P. tracheiphilum trs dilus que l'on peut obtenir des symptomes de tracheomycose, tandis qu'avec des inoculums concentrs l'on n'a que des moisissures des racines et des feuilles. La localisation du parasite dans les vaisseaux des plantes dans le champ peut driver des petites quantits d'inoculum dans le sol et la forte reactivit des tissus corticals au parasite, qui trouverait les conditions favorable pour infecter les parenchymes seulement dans les couches les plus profondes du sol. A disease of Lettuce causing dwarfing, wilt and blackening of the vascular bundles of stem and root was observed in the district of Savona (Italy). The pathogen was identified as a pythiaceous fungus. Its conidia are terminal or intercalary, spherical or subspehrical, measuring  14 to 36, average  25,6 in diameter, with thickened wall in old cultures. Oogonia, measuring  13-18, average  15,5 in diameter, are terminal and smooth; antehridia paraginous, mono-and diclinous, 1 or 2 per oogonium, are irregular in shape, and oospores are plerotic with thick wall. It produces planoconidia only in the host tisseus. Its pathogenicity on Lettuce was proved to the much higher than that of P. debaryanum Hesse and P. ultimum Trow. The fungus was considered to be a new species of Pythium and described as P. tracheiphilum, according to its ability to invade the xylem vessels. Artificial infections of young seedlings with concentrated inocula caused rotting of root and leaf Wilt symptoms were induced only in older plants with diluted inocula. Low inoculum potential, conditions less favorable to the infections in the superficial layers of the soil and strong ability of the cortical tissues to react to the fungus could account for its localization in the xylem vessel of plants grown in the field.
42683836|Prove di laboratorio con miscele di vari fungicidi hanno dimostrato che l'efficacia dello Zineb e dello Ziram viene aumentata notevolmente con l'aggiunta di polisolfuro di bario contro i funghi Botrytis cinerea, Cercospora beticola, Aspergillus niger e Ventaria pirina. Prove antiticchiolatura eseguite in pieno campo hanno confermato tale effetto favorevole. The activity of fungicide mixtures Zineb, Ziram, TMTD, Ferbam, DNRB, Captan, Actidione and bariumpolysulfide (BPS) was tested in laboratory experiments. Serial dilutions of the fungicides were prepared in micro-petri dishes disposed in such a way to have in a direction the diminishing concentrations of one of the fungicide and in the other direction that of the other. Nutrient-agar was then added to each dish and they were sprayed with a spore suspension of the fungus to be tried (Botrytis cinerea, Aspergillus niger, Cercospora beticola or Ventaria pirina). The germination and growth of the fungi were examined after 24 hours with a microscope and after 24 days macroscopically. Zineb + BPS and Ziram + BPS demonstrated a sinergistic action against all the fungi tested, and the synergism seemed to deserve to be tried in the field. In the field experiment against apple scab in a severe scab year, 9 treatments of 1) Ziram; 2) mixture of Ziram + BPS; 3) Zineb and 4) mixture of Zineb + BPS gave : 4,32 % ; 2,56 % ; 1,43 % and 0,38 % infected leaf surfaces respectively. The infection of the control plants (no treatment during the first 4 sprayings and 0,2 % Ziram afterwards) was 13,99 %. The difference between Ziram and Ziram + bariumpolysulfide was not significant (P = 85%); the difference with Zineb resulted highly significant (P> 99%). L'activit des mlanges fongicides (Zinbe, Ziram, Ferbam, TMTD, DNRB, Captane, Actidione et polysulfure de barium (PSB) a t tudie au laboratoire. 42685880|Four Phytophthora-pepper interactions obtained by inoculating the leaves of two isogenic pepper varieties, one susceptible (QS) and one resistant (QR) to Phytophthora capsici, with cystospore suspensions of one isolate of P. capsici (C) highly virulent and one isolate of P. parasitica (P) nonpathogenic on pepper were ranked as follows in order of decreasing compatibility on the base of severity and type of symptoms: C/QS, C/QR, P/QS, P/QR. The absence of differences in spore germination and initial tissue penetration suggests that the resistance of the pepper leaves to both the virulent and avirulent Phytophthora isolates is not expressed in the epiphytic and initial penetration phases. The levels of capsidiol and capsenone were not correlated with varietal or nonhost resistance. The phytoalexins were detected late, after the tissue damage had become evident, in all the interactions and accumulated in amounts high enough to account for a reduction of fungal growth only in the fully compatible C/QS interaction. The decrease of capsidiol content with decreasing parasite-host compatibility suggests that the accumulation of phytoalexins in pepper leaves is a marker of pathogenesis rather than resistance.
42685345|Forest communities in the Mediterranean region are quite rich in species. Although most of them are confined to mountain areas they are very useful for both wood production and soil protection. Climatic conditions in the region and particularly summer drought, reduce vigour of trees giving opportunistic microorganisms an opportunity to cause disease. The most common fungi responsible for damage in natural forests and plantations are described together with some extremely harmful pathogens introduced from different areas.
42685333|A suction trap and soybean plants (Glicine max (L.) Merr.) were used during the summer season 1988 and 1989 to study the population of flying aphids and their natural infectivity for soybean mosaic potyvirus (SoyMV) in North-east Italy. In total 1,419 flying aphids were caught alive, used individually for experimental transmissions on soybean test plants and identified. Catches with suction trap were compared in 1989 with winged aphids directly collected on soybean plants. Great differences in the composition of populations and in their infectivity were obtained using the two catching methods. With the suction trap a great number of aphid species were found, while 99% of aphids collected from the soybean plants belonged to the Aphis genus and, in particular, about 73% were Aphis craccivora Koch. Only one positive transmission with Therioaphis trifolii Monell caught in a 1.7 m suction trap was obtained in 1988; none in 1989, while 10 infected A. craccivora were collected on soybean plants in the same year. At least 40 aphid genera were assayed but no transmission was obtained. Only one of the 5 Aphis species identified among 569 flying aphids collected on field plants in 1989 may be considered actually important as a vector of SoyMV in the Friuli-Venezia Giulia region.

The differential response of the phylloxera resistant rootstocks to root-knot nematodes and their susceptibilitry to X. index need to be taken into account when traditional grapevine areas of Crete are replanted. 42685553|Con il metodo MPN ('Most probable number') sono state effettuate determinazioni quantitative dell'inoculo di specie di Phytophthora patogene per gli agrumi, nel terreno e nelle acque d'irrigazione.  stata utilizzata a tal fine la tecnica d'isolamento mediante dischetti di foglie di arancio amaro, usando questi ultimi come esca e trasferendoli poi su substrato agarizzato selettivo. La presenza di propaguli di Phytophthora nei campioni di terreno, inoltre,  stata rilevata inoculando direttamente con il terreno in esame mele o limoni. Dal numero di dischetti di foglie o di frutti infetti, utilizzando apposite tabelle,  stato possibile risalire al numero pi probabile di propaguli presenti, nel campione in esame. Il metodo MPN pu essere utilizzato vantaggiosamente per lo studio delle popolazioni di Phytophthora nelle acque e nei terreni con una bassa densit d'inoculo. Nell'esame di campioni con una densit d'inoculo elevata, invece, il methodo  risultato poco sensibile e meno preciso del metodo di conteggio diretto delle colonie sviluppatesi su un substrato agarizzato, in piastre seminate con una sospensione diluita di terreno. Inoculum of citrus Phytophthoras in soil and in irrigation water has been quantitatively determined by the most probable number (MPN) method. Sour orange leaf-discs as bait, in combination with selective agar-medium, have been used for isolating Phytophthora propagules. Propagules in soil samples have also been detected by direct inoculation of apples or lemons with soil. Using pre-calculated tables, the most probable number of propagules in the samples has been obtained from the number of infected leaf-discs or positive inocula. The MPN method may be effectively used for quantifying Phytophthora populations in water and soils with low inoculum density; but, in samples with a high inoculum density, this method has been insensitive and less precise than the soil dilution plate method with selective media.
42683738|Nel corso di sei anni d'indagine si  cercato di approfondire e quindi di meglio configurare il mutevole quadro dei rapporti che intercorrono tra la Tilletia foetida (Wallr.) Liro ed il suo ospite specifico, in relazione a particolari tipi di ambiente.  stato cosi visto che si possono ottenere infezioni, spesso notevoli, a temperatura di 1-2C, ritenuta finora inadatta alie esigenze del parassita. Anche alia temperatura di 24-26C il Grano pu risultare colpito in maniera discreta. Infatti la temperatura non  il solo fattore a condizionare l'attacco, specialmente quando si agisca con livelli termici bassi (1-2C), o relativamente elevati (24-26C).  stato accertato cosi che l'umidit assume spesso un rilievo di primo piano, per cui, ad una stessa temperatura, impiegando pi livelli di umidit, si possono ottenere risultati molto diversi quanto alla percentuale di attacco. Di slito, umidit molto elevate sono di ostacolo al parassitamento del fungo, specialmente quando si agisca con temperature limite (1-2C e 24-26C). Umidit molto basse risultano pur esse negative ai fini dell'attacco, fatta eccezione per la temperatura di 1-2C, alla quale la carie riesce ancora ad affermarsi. Oltre l'umidit, pero,  stato constatato che anche l'inoculo ha un'importanza particolarmente evidente con temperature intermedie (8-10C e 18-20C). Infatti una forte concentrazione di spore annulla spesso l'effetto negativo di elevate umidit, per cui l'attacco pu divenire addirittura grave. Altro risultato di un certo rilievo  che, alla temperatura di 8-10C (considerata dalla maggior parte degli Autori ottimale per l'infezione da Tilletia), il grado di umidit del terreno perde gran parte della sua importanza; anzi riteniamo che sia questa la ragione per la quale la temperatura risulta ottimale, in quanto il fungo pu infettare anche ai pi diversi gradi di umidit, escludendo da questi soltanto i pi bassi. Infine, cultivar a pronta germinazione ed a rpido sviluppo iniziale sfuggono di slito al parassitamento, contrariamente a quelle che hanno un processo germinativo ed un accrescimento pi rallentato. Bisogner ora studiare l'influenza che sul grado d'infezione ha la natura e struttura del terreno, in relazione sempre a temperatura, umidit, inoculo. Six years' studies have been carried out in order to clarify the complex picture of the relationships between Tilletia foetida (Wallr.) Liro and its specific host in relation to particular environmental conditions. It has been shown that serious infections can take place at a temperature of 1-2C which, up to now, has been considered unsuitable for the requirement of the pathogen. Outbreacks of a certain importance can also occur at 24-26C. In fact it seems that temperature does not represent the only infection conditioning factor, particularly at low (1-2C) or relatively high (24-26C) thermic levels. Soil moisture often plays a role of primary importance so that, at the same temperature, changing levels of soil moisture yield different intensities of attack. Usually, high moisture levels hinder the parasitic action of the fungus expecially at extreme temperatures (1-2C and 24-26C). Negative effect on the infection are produced also by low moisture levels, except for temperature of 1-2C at which the parasite is still able to infect. The level of inoculum seems to be particularly important at intermediate temperatures (8-10C and 18-20C). Under these conditions a high spore concentration balances out the negative effect of high moisture, often resulting into severe infections. It seems worth pointing out that at 8-10C (which is considered by the majority of the authors as the optimum temperature for Tilletia attacks) the degree of soil moisture looses a great deal of its importance. This explains why such figure is considered the optimum temperature. In fact the fungus, in these conditions, can infect pratically at any moisture level except for the very low ones. Finally the cultivars which germinate quickly and have a rapid initial growth easily excape infection whereas the opposite happens to those having both a slower germinative process and growth. It seems now necessary to investigate the influence of the type and structure of the soil on the severity of infections in relation to the same factors considered: temperature, soil moisture and level of inoculum. Au cours de six annes de recherches on a cherch  approfondir et, donc,  mieux dfinir les rapports entre Tilletia foetida (Wallr.) Liro et son hte spcifique dans divers types de milieu. On a observ que des infections, souvent notables, peuvent s'obtenir  des tempratures de 1-2C, jusqu'ici considres insuffisantes pour les exigences du parasite. Mme  temprature de 24-26C, le Bl peut tre infect d'une faon considrable. La temprature n'est pas le seul facteur conditionnant l'infection, en particulier lorsqu'on emploie des niveaux thermiques bas (1-2C) ou relativement levs (24-26C). On a pu s'assurer que l'humidit joue souvent un rle de premire importance; avec plusieurs taux d'humidit employs  la mme temprature, on a pu obtenir des rsultats trs diffrents, quant au pourcentage dlnfection. En rgle gnrale, des humidits trs leves entravent le parasitisme du champignon, en particulier aux conditions de tempratures limites (1-2C et 24-26C). Des taux d'humidit trs bas rendent aussi ngatives les infections, exception faite pour la temprature de 1-2C  laquelle la carie est encore capable d'attaquer le Bl. On a constat de plus que l'inoculum a une importance particulirement vidente avec des tempratures intermdiaires (8-10C et 18-20C). En effet une haute concentration de spores annulle souvent l'effet ngatif des humidits leves et peut permettre une infection grave. Un autre rsultat d'une certaine importance est que,  la temprature de 8-10C (considre par la plupart des Auteurs comme l'optimum pour les infections de Tilletia), le degr d'humidit du sol perd une grande partie de son importance. A ce sujet, nous pensons que c'est la raison pour laquelle cette temprature est un optimum, le champignon tant capable de infecter mme aux degrs d'humidit les plus varis,  l'exclusion seulement des plus bas. Enfin, les cultivars  prompte germination et  rapide dveloppement initial chappent  l'infection au contraire de ceux qui ont un processus germinatif et un dveloppement plus ralentis. Il faut cependant tudier l'influence exerce par la nature et la structure du sol sur le degr d'infection en rapport avec la temprature, l'humidit et l'inoculum.

42685615|A field survey was conducted during spring and summer 1985 on cucurbits in specific locations in Lebanon and North Syria. Results indicated that Zucchini yellow fleck (ZYFV), Zucchini yellow mosaic (ZYMV), Watermelon strain of Papaya ringspot (PRSV-W), Watermelon mosaic 2 (WMV-2) and Cucumber mosaic (CMV) viruses were present in Lebanon in 40.3, 40.3, 23.6, 37.5, and 18.0% of the 72 tested samples and in Syria in 58.7, 0.0, 76.1, 41.3 and 95.6% of the 46 tested samples, respectively. Simultaneous infection with more than one virus was detected in 66.4% of the total samples tested. Bean yellow mosaic virus (BYMV) was not detected. Testing different extraction buffers for their suitability in virus detection by the enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA), the 0.1 M phosphate plus 0.1 M EDTA buffer, pH 7.4, was the most efficient for all the above viruses. Viariability in virus detection due to leaf age, time of infection and individual plants was minimal. Simpler and shorter procedures of the ELISA test showed promise for their applicability in large-scale indexing of field samples. Using 4 to 8 intact leaf disks per well was as efficient as using macerated leaf disks for the detection of PRSV-W, WMV-2 and ZYFV by ELISA. Simultaneous incubation of the leaf sap and enzyme-conjugate decreased the assay time by at least four hours. To correctly interpret ELISA results obtained form field samples quantification of serological relatedness among the potyviruses surveyed was necessary. Cross reactivity between PRSV-W antigen WMV-2 and ZYMV antisera, and between ZYFV antigen and ZYMV antiserum was detected by ELISA. 42685901|Isolations from anthracnose-infected bean plants (Phaseolus vulgaris L.) collected from fields at different places in Turkey yielded several strains of the bean pathogen, Colletotrichum lindemuthianum. The isolates were broadly characterized into four major race groups, namely alpha, beta, gamma and delta, by their specific differential reactions on the bean cvs Processor, Dark Red Kidney, Kaboon, Widusa and Cornell 49-242. Race alpha was found to contain only two isolates which differed in virulence. The isolates of race beta which were most commonly occurring, were newly differentiated into subraces 1f, 1g, 1h and 1i by selective reactions on a second set of bean cvs, namely Prelude, Michelite, Perry Marrow, Bo-22 and Renka. The isolates of race gamma were identified into two subraces la and 72a, whereas isolates of race delta were homogeneous. Any breeding program of new bean cultivars adapted to Turkey should aim to incorporate resistance genes against these races.

42685395|Ascochyta blight (AB) caused by Ascochyta rabiei (Pass.) Labr. and Botrytis grey mould (BGM) caused by Botrytis cinerea (Pers. ex Fr.) are important diseases of the aerial plant parts of chickpea in most chickpea growing areas of the world. Although conventional approaches have contributed to reducing disease, the use of new technologies is expected to further reduce losses through these biotic stresses. Reliable screening techniques were developed: 'field screening technique' for adult plant screening, 'cloth chamber technique' and 'growth chamber technique' for the study of races of the pathogen and for segregating generations. Furthermore, the 'cut twig technique' for interspecific population for AB and BGM resistance was developed. For introgression of high levels of AB and BGM resistance in cultivated chickpea from wild relatives, accessions of seven annual wild Cicer spp. were evaluated and identified: C. Judaicum accessions 185, ILWC 95 and ILWC 61, C. pinnatifidum accessions 188, 199 and ILWC 212 as potential donors. C. pinnatifidum accessionl88 was crossed with ICCV 96030 and 62 F 9 lines resistant to AB and BGM were derived. Of the derived lines, several are being evaluated for agronomic traits and yield parameters while four lines, GL 29029, GL29206, GL29212, GL29081 possessing high degree of resistance were crossed with susceptible high yielding cultivars BG 256 to improve resistance and to undertake molecular studies. Genotyping of F populations with SSR markers from the chickpea genome was done to identify markers potentially linked with AB and BGM resistance genes. In preliminary studies, of 120 SSR markers used, six (Ta 2, Ta 110, Ta 139, CaSTMS 7, CaSTMS 24 and Tr 29) were identified with polymorphic bands between resistant derivative lines and the susceptible parent. The study shows that wild species of Cicer are the valuable gene pools of resistance to AB and BGM. The resistant derivative lines generated here can serve as good pre-breeding material and markers identified can assist in marker assisted selection for resistance breeding.

42685614|The production in culture of apothecia of Botryotinia fuckeliana (de Bary) Whetz. was achieved starting from Botrytis cinerea strains collected directly in nature from Grapevine and other plants. The conditioning of sclerotia involved a pre-treatment at different temperatures, mass-spermatization and incubation in a growth chamber at 11  1C under the illumination supplied by a combination of fluorescent and incandescent lamps with a 12-hour photoperiod. Brief descriptions of the stages of development and of histological structures of apothecia are reported. Cytological observation allowed to follow the nuclear evolution in asci and ascospores. In the early stage of differentation, the ascospores appeared to be uninucleate but, while being still in the ascus, further mitotic divisions occurred, making the mature ascospores multinucleate. As a rule, cultures from complete sets of ascospores do not belong to the same morphotype, showing recombination of characters. Impiegando ceppi di Botrytis cinerea Pers. isolati direttamente in natura da Vite e da altre piante  stato possibile produrre in coltura apoteci di Botryotinia fuckeliana (de Bary) Whetz. Il condizionamento degli sclerozi ha previsto il pre-trattamento a differenti temperature, la spermatizzazione di massa e Tincubazione a 11  1C e illuminazione con lampade fluorescenti associate a lampade incandescenti (fotoperiodo di 12 ore). Si riporta una breve descrizione dello sviluppo e della struttura istologica degli apoteci. Osservazioni citologiche hanno permesso di seguir l'evoluzione nucleare negli aschi e nelle ascospore. Nei primi stadi della loro differenziazione le ascospore sono uninucleate, divengono poi a maturit multinucleate per divisioni mitotiche che occorrono quando esse sono ancora neirasco. Generalmente, colture dervate da serie complete di ascospore di uno stesso asco non presentano lo stesso morfotipo mostrando ricombinazione di caratteri.
42685717|Trials using bench grafting to transmit a grapevine flavescence dore-like disease were carried out in 1988 and 1989. In the first year healthy single-bud scions of cv. Chardonnay and Baco 22A were grafted onto donor stock cuttings taken from diseased cv. Pinot blanc and Sangiovese vines. Disease transmission was obtained from 'Pinot' stock cuttings collected from vines with generalized and localized symptoms; these vines were also diseased the year before and the year after. Positive transmission was revealed in 4.7% and 3.9% of the 'Baco 22A' and in 13.5% and 6.4% of the 'Chardonnay' indicator scions respectively. The disease was also transmitted by cuttings from apparently recovered 'Pinot' vines with symptoms the year before and the year after. In this case the percentages of'Baco 22A' and 'Chardonnay' plants with symptoms were 2.9 and 1.9 respectively. Donor stock cuttings from locally affected 'Sangiovese' vines also transmitted the disorder to 4.7% of 'Baco 22A' and 0.6% of 'Chardonnay' indicator scions. The average disease transmission rate was 4% for 'Baco 22A' and 5.6% for 'Chardonnay'. On the other hand, when healthy 'Pinot' stock cuttings from vines which were also asymptomatic the year before and the year after were used, no diseased indicator plants were observed. The second year, healthy 'Kober 5BB' rootstocks were grafted with bud scions taken from diseased 'Chardonnay' and 'Sangiovese' vines as self-indicators of infection. Buds from 'Chardonnay' vines with both generalized and localized symptoms, also affected the following year, revealed the disease in 13.2% of the plants. Buds from vines of the same cultivar and with the same disease severity levels, but which were recovered the following year, revealed a disease incidence of 15.6% and 1.1% respectively. Buds from asymptomatic 'Chardonnay' vines, showing symptoms of the disease the following year, revealed infection in 1.7% of the plants. When 'Sangiovese' buds were taken from vines with localized symptoms, also affected the following year, the disease was observed in 2.6% of the plants. The average incidence of infection in the young 'Chardonnay' plants was 8.9%. On the other hand, using buds from asymptomatic 'Chardonnay' vines, also healthy the following year, no diseased plants were observed. The significance of these results is discussed taking into account the presumed etiology and epidemiology of this disease. Prove di trasmissione per innesto legnoso di una malattia della vite simile alia flavescenza dorata, sono state effettuate nel 1988 e nel 1989. Il primo anno, innestando a doppio spacco talee della cv. Pinot blanc e della cv. Sangiovese quali soggetti donatori, con gemme sane della cv. Baco 22A e Chardonnay quali nesti indicatori dell'affezione, risultava quanto segue. Trasmissione positiva veniva ottenuta dal legno di viti.'Pinot' che nell'estate manifestavano sintomi sia in maniera generalizzata che localizzata. Tutte queste risultavano ammalate pure l'anno precedente e poi anche l'anno seguente. Per quanto riguarda il 'Baco 22A', le barbatelle con sintomi erano rispettivamente il 4,7% ed il 3,9%; per quanto riguarda lo 'Chardonnay' erano in vece il 13,5% ed il 6,4%. Trasmissione positiva veniva inoltre ottenuta dal legno di viti che si presentavano senza sintomi ma che erano ammalate l'anno precedente (risanate) e che poi si presentavano affette pure in quello seguente. Le barbatelle con sintomi di 'Baco 22A' e di 'Chardonnay' risultavano rispettivamente il 2,9% e l'1,9%. Cosi pure per quanto riguarda quelle derivate dall'innesto delle talee provenienti da piante ammalate in maniera localizzata della cv. Sangiovese dove se ne registrava rispettivamente il 4,7% e lo 0,6%. In generale la percentuale media di trasmissione ottenuta risultava del 4% per il 'Baco 22A' e del 5,6% per lo 'Chardonnay'. Per contro, dal legno di viti di 'Pinot' che non manifestavano sintomi e che presentavano la medesima condizione sanitaria sia l'anno precedente che quello seguente, non si osservava nessuna barbatella ammalata dei due rivelatori. Il secondo anno, innestando invece talee sane di 'Kober 5BB' quale soggetto con gemme di viti, variamente interessate dalla malattia, della cv. Chardonnay e della cv. Sangiovese quali nesti autoindicatori della presenza dell'infezione, i risultati ottenuti erano i seguenti. Con gemme provenienti da viti 'Chardonnay' che nell'estatemanifestavano una sintomatologia sia generalizzata che localizzata e che risultavano poi affette pure l'anno seguente, si registravano rispettivamente il 13,2% ed il 13,2% di barbatelle ammalate. Con gemme di viti che mostravano sintomi dello stesso livello di gravita delle precedenti e che l'anno seguente risultavano invece risanate, se ne osservavano rispettivamente il 15,6% e l'1,1%. Barbatelle ammalte (1,7%) venivano inoltre ottenute con gemme di piante che si presentavano senza sintomi ma che l'anno seguente risultavano affette. Cosi pure per quanto riguarda l'innesto di gemme di 'Sangiovese' provenienti da viti ammalate in modo localizzato e che si presentavano poi tali anche l'anno seguente; la percentuale di barbatelle con sintomi risultava del 2,6%. In genrale le giovani piante di 'Chardonnay' affette erano in media l'8,9%. Per contro, anche in questo caso, con gemme di piante 'Chardonnay' senza sintomi che apparivano tali pure l'anno seguente (controllo sano), non si osservava nessuna barbatella ammalata. L'importanza di questi risultati viene discussa in considerazione della presunta natura eziologica della malattia ed in particolare delle sue ritenute caratteristiche epidemiologiche.
42685291|The natural and experimental host ranges of faba bean necrotic yellows virus (FBNYV) were investigated to obtain a better understanding of its ecology. Eleven wild leguminous and non-leguminous plant species from Egypt and Syria were shown to be natural hosts of FBNYV. In experimental host range studies 20 wild legume species from Egypt, where FBNYV epidemics have frequently occurred, were found susceptible to FBNYV, some of which did not produce symptoms. Potential hosts included crops, such as Glycine max (L.) Merr., Phaseolus vulgaris L., Trifolium alexandrinum L., Trigonella foenum-graecum L., and Vigna unguiculata (L.) Walp. Based on these host-range data, a model illustrating the possible infection cycle of FBNYV in Syria is proposed. Inoculation of a FBNYV-susceptible faba bean line at different growth stages under field conditions showed striking effects on symptoms and yield. Symptoms were the more severe and yield losses were the higher the earlier plants were infected.
42684447|An early selective protection (ESP) was demonstrated in tobacco leaves against bacteria. The induction of ESP was nonspecific since compatible (Pseudomonas tabaci), incompatible (P. pisi), and saprohytic (P. fluorescens) bacteria all induced this reaction. Its effect on bacterial growth, however, was specific because compatible bacteria were not inhibited. Protection of the plant can be detected as early as 3 h after inoculation and is complete by 6-19 h. Light does not affect the development of ESP. Results suggest that ESP is not identical with either the hypersensitive reaction (HR) or with acquired resistance (premunity) of plants. However, it may be related to the envelopment or immobilization of bacteria by plant cell-wall components.  stata messa in evidenza in foglie di Tabacco la precoce comparsa di una reazione selettiva di protezione nei confronti di batteri diversi. Tale reazione  stata aspecifica essendo stata ugualmente indotta da isolati compatibili (Pseudomonas tabaci), da isolati incompatibili (Pseudomonas pisi) e da saprofiti (Psedomonas fluorescens).  stata invece specifica l'influenza sulla moltiplicazione batterica non essendovi stata inibizione negli isolati compatibili. L'azione di protezione sulle piante pu essere accertata gi 3 ore dopo l'inoculazione ed  completa dopo 6-19 ore. La luce non ha influenzato lo svolgimento della reazione di difesa. I risultati ottenuti suggeriscono che la reazione selettiva di protezione non  identica alla reazione di ipersensibilit o a reazioni di resistenza acquisita (preimmunit) delle piante. Comunque, essa potrebbe essere messa in relazione con l'inglobamento o con l'immobilizzazione dei batteri da parte di componenti delle pareti delle cellule dell'ospite.

43872354|In an attempt to define virulence determinants of Diaporthe helianthi, the causative agent of sunflower stem canker, the gene named Dhpg, coding for an endopolygalacturonase, was investigated in the highly virulent strain 8/96 isolated from a diseased plant in France. The 1130 bp coding sequence, in addition to 1473 bp from the upstream region, were cloned, sequenced and analyzed. Dhpg was most closely related to polygalacturonase genes from phytopathogenic fungi, such as Ophiostoma ulmi, O. novo-ulmi, and Gibberella zeae. A Southern blot RFLP analysis proved that Dhpg was represented in single-copy in the genome of the isolate 8/96. Analyses carried out both in vitro on liquid cultures and in vivo on host infected tissues provided evidence of the constitutive expression of the Dhpg transcript under all tested conditions. Moreover, an European collection of D. helianthi isolates was screened for the presence of Dhpg homologues by PCR, revealing the same single band in all French and Yugoslavian isolates, while one Romanian and all Italian isolates displayed a variable pattern. This genetic variability related to the different geographic origin of D. helianthi is consistent with data previously reported for different loci on the same set of isolates. This is the first report of a polygalacturonase gene in D. helianthi.
42685589|Da semi di frutti di Pomodoro di una cultivar pugliese ('Leccese da serbo') mostranti imbrunimenti vascolari,  stato ripetutamente isolato un fungo che, saggiato su cultivar di Pomodoro: suscettibile per il fattore i/i ('Super Marmande') e resistente per il fattore 1-1 ('Robusta'),  stato classificato come razza 0 di Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyd. et Hans. Il patogeno, che era localizzato nei residui di polpa aderenti al seme,  stato facilmente eliminato con l'estrazione dei semi mediante fermentazione naturale oppure per mezzo di trattamenti a base di ipoclorito di sodio o di sublimato corrosivo. Esso non  risultato lungamente persistente sul seme: dopo un anno, la percentuale di semi contaminati era gi fortemente ridotta; dopo altri 6 mesi, il patogeno non  pi stato reperito. Quando i semi naturalmente infetti sono stati immediatamente seminati, le piante originate da tali semi sono risultate affette dalla tracheomicosi per il 15% circa; dopo un anno dall'estrazione del seme, la trasmissione della malattia si  ridotta a circa lo 0,5%. Inoculazioni artificiali sono state effettuate in campo su piante di pomodoro 'Leecese da serbo', 'Super Marmande' e 'San Marzano'. Sui semi ottenuti da queste piante  stata osservata la presenza del patogeno, risultando la cv. Leccese o da serbo la pi suscettibile anche sotto tale aspetto. Entro variazioni dipendenti dalla diversa suscettibilit delle variet saggiate, il seme  risultato tanto pi infetto quanto pi tardiva era l'epoca di raccolta. Fusarium oxysporum was repeatedly isolated from discoloured tissues of 'Leccese da serbo' tomato fruits. The fungus, tested on the tomato cultivars 'Super Marmande' (i/i) and 'Robusta' (I-1/I-1) was identified as race 0 of Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyd. et Hans. The pathogen, located within tissues of pulp residues to the seed coat, was easily eradicated from the seed by means of natural fermentation of the pulp as well as by seed treatments with sodium hypochlorite or mercuric chloride. The viability of the pathogen on seed was short: at a year after extraction the infection percentage of seeds appeared greatly reduced, and at one year and 1/2 after extraction the pathogen was no longer detectable. Infected seeds sown immediately after extraction from the pulp produced about 15% diseased plants. In sowings made with one-year old seeds the seed-to-plant transmission of the pathogen was as low as 0,5%. The plant-to-seed transmission was ascertained in the field by artificial inoculation of 'Leccese da serbo', 'Super Marmande' and 'San Marzano' tomatoes. The pathogen was found on the seed of these tomato cultivar the 'Leccese da serbo' showing the highest percentage of infected seeds.
42684197|Inactivation of Carnation mottle virus (CarMV) was achieved by heating purified viral suspensions at a concentration of 1.8 mg/ml for 120 min at 70C, in 0.01 M phospate buffer, pH 7.0. Thermally treated and untreated CarMV particles were compared for their ultraviolet absorption properties, electrophoretic mobility, sedimentation coefficient, buoyant density and morphology. Between heated and unheated particles only a slight difference in ultraviolet absorption characteristics was observed, while the other properties remained unchanged. RNA extracted from both heated and unheated CarMV particles were also studied. RNA from unheated particles gave two peaks in sucrose gradients and three bands in polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. The molecular weights of these RNAs, expressed in million daltons units, were 1.38, 0.67, 0.56. On the contrary the RNA extracted from heated particles did not show similar patterns and seemed to be almost completely degraded. These results indicate that cleavages of the RNA may be responsible for the inactivation of heat-treated virus. 42685815|Da un esemplare di albero di Giuda (Cercis siliquastrum L.) che presentava maculature anulari e lineari giallastre e malformazioni fogliari,  stato isolato un virus che dai risultati delle prove di trasmissione sulle piante indicatrici, dalle propriet in vitro , dalla microscopia elettronica e dai saggi sierologici  stato identificato corne virus del mosaico dell'Erba medica (AMV). In base alle alterazioni ultrastrutturali e al tipo di aggregazione delle particelle osservate al microscopio elettronico nei tessuti di Cercis e di Chenopodium amaranticolor , l'isolato di AMV sembra ascrivibile al tipo 2A di Hull et al. (1970). Per quanto ci risulta nessuna infezione virale  stata finora segnalata in C. siliquastrum. A virus isolated from a Judas-tree (Cercis siliquastrum L.) showing yellowish ringspot, line-pattern symptoms and deformation on the leaves, was identified as Alfalfa mosaic virus (AMV) by indicator plants, properties in vitro , electron microscopy and serology. On the basis of the ultrastructural alterations and of the type of aggregation of virus particles observed by the electron microscope in infected Judas-tree and Chenopodium amaranticolor tissues, our AMV-isolate seems to belong to the 2A type (Hull et al., 1970). To our knowledge, no viral infection has been reported in Cercis siliquastrum so far.
42684488|The Potato bouquet (TBRV-PB) and Beet ringspot (TBRV-BR) strains of Tomato black ring virus, and Myrobalan latent ringspot virus (MyLRV) were studied comparatively in cells of Chenopodium quinoa Willd. and with immune electron microscopy. No difference was found in the general ultrastructure of TBRV-PB and TBRVBR infections and in the aspect, location and composition of their cytoplasmic inclusion bodies. The inclusions consisted of loose accumulations of membranous vesicles, endoplasmic reticulum, ribosomes and flaky electrondense amorphous material of unknown nature. The inclusion bodies of MyLRV were much more compact and lacked the flaky amorphous component. The differences were clear-cut and consistent enough to constitute a reliable character for differentiating the two viruses. The results of immune electron microscopy tests confirmed that TBRV and MyLRV are not serologically related. Non sono state osservate differenze di rilievo nella ultrastruttura delle infezioni di TBVR-PB e TBRV-BR n nell'aspetto, localizzazione e composizione dei loro corpi d'inclusione citoplasmatici. Questi erano composti da accumuli di vescicole membranacee, reticolo endoplasmico, ribosomi e fiocchi di materiale amorfo ed opaco agli elettroni di natura ignota. I corpi d'inclusione di MyLRV erano assai pii compatti privi del materiale amorfo di cui sopra. Le differenze sono apparse sufficientemente nette e costanti da costituire un buon carattere per la differenziazione dei due virus. I risultati della immuno microscopa elettronica hanno confermato che TBRV e MyLRV non sono correlati sierologicamente.

42685991|Three Armillaria species, namely Armillaria mellea, Armillaria gallica and Armillaria tabescens, were used to inoculate 2-year-old olive trees in Greece. A. mellea was the only pathogen that caused serious infections and tree mortality. Olives appeared to be resistant to A. gallica and A. tabescens. A. gallica caused only some light infections, affecting mainly the dead wood of the rhizomes and some small secondary roots. A. tabescens was non-pathogenic to olives. It is suggested that olive can be used to replace more susceptible plant species in orchards infected by A. gallica or A. tabescens.

42685207|A specification of Cercospora beticola distribution troughout the Mediterranean basin was carried out by means of data collected in the ambit of I.I.R.B. (International Institute for Beet Research) from 46 sugarbeet-growing zones (1,000,000 ha). Disease intensity ranges from very high values (in Po Valley, in many Greek zones, and in Turkish zones near to Marmara and Black Seas) to traces (in inland zones of Turkey, in southern Spain, in some Syrian zones, and in Tunisia, Algeria, and Egypt). Changes in disease intensity are explained on the basis of ecological and epidemiological factors. Summer aridity peculiar to Mediterranean climate strongly influence disease development, but seed-time and irrigation can reduce the limiting effect of arid climate on the fungus. Elevation above sea level also influences disease intensity, limiting it. Changes in control measures, both as fungicidal sprays and resistant cultivars, are roughly related to changes in disease intensity and they seem to have less influence than epidemiological conditions.

42685419|During the genomic and proteomic era of plant pathology in the last decade, extensive progress has been made in the understanding of the mechanisms of the interactions between plants and microbial pathogens. New models of pathogenesis have been designed, new biological phenomena have been discovered, a plethora of new molecules and functions have been determined, and new terms and senses have been added to phytopathological language. In this context, however, defects often emerge in many of the papers published on these subjects: the meanings attributed to some new terms are not always unique and do not always adhere to the basic concepts of plant pathology, including those relating to disease, disease cycles, pathogenicity, virulence, and avirulence. This paper discusses this problem, emphasizes established defintitions and proposes new ones, to assist the phytopathology community in unifying terminology for the benefit of our research discipline.
43871734|This study examined the effects of a liquid formulation (Formulation A) on olive leaf spot (OLS), caused by Fusicladium oleagineum. In the laboratory test the formulation, consisting in a dispersion of Brassicaceae in vegetable oil, was tested in comparison to vegetable oil alone and to a chemical fungicide (dodine). Vegetable oil, Formulation A, and dodine reduced conidium germination (47, 20 and 23% respectively), compared with untreated experimental controls (56%). Field trial results confirmed the efficacy of the formulation and dodine with respect to the untreated controls. Two applications of formulation in spring plus three additional sprays in autumn maintained OLS incidence below the harmful threshold, especially if applied on cultivars showing medium to low susceptibility to the disease.

42685222|The effect of nine sugarbeet cultivare with different known levels of resistance in reducing the apparent infection rate of Cercospora leaf spot epidemics compared to a susceptible cultivar, was studied at 18 locations during a three-year period. Host resistance was very effective: in the most resistant cultivars the infection rate, computed over a 30-day period during the progress of epidemics, was 35% less than that of the susceptible one, wheras in the least resistant cultivar it was 19%. Cultivar x environment (years and locations) interaction lead to wide variation in the magnitude of rate-reducing effect.

42685800|Healthy seedlings of Catharanthus roseus (L.) G. Don placed in a vineyard in northern Italy developed symptoms including phyllody and virescence of flowers, indicating possible infection by a MLO. The pathogen was transmitted by grafting to healthy plants of periwinkle. DNA was extracted from phloem isolated from the graftinoculated Italian periwinkle virescence (IPVR)-diseased plants, digested with restriction endonucleases EcoRI and Hin dIII, ligated into plasmid vector pIBI30, and cloned in Escherichia coli strain DH5. Recombinant plasmids and cloned DNA inserts that hybridized with nucleic acid extracted from plants with symptoms of IPVR, but not with nucleic acid from healthy C. roseus, were labeled with biotin and used as probes in dot and Southern hybridizations. Results from Southern hybridizations indicated that at least six IPVR-specific cloned DNA fragments represented chromosomal DNA. When dot hybridizations were carried out under conditions of moderate stringency (42C), five of thirteen probes hybridized with nucleic acid extracted from plants infected by IPVR MLO and not with nucleic acid extracted from plants infected by any of twelve other MLOs. Of the remaining eight probes tested, each hybridized under conditions of moderate stringency with nucleic acid from plants infected by any one of from two to twelve MLOs in addition to IPVR MLO. Under conditions of high stringency, four of these eight probes (G42AI, G42BI, G7AI and GUI) hybridized only with nucleic acid extracted from plants infected by IPVR MLO. The findings establish that a MLO is associated with IPVR disease. Although the results revealed a sharing of nucleotide sequence homologies between IPVR MLO and MLOs associated with several other diseases including X-disease, Clover proliferation, Ash yellows, Elm yellows, and flavescence dore, IPVR MLO could be distinguished from these and all other MLOs studied. Piante sane, derivate da seme, di Catharanthus roseus L. (G. Don) dopo esposizione in un vigneto dell'Italia settentrionale hanno sviluppato sintomi consistenti in fillodia e virescenza dei fiori che indicavano la possibile presenza di una infezione da MLO. Il patogeno denominato agente della virescenza italiana della vinca (IPVR),  stato trasmesso per innesto a piante sane di vinca (C. roseus); si  quindi proceduto all'estrazione del DNA dal floema delle piante infette. Tale DNA  stato tagliato in siti specifici con le endonucleasiE'coRI eHin dIII, inserito nel plasmide pIBI30 e clonato in Eschirichia coli ceppo DH5. I plasmidi ricombinanti e gli inserti di DNA ehe davano ibridazione con gli estratti di acidi nucleici delle piante infette da IPVR ma non con quelli di Vinca sana, sono stati marcati con biotina ed usati come sonde in esperimenti di ibridazione a macchia e di "Southern". I risultati delle ibridazioni "Southern" hanno permesso di evidenziare che almeno sei frammenti ottenuti dal clonaggio di IPVR MLO DNA sono di tipo cromosomico. Quando l'ibridazione a macchia veniva condotta in condizioni di stringenza moderata (42C), 5 sonde su 13 ibridavano con l'acido nucleico estratto da piante infette con IPVR MLO e non con quello estratto da piante infette con altri 12 MLO differenti. Le rimanenti 8 sonde saggiate reagivano nelle medesime condizioni di stringenza, oltre ehe con IPVR, con un numro variabile da 2 a 12 altri MLO. In condizioni di elevata stringenza, 4 di queste 8 sonde (G42AI, G42BI, G7AI e GIII) ibridavano in maniera specifica solamente con l'acido nucleico estratto da piante infette da IPVR MLO. Questi risultati dimostrano che effettivamente un MLO  associato ad IPVR; essi inoltre indicano che, nonostante la presenza di omologie nella sequenza nucleotidica fra questo MLO e quelli associati ad altre malattie quali la malattia x, la proliferazione del Trifoglio, il giallume del Frassino, il giallume dell'Olmo e la flavescenza dorata, IPVR MLO pu essere distinto da essi e dagli altri MLO utilizzati in questa ricerca.
43872342|Garlic is an important crop cultivated worldwide and several different viruses have been associated with propagative material. Garlic is propagated from bulbs and/or from vegetative topsets of the inflorescences known as bulbils. The effects of the geographic origin and the type of the propagative material on the phylogenetic relationships and genetic variability of the coat protein genes of four allium viruses are presented here. Onion yel low dwarf virus (OYDV), Leek yellow stripe virus (LYSV), Garlic virus X(GVX), and Garlic common latent virus (GCLV) were detected in single and mixed infections in plants grown either from bulbils and/or bulbs originating from Italy, China, Argentina, and the U.S.A. OYDV and LYSV fell into five and three well supported clades respectively whereas isolates of GVX and GCLV all clustered into one well-supported clade each. Some of the OYDV and LYSV clades presented evidence of host tissue selection while some phylogenetic structuring based on the geographic origin or host was also observed for some virus clades. Unique haplotypes and novel coat protein amino acid sequence patterns were identified for all viruses. An OYDV coat protein amino acid signature unique to Chenopodium quinoa, an uncommon host of the virus, was of particular interest. The type of propagative material affected the population dynamics of all of the viruses. The virus populations in plants propagated from bulbs were more diverse than in plants propagated from bulbils.

Cultures of Phytophthora infestans (Mont.) de Bary were obtained from Potatoes and Tomatoes in Sicily, Apulia, Campania and Emilia. From 183 multispore isolations, 193 race deter minations (129 from Potatoes and 64 from Tomatoes) were made. Race 4 was identified in 89,89% of the cultures obtained from Potatoes, while races 0 and 4 were found in 60,93 % and 31,25 % respectively, of those from Tomatoes. Both races were present in all the regions investigated, and on five occasions they were obtained as mixtures in one culture. Eight cultures consisted of mixtures of races 0 or 4 with race 3 or 3, 4 and one, from Tomato, was a mixture of the three races: 0; 3; 4. One culture from Potato was a mixture of races 2, 4 and 2, 3, 4 and another was race 3, 4 alone. The presence of the race 4 characteristic in these cultures was noted. The predominance of race 4 on potatoes and race 0 on tomatoes indicates that infection of potatoes is largely indipendent of that on tomatoes. The relatively high proportion of race 4 on tomatoes suggests that potatoes might provide a source of infection with this race, particularly where tomatoes follow potatoes. The low frequency of specialised races indicates that the corresponding R genotypes are not common in the regions studied. Sufficient isolates of these races were not obtained to determine their geographical distribution. 42685263|Resistance was induced in tobacco plants using Pseudomonas syringae pv. aptata (Brown et Jamieson) Young et al. elicitors consisting of pr-LPS complexes (purified elicitor) and heat-killed cells (crude elicitor). Primary localized, induced resistance was acquired by interveinal leaf panels of plants derived from seedlings 48 hours after infiltration with purified elicitor. A line of adult plants (PR line) was regenerated from expiants of leaf tissue with primary localized resistance. Interveinal leaf panels of PR line plants were infiltrated with purified elicitor, and after 48 hours, their expiants were used to regenerate a second line of adult plants (SR line). Other interveinal leaf expiants derived from seedlings were used to produce callus on medium containing the crude elicitor in concentrations of 1 and 5% (w/v); these were then used to regenerate two lines of corresponding adult plants (CR-1 and CR-5). The four lines of regenerated adult plants were inoculated with a virulent strain of P. syringae pv. tabaci (Wolf et Foster) Young et al. and after 21 days the total number of lesions were assessed, as well as the number and mean area of individual and confluent chlorotic and necrotic spots. Corresponding lines of adult plants were regenerated with the same protocols without the elicitors. For the SR line, untretaed and PR line plants infiltrated with water were used as controls. The PR and CR-1 line plants, but not the SR and CR-5 ones, showed a significantly lower total number of lesions and mean area of necrotic spots than the controls. The results indicated that tobacco plants resistant to P. s. pv. tabaci can be regenerated starting from the leaf tissue expiants with localized primary induced resistance and from callus kept in contact with appropriate concentrations of crude elicitor.

42685805|An elongated rod-shaped virus, for which the name Grapevine labile rod-shaped virus (GLRSV) is proposed, has been found associated with a grapevine symptomless plant in Italy. Preliminary results of this study suggest that GLRSV is a new member of the labile rod-shaped virus group. Size and outward aspect, physic chemical properties, difficulties encountered in purification, low concentration in the plant and in the purified preparations are in line with what has been published for this group. GLRSV, however, is the only member of this group occurring in a woody plant species. Un virus allungato, per il quale  stato proposto il nome di virus allungato labile della Vite, (Grapevine labile rod-shaped virus, GLRSV),  stato trovato associato ad una pianta di vite ehe non presentava alcuna particolare sintomatologia. I risultati preliminari di uno studio dlie proprit del GLRSV permettono di identificarlo come un probabile nuovo membro del gruppo "labile rodshaped virus". Infatti, le caratteristiche morfologiche e fisico-chimiche di questo virus, la difficolt della sua purificazione, la bassa concentrazione sia nella pianta ehe nei preparati purificati, sono in linea con quanto  noto nella bibliografia per questo gruppo di virus. Esso, tuttavia, sarebbe l'unico componente del gruppo ad essere stato osservato in un ospite legnoso.

42685919|Investigations were carried out in Albania for assessing the presence and distribution of Sharka, by surveying a total of 59 commercial orchards (48 Plum, 6 Peach and 5 Apricot stands) and 3 stone fruit varietal collections. Surveys were based on field inspections for observation of symptom, immunoenzymatic (ELISA) and immunoelectron microscopy (IEM) tests, and biological indexing (GF 305 and herbaceous hosts). Plum orchards proved to be seriously affected by Sharka, the disease being practically endemic in the South-Eastern areas of the country, where 2/3 of the plums tested were ELISA positive. No infections were detected in Peach and Apricot, except for a single case, but these data need to be further substantiated by testing a more representative number of samples.

The majority of vinclozolin tolerant strains showed higher sensitivity to copper than sensitive strains. On solid media vinclozolin has fungistatic and not fungicidal effects against mycelium of B. cinerea.
42685749|During the four growing seasons 1984/85 - 1987/88, 118 wheat fields representing all major wheat areas in Syria were evaluated for disease incidence and severity. Common bunt, septoria tritici blotch and yellow rust were the most widely encountered diseases across all areas surveyed. Diseases found in each of the four successive seasons were yellow rust, leaf rust, stem rust, bacterial leaf streak, loose bunt, loose smut, flag smut and septoria tritici blotch. Diseases encountered in one, two or three of the seasons of survey included basal glume rot, powdery mildew, downy mildew, foot and root rot, seed-gall nematode, alternara leaf blight, and septoria nodorum blotch. Five diseases, recorded for the first time in Syria, were bacterial leaf streak, basal glume rot, downy mildew, alternara leaf blight and septoria nodorum blotch. Yellow rust, septoria tritici blotch, loose smut and flag smut also were identified on Aegilops spp., a weed of the drier areas. This observation represents the first record of wheat diseases on wild relatives of wheat in Syria. The importance of an alternative host in the survival and spread of these diseases is unclear at this time but must be considered in future studies of the epidemiology and control of these diseases. The most widely grown commercial wheat cultivars and landraces, 'Haurani', 'Gezira 17', 'Shyhani', 'Sawadi', 'Mexipak' and 'Florence Aurore' were found susceptible to the major diseases and need to be replaced with resistant genotypes. L'incidenza e la gravit delle malattie del Frumento sono state valutate nel corso di quattro cicli colturali; 1984/85 - 1987/88, nelle aree cerealicole pi importanti della Siria. Carie, septoriosi e ruggine gialla sono risultate le pi diffuse. Le malattie riscontrate in ciascuno dei quattro cicli colturali considerati sono: ruggine gialla, ruggine bruna, ruggine nera, striatura fogliare batterica, carie, carbone e septoriosi. Le malattie riscontrate in uno, due o tre cicli colturali sono: oidio, mal del piede, alterazioni da nematodi, alternariosi e septoriosi (Leptosphaeria nodorum). Sono state diagnosticate per la prima volta le seguenti malattie: striatura fogliare batterica, marciume basale della gluma (Pseudomonas atrofaciens), peronospora, alternariosi e septoriosi (Leptosphaeria nodorum). La ruggine gialla, la septoriosi, la carie, il carbone sono state individuate per la prima volta su Aegilops spp.; una graminacea spontanea. Questa indicazione pone in rilievo la necessit di uno studio epidemiologico pi accurato ed esteso. Le principali cultivar di frumento cultivate, quali: 'Haurani', 'Gezira 17', 'Shyhani', 'Sawadi', 'Mexipak' e 'Florence Aurora' sono risultate molto suscettibili alie malattie pi diffuse e si richiede, pertanto, una loro sostituzione con altre resistenti.

De telles valuations permettent de comparer des vergers en situations diffrentes, de fournir des objectifs chiffrs pour l'valuation de la rsistence d'une varit, ou peuvent tre utilises dans des modles de simulation d'pidmies. An experiment was performed in an apricot orchard to estimate the number of the potential vectors of Plum pox virus which land on a tree during a given period. Two independent types of estimates were made. One uses the total foliage surface area of a tree combined with the number of the aphids recorded on a given foliage surface area. The second one uses the data provided by sticky fishing-line traps and an estimate of the interception area which corresponds to a tree. Calculations provide estimates in the same range. The estimate calculated from the data of the traps can be easily obtained from any orchard. Such estimates can be useful to compare different orchards, to evaluate the level of resistance to be obtained for the fruit tree, or can be used as a parameter of simulation models of epidemics.
