43872360|The main mycotoxigenic fungi found in maize in the Mediterranean basin include Aspergillus section Flavi and several Fusarium species, Fusarium section Liseola being the more widespread. While Aspergillus section Flavi species can develop in the field or in stored maize in Mediterranean countries, Fusarium species colonise maize ears in the field. As a consequence, fumonisins are the major contaminants in Mediterranean maize, together with aflatoxins. The prevalence of Fusarium section Liseola in the Mediterranean countries is closely linked to the activity of insects such as Sesamia nonagrioides and Ostrinia nubilalis. The incidence of the different mycotoxigenic fungi and mycotoxins across the Mediterranean countries is extensively reviewed in this work. Furthermore, both pre- and postharvest strategies to reduce the presence of such toxins in the maize chain are described. Finally, the incidence and levels of mycotoxins encountered in maize products intended for direct human consumption in the Mediterranean countries are also assessed; they are much lower than those in maize grain as a result of food processing technologies.
42684373|A technique for obtaining single-zoospore cultures from the germ-sporangium of a single germinating oospore of Phytophthora infestans (Mont.) de Bary has been developed. It consists of inducing zoospore liberation from a germinated oospore placed singly in a droplet of water in a concave microscope slide and exposed to 3-4 C and of picking, by the use of a micropipette, zoospores still swimming and transferring them individually onto agar (containing per liter: extract from 40 g of frozen lima bean, 25 cc of V-8 juice, 2.5 g of CaCO and 5 g of pectin) plates where development of colonies is evident in two-three days. One hundred and seventy-seven cultures were established from single zoospores and 17 from more than one zoospore in association. As high as 13 cultures were derived from among the zoospores liberated by a single germ-sporangium. The single-zoospore technique described here is simple and could be useful in analyzing genetically the offspring of crosses in species of Phytophthora.  stata messa a punto la tecnica per l'ottenimento di colture mono-zoosporiche da macro-sporangi di singole oospore di Phytophthora infest ans (Mont.) de Bary. Essa consiste nel favorire la liberazione delle zoospore da macro-sporangi individualmente inclusi in gocciole d'acqua su vetrini da microscopio e esposti a 3-4 C e nel trasferire, mediante l'uso di una micropipetta, le zoospore ancora in movimento e singolarmente su substrato agarizzato (contenente per litro: estratto di g 40 di fagioli di Lima surgelati, ce 25 di sueco di vegetali V-8, g 2,5 di CaCO 3 e g 5 di pectina) ove lo sviluppo delle colonie risulta evidente in 2-3 giorni. Centosettantasette colture sono state derivate da single zoospore e 17 da pii di una zoospora in associazione. Fino a 13 colture mono-zoosporiche sono state ottenute in seno alia popolazione zoosporica liberata da un singolo macro-sporangio. La tecnica dell'isolamento mono-zoosporico sopra descritta  semplice e pu risultare utile nell'analisi genetica della progenie di incroci in specie di Phytophthora.
43872348|Pasteuria penetrane is a biological control agent of root-knot nematodes (Meloidogyne spp.), preventing root invasion by second-stage juveniles (J2s), and eventually causing females sterility and death. Greatest control effects for P. penetrane depend on the numbers of endospores attached to nematode cuticles. A method based on digital image analysis was used to record the effects of endospore attachment on the movements of juvenile rootknot nematodes, using a model based on the centroid point. Data showed that the numbers of endospores attached to the cuticle influenced nematode movement. At high endospore attachment levels (20-30 per J2), nematodes did not show directional movement, whereas nematodes encumbered with five to eight spores showed limited directional movement, compared to those without endospores. Nematode cephalic region turns were modelled using a Markov chain, showing that P. penetrans endospores affected movements. Less nematodes invaded and established on tomato root systems when encumbered with low (five to eight) or high numbers (20-30) of P. penetrans endospores, compared with unencumbered nematodes.
42685676|Bean plantlets (Phaseolus vulgaris L. var. Topcrop) raised in growth chamber, were stressed by partial restoration of transpired water. The decrease in water potential, which fell to  12.5,  16 bar within 6-8 days, led to a progressive and marked decrease of both water conductivity and photosynthetic activity, though the last resulted less sensitive to water stress. Since the fall in stomatal conductance was more marked in the abaxial than the adaxial surface, the underside of the leaf seems to be mainly responsible for water economy, particularly in stressed plants. Intercellular CO partial pressure also fell progressively until water potential reached about  12.5 bar, than it rose fairly rapidly. The changes of CO assimilation versus intercellular CO relationship have been commented. Since the shift from decrease to increase of CO partial pressure occurred at a reasonable constant water potential value, it would seem to be a reliable index of water status, worthy of particular attention. Piante di fagiolo (Phaseolus vulgaris L. cv. Topcrop), cre sciute in camera climatizzata, sono state sottoposte a stress idrico mediante parziale reintegrazione dell'acqua traspirata. In 6-8 giorni, il Potenziale idrico  diminuito fino a circa  12,5,  16 bar: lo stress, piuttosto intenso, non  innaturale per piantine dtate di ridotto apparato radicale e scarsa capacita di adattamento. La diminuzione del potenziale idrico delle foglie primarie ha causato una diminuzione progressiva della conduttanza stomatica e dell'attivit fotosintetica che raggiungevano valori assai bassi quando il Potenziale scendeva oltre  12,5 bar. La piu marcata diminuzione, in valore assoluto, della conduttanza stomatica della pagina inferiore, indica il suo rulo preminente nella economa idrica delle piante stressate. La fotosintesi appare meno influenzata dallo stress idrico di quanto lo sia la conduttanza stomatica: fra  8 e  10 bar, essa  scesa dal 90 al 60%, mentre la conduttanza  passata dal 55 al 30% del testimone. La pressione parziale di CO all'interno dei tessuti  diminuita progressivamente a potenziali idrici compresi fra  10 e  12 bar, poi  aumentata bruscamente, raggiungendo valori talvolta superiori a quelli del testimone. Poich nelle foglie stressate l'aumento di CO interna si verifica a valori abbastanza costanti del potenziale idrico, esso potrebbe essere considerato un indice attendibile dello stress idrico della pianta e appare pertanto degno di particolare attenzione.

42684111|The kinetics of radioactive sucrose, glucose, and fructose in healthy and curly top infected tomato leaves were studied over a period of up to 30 hours under light following a 20 to 30 min labelling with CO. The respective time-course curves were described as sums of two or three exponentials. There was an apparent simplification of the kinetics as a consequence of virus infection, which was reflected most clearly in a transition from three-exponential to biexponential C-sucrose profiles. Glucose and fructose radioactivity, after a short initial increase to a maximum, dropped to very low levels in healthy leaves, but was strongly retained in diseased leaves and remained stationary in leaves of plants with severe symptoms. These differences resembled to some extent those caused by normal plant and/or leaf aging. The fractional turnover rates of sucrose, glucose and fructose and the rate of sucrose translocation, calculated on the basis of a three-compartment model, were decreased by 40 to 70 % as a result of infection. The calculated  sink capacity  of the foliar sugar interconverting system for the local assimilate was roughly doubled. La cinetica del saccarosio, del glucosio e del fruttosio radioattivi  stata studiata, per un periodo di oltre 30 ore, in foglie di pomodoro sane ed infette da virus della punta riccia sottoposte ad illuminazione continua e previamente  marcate  per 20-30 minuti con CO. Le curve relative rappresentanti l'andamento del contenuto degli zuccheri erano descritte dalla somma di 2 o 3 componenti di tipo esponenziale. Come conseguenza dell'infezione la cinetica degli zuccheri era semplificata nelle piante malate; questo era dimostrato dal fatto che le curve del saccarosio-C avevano solo 2 componenti in piante virosate, mentre in piante sane ne avevano 3. La radioattivit dovuta al glucosio ed al fruttosio, dopo un breve incremento iniziale, calava ad un livello molto basso nelle foglie sane, mentre era fortemente trattenuta nelle foglie malate e rimaneva ad un livello stazionario in foglie di piante particularmente colpite dall'infezione. Queste differenze sembravano molto simili a quelle provcate in piante sane dall'effetto dell'invecchiamento naturale. Le velocit frazionali di ricambio (fractional turnover rate) del saccarosio, del glucosio e del fruttosio e la velocit di traslocazione del saccarosio, calculate sulla base di un  modello  a tre compartimento sono risultate ridotte del 40-70 % a seguito dell'infezione virale. La capacita di ritenzione ( sink capacity ) degli assimilati locali calcolata nel sistema di interconversione degli zuccheri locali,  risultata approssimativamente raddoppiata nelle foglie malate. La cintique du saccharose, glucose et fructose radioactifs a t tudie pendant une priode de plus de 30 heures dans des feuilles de tomato saines et infectes par le virus de la frisole, en condition de lumire continuelle et prcdemment  marques  pendant 20-30 minutes avec CO. Les diffrentes courbes, reprsentant la variation de la teneur en sucres dans le temps, ont t dcrites par la somme de deux ou trois composantes exponentielles. Par suite de l'infection du virus la cintique des sucres tait simplifie dans les plantes malades; cela tait dmontr par le fait que les courbes du saccharose-C n'avaient que deux composantes dans les plantes infectes, tandis qu'elles en avaient trois dans les plantes saines. La radioactivit due au glucose et au fructose, aprs une brve augmentation initiale jusqu'au maximum, descendait  des niveaux trs bas dans les feuilles saines, tandis qu'elle tait retenue considrablement dans les feuilles malades et restait stationnaire dans celles appartenant  des plantes fortement infectes. Ces diffrences ressemblaient dans une certaine mesure  celles causes par le vieillissement naturel des plantes saines. Les vitesses fractionnelles de rechange du saccharose, du glucose et du fructose et la vitesse de translocation du saccharose, calcules sur la base d'un  modle   trois compartiments, on t rduites de 40-70 %  cause de l'infection. La capacit de rtention ( sink capacity ) du systme d'interconversion des sucres des feuilles qu'on a calcule, pour ce qui concerne les assimils locaux, avait approximativement doubl dans les feuilles malades.

42683564|In Emilia sono stati eseguiti alcuni rilievi di campagna e di laboratorio su Xanthomonas juglandis (Pierce) Dowson, agente delle  macchie nere  del Noce. L'identit del patgeno  stata accertata con infezioni sperimentali su foglie e germogli di Jugions regia e J. nigra e su frutti di J. regia, dai quali il batterio  stato reisolato, e con osservazioni morfologiche, colturali e biochimiche, delle quali sono descritti tcnica e risultati.  stata pure eseguita un'esperienza di campo che ha permesso di accertare la possibilita della diffusione della malattia tramite il polline infetto. In 1959 and 1960, Xanthomonas juglandis (Pierce) Dowson  the cause of Walnut blight  was submitted to field and laboratory investigations, mainly because of a disagreement as to the real symptoms, when comparing the syndrome found in the field in Emilia and those recorded in the Italian bibliography which concerns with this disease. The pathogen was identified through the usual observations of phytopathological and microbiologie order, the method and results of which are as follows: Phytopathological tests were made through inoculation, with a positive result, of eight isolates of the pathogen on Jugions regia and J. nigra leaves and shoots, besides on J. regia fruits. Microbiologie research was made on two isolates of the pathogen, one from a naturally infected J. regia leaflet and the other one, from a J. nigra leaflet, which was experimentally inoculated with an isolate taken from a naturally infected J. regia blossom. The results were as follows:  morphology. In taking 24 hours old nutrient agar cultures, the bacteria are found to be rods with straight or slightly curved axis with rounded or flattened tips, seldom sharpened, both singly and in pairs, sometimes in short chains. Their measures are:  1,5-3  0,3-0,5. They are Gram-negative and are readily stained with Ziehl's Carbol-fuchsin and with Ammonium oxalate christal violet. It is difficult to bring into evidence well defined capsules. The bacteria are actively motiles, have a one polar flagellum, and do not form spores.  growth in culture. In beef-extract peptone broth the bacterial growth is evident after 12 hours, and after 36 hours there is a visible clouding of the liquid. After 4-6 days, as the cloudiness is gradually increasing, a fine ring developes on the outside of the exposed surface of the liquid, changing on the 8th-10th day into a delicate, fragile superficial pellicule. While the pellicule is forming, the first sediments appear clearly at the bottom of the test-tube. In solid media, the bacterium forms colonies, the features of which can be seen in table I.  physiology. The bacterium is a facultative anaerobe. It does not reduce nitrates to nitrites. It produces a yellow pigment whose intensity depends on the medium. It neither produces indole from peptone and from tryptophane broth, nor hydrogen sulfide and ammonia from peptone. It liquefies gelatin, has lipolytic activity and also hydrolyses starch. It produces acid from xylose, dextrose, lvulose, mannose, lactose, maltose, sucrose, glycerol, mannitol and starch, without any formation of gas; neither acid nor gas are produced from inulin, aesculin and salicin. From the 3rd or 5th day, it brings about an enzymatic curd of milk, which from the 10th-15th day is gradually digested; in phenolred milk the final reaction is definitely alkaline; in litmus-milk, the litmus is gradually reduced from the 4th-5th day. It does not endure the specified transfers in Starr's asparagin medium. It thrives in Dunham's solution, and grows a little in Ashby's, Fermi's and Uschinsky's solution. It does not grow in Cohn's solution. It withstands hydrogen-ion concentrations from pH = 5,8 and pH = 10 ; is inhibited by reactions respectively corresponding to pH = 5,4 and pH = 10,5 ; the optimum pH for growth is included between pH = 6,4 and pH = 7,2. Its growth is prevented at temperatures lower than 5C and above 35C and its optimum is at 25-30C. Its thermal death point is 52C. The most significant differences which emerged during the present and earlier researches regarding biochemical aptitudes of the bacterium are compared in table II. At last here is an account of a field test to ascertain the possibility of dissemination of the inoculum through infected pollen. At the vegetative stage, when the catkins were about cm 3 long and when the lobes at the tip of the young nuts were beginning to expand, 50 twigs from a healthy isolated Walnut tree were stripped of catkins and wrapped in very fine nylon net. Then some bags were left permanently closed (there no blossom set in). Healthy catkins, healthy catkins and infected twigs, and infected catkins were respectively introduced into other bags. In the first case no trace of infection was found; in the second one only the leaves were infected; in the third one, infection was found under the form of blossomend rot in many blossoms just set. On the basis of such results (which should however be stated on a larger scale) it is supposed that pollen may take part in the penetration of the pathogen (during the fecundation process) as well as in its dissemination. 42684193|From rootlets of Sugarbeet affected by  Rizomania  2 fungi and 2 viruses have been isolated. A strain of Tomato bushy stunt virus and a Olpidium sp. were only occasionally found, and did not cause Rizomania-like symptoms. A fungus identified as Polymyxa betae Keskin and a tubular virus were instead always present in the rootlets, and when transmitted to healthy Sugarbeet caused symptoms very close to those of Rizomania. Both of them were always acquired by healthy Sugarbeet seedlings potted in soil where previously diseased Sugarbeets were grown, even when the soil was previously air dried for 40 days. P. betae and the virus were also transmitted to healthy Sugarbeet seedlings, potted either in sterilized soil or sterilized sand, by adding to them a homogenate of diseased rootlets thoroughly washed. The seedlings also acquired the 2 pathogens when put with their roots in contact with a water suspension in which rootlets of diseased Sugarbeets were left for sometime and them removed. The tubular virus was mechanically transmitted only to chenopodiaceous plants, and was purified by chloroform homogeneization and ammonium sulfate precipitation. The following characteristics of it have been determined:  particles lenght: 115 nm and 262 nm;  UV absorption ratios (corrected for light scattering): OD/OD = 1.16, ODmax/ODmin = 1.29;  RNA %: 5.1. In agar gel double-diffusion tests and precipitin tests, it resulted not to be correlated with Tobacco rattle virus, Pea early browning virus, Potato mop top virus, Wheat mosaic virus (soil borne), and Barley stripe mosaic virus. Our virus seems to have several characteristics very similar to those of Beet necrotic yellow vein virus (BNYVV) isolated from Sugarbeet in Japan, but this last has particles of three different lenghts. Da radiei di bietole infette da Rizomania sono stati isolati due funghi e due virus. Un ceppo del virus del rachitismo cespuglioso del Pomodoro e un fungo, Olpidium sp., sono stati solo occasionalmente trovati e non erano responsabili dei sintomi delia Rizomania. Un fungo, identifica to come Polymyxa betae Keskin ed un virus bastoncelliforme erano, invece, sempre presenti e, quando erano trasmessi a semenzali sani di Bietola, causavano sintomi molto simili a quelli della Rizomania. Entrambi i patogeni hanno sempre infettato bietole piantate in terreno in cui avevano dimorato in precedenza piante ammalate, anche se quest'ultimo era stato precedentemente seccato all'aria per 40 giorni. La P. betae ed il virus bastoncelliforme sono stati anche trasmessi a semenzali di Bietola piantati in terreno o sabbia sterile, addizionando ad essi un omogeneizzato di radiei ammalate previamente lavate. I due patogeni veniyano trasmessi a Bietole sane anche quando le radiei di queste venivano poste in una sospensione acquosa in cui erano state messe, precedentemente, radiei di piante ammalate. Sembra, quindi, che la P. betae sia il probabile vettore del virus bastoncelliforme  soil-borne . 42684140|Infection of tomatoes, beans and beets with curly top virus, besides causing strong distorting of the plant tops, caused shortening and thickening, as well as abnormal tropism, of the roots. Histological observation disclosed a greatly increased number of secondary root initials in infected roots. All the gross top symptoms, as well as root symptoms of virus-diseased plants could be reproduced by treating healthy plants with low levels of ethylene. Diseased plants were found to produce higher levels of ethylene than healthy controls. Root symptoms of disease appeared before top symptoms. Both experiments involving reciprocal grafts of susceptible and resistant beans, and experiments involving treatment of healthy plants with ethvlene indicate that ethylene is translocated downward in the plant more readily than upward. Increased ethylene production in infected plants, and resultant morphological distortions, appear before phloem necrosis appears. Per ora, pertanto, l'impiego dell'aria calda sembrerebbe offrire la migliore combinazione di efficacia e di sicurezza. Heat treatments were tried in order to eradicate Fusarium moniliforme Sheld. from internally infected Maize (Zea mays L.) kernels. Immersion in hot water (60C) of pre-soaked kernels proved the most rapid method. A 5-minute treatment lowered the amount of infected kernels to 2 percent of the control; germinability however was unfavourably affected and reduced to 72.8 percent. Exposure of pre-soaked or dry kernels for 2 or 24 hours, respectively, to hot air (55C and 97% R.H.) afforded complete eradication of the pathogen without consistently affecting germinability. A treatment with a steam-air mixture eliminated the pathogen from dry kernels but lowered the germinability to 42 percent. A shorter exposure (40 minutes) reduced infection to 2.7 percent of the control and did not affect germinability. These results indicate that hot air treatment seems more recommendable for being less risky for kernel germinability. Some problems arising from the use of treated kernels need to be investigated and they are pointed out. A new medium, designated as IMM, has been developed for the production of syringomycin (SR) and syringotoxin (ST) in still culture. The production of one of these two phytotoxins by 14 different strains of Pseudomonas syringae pv. syringae proved to be almost always greater in the IMM medium than in the media PDB-CA and, in particular, SRM previously utilized for the production of SR and ST. It was also observed that glucose seems to inhibit the synthesis of ST. On the contrary, the observation that inorganic phosphate (Pi) concentrations of 1 mM or more inhibit the synthesis of SR does not seems true; in the conditions adopted in this work Pi concentration up to 40 mM did not have any effect on SR and ST production.
42685899|Epidemiological studies of barley yellow dwarf luteoviruses (BYDV) in Gramineae began in Portugal in 1988. Aphid monitoring for four consecutive growing seasons showed the presence of three main aphid vectors (Rhopalosiphum padi, R. maidis, and Sitobion avenae ). Aphid infectivity was demonstrated by transmission experiments and the viruliferous status of trapped aphids was assessed serologically. Several Gramineae as well as some dicotyledonous plants were shown to be hosts of cereal aphids. Serological surveys were used to detect BYDV infections in cereals as well as to identify the serotypes present. PAV predominated but RPV, MAV and mixed infections were also detected. Gramineae other than cereals (pasture and forage grasses, wild grasses and weeds) were identified as BYDV reservoirs. Also, the SGV serotype was detected in a cereal volunteer and RMV was detected in a wild oat weed. The importance is stressed of forage grasses, weeds and maize as BYDV or/and aphid reservoirs, mainly during the dry-hot summer periods of Mediterranean climates.

Growing conditions also appeared to influence the severity of the disease. The persistency of the disease was investigated in a grove of Zahdi. Dissections and isolations made from artificially and naturally infected tree tops showed that the fungus persisted on the trees mainly as mycelium on the living tissues of the leaf sheaths and fibers. Surveys made during four and five years after inoculation showed that the disease gradually and progressively spread to the plants surrounding the inoculated area. 42685357|An undescribed disease of Retama sphaerocarpa (L.) Boiss. was found in the central area of Spain in 1996. The disease was characterised by hyperplastic galls on branches, very similar to knots induced by Pseudomonas savastanoi on olive and oleander plants. The causal agent was characterised as a pathovar of Pseudomonas savastanoi. The isolated strains formed a homogeneous group of aerobic, Gram-negative, rod-shaped bacteria, which showed distinct phytopathological features when compared with other pathovars of P. savastanoi. The name P. savastanoi pv. retacarpa pv. nov. is proposed for this new pathovar. The pathotype strain has been deposited in the Coleccin Espaola de Cultivos Tipo, Valencia, Spain, as CECT 4861, and in the National Collection of Plant Pathogenic Bacteria, Sand Hutton, York, U.K as NCPPB 4050.
42685311|Severe decline of oak trees has been observed in Italy in the last fifteen years and attributed to several biotic and abiotic causes. In order to assess the spread and the etiology of oak decline in southern Italy, investigations have been carried out in eight declining oak woods. Oak species affected, site and climatic conditions, plant water potential, anthropic factors (pasturing, silvicultural management, air pollution) and fungi associated to declining plants were evaluated. Quercus cerris L. and Q. frainetto Ten. were more susceptible to decline than Q. pubescens Willd. Highest values of water potentials occurred in susceptible Quercus species. Oak decline proved to be more serious where a prolonged drought had occurred. In several oak woods, susceptible Q. cerris and Q. frainetto tend to be gradually substituted by the more xerotollerant Q. pubescens. This alteration in oak species composition occurred more markedly in old and neglected coppice stands, characterized by overstocking, poor soil fertility, unfavourable exposure and over-pasturing. The following genera of fungi were frequently isolated from diseased oaks: Diplodia, Hypoxylon, Cylindrocarpon, Phoma, Ophiostoma/Ceratocystis, Armillaria, Phellinus. The results of this investigation indicated that oak decline can be controlled by silvicultural practices and careful management.
42683961|An electron microscope study on the changes of fine structure of Gomphrena globosa L.cells infected by Beet mosaic virus (BMV) was carried out using tissues sampled from local lesions of various ages (5, 8, 13, 19 and 43 days old). Cells organelles were variously affected. Mitochondria and chloroplasts showed the most striking modifications. Many nuclei displayed accumulation of protein into globose masses (satellite bodies). Indications are that these nuclear abnormalities might be BMV-specific. Intracytoplasmic inclusions were plentiful.Some consisted of complex proteinaceous structures appearing as pinwheels or bundles depending upon the plane of sectioning. Other inclusions were made up of a series of thin flat plates always connected to the plasma membrane and inserted on it at a right angle. A possible way of formation of the more complex inclusions through a close gathering of these lamellar elements is illustrated. The cytoplasm housed tubular, rigid-looking elements, probably with a protein nature, arranged in bundles or in paracrystalline arrays and numerous virus particles. The latter were scattered at random in the hyaloplasm or were lined up in monolayers. Often, monolayers of BMV particles were contained, along with aggregates of tubules, within peculiar cytoplasmic folds protruding into the vacuole. The function of these structures is briefly discussed. 42685988|Forty-six Monilinia brown rot isolates from different parts of the world were subjected to SDS-PAGE analysis. Total mycelial protein profiles were compared to distinguish between Monilinia species. Fourteen darkstaining repetitive bands, between 66 and 9 kDa, were chosen as representative. The presence or absence of these bands was used to group Monilinia isolates by a similarity index, using UPGMA. Total protein profile pattern polymorphism enabled the brown rot isolates to be clustered in three major groups corresponding to Monilinia laxa, Monilinia fructigena, and Monilinia fructicola. M. laxa was closer to M. fructigena than to M. fructicola. M. fructigena isolates had uniform profiles. Two isolates, both from Australia, gave atypical protein profiles. SDS-PAGE total protein banding pattern phenotypic analysis was a reliable method to discriminate between the three Monilinia species.
42685251|A virus isolated from leaves of greenhouse-grown tomato showing rare ringspot lesions in some plants was characterized as Tobacco Necrosis Virus and named TNV-T. The serological relationship with other known TNV strains indicates that TNV-T has the highest affinity with members belonging to serotype group A according to Babos and Kassanis (1963) classification. A very high serological affinity was shown with the TNV-nft strain isolated from nutrient feeding solution of a bell pepper culture in a greenhouse in Germany. This was also confirmed by identifying molecular weight of TNV-T and TNV-nft coat protein electrophoresis. Protein subunits of both isolates showed a molecular weight of about 29,900 kDa and were easily distinguished after electrophoretic separation from those of TNV-P and TNV-E isolates belonging to serotype D group which have a molecular mass of about 30,000 kDa.

42685415|During the last five years a decline of table grape plants has been noticed in nurseries, young plantations and vineyards of the Northeastern region of Brazil, where the management systems for grapevine production are adapted to the specific environmental conditions of a tropical viticulture. 43872364|Fungi that belong to the genera Aspergillus, Fusarium, and Penicillium pose serious phytopathological and mycotoxicological risks at pre-harvest and post-harvest stages, as well as in processed food products because they can produce several mycotoxins. Mycotoxins pose a serious problem for animal and human health and have a significant economic impact worldwide. The Mediterranean basin is a large geographical region with a temperate climate supporting the cultivation of a wealth of field and greenhouse crops with a high risk of mycotoxin contamination. The most important mycotoxins that occur in the Mediterranean basin are aflatoxins (B1, B2, G1 and G2) in dried fruits and nuts, ochratoxin A in grapes and raisins as well as trichothecenes and fumonisins in cereals. A variety of chemical, biological and physical strategies have been developed to control the mycotoxigenic pathogens; to minimize mycotoxin production at pre- or post-harvest level; to contribute to decontamination and/or detoxification of mycotoxins from contaminated foods and feeds; or to inhibit mycotoxin absorption in the gastrointestinal tract. Biological control using microbial antagonists either alone or as part of an integrated control strategy to reduce pesticide inputs, has emerged as a promising approach for control of mycotoxins in crops, both pre-and post-harvest. Several organisms including atoxigenic Aspergilli, yeasts, bacteria and fungi have been tested for their ability to reduce both fungal infection and mycotoxin contamination. For instance, atoxigenic fungal strains are being used widely to prevent pre-harvest aflatoxin contamination of crops such as peanuts, pistachios, maize, and cottonseed in several parts of the world including the Mediterranean area. Recent advancements in the use of biocontrol strategies have led to registration of commercial products with increased practical applications for the benefit of growers in several countries.

42684730|In summer 1980, in a grape-growing area of the province of Palermo (Sicily) a disease of the yellows type was detected in vines of the white-berried cv. Inzolia. In a short time the disease spread in epidemic form so that now it is present in several areas of all the provinces of Sicily. The early symptoms in July appear as a chlorosis along the veins, yellowing and necrosis of the leaves and wilting of the bunches. Infected shoots have a weeping appearance, mature irregularly or remain green. Immature portions of the canes turn black in winter. The disease has been observed also in a few plants of red-berried grapevine cultivars such as 'Nerello mascalese', 'Perricone' and 'Sangiovese' in which it induces reddening of the leaves. In some arbors the disease was found to affect up to 96% of the vines. The observed symptomatology resembles that reported for flavescence dore and black wood. Studies have been carried out since 1981 for determining the aetiology of the disease, the distribution and epidemiology of the causal agent, the effect of pesticides as a preventive measure against a possible vector, indexing on test plants. Nell'estate del 1980 in una zona vinicola della provincia di Palermo  stata osservata su viti di cv. Inzolia, una malattia di tipo giallume. L'affezione si  estesa in breve tempo in altre aree viticole siciliane si da fare sospettare una diffusione epidemica. I sintomi appaiono in Luglio sotto forma di clorosi lungo le nervature seguite da ingiallimenti e necrosi delle foglie e avvizzimento dei grappoli. I tralci infetti hanno un aspetto procumbente, maturano il legno irregolarmente o rimangono verdi. Le parti immature dei sarmenti anneriscono in inverno. La malattia  stata anche osservata su alcune viti ad uva nera di cv. Nerello mascalese, Perricone e Sangiovese nelle quali induce arrossamenti fogliari. In alcuni tendoni l'incidenza dell'alterazione  risultata elevatissima (fino al 96% di piante colpite). I sintomi della malattia ricordano quelli della flavescenza dorata o dellegno riccio. Dal 1981 ricerche sono in corso per accertare l'eziologia della malattia, la distribuzione e l'epidemiblogia del suo agente, l'effetto di trattamenti insetticidi contro un possibile vettore, le possibilit di saggio su indicatori differenziali.

42684371|Pathological degenerative changes induced by Barley yellow dwarf virus (BYDV) on several leaf tissues of Barley and Oat were examined by means of the light microscope. They consisted of a necrotic obliteration of phloem elements of the median and parietal vascular bundles, collapse of xylem elements of the parietal vascular bundles, necrosis of dispersed ground parenchyma cells. Furthermore, the pericyclic sheath of the vascular bundle and the sclerenchymatous Strand, which extends between the vascular bundle and the upper and lower epidermis, tended to turn into unspecialized parenchymatous tissues. Finally, the collenchymatous aggregation, located superficially in the middle of the lower leaf surface, underwent hypoplasia. The suffer appearance and the erect growth habit of infected plants was the result of all those disturbances. The increased thickness of infected leaves might be also attributed to the intervention of several hypertrophied tissues. The extent of all these abnormalities induced by BYDV was strictly correlated to the developmental stage at which plants were infected and to the degree of differentiation of several tissues when infection took place. Sono state studiate al microscopio ottico le alterazioni patologiche indotte dal virus del giallume dell'Orzo (BYDV) in tessuti di Orzo e Avena. Queste consistono nell'obliterazione necrotica di cellule floematiche dei fasci vascolari mediani e parietali nonch nel collasso di elementi xilematici dei fasci parietali e nella necrosi di cellule parenchimatiche distribuite a caso. Inoltre, il periciclo dei fasci vascolari e delle fibre sclerenchimatiche che si estende tra i fasci stessi e le due epidermidi, tende a trasformarsi in tessuto parenchimatico non specializzato. Infine, i collechimi superficiali posti al centro delia pagina inferiore delle foglie divengono ipoplastici. L'aspetto rgido e l'habitus eretto delle piante infette sembra dipendere da queste alterazioni, mentre l'aumento in spessore delle lamine fogliari sembra poter essere attribuibile alla presenza di tessuti ipertrofici. La gravit delle anomalie indotte da BYDV  strettamente correlata alio stadio di sviluppo delle piante al momento dell'infezione e in particular modo al grado di differenziazione dei tessuti all'atto della infezione.

Analysis was carried out on the bacterial population composition from the phylloplane of Olive and Oleander plants affected by Olive knot/ disease. Some phenotypic characteristics were studied: i) antagonistic activity against Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi, the causal bacterium in Olive knot/ disease; ii) in vitro 3-indolacetic acid production; iii) ice nucleation activity. In the spring and summer 1984, 2300 colonies were collected from Olive and Oleander leaves. Out of these 2300 colonies, sixty morphologically different ones were chosen and subjected to 24 diagnostic tests. The results permitted the identification of these isolates belonging to the genera Pseudomonas (33%), Bacillus (22%), Xanthomonas (10%), Acinetobacter (7%), Erwinia (5%), Serratia (3%), Lactobacillus (3%), Coryne bacterium (3%), Flavobacterium (2%) and to an unidentified Nitrogen-fixing/ group of bacteria (8%). Of the 60 isolates, 11 belonging to the genera Pseudomonas (2), Bacillus (4), Xanthomonas (2), Lactobacillus (1) and to the Nitrogenfixers (2) were found to produce in vitro S-indolacetic-acid (IAA) in amounts varying from 1.2 to 25.3 mg/1 of culture media. Besides, 3 IAA producer isolates (OTG 23, OTG 12 and NTG 7), inoculated in to stems of young Olive plants, caused new tissue development. The antibacterial activity of all 60 isolates was studied and 10 isolates belonging to the genera Pseudomonas (2), Bacillus (3), Lactobacillus (2), Acinetobacter (1) and to the Nitrogen-fixers (2) were shown to produce antibacterial substances active against some Pseudomonas syringae pathovars (pv. maculicola, pv. glycinea, pv. savastanoi). Finally, none of the 60 isolates had an ice nucleation at temperature ranging from 0C to -5C. All of the above results suggest that some important interactions may occur between epiphytic bacteria and Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi on Olive plants.

Hug. e su alcune relazioni intercorrenti fra pianta ospite e patgeno, con i seguenti risultati: a) il distacco e la successiva disseminazione dei conidi non sono effettuati dal vento ma esclusivamente dalla pioggia; b) le infezioni avvengono soltanto in corrispondenza di precipitazioni; c) la diffusione del patogeno  limitata a breyi distanze dalla sorgente di inoculo; d) nell'oliveto la propagazione della malattia  lenta; e) le foglie maggiormente sensibili alle infezioni sono quelle di pi recente formazione; f) tra le cultivar di Olivo  Moraiolo ,  Frantoio  e  Leccino , la  Moraiolo   la pi recettiva aile infezioni; sulla  Leccino  il patogeno si sviluppa molto pi lentamente. Field researches on the Olive leaf spot caused by the fungus Spilocaea oleaginea (Cast.) Hug. have taken to the following results: a) conidia are not detached and spread by wind or by other atmospheric agents, but exclusively by rain; b) the infections occur only during the rainfall; c) the disease speads only to short distances from infected trees; d) the spread of leaf spot is very slow; e) young leaves are more susceptible than the old one; f) among three Olive varieties,  Moraiolo ,  Frantoio  and  Leccino ,  Moraiolo  appears the most susceptible; on  Leccino  the development of the fungus occurs more slowly. According to these results effective control of leaf spot with fungicides is expected when spray treatments are applied by proper timing, before protracted rains and temperature conditions favorable to the germination of conidia. A particulary effective prevention of the disease will be obtained by spraying affected trees which are a source of conidia for new infections. 43872345|The specificity of fungal endophytes to trees has generally been investigated on allopatric populations. In the present study, specificity was investigated on Quercus cerris and Quercus pubescens growing in sympatry the same site, to examine host-endophyte interactions without interference from habitat-specific selective pressure. In a two-year study, 4800 samples were obtained from photosynthetic and non-photosynthetic tissue (leaves and twigs) both of healthy and declining trees. Endophytes were isolated from surface-sterilized samples and identified by traditional or molecular methods. Twenty-two endophyte species in 19 genera were identified. Some taxa in the Sordariomycetes, Dothideomycetes and Leotiomycetes colonized both species, but quantitative differences evident. Water shortages and extended droughts may have impacted more severely on Q. cerris, which exhibited more diverse endophytic assemblage and greater infection levels than Q. pubescens. In both species, more isolates were recovered from twigs than from leaves, and more from declining than from healthy trees. Endophytes tended to be specific to each host, and to the organs of that host. Interaction between plant species and the environment and continued competitive interaction between endophyte species may have led to niche diversification, with selection favouring host-specific and organ-specific endophytes. This study advances understanding of the role of some pathogenic fungal endophytes in Mediterranean oak forests.
42685234|Fusarium wilt of chickpea (Cicer arietinum) - caused by Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. ciceri, is a seedand soil-borne disease of economic importance. The fungus is systemic and can be isolated from all parts of the infected plant including seed. The survival of the fungus in crop residues was studied from 1978 to 1984. Wilted plants were collected in March 1978 to study fungus survival in leaflets, terminal branches, stems, and roots. Infected plant parts were buried in the soil (Vertisol). The fungus could not survive in the leaflets stored in the laboratory or soil for more than 2 months, but it could survive in terminal branches for 6 months in the laboratory and 9 months in the soil. The fungus could survive on crop residues (root and stem portions) buried in the soil for at least 72 months. The pathogen within the host tissue could not survive in flooded soil for more than 65 days; however, it could survive for over 200 days in the soil which was kept continually wet. Influence of crop rotation and intercropping on wilt incidence in chickpea was studied from 1980 to 1983. The crops included were sorghum, maize, and wheat. The study was conducted in a portion of a wilt sick plot, developed at ICRISAT Center, Patancheru, using a highly susceptible cultivar JG 62. At the end of a 3-year study, no significant reduction in wilt incidence was observed.

On the contrary, mutant strains B133, auxotrophic for glycine and B310, auxotrophic for arginine, producers of 5 and 72 units of SR/ml of culture filtrate, respectively, failed to grow. These results seems to indicate some influence of SR (and ST) on the multiplication of pv. syringae in maize and on the induction of disease symptoms or hypersensitive reactions.

Zearalenone, an estrogenic mycotoxin produced by Gibberella zeae (Schw.) This virus has a thermal inactivation point between 50 and 60 C, dilution end point between 10 and 10 and longevity in vitro of 4-5 days. Four different purification methods were tried. Cross-protection tests, carried out on Tobacco plants with this virus and with CMV-Y, always gave positive results. 42685820|The role of the leaves that fall to the ground from infected twigs is still a poorly understood aspect of mal secco epidemiology. Trials were carried out in the growth chamber and leaves fallen from infected twigs were collected in the field in order to investigate the influence of temperature and host susceptibility on the presence of the pathogen inside the leaves of infected plants. In the growth chamber trials, the highest percentage of leaves hosting the pathogen was obtained at the lowest tested temperature (10C). 'Femminello' lemon leaves showed a higher presence of the pathogen than sour orange and 'Monachello' lemon. In the field, leaves collected in spring contained higher quantities of the pathogen than in autumn. Since the leaves of infected branches may provide inoculum for root infections, it seems that these findings should be taken into consideration during sanitation pruning, of susceptible lemon cultivare such as 'Femminello' especially at the beginning of the spring. Un aspetto ancora incerto della epidemiologia del mal secco  il ruolo svolto dalle foglie cadute al suolo da piante infette. Al riguardo sono state s volte prove in cella climatica e sono state raccolte foglie da rami infetti in campo per verificare l'influenza della temperatura e della suscettibilit dell'ospite sulla presenza del patogeno nelle foglie cadute da piante infette. In cella climatica la pi elevata percentuale di foglie infette  stata riscontrata alla pi bassa temperatura saggiata (10C). Nelle foglie di limone 'Femminello'  stata riscontrata una maggiore presenza del patogeno rispetto a quelle di arancio amaro e di 'Monachello'. Nelle foglie raccolte in campo  risultata una pi elevata presenza del patogeno in primavera rispetto all'autunno. Poich le foglie infette cadute al suolo possono costituire fonte di inoculo per le infezioni radicali, di questi risultati si dovrebbe tener conto nel mettere in atto interventi cesori di risanamento, in particular modo ad inizio primavera e per le cultivar di limone pi suscettibili, quale il 'Femminello'.
42685391|The phytosanitary status of pome fruit trees was examined in Tunisia, in surveys conducted in spring 2009 and 2010, in the main Tunisian mother blocks. A total of 248 samples were collected (111 from apple, 106 from pear and 31 from quince), and tested for the presence of Apple chlorotic leaf spot virus (ACLSV) and Apple mosaic virus (ApMV) using ELISA and RT-PCR, and for Apple stem pitting virus (ASPV) using RT-PCR. 37% of the samples were infected by at least one virus. ACLSV was the most widespread virus (34% of samples), followed by ApMV (4%). Furthermore, molecular analysis showed that 69% of the sampled trees were infected and apple was the most infected species (80%), followed by pear (75%) and quince (10%). ASPV was the most prevalent virus (46%), followed by ACLSV (39%) and ApMV (10). Mixed infections occurred in several trees, and the most common combination was ASPV+ACLSV (23%). This is the first report on the presence of viruses infecting pome fruits in Tunisia.
42684367|A hitertho undescribed virus for which the name of artichoke vein banding virus (AVBV) is proposed, has been isolated in Apulia (Southern Italy) from Artichoke plants showing mild and transitory chlorotic discolourations along the veins. AVBV possesses isodiametric particles about 30 nm in diameter which sediment as three components (T, M and B) when centrifuged in sucrose density gradient columns or in the analitycal ultracentrifuge. Component T sediments at about 56 S, is composed by empty protein shells and is not infectious. Component M (92 S) and B (124 S) are both nucleoproteins. The nucleic acid is a single-stranded RNA occurring as two functional species with molecular weight of 1.510 (RNA-2) and 2.1  10 (RNA-1) estimated by polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Component M particles contain 1 molecule of RNA-2 whereas the particles of component B contain either 1 molecule of RNA-1 or 2 molecules of RNA-2. Both RNAs are required for infectivity although some residual infectiyity was found associated with RNA-1 even after heating in presence of 8 M urea. The protein coat is composed by three polypeptides with molecular weight of 27,500, 24.500 and 22,000. AVBV is serologically unrelated to 20 plant viruses with isometric particles including 13 nepoviruses. Because of its phvsico-chemical and hydrodynamic characteristics, AVBV resembles nepoviruses and, although the vector is not known, it seems to be a likely new member of this group having the following cryptogram: $R/1\,:\,\frac{{2,1\, - \,1,5}}{{37}}\, + \,\frac{{1,5}}{{24}}\,:\,S/S\,:\,S/*.$ Nella presente Nota si descrivono le caratteristiche di un nuovo virus isolato da Carciofo in Puglia e denominato virus delia scolorazione perinervale (Artichoke vein banding virus, AVBV). AVBV ha particelle isodiametriche di circa 30 nm, che sottoposte a centrifugazione in gradienti di den sit di sacarosio o in centrifuga analtica, sedimentano come 3 componenti: il pi leggero, costituito da capsidi proteici vuoti, ha coeficiente di sedimentazione pari a 56 S e non  infettivo; il componente intermedio, M, e quello pi pesante, B, hanno spettri di assorbimento UV tipici di nucleoproteine e coefficienti di sedimentazione di 92 e 124 S, rispettivamente. L'acido nucleico estratto da AVBV  un RNA monocatenario, che  presente nel virus sotto forma di 2 tipi di molecole: RNA-1 e RNA-2 con pesi molecolari, determinan dopo elettroforesi su gel di poliacrilamide, di 2,1  10 e 1,5  10 dalton rispettivamente. Il componente M contiene solo RNA-2; ment re il pi pesante pu albergare nel proprio capside una sola molecola di RNA-1 oppure 2 molecole di RNA-2. Entrambe le specie di RNA sono necessarie all'infezione, ma l'RNA-1, pur se estratto con calore in presenza di urea 8 M, conserva residui di infettivit. 42685429|Gummosis is the most important disease of pistachio trees in Iranian pistachio orchards. Phytophthora pistaciae, the main causal agent of this disease, was isolated and described from Kerman province of Iran for the first time. The present study aimed to establish the host range, morphological characteristics and ribosomal genome of P. pistaciae isolates. During 2009-2010, isolates of P. pistaciae were sampled from 12 infected pistachio plantations in Kerman and Yazd provinces of Iran. Based on phylogenetic analysis of ITS regions, all isolates belonged to a monophyletic clade and clustered with P. pistaciae from other studies. The isolates were high temperature tolerant and produced non-papillate, ellipsoid to ovoid sporangia with polar caps, and were non-caducous, sympodial and had internal and external proliferation. The isolates were mothallic and produced spherical oogonia with smooth walls and paragynous, rarely amphigynous, spherical to ovoid antheridia. Oospores were spherical, colorless and aplerotic. Isolates generated chlamydospores in host tissues. The host range of P. pistaciae is not limited to pistachio species. Almond, walnut, apricot, grape, mango, sour cherry, among woody plants, and pea, different types of beans, chickpea, faba bean, safflower and okra, among herbaceous plants, were shown to be potential hosts of the pathogen. This study showed that isolates of P. pistaciae were homogenous in ITS rDNA genome and their host range, and morphological traits were similar.

Welt. involved laboratory and greenhouse experiments to study the germination and infectivity of conidia and ascospores and the host range of the pathogen. Highly significant increases in yield of roots, tops and sugar were obtained by fungicidal treatments. No significant differences were seen among the different treatments in the percent dry matter, fat, protein, fiber and ash content of the foliage. 43871735|A suppression subtractive hybridization (SSH) approach was used to generate cDNA libraries representing genes differentially expressed in the haploid cells of the maize head smut pathogen Sporisorium reilianum exposed to GR24, a strigolactone analogue. Strigolactones are present in root exudates and have been known to trigger germination of parasitic plant seeds and signal mycorrhizal fungi to connect to root systems forming mutualistic relationships. Cell respiration increased within 1 h after GR24 addition, but decreased after 5 and 8 h. All induced cells were used to construct a cDNA library, which contained 1440 clones. The cDNA ESTs were deposited on macro-array membranes and hybridized with P cDNA probes obtained from mRNA isolated from S. reilianum yeast cultures exposed or not to 100 nM GR24 for three time intervals. A total of 678 ESTs were identified as differentially expressed during three time-courses in response to GR24. A set of 36 candidate genes were analyzed by qRT-PCR that presented an induction of the genes at 1 h, confirming the hybridization data. Induced genes mostly affect catalysis functions (45%) like cell respiration (27%), and cell signaling (26%). Although the biological significance of this perception remains hypothetical, these results indicate mat strigolactones could have a wider biological influence in the rhizosphere than previously recognized.
42685720|E' stato condotto uno studio sulle caratteristiche di alcune scale per la valutazione della gravit della ruggine bruna su foglie di frumento. Sono state analizzate le valutazioni fatte da otto osservatori usando tre scale, differenti per numero e graduazione delle classi. Per ciascuna scala  stato valutato: il grado di ripetibilit, di riproducibilit, di accuratezza e di discriminazione. I risultati hanno dimostrato che scale diverse forniscono valutazioni differenti e che, pertanto,  molto importante conoscere le caratteristiche di una scala di valutazione prima di applicarla. A study on the performances of three assessment methods of rust severity on wheat was made. The methods differed from one another in the number of classes and in the progression of the gradation of classes. The repeatibility, the reproducibility, the accuracy and the discriminative capacity of the estimates made by some observers using the three methods was evaluated. Results show that different methods give different evaluations, so it is necessary to know the performances of an assessment method before its application.

42684896|1,3--glucanase and chitinase have been determined in plants subject to stresses that delay symptom expression and colonization in Fusarium wilt of Tomato. Treatment of the root with heat or chloroform or root inoculation with a nonpathogenic form of F. oxysporum systemically stimulated in roots, stem and leaves both enzymes which showed maxima of activity after 3-5 days. Variations of 1,3--glucanase and chitinase activity paralleled the variations of peroxidase, polyphenoloxidase, phenols concentration and ethylene release that had been observed in previous work. It is suggested that stimulation of glycosidases is part of a common physiological syndrome associated to death of the cells of part of the rootlets. Inoculation with F. lycopersici caused further increases of enzyme activity in previously stressed plants, more intense than those induced in control plants. The relation among induced resistance, glycosidases and production of ethylene are discussed. Snyd. et Hans.). Si suggerisce che gli incrementi delle attivit glicosidasiche siano parte di una comune sindrome da stress associata alla morte di parte delle cellule radicali. 42685313|A comparison of the chemical composition of exopolysaccharide (EPS) fractions obtained from two phytopathogenic strains of Pseudomonas syringae subsp. savastanoi and grown on three different culture media is reported. Strain ITM317, which is virulent on olive plants but avirulent on oleander, and strain ITM519, which is virulent on both plants, were investigated and their EPS fractions were found to be similar when they were extracted from the same culture medium. Depending on the medium employed the EPS fractions consisted of alginates, of glucans and lipopolysaccharides, or of heteropolysaccharides, the last consisting of fucose, galactose, 2-deoxy-2-acetamidoglucose, and 2-deoxy-2-acetamidogalactose. Tests of some EPS fractions on water-soaking induction and on the inhibition of knot-formation on bean and oleander plants respectively are also reported. From the tests performed it was concluded that EPSs produced by strains of P. syringae subsp. savastanoi from olive did not interfere with knot induction on oleander by homologous strains.
43871745|During a survey in a pine stand in Rome, six basidiomes of Ganoderma adspersum were collected from declining 50-60 year-old Pinus pinea. Species identification was accomplished through observation of macroscopic and microscopic morphological traits. Furthermore, ITS sequences of the collected specimens, 28 samples collected elsewhere, one isolate from the German collection of Microorganisms and Cell Cultures (DSMZ), and 21 sequences from GenBank were analyzed using MP and UPGMA. Both analyses showed that isolates fell into four well-delineated clades, namely G. adspersum, G. applanatum, G. resinaceum and G. lucidum. All the isolates collected from P. pinea were confirmed as G. adspersum. Previously, G. adspersum had been reported on hardwood trees and infrequently on a few conifers. Only sporocarps identified on the basis of morphological characters as G. applanatum have sporadically been recorded on P. pinea; there is no previous record of G. adspersum on this host. Somatic incompatibility tests showed that infections, probably via basidiospores, and symptoms apparently associated with wood colonization by G. adspersum, worsened during the 3-year course of the study.
42685301|A virus disease of lentil (Lens culinaris) characterized by yellowing and severe stunting was observed in northern Syria during the spring of 1994. The virus was not mechanically transmitted, but persistently transmitted by the pea aphid Acyrthosiphon pisum. Electron microscopy of negatively stained infected-tissue extracts and purified virus preparations revealed angular, luteovirus-like, isometric particles ca. 28 nm in diameter. SDS-polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis revealed that the virus capsid protein size was 23K. Serological data, employing monoclonal and polyclonal antibodies in double antibody sandwich ELISA (DAS-ELISA), triple antibody sandwich ELISA (TAS-ELISA), ISEM, and tissue-blot immunoassay (TBIA) suggested the virus is serologically similar to soybean dwarf virus (SbDV) and related to subterranean clover red leaf virus (SCRLV). On the basis of host range, transmission characteristics, serology and electron microscopy, the lentil virus isolate SL1-94 was identified as SbDV. A distant serological relationship to four other luteoviruses was detected by immunoelectron microscopy (IEM). This is the first report of SbDV naturally infecting lentil in Syria and in the West Asia and North Africa regions.

42685974|From a faba bean leaf sample collected in Libya a tobravirus was isolated. By its experimental host range, symptoms, food legume genotypical reaction, particle sizes and morphology, and serological decoration in the electron microscope, it could be identified as an isolate of the type strain serotype of pea early-browning virus. This is the first report on the occurrence of the virus in Libya, and in North Africa east of Algeria. It may already be of actual, but is at least of potential importance to the country.
42685552|Several ELISA variants, using antisera from different animal species (chicken, rabbit and goat) were evaluated for their ability to detect citrus tristeza virus (CTV) in infected citrus tissue. When protein A and goat antirabbit IgG (GR) were labelled with alkaline phosphatase and tested for CTV detection, both conjugates proved to be suitable, the latter however, being by far more reactive. When a preformed complex of anti CTV rabbit IgG and GRconjugate was used, the indirect ELISA procedure was shortened by 10-50% without much loss in detectability. Greater loss in A405 values was obtained when the procedure was reduced to a one working day. However, CTV-infected tissue was still detectable. Polystyrene beads proved to be as reliable as the plates. When using an indirect ELISA variant, the use of the beads led to an increase in the A values of infected tissue by 10-50% without any noticeable effect on the healthy readings. Sono state valutate alcune varianti del metodo ELISA, usando antisieri prodotti in diverse specie animali (polio, coniglio, capra), ai fini dell'identificazione del virus della tristeza (CTV) in tessuti infetti di agrumi. Sia la proteina A che immunoglobuline anti-coniglio di capra (GR), coniugate con fosfatasi alcalina, sono adatte alio scopo, ma le seconde sono molto pi efficienti della prima. Quando si usa un complesso preformato di immunoglobuline di coniglio e GR coniugate, il tempo necessario per il test  ridotto di 3 ore con poca perdita di sensibilit. L'efficienza del metodo, per,  notevolmente ridotta quando tutto il procedimento viene attuato in un solo giorno. Sfefe di polistirolo possono essere usate al posto delle piastre. Con esse, con il metodo indiretto, i valori di A possono essere del 10-50% superiori a quelli ottenuti con Tuso delle piastre, mentre quelli per i tessuti sani sono pressoch eguali.
42685948|Diseased elms (Ulmus carpinifolia Gled.) growing in the Basilicata Region (Southern Italy) showed yellowing, leaf epinasty, little leaf, stunting, premature casting of leaves and pronounced witches' brooms. MLOs were found in such plants but not in healthy controls. The MLOs were detected by fluorescence and electron microscopy and PCR amplification of a 16S rRNA gene fragment. They were characterized by AluI restriction endonuclease digestion and RFLP analysis. Electron microscopy revealed MLOs, often strongly degenerated, only in mature sieve elements. Callose was heavily deposited in sieve tubes containing MLOs, and collapsed sieve elements were scattered through the phloem in all diseased samples. This is the first report on detection of MLOs in elms in Southern Italy.
42685210|A DNA molecule, 2773 nucleotides long, was isolated from tomato plants infected by tomato yellow leaf curl geminivirus in Sicily (TYLCV-Sc). The DNA was cloned and sequenced. Comparisons with other TYLCV isolates from Sardinia and Spain (western Mediterranean) showed high total sequence homology (above 90%), although homology was lower (80-84%) in the intergenic regions. Total DNA homology dropped to 76% when TYLCV-Sc was compared with an isolate from Israel (TYLCV-Is). This lower homology was confirmed by the use of digoxigenin-labelled probes prepared from TYLCV-Sc and TYLCV-Is. In dot blot experiments on samples collected in different Mediterranean areas the TYLCV-Sc probe reacted strongly with western Mediterranean isolates and moderately with those from the eastern Mediterranean. The cloned TYLCV-Sc DNA replicated in tobacco protoplasts and no differences were observed in viral DNA forms compared to TYLCV-Sr, an isolate from Sardinia.
42684736|The etiology of Grapevine leafroll (GLR) and stem-pitting (GSP) diseases is still uncertain, and various kinds of virus (a potyvirus, closterovirus-like particles, small isometric particles) have at times been implicated. Using the techniques of immunosorbent electron microscopy and decoration, 25 different grapevines suffering from GLR or GSP were examined for the presence of the two closteroviruses grapevine virus A (GVA) and B (GVB): 12 GLR samples and 9 GSP samples contained both GVA and GVB; two GLR samples and one GSP sample contained GVB alone, while none contained GVA alone. No closterovirus particles were detected in three healthy controls and in one GSP sample. Attempts to infect Grapevine seedlings with GVA from Nicotiana clevelandii Gray by mechanical inoculation or grafting were negative, as were attempts to transmit GVB from grapevines to herbaceous hosts. L'eziologia delle ampelopatie note come accartocciamento fogliare (GLR) e legno riccio (GSP)  tuttora incerta, sebbene in viti affette dall'una o dall'altra malattia sia stata rilevata la presenza di diversi tipi di virus (un potyvirus, alcuni closterovirus e virus isodiametrici piccoli). Mediante le tecniche di microscopia elettronica immuno-adsorbente e decorazione sono stati controllati per la presenza dei due closterovirus grapevine virus A (GVA) e grapevine virus B (GVB) 25 diverse viti affette da GLR o da GSP: 12 piante con GLR e 9 con GSP sono risultate affette sia da GVA che GVB, 2 piante con GLR e 1 con GSP dal solo GVB, nessuna pianta dal solo GVA. Tre piante sane di controllo ed una affetta da GSP non contenevano particelle di closterovirus. Diversi tentativi effettuati per infettare con GVA giovani semenzali di Vite mediante inoculazione meccanica o innesto da Nicotiana clevelandii Gray sono stati negativi, cosi come altri tentativi per trasmettere GVB da Vite a piante erbacee.
42685918|La variabilit morphologique chez Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici a t recherche  deux niveaux: au sein d'une population de conidies provenant du thalle d'un isolat (variabilit interclonale) et au sein d'une population de conidies provenant d'un thalle issu d'un clonage monospore (variabilit intraclonale). Enfin, cette variabilit a t tudie sur des cultures jeunes et ges. L'ensemble des essais a t ralis sur deux isolate. Les rsultats mettent en vidence l'existence d'une variabilit morphologique importante, mais galement des rponses diffrentes suivant les deux isolats. La variabilit interclonale n'a t observe que chez l'un des isolats et semble tre une proprit constitutive de l'isolat. La variabilit intraclonale se manifeste chez les deux isolats, mais uniquement au sein d'une population de conidies rcoltes sur des thalles gs. Dans ce dernier cas, on observe une forte augmentation de la frquence d'apparition d'un morphotype considr comme snescent sans, toutefois, que cette forme soit irrversiblement acquise: on note un taux non ngligeable de rversion vers des morphotypes considrs comme juvniles. The morphological variability of two isolates of Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici was investigated both within inter-and intraclonal populations of conidia from young and old cultures. Data show the occurrence of pronounced interclonal variability in conidia from one of the isolates only, whereas the two isolates displayed intraclonal variability. Nevertheless, this intraclonal variability was evidenced on old cultures only. A high percentage of the resulting sub-cultures were of a senescent type. However reversion from this type to a juvenile one was also observed, indicating that senescence was not permanently acquired.
42684733|Substrates of carbon-coated Parlodion-covered 200-mesh electron microscope grids made in Maryland, USA and sent, via air-mail, to Stellenbosch, RSA, were used for extracts from field-grown grapevines exhibiting symptoms of leafroll, stem-pitting, corky bark, Merlot-disease, fanleaf complex (proper, vein banding, yellow mosaic), fleck, yellow speckle and enations. The tissues, internodal bark, petioles, shoot apices and young leaves were extracted in 0.01 M phosphate buffer containing 2.5% nicotine (final pH 9.8) and the extract negatively stained on the substrates whith 2% ammonium molybdate, pH 5.0, applied dropwise. Electron microscopy, in Maryland, of such preparations detected closterovirus-like particles ca. 700  10 nm in extracts from grapevines exhibiting symptoms of leafroll, stem-pitting, corky bark and also in vines not exhibiting symptoms of disease. Extracts from 'Merlot' vines showing symptoms of Merlot-disease contained, in addition to the closterovirus-like particles, spherical viral-like particles ca. 27 nm in diam. Long flexuous viral-like particles ca. 1300  8 nm were detected in extracts from a 'Queen of the vineyard' vine exhibiting symptoms of corky bark. The results show that electron microscopy can detect viral-like particles in extracts from grapevines and that the preparation can be sent long distances through the mails (Postal Service). The detection of similar closterovirus-like particles in extracts from grapevines exhibiting symptoms of leafroll, stem pitting, corky bark and in symptomless vines questions the closterovirus, per se, etiology for any single disease of grapevines whose agent(s) is only graft transmissible. Tessuti di corteccia internodale, piccioli, apici dei germogli e foglie giovani sono stati estratti in tampone fosfato 0,01 M con nicotina al 2,5% (pH finale 9,8) e gli estratti sono stati colorati negativamente con una soluzione acquosa di molibdato di ammonio al 2,5%, pH 5,0, applicata goccia a goccia. Osservazioni al microscopio elettronico di questi preparati, effettuate nel Maryland, hanno dimostrato la presenza di particelle closterovirus-simili di circa 700  10 nm in estratti di viti con sintomi di accartocciamento fogliare, legno riccio, suberosi corticale e in viti senza sintomi apparenti di malattia. 42685831|Olive tree cultivars, either native or introduced in Portugal, were surveyed for the presence of Strawberry latent ringspot nepovirus (SLRV). Field observations showed that virus-like symptoms, as leaf and fruit deformations, were relatively common but occurred with higher incidence in some cultivars, as Negrinha. A few experiments have shown that cuttings taken from trees showing severe leaf and fruit symptoms, had a much lower rooting ability as compared with those, of the same cultivar, without symptoms. Extracts of symptomatic fruits produced symptoms when mechanically inoculated onto indicator plants and similar results were obtained when extracts of whole flowers, taken from the same trees, were used. Results from DAS-ELISA revealed that SLRV can be detected in olive fruits and leaves, either showing symptoms or not, and also in young leaves and roots from rooted cuttings. Identical results were obtained with "indirect" ELISA but with less specificity. A total of 247 samples from 25 cultivars were analysed by DAS-ELISA and SRLV was detected in 47 samples. Alcune prove hanno dimostrato che talee prelevate da alberi presentanti sintomi sulle foglie e sui frutti, hanno una minore potenzialit rizogena nei confronti di quelle prelevate da alberi senza sintomi. 42684727|In studies carried out in southern Sardinia, the yield of vines of cv. Questo valore raggiungeva il 55% se le piante con legno riccio erano anche affette da GFV, accertato sia per via biologica (inoculazioni su indicatrici erbacee), sia mediante la tecnica ELISA. 42685757|Diversi campioni di Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici prelevati da varie cultivar di frumento e da differenti localit della Puglia e della Basilicata, quando venivano moltiplicati in serra presentavano una bassa infettivit e una scarsa produzione di pustole e di uredospore. Ci era causato da Darluca filum Cast., un fungo iperparassita di P. recondita e di altre specie appartenenti agli Uredinali. Detto fungo  stato riscontrato soprattutto sui campioni di ruggine provenienti dall'arco Jonico. Il periodo di latenza e lo sviluppo di D. filum sembra essere influenzato dalla temperatura, dalla luminosit, dalla suscettibilit della cultivar alla ruggine e dallo stadio di sviluppo di quest'ultima. Contribuendo soprattutto alla riduzione della produzione di uredospore di P. recndita e di altri Uredinali, D. filum pu essere presa in considerazione come un valido componente di lotta integrata verso tali patogeni. Some samples of Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici, picked from different wheat cultivare and localities in the regions of Apulia and Basilicata, showed a low infectivity rate and a scarse production of pustules and urediniospores when multiplied in the greenhouse. The causal agent was identified as Darluca filum Cast., a hyperparasite of P. recondita and other Uredinales. The fungus was prevalent in the rust samples coming from the wheat fields on the Ionian coast. The latent period of D. filum and its development seem influenced by temperature and luminosity, by the cultivar susceptibility to the rust and by the development stage of the pathogen. To contribute to the reduction of the urediniospores production of P. recondita and other Uredinales, D. filum may be considered as a good agent in programs of rust integrated control.
43872335|Effects of increased CO and temperature on powdery mildew (Podosphaera xanthii) of zucchini (Cucurbita pepo), were evaluated under controlled conditions. Zucchini plants were grown in phytotrons under four different simulated climatic conditions: 450 ppm of CO at standard (18C night, 24C day) and elevated temperatures (22C night, 28C day), elevated CO (800 ppm) with standard temperature and elevated CO (800 ppm) with elevated temperature (4C higher than standard). Physiological responses of zucchini and pathogen development were studied. Under elevated CO both healthy and infected zucchini plants grew better when temperature was lower. Elevated CO generally caused no significant differences in pathogen development or disease severity, whereas elevated temperature stimulated the development of the pathogen. A combination of elevated CO and temperature always stimulated the development of the pathogen and disease severity compared to standard conditions.
42685398|A novel pathogenesis-related protein 4 (PR4) encoding gene, LcPR4a, was induced in Lens culinaris following Ascochyta lentis infection. LcPR4a encodes a predicted 146 amino acid protein of 15.8 kDa. The putative LcPR4a protein belongs to the class II PR4 family and has close phylogenetic affinity to PR4 proteins from related species. qPCR analysis revealed differential expression of the LcPR4a gene upon Ascochyta lentis infection in both resistant and susceptible cultivars. This, combined with preliminary in vitro antifungal assays of the recombinant protein expressed in E. coli, suggests the potential important role of LcPR4a in the defence response of lentil to Ascochyta lentis attack.
42684902|Indagini effettuate su porzioni internodali di rametti di tre diverse cultivars di Olivo, allevate in Puglia, hanno messo in evidenza che sui tessuti delle piante erano presenti nuclei di cristallizzazione del ghiaccio non identificabili con batteri criogeni. Tali nuclei criogeni, risultati alquanto stabili a diversi trattamenti fisici e chimici, sono apparsi in grado di catalizzare la cristallizzazione dell'acqua soprafusa nelle provette contenenti i pezzi di rametti in un intervallo di temperatura compreso tra  2,7 e  5,5C. Prove condotte alio scopo di studiare l'effetto di talune condizioni sperimentali sul congelamento in vitro dei pezzi di rametti hanno indicato, tra l'altro, che la temperatura di congelamento dei campioni esaminati non era influenzata in maniera significativa dalla quantit di tessuto saggiato e dal tempo di incubazione alle basse temperature. Questi risultati e soprattutto il fatto che la temperatura alla quale si aveva formazione di ghiaccio nelle provette contenenti i pezzi di rametti era invariabilmente distribuita in un intervallo piuttosto ampio (tra 2 ,7 e 5,5C), ha permesso di ipotizzare una distribuzione diseguale dei nuclei criogeni sulle piante di Olivo. Si ipotizza infine, che tali nuclei criogeni possano favorire l'insorgenza di danni da freddo e, successivamente, di infezioni di rogna da Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi. A survey of the internode pieces of twigs of three different olive cultivars grown in Apulia revealed the presence of ice nucleating agents not identifiable with cryogenic bacteria on the tissue samples. The cryogenic nuclei, which appeared quite stable under a range of physical and chemical treatments, were able to catalyze the formation of ice in the test tubes containing the pieces of twigs at temperatures ranging from  2.7C to -5.5C. Experiments performed with the purpose of sty dying the effect of some experimental conditions on the temperature of ice nucleation showed that the nucleation temperature was not significantly affected by sample mass or by incubation length at each temperature. These results and the fact that the temperature at which ice formation occurred in the test tubes containing the pieces of olive twigs was invariably distributed in a wide range of temperatures (between -2.7 and -5.5C) enabled us to suppose that the distribution of ice nuclei in or on olive twitgs may be uneven. The hypothesis that the ice nucleating agents associated with olive tissues can promote frost damage to the plants and, subsequently, infections of Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi, the causal agent of olive knot disease, is presently being studied.
42684751|In the Federal Republic of Germany, up to now, five different nepoviruses have been detected in grapevines. All these induce decreased vigour and yield losses, but at a different rate and with diversified leaf symptoms. In the Palatinate, the most frequently occuring and widespread viruses are Grapevine fanleaf (GFV), Arabis mosaic (ArMV) and Raspberry ringspot (RRV). Tomato black ring (TBRV) and Strawberry latent ringspot (SLRV) viruses seem to be of local importance only. The most frequent vector-virus combinations are: Xiphinema index and X. vuittenezi with GFV; X. diversicaudatum with ArMV. Patchy spread of RRV seems to be associated mainly with Siddiqia maxima, whereas Longidorus macrosoma, a recognized vector of RRV, is limited to only a few soils. Economic damages, as expressed by yield losses and rate of spread of the disease in the field are highest with GFV-X index and ArMV-X diversicaudatum combinations. The combination RRV-L. macrosoma also induces severe losses but occurs seldom. In vineyards where S. maxima occurs, RRV is spread at a very high rate but severe damages appear only after some years from disease onset. A tutt'oggi cinque diversi nepovirus sono stati segnalati su Vite in Germania. Tutti riducono il vigore vegetativo e la produzione delle piante ancorch in modo diversificato. Nel Palatinato i virus pi diffusi sono l'arricciamento della Vite (GFV), il mosaico dell'Arabis (ArMV) e la maculatura anulare del Lampone (RRV) mentre i virus della maculatura anulare nera del Pomodoro (TBRV) e della maculatura anulare latente della Fragola (SLRV) sembrano rivestire solo importanza locale. Le combinazioni vettore-virus pi frequenti sono: Xiphinema index e X. vuittenezi con GFV; X. diversicaudatum con ArMV. La diffusione nei vigneti di RRV sembra associata pi alla presenza di Siddiqia maxima che di Longidorus macrosoma che  limitato a pochi terreni. I pi elevati danni economici basati sulla stima delle perdite di prodotto, sono dati dalle combinazioni X. index-GFV e X. diversicaudatum-ArMV. L'associazione L. macrosoma-RRV  anch'essa assai dannosa ma rara. Nei vigneti con S. maxima, RRV si diffonde a notevole velocit ma danni apprezzabili si rendono evidenti solo dopo qualche anno dall'inizio della malattia.
42685433|Severe decline of olive trees was observed in the Lecce province, Apulia (Italy), and received the name 'complesso del disseccamento rapido dell'olivo' (olive rapid decline complex). Affected plants showed leaf scorch symptoms and dieback of twigs, branches and even of the whole plant. Similar symptoms, unusual for the area, have also been observed in other Apulian localities (Cerignola, Foggia, Canosa di Puglia, and Andria). Three fungal species were associated with the symptoms: Phaeoacremonium aleophilum, Neofusicoccum parvum, and richardsiae. The latter is the first report of this fungal species infecting olives. In the Lecce province, the bacterium Xylella fastidiosa also was detected from affected olive trees. Xylella fastidiosa is a quarantine agent in Europe that had been previously reported in the Mediterranean region, but did not spread probably because of the lack of a vector. Present findings suggest that this fundamental condition has now been met.
