42683932|Cercospora personata Berk. et Curt. leafspot is prevalent on Groundnuts in Israel in fields irrigated by sprinklers. The considerable damage caused by the pathogen may be mainly indirect, defoliation depriving soil surface and pegs of shade; heat-damaged gynophores are secondarily invaded and subsequently torn at harvest, the pods remaining in the soil. First disease symptoms may appear from the onset of flowering, provided a primary inoculum is present early. Sowing groundnuts for two years in succession should therefore be avoided. Only one cultivar has been found field resistant. Early susceptible cultivars are suggested as indicators in disease forecasting. Under conditions favorable to disease development, the first spray should be applied to the crop as a preventive measure. The experimental fungicide Daconil was found promising; Zineb sprays are recommended. 43871748|In spring 2009-2010, red valerian plants (Centranthus ruber L.) showing stunting, mild leaf vein mosaic, reduction in size of leaves and flowers and occasional deformation and reduction of the number of leaves, were observed in Campania (Southern Italy). The presence of Cucumber mosaic virus (CMV) in the diseased plants was demonstrated by the reactions of test plants, electron microscopy, serology and RT-PCR. 42684903|Rilievi sono stati effettuati in alcuni vigneti-vitigni dell'Emilia-Romagna dove era presente una malattia simile alla flavescenza dorata. La percentuale di piante infette fra il 1983 e il 1987, variava dallo 0,1 al 42,8. La velocit di diffusione dell'epidemia  stata determinata mediante il calcolo sia del tasso d'infezione apparente (r) che di quello assoluto (QR), secondo le formule di Van der Plank. Nel periodo 1985-87, i tassi medi d'infezione annuali risultavano rispettivamente 0,61 e 0,04. La distribuzione spaziale delle piante ammalate, ottenuta adottando la tecnica di Van der Plank dell'analisi delle doppie, risultava sia raggruppata che casuale. Gradienti d'incidenza sono stati inoltre dimostrati in due vigneti, considerando la percentuale di piante ammalate (yt) in blocchi trasversali o in singoli filari consecutivi verso la distanza progressiva (x) dal margine dell'appezzamento. Allo scopo  stato usato il modello log-log di Gregory. Nell'equazione di regressione (log yt = a -blog x), la pendenza del coefficiente b variava da 0,18 a 1. I risultati indicavano una provenienza dell'infezione verosmilmente da sorgenti locali esterne agli appezzamenti. A few vineyards in Emilia-Romagna were inspected for a flavescence dore-like disease. The percentage of infected plants in the period 1983-1987 varied from 0.1 to 42.8. The rate of disease spread was determined using both Van der Plank's apparent infection rate (r) and absolute infection rate (QR). During the period 1985-87 the mean yearly infection rates were respectively 0.61 and 0.04. The disease pattern in the fields, using Van der Plank's doublet analysis technique, was shown to be both random and clustered. Incidence gradients were demonstrated in two vineyards by plotting the percentage of infected plants (yt), in consecutive transverse blocks and in rows, against the progressive distance (x) from the edge of the field. Gregory's log-log model was used. In the regression equation (log yt = a -blog x) the slope of the coefficient b varied from 0.18 to 1. The results suggested that the infection very probably spread from outside local sources.
42685262|A new universal oligonucleotide primer pair R16mF2/R1 and a modified universal oligonucleotide primer pair R16F2n/R2 for polymerase chain reaction (PCR) were designed on the basis of comparative analysis of 16S rRNA gene sequences from 19 phytoplasmas (previously called mycoplasmalike organisms), 48 related mollicutes, and other prokaryotes. These primer pairs specifically initiated amplification of 16S rDNA sequences from representatives of all known phytoplasma 16S rRNA groups plus one closely related Acholeplasma strain. These primer pairs did not initiate amplification from any healthy plant host or any plant pathogenic bacteria tested. Direct PCR assays using the new primer pair R16mF2/R1 allowed sensitive detection of phytoplasmas from most woody hosts, including ornamental and fruit trees where the associated phytoplasmas had not been readily detected before. Nested-PCR assays using two universal primer pairs, R16mF2/R1 and R16F2n/R2, increased detection sensitivity over 100 fold and readily detected phytoplasmas from all the woody hosts and insect hosts tested. RFLP anlysis of the nested-PCR products allowed identification of the primary phytoplasma(s) associated with each tissue sample.

The amino acids composition of the mycelium of 15 isolates of Cycloconium oleaginum Cast. and of 1 each of the following species : Fusicladium dendriticum (Wallr.) Fck., F. pirinum (Lib.) Fck. and Pollaccia elegans Servaz. was studied by qualitative paper chromatography. From acid hydrolisates prepared from mycelial cultures grown in a mineral medium, 13 amino acids were detected. By comparing their Rf values with those of some known amino acids, eight were identified as alanine, arginine, glutamic acid, cysteine, leucine, lysine, serine and valine ; the Rf values of the others were not referable to any of the known amino acids tested. Alanine and lysine were found in all the studied isolates. According to the presence or the absence of the arginine it was possible to divide the isolates of C. oleaginum into two categories. The ones able to synthetize arginine were then distinguished into three groups, characterized by the presence of the below mentioned amino acids : I. (six isolates) : leucine, valine, cysteine, and three other amino acids whose Rf values were 0,56-0,14-0,05 ; II. (two isolates) : glutamic acid and serine (the chromatogram of the isolate Pu/1 shows also one unidentified spot with Rf value 0,60) ; III. (four isolates) : one unidentified amino acid whose Rf is 0,60. The three isolates of C. oleaginum unable to synthetize arginine are included in the same group (IV). Their chromatograms show the presence of the cysteine and of two unidentified spots with Rf values 0,60 and 0,14. It is interesting to note that previous research had already shown that the two isolates included on the basis of their amino acids contents-into group II also differed greatly from the rest for morphological characters. The differences found in the amino acid contents of F. dendriticum, F. pirinum and P. elegans, though noticeable, proved to be of the same order of those found in the above mentioned groups of C. oleaginum isolates. The distinction on morphological ground of C. oleaginum, F. dendriticum, F. pirinum and P. elegans in four different species is not confirmed by differences in the amino acids composition of their mycelia. Notwithstanding, the ability or inability to synthetize in identical growing conditions, the same amino acids which is shown by some isolates of C. oleaginum appears to be a valid element for their biological distinction. 42684427|Carnation yellow stripe virus (CYSV) is a new virus isolated in Apulia (Italy) from carnation plants 'Pink shocking' showing striking yellow stripes of the leaves. CYSV is transmissible by inoculation of sap to a limited number of herbaceous hosts. Purified preparations contain isometric particles about 30 nm in diameter, which require stabilization with thyoglicollic acid. The genome is a single stranded RNA with molecular weight of 1.510 dal tons. The virus sediments as a single component with 99-105 S, has a buoyant density of 1.369 g/ml and polypeptides subunits with molecular weight of 27,000 dal tons. Serological tests showed that CYSV is related to a Grape strain of TNV. Il virus della striatura gialla del Garofano (CYSV)  un nuovo virus isolato in Puglia da piante di garofano 'Pink shocking' presentanti vistosa striatura gialla sulle foglie. CYSV  trasmissibile per sueco ad un limitato numero di piante erbacee indicatrici. Preparad purificad contengono particelle isodiametriche di circa 30 nm che richiedono stabilizzazione con acido tioglicolico. Il genoma  una molecola di RNA a singola elica con peso molecolare di 1,5  10 dalton. Il virus sedimenta come singolo componente con 99-105 S, ha una densit di galleggiamento di 1,369 g/ml e subunit proteiche con peso molecolare di 27.000 dalton. CYSV  sierologicamente correlato ad un ceppo di TNV isolato da Vite.

Lv. befallen sind. Das. Sphaerotheca-Myzel entwickelt sich auf der Zone der Bltter, die schon von Taphrina parasitiert ist, whrend die gesunden Zonen derselben Bltter keinen Befall zeigen. Eine oder beide Blattseiten der durch Taphrina parasitierten Bltter knnen von Sphaerotheca befallen werden. In den Zonen, in denen die Asci von Taphrina ausgebildet werden, sind die Hyphen von Sphaerotheca selten; an denselben Stellen gehen die Epidermiszellen, die die Sphaerotheca-Haustorien enthalten, frher zugrunde, und deshalb sterben auch die Haustorien. Ein direkter Antagonismus zwischen den beiden parasitischen Pilzen besteht nicht. Ihre Hyphen knnen durchaus in Kontakt miteinander kommen, ohne dadurch geschdigt zu werden. Osservazioni citologiche sono state effettuate su tessuti fogliari di Prunus persica L., cv  Frau Annelise Rudolf , attaccati contemporaneamente da Taphrina deformans (Berk.) Tul. e da Sphaerotheca pannosa (Wallr.) Lv. Il micelio di S. pannosa si sviluppa sulle zone fogliari gi invase da T. deformans, mentre le zone sane dlie stesse foglie non subiscono alcun attacco. La S. pannosa pu svilupparsi su una sola o su entrambe le pagine fogliari delle foglie gi colpite da T. deformans. Nelle zone in cui si formano gli aschi di Taphrina le ife di Sphaerotheca sono rare. In tali zone le cellule epidermiche invase dagli austori di S. pannosa degenerano rapidamente e muoiono. La loro morte  seguita da quella degli austori ehe esse contengono. Nelle zone in cui le cellule ascogene di T. deformans non sono ancora formate, le cellule epidermiche invase dagli austori di S. pannosa muoiono pi tardi; in tale caso gli austori sopravvivono pi a lungo. Non esiste nessun antagonismo diretto tra i due funghi parassiti: infatti le loro ife possono trovarsi in contatto le une con le altre senza danneggiarsi. Some cytological observations were made on the leaf tissues of Prunus persica L., cv  Frau Annelise Rudolf , attacked at the same time by Taphrina deformans (Berk.) Tul. and Sphaerotheca pannosa (Wallr.) Lv. The mycelium of S. pannosa only develops on the leaves areas which are already infected by T. deformans, while the healthy parts of the same leaves are not attacked by this fungus. The S. pannosa mycelium can develop upon one or both sides of the Peach leaves which are already infected by Taphrina. On the areas where T. deformans produces its asci, the hyphae of S. pannosa are very rare. In such parts the host epidermal cells, which are parasited by the haustoria of S. pannosa quickly collapse; their death is immediately followed by the death of the austoria they contain. On the areas where the T. deformans ascogenous cells are not yet produced, the host epidermal cells, which are parasited by the haustoria of S. pannosa, die later; in this case the haustoria can survive for longer. There is no direct antagonism between the two above mentioned parasitical fungi whose hyphae can contact without damaging each other.
42685700|PAV-, RPV-and MAV-like isolates of Barley yellow dwarf virus (BYDV) were detected in cereal samples collected from Algeria, Jordan, Morocco, Syria and Tunisia during the spring of 1986 and 1987. Detection was carried out by employing direct and indirect ELISA with a number of polyclonal and monoclonal antisera, respectively. PAV type was the most commonly detected, followed by MAV and RPV. The PAV monoclonal from England (MAC 91) detected 24 out of the 43 PAV isolates, whereas the monoclonal from the USA (MC 32-39) detected 45. When field samples were tested by six monoclonal and two polyclonal antisera, serological variability within each BYDV type was noticed. In addition, 17 field isolates from Syria reacted positively with the Bioreba F polyclonal antiserum, but unexpectedly did not react with any of the PAV, RPV or MAV monoclonals used. 42684595| stato messo a punto un metodo per la determinazione quantitativa nel terreno delle popolazioni di Phytophthora patogene degli agrumi. Tale metodo, che  una modifica della tecnica dei pezzetti di foglia-esca di Grimm e Alexander, consente di ottenere misure dell'indice del Potenziale di malattia (DPI) confrontabili con quelle ricavate con la tecnica dei frutti di limone-trappola, messa a punto da Tsao; esso consiste nell'utilizzare corne esche dischetti di foglie di arancio amaro e nel rilevare infezioni di Phytophthora mediante trasferimento dei dischetti in piastra contenenti un mezzo di coltura selettivo. Sono stati impiegati i seguenti substrati: PDA + BNPRAH, CMA + BNPRAH e P VPH. Nel corso delle prove sono stati analizzati pi di 100 terreni, prelevati in agrumeti e vivai della Sicilia orientale. I valori del DPI non dipendono, entro certi limiti, dal contenuto di umidit del terreno; risultano, per contro, correlati alla densit d'inoculo (ID) rilevata con la tecnica di isolamento diretto dal terreno per diluizione successiva in piastre contenenti un mezzo selettivo. Il DPI pi elevato, nei terreni presi in esame,  stato di 32; il valore massimo dell'ID  stato di 54 propaguli/g di terreno secco. A method for quantitative evaluation of citrus Phytophthoras in soils has been devised. The method is a modification of Grimm and Alexander's leaf-trap technique. Disease potential indices measured by this method may be compared with data estimated with Tsao's technique of lemon fruit-traps. Sour orange leaf-disks have been employed as traps; Phytophthora's infections have been detected by culturing leaf-disks in plates filled with selective media (PDA + BNPRAH, CMA + BNPRAH and P VPH). More than hundred soils, sampled in citrus nurseries and orchards of Eastern Sicily, have been tested. DPI values are not influenced, within certain limits, by moisture content of the soil; they, on the contrary, are positively correlated to inoculum density (ID), estimated by direct isolation from soil on selective medium with dilution-plate technique. The highest values of DPI and ID in tested soils have been 32 and 54 (propagules/g of dry soil), respectively.

42684266|A review is presented of the symptoms, distribution, host range, and economic status of the Oidium (Erysiphe heraclei DC.) and Oidiopsis [Leveillula turica (Lev.) Arn.] mildews of umbelliferous crops. The Oidium type mildew occurs mainly in Europe and West, Central, and South Asia; the Oidiopsis type mildew occurs mainly in the Mediterranean and Middle East countries. The Oidium type mildew appears limited to hosts in the Umbelliferae but divergent results of cross-inoculation tests render its range of hosts within this family uncertain. The host range of the Oidiopsis type mildew is not known. Studies of the Oidium type mildew of Carrot (Daucus carota L.) in Israel have shown that older crops are always the first to be affected. The age at which crops are affected by the mildew depends chiefly on the rate at which they mature (much faster in summer), and also on water stress and on the amount of inoculum available. Age thresholds for expected infection of carrots by mildew can thus be estimated for the guidance of control operations. Arn.]. Cet Oidium n'attaque que les htes dans la famille des Ombellifres, mais le nombre d'espces de cette famille qui peuvent tre atteints par une souche n'est pas tout--fait clair. 42685832|Epidemic leaf and fruit spotting in peach-trees caused by Xanthomonas campestris pv. pruni has occurred for a few years in peach orchards in the Veneto region (area south-east of Lake Garda). From samples of infected leaves collected in different orchards a total of 8 phages active against X. c. p. were isolated. The sensitivity of 21 Italian and foreign X.c.p. strains was assessed with 6 selected phages; 16 were very sensitive to 5 phages. Two of the remaining 5 strains were not lysed by any phage and 3 only partially lysed. Six X.c.p. strains from plum were found to be sensitive to the phages associated with X.c.p. in peach. Phage F had the widest range of activity and was selected to set up a biological control technique to be adopted during the summer for the protection of leaves and fruits. A phage suspension, sprayed on nectarine fruits 30 minutes before the challenge bacteria, prevented disease symptoms in 92.12% of the cases 1 week after the inoculation. X.c.p. was successfully reisolated from a minority of asymptomatic fruits. The protection afforded by phage treatment may be caused by lysis of X.c.p. cells or by lysogeny; in the latter case, lysogeny may have inhibited bacterial endophytic colonization. The epiphytic survival of the phage and the interference with the phage-bacteria interaction of the most common pesticides used in summer treatment of peach orchards were studied. On the surface of leaves in the orchard, phage survival was approximately 10 times lower than on the leaves in the climatic chamber. In the orchard, however, phage survival was at least 5 days. Out of 19 commercial pesticides tested, only those containing ziram and TMTD completely inhibited the phage. An appreciable reduction in phage population was caused by benzoximate, chloropyrifos-methyl, parathion-methyl, triforine and propargyl. Carbendazim and ethiofencarb increased phage population. Maculature epidemiche di foglie e frutti di pesco causate da Xanthomonas campestris pv. pruni si sono verificate da alcuni anni nei pescheti della regione Veneto (area a Sud-Est del lago di Garda). Da campioni di foglie infette prelevate in diverse aziende sono stati isolati 8 batteriofagi attivi contro X.c.p. La sensibilit di 21 ceppi italiani e stranieri di X.c.p. e  stata valutata nei confronti di 6 batteriofagi selezionati. 16 sono risultati molto sensibili a 5 fagi. Degli altri 5 ceppi, due non hanno subito lisi da alcun batteriofago, tre hanno subito lisi parziali. 6 ceppi di X.c.p. da susino sono risultati sensibili ai fagi associati a X.c.p. su pesco. Il fago F avente maggiore spettro di attivit  stato scelto per la messa a punto di una tecnica di lotta biologica da attuare durante Testate per proteggere foglie e frutti. Una sospensione del fago aspersa su frutti di nettarine 30 minuti prima del batterio provocatore ha prevenuto la comparsa dei sintomi di malattia nel 92.12% dei casi dopo 1 settimana dalla inoculazione. Il reisolamento di X.c.p. ha avuto successo in una minoranza di frutti asintomatici. La protezione conseguente al trattamento col fago pu, essere causata da lisi delle cellule di X.c.p. o da lisogenia; in quest'ultimo caso, la lisogenia pu aver inibito la colonizzazione endofta batterica. La soprawivenza epifita del fago e la interferenza sulla interazione fago-batteri dei pi comuni pesticidi usati nei trattamenti estivi ai pescheti sono state studiate. Alia superficie delle foglie nel frutteto la soprawivenza del fago  stata di circa 10 volte pi bassa rispetto a quella su foglie in celia climatica. In frutteto, comunque, la soprawivenza del fago  risultata di almeno 5 giorni. Di 19 pesticidi commerciali saggiati, solo quelli contenenti Ziram e TMTD hanno inibito completamente il fago. Apprezzabile riduzione della popolazione fagica  stata causata da Benzoximate, Chloropyrifos-methyl, Parathion-methyl, Triforine e Propargyl. Carbendazim ed Etiofencarb hanno interferito positivamente.
42684748|This paper reviews the recent progress in the knowledge of the epidemiology of vector-borne diseases of Grapevine induced by viruses and mycoplasma-like organisms (MLO). Reference is made to diseases like fanleaf, leafroll, corky bark, vein yellowing leaf roll and to the MLO-induced flavescence dore and black wood. La presente nota passa in rassegna i recenti progressi nelle conoscenze sulla epidemiologia delle malattie della Vite indotte da virus o da organismi micoplasma-simili (MLO) e trasmesse da vettori. Si fa particolare riferimento all'arricciamento, l'accartocciamento fogliare, la suberosi corticale, l'accartocciamento fogliare con ingiallimento nervale, e inoltre, alla flavescenza dorata e legno nero, due malattie indotte da MLO.
42683874|We stated, by field and greenhouse experiments, that the virus disease occurring in Hungary on Apricot, Plum and Peach and inducing ring and pox-like spots on the fruit is caused by the same virus agent. This virus induces symptoms on the Plum variety  Pozegaa , on Myrobalan (Prunus cerasifera) and P. persica seedlings and on Chenopodium foetidum. Transmission was unsuccessful on the following woody plants: P. avium, P. cerasus, and on the following herbaceous plants: Cucumber (Cucumis sativus), Pumpkin (Cucurbita pepo), Ammi majus, Ch. amaranticolor, Ch. ambrosioides, Ch. murale, Ch. quinoa, Datura stramonium, Solanum sisymbriifolium, Ocimum basilicum, Nicotiana glutinosa, N. langsdorifii, N. tabacum ( Samsun , Tab./R/W.B., I 787), N. xanthi glutinosa. A comparison with the Plum variety  Pozegaca  and Myrobalan-seedlings reveals that the virus is identical with the  arka  (Plum pox) virus occurring also in Jugoslavia. In experiments with an isolate originating from Plum, we obtained symptoms on P. avium and P. cerasus seedlings as well as on Cucumber sind Pumpkin plants, which indicates the probable existance of a latent ring spot infection. At the transmission from this tree with mixed infection the symptoms developed on the Plum variety  Pozegaa  and on Myrobalan seedlings showed close identity with those produced by the other isolates, whereas on the P. persica seedlings they appeared with a delay of three weeks and then too with minor intensity. Ch. foetidum failed to manifest symptoms. Nous avons tabli au cours d'expriences en serre et en plein air que les maladies  virus qui existent en Hongrie sul Abricotier, Prunier et Pcher et qui produisent des taches annulaires et pustuleuses sur le fruit sont dtermines par le mme virus. Ce virus produit des symptmes sur la varit de prune  Poegaa , sur les semis de Myrobolan, (Prunus cerasifera) et de Pcher (P. persica) et enfin sur Chenopodium foetidum. Les transmissions n'ont pas russi sur les plantes ligneuses suivante: P. avium, P. cerasus et sur les plantes herbaces suivantes: Concombre (Cucumis sativus), Citroville (Cucurbita pepo), Ammi majus, Chemopodium amaranticolor, Ch. ambrosioides, Ch. murale, Ch. quinoa, Datura stramonium, Solatium sysimbrifolium, Ocimum basilicum, Nicotiana glutinosa, N. langsdorfii, N. tabacum ( Samsum , Tab./R/W.B., I 787), N. xanthi, N. glutinosa. La comparaison des symptmes obtenus sur la varit de prune  Poegaa  et sur les semis de myrobolan revle que ce virus est identique au virus de la  Charka  (Plum pox) tel qu'il existe en Yougoslavie. Dans un essai fait avec une origine de virus obtenue  partir d'un prunier, nous avons obtenu des symptmes sur des semis de P. avium et P. cerasus aussi bien que sur Concombre et Citrouille ce qui indique l'existance probable d'une infection latente de taches annulaires. Aprs transmission  partir de cet arbre  infection mixte les symptmes obtenus sur la varit  Poegaa  et sur les semis de myrobolan taient identiques  ceux produits par les autres origines, tandis que sur les semis de Pcher, ils apparaissaient avec un retard de trois semaines et ensuite avec une moindre intensit. Ch. foetidum n'a manifest aucun symptme. Si dimostra, con sperimentazioni effettuate in campo e in serra, che la virosi frequente su Albicocco, Susino e Pesco, in Ungheria, con sintomi di maculatura ad anello e di vaiolatura dei frutti  prodotta dal medesimo virus. Questo virus causa sintomi sulla cv  Pozegaca  di Susino, su Mirabolano (Prunus cerasifera), su piante da seme di Pesco (P. persica) e su Chenopodium foetidum. Negative sono risultate le prove di trasmissione alie seguenti specie arboree: P. avium e P. cerasus e alle seguenti specie erbacee: Cetriolo (Cucumis sativus), Zueca (Cucurbita pepo), Amni majus, Ch. amaranticolor, Ch. ambrosioides, Ch. murale, Ch. quinoa, Datura stramonium, Solanum sisymbriifolium, Ocimum basilicum, Nicotiana glutinosa, N. langsdorffii, N. tabacum ( Samsun  Tab./R/W.B., I 787), N. xanthi glutinosa. Da un confronto dei sintomi osservati sulla cv  Pozegaa  di Susino e su piante da seme di Mirabolano, la malattia appare essere identica alia  arka  (Plum pox), diffusa anche in Jugoslavia. Nelle prove di trasmissione eseguite con materiale da una pianta di Susino infetta, sono stati ottenuti sintomi su piante da seme di P. avium e di P. cerasus, su Cetriolo e Zueca. Ci indica la probabile esistenza di infezione latente del virus della maculatura anulare. I sintomi osservati sulla cv  Pozegaa  di Susino e su piante da seme di Mirabolano, inoculate con materiale prelevato dalla pianta con infezione mista, erano molto simili a quelli ottenuti sulle stesse specie indicatrici con materiale prelevato da altre piante. Su piante da seme di Pesco, invece, i sintomi sono comparsi con un ritardo di tre settimane e in forma lieve. Ch. foetidum non ha manifestato alcun sintomo.
42683888|At the Plant Pathology Station of Rome, experiments have been conducted with the object of producing Cherry trees free of virus. The work has been carried on in the following four phases: I. Preliminary selection of the plants for the research on the basis of their external characteristics. II. Successive biological testing of the pre--selected plants. III. Maintenance, under healthy conditions, of the mother plants which proved virus-free. IV. Multiplication of these latter under such conditions as to impede possible virus contamination. The selection, i.e. the search for vigorous Cherry trees of normal aspect, has been carried out for some choice cultivars and for wild Cherry seedlings to adopt as root-stocks. The biological testing of these Cherry trees was carried out on the following indicator plants of Cherry viruses: sweet Cherry,  Bing ,  Napoleon ,  Van ,  Lambert  and  Mazzard F 12/1  varieties; sour Cherry,  Montmorency  variety ; Prunus serrulata,  Shirofugen  and  Kwanzan  varieties; wild Peach seedling. For the maintenance, under healthy conditions, of the plants tested with positive outcome, recourse was made to their cultivation in isolated localities, distant from other cultivations of fruit trees. In regard to the propagation of the mother plants, and, in particular, of the wild cherries to use as root-stocks, the reproduction for seed and agamic multiplication were adopted. This latter was done chiefly in two ways: a) by obtaining rooted sprouts and, successively, new plants, from buds of the woody twigs; b) by cuttings taken from the green twigs. A virus has been mechanically transmitted from Strawberry plants (Fragaria vesca L.) showing leaf mosaic, leaf blade malformation, dwarfing and root necrosis. The virus was recovered from extracts of both leaves and roots. A fungus (Olpidium sp.) was also observed from the roots of such plants. The symptoms caused by the virus in several host species were compared. Various methods of virus purification were investigated. The best was the clarification of the plant sap with a suspension of bentonite (25 mg/ml) in phosphate buffer (0.05 M, pH 8) followed by two or more cycles of differential centrifugation. The time of ultracentrifugation changed the UV absorption characteristics of the pellets. After 50 minutes at 50,000 rpm, UV absorption spectra were typical for nucleopro teins, whereas with longer runs (up to 2 hours) the UV spectra shifted toward those typical of naked RNA or RNA partially coated with protein. Treatment of the latter pellets with 0.25 g/1 pancreatic RNA-ase for 30 min at room temperature caused complete loss of infectivity. Upon separation of the complete virus from the apparently naked infectious RNA the following characteristics were established for each component: a) complete virus: UV absorption ratios (corrected for light scattering) E()/E) = 0.55, Emax ()/Emin (240-242) = 1.36; particle diameter (in shadowcasted preparations) = 38.5 m; b) RNA: UV absorption ratios (corrected for light scattering) E()/E() = 0.45, Emax ()//Emin() = 1.99. Most of the characteristics determined so far were in good agreement with those known for Tobacco necrosis virus (TNV) including the possible existence of an  unstable variant  . However in agar gel double-diffusion tests using an anti-TNV serum, no serological relationship has yet been found. Further reasearch to improve our knowledge of the virus is currently in progress. 43871739|Microbial products containing bacteria (Cedomon [Pseudomonas chlororaphis MA342, PC-MA342], Mycostop [Streptomyces sp. K61, SG-K61], Proradix  Agro [Pseudomonas sp. DSMZ13134, PS-DSMZ13134]) and fungi (Clonotry [Trichoderma harzianum and Clonostachys rosea, TH+ CR], Remdier [T. asperellum ICC012 and T. gamsii ICC080, TA-ICC012+ TG-ICC080], Rootshield WP [T. harzianum T22, TH-T22]) were tested for efficacy against Fusarium solani f. sp. cucurbitae race 1 (FSC7 strain) on zucchini. They were applied to seeds (S), plant growth substrate (PGS) and both (S+ PGS) in a growth chamber experiment, and to PGS, transplantation soil mixture (TSM) and both (PGS+ TSM) in a greenhouse experiment. FSC7 was inoculated in PGS at sowing time in the growth chamber and in TSM at transplant in the greenhouse. In the growth chamber, the most effective products were Cedomon (S and S+PGS treatments), Rootshield (PGS treatment) and Proradix (S+ PGS treatment), reducing the disease by 39.7, 43.1, 25.8 and 36.4%, respectively. In the greenhouse, all tested products applied to PGS reduced the disease severity and more markedly when applied to PGS+TSM. In the PGS and PGS+TSM treatments, Cedomon was the most effective product showing a disease decrease by 42.4 and 59.5%, respectively. The data obtained in vivo were consistent with the ability of the antagonists to colonize zucchini rhizosphere and with their inhibitory effects on the growth of the pathogen in in vitro assays. The bacteria caused the greatest growth inhibition of FSC7 showing abnormal morphology, while Trichoderma spp. parasitized FSC7 hyphae. Bacteria were the most active in reducing pathogen colony growth through antibiotic metabolites. All antagonists produced exoand endochitinase enzymes. Trichoderma strains showed greater levels of -N-acetylhexosaminidase and endochitinase, whereas SG-K61 was the most active producer of chitin 1,4--chitobiosidase. These results indicate that the studied bioproducts have potential for an effective management of zucchini Fusarium foot and root rot through rhizosphere competence and several mechanisms exerted by their microbial ingredients.
42683730|Nelle radiei delle piante di Frumento con mosaico  costantemente presente il fungo Polymyxa graminis Led. In associazione a questo, si trova  talora  una specie di Olpidium. Gli stessi funghi sono present, talora, in piante di grano esenti da mosaico. La P. graminis, come dimostrano i dati di una serie di esperienze,  da ritenere l'agente vettore del virus del mosaico. Quando le zoospore del fungo, in opportune condizioni, sono trasferite sulle radiei di piante sane, queste contraggono l'infezione di mosaico. Isolati di P. graminis non viruliferi possono essere trasformati in viruliferi, facendo loro parassitizzare radiei di frumento con mosaico. Di converso, isolati di P. graminis viruliferi, possono essere trasformati in non viruliferi, allevandoli su Trifolium incarnatum. Nessuna relazione sembra esistere tra l'Ol pidium e il virus del mosaico. In the roots of Wheat plants affected with soil-borne mosaic virus one can always find the Polymyxa graminis Led. fungus. In connection with it, there can also sometimes occur Olpidium sp. These two fungus can also be found, sometimes, on Wheat mosaic-free plants. As shown by the results of a number of tests, the P. graminis fungus can be considered to be the Wheat soil-borne mosaic virus vector. When the fungus zoospores, under favourable conditions, are transferred to roots of healthy plants, they become infected with the soil borne mosaic virus. Non-viruliferous isolates of P. graminis can become viruliferous, if they parasitize wheat roots, affected with soil-borne mosaic virus. On the contrary, viruliferous isolates of P. graminis can be made non-viruliferous, if they are grown on Trifolium incarnatum. No relationship seems to exist between Ol-piduim and the Wheat soil-borne masoic virus. Dans les racines des plantes de Bl atteintes de la mosaque, on trouve toujours le champignon Polymyxa graminis Led. En association avec lui, on y trouve aussi  parfois  una espce d'Olpidiwn. Les mmes champignons se retrouvent parfois mme sur des plantes de Bl indemnes du virus de la mosaque Comme le montrent les donnes d'une srie d'expriences, le P graminis doit tre considr comme l'agent vecteur du virus de la  osaque Lorsque les zoospores du champignon, dans des conditions favorables, sont transportes sur les racines de plantes saines, ces dernires deviennent infectes de mosaque. Des isols non-viruliferous de P graminis peuvent devenir viruliferous, s'ils parasitisent des racines de Bl affectes de mosaque. Au contraire, des isols viruliferous de graminis peuvent devenir non-viruliferous, s'ils sont coultivs sur Trifolium incarnatum. Aucune relation ne semble exister entre l'Ol pidium et le virus de la mosaque.
43872367|An Aspergillus population (67 strains), isolated from maize in 2003, during the first outbreak of aflatoxin contamination documented in Northern Italy, was characterised according to gene sequencing data. All strains were identified as A. flavus by sequencing of -tubulin and calmodulin gene fragments. Furthermore, the strains were analysed for the presence of seven aflatoxin biosynthesis genes in relation to their capability to produce aflatoxin B, targeting the regulatory genes aflR and aflS, and the structural genes aflD, aflM, aflO, aflP, and aflQ. The strains were placed into four groups based on their patterns of amplification products: group I (40 strains) characterised by presence of all seven amplicons; groups II (two strains) and III (nine strains), showing four (AflM, aflP, aflO, and aflQ) and three (aflO, aflP, aflQ) amplicons, respectively; and group IV (16 strains) characterised by total absence of PCR products. Only group I contained strains able to produce aflatoxin B (37 out of 40), whereas the strains belonging to the other groups and lacking three, four or all seven PCR products were non-producers. The results obtained in this study pointed out that A. flavus was the only species responsible for aflatoxin contamination in Northern Italy in 2003, and that the aflatoxin gene cluster variability existing in populations can be useful for understanding the toxicological risk as well as the selection of biocontrol agents.

43872339|Phytophthora root rot is considered to be the most destructive disease to citrus production in Egypt. Phytophthora species are generally present in citrus nurseries, where soil pots containing the survival propagules are considered responsible for their spread into new orchards. The goal of this study was to investigate the distribution and seasonal variation of Phytophthora species in soil and feeder roots in two Egyptian citrus nurseries, characterized by different management, and to identify Phytophthora species associated with root rot. Soil and root samples were collected at monthly intervals from Sour orange and Volkameriana lemon rootstocks during March-July period. The inoculum density of Phytophthora species, and the percentage of infected feeder roots, were estimated using the plate dilution method in conjunction with selective media. Phytophthora isolates were identified according to their morphological characteristics and on the basis of the ITS regions of the rDNA. Phytophthora nicotianae was the predominant isolated species, followed by P. citrophthora and P. palmivora. Phytophthora nicotianae was detected in both nurseries, while P. citrophthora and P. palmivora were recovered only in one nursery. Inoculum density of Phytophthora species fluctuated during spring and summer according to the environmental conditions, rootstock, and nursery management practices.

42685238|Thirty three mycoplasmalike organism (phytoplasma) isolates were recovered from different infected plant species in Europe or in the US and maintained in whole plants or micropropagated shoots of periwinkle (Catharanthus roseus) in Italy or UK for at least 18 months. PCR assays using universal (generic) primer pair R16F2/R2 and phytoplasma 16S rRNA group I (aster yellows and related phytoplasmas) specific primer pairs R16(I) F1/R1 amplified 1.2 and 1.1 kb 16S rDNA fragments respectively, from all phytoplasma-infected plants. RFLP analyses of DNA fragments indicated that all the isolates belonged to phytoplasma 16S rRNA group I: 19 isolates were identified as subgroup 16SrI-B members, and one as a member of the subgroup 16SrI-C. Among remaining isolates, 12 showed RFLP patterns identical to each other, different from those described in the literature and similar to patterns obtained from isolates recovered from infected tomato showing stolbur symptoms and from infected celery showing yellows symptoms: they were assigned to a new subgroup, designated 16SrI-G. One isolate was different from all the other examined. PCR assays by primers AY19p/m amplifying an uncharacterized chromosomal region confirmed the difference at the chromosomal level between phytoplasmas in subgroup I-B and phytoplasmas in the other subgroups. The RFLP analysis of DNA fragments obtained with primer pairs G35p/m amplifying a second uncharacterized chromosomal region clearly showed differences among patterns obtained from phytoplasmas in subgroups I-G and I-B. Phytoplasmas belonging to subgroup 16SrI-B appear to be the most widespread in Europe. They are associated with diseases in a wide variety of cultivated crops. Second important aster yellows related phytoplasmas are strains in subgroup 16SrI-G which are associated with diseases in several crops including woody plants.

42685235|Further investigations were carried out in Sardinia on bacterial necrosis ("Mai nero") of grapevine. The disease is widespreading and occurs in several cultivars other than 'Cannonau'. A high percentage of infected plants was detected even if with a variable symptom expression. This may be due both to environmental factors and cultural practices. X. ampelinus was always isolated from infected plants and detected by ELISA in symptomatic and asymptomatic plant tissues. Strain 196 IG, among the several isolated, was characterized and used in transmission tests. Main physiological and biochemical properties of the bacterium agree with those reported in literature; however it lacked in tyrosinase activity. ELISA results confirm disease dormancy. X. ampelinus was able to multiply and diffuse from the site of inoculation to the adiacent internodes 40, 70 and 110 days post inoculation; however, with the progress of season (and the consequent higher temperature), its activity tended to decrease.

42684554|A virus with flexuous filamentous particles 700-800 nm long was isolated from Zucchini plants showing pin-point yellow spots of the leaves. This virus, called Zucchini yellow fleck virus (ZYFV), infected only plants belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae, and was transmitted to Zucchini squash by the aphid Myzus persicae Sulz. in a non-persistent manner. In Zucchini sap, ZYFV was infective at a dilution of 10 but not 10, after heating for 10 min at 55C but not 65C, and after 25 but not after 30 days. One polypeptide (mol. wt 36000) was detected in freshly purified virus preparations. Upon storage two breakdown products were formed (mol. wt 34500 and 33800). Infected cells contained two types of inclusions: cylindrical (pinwheels and scrolls) and amorphous. ZYFV was serologically unrelated to several potyviruses including those infecting squash in Italy. 42685385|Pepper (Capsicum annuum L.), one of the most widely grown vegetables worldwide, is susceptible to root rot caused by Phytophthora capsici. Many biocides have recently been banned in Europe because of human health and environmental concerns. Integrated pest management is a European priority, where biological control together with other agronomic practices should replace pesticide management of plant diseases in the future. Application of different concentrations of the fungus Trichoderma asperellum strain T34 (the in T34 Biocontrol ) on incidence of disease caused by P. capsici in pepper was studied. Different methods of application of the microbial control agent and inoculation of the pathogen were examined. T34 and etridiazole (Terrazole ) were compared for their ability to suppress P. capsici. T34 reduced disease in most of the assayed situations (up to 71% disease reduction), while etridiazole was effective only when applied at the same time as the pathogen. The results obtained are discussed on the basis of the different modes of action of T34 and etridiazole. T34 is a useful biological alternative to chemicals for the control of P. capsici in pepper.

The selected populations showed a percentage of rotten bulbs twice lower than that of the commercial populations of 'Dorata di Parma', and similar to the medium tolerant hybrids Cosmic and CMW 745. The three methods of infection adopted were significantly correlated; nevertheless, the Fusarium colonized wheat seed method is better than the other two, allowing a better screening of the tested genotypes. The selected population ERSO-1 and ERSO-2 are in multiplication for a distribution to the farmers. 42685765|The results of a three-year experiment for the control of non-persistently transmitted ALV on artichoke cv. Spinoso sardo are reported. Sticky yellow traps, 2% mineral oil and 0.005% deltamethrin were used, singly and in combination. The ALV infections were determined by DAS-ELISA. All the treatments significantly reduced the ALV transmission, especially the mineral oil and deltamethrin, either alone or in all various combinations. However, from an ecological, biological and economic point of view, it would be better to employ the mineral oil; it also had no apparent phytotoxic effect on the plants. Finally, the expediency of applying more or less oil sprays with respect to different situations, is emphasized. Vengono riportati i risultati di prove triennali di lotta contro gli afidi vettori di ALV sul carciofo 'Spinoso sardo', con trappole gialle invischiate, olio minerale leggero (al 2%) e deltametrina (allo 0,005%), da soli e in combinazione. Le infezioni sono state rilevate mediante il metodo DAS-ELISA. Tutte le tesi saggiate si sono rivelate significativamente efficaci rispetto al testimone, in particolare Tolio minerale e la deltametrina, da soli e in combinazione tra loro e con le trappole gialle. Tuttavia, motivi di ordine ecologico, biologico ed econmico inducono a privilegiare l'impiego di olio minrale; esso, oltre tutto, non ha comportato fenomeni di fitotossicit. Viene infine suggerita l'opportunit di intervenire in maniera pi o meno assidua secondo le diverse situazioni.

42684431|Nel corso di un'indagine condotta sulle malattie virali del Geranio (Pelargonium zonale, P.  hortorum) sono state ritrovate tre differenti sintomatologie: a) Mosaico, b) Anulatura concentrica, c) Scolorazione perinervale. In a survey for virus diseases of Pelargonium (Pelargonium zonale, P.  hortorum), three different disorders were recognized: a) Mosaic. Diseased plants show an irregular discolouration of leaves only. The host-range reactions and the morphological, serological and hydrodynamic properties of the causal agent indicated it as an isolate of cucumber mosaic virus (CMV). b) Zonale spot. Characterized by the presence of concentric, yellow bands centered around, and starting from the petiolar sinus from which they extended to a great portion of the leaf blade. The causal agent is sap transmissible and appeared heterogeneous both under the electron microscope (showing spherical and subspherical particles with a diameter ranging from 23-35 nm) and in the analytical ultracentrifuge, giving three different peaks sedimenting at 82, 92 and 119 S. The virus was also heterogeneous in polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. The nucleic acid represented 14-16% of the particle weight and was made up of two pieces of RNA, the molecular weight of which were respectively 1.25  10 and 0.95  10 daltons. The protein coat had a major component with m. w. 23,500 and traces of a minor component with a m. w. 44,000. The virus did not react against 33 antisera to isometric and subspherical viruses. The virus shares the main properties of the Ilarvirus group and may be a new member, for which the name of Pelargonium zonate spot virus (PlZSV) is proposed. c) Vein banding. The symptoms consist mainly of a distinct clearing of tissues adjacent to the main and secondary veins. Two viruses were found associated with the disease which could be separated on differential herbaceous hosts. Whereas one of the viruses (isolate Pl-C) has not yet been identified the other proved to be a rhabdovirus virtually identical in particle size, host range reactions and intracellular localization of virus particles to Pelargonium vein clearing virus (PlVCV).
42684124|A new disease of Peach [Prunus persica (L.) Batsch.] causing serious damage to 2 to 4-year old trees of certain cultivars was observed in Greece for the first time in 1970. The disease appears in an orchard suddenly and spreads rapidly causing heavy financial losses. It is characterized by small to large canker lesions on twigs, branches and stems that result in but blast, girdling and killing of twigs, and weakening and, occasionally, killing branches and entire trees. No foliar or fruit symptoms develop. The canker lesions on annual twigs appear as areas of collapsed bark and necrotic wood. On older wood they at first appear as small bark elevations with slightly depressed centers but, as they enlarge, a pocket of necrotic wood forms beneath the center of the lesion and then necrosis advances outward toward the bark. The lesions enlarge much more along the stem axis than to the sides, and cankers up to several feet long may form. The cause of the disease has not yet been determined but the possibilities of its being a bacterium of the Pseudomonas type or a virus of the necrotic ringspot type are discussed. La malattia compare all'improvviso nei frutteti e si propaga rapidamente causando gravi danni economici. Essa si manifesta con cancri di diversa grandezza che si formano sui rametti, sulle branche e sul tronco. In conseguenza della formazione di tali cancri le gemme muoiono e possono verificarsi estesi deperimenti dei rametti dell'annata e occasionalmente aversi la morte delle branche e di intere piante. I frutti e le foglie non manifestano alcun sintomo. I sintomi sui rami dell'annata si manifestano sotto forma di depressioni della corteccia e con necrosi del legno. Sui rami piu vecchi i sintomi si manifestano sotto forma di piccole protuberanze della Corteccia con leggere depressioni centrali. In corrispondenza del centro della lesione si forma una concavit di legno necrotico; tale necrosi poi si estende verso l'esterno interessando la corteccia. Le lesioni si estendono pi nel senso della lunghezza che lateralmente e possono raggiungere notevoli dimensioni. La causa della malattia non  stata accertata ma  possibile che di essa possa essere responsabile un batterio di tipo Pseudomonas o un virus di tipo maculatura anulare necrotica. En Grce, on a observe pour la premiere fois en 1970, une maladie nouvelle du Pecher [(Prunus persica (L.) Batsch.)] qui endommage serieusement les arbres de 2  4 ans de certains cultivars. La maladie parat dans un verger soudainement et se propage rapidement, en donnant lieu  des pertes financires considrables. Cette maladie est caractrisee par de petits et grands chancres sur les rameaux, les branches et les troncs, ce qui produit l'eborgnage, des incisions annulaires et la mort des rameaux et, encore affaiblissement et parfois, la mort des branches ou des arbres tout entiers. Il n'y a pas de symptmes sur les feuilles ou les fruits. Les chancres sur les pousses de l'anne se presentent sous forme d'affaissement de l'corce et ncrose du bois. Sur le bois plus vieux, ces lesions, au commencement, paraissent comme de petites zones de soulvement de l'corce ayant, au centre, une lgre dpression; mais, lorsque ces zones deviennent plus agrandies, une poche de bois necrotique va se former sous la partie centrale de la lesions et ensuite, la ncrose se propage vers l'extrieur du ct de l'corce. Les lsions s'grandissent beaucoup plus le long de la tige que sur les cts et de chancres d'une longueur de plusieurs pieds peuvent se produire. La cause de la maladie n'a pas encore t dtermine, mais on discute la possibilit qu'elle soit provoque par une bacterie du type Pseudomonas ou par un virus comme celui des taches annulaires ncrotiques.

Le infezioni pi gravi si hanno con temperature medie comprese tra 15 e 25 C e con precipitazioni rispettivamente non inferiori a mm 30 e 40. Si  inoltre notato che il periodo di incubazione risulta alquanto pi corto nei cloni piu sensibili (per es.  I 262  e  I 488  ) e sensibilmente pi lungo, anche di 3 giorni, in quelli pi rsistenti. Research has been carried out in a large number of Poplar stands of the Po Valley in order to ascertain the influence of the climatic conditions on the severity of the attacks of Marssonina brunnea (Ell. et Ev.) P. Magn., a fungus causing a serious foliar disease on the Euramerican Poplars. The infections are possible in the rainy periods the average temperatures of which range from 8 to 26 C. Only little infections occur, whatever the rainfall may be, when the temperatures are below 13 C, on the contrary as they rise the intensity of the infections varies according to the different combinations temperature/rainfall. To induce serious infections at the average temperatures of 14-16 C, 35 mm rainfall in ten days is sufficient while more than 45 mm rainfall is needed if the average temperature reaches 21 C. The infections take place in the days or couples of days in which the average temperature ranges from 9 to 25 C and the rainfall does not fall respectively below 10 and 20 mm. The most serious infections occur at temperatures ranging from 15 to 25 C when the rainfall is respectively at least 30 and 40 mm. Higher rainfall needed at higher temperature in order to have serious infections depends on the faster evaporation occurring as temperature rises which lesses the persistance on the susceptible parts of the plant of the film requested for the M. brunnea conidia dissemination and germination. Positive correlations between the severity of the M. brunnea attacks and the lenght of the wet periods registered by the Bazier thermohumectographe have been observed. Field observations have shown that when the relative humidity in the days following the infection is above 80 % the M. brunnea incubation period in Populus  euramericana cl.  I 214  lasts 6-8 days at average temperatures of 20-22 C and gets beyond 10-12 days when they exceed 25 or fall below 16 C. As a rule the M. brunnea incubation period is longer in the resistant than in the susceptible Poplar clones.

42684369|Erwinia atroseptica, E. carotovora, Pseudomonas pisi, P. syringae y Xanthomonas phaseoli var. fuscans, no han mostrado ninguna capacidad para degradar pisatina, una fitoalexina de tipo isoflayonide producida por plantas de guisante, Pisum sativum L. Si bien, pisatina ha ejercido una marcada inhibicin sobre el crecimiento de cada une de ellas, llegando a anularlo por completo en el caso de P. syringae y X. phaseoli var. fuscans. La degradacin de pisatina por hongos es un hecho claramente demostrado. Uno de sus metabolitos, 6a-HI, producido por la accin de Ascochyta pisi, se ha encontrado tambin como producto intermediario en la degradacin de pisatina por la accin de Fusarium oxysporum f. pisi y Aphanomyces euteiches, e incluso por otros no patgenos como F. oxysporum f. lycopersici y Aphanomyces laevis. En estos ltimos, el proceso de degradacin es muy lento y adems de 6a-HI, paracen presentarse otros subproductos, sin que hasta el momento se haya logrado su completa caracterizacin. Sobre ella, seguiremos nuestros trabajos. Erwinia atroseptica, E. Carotovora, Pseudomonas pisi, P. syringae e Xanthomonas phaseoli var. fuscans non hanno degradato la pisatina, una fitoalessina di tipo isoflavonoide prodotta dal Pisello (Pisum sativum L.). La pisatina ha comunque mostrato attivit antibatterica specialmente nei confronti di P. syringae e di X. phaseoli.  stata anche studiata la capacit di degradare la pisatina da parte di alcuni funghi patogeni del Pisello. Tale capacit  sembrata dipendere dalla specie fungina. In particolare,  stato osservato che con F. oxysporum f. pisi la 6a-idrossi-inermina (6a-HI)  un composto intermedio mentre con Aphanomyces euteiches e Ascochyta pisi  un composto finale delia degradazione della pisatina. Anche altri funghi non patogeni per il Pisello, come F. oxysporum f. lycopersici e Aphanomyces laevis degradano la pisatina anche se in maniera molto limitata. In aggiunta a 6a-HI sono stati messi in evidenza numerse altre sostanze che potrebbero essere composti intermedi della degradazione della pisatina. Ulteriori caratterizzazioni di questi composti stanno per essere seguite. Erwinia atroseptica, E. carotovora, Pseudomonas pisi, P. syringae and Xanthomonas phaseoli, var. fuscans were not able to degrade pisatin the phytoalexin of pea plants, Pisum sativum L. However, pisatin appeared to be inhibitory to bacterial growth, especially of P. syringae and X. phaseoli. The ability of pea-pathogenic fungi to degrade pisatin has been extensively studied. One of its metabolites, 6a-hydroxy-inermin (6a-HI), has been found to be an intermediate (Fusarium oxysporum f. pisi) or an end-product of pisatin breakdown (Aphanomyces euteiches, Ascochyta pisi), depending on the fungal species studied. Related fungi, not pathogenic to pea, viz. F. oxysporum f. lycopersici and Aphanomyces laevis also degraded pisatin; in the latter fungi, however, the rate of breakdown was very low. In addition to 6a-HI several other compounds have been detected, which could be other intermediates in pisatin degradation. Further characterization of these fungal breakdown products of pisatin is being pursued in this laboratory.
42685267|For the study of Eutypa canker incidence on grapevines, two scales of a 0-5 disease index have been used so far. A study was undertaken to compare these two scales. Both the enzymes and toxin were detected within 12 hours from inoculation, while the pathogen was isolated within 6 hours from the inoculation of the roots and stems of seedlings. The proteases from the hypocotyls as well as culture filtrate attacked casein, liberating amino acids at pH 7. Both the enzymes released compounds in the presence of polygalacturonic acid which gave a peak at 232 m in the UV light. A complex virus disease of Chicory (Cichorium intybus L.) characterized by two major syndromes: i.e. bright yellow mottle of the leaves and chlorotic rings and spots, is reported from Southern Italy. The chrome-yellow discolourations are induced by a virus with isodiametric particles 25 m in diameter and polygonal contour, provisionally called Chicory yellow mottle (CYMV). This virus resembles members of the Cowpea mosaic virus group in having more than one kind of particles sedimenting at different rates in zonal density gradient centrifuga tion. The lighter particles (top component) are non infectious empty protein shells. The fast sedimenting components (bottom 1 and 2) are both infectious and contain nucleic acid although in different proportions. CYMV was not serologically related to 23 viruses with isometric particles including three members of the Cowpea mosaic virus group (Broadbean vascular wilt, Echtes Ackerbohnenmosaik, Cowpea mosaic. Another isodiametric virus which was found frequently associated with chlorotic syndromes, has characters in common with members of the NEPO group of viruses (responses of herbaceous hosts, shape and size of the particles, arrangement of particles in rows within tubules). There are indications that this entity might be related to Tomato black ring virus. Conclusive evidence of this, however, is still lacking. A decline affects a local cultivar of wine Grape ( Primitivo di Gioia ) on Vitis Berlandieri  V. riparia  420 A  and some other rootstocks near Taranto (Southern Italy). Affected vines show progressive stunting of scions, which die-back up to bud union in a few years. The bark of affected stocks is thicker and the wood is thinner than the healthy ones. Prominent cordons, and elongated pegs or ridges are formed on the cambial face of the stock bark by hyperplastic cortical tissues, mostly medullary rays. In addition to these outgrowths covering its under-surface, the bark of the stock shows tissue disorganization and necrosis of the phloem. The corresponding symptoms on the stock wood are striations and crowded depressions in the wood, appearing as longitudinally elongated pits. Wood is hypoplastic and sometimes contains very little starch. These symptoms, some of which justify the name adopted by the growers to indicate the decline:  legno riccio  (rugose wood), has been observed only below the bud-union and only on grafted vines. After the death of the scion, the stock grows normally and simptoms disappear from its bark and wood. Attemps to re-graft rootstocks commonly fail; otherwise, wood pitting and other symptoms reappear on the stocks. The possible causes of the decline are shortly discussed. Les tissus de l'corce sont en outre dsorganiss et le phlome actif est souvent assez pauvre en amidon. 42685383|Phytophthora inundata is an Oomycetous plant pathogen that has been isolated from a range of different plant species. Although formally described in 2003, relatively little further characterisation of this taxon has been reported. This study presents an approach to phylogenetic discrimination of P. inundata based on concordance of multiple gene genealogies in relation to the host range and morphological traits of isolates from Iran (Beta vulgaris, Pistacia vera, Solanum nigrum and river water), United Kingdom (Salix matsudand), Spain (Olea sp.) and the United States of America (unknown host). Isolates were identified by rDNA internal transcribed spacer (ITS) sequence analysis, followed by assessment of pathogenicity, morphological, physiological (cultural, temperature relations and mating) and molecular traits. Multiple gene genealogy analyses were performed on regions of nuclear (ITS, -tubulin, translation elongation factor la) and mitochondrial (cytochrome c oxidase subunit I) gene sequences of this and other major Phytophthora species. Congruence was observed in different phylogenetic data sets. Maximum likelihood phylogenetic reconstruction based on the different genes indicated that, although there is some variation between morphological and mating behaviour of P. inundata isolates, this taxon is a distinct and homogeneous species which always appeared as a sister taxon to P. humicola. Phytophthora inundata is shown to be a uniform species, with isolates from wide-ranging geographic origins having similar host ranges, molecular, and morphological characteristics.
42685287|A peptidic phytotoxic metabolite, with an apparent molecular weight of 3.3 kDa and constituted by 25 amino acids, was isolated from culture filtrates of Phytophthora nicotianae, the causal agent of crown and root rot of tomato. This metabolite, named phytophorin, induces wilting and chlorosis on tomato cotyledonary leaves at micromolar concentrations (7.5 M and 4.5 M, respectively); it is inactivated by pronase. It is the only phytotoxic component of a group of units which form non-host specific phytotoxic multiple aggregates with a probable molecular weight ranging from 3.5 to 30 kDa. These aggregates are heat and pH stable and cause an electrolyte loss through the cell membrane of tomato plant tissue, suggesting their potential involvement in the disease.
42684494|Plants of white bryony (Bryonia cretica L. formerly known as B. dioica Jacq.) in Northern Italy, bearing mottle and mosaic leaf symptoms, contained viruses producing severe disease when sap-inoculated to cucumber, zucchini squash, marrow and watermelon. Negative staining and electron microscopy showed that flexuous particles were present, identified as those of potyviruses from their length and fine structure, and by the presence of pinwheel-related structures. Thin sectioning confirmed the presence of pinwheels in infected tissues. No other virus particle type was observed. Immunoelectron microscopy (decoration) gave evidence for the presence of three potyviruses, P I, P II and P III. An antiserum against white bryony mosaic virus (a carlavirus) reacted strongly with P I, indicating that the original antigen suspension injected to prepare the serum must have contained P I (or a closely related virus) as well as the carlavirus. P I did not react with any other potyvirus antiserum tested. P II was serologically related to both celery mosaic and bean yellow mosaic viruses, and P III was closely related to celery mosaic virus but not bean yellow mosaic virus. Spiral structures were often observed wrapped around the potyvirus particles. It is concluded that white bryony, a common perennial plant, probably acts as a reservoir of agriculturally important viruses. Piante di Bryonia cretica L. 42684087|It has been suggested that the resistance of Garlic (Allium sativum L.) bulbs to decay by penicillia other than Penicillium corymbiferum Westling may be due to a differential sensitivity to allicin. This antibiotic compound is produced from alliin already present in the tissue, by alliin lyase whenever injury occurs. The growth and sporulation of 7 isolates of P. corymbiferum from various hosts was either stimulated or somewhat inhibited by alliin at a concentration commonly found in Garlic, whereas all the isolates were somewhat inhibited by allicin. These isolates contained an alliin lyase and utilized alliin as an effective sulfur source when grown in Czapek's medium. They were all pathogenic to Garlic but varied in their degree of virulence. Three other species of Penicillium which could not parasitize Garlic were greatly inhibited by allicin, but not alliiin. They could not utilize alliin as a sulfur source and did not contain alliin lyase. However, the growth of a Penicillium sp. from Onion was not inhibited by alliin or allicin, and it also had alliin lyase activity. Even so, this fungus did not cause a decay of Garlic bulbs. These findings suggest that allicin, although probably important as a fungitoxicant in many instances, cannot be the sole basis for resistance of Garlic to Penicillium spp. Viene prospettata la possibilit che la resistenza dei bulbi di Aglio (Allium sativum L.) al marciume causato da specie di Penicillium diverse da P. corymbiferum Westling sia dovuta alla sensibilit di questi ultimi all'allicina. 43872361|Figs are an economically important crop in the Mediterranean area. Fungal infection can be observed on figs on the tree, after shriveling, after falling to the ground, and during the drying process. Fungal growth and subsequent mycotoxin production are influenced by a variety of complex interactions between instrinsic and extrinsic factors as well as stress factors and physical damage. The dominant fungal flora in dried figs consisted of Aspergillus section Nigri, Fusarium spp., Aspergillus section Flavi and Pnicillium spp. Fungal infection can result in mycotoxin contamination including aflatoxins, citrinin, cyclopiazonic acid, fumonisins, patulin and ochratoxin A. This review describes the major fungal infection and mycotoxin contamination in dried figs.
42684473|For histological studies of white pine blister rust infection and resistance it is desirable to obtain consistently numerous needle infections in known localized areas. Often, however, artificial inoculation have yielded well-distributed basidiospore casts and excellent germination but little or no subsequent needle infection. Recent observations by scanning electron microscopy have supplemented our previous work on the stoma as the infection court. The amount of epicuticular wax deposits in the stomatal antechamber varied among needles and among different trees. Complete occlusion of the stomatal antechamber by wax accumulation is common and can reduce greatly the number of opportunities for infection. In addition germ tubes that did enter the stomatal antechamber often failed to penetrate between guard cells, and no infection resulted. Apertures between the guard cells of stomata in needles under both light and dark conditions varied even on the same needle, and it seems doubtful that aperture closure alone was important in preventing entry by the germ tube into the substomatal chamber. We suggest that failure of germ tubes to penetrate may result from lack of a stimulus from the substomatal chamber or the presence of an inhibitory agent that emanates from the substomatal region. Wax occlusion of stomata and induced failure of germ tubes to penetrate between guard cells may constitute two factors of the  reduced needle-lesion frequency  type of resistance to infection by Cronartium ribicola. Per gli studi di istologia dell'infezione causata da C. ribicola su P. strobus e per indagini sul miglioramento gentico per la resistenza  desiderabile ottenere numerse infezioni in aree localizzate degli aghi. Spesso le inoculazioni artificiali permettono di ottenere una eccellente distribuzione di basidiospore dtate di elevata germinabilit ma poi si riscontra una scarsa o nulla infezione fogliare. Le recenti osservazioni compiute al microscopio elettronico a scansione hanno confermato il nostro precedente lavoro che indicava lo stoma come luogo del primo insediamento del fungo. L'ammontare dei depositi cerosi epicuticulari nell'anticamera stomatica era diverso tra gli aghi e tra i pini. L'occlusione completa dell'anticamera stomatica dovuta all'accumulo di cera  frquente e riduce notevolmente le probabilit di infezione. Inoltre i tubetti germinativi, che non entrao nell'anticamera stomatica, spesso non riescono a penetrare tra le cellule di guardia e quindi non determinano infezione. Le aperture tra le cellule di guardia degli stomi variano anche sullo stesso ago in condizioni di luminosit diverse e sembra difficile pensare che l'aperturachiusura da sola sia un fattore importante nel prevenire l'ingresso del tubetto germinativo nella camera sottostomatica. Gli Autori ritengono che l'incapacit dei tubetti germinativi di penetrare possa essere attribuita alla mancanza di uno stimolo dovuto alla camera sottostomatica o alla presenza di un agente inibitore, che emani dalla regione sottostomatica. L'occlusione cerosa degli stomi e la incapacita indotta dei tubetti germinativi di penetrare tra le cellule di guardia possono costituire due fattori di resistenza all'infezione da C. nbicola indicata corne  ridotta frequenza di lesioni fogliari .

La fluorescenza delle pareti dei vasi colpiti e delle cellule circostanti aumentava gradualmente col progredire della malattia e si dttenuava via via con il loro imbrunimento. Le zone di reazione dei fenoli e dei chinoni (nitrosoreazione e reazione con anilina-KIO) coincidevano con quelle in cui si era manifestato au- mento di fluorescenza; pertanto questi composti potrebbero essere, almeno in parte, responsabili del fenomeno. Sembra verosimile che l'aumento di fenoli catecolici nella parete cellulare sia conseguenza della diminuita sintesi di lignina (con accumulo di precursori fenolici) o di una sua degradazione per distacco di fenoli. La reazione con floroglucina-HCl evidenziava nelle piante malate una diminuita lignificazione delle pareti dei vasi pi giovani, specie negli ultimi internodi. Sembra cosi confermata l'ipotesi che il collasso e la deformazione dei giovani vasi siano dovuti alia rallentata sintesi di lignina e all'aumentata pressione di accrescimento dei parenchimi circostanti, molto probabilmente causate entrambe da fenomeni di iperauxinia. La malattia riduceva inoltre la produzione di legno secondario, specialmente nell'anello xilematico interfasciale. Tale riduzione risultava maggiore nelle piante infettate dalla razza 1 pi virulenta. Anche i sintomi esterni e le alterazioni istochimiche causati dalla razza 1 erano pi gravi e precoci rispetto a quelli causati dalla razza 2, il cui sviluppo nelle piante era in genere pi lento e contenuto. Microscopic observations of primary fluo rescence and histochemical detections of phenols, quinones and lignin were carried out in stems of the 'Bonny Best' Tomato plants inoculated with race 1 and 2 of Fusarium oxysporum Schl. f. sp. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyd. et Hans. The race 1 is more virulent than the race 2 with respect to this host Wall fluorescence of the infected vessels and of the surrounding cells gradually increased with the advancement of the disease and diminished with their discoloration. The localization of the reactions for phenols and quinones (nitrous reaction and aniline-KIO reaction) was the same as that of increased fluorescence for which, therefore, these compounds could be, at least in part, responsible. The increase of catecholic phenols in the cell wall could be consequent to a slackening of lignin synthesis (with accumulation of phenolic precursors) or to a lignin degradation with liberation of phenols. The reaction with HCl-phloroglucinol gave evidence in the diseased plants of diminished lignification of the walls of younger vessels, especially in the last internodes. Thus the hypothesis seems confirmed that the collapse and deformation of these vessels might be due to a retarded synthesis of lignin and to an increased pressure caused by abnormal growth of the surrounding parenchymae, both probably caused by hyperauxiny. Furthermore, the disease reduced the production of secondary wood, especially in the interfascicular xylem ring. This reduction was found to be greater where infection was due to the more virulent race 1. The external symptoms and the histochemical alterations induced by the race 1 were also more severe and precocious with respect to those caused by the race 2, whose development in the plants was generally slower and more contained. 42685221|En conditions naturelles d'infection, 13 varites de Piment cultives sous abris serre ont t values en 1991 pour la rsistance  Leveillula taurica. Pendant l'anne 1992, nous avons selectionn les lignes les plus rsistantes pour rpter l'valuation en conditions naturelles d'infection et pour suivre l'volution de l'pidmie durant la culture. Deux haplode doubls 'HV 12' et 'HV 13' ont confirm leur haut niveau de rsistance. La ligne HV 13 a l'avantage d'tre plus vigoureuse et plus productive. Thirteen pepper cultivars were evaluated for their resistance to powdery mildew (Leveilula taurica) under natural epidemics in glasshouse cultivation in Tunisia. Two years experimentation were conducted and showed that natural epidemics provide severe and homogeneous infection conditions at the field level, allowing a pertinent evaluation of genetic resistance. The sporulation rate of the fungus, scored on infected leaves varied during the growing period (october to june) and the defoliation rate of the plants due to infection have to be taken into account to evaluate the varieties. This evaluation is more relevant at the end than during the growing period. Most of the local Tunisian cultivars were susceptible to L. taurica, three lines showed intermediate resistance and only two haplodiplod lines showed a high resistance level.
42684432|A survey of plant parasitic nematodes carried out in the Maltese islands indicates that the potato cyst eelworm, Globodera rostochiensis (Woll.) Mulvey et Stone, although present is prevented by several factors from increasing its populations. The stem nematode, Ditylenchus dipsaci (Khn) Filipjev, is a major pest of onion (Allium cepa L.) and broad beans (Vicia jaba L.) in Gozo and the root-knot nematode, Meloidogyne incognita (Kofoid et White) Chitw., although never observed on out-door crops, causes severe damage to various vegetable crops in glasshouses. However, it can be economically controlled, especially on tomato (Lycopersicon esculentum Mill.) by soil fumigation with either methyl bromide or D-D. Cereals are often infested by Meloidogyne naasi Franklin, but only one infestation of Heterodera avenae Woll. was observed in a barley (Hordeum vulgare L.) field in Malta. It has been found that among the fodder plants sweet vetch (Hedysarum coronarium L.) is a good host for M. naasi and that a cyst nematode, probably Heterodera goettingiana Liebscher, affects vetch (Vicia sativa L.) fields. Vineyards were often found infested by Xiphinema index Thome et Allen and citrus gardens always by the citrus nematode Tylenchulus semipenetrans Cobb. Treatment with phenamiphos at the rate of 10 g ai/plant within three months decreased root populations of T. semipenetrans by 71% and soil populations by 77%. Five months after treatment the differences with respect to the control had increased to 77 and 83% respectively for roots and soil. Indagini condotte sui nematodi fitoparassiti delle isole Maltesi indicano che il nematode cisticolo Globodera rostochiensis (Woll.) Mulvey et Stone della patata (Solanum tuberosum L.)  presente solo in livelli di popolazione piuttosto bassi. Il nematode degli steli Ditylenchus dipsaci (Khn) Filipjev  uno dei principali parassiti di cipolla (Allium cepa L.) e fava (Vicia faba L.) in Gozo ed il nematode galligeno Meloidogyne incognita (Kofoid et White) Chitw., benche mai osservato in pieno campo, causa gravi danni a varie colture ortensi in serra. Tuttavia, esso puo essere controllato, con risultati soddisfacenti dal punto di vista econmico, specie su pomodoro (Lycopersicon esclulentum Mill.), con fumigazioni a base di Bromuro di metile o D-D. I cereali sono frequentemente infestad da Meloidogyne naasi Franklin, mentre Heterodera avenae Woll,  s tata osservata solo una volta in un campo di orzo (Hordeum vulgare L.) in Malta. Tra le foraggere la sulla (Hedysarum coronarium L.)  una coltura spesso attaccata da M. naasi, mentre la vecia (Vicia sativa L.) puo essere danneggiata da attacchi di un nematode cisticolo, probabilmente H. goettingiana Liebscher. I vigneti sono stati spesso trovati infestati da Xiphinema index Thome et Allen e gli agrumeti da Tylenchulus semipenetrans Cobb. Trattamenti con Fenamifos, alla dose di 10 g di principio attivo per pianta, hanno ridotto le popolazioni del nematode degli agrumi del 71% sulle radiei e del 77% nel terreno, nel giro di tre mesi. Cinque mesi dopo il trattamento le popolazioni erano ulteriormente ridotte rispettivamente del 77 e dell' 83%, sulle radiei e nel terreno, nei confronti delle piante non trattate.
42685931|A disorder characterized by stunting and bushy growth, shown by 'Kober 5BB', following grafting onto different wine grape cultivare was observed and investigated in Sardinia. The factor responsible for this graft incompatibility reaction occurred with remarkably high incidence (more than 70%) in cv. Malvasia di Bosa, and to a lesser extent in cultivare Aleatico, Cannonau, Monica, Pascale di Cagliari and Vermentino. It persisted in propagation material and was latent in Vitis rupestris Scheele, 'LN 33' and in Vitis vinifera L. Rupestris stem pitting (RSP) was detected in more than 70% of the affected clones but also in a 40% of those not carrying the incompatibility factor. The reverse was true for leafroll. ELISA tests were inconclusive: grapevine fleck virus (GFkV) occurred in 60% of affected and 40% of non affected clones, whereas grapevine virus A (GVA), grapevine virus B (GVB) and leafroll associated virus I (GLRaVI) and III (GLRaV III) were more or less equally represented in both groups of donors (affected and not). These findings support the notion that the observed disorder is induced by a graft-transmissible factor differing from those involved in known virus diseases.
42684146|Studies on relationship of two strains of Watermelon mosaic virus with its vector Myzus persicae Sulz. indicate that the virus is transmitted in the typical non-persistent manner and is  stylet-borne . Preacquisition fasting of 4 hours with 2 minutes acquisition feeding increased the maximum efficiency of the vector. Even a single aphid was found to be capable of transmitting the WMV strains. The virus persisted in the viruliferous aphids when the latter fed continuously for 10 minutes only. Alate and apterous adults were alike in transmitting the virus, while the nymphal forms were slightly more efficient. Infectivity of viruliferous aphids was lost after 2 hours postacquisition fasting. L'efficienza del vettore si  accresciuta dopo un periodo di affamamento di 4 ore seguito da un'acquisizione di 2 minuti. Entrambi i ceppi sono stati trasmessi da un solo afide. Il periodo di ritenzione non ha superato i 10 minuti e le 2 ore, rispettivamente in individui nutriti continuamente tenuti in affamamento dopo l'acquisizione. Nessuna differenza  stata inoltre riscontrata nella capacit di trasmettere il virus tra afidi atteri e afidi alati. Queste forme sono risultate comunque meno efficienti delle forme ninfali. Les tudes sur la relation entre deux souches du virus de la mosaque de la Pastque (WMV) avec son vecteur Myzus persicae Sulz. montrent que le virus est transmis de faon typique non-persistante et qu'il est  stylet-borne . Un jene de 4 heures de pracquisition et deux minutes d'alimentation d'acquisition ont augment l'efficacit du vecteur. On a trouv que mme un seul aphidien est capable de transmettre les souches de WMV. Le virus persistait dans les aphidiens virulents quand ces derniers taient aliments de faon continue pendant 10 minutes seulement. Les adultes ails et aptres taient semblables dans la transmission du virus, tandis que les formes nymphales taient lgrement plus efficaces.
