42684597|Grapevine fanleaf virus was readily detected in leaf or stem cortex samples of infected grapevines at all times of the year using immunosorbent electron microscopy. Incubation of the grids with antiserum for longer than 5 min at 22C did not increase the numbers of virus particles trapped, whereas incubation of the grids with the grapevine extracts for up to 4 h at 7C increased the numbers of particles trapped. Use of nicotine, polyvinylpyrrolidone or polyethylene glycol, but not sodium sulfite or phosphate buffer alone, during tissue extraction, aided detection of the virus particles. Il virus delle malformazioni infettive della vite (GFV)  stato rilevato rapidamente in campioni di foglie o di tessuto corticale di viti infette utilizzando la microscopia elettronica immunosorbente, in ogni epoca dell'anno. L'incubazione dei retini con l'antisiero per pi di 5 min a 22C non ha aumentato il numero di particelle virali intrappolate, mentre l'incubazione dei retini con l'estratto di vite per un periodo fino a 4 h a 7C ha aumentato il numero di particelle intrappolate. Durante l'estrazione dei tessuti, nicotina, polivinilpirrolidone o polietilenglicole hanno dimostrato di avere buona azione protettiva sulle particelle virali, mentre solfito di sodio o tampone fosfato da solo hanno dimostrato di non proteggere le particelle dalla degradazione.
42685675|A special technique was set up for in situ detection of Clavibacter michiganensis ssp. sepedonicus, the causal agent of ring rot in potato tubers. Stems from 4-week old potato plants were inoculated with a suspension of 10 cell/ml. Sampling was followed by fixation, dehydration and embedding in paraffin. Thin sections were cut, de waxed and treated according to the indirect fluorescence antibody staining technique (IFAS). Microscope observations revealed the precise localization of the corynebacteria in the vessel lumen and, occasionally, in the intercellular spaces of adjacent parenchymatic cells. It was also observed that the germs moved both up and down the stems, away from the inoculation site, as well as to other non-inoculated stems. The sensitivity of the method is discussed and compared with that of traditional IFAS.  stata messa a punto una tecnica particolare per rilevare in situ Clavibacter michiganensis ssp. sepedonicus, l'agente causale del marciume anulare della patata. In piante di 4 settimane di et sono stati inoculati i fusti con una sospensione batteria di 10 cell/ml. I campioni sono stati fissati, disidratati ed inclusi in paraffina. Sono state tagliate sezioni sottili, deparaffinate e trattate secondo la tecnica di colorazione indiretta di immunofluorescenza (IFAS). Osservazioni al microscopio hanno evidenziato la localizzazione precisa dei corinebatteri nel lume dei vasi e, occasionalmente, negli spazi intercellulari delle cellule parenchimatiche adiacenti. Si  osservato che il movimento dei germi dal punto di inoculo  avvenuto sia in senso acropeto che basipeto, come pure verso altri fusti non inoculati. La sensibilit del metodo  discussa e comparata con quella della IFAS tradizionale.
42684195|Infezioni locali da V. dahliae sono state frequentemente osservate su foglie di Pomodoro in pieno campo e in serra. In serra, saggi d'inoculazione di foglie di Pomodoro sono stati effettuati spruzzando o depositando gocce di una sospensione del fungo in acqua. Sono stati usati due ceppi del fungo: l'isolato Vd-35, ottenuto da un'infezione fogliare localizzata e Fisolato Vd-50 ottenuto da un fusto di Pomodoro sistemicamente infetto. Entrambi gli isolati hanno causato infezioni locali su foglie con microferite prodotte con polvere abrasiva, ma non su foglie intatte. Le macchie fogliari sono state inizialmente clorotiche e in seguito necrotiche. Spesso, le foglie infette sono infine cadute prematuramente a causa di estesi ingiallimenti e seccumi. Le infezioni fogliari locali non si sono evolute in infezioni sistemicne. Il maggior numero e raumentata disseminabilit dei conidi prodotti nelle infezioni fogliari vengono discussi in relazione all'epidemiologia e all'adattabilit di V. dahliae. Local infections by V. dahliae on leaves of Tomato plants growing in field and greenhouse were observed in southern Italy. Inoculation tests were made by spraying or depositing drops of a water suspension of the fungus on tomato leaves. Isolate Vd-35, obtained from a tomato leaf with local lesions and isolate Vd-50, from a systemically infected tomato stem, were used. Both isolates caused local infections on leaves previously wounded with an abrasive powder; no symptoms were produced on intact leaves. Local leaf lesions were first chlorotic and later necrotic. Eventually, many inoculated leaves showed extensive chlorosis and/or necrosis and abscissed prematurely. Local leaf infections did not evolve to systemic infections. The higher number of conidia and their increased possibilities of dispersal from leaf infections are discussed in relation to epidemiology and adaptability of V. dahliae. En serre, on a effectu des essais d'inoculation des feuilles de Tomate en aspergeant ou en dposant des gouttes d'une suspension du champignon dans l'eau. Deux souches du champignon ont t utilises: l'isolat Vd-35 obtenu d'une infection foliaire localise et l'isolat Vd-50 obtenu d'une tige de tomate systmiquement infect. Les deux isolats ont caus des infections localises sur les feuilles avec microblessures produites par une poudre abrasive, mais pas sur les feuilles intactes. Au dbut, les taches foliaires sont chlorotiques et ensuite, ncrotiques. Souvent, les feuilles infectes tombent prmaturment  cause de jaunissements importants et de ncrose. Les infections foliaires localises n'ont pas volu en infections systmiques. Le nombre accru et la plus grande dissmination des conidies produits dans les infections foliaires sont discuts en relation avec l'pidmiologie et l'adaptabilit de V. dahliae.
42683949|Les Auteurs ont essay, en vases de culture, diffrents substrats de semis sur la fonte de semis de Pinus strobus L. et sur le dveloppement radiculaire de ce Pin. Dans 2 expriences ils ont tudi les facteurs substrats et fongicide aux niveaux suivants:  substrats: terreau de fumier, tourbe, mlange mr de tourbe et terreau;  fongicides: absence, oxychlorure de cuivre, carbammates. Les agents suivants de la fonte ont t reconnus: Rhizoctonia solani Khn, Pythium ultimum Trow, Fusarium spp. Une exprience a mis en vidence une action inhibitrice de la fonte dans le mlange tourbeterreau aprs 2 ans de maturation. Cette action disparait lors de la prolongation de la maturation du mlange  la troisime anne. Le traitement au carbammate (TMTD) a annul cette action inhibitrice naturelle, tandis que le traitement  l'oxcyhlorure de cuivre l'a augmente. Les fongicides se sont avrs efficaces contrela fonte dans tous les autres substrats: tourbe seule, terreau de fumier, mlange frais de tourbe-terreau et mlange mr de 3 ans; les carbammates, TMTD et Dithane M-45 ont t plus efficaces que l'oxychlorure de cuivre. Le dveloppement radiculaire (allongement des racines, nombre de racines courtes) et les mycorrhizes sont favoriss par la prsence de tourbe dans les substrats, que le processus trop prolong de maturation du mlange, jusqu' 3 ans, rduit. Les fongicides agissent diffremment sur le dveloppement radiculaire dans les divers substrats. L'oxychlorure de cuivre a une action inhibitrice leve dans la tourbe seule, que l'adjonction de terreau rduit. Les fongicides organiques (TMTD et Dithane M-45) au contraire, sont inhibiteurs du dveloppement radiculaires dans le terreau seul et l'adjonction de tourbe a un effet tampon sur leur action. Le mlange frais tourbe-terreau, sans apport de fumier, avec incorporation de carbammates (TMTD ou Dithane M-45) est, pour le moment, le substrat le plus sr pour rduire les pertes par la fonte dans les semis de Pins. Le mlange humifi tourbe-terreau prsente un intrt tout particulier pour ses proprits naturelles d'inhibition parasitaire, mais devra faire l'objet de recherches ultrieures avant l'application pratique,  cause de l'instabilit de ses proprits antagonistes vis  vis des agents de la fonte. The effects of different sowing media on damping-off of Eastern white Pine (Pinus strobus L.) seedlings as well as on the root development have been tested in pots. The factors: medium and fungicide have been compared in two factorial tests, using the following:  sowing media: farmyard manure mould; peat; mature mixture of peat and mould;  fungicides: none; copper oxychloride; carbamates. The following agents of damping-off have been detected: Rhizoctonia solani Khn, Pythium ultimum Trow, Fusarium spp. The trial evidenced that a 2-year humification of the peat and mould mixture inhibits damping-off, while the inhibitory action disappeared when the humification of the mixture was extended from two to three years. The use of carbamate (TMTD) eliminated this natural inhibitory action while the copper oxychloride treatment increased it. The fungicides proved to be effective against damping-off in all the others substrata: peat, manure mould, peat and mould fresh mixture, as well as mixture after a 3-years humification; the carbamates TMTD and Dithane M-45 proved to be more effective than copper oxychloride. The presence of peat in the media helped the development of roots (elongation of roots, number of short roots) and mycorrhizas while a too long humification of the mixture (up to 3 years) reduced it. As far as the root development was concerned the fungicides acted in different ways in the different substrata. The high inhibitory action of copper oxychloride in the peat medium was decreased by the addition of mould. On the contrary, the organic fungicides (TMTD and Dithane M-45) inhibited the root development in the mould substratum, while the addition of peat reduced this inhibitory action. The fresh mixture of peat and mould without addition of manure, but with carbamates (TMTD or Dithane M-45) proved to be, for the time being at least, the more reliable substratum to reduce the losses due to damping-off on Eastern white Pine seedlings. The natural characteristics of parasite inhibition detected in the peat and mould mature mixture have a specific interest, but further research is needed before practical application because of the instability of its antagonistic properties against damping off agents. Gli Autori hanno provato, con esperienze in vaso, l'influenza di diversi substrati di semina sulla mora dei semenzali di Pinus strobus L. e sullo sviluppo radicale di questo Pino. Sono stati studiati dapprima i fattori: substrato e funghicida, impiegando:  substrati: terriccio di letame; torba; miscela matura di torba e terriccio;  funghicidi: nessuno; ossicloruro di rame; carbammati. Sono stati individuati i seguenti agenti della mora: Rhizoctonia solara Khn, Pythium ultimum Trow, Fusarium spp.  stata messa in evidenza un'utile azione della miscela torba-terriccio matura (di 2 anni) contro la mora. II trattamento con TMTD ha annullato questa azione inibitrice naturale, mentre il trattamento con pssicloruro di rame l'ha accresciuta. I prodotti funghicidi si sono dimostrati efficaci contro la mora in tutti gli altri substrati: torba sola, terriccio di letame, miscela fresca di torba e terriccio e miscela matura di 3 anni di torba e terriccio; i carbammati (TM TD e Dithane M-45) sono stati pi efficaci dell'ossicloruro di rame. Lo sviluppo radicale (allungamento delle radici e numero di radiei corte) e le micorrize sono stati favoriti dalla presenza di torba nei substrati, ma un processo troppo lungo di maturazione della miscela, fino a 3 anni, ha ridotto tale effetto. L'aggiunta di funghicidi ai diversi substrati ha avuto diffrente conseguenza sullo sviluppo radicale. L'ossicloruro di rame mescolato alla torba ha mostrato un'azione inibitrice elevata che l'aggiunta di terriccio ha ridotto. I funghicidi organici (TMTD e Dithane M-45) hanno invece inibito lo sviluppo radicale nel terriccio, ma l'aggiunta di torba ha moderato questo effetto. La miscela fresca torba-terriccio, senza apporto di letame, con incorporamento di carbammati (TMTD o Dithane M45) , per il momento, il substrato pi sicuro per ridurre le perdite per mora nei semenzai di Pino. La miscela umificata torba-terriccio presenta un interesse particolare per la sua naturale azione antagonistica contro gli agenti di mora. Sarebbero per utili al proposito altre osservazioni a causa dell'instabilit di questa azione.
42684479|Some of the present subjects of research on biology of Melampsora pinitorqua in Italy, Finland, Poland and Sweden are the following. 1) Susceptibility of various pine species in different environments. 2) Trials for better identification of different proveniences of the Melampsora populnea  complex . 3) Overwintering and germinability of the rust teliospores. As to the first point: in all countries Pinus contorta and P. banksiana appeared not susceptible, P. silvestris was the most susceptible species, P. nigra ssp. austraca, somewhat susceptible in Italy, appeared more susceptible in Sweden and Finland, but to a clearly lower degree than P. silvestrs. The importance of phenology in relation to infection on P. nigra is discussed. The second point of the research deals with the Italian trials for better identification of two proveniences of Melampsora, M. pinitorqua from Tuscany and M. larici-tremulae from the central Alps. The objective of the work as follows: 1) to separate the mixture of the two species of Melampsora which may occur together on the same poplar leaves, 2) to test the host range of the two species and to compare their morphology. These experiments will be useful to clarify the systematic relations of some components of the M. populnea  complex , and the probable presence of separate species, formae spciales, or ecotypes. The problems with the M. populnea complex mentioned by workers of other countries are reported. The observations on the third point of the research carried out in Italy, Finland, Poland and Sweden, concern: the maturation period of teliospores and the time of their germination in spring; the germinability of teliospores overwintered in different both natural and artificial environments; the germinability of mature teliospores after storage. 42684449|Cipress canker, caused by Seiridium (Coryneum) cardinale (Wag.) Sutton et Gibson, is recognized as the most damaging disease of Italian cypress (Cupressus sempervirens L.). A programme for breeding resistant Italian cypress started in 1974. Artificial inoculations pointed out some differences in susceptibility within the species. Some trees (about 2% of all the artificially inoculated cypresses) recovered from the established cankers completely. The methods used for large scale inoculations, are described; Cupressus species are listed according to their susceptibility in Italy; and the breeding programme is outlined. There are hopes to find a large genetic base of resistant trees, which will be able to transmit resistance to canker to their progenies. Il cancro del Cipresso, causato da Seiridium (Coryneum) cardinale (Wag.) Sutton et Gibson,  la malattia del Cipresso comune (Cupressus sempervirens L.) pi dannosa e preoccupante nelle piantagioni, nei vivai e nelle alberature stradali in Italia. Nel 1974 fu iniziato un programma di miglioramento genetico per la resistenza al cancro in considerazione degli scarsi risultati ottenuti con la lotta chimica specialmente curativa. Alcuni cipressi  il 2% delle piante inoculate artificialmente  riuscirono a cicatrizzare completamente il cancro. Viene descritta la metodologia impiegata per l'inoculazione di cipressi su larga scala, viene indicato il grado di suscettibilit di numerose specie di cipresso ed, infine, vengono illustrati gli scopi degli incroci intra ed interspecifici effettuati. 42685414|Sporadic and costly failure of newly planted vines is an ongoing problem in the Australian wine industry. Failed vines are frequently infected with wood pathogens, including the fungi associated with Young Vine Decline. Hot water treatment (HWT) and other nursery practices have also been implicated in vine failure. We undertook a survey of Australian grapevine nurseries to develop an understanding of current propagation practices and to facilitate the development of reliable propagation procedures that consistently produce high quality vines. A survey covering all aspects of grapevine propagation including sources of cuttings, HWT, sanitation and cold storage was mailed to all 60 trading Australian vine nurseries. In all, 25 nurseries responded, a response rate of 41.7%. Practices were found to vary widely both within and between nurseries. The vast majority of respondents (20) reported that they currently used, or had used, HWT, but the reliability of HWT was questioned by most nursery operators. A majority (18) felt that some Vitis vinifera varieties were more sensitive to HWT than others. Hydration also emerged as an important factor that had the potential to affect vine quality. All respondents used hydration and although the majority used treated water, cuttings were not generally seen as a source of cross contamination. Our study identified a clear need for further research into the effects of HWT on cutting physiology and the role of hydration in the epidemiology of grapevine pathogens, and the importance of incorporating the results of such research into practical and comprehensive propagation guidelines for vine nurseries.
42685413|Grapevine nurseries soak cuttings in water during propagation to compensate for dehydration and promote root initiation. However, trunk disease pathogens have been isolated from soaking water, indicating cross contamination. Cuttings of Vitis vinifera cv. Sunmuscat and V. berlandieri x V. rupestris rootstock cv. 140 Ruggeri were immersed in sterilized, deionised water for 1, 2, 4, 8 and 16 h. The soaking water was cultured (25C for 3 days) on non-specific and specific media for fungi and bacteria. The base of each cutting was debarked and trimmed and three 3 mm thick, contiguous, transverse slices of wood cultured at 25C for 3 days. The soaking water for both cultivars became contaminated with microorganisms within the first hour. Numbers of fungi isolated from the wood slices soaked for one hour were significantly greater than those from non-soaked cuttings. The number of bacterial colonies growing from the wood slices increased after soaking for 2-4 h in Sunmuscat. In a second experiment Shiraz cuttings were soaked for 1, 2, 4, 8 and 24 h. The soaking water became contaminated within the first hour but only the bacterial count increased significantly over time. Microorganisms also established on the container surfaces within the first hour although there were no significant increases over 24 h. These results confirm that soaking cuttings is a potential cause of cross contamination and demonstrate contamination of cuttings occurs after relatively short periods of soaking. Avoiding exposing cuttings to water will reduce the transmission of trunk diseases in propagation.

42684433|Sono state condotte alcune osservazioni sul'impiego di due metodi di analisi chimica quantitativa delle aflatossine B, B, G e G in differenti prodotti vegetali (cereali, legumi, semi oleosi, mandorle, insilati, mangimi completi, ecc): il metodo ufficiale della Comunit Economica Europea (CEE) e il metodo fluorimetrico di Velasco. Entrambi i metodi hanno dimostrato una sensibilit non adeguata ai nuovi limiti di tolleranza delle aflatossine indicati dalla CEE e, per diversi prodotti vegetali, una scarsa affidabilit. I tentativi per migliorare il metodo CEE, condotti integrando e modificando le sue diverse fasi con altre fasi riprese da metodi pi recenti hanno portato alla definizione di un mtodo pi adeguato, simile a quello proposto recentemente da Barabolak (1977) per il mais, che  risultato applicabile con una buona sensibilit (0,5-1 g/kg) e ripetibilit dei risultati a tutti i prodotti considerati. Il metodo proposto  il seguente: estrazione delle aflatossine dai campioni in omogenizzatore con acetone-acqua (85 + 15); purificazione dell'estratto con solfato di ammonio; estrazione della soluzione salina con benzene; purificazione dell'estratto benzenico con una colonna cromatografica preparata con gel di silice e ossido di alluminio acido ed eluita con, nell'ordine: benzene-acido actico (90 + 10), etere etilico-esano (75 + 25)  che si scartano  e con cloruro di metilene-acetone (75 + 25); determinazione quantitativa delle aflatossine con cromatografie su strato sottile di gel di silice, sviluppate in una o due direzioni rispettivamente con cloroformio-acetone (88 + 12), o con etere etilico-metanolo-acqua (94 + 4,5+ 1,5) nella prima direzione e cloroformio-acetone (88 + 12) nella seconda direzione. Some observations on the analysis of aflatoxins B; B, G and G in different foods and feeds (cereals, legumes, oil-seeds, almond, silages, mixed feed, etc.), by official method of European Economic Community (EEC) (Anonymous, 1975; Anonymous, 1976) and Velasco minicolumn fluorometer method (Anonymous, 1974; Velasco, 1975), were carried out. Both methods showed an inadequate sensitivity in respect of the new limits of aflatoxins permitted in feeds adopted by EEC (Anonymous, 1974a) and, for several products, an insufficient reliability. Attempts to improve the EEC method by suitable modification and integration with procedure suggested by several published methods, led to a new adapted method similar to that recently proposed by Barabolak (1977) for corn, that was applicable with high sensitivity (0.5-1 g/kg) for all products considered. The proposed method is composed of: extraction of aflatoxins from the sample by high-speed blending with acetone-HO (85 + 15); purification of the extract with ammonium sulfate; partition of the filtrate with benzene; purification of the benzene extract on a silica gel-alumina column by washing with benzene-acetic acid (90 + 10) and ether-hexane (75 + 25), and eluting with methylene chloride-acetone (75 + 25); identification and quantitative determination of aflatoxins B, B, G and G by one-and two-dimensional silica gel thin layer chromatography, eluted respectively with chloroform-acetone (88 + 12), or with ether-methanol-HO (94 + 4.5 + 1.5) followed by chloroform-acetone (88 + 12).
42684037|To determine the extent to which abnormal carbohydrate accumulation in leaves of PLRVinfected plants is due to inhibited translocation or to aberrant variation in the metabolism of these compounds, kinetic comparisons of healthy and diseased Physalis floridana Rydb. plants were conducted, using C as marker. Selected leaves of healthy and PLRV-infected plants were simultaneously pulse-labelled with CO under appropriate light and temperature conditions. Thereafter small leaf disks were sampled from the exposed leaves over a period of 30 hours. These samples were fractionated and analyzed to determine the levels of labelled sucrose, fructose, glucose, ethanol-soluble, and ethanol-insoluble constituents. Because the behavior of labelled compounds in a steadystate system follows exponential laws, the level of each compound was plotted as a function of time on semilogarithmic graphs. The curves obtained represented the overall metabolic turnover rates of the photosynthates. These were resolved into a series of components with their slopes indicating the rate constants of different metabolic reactions determining the fate of the photosynthate. These time profiles, which were always multiexponential, were analyzed by the " backward projection " technique. The half-life, as well as the rate constant (slope) for each curve component (straight line), were determined. These data were used to derive appropriate mathematical equations which described the various types of profiles encountered. For " soluble " fraction sucrose and some " insoluble " fractions, " continuous elimination " type profiles were observed. For glucose and fructose, profiles were encountered in which there was a mono-exponential increase to a maximum, followed by a multi-exponential decrease. For sucrose continuous elimination curves, the total rate of sucrose turnover (equivalent to the total loss of this metabolite) was calculated from the slope of the zero-time curve tangent. In general, there was a consistent decrease in the rate constants for each fraction and compound of diseased plants as compared with healthy. A reduced rate of sucrose turnover also was typical of diseased plants. The greater the normal turnover rate of a given compound or fraction, the greater was its reduction in diseased plants. The theoretical initial radioactivity distribution among the fractions and compounds was established by adding up the zero-time values of the straight line components resolved from the relative profiles. By this means, the relative rates of CO fixation in healthy and diseased plants were compared. In plants with mild symptoms, photosynthesis appeared to be unaffected by infection. In severely affected plants, this initial value was approximately 1/3-1/2 that of the healthy. To compare photosynthate translocation, experiments were performed in which 15 minutes after 2 hours labelling sections were cut along the petioles and the adjoining stems of exposed diseased and healthy leaves. These fresh-cut sections were assayed for radioac tivity level. In general translocation gradients of radioactive photosynthates were much higher in healthy plants than in diseased plants. From the kinetic profile data obtained in the course of the study, a relationship of precursor-products was determined among sucrose and fructose-glucose. A compartmental approach was used to analyze the connections among these three main sugar pools. Based upon our own findings and the results of investigations in the literature, a model was proposed. Tracer techniques and kinetic analysis permitted us to demonstrate that PLRV infection depresses both translocatlon and total metabolic turnover rates. Thus those who claimed that either one of these two factors was alone responsible for the carbohydrate accumulation in the leaves of PLRV-infected plants were only partially right. Allo scopo di determinare in quale misura l'accumulo anomalo di carboidrati nelle foglie di Phvsalis floridana Rydb. infette dal virus dell'accartocciamento della Patata (PLRV) sia dovuto ad inibita traslocazione o ad alterato metabolismo, sono state effettuate analisi comparative della cinetica di questi composti in piante sane e in piante ammalate, usando il C come elemento marcante. Successivamente, per un periodo di circa 30 ore, dalle foglie esposte all'atmosfera radioattiva sono stati prelevati dischi di tessuto, su di essi, dopo opportuni frazionamenti, si  determinato il contenuto dei seguenti composti radioattivi: saccarosio, fruttosio, glucosio, frazione solubile e frazione insolubile in etanolo. Siccome il comportamento di composti marcati in un sistema in equilibrio (steady-state) segue leggi esponenziali, le variazioni nel tempo del contenuto di ogni composto, sono state riportate su coordinate semilogaritmiche. Ciascuna curva cos ottenuta, rappresentante la velocit complessiva del ricambio (turnover) metablico dei composti di origine fotosintetica,  stata poi scomposta in una serie di linee rette componenti. Le inclinazioni di tali rette indicavano le costanti di velocit delle diverse reazioni metaboliche di trasformazione di ogni composto. Queste curve di tipo multi-esponenziale, sono state analizzate con una particolare tcnica di estrapolazione (backward projection) e, per ogni componente, si sono quindi determinad il " tempo di dimezzamento " (half-life) e la costante di velocit (rate-constant). Questi Ultimi dati sono stati poi utilizzati per ottenere equazioni matematlche che descrivessero l'andamento delle curve stesse. A seconda dei metaboliti esaminati, sono stati determinad diversi tipi di curve cinetiche. Per le frazioni solubili in etanolo, per alcune frazioni insolubili e per il saccarosio, le curve erano del tipo " eliminazione continua ". Per il glucosio e il fruttosio le curve erano ascendenti in modo mono-esponenziale fino ad un massimo e poi discendenti in maniera pluri-esponenziale. Per le curve di eliminazione del saccarosio, la velocit totale di ricambio del composto (correspondente alla " perdita totale " del metabolita)  stata calcolata dall'incllnazione della tangente alle curve al tempo zero. In generale tutte le costanti di velocit dei vari composti o frazioni esaminate sono risultate notevolmente ridotte nelle piante yirosate in confronto a quelle sane. Quanto pi elevata era la velocit di ricambio metabolico di un determinato composto o frazione nelle piante sane, tanto pi i suoi valori erano ridotti nelle piante ammalate. Inoltre, nelle piante ammalate la velocit totale di ricambio del saccarosio era notevolmente ridotta. Dalle curve descriventi l'andamento cinetico delle concentrazioni dei vari metaboliti marcati,  stata calcolata anche la distribuzione iniziale teorica della radioattivit nei vari composti e frazioni. Ci  stato ottenuto sommando per ogni curva i valori al tempo zero delle linee rette componenti. 42685239|Studies on inoculum densities of the chickpea wilt pathogen Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. ciceri race 1 and 2 with thre chickpea cultivars representing early wilter (highly susceptible), late wilter (moderately susceptible) and resistant were conducted in glasshouse at 25C. Highly susceptible cv. JG 62 showed 100% mortality at 15 days for race 1 and 17 days for race 2 at higher inoculum density. At the low inoculum density, the wilting was delayed and at this inoculum level two other cultivars showed no mortality. The wilt resistant cultivar cv. WR 315 and moderately susceptible cultivar cv. K 850 remained completely free from wilt symptoms up to 60 days while cv. JG 62 wilted in 27 days with F.o. f. sp. ciceri population ranging 4233-4667 propagules/g soil. However, xylem browning in the root and collar region was recorded in cv. K 850. The F.o. f. sp. ciceri population of race 1 and 2 increased with age of the plant in soils with wilt susceptible, moderately susceptible, and resistant chickpea cultivars. Moderately susceptible and resistant cultivars supported the multiplication of F.o. f. sp. ciceri propagules in the soil though the plants were free of wilt symptoms up to 60 days after planting. The multiplication ratio was higher at low inoculum density of the propagules compared to the higher inoculum density for both the races of F.o. f. sp. ciceri. As the inoculum density increased the multiplication ratio decreased.
42684243|Cucumber mosaic virus is a very common disease of many cultivated plants in Israel, particularly during the spring, autumn and winter seasons. It has been found to reduce plant development greatly, to cause plant death by interacting with Pythium and Fusarium root pathogens, and to increase the destructive effect of the latter pathogen. Breading has resulted in the production of some resistant cultivars of Cucumber, and work is being carried out on the breeding of other crops. In addition some control has been achieved by yellow plastic sheets with sticky surfaces, placed upright around plots, and acting as aphid attractants, by silvery plastic sheets and other silver coverings of the soil acting as repellents, and by sprays with oil emulsions. Il virus del mosaico del Cetriolo  oltremodo comune in molte colture in Israele, in particolare in primavera, autunno ed inverno. Il virus causa una grave riduzione dello sviluppo delle piante, causa elevate mortalit in associazione con funghi del suolo come Pythium e Fusarium, ed aumenta i danni causati da questi funghi. Sono state prodotte alcune variet resistenti di Cetriolo, e si lavora alla produzione di variet resistenti di altre colture. Oltre a cio si sono avuti risultati positivi nella lotta contro questo virus usando trappole di materiale plastico di color giallo coperte di sostanze appiccicose, messe verticalmente intorno aile parcelle, che agiscono da attraente per gli afidi ed inoltre, usando materiale plastico argenteo ed altre coperture argentate del terreno, che agiscono come repellenti degli afidi, e con irrorazioni con emulsioni di olii. Le virus de la mosaque du Concombre est trs rpandu dans plusieures cultures en Israel, notamment au printemps, en automne et en hiver. Le virus cause une grave rduction du dveloppement des plantes, provoque une mortalit leve en association avec les champignons du sol comme Pythium and Fusarium, et il augmente les dgts causs par ces champignons. On a produit certaines varits rsistantes de Concombre et on travaille  prsent pour la production de varits rsistantes d'autres cultures. En outre, on a obtenu des rsultats positifs dans la lutte contre ce virus en utilisant des piges en matire plastique de couleur jaune couverts de substances collantes, placs verticalement autour des parcelles pour pouvoir attirer les aphidiens et, en plus, on utilise de la matire plastique argente et d'autres couvertures argentes du sol qui agissent comme lments rpulsifs des aphidiens et aussi des pulverisation avec mulsions d'huiles.
42683671|La penetrazione dei parassiti in ospiti non specifici e il grado di affinit di questi ultimi verso i parassiti stessi, rispetto a quello mostrato dal rispettivo ospite specifico, formano l'oggetto di questa Nota. Sono stati scelti corne parassiti: Puccinia recondita Rob. (che attacca il Frumento e alcune Graminacee spontanee) e Uromyces fabae (Pers.) de Bary (che attacca la Fava e alcune Leguminose del genere Vicia), entrambi obbligati e specializzati. La serie di ospiti  stata infttata con le uredospore di entrambi i parassiti. Sono state cosi ottenute due serie di dati confrontabili, alle quali si  potuto aggiungere la serie precedentemente studiata da Sempio e Caporali (che ha nove ospiti in comune con la nostra), ottenuta con infezioni di Uromyces appendiculatus (Pers.) Link. Le specie infettate sono state: Triticum aestivum ssp. vulgare L. cv Mentana (ospite specifico di P. recondita); Vicia faba L. var major Harz. (ospite specifico di U. fabae). Seguono altri ospiti: Fagiolo cv  Cinquantino  e  Spagnone ; Erba medica; Pomodoro cv  Marglobe ; Vite cv  Maivasia ; Tabacco cv  Bright 5 ; Orzo; Avena; Cavolo; Sulla; Scarola; Endivia. Pezzi di foglia prelevati a 16, 24, 48, 72 e 96 ore dall'inoculazione venivano posti a chiarificare in una soluzione di cloralio idrato onde poter seguire al microscopio l'andamento del micelio nei vari tessuti del mesofillo, rimasti morfologicamente pressoch inalterati. Sulle diverse specie i tubuli micelici mostravano differente attrazione stomatica, ma si potevano osservare penetrazioni pi o meno frequenti nella maggior parte delle specie esaminate. In tutte le specie la penetrazione  risultata normale: appressorio soyrastomatico, stiletto, vescicola ipostomatica (pi o meno evidente) e ife d'infezione (di diversa conformazione e sviluppo). Da questo studio, come da quelli precedenti sull'argomento,  emersa la mancanza di una relazione fra affinit sistematica tra gli ospiti e il comportamento biologico dei medesimi rispetto ai parassiti studiati. In entrambe le serie, infatti, ospiti sistematicamente molto lontani dall'ospite specifico presentano un'affinit biologica, cio una compatibilit verso il parassita in questione, spesso superiore di altri, molto pi vicini sistematicamente a quest'ultimo. Citiamo ad esempio il caso del Fagiolo cv  Cinquantino  infettato con P. recondita: nella scala delle affinit biologiche verso il parassita, esso viene prima dell'Avena, (rispettivamente al terzo e al quarto posto), che appartiene alla stessa famiglia dell'ospite specifico della ruggine. Nell'ambito della famiglia delle Leguminose, poi, si  osservato, sempre nei confronti della P. recondita, una notevole diversit di comportamento: si passa infatti per gradi dal Fagiolo cv  Cinquantino , relativamente affine (terzo posto), alla Sulla del tutto immune (quattordicesimo posto). Anche rispetto all'U. fabae l'affinit delle specie ospiti appartenenti alla famiglia delle Leguminose, sottofamiglia Papilionacee, cui appartiene l'ospite specifico,  diversissima. Si passa infatti dall'ospite specifico a quello refrattario attraverso graduali passaggi: Fava (assai suscettibile), Fagiolo cv  Cinquantino  e cv  Spagnone , Erba medica, Sulla (immune). Comportamento molto difforme, nei riguardi dei tre parassiti in esame, hanno anche gli ospiti appartenenti alla famiglia delle Solanacee. Il Pomodoro cv  Marglobe  occupa, nella scala delle affinit, il terzo posto per U. appendiculatus (Sempio e Caporali, 1958), il quarto per U. fabae e il nono per P. recondita; mentre il Tabacco cv  Bright 5  occupa rispettivamente l'undicesimo, il decimo e il dodicesimo posto. Notevole uniformis di comportamento consistente in un'azione tossica preventiva sulla germinazione delle spore, hanno mostrato le Graminacee nei confronti dei due Uromyces; mentre le due cv di Fagiolo ( Cinquantino  e  Spagnone ) hanno mostrato una notevole affinit oltre ehe per U. appendiculatus (parassita specifico) anche per U. fabae e P. recondita. Sono stati osservati inoltre casi di quasi completa refrattariet (Scarola, Endivia e Cavolo cinese verso P. recondita; Endivia, Scarola e Tabacco cv  Bright 5  verso U. fabae), nonch casi di azione tossica preventiva (Sulla verso P. recondita; Cavolo cinese, Orzo,. Avena e Frumento verso U. fabae). Gli elementi della suscettibilit sono sembrati sostanzialmente gli stessi rilevati da Sempio e Caporali (1958). Si deyono tuttavia rilevare due aspetti differenziali: 1) l'approfondimento del micelio nei mesofillo non pu essere assunto sempre come elemento valido di suscettibilit. Infatti nei caso di U. fabae lo sviluppo del micelio rimane superficiale, anche nell'ospite specifico, durante tutto il periodo d'incubazione; 2) non sono mai stati rilevati austori in ospiti non specifici. Si  cos stabilita una scala di immunit crescente per P. recondita, U. fabae e U. appendiculatus in base ai particolari rilevati. An investigation was carried out on the penetration of plant parasitic fungi in non-specific hosts. Also their degree of affinity with these hosts was compared with the affinity shown towards the respective specific hosts. As obligate specialized parasites Puccinia recondita Rob. (which infects Wheat and some spontaneous Graminaceae) and Uromyces fabae (Pers.) De Bary (which infects French bean and some species of Vicia) were chosen. Two identical series of plants were infected with uredospores of both pathogens: Triticum aestivum ssp. vulgare L. cv  Mentana  (specific host of P. recondita), Vicia faba L. var.  major  Harz, (specific host of U. fabae); French beans cv  Cinquantino  and  Spagnone ; Alfalfa; Tomato cv  Marglobe ; Grapevine cv  Malvasia ; Tobacco cv  Bright 5 ; Barley; Oat; Cabbage; Sulla; Endive and Scarola. Two comparable series of data were obtained, which were also compared with those previously given by Sempio and Caporali (1958), who had infected with uredospores of Uromyces appendiculatus nine of the above mentioned hosts. Leaf portions were taken 16, 24, 48, 72 and 96 hours after infection and clarified in chloral hydrate. It was then possible to follow the development of the mycelium in the various foliar tissues which had remained morfologically nearly unaltered. Athough on different hosts the germ tubes showed a different degree of stomatic attraction, more or less frequent penetration occurred in most of the species under study. In all the plants the penetration process followed the usual path: appressorium, infection thread, substomatal vescicle (more or less evident), infecting hyphae (having different conformation and development). The results of these studies, are in good agreement with the results previously obtained by others. No relationship seems to exist between the taxonomical affinity among the hosts and their biological behaviour in respect to the parasites. In fact, in both series, plants taxonomically unrelated to the specific host of a given parasite showed a biological affinity, that is, a degree of compatibility, often far superior to the affinity observed in other plants taxonomically closer to the specific host. For example French bean cv  Cinquantino , shows higher biological affinity to P. recondita than Oat although the latter belongs to the same family of the specific host of this rust. French bean cv  Cinquantino  and Oats are respectively in the third and fourth place of the scale of biological affinity to P. recondita. Furthermore, within the group of leguminous plants there are remarkable differences in respect to P. recondita. For example French bean cv  Cinquantino  shows a good degree of affinity (third place) whereas Sulla is totally immune to infection (fourtheenth place). In regard to U. fabae the degree of affinity of the plants belonging to the same sub-family (Papilionaceae) of the specific host is quite different. Here again Broad bean (specific host) is very susceptible, more than French bean cv  Cinquantino  and  Spagnone ; Alfalfa is still less susceptible and finally Sulla is immune. Similar results were obtanied with solanaceous plants. In the scale of affinity Tomato cv  Marglobe  occupies the third place in regard to U. appendiculatus (Sempio e Caporali, 1958); the fourth in regard to V. fabae and the ninth in regard to P. recondita. On the contrary, Tobacco cv  Bright 5  is found respectively in the eleventh, tenth and twelfth place of the same scale. The tested members of Graminaceae family showed a consistent toxic action by inhibiting the spore germination of the two Uromyces species. Both French bean (cv  Cinquantino  and  Spagnone ) showed instead a noticeable affinity for the specific parasite (U. appendiculatus) as well as for U. fabae and P. recondita. Examples of almost total immunity (Scarola; Endivie and Chinese Cabbage towards P. recondita; Endivie, Scarola and Tobacco  Bright 5  towards V. fabae) and of toxic action (Sulla towards P. recondita; Chinese Cabbage, Barley, Oat and Wheat towards V. fabae) have been observed. The elements of susceptibility seemed to be pratically identical to those found by Sempio and Caporali (1958). However there are two main differences: 1) the deep penetration of the mycelium into the mesophyll cannot always be considered as an element of susceptibility, U. fabae mycelium growing superficially throughout the incubation period also in the instance of a specific host; 2) haustoria are never found in non-specific hosts. In conclusion, by putting together the histological details observed by us and by Sempio and Caporali (1958), it has been possible to establish an immunity scale for P. recondita, U. fabae and U. appendiculatus. 42685224|Investigations were carried out in France (Colmar) and Italy (Sassari and Bari) on grapevines known to contain a graft incompatibility factor revealed by the rootstock hybrid Vitis riparia x Vitis berlandieri 'Kober 5BB'. Several grapevine accessions were examined in both countries by ELISA using antisera specific to grapevine leafroll-associated closterovirus 1, 2 and 3, grapevine trichovirus A and B and grapevine fleck virus and by field or green-graft indexing. In other trials, the viruses still present in vines propagated from heat-treated cv. Chardonnay accessions were analysed by ELISA and the results of serological tests were compared with those coming from field indexing. The results obtained in Italy and France were comparable and led to the conclusion that a remarkably close association exists between GLRaV-2 and the 'Kober 5BB' graft-incompatibility condition.

Dans les cultures, les plantations de melons et courgettes sont contamines plus tt, et en plus forte proportion que celles de poivrons, et celles-ci plus que celles d'aubergines ou de tomates. Nous avons pu dmontrer exprimentalement qu'il existait des diffrences de rceptivit aux infections par pucerons entre ces espces vgtales. Pour la Tomate, on observe d plus une variation de rceptivit avec l'ge des plantes, les plus jeunes tant les plus sensibles (ces rsultats ont t obtenus avec deux espces de pucerons, Myzus persicae Sulz. et Aphis gossypii Glov.). Dans la nature les premires contaminations sont observes  la fin du mois de Juin. La densit des vecteurs s'accroit ensuite, et devient trs importante en Juillet et Aot. Par consquent les Melons et les Courgettes, trs rceptifs sont trs fortement attaqus des le dbut de Juillet. Sur les Poivrons, l'infection progresse plus lentement, mais devient importante en Aot. Les Aubergines ne sont jamais. attaques en forte proportion. Quant aux Tomates, seules les plantations tardives, semes en Juillet, et par consquent exposes trs jeunes  de fortes densits de vecteurs, sont attaques en forte proportion. Cette situation s'observe dans les plaines alluviales proches du niveau de la mer. Sur les coteaux, au-dessus de m 100 d'altitude les vecteurs semblent plus rares, et les cultures marachres moins atteintes. Cucumber virus I is the causal agent of an important disease in the vegetable growing areas of South-Eastern France. The symptoms induced by this virus are described on Muskmelon, Squash, Tomato, Pepper, Eggplant and Tobacco (in each case we have tentatively distinguished primary and secondary leaf symptoms, and symptoms on fruit). In the field, it appears that Muskmelons and Squashes are contaminated earlier, and in greater proportion than (in decreasing order) Peppers, Tomatoes and Eggplants. We could obtain experimental evidence of differences in susceptibility to aphid-transmitted virus between these vegetable species, which agrees very well with the differences observed in the field. In Tomato, we have also observed a variation of receptivity with the age of the plants, young ones being more receptive. These results were obtained with two species of aphids; Myzus persicae Sulz. and Aphis grossynii Glov. The first field infections are observed in the second half of June. The vector density then increases progressively to reach a pick in July and August. Consequently, Muskmelons and Squashes, very receptive, are strongly infected since the first days of July. In Peppers infection progresses more slowly, but becomes serious in August. Eggplants are never infected to a high percentage. In Tomatoes, only the late crops, sown in July, and therefore exposed in the seedling stage to a high vector density, are attacked to a serious extent. This situation is the rule in the alluvial areas near sea level. On the slopes of the hills, at altitudes higher than m 100 (= 300 ft.), the vectors seem to be rare, and the plants are less infected. Il virus I del Cetriolo causa gravi danni alle colture ortensi del Sud-Est della Francia. Sono descritti i sintomi prodotti dal virus su Melone, Zueca, Pomodoro, Peperone, Meianzana e Tabacco (in ogni caso si  tentato di distinguere sintomi primari e secondari sulle foglie e sintomi sui frutti). Sembrerebbe che le colture di Melone e di Zueca siano attaccate in campo prima e in maggiore proporzione di quelle di Peperone, Pomodoro e Melanzana.  stato sperimentalmente dimostrato che esistono differenze nella suscettibilit di queste diverse specie alle infezioni per mezzo di afidi. Ci concorda con quanto osservato in campo. Nel Pomodoro  stata anche osservata una variazione della recettivit alla malattia con l'et dlie piante. Le piante giovani sono le pi recettive. Questi risultati son stati ottenuti con due specie di afidi: Myzus persicae Solz. e Aphis gossypii Glov. Le prime infezioni si osservano in campo nella seconda meta di giugno. In seguito, la popolazione dei yettori aumenta progressivamente fino a raggiungere un massimo in luglio e agosto. Di conseguenza, Meloni e Zucche, che sono molto suscettibili, vengono fortemente infettati fin dai primi giorni di luglio. Sul Peperone l'infezione progredisce pi lentamente ma diventa grave in agosta. Le Melanzane non sono mai infettate in alta percentuale. Per il Pomodoro solo le colture tardive, seminate in luglio e dunque esposte ad alte densit di vettori quando sono nei primi stadi vegetativi, sono colpite in alte percentuali. Questa situazione  la pi comune nelle pianure alluvionali prossime al livello del mare. Sulle pendici collinari, ad altezze superiori a m 100, i vettori sembrano pi rari e le colture ortensi meno colpite.
42685462|In autoclaved soil 14-18C was most favorable for the survival of Agrobacterium tumefaciens (Sm. et Town.) Conn. In natural (unautoclaved) soil, 8C was more suitable for the persistence of the pathogen than higher temperatures. The optimum survival temperature was considerably lower than the optimum growth temperature. The optimum soil moisture for the survival of the bacteria ranged between 25 and 50% MHC in both autoclaved and unautoclaved soils. At low soil moisture (25% MHC), the bacteria increased in number slowly and declined equaly so. At high soil moisture (75-100% MHC), the bacteria rapidly increased and declined with time. The crown-gall organism could not survive in acidified soil (pH 4.1 or less), and slightly alkaline soil favoured survival. The organism survived better in autoclaved soil than in unautoclaved soil, and its survival decreased with the increase in the percentage of natural soil. A low C/N ratio (= 5) was most conducive to growth in pure culture during the first 2 days of incubation. A higher C/N ratio was required for continuous increase in viable counts during prolonged incubation. In the soil, increasing the C/N ratio was associated with an increase in the number of viable bacteria. Gemmeiza siltclay soil was more suitable for survival than Giza sandy-clay-loam soil and Tahrir calcareous sandy-loam soil. A. tumefaciens survived in galled leaves of cv. Pacific-6 of Castor Bean buried in air-dry or moistened soil for at least 144 days. Root exudates of different host plants varied in their effect on the growth of the pathogen. Certain susceptible root exudates stimulated growth. Maize (non-host) root exudates markedly suppressed the growth of the pathogen. La temperatura pi favorevole alla sopravvivenza di Agrobacterium tumefaciens (Sm. et Town.) Conn, in terreno sterilizzato in autoclave,  stato di 14-18  C. In terreno non trattato in autoclave, il patgeno  sopravvissuto meglio a 8  C che a temperature pi elevate. La temperatura ottimale per la sopravvivenza  stata considerevolmente pi bassa di quella ottimale per l'accrescimento. L'umidit ottimale per la sopravvivenza dei batteri  risultata compresa fra il 25 e il 50% dlia capacita di retenzione dell'umidit (MHC), sia nei terrena trattati in autoclave, sia in quelli non trattati. In condizioni di bassa umidit (25% MHC), si sono verificad dapprima un lento aumento, poi una lenta diminuzione del numero di batteri. Con umidit elvate (75-100% MHC), tale aumento e tale diminuzione son stati rapidi. La sopravvivenza dei batteri  stata impedita in terreno acido (pH non superiore a 4,1) e favorita in terreno leggermente alcalino. I batteri son sopravvissuti meglio in terreno trattato in autoclave che in terreno non trattato; in miscele dei due tipi di terreno, la sopravvivenza dei batteri  aumentata con l'aumentare della percentuale di terreno trattato. L'accrescimento dei batteri in coltura pura  risultato massimo, nei primi due giorni, nei substrati aventi un basso valore del rapporto C/N (C/N = 5). Valori pi elevati del rapporto C/N son risultati necessari per consentir la continuazione dell'accrescimento per periodi pi lunghi. L'aumento del rapporto C/N nei terreno ha determinate un aumento del numero di batteri vitali. Il terreno melmoso-argilloso della zona di Gemmeiza  risultato pi favorevole alla sopravvivenza dei batteri di quanto lo siano risultati il terreno sabbioso-argilloso, ricco di sostanza orgnica, della zona di Giza e quello sabbiosocalcareo, pure ricco di sostanza orgnica, della zona di Tahrir. A. tumefaciens  sopravvissuto per almeno 144 giorni in galle su foglie di Ricino, cv. Pacific-6, interrate in terreno seccato all'aria o in terreno inumidito. Gli essudati radicali di diverse piante ospiti hanno mostrato un diverso effet to sull'accrescimento del patgeno. Alcuni essudati di piante suscettibili hanno stimolato l'accrescimento. Gli essudati radicali del Mais (che non  una pianta ospite) hanno notevolmente limitato la moltiplicazione del patgeno. La temprature la plus favorable pour la survivance de Agrobacterium tumefaciens (Sm. et Town.) Conn, dans un sol trait en autoclave, a prouv tre de 14-18C. Dans le sol non-trait en autoclave, le pathogne a mieux survcu  8C qu' des tempratures plus leves. La temprature optima pour la survivance tait notablement plus basse que l'optima pour l'accroissement. L'humidit optima pour la survivance des bactries tait comprise entre 25 et 50% de la capacit de rtention de l'humidit (MHC), soit dans les sols traits en autoclave, soit dans les sols non-traits. Dans les conditions de basse humidit (25% MHC) on a eu d'abord une lente augmentation, et puis une lente diminution du nombre des bactries. Avec humidit leve (75-100% MHC) cette augmentation et cette diminution ont t rapides. La survivance des bactries a t empche en sol acide (pH n'excdant pas 4,1) et favorise en sol lgrement alcalin. Les bactries ont mieux survcus dans le sol trait en autoclave que dans le sol non-trait; dans des mlanges des deux types de sol, la survivance des bactries a augmente avec l'augmentation du pourcentage de sol trait. L'accroissement des bactries en culture pure a t maximum dans les deux premiers jours, dans les milieux ayant une faible valeur du rapport C/N (C/N = 5). Des valeurs plus leves du rapport C/N se sont dmontres ncessaires pour permettre la continuit de l'accroissement pendant des priodes plus longues. L'augmentation du rapport C/N dans le sol a dtermin une augmentation du nombre des bactries actives. Le sol limonneux-argileux de la zone de Gemmeiza a t plus favorable  la survivance des bactries par rapport au sol sablonneuxargileux, riche en matire organique, de la zone de Giza et  celui sublonneux-calcaire, aussi riche en matire organique de la zone de Tahrir. A. tumefaciens a survcu pendant au moins 144 jours en tumeurs sur feuilles de Ricin, cv. Pacific-6, enterres dans le sol sch  l'air ou dans un sol humidifi. Les exsudais radicaux de diffrentes plantes htes ont montr un effet diffrent sur l'accroissement du pathogne. Certains exsudais de plantes sensibles ont stimul l'accroissement. Les exsudt s radicaux du Mais (qui n'est pas une plante hte) ont limit notamment l'accroissement du pathogne.
42685755|One hundred and sixteen Eggplant accessions were tested in the field for resistance to Verticillium dahliae Kleb. Disease assessment was based on external and internal symptoms. Plants were scored for both types of symptoms and the amount of disease (% of diseased plants and severity index) was calculated for each accession. Disease ratings based on external symptoms did not always coincide with those for vascular discoloration of resistant accessions. No accessions possessed high resistance. However, some accessions showed levels of resistance characterized by percentage of diseased plants and, particularly, by disease severity values for both external symptoms and vascular discoloration lower than those for the susceptible cv. Florida Market. Resistance found in the original Eggplant accessions (S) was transmitted in single-plant selected S and S progenies. A new term, slow wilting (SW), is proposed to indicate the type of resistance exhibited by some resistant accessions. Centosedici accessioni di Melanzana sono state saggiate in pieno campo per la resistenza verso Verticillium dahliae. Ogni accessione  stata valutata considerando la percentuale di piante malate e l'indice di gravit della malattia sia dei sintomi esterni che degli imbrunimenti vascolari. Nelle accessioni resistenti la gravit dei sintomi esterni di malattia non ha coinciso sempre con quella degli imbrunimenti vascolari. Nessuna accessione  risultata altamente resistente, tuttavia alcune hanno mostrato livelli di resistenza caratterizzati da percentuali di piante malate e, in particolare, da indici di gravit di malattia, sia per i sintomi esterni sia per gli imbrunimenti vascolari, significativamente pi bassi di quelli della cv. suscettibile Florida Market. La resistenza individuata nelle accessioni originali di Melanzana (S)  stata trasferita alle progenie S e S ottenute per autoimpollinazione da piante selezionate. Si propone un nuovo termine, 'slow wilting' (SW), per indicare il tipo di resistenza manifestato da alcune accessioni resistenti.

42684552|Beet necrotic yellow vein virus (BNYVV), the causal agent of rizomania of sugarbeets, had a similar ultrastructure in local lesions of Chenopodium amaranticolor and Sugarbeet (Beta vulgaris L.) and in systemically infected Beta macrocarpa. The virus was not seen in large aggregates but was mostly dispersed in the cytoplasm. In angle-layered aggregates, angles between virus particles were 45 and 90. Virus was not seen aggregated in parallel arrangements. Virus particles stained only weakly. Viral RNA in particles cut across was sometimes visible in ultrathin sections not as a closed ring, but in an angular horse shoe-shaped arrangement. There was no resemblance between BNYVV aggregates, or virus-induced ultrastructural changes of the host cell, and those of the morphologically similar soil-borne wheat mosaic virus. Il virus dell'ingiallimento nervale necrotico della barbabietola (BNYVV), agente della rizomania, ha presentato idntica ultrastruttura in lesioni locali di C. amaranticolor e barbabietola (Beta vulgaris) e in cellule di Beta macrocarpa con infezione sistemica. Il virus  stato osservato principalmente come particelle singole nel citoplasma, anziehe grandi aggregati. Le particelle virali negli aggregati erano disposte sia a 45 e sia a 90 fra di loro. Non sono stati osservati ammassi di particelle disposte parallelamente. Le particelle virali si coloravano debolmente. In sezioni ultrasottili l'RNA di particelle virali sezionate trasversalmente presentava una disposizione a ferro di cavallo anziehe ad anello. Gli aggregati del BNYVV e le modificazioni ultrastrutturali da esso indotte nelle cellule ospiti non presentavano alcuna somiglianza con quelle del mosaico del grano, virus quest'ultimo morfologicamente simile al BNYVV.

42685878|Interactions between Glomus mosseae and Plasmopara helianthi in sunflower plants susceptible and resistant to downy mildew were studied in three pot experiments. A reduction of the systemic infection by the pathogen was observed in all experiments and was influenced by the quantity of the mycorrhizal inoculum. Mycorrhizal plants preinoculated with G. mosseae at the highest rate of inoculum showed a well-developed mycorrhizal root colonization and a decrease in root infection by the pathogen. Root and shoot dry weights of mycorrizal and P. helianthi infected plants were significantly higher than those of P. helianthi infected ones; similar results were also obtained for root and shoot lengths. Systemic infection and sporulation were lower in mycorrhizal and P. helianthi infected plants compared to P. helianthi infected ones. Histochemical reactions of incompatibility (production of phenolics, accumulation of lignin) performed in roots of susceptible and resistant plants showed that no defence responses towards the pathogen were induced by mycorrhizal infection. The mechanisms by which mycorrhizal fungi can reduce disease incidence and pathogen infection are discussed.
42684038|Sixteen derivatives of fusicoccin, prepared by chemical modification of the parent compound, have been tested for their phytotoxic activity on cuttings of young Tomato plants. With the exception of hydrogenation of the t-pentenyl group, any structural modification (partial or full deacetylation, acetylation, removal of the t-pentenyl group, removal of the glucosidic moiety) remarkably or completely abolished phytotoxicity. Sedici derivati della fusicoccina, preparati per modificazione chimica di questo metabolita, sono stati saggiati per la loro attivit tossica su giovani piante recis di Pomodoro. Tranne l'idrogenazione del gruppo t-pentenilico, qualsiasi modificazione strutturale (deacetilazione parziale o totale, acetilazione, rimozione della parte glucosidica) ha notevolmente diminuito o completamente eliminato la fitotossicit. On a essay, sur des plants coups de Tomate, seize drivs de la fusicoccine prpars par modification chimique de ce metabolite. A l'exception de l'hydrognation du groupe t-pentnyl quelque que ait t la modification structurale (dacetylation partielle ou totale, actylation, enlvement de la partie glycosidique), la phytotoxicit a t remarquablement diminue ou bien compltement limine.
42685292|Charcoal rot caused by Macrophomina phaseolina is one of the most important diseases of sunflower in Italy where the fungus survives in the sclerotial stage on plant debris. A study was carried out to investigate the pycnidial stage of M. phaseolina on sunflower in Italy. No mature pycnidia were found on 64 infected stem samples collected at commercial maturity in different climatic areas of Italy, but, on 46 samples, it was possible to distinguish amid sclerotia elongated black bodies wich we suppose to be pycnidia initials. Sixty-four isolates obtained from these samples did not produce pycnidia on oat agar and potato dextrose agar, while 60 isolates produced pycnidia within 6-9 days on sunflower leaf-water-agar, and 3 produced initials within a month, while one produced only sclerotia. No mature pycnidia were produced by M. phaseolina isolates on artificially inoculated plantlets of sunflower maintained in a growth chamber for ten days after inoculation. No mature pycnidia, but only pycnidia initials were found on sunflower plants artificially inoculated maintained under natural field conditions until the end of July, to obtain an earlier infection than it usually occur in Italy. M. phaseolina isolates should be considered as sporulating, but under Italian field conditions this pathogen does not appear to produce mature pycnidia, probably because the environmental conditions are below the optimal conditions of tropical environments where mature pycnidia are sometimes found.

42685577|A study was made of the effects of temperature germination of aecidiospores, urediospores and basidiospores of Cronartium flaccidum, a causal agent of two-needled pine blister rust. Aecidiospores and urediospores germinated on water agar, while basidiospores germinated on distilled water. Fresh aecidiospores started germination 1 hour after the scattering at 15C, with a value of 75% and continued to germinate for 72 hours. Fresh urediospores germinated within 1 hour reaching 66% at 20C and continued for 72 hours. Basidiospores germinated within 6 hours reaching 80% at 20C and continued to grow for 72 hours. The temperature range of germination was: aecidiospores: 5-30C; urediospores: 5-25C; basidiospores: 10-25C. After a storage period of 30 days in dry vacuum at 5C aecidiospores started germination within 265 min and were viable for 360 days at 15C. After a storage period of 30 days urediospores germinate within 268 min and were viable for 180 days at 20C. The temperature range of germination was: aecidiospores: 5-25C, urediospores: 10-25C. The knowledge of conditioning of C. flaccidum at various stages may be a contribution to its epidemiology, making it possible to evaluate cyclic though dangerous epidemics in our country. Si  studiata l'influenza della temperatura sulla germinazione delle ecidiospore, uredospore e basidiospore prodotte da C. flaccidum, agente della ruggine vescicolosa della corteccia dei pini a due aghi. Ecidio e uredospore sono state fatte germinare su agar acqua, le basidiospore in acqua distillata. II campo utile delle temperature di germinazione  stato: -ecidiospore: da 5 a 30C; uredospore: da 5 a 25C; basidiospore: da 10 a 25C. Le ecidiospore fresche hanno cominciato a germinare dopo I ora a 15C, con un valore del 75% e hanno continuato per 72 ore. Le uredospore fresche hanno iniziato la germinazione in 1 ora, con un valore del 66% e hanno continuato per 72 ore. Le ecidiospore consrvate sotto vuoto a 5C per 30 giorni hanno iniziato a germinare in 265 min e son rimaste vitali per 360 giorni a 15C. Le uredospore consrvate sotto vuoto a 5C per 30 giorni hanno germinato in 268 min e son rimaste vitali per 180 giorni a 20C. II campo utile delle temperature di germinazione  stato per le ecidiospore, da 5 a 25C e per le uredospore, da 10 a 25C. La conoscenza di alcuni fattori condizionanti i diversi stadi di C. flaccidum costituisce un contribute allo studio della sua epidemiologia, rendendo possibile la previsione delle epidemie di ruggine, cicliche, ma pericolose nel nostro Paese.
42683930|In order to determine whether the aetiology of response of Tomato to Corynebacterium michiganense (E. F. Sm.) Jens, is best described by the  hypothesis of the individual effective dose  or by the  hypothesis of independent action , two variants of C. michiganense, differing in their resistance to terramycin but having the same virulence and the same rate of growth in vitro and in vivo, were inoculated separately and together in Tomato plants, cv  Florentina ,  Roma  and  C 1402 . The results of the mixed inoculation experiments conformed to the predictions of the hypothesis of independent action, i.e. (a) the hosts responding to doses of many ED 50's do so following the multiplication of many of the inoculated bacteria, (b) the majority of the hosts responding after inoculation with 1 or less than 1 ED 50 do so as a result of the multiplication of only one of the inoculated bacteria, if the hosts do not differ in resistance, and (c) the effect of heterogeneity in host resistance is to increase the proportion of hosts responding following the multiplication of many inoculated bacteria after challenge with  1 ED 50, and to decrease the proportion after challenge with many ED 50's. The slope, b, of the log-dose/probit-response curve, too, was always compatible with that predicted by the hypothesis of independent action, i.e. b  2. Jens, est mieux dcrite par l' hypothse de la dose individuelle effective  ou par l' hypothse de l'action indpendante , deux souches de C. michiganense, ayant une rsistance diffrente  la terramycine mais la mme virulence et la mme croissance in vitro et in vivo, ont t inocules sparment ou ensemble dans des plantes de Tomate, cv  Florentina ,  Roma  et  C 1402 . 42685751|In a field trial conducted for three seasons (1982-83, 1983-84 and 1985-86) at Tel Hadya, ICARDA, Syria, the relationship between temperature, relative humidity and Ascochyta blight development in Winter sown Chickpeas was studied. In all three seasons, the disease severity was high, reaching a score of 8 and above on a 1-9 scale. A stronger influence of temperature was found on Ascochyta blight epidemic development in a Mediterranean climate as compared to relative humidity. In the early part of crop growth (January-March), though relative humidity was high (> 60%), cool teperatures (minimum < 5C and maximum < 15C) were found to limit blight epidemics. Blight epidemics developed when the weekly mean temperatures were between 10C and 20C. Weekly maximum temperatures higher than 25C slowed down blight epidemics. Weekly mean relative humidity of > 60% supported blight epidemics and it was not found to be a limiting factor during most of the growth period of Winter-sown Chickpea in Syria. Sono state studiate le correlazioni tra lo sviluppo dell'ascochitosi su Cece a semina invernale, la teperatura e l'umidit relativa in prove di campo condotte nel corso di tre cicli colturali (1982-83, 1983-84 e 1985-86). In tutti e tre i cicli colturali la gravit della malattia  stata particularmente elevata. La temperatura esercita, nell'ambito del clima mediterraneo, una pi marcata influenza rispetto all'umidit relativa. Nel primo periodo della coltura (gennaio-marzo) lo sviluppo epidemiologico della malattia  contenuto dalla temperatura (min.<5 e max.<15C) nonostante l'umidit relativa risulti elevata (>60%). Intenso sviluppo epidemico si ha quando la teperatura media oscilla tra 10C e 20C; temperatura media > 25C rallentano lo sviluppo epidemico. Umidit relative media > 60% assecondano lo sviluppo epidemico e risultano non essere un valore limite per la maggior parte del ciclo vegetativo di sviluppo del Cece da semina invernale in Siria.

42684194|Leveillula taurica (Lv) Arn. has been recorded on Pepper in about 50 countries, on Eggplant, Tomato and Tropaeolum majus L. in 25-30, and on a large number of widely grown crops in 1-9 countries only. The fungus achieves its widest distribution on major crop hosts in the Mediterranean region, which accounts for almost half the host/country records on these crops. An important reason for this varied distribution of the fungus lies in its differential interaction with certain hosts, and more particularly in the effect of humidity factors on this interaction. Thus, the wide distribution of L. taurica on Pepper is connected with the favourable effect of high humidity on its development on this host. Although there is evidence that some highly specialized strains of the fungus exist, the wide host range of L. taurica populations demonstrated in crossinoculations makes it appear that strain specialization cannot adequately explain the wide divergence in the distribution of this fungus on its crop hosts. Leveillula taurica (Lv.) Arn.  s tata trovata su Peperone, in pi di 50 Paesi; su Melanzana, Pomodoro e Tropaeolum majus L. in 25-30 Paesi; e su un gran numero di colture largamente coltivate, solo in 1-9 Paesi. Il fungo ha la sua pi vasta distribuzione nella Regione Mediterranea, sulle sue principali colture ospiti. Quasi la met delle segnalazioni: ospite/Paese provengono difatti, per tali colture, da questa Regione. Un importante motivo cui  dovuta questa difforme distribuzione del fungo risiede nelle diverse interazioni del patogeno con taluni ospiti, e, in particolare, nell'influenza dell'umidit su queste interazioni. Cos, la vasta distribuzione di L. taurica su Peperone  legata alla favorevole influenza dell'alta umidit sullo sviluppo del fungo su tale ospite. Sebbene vi siano elementi che provano l'esistenza di alcuni ceppi altamente specializzati del fungo, la vasta gamma di ospiti delle popolazioni di L. taurica, dimostrata dai saggi di inoculazione incrociata, ha mostrato che la specializzazione dei ceppi non offre una spiegazione suficiente della notevole difformit nella distribuzione del fungo sulle colture ospiti. Leveillula taurica (Lv.) Arn. a t trouve sur le Piment dans une cinquantaine de pays, sur l'Aubergine, la Tomate et le Tropaeolum majus L. dans 25-30 pays, et sur de nombreuses cultures largement cultives dans pas plus que 1  9 pays. Une raison importante pour les diffrences si prononces dans la distribution du pathogne sur les diverses cultures est l'interaction varie entre le pathogne et son hte, et spcialement l'effet de l'humidit sur cette interaction. La distribution rpandue de la maladie sur le Piment, par exemple, est lie avec l'effet favorable de l'humidit leve sur son dveloppement sur cette plante hte. Il y a des preuves de l'existence de souches hautement spcialises de L. taurica sur divers htes; mais le grand nombre des cultures infectes par des souches particulires en essais d'inoculation, ne permet pas de conclure que la spcialisation des races est une raison suffisante pour les diffrences remarquables dans la distribution de ce champignon sur les diverses cultures.
42685212|The protocols for the preparations of several antisera specific to Alternaria solani, as well as the determination of their sensitivity and detection range, are described. The results indicate that the antisera obtained against soluble antigens from fungal still cultures, precipitated in cold acetone, are of best value both in terms of titer and of discrimination in favour of the early blight agents. The Chromatographic separation of the antigen mentioned above did not evidentiate differences in antigenic structures, as suggested by the responses of the antibodies originated from eluates at higher and lower molecular weight. Indirect ELISA tests performed using such antibodies and an anti-rabbit alkaline phosphatase conjugate proved to be suitable for routine detection of Alternaria isolates.

42685406|Esca and Eutypa dieback are two major wood diseases of grapevine in France. Their widespread distribution in vineyards leads to vine decline and to a loss in productivity. However, little is known either about the temporal dynamics of these diseases at plant level, and equally, the relationships between foliar expression of the diseases and vine death is relatively unknown too. To investigate this last question, the vines of six vineyards cv. Cabernet Sauvignon in the Bordeaux region were surveyed, by recording foliar symptoms, dead arms and dead plants from 2004 to 2010. In 2008, 2009 and 2010, approximately five percent of the asymptomatic vines died but the percentage of dead vines which had previously expressed esca foliar symptoms was higher, and varied between vineyards. A logistic regression model was used to determine the previous years of symptomatic expression associated with vine mortality. The mortality of esca is always associated with the foliar symptom expression of the year preceding vine death. One or two other earlier years of expression frequently represented additional risk factors. The Eutypa dieback symptom was also a risk factor of death, superior or equal to that of esca. The study of the internal necroses of vines expressing esca or Eutypa dieback is discussed in the light of these statistical results.

Sub-cilindrical ('Charleston Gray' and 'Garrisonian'), ovoidal ('Blue Ribbon') and spherical ('Sugar Baby' and 'Crimson Sweet') fruit shaped cultivars were used. Irrigation regimes of 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 days frequency and a non-irrigated check were compared. Furrow irrigation was used. The 'Sugar Baby' cultivar was completely resistant (no fruits with blossom-end rot) in all irrigation regimes. 'Garrisonian' and 'Charleston Gray' were highly susceptible, exhibiting 64.56% and 56.39% of blossomend rotted fruits, respectively, in the average of all tested regimes. The influence of the irrigation frequency on the weight and number of blossom-end rotted fruit production of susceptible cultivars, was not statistically significant. This might be attributable to the levelling effect of the 17.5 mm rain of August 3rd and 4th. However, further investigations will be necessary, before this can be substantiated. Dans des diverses localits de l'Italie septentrionale est rpandue dans le Bl une malade de virus qui se distingue par une maculature chloratique du lambeau foliaire, laquelle apparait dj au dbut du cycle vgtatif de la plante, mais qui ressort davantage pendant la priode fin-hiver dbut-printemps et qui, en outre, s'attnue progressivement avec les tempratures diurnes plus leves des mois d't. La maladie est transmissible par jus avec difficult et en faible proportion, aile n'est pas transmissible par pucerons et par semence, tandis qu'elle se propage aisment par le terrain o l'infection persiste pendant quelques annes en l'absence des graminaces. In various localities of Northern Italy we find the diffusion of a virus disease in Wheat. It can be identified by a chlorotic motling of the leaves and is already apparent at the beginning of the plant's vegetative cycle though growing more evident during the period around the end of winter and the beginning of spring, gradually diminishing there after with the very hot weather of the summer months. Sap transmission of the disease can only be obtained with difficulty, and even then in low percentages; nor can it be transmitted by aphides or by seed. It is, however, easily propagated through the soil, where the infection persists for some years even without the presence of grasses. Numerous kinds of grasses have shown themselves susceptible to the disease: by growing them in infected soil they easily contract the disease. By means of the electronic microscope the presence has been noted in infected plants of virus-type elongated particles about 161 and 290 mu. It is believed that this virus can be identified with the North-American Wheat soil-borne mosaic.

42685572|In pepper plants grown in plastic houses a severe disease caused by an unusual strain of Tobacco mosaic virus (P-TMV), recorded for the first time in Greece, was noticed. 42685946|Mycoplasmalike organisms (MLOs) associated with lettuce yellows disease in Northern Italy were experimentally transmitted from infected lettuce to healthy periwinkle (Catharanthus roseus) plants by leafhoppers (Macrosteles quadripunctulatus) under greenhouse conditions. Because of symptom variability in the infected periwinkles, the MLOs in five plants with different symptoms were propagated separately and examined for genetic variability. Dot hybridization assays using cloned MLO DNA probes, and polymerase chain reaction (PCR) assays using primer pairs specific to the aster yellows (AY) MLO strain cluster, indicated that the naturally infected lettuce and all five isolates contained MLOs belonging to the AY strain cluster. Restriction fragment length polymorphism (RFLP) analyses of DNA using several well characterized probes, showed that all samples contained MLOs belonging to the type II, subcluster of the AY cluster. RFLP analyses of PCR-amplified 16S rDNA sequences confirmed the close relationship of all isolates and of MLO infecting lettuce to this subcluster. Only one isolate in periwinkle showed genetic differences that were associated with differences in symptoms.
42685978|Leaves from 55 fig tree accessions showing mosaic symptoms, collected in 13 different European, Mediterranean, and Middle Eastern countries and California, were studied ultrastructurally and cytochemically. Regardless of the type and intensity of symptoms exhibited by the mother tree, all samples contained intracytoplasmic aggregates of electron dense enveloped bodies with different size and shape: (i) round to ovoid, single or multiple and branched, up to 200 nm in diameter; (ii) elongated straight or slightly flexuous, or branched, up to and above 1 m. These bodies were sometimes connected to, and appeared to be budding from, citoplasmic membranes, were bound by a lipoprotein unit membrane about 12 nm thick, contained proteinaceous material and were insensitive to tetracycline. These structures were tentatively identified as particles of the possible agent of the disease, whose nature, however, although suspected to be viral, was not ultimately ascertained. Profiles of filamentous, isometric and bacilliform particles were also observed, each kind in a single specimen. These are likely to belong to occasional viral contaminants not involved in the etiology of the mosaic disease.
