42685580|A study was made of the effects of high temperatures on aeciospore germination testing a range of temperatures from 20 to 40C in climatic cell with 30% relative humidity and 10,000 lux. At 20C germinative power was good (33%), but at 25 and 30C it decreased rapidly and was down to zero at 35 and 40C. Many germ tubes curled up and a lysis of the apex was visible at 25 and 30C. Moreover the germ tube was shorter at high temperatures. An hypothesis was made to explain the decrease of the disease rate (Cronartium flaccidum) in some areas in Italy: during the aeciospore emission period (March and April) it was possible on the coast to record temperatures of 25 and 30C. This fact may explain why the disease decreased; as the germination capacity was lower; the germ tubes, whose apex was affected by a lysis, were not long enough to penetrate into the mesophyll tissue and did not cause infection. 42685396|Understanding the host response to Ascochyta fabae in faba bean (Vicia faba L.), is crucial to elucidate the biology of host resistance. In an attempt to unravel the faba bean - A. fabae interaction, we performed genome-wide transcriptome profiling by deepSuperSAGE that quantified the early transcriptional changes elicited by the fungus in the resistant 29H faba bean genotype. The total number of 26 bp tags obtained was 1,313,009, of which 51,484 were unique sequences (UniTags) and 161 of them corresponded to fungal sequences. Sequences with a full match of the 26 bp revealed 2,222 tags with a significant P-value that were expressed differentialy between inoculated and control leaves. After gene ontology (GO) annotation, 2,143 of these matched to databases sequences (approximately 1/3 into each GO domain). At a 2.7-fold change threshold, 1,197 sequences were significantly differentially expressed in infected as compared to control leaves. Of these, nearly half were up-and the other downregulated. The most enriched GO terms corresponded to tags related with photosynthesis metabolism or structural components. Ten of them can be associated with plant defense, due to their association with responses to the jasmonic acid pathway, pectin esterase activity or gene silencing. Validation of the SuperSAGE data by qPCR of ten differentially expressed UniTags confirmed a rapid increase or decrease in mRNA 8 to 12 hours after inoculation in most of the up-regulated tags and, less consistently, in the downregulated ones. This study represents the most comprehensive analysis of the Ascochyta-response transcriptome of faba bean available to date. The applicability of these tags will increase as more faba bean genomic and cDNA sequences become available.

It occured in a few vineyards infecting a low percentage of plants (0,1-1%), although in some cases incidence was of 10-20%. The natural spread of the disease and the inconsistency of symptom expression were observed over a 7 year study in an infected vineyard. The most susceptible cultivars were Razaki and Roditis. The stem pitting disease is considered an important factor associated with serious yield losses and reduced longevity observed in numerous vineyards. Besides 'Razaki' and 'Sultana', which were found to be the most sensitive cultivars, severe symptoms were also observed in the cv. Muscat de Hamburg, Savatiano, Roditis, and Xynomavro Naoussis, and on the rootstocks 110 R, 99 R, Kober 5 BB, and 420 A. Enation seems to be restricted to Crete, where 'Razaki' was most seriously affected. The differences between the average light/dark CO release ratios (at the three O concentrations), during the second half of the disease cycle, resulted signi ficant at the test of Student in the first and highly significant in the second series of determinations. 42685995|Salicylic acid (SA), infiltrated into the lower leaves of Chenopodium amaranticolor plants, 6 days before a tobacco necrosis virus (TNV) challenge inoculation of the upper leaves, caused an acquired susceptibility of these leaves, with respect to leaves of non-SA infiltrated plants: 57-72% increase in virus synthesis. A primary TNV inoculation of lower leaves caused, instead, an acquisition of systemic resistance by the upper leaves, which reduced virus synthesis in challenge inoculations by 46%. When the lower leaves were SA infiltrated immediately after TNV inoculation, the treatment did not influence upper-leaf acquisition of systemic resistance, but when it was infiltrated 24 h before inoculation it caused an acquisition of systemic susceptibility, as demonstrated by a 132% increase of virus synthesis in a challenge inoculation with respect to control plants and a 412% increase with respect to plants which received a primary TNV inoculation in the lower leaves. Moreover, the endogenous SA content of upper leaves of plants inoculated in the lower leaves did not differ from that of the uninoculated control plants. The results show that in the experimental system used, SA was not a possible signal molecule for the acquisition of systemic resistance, but was rather a chemical that in high doses cause a systemic aquired susceptibility.

42685736|A medium called PLSS was developed and tested for direct isolation of Pyrenochaeta lycopersici from soil. Its composition was (per liter): malt extract agar g 48, PCNB 100 mg a.i., dicloran 50 mg a.i., copper sulphate 100 mg, pH adjusted to 4.7 with 25 ml of a 2% water solution of citric acid. 43872357|Devastating outbreaks of crown and root diseases have impacted severely on commercial strawberry production in Western Australia (W.A.). Studies were conducted to evaluate the yields, and resistance of three commercial strawberry cultivars to crown and root diseases, both in fumigated and non-fumigated field beds, and to determine the responses of eight commercial cultivars to individual pathogens under controlled conditions. In the field, cv. Camino Real showed the greatest fruit yield both in fumigated and non-fumigated beds, and was the most disease-resistant cultivar. Each cultivar had a greater fruit yield and a lower amount of plant decline in fumigated beds, compared with non-fumigated beds. Both for fumigated and non-fumigated beds, the amount of plant decline increased from August to November, particularly in non-fumigated beds. Under controlled conditions, cv. Festival was most resistant and cv. Camarosa most susceptible to wilt-causing Fusarium oxysporum. Against binucleate Rhizoctonia AG-A, Cylindrocarpon destructans and Phoma exigua, cv. Festival was most resistant and cv. Aromas most susceptible. Cultivar Camino Real was the most resistant to Gnomonici fructicola and Phytophthora cactorum and cv. Festival most resistant to Pythium ultimum. Against Macrophomina phaseolina, cv. Albion was the most resistant with cv. Camarosa the most susceptible. Cultivar Camarosa, the most widely grown cultivar in W.A., was most susceptible to F. oxysporum, while cv. Camino Real was resistant to F. oxysporum both in the field and the controlled environment conditions. Cultivar Festival is the most resistant cultivar to F. oxysporum and a range of different pathogens. The Australian bred cv. Juliette was as susceptible as cv. Camarosa to F. oxysporum, but relatively resistant to binucleate Rhizoctonia AG-A. This is the first study, not only to define the relative yield potentials of different cultivars in a situation where crown and root disease prevails in the field, but also to demonstrate differential resistance of current cultivars to specific pathogens associated with crown and root disease in W.A. For the first time, growers can now make informed choices about the cultivars they can deploy to minimise losses caused by diseases.

Le osservazioni sulla distribuzione delle micotossine nelle piante infette in relazione alla presenza di specie di Fusarium tossigene, hanno indicato una reale possibilit di traslocazione delle tossine stesse, e in particolare dello zearalenolo, dalla base dei culmi infetti fin nei tutoli, ma non nelle cariossidi, di spighe non infette. Four to seven dif ferent Fusarium species were isolated from the infected lower internodes of Corn plants affected by stalk rot at harvest time in Basiiicata in 1983. The most frequently isolated species were, in order of incidence, F. moniliforme, F. culmorum, F. equiseti and F. proliferatum. Along with these species, always found together, F. oxysporum, F. chlamydosporum, F. acuminatum, F. semitectum, and F. solani were occasionally also isolated. The presence and the relative incidence of Fusarium species in the upper parts of infected plants, especially in the ears (peduncles, cobs, and kernels), were almost the same as those found in the stalks. In the following year, along with the above mentioned Fusarium species, F. graminearum, belonging to Group 2, was also isolated. The appearance of this species, which normally appears late in the season, was favoured in 1984 by a more prolonged cultural Corn cycle. Zearelenone (up to 10,500 ng/g), zearalenol (up to 86 ng/g of diastereomeric mixture) and deoxynivalenol (up to 668 ng/g) were found in all of the samples of stalk rot and in several samples from the upper parts of infected plants, especially ears. Investigations on the distribution of toxigenic Fusarium species and their mycotoxins showed some positive evidence regarding the translocation of the toxins, especially zearalenol, from infected stalks upwards to the cobs, but not into the kernels, of uninfected ears.

Le 33 accessioni di T. dicoccum esaminate, hanno mostrato in genrale moderata suscettibilit alle ruggini e resistenza o moderata resistenza ad uno o pi biotipi di E. graminis.
42684240|Carnation mottle virus (CaMV), Carnation etched ring virus (CERV) and Carnation yellow fleck virus (CYFV) have been isolated from commercial spray Carnations in Israel. Carnation streak and a virus resembling Carnation vein mottle virus have also been observed. Plants infected with CaMV generally appear to be symptomless, while those infected with CERV show etched necrotic lines and rings on their leaves. CYFV causes yellowing and sometimes purpling of infected leaves and plants are often wilted. The host ranges of these viruses are described. In an electron microscope CaMV, CERV and CYFV are seen as having isometric 28-29 nm, isometric 50 nm, and flexuous elongated 1250  13 nm particles, respectively. In leaf dip preparations, CYFV characteristically forms bundle aggregates. The damage caused by these viruses and their control are discussed in relation to the problem in Israel. Le piante colpite da CaMV di solito non mostrano sintomi, mentre quelle infette da CERV hanno sulle foglie maculature lineari e anulari, necrotiche e infossate. CYFV causa ingiallimento e, talora, arrossamento delle foglie colpite e avvizzimento delle piante. Di tutti questi virus vengono descritte le reazioni degli ospiti. In preparati diretti da foglie, CYFV forma caratteristici aggregati fascicolari. Vengono illustrati e discussi i danni causati da questi virus e la relativa lotta, in relazione alia situazione israeliana. 42685035|Samples of leaf rust (Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici) and stem rust (P. graminis f. sp. tritici), collected from 4 different Albanian localities (Tirane, Kameza, Presa and Durazzo), were tested in the greenhouse on wheat lines containing single genes of resistance. 42684430|The ultrastructural and enzymatic properties of F. oxysporum and F. solani mitochondria was studied. By cytochemical staining with diaminobenzidine cytochrome oxidase activity was detected in the cristae of the mitochondria of both fungi. The enzymatic determination of the cytochrome oxidase on mycelial extracts did not measure any activity in the extracts of F. solani, while some activity was measured in F. oxysporum. Gel filtration on Sephadex G-25 removed inhibitor(s) from the extracts of both fungi, and the specific activity measured in F. oxysporum resulted 1.94, almost twice as much as that measured in F. solani. These results agree quite well with previous findings on the respiratory metabolism of the two fungi, which showed that the respiratory activity mediated by the cytochrome oxidase is twice as much in F. oxysporum than in F. solani. Sono state studiate le propriet ultrastrutturali ed enzimatiche dei mitocondri di F. oxysporum e di F. solani. L'attivit citocromossidasica  stata messa in evidenza nelle creste dei mitocondri di entrambi i funghi mediante colorazione con diaminobenzidina. La determinazione enzimatica della citocromossidasi negli estratti miceliali non mostra alcuna attivit negli estratti di F. solani, mentre  presente una certa attivit in quelli di F. oxysporum. La filtrazione su Sephadex G-25 allontanava (lo) gli inibitori(e) dagli estratti di entrambi i funghi, e l'attivit specifica in F. oxysporum risultava 1,94, quasi doppia di quella misurata in F. solani. Questi risultati confermano plenamente i precedenti dati sul metabolismo respiratorio dei due funghi, che dimostravano che l'attivit mediata della citocromossidasi era due volte pi grande in F. oxysporum ehe in F. solani.
42684770|In Spring 1983 an epidemic leaf spot was observed on deciduous Magnolias in numerous nurseries in the Pistoia area of Tuscany. The leaf spots became dark brown, were 6-7 mm in diameter, and limited by the smallest veins. Magnolia liliflora was the species most affected. In the diseased shrubs spots were also occasionally seen on the petals and cankers on the shoots. A fluorescent pseudomonad was isolated from the leaf and petal spots and from the shoot cankers and was identified for its phytopathological, morphological and physiological characteristics as Pseudomonas syringae van Hall. Comparative experimental inoculations showed that the bacterium caused leaf spots on M. liliflora, M. liliflora nigra, M. denudata, M. Kobus, x M. Soulangeana, M. Soulangeana Alexandrina and M. stellata, but not on M. grandiflora, M. grandiflora gallissoniensis, M. Sieboldii, Liriodendron tulipifera and Syringa vulgaris. The P. syringae isolates causing leaf spots in deciduous Magnolias may be a new pathovar. It seemed incorrect to refer to them as P. syringae pv. syringae because the neopathotype strain is pathogenic on lilac, while the Magnolia isolates were not. Una maculatura fogliare epidemica  stata osservata nella primavera 1983 su magnolie decidue in numerosi vivai della provincia di Pistoia nella regione Toscana. Sulle foglie le maculature erano di color bruno-scuro, 6-7 mm in diametro, delimitate dalle nervature pi piccole. Magnolia liliflora era la specie pi colpita. Nelle piante malate, in qualche caso, si nota vano anche maculature sui petali e cancri sui germogli. Dalle maculature delle foglie e dei petali e dai cancri dei germogli  stata isolata una pseudomonade fluorescente che  stata identificata per caratteri fitopatologici, morfologici e fisiologici come Pseudomonas syringae Van Hall. Inoculazioni sperimentali comparative hanno mostrato che il batterio era capace di causare maculature fogliari su M. liliflora, M. liliflora nigra, M. denudata, M. Kobus, x M Soulangeana, M. Soulangeana Alexandrina e M. stellata, ma non su M. grandiflora, M. grandiflora gallissoniensis, M. Sieboldii, Liriodendron tulipifera e Syringa vulgaris. Gli isolati di P. syringae agenti delle maculature fogliari delle magnolie decidue potrebbero costituire un nuovo pathovar. Non  parso corretto riferirli a P. syringae pv. syringae perch il ceppo neopatotipo  patogeno sui lill, mentre gli isolati da magnolia non lo sono.
42685966|Pathogenicity tests of 17 single-pycnidiospore isolates of Mycosphaerella graminicola, originating from six wheat-growing regions in Syria, Chile and USA, were conducted on seven wheat cultivare to assay the virulence pattern of these isolates. Disease development was measured as percentage of necrotic lesions and pycnidial density on leaves. Results showed variation in the virulence of the isolates. Significant differences were found between the cultivars, among the isolate groups and cultivar x isolate group. Higher tissue necrosis scores were reflected on the first leaf stage compared to the second, while there was a generally higher pycnidial formation on the second leaf than on the first leaf. 'Tadinia' was the less susceptible cultivar and the group of isolates from California was the most virulent one. The durum wheat cultivar Badri/Gta/Fg scored the highest leaf necrosis and pycnidial density when inoculated with isolates originating from durum wheat. At 90% similarity level, isolates from California formed one cluster and all other isolates a second cluster. Except in one group of isolates from California, no significant differences were found among isolates originating from the same pycnidium.
42685246|Fungal colonies were obtained from the crown regions of 251 chickpea plants with wilt symptoms which had been collected from 39 farmers' fields and a wilt sick plot in Tunisia. Most cultures were identified as Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. ciceri but five were identified as Fusarium solani. Inoculation of a set of 16 differential cultivare defined the F. oxysporum f. sp. ciceri isolates as race 0. In addition to the Fusarium species, 19 plants from the wilt sick plot yielded either Gliocladium catenulatum or G. roseum.
42685936|Rugose wood symptoms were observed in a single variety (cv. Asimi) of the 18 or so native grapevine cultivare grown in Yemen. All diseased vines were infected by a mechanically transmissible isolate of grapevine virus A (GVA), but some contained also grapevine leafroll-associated virus I (GLRaV I) or III (GLRaV III). ELISA and IEM tests did not reveal the presence of grapevine fanleaf or grapevine fleck viruses. The Yemeni isolate of GVA was able to infect herbaceous host other than Nicotiana species, but showed physico-chemical and ultrastructural properties similar to those of Italian isolates of the same virus with which it is being compared. The present findings confirm the alleged relationship of GVA with rugose wood, and provide support to the notion that clostero-like viruses of the grapevine had a long-lasting association with Vitis vinifera L., with which they may have co-evolved and spread from its centre(s) of origin.
42685994|Chickpea (Cicer arietinum L.) and lentil (Lens culinaris Medik.) are among the major cool-season food legumes grown in Ethiopia. Fungal and viral diseases are important factors limiting production of these two crops in the country. As there is no systematic study on the virus diseases of these crops, a survey to identify virus diseases of chickpea and lentil crops in Shewa province, Ethiopia, was conducted during November 14-23, 1998. The survey covered a random selection of 33 chickpea and 32 lentil fields. Virus disease incidence was determined by laboratory testing 100-200 randomly collected samples from each field with antisera of 12 viruses. In chickpea fields, beet western yellows polerovirus (BWYV) was most frequently found and in lentil fields, pea seed-borne mosaic potyvirus (PSbMV) was the most common, followed by luteoviruses [BWYV and soybean dwarf virus (SbDV)]. Laboratory testing of random samples, showed that 5 chickpea and 11 lentil fields had a virus disease incidence of 21% or higher. The highest virus disease incidence in a single field was 58.5% for lentil (PSbMV) and 41.3% for chickpea (BWYV). Other viruses detected more rarely, were faba bean necrotic yellows nanovirus (FBNYV) and broad bean wilt fabavirus (BBWV) in chickpea; FBNYV, broad bean stain comovirus (BBSV), bean yellow mosaic potyvirus (BYMV) and cucumber mosaic cucumovirus (CMV) in lentil.
42685426|This study was conducted to update the occurrence and molecular variability of Citrus tristeza virus (CTV) isolates recently obtained from surveys in different orchards in mainland Portugal. The asymmetric PCR-ELISA typing method based on the coat protein (CP) gene was used to characterize CTV isolates. Most isolates of the virus found in the Algarve region, where major citrus producing zones exist, belonged to the mild phylogenetic group (GpM). The prevalence of haplotypes from this group suggests that the aphid vector Toxoptera citricidus, which is present in the northern region of the country associated to diverse severe strains, has not yet reached the Algarve. Although most of the isolates harbour haplotypes from group M, haplotypes from the remaining phylogenetic groups were also identified and characterized.

42684557|Prepenetration, penetration and postpenetration activities of Rhizoctonia solani Khn, Fusarium oxysporum Schl. and Nigrospora oryzae (B. et Br.) Petch in inoculated seeds were studied. Complete colonization of seed surfaces by R. solani, F. oxysporum and N. oryzae was attained 96, 120 and 144 hours, respectively, after inoculation. R. solani required a relatively shorter period to penetrate seed. Micropylar opening was the most common site of penetration by all the tested fungi, followed by the basal ends of the chalaza. Direct penetration through the seed coat was of less significant, however, R. solani was more efficient in this respect. R. solani and N. oryzae could colonize all the internal parts of the seed, however mycelium and spores of F. oxysporum were more frequently localized in seed coat and intercotyledonary spaces, but not in the embryo.  stata studiata l'attivi t di Rhizoctonia solani Kuhn., Fusarium oxysporum Schl. e Nigrospora oryzae (B. et Br.) R. solani ha richiesto tempi relativamente pi brevi per la penetrazione. Per tutti i funghi presi in considerazione, il micropilo  stato il sito pi comune di ingresso seguito dalla base della calaza. Di scarsa importanza  stata la penetrazione diretta e, a tal riguardo, R. solani  stata la specie fungina pi attiva. Quest'ultimo fungo e N. oryzae hanno anche colonizzato tutte le parti interne del seme, mentre micelio e conidi di F. oxysporum, assenti nell'embrione, sono stati pi frequentemente present nel rivestimento del seme e negli spazi intercotiledonari.
42684425|A disease of white-flowered Cattleya plants, which causes necrotic streaks and spots on the flowers, is described. Mechanical inoculation of differential hosts showed that plants were virus infected. The virus inoculated had the following characteristics:  partially flexuous rods of 488 nm modal lenght  thermal inactivation point: 60-65 C  dilution end-point: 10 - 10  ageing in vitro: more than 25 days. The virus was purified from Datura stramonium inoculated plants by butanol treatment and density gradient contrifugation. Purified suspensions showed the following characteristics:  UV absorption ratios: A/A= 0.86, A max/A min = 1.15 (uncorrected for light scattering); A/A= 0.84, A max/A min = 1.21 (corrected for light scattering);  RNA content: 5,6% (calculated from UV absorption data corrected for light scattering);  serological relationship: positive with an anti-CyMV serum. From the results obtained the virus has been identified as an isolate of Cymbidium mosaic virus. This last is considered as the causal agent of the symptoms described, because reinoculation of Cattleya plants gave rise to symptoms very similar to those of naturally infected plants. Besides, no other virus was ever isolated from such plants, and virus-free plants grown in the same environmental conditions never showed virus-like symptoms due to physiological disorder or insect damage. Viene descritta una malattia sui fiori bianchi di piante di Cattleya i cui sintomi consistono in striature e macchie necrotiche. Da esperimenti di inoculazione meccanica su ospiti differenziali  risultato che tali piante erano affette da un'infezione virale. Il virus isolato ayeva le seguenti caratteristiche:  particelle parcialmente flessuose di 488 nm di lunghezza normale;  temperatura di inattivazione trmica: 60-65 C;  diluizione limite 10-6 -10.  conservazione in vitro: superiore a 25 giorni. Il virus  stato purificato da piante di Datura stramonium con l'ausilio di butanolo e centrifugazione in gradiente di densit. Le sospensioni virali purificate avevano le seguenti caratteristiche:  rapporto di assorbimento in UV: A/= 0,86, A max/A min= 1,15 (non corretti da torbidita); A/A= 0,84, A max / A min= 1,21 (corretti da torbidit);  contenuto in RNA= 5,6% (calcolato dai dati di assorbimento in UV corretti da torbidit);  correlazione sierologica: positiva con un siero anti-CyMV. Dai risultati ottenuti il virus  stato identificato come un isolato di virus del mosaico del Cymbidium. Esso  stato considerato come l'agente causale dei sintomi descritti, perch inoculndolo su piante di Cattleya si ottenevano sintomi molto simili a quelli visibili su piante naturalmente infette. Inoltre, nessun altro virus  mai stato isolato da tali piante e piante virus-esenti cresciute nelle medesime condizioni ambientali non hanno mai mostrato sintomi, dovuti a squilibri fisiologici o at tacchi di insetti, simili a quelli provocati da infezioni virali.
42685336|Pomegranate decline has been observed mostly in newly established 3-7 year-old orchards. The first disease symptoms usually appear in early summer as one side yellowing, wilting and death of some branches or the entire tree. Collar region of the diseased plants contains loose bark with flaky tissues. Roots of such trees are healthy and capable of producing vigorous suckers. All attempts to isolate fungal pathogens from diseased tissues or soils around diseased plant failed using general and semiselective media or baits. Roots and suckers from diseased plants transplanted in the greenhouse produced healthy plants during three years. Severe winter freezing injury however does not result to the above symptoms and the overwintered branches do not resume growth in the following spring. Decline symptoms were usually observed less frequently on older trees, intercropped with other trees, and in the colder regions of the Fars province. It is not present in the warmer areas of the province.The decline was very severe in milder winter areas with prolonged warmer falls and early freezing in late fall or early winter. Flood irrigation during cold nights, crown ringing and gibberellic acid application in late summer intensified the decline, and crown protection by gunny effectively reduced it. It is concluded that sudden drop in temperature in late fall and early winter in the milder areas where the trees are not fully dormant is the main contributing factor to decline.
42685721|Two field experiments were conducted at ICARDA, Tel Hadya, Syria for three seasons (1982/83,1983/84, and 1985/86) to study the relationship between Ascochyta blight severity and yield loss in chickpea and to identify disease resistant lines. The first experiment involved 20 germplasm lines representing a range of resistance and susceptibility. The second involved 19 germplasm lines with a low blight severity. In the first experiment, less than 10% yield loss was recorded in lines showing a rating of 2 to 4. Yield loss was 16% in lines with 5 rating, 26-27% in lines with 6 to 7 rating, and more than 80% in lines with 8 to 9 rating. In the second experiment, lines with a rating of 4 or less showed a maximum of 12% loss in yield, while susceptible line 'ILC 1929' with a 9 rating showed almost 100% yield loss. In both experiments, the yields of the susceptible lines were higher than the lines with less than 4 rating under disease free conditions. Due serie di ricerche di campo sono state condotto dall'ICARDA, Tel Hadya, Siria, per tre cicli colturali (1982/83,1983/84 e 1985/86) al fine di analizzare le correlazioni tra l'intensit dell'ascochitosi e la perdita di produttivit nel Cece ed individuare linee resistenti. Nella prima serie di ricerche sono state considerate 20 linee di germoplasma a differente grado di suscettibilit alla malattia; nella seconda 19 linee di germoplasma resistente. Nella prima serie di prove di campo  stato constatato: una perdita di produttivit inferiore al 10% nelle linee con una intensit di malattia compresa tra l'indice 2 e 4 della scala adottata, il 16% nelle linee con indice 5, il 26-27% nelle linee con indice da 6 a 7, e pi dell'80% nelle linee con indice da 8 a 9. Nella seconda serie di prove di campo le linee con indice 4 o inferiore, la perdita di produttivit  stata al massimo del 12%, a confronto della linea suscettibile 'ILC 1929' con un indice di 9 la quale ha presentato una perdita del 100%. In entrambe le prove e in condizioni di assenza di malattia la produttivit delle linee suscettibili  stata superiore a quella delle linee con un indice inferiore a 4.
43872369|The present study was designed to isolate and identify toxigenic mycoflora of maize and maize-gluten meal. A total of 82 samples of maize and 8 samples of maize-gluten meal were collected from Faisalabad district of Pakistan over a period of two years. These samples were inoculated on different culture media. Fungal contamination of maize and maize-gluten was 56% and 75% of samples, respectively. Isolation frequencies of different genera isolated from maize were Aspergillus 33%; Penicillium 28%; Fusarium 10%; and Alternaria 1%. Isolation frequency among species was maximum for P. verrucosum, followed by A. niger aggregates, A. ochraceous, A. flavus, P. chrysogenum, A. parasiticus, A. carbonarius, Fusarium spp. and Alternaria spp. Relative density of Aspergillus isolates was maximum for A. niger aggregates and A. ochraceous (30% each) followed by A. flavus (26%), A. parasiticus (11%) and A. carbonarius (3%). Percentage of toxigenic fungi among Aspergillus isolates was 52%. Aflatoxigenic isolates of A. flavus and A. parasiticus were 43 and 67% and ochratoxigenic isolates of A. carbonarius, A. ochraceous and niger aggregates were 100, 63 and 38%, respectively. Aspergillus parasiticus produced higher concentrations of AFB1 (maximum 1374.23 ng g) than A. flavus (maximum 635.50 ng g). Ochratoxin A production potential of A. ochraceous ranged from 1.81 to 9523.1 ng g, while in A. niger aggregates it was 1.30 to 1758.6 ng g. Isolation frequencies of fungal genera from maize-gluten meal were Aspergillus (63%) and Penicillium (50%). A. flavus was the most frequently isolated species. Percentage of toxigenic fungi among Aspergillus isolates was 40%. Aflatoxigenic isolates of A. flavus were 33% and ochratoxigenic isolates of A. ochraceous were 100%.
42684746|Electron microscopy of extracts from apical tissues of 'Colombard' grapevines exhibiting symptoms of fanleaf, 'Chenel' grapevines showing symptoms of vein banding and 'Vidal-256' grapevines with little grape symptoms, detected tubular arrangements of membrane-associated 30 nm spherical viral-like particles. The 'Colombard' and 'Chenel' grapevines were infected with Grapevine fanleaf virus (GFV) and the 'Vidal-256' with Tomato ringspot virus (TomRSV), respectively. The tissues were extracted in 0.01M sodium phosphate buffer containing 2.5% nicotine and the extract negatively stained with 2% ammonium molybdate. Electron microscopy of ultrathin sections detected similar membrane-bound particles in plasmodesmata of apical tissues from both grapevines. Numerous accumulations of membrane-bound spherical viral-like particles were also detected in the cytoplasm of GFV infected 'Colombard' tissue; similar accumulations were not detected in the cytoplasm of TomRSV infected 'Vidal-256' tissues. Tubular structures of viral-like particles were also detected in extracts from apical tissues of herbaceous plants infected with the Grapevine and Apricot isolates of TomRSV. Electron microscopy did not detect similar structures in aqueous extracts from infected grapevines. In addition to detecting membrane associated spherical particles, closteroviruslike particles were also detected in extracts from both the GFV infected 'Colombard' and the TomRSV infected 'Vidal-256' grapevines. These results indicate the necessity of including the electron microscopy of tissues extracted in buffers containing nicotine, as part of indexing programs. I tessuti sono stati estratti in tampone sodio fosfato 0.01M contenente nicotina al 2,5% e gli estratti sono stati colorati negativamente con molibdato di ammonio in soluzione acquosa al 2%. Strutture tubulari contenenti particelle simil-virali sono state ritrovate in estratti di tessuti apicali di piante erbacee infette con isolati da Vite e Albicocco di TomRSV. Queste strutture non sono per state mai osservate negli estratti acquosi da Vite. Questi risultati suggeriscono l'utilit dell'uso della microscopia elettronica nei programmi di indexaggio.
42683898|The viruses associated with four virus diseases of Grapevine occuring in Italy:  malformazioni inf ettive ,  giallume inf ettivo ,  scolorazione perinervale  and  distorsioni fogliari , have been purified in order to: a) ascertain the serological relationships between the different isolates; b) attempt the transmission of the purified viruses by mechanical inoculation back to Grapevine. The viruses were purified by clarifyng the sap of infected plants of Gomphrena globosa L. and Phaseolus yulgaris L. cv  Bountiful  with butanol or with a mixture 1 : 1 of butanol-chloroform. Clarification was followed by 3-4 cycles of low- and high-speed centrifugation. The final separation of the viruses from the normal plant proteins was obtained with density gradient centrifugation in sucrose columns. The homogeneity of the virus preparations was checked by spectrophotometry, analytical centrifugation, electron microscopy and serology. All these tests showed that a satisfactory degree of homogeneity was yielded. As seen under the electron microscope it appears that the virus particles have a polyhedrical structure and are about my, 30 in diameter. By injecting the purified virus preparations into rabbits, four specific antisera were obtained; one to each isolate. Serologically no measurable differences between the viruses associated with the four diseases were detected in agar double-diffusion plates. The virus isolates appeared to be all strains of Grapevine fanleaf virus. Transmission tests to seedlings of Vitis vinifera L. cv  Mission  and to young-shoots of Vitis rupestris Scheele cv  St. George  indicate that the virus associated with fanleaf diseased vines can after purification be reinoculated into Grapevine on which it produces symptoms similar to those characterizing the fanleaf disease. 42683977|In deep-bedding manure, sclerotial germinability decreased rapidly and a complete lack of germination was observed 20 days after the incorporation of the sclerotia. In a manure pile, sclerotia also lost their germinability completely inside the pile. In dry yard-manure, 73 % of the sclerotia were able to germinate after three months. It is assumed that in each case a different principal factor was responsible for the decrease of sclerotial viability. In the case of deep-bedding manure the process may be attributed to the accumulation of a high amount of free ammonia, reaching values of 1248 ppm. In manure pile the most important factor is the temperature. The high viability of sclerotia in dry yard-manure may be attributed to a lack of fermentation in such manure. E stata studiata la soprawivenza degli sclerozi di Sclerotium rolfsii Sacc. incorport! in tre tipi di letame bovino. Nel letame di lettiera permanente, la germinabilit degli sclerozi  diminuita rapidamente fino ad annullarsi del tutto dopo venti giorni dall'incorporazione. Anche nel letame in cumuli, la germinabilit degli sclerozi  andata completamente perduta al centro dei cumuli. Nel letame secco di corte, il 73 % degli sclerozi erano ancora germinabili dopo tre mesi. Si ritiene che il fattore principale cui va attribuita la diminuzione delia vitalit degli sclerozi sia diverso in ciascuno dei tre casi. Nelletame di lettiera permanente, il processo potrebbe essere attribuito all'accumuJo di elevate quantit di ammoniaca, che hanno raggiunto valori di 1248 ppm. Nel letame in cumuli, il fattore piu importante  l'elevata temperatura. L'alta vitalit degli sclerozi nel letame secco di corte pu essere attribuita all'assenza di fermentazione. Des sclrotes de Sclerotium rolfsii Sacc. ont t placs dans trois types de fumier de bovids: fumier de litire profonde, fumier en tas et fumier sec de cour de ferme. Dans le fumier de litire profonde, le pouvoir de germer de sclrotes diminue rapidement jusqu' l'annulation complte vingt jours aprs leur incorporation. Dans le fumier en tas, le pouvoir germinatif des sclrotes a disparu compltement  l'intrieur du tas. Par contre dans le fumier sec, 73 % des sclrotes gardrent leur pouvoir germinatif. Nous supposons que la rduction de la vitalit des sclrotes est due dans chaque cas  un facteur principal diffrent. Dans le cas de la fumure de litire profonde, le processus peuttre attribu  l'accumulation d'une forte quantit d'ammoniaque libre, pouvant atteindre des valeurs de 1248 ppm, tandis que dans le fumier en tas, le facteur le plus important semble tre la temprature. La facult germinative leve des sclrotes dans le fumier sec de cour peut tre attribue  l'absence de fermentation dans ce type de fumier.
42684138|Seven virulent isolates of Pseudomonas marginata (McCulloch) Stapp were obtained from Gladiolus (Gladiolus hortulanus L.) leaves and corms collected from different localities of Alexandria area. All isolates were morphologically and biochemically similar but were different from the known isolates of P. marginata in certain biochemical activities namely their disability to produce HS or indole in the medium and to hydrolyse starch. The seven isolates were found pathogenic to Gladiolus, as well as, Freesia refracta Klatt, Tritonia sp., Polianthes tuberosa L. and Antholiza aethiopica L. The two latter species could be recorded as new experimental hosts for the bacterium. On the other hand, the isolates of the present work proved nonpathogenic to Dianthus caryophyllus L., Delphinium ajacis L. and Iris sp. which were known as common suscepts of P. marginata. 42685361|Clean rice embryos, i.e. embryos free from a caryopsis coat on the ventral surface or a depleted layer on the dorsal surface, were obtained from cvs IR24, IR36, IR65 and IR2071-137-5-5-1 and, for comparison, IR62 after soaking in 5% NaOH at 25C for 6 to 36 h. This same technique was also used to extract clean embryos from grains of rice cv. Bordagol affected by brown spot disease. The embryos were then examined for the presence around them of hyphal cushions of Cochliobolus miyabeanus. Hyphal cushions around embryos were formed by Cochliobolus miyabeanus hyphae in 4.2% of discolored, i.e. infected rice grains of cv. Bordagol. Embryos could not be liberated from such hyphal cushions by the conventional extraction process. Hyphal networks associated with the hyphal cushion first bound to the caryopsis coat, then to the depleted layer, thereby infecting the scutellar region of the embryos. Sclerotium-like structures and dark hyphal coating of C. miyabeanus were found in most hyphal cushions.
42683897|Three virus diseases of Grapevine occurring in Italy:  malformazioni infettive ,  giallume infettivo , and  scolorazione perinervale  were compared with the corresponding Californian virases: fanleaf, yellow mosaic and vein banding. A fourth disease present in Southern Italy on the cv  Cardinal :  distorsioni fogliari  was compared with fanleaf, to which it is similar in many ways. The relationships of the viruses that cause these diseases were investigated. The diseases were compared on a series of indicator plants inoculated by chip-bud-grafting infected grape wood into virus-disease-free Grapevine varieties, and by mechanical sap inoculation to herbaceous plants. Symptoms induced in the indicator plants by viruses from the Italian diseased grapevines were found to be similar to those reported for similar hosts by American and European authors who worked with comparable diseases. The physical properties of the viruses, determined using sap from infected plants of Chenopodium quinoa Willd., were also close to those previously reported in the literature. Dilution end point ranged from 1 : 5.000 to 1 : 20.000; thermal inactivation point from 58 to 62 C, and longevity in vitro from 9 to 17 days.  Mission  grapevine seedlings and young shoots of Vitis rupestris Scheele cv  St. George  were successfully inoculated with the virus strains MID-91 (malformazioni infettive) and DFD-86 (distorsioni fogliari) using sap from infected plants of Gomphrena globosa L. and C. quinoa. These findings strongly suggest that  mal-, formazioni infettive  ,  giallume infettivo  , and  scolorazione perinervale  are identical to fanleaf, yellow mosaic, and vein banding, respectively. It also appears that  distorsioni fogliari  is very likely produced by a strain of fanleaf virus. Finally the experimental findings seem to confirm the hypothesis postulated by Hewitt and collaborators that the causal agents of these different diseases are all strains of the same virus.  Malformazioni infettive ,  giallume infettivo ,  scolorazione perinervale  e  distorsioni fogliari  sono alcune delle virosi dlia Vite present nell'Italia mridionale. Le prime tre malattie, sulla base della loro sintomatologia di campo, sembrano corrispondere rispettivamente aile virosi californiane:  fanleaf .  yellow mosaic  e  vein banding  . La malattia delle  distorsioni fogliari  osservata su cv  Cardinal  in Puglia pu essere ravvicinata al  fanleaf , bench present sintomi leggermente diversi e pi gravi di questa ultima. I sintomi indotti, tanto sulle cultivar indicatrici di Vite quanto sulle piante erbacee, dai virus provenienti dalle viti italiane saggiate, sono apparsi assai simili a quelli ottenuti con prove simili con virus californiani e a quelli descrita da Autori americani ed europei sugli stessi ospiti. Le proprit in vitro di quattro isolati italiani, determinate con sueco di piante infette di Chenopodium quinoa Willd., oltre ad essere vicine tra loro, non hanno diferito molto da quelle riportate da altri AA. Il limite di diluizione finale di infettivit  risultato compreso tra 1 : 5.000 e 1 : 20.000; il limite di inattivazione termica tra 58 e 62C; la longevit in vitro, tra 9 e 17 giorni. Inoculazioni dei ceppi MID-91 (malformazioni infettive) e DFD-86 (distorsioni fogliari) 4a sueco di piante di Gomphrena globosa L. e di C. quinoa a giovani piantine da seme di  Mission  e a giovani germogli (cm 3-4 di lunghezza) di  St. George  , hanno dato risultati positivi. Tali risultati fanno ritenere probabile l'identit delle  malformazioni infettive  , del  giallume infettivo  e della  scolorazione perinervale  rispettivamente con fanleaf, yellow mosaic e vein banding. La malattia delle  distorsioni fogliari  inoltre sembrerebbe prodotta da un ceppo del virus del fanleaf. Le diferenze sintomatologiche osservate in campo tra questa virosi e fanleaf tipico, sono interpretate come risultato di una interazione tra ceppo di virus, cultivar di Vite e condizioni ambientali. Le prove eseguite sembrano infine confermare l'ipotesi di Hewitt e Collaboratori, secondo la quale le malattie considerate non sarebbero provocate da virus differenti, ma da ceppi diversi del virus del fanleaf. 42684041|Bacterial stalk rot of Corn (Zea mays L.) was found in different parts of Rajasthan. On the basis of morphological, biochemical and cultural characteristics and ability to produce soft rot of vegetable and fleshy fruits, two isolates (M and M) of the pathogen were identified as strains of Erwinia carotovora (Jones) Holland. 42685299|Sensitivity (EC50 values) of 105 isolates of Botrytis cinerea Pers. to the mixture of carbendazim and diethofencarb were determined, based on the inhibitory effect on the increase of fungal biomass measured by the absorbance. Isolates were collected in 1992 from vegetables grown in non-heated greenhouses in two different areas ("Levante" and "Poniente") in Almera, Spain, where the use of the mixture of carbendazim and diethofencarb began in 1989 and it was not too intensive by then. Sensitivity of isolates measured by the EC50 values had a mean and standard deviation of 0.0994  0.036 mg litre 1 of the mixture of carbendazim and diethofencarb (1:5) for the Total' population and 0.0996  0.037 and 0.0993  0.035 mg litre 1 for "Levante" and "Poniente" populations, respectively. Three isolates from "Poniente" area had a mean and standard deviation of 74.6  12.3 mg.litre and were characterised as moderately resistant to carbendazim and insensitive to diethofencarb. The frequency distribution of EC50 values of the sensitive isolates was lognormal for all subpopulations. The resistance factor expressed as the ratio of EC50 of the resistant population and the EC50 of the sensitive population was 827. The population of B. cinerea showed two nonoverlapping sensitivity distributions around widely differing central values.

42684145|Chicory yellow mottle virus (CYMV), an isometric entity recently found in Southern Italy, yielded 6 virus-specific components when centrifuged in sucrose density gradient columns. The components differed from one another because of the diverse sedimentation coefficient and the nucleic acid content. The slowest sedimenting form (T) was made up of non infectious protein shells devoid of nucleic acid. It had a Sw. = 50. The T component did not differ serologically from the fast sedimenting fractions. The bulk of them (5 sedimenting forms) constituted the heterogeneous bottom component (B). The infectivity was associated with the heaviest fractions of the latter (B and B). Unfractionated virus preparations were electrophoretically homogeneous with a R = 0.10, and tended to crystallize spontaneously in the cold (4C). The nucleic acid was a single stranded RNA with the following base molar composition: G28.1, A21.6, C22.9, U27.4. The cryptogram of CYMV as it stands now is R/1:*/40:S/S:S/*. From more than 200 field samples of P. recondita Rob. ex Desm. f. sp. tritici Erikss. collected in 1975 in Southern Italy, and especially in Apulia, 22 physiologic races already known in Italy have been isolated. With respect to the field samples with virulent genes to differential varieties, the carriers of corresponding resistance genes, 'Malakof' (Lr 1), 'Webster' (Lr 2a) and 'Democrat' (Lr 3) were less attacked. This has been known for more than 20 years, as demonstrated by Basile and coworkers. In accordance with the reactions of the near-isogenic lines studied, the most efficient genes proved to be Lr 9, Lr 1, Lr 2a, Lr 19, Lr 3. Furthermore the gene complex of 'Valgerardo' (Triticum durum Desf.) and 'Elia' (T. aestivum L.), also appeared to be very effective. This was especially true for 'Valgerardo' wheat, with respect all field samples presently studied, confirmed what already to known for years. The search for additional differential varieties, for investigating the behaviour of resistance genes present or presumably useful in cultivated varieties, indicated that 'Ardito', 'Aniversario', 'Klein Lucero', 'Sinvalocho', 'Elia', 'Agatha' and 'Transfer' can be used as differential. 'Valgerardo' instead is useful essentially as a "trap". To the above differential it is very important to add the most important isogenic-lines. The varieties of bread wheat cultivated in Italy are almost all susceptible, with the exception of the old 'Bianchetta 83' and the varieties resistant to some races ('Leone', ' Strampelli', 'Garibaldino', 'Est Mottin', 'Leonardo' etc.) which are of limited importance. Among durum wheat varieties the most resistant are: 'Valgerardo', 'Valnova', 'Valselva', 'Valsacco', 'Creso' and 'Vallezisa', all of similar origin. 'Belvedere', which is also very resistant, owes its behaviour to other genes. 'Belfuggito', ' Trinakria', 'Lambro', 'Hymera' are also interesting because of their resistance to some races. Because of their ample assortment of resistance genes the following varieties seem to be useful in breeding for resistance: bread wheat, 'Bianchetta 83', 'Klein Lucero', 'Era', 'Red Coat', 'Super x', 'Magnif MG', 'Sonora', as well as ' Ardito', 'IFLE 7d', 'Barleta 10', 'EI Gaucho', 'Klein Aniversario' and 'Elia'; the durum wheat, 'Valgerardo'. some selections of the 'Giorgio' group, having specific and general resistance; 'Beladi 116', 'Kyperounda' and various wheat coming from Spain; N.S. 29, 57, 117 and 118, etc. It seem unnecessary to mention that the behaviour of various lines of Triticum timopheevi Zhuk. and T.monococcum L. proved generally very valuable. 42685490|La temperatura interna di alcuni organi di piante di tabacco, mantenute in condizioni ambientali controllate,  stata misurata in relazione a tre temperature ambiente. Alla luce, la temperatura delle foglie  risultata inferiore a quella ambiente per efftto della traspirazione; al buio,  stata misurata una ulteriore, lieve diminuzione della temperatura fogliare. La temperatura al colletto delle piante dipende dalla temperatura del terriccio ed  risultata sensibilmente inferiore a quella ambiente. La temperatura del fusto varia con la distanza dal terrieccio. Saggi di infettivit eseguiti per rivelare la presenza del virus X della Patata, hanno dimostrato che tale virus permane in vari organi della pianta, ad eccezione delle foglie, anche dopo 30 giorni a 40C. L'esistenza di zone fredde in piante sottoposte a termoterapia pu essere una delle cause dell'impossibilit di eliminazione definitiva del virus X della Patata dall'intera pianta. Internal temperatures of various organs of Tobacco plants, kept under artificial conditions, were measured in air temperatures of 30, 35 and 40C. In the light, leaf temperature was always lower than air temperature; in the dark, a further slight lowering was observed. The temperature of the transition region was constistently lower than that of air. The temperature of the stem depends on its distance from the soil. The lowering of temperature found in leaves was due to transpirational cooling, whereas differences between the air temperature and that of the transition region depended on soil temperatures. Tobacco plants, systemically infected with Potato virus X(PVX), were exposed to thermotherapy and kept at 40C for 30 days. Just after the heat treatment, virus infectivity was not recovered from leaves but was recovered from roots and basal parts of the stem. Cuttings taken from tobacco plants did not show viral infectivity just after the heat treatment but, when transferred to 22C, showed viral infectivity after 15-20 days. The existence of cooler zones in plants exposed to thermotherapy may be one of the reasons for the failures in heat eradication of PVX from the whole plants. La temprature interne de diffrents organes de plantes de tabac, leves en chambre climatise, a t mesure par rapport  trois tempratures ambiantes (30,35 et 40  C). A la lumire, la temprature des feuilles est toujours infrieure  celle de l'ambiance  cause de la transpiration;  l'obscurit, il y a une baisse ultrieure bien que lgre. La temprature du collet, qui dpend de celle de la terre, est remarquablement infrieure  la temprature ambiante; la temprature de la tige change avec la distance de la terre. Une exprience de thermothrapie a t conduite sur des plantes de tabac infectes per le virus X de la Pomme de terre. Immdiatement aprs le traitement thermique (30 jours  40  C), les essais d'infectivit montrent la prsence du virus dans les racines et dans la partie bsale de la tige. Dans la partie suprieure de la tige et dans les feuilles, le virus n'est mis en evidence qu'aprs un sjour de 15-20 jours a 22C. L'existence de zones froides dans les plantes sou mises  la thermothrapie peut tre une des causes qui empchent l'limination totale du virus X de la pomme de terre dans les plantes.

42685977|Based on the morphological characteristics of the ustilospores, the prevalence of Tilletia foetida and T. caries on bread wheat and durum wheat in some countries of West Asia and North Africa, the WANA region, has been studied. The spore wall structure forms the most feasible and convenient method for differentiation between the two pathogens. Accordingly, T. foetida is the most prevalent pathogen in bread wheat and durum wheat in the region and the predominant pathogen in bread wheat. T. foetida was found to be the only pathogen in bread wheat in Lebanon, Tunisia, Iran, Pakistan and Morocco. In Syria and Turkey T. foetida contributed to 93% and 90% of the counted spores respectively. T. caries was widespread in durum wheat from Syria but completely absent from Lebanon and Tunisia. This phenomenon has been confirmed in artificial inoculation tests and discussed as host-preference in T. foetida and T. caries irrespective of the geographical area in which the disease is observed and irrespective of the environmental conditions. Not all kernels on the same spike are affected by the common bunt disease and this partial infection of the spike is considered as partial resistance which can offer an alternative in breeding for resistance to common bunt. The mean kernel infection per spike indicated a yield loss factor of 0.925 in relation to disease incidence in naturally bunted spikes.
42684550|La prsente tude montre que la salinit du sol et des eaux d'irrigation a un effet important sur la population de Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici. Ce parasite tolre des potentiels osmotiques de l'eau extrmement bas (144 bars) et sa sporulation est fortement stimule par l'augmentation de la salinit du milieu. Les arrosages successifs de la terre avec des eaux contenant diffrentes quantits de NaCl et l'estimation des Fusaria du sol montrent que la population de F. oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici est d'autant plus importante que la salinit des eaux est leve. Cette quantits plus longue conservation du parasite dans des terres contenant diffrentes quantits de NaCl est due non pas  l'action du sel seul, mais  l'effet combin de ce dernier et de l'eau liquide. En l'absence d'eau, et quelle que soit la salinit du milieu, la population de F. oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici diminue puis disparait rapidement. Results of this study show that irrigation and soil salinity have a profound effect on the population of Fusarium oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici. The fungus tolerates very low water potentials (144 bars) and sporulates profusely in saline environments. Successive irrigations with water containing different quantities of NaCl show that F. oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici population increases with the salinity of irrigation water. In dry saline soil, the fungus population decreases rapidly and disappears. These results show that the survival of F. oxysporum f.sp. lycopersici in a saline environment is not due only to the effect of the salt, but to the combined effect of salt and liquid water.

Tests were carried out in greenhouse at 17, 22, 26 and 30C. At all temperature regimes the percentage of isolates that were virulent was higher on heterozygous than on homozygous Tm hosts. The genetic factors Tm-2 and Tm-2 protected against more TMV isolates than the Tm-1 gene. Classification of the isolates was made on the basis of differential reactions which occurred between Tra-gene resistant hosts and strains of the virus. Five strains, namely, 0, 1, 2, 2 a and 2.2 a were identified. The best strain classification of isolates was accomplished at 26  C and with differentials possessing resistance genes in the homozygous condition. 42685976|Grapevine flavescence dore (FD) is known to be associated with mycoplasmalike organisms (MLO) seemingly spread in the vineyards by the leafhopper Scaphoideus titanus Ball which occurs in Northern Italy. The study was carried out for two years in order to check for the presence of MLOs in this insect using dot hybridization with biotinylated MLO-DNA probes. The DNA extracted from 11 of 15 groups of S. titanus reared on symptomatic vines showed hybridization signals with probes pAY and pG at 52C. Three of 5 groups of insects reared on symptomless vines (FD-infected in the past) and two groups of insects reared on vines which had never showed symptoms were also positive. These results show the possibility to detect the presence of MLO potentially related with FD disease in an insect population with DNA probes. A relationship between the presence of MLO-infected insects and the maintenance of the disease through the years in the field appears also possible.

Hugh., tale resistenza  fortemente aumentata per tutto lo spessore delia foglia sottostante aile vegetazioni del fungo. Tuttavia, porzioni di foglie sane e di foglie infette sono state facilmente macerate (e sono state macerate nel medesimo tempo) se previamente estratte a lungo con acetone. Nell'aglicone del-Foleuropeina si  cosi creduto di identificare il principale inibitore degli enzimi maceranti present nelle foglie di Olivo. Quest'ultimo, impregnando pareti e lamelle mdiane, le renderebbe resistenti all'azione degli enzimi maceranti extracellulari del parassita, al quale verrebbe cosi impedito l'approfondimento nel mesofillo. Gli stessi meccanismi difensivi sarebbero anche in gran parte responsabili dlia localizzazione subcuticolare di S. oleagina, che pu accrescersi solo negli strati fortemente cutinizzati e relativamente impermeabili delia prete esterna delle cellule epidermiche, nei quali gli inibitori non possono agire. Healthy leaf tissues of Olive (Olea europaea L.) offer a natural resistance to macerating enzymes. In leaves infected by the leaf spot fungus, Spilocaea oleagina (Cast.) Hugh., the whole tissues around and underlying the spots withstand maceration much better than unaffected tissues. However, when discs taken from healthy and infected leaves were subjected to prolonged acetone extraction prior to maceration, were easily macerated, the time necessary for obtaining the loss of their coherence being identical in both cases. Extraction trials with organic solvents indicated the occurrence of a higher phenolic content in infected leaf tissues than in healthy ones. When the most important phenolic glycoside of Olive leaf, oleuropin and its derivatives, namely its aglucone and a dihydroxyphenyl-ethyl alcohol (DPEA), were added to  Pectinase  solutions, DPEA was inactive, oleuropin was slightly inhibitiory, and its aglucone showed high enzyme inhibition. Thus the aglucone of oleuropin is suggested to be the natural inhibitor of macerating enzymes in Olive leaves. It is suggested that in leaves of susceptible Olive trees, the infection by S. oleagina triggers a series of metabolic events which lead to new synthesis of phenolic compounds, among which oleuropin. This and the glucoside already stored in leaf tissues are mobilized, translocated into the cell walls and hydrolized by -glycosidases, releasing its aglucone. These defence mechanisms might also account to a great extent for the subcuticular habitat of S. oleagina, which can grow only within the highly cutinized, scarcely permeable layers of the outer wall of epidermal cells, where the inhibitors can not function. 42684725|A brief description is given of a new disease of cv. Kerner in Germany. The disorder, for which the name of Kerner Disease is proposed, is characterized by a progressive decline, withering and dessiccation of leaves, shoots and bunches and profound alterations of the woody cylinder which somewhat resemble stem grooving (legno riccio). Infected vines are usually killed by the disease. Viene fornita una breve descrizione di una nuova malattia infettiva della cv. Kerner in Germania. La malattia, per la quale si propone il nome di Kerner Disease,  caratterizzata da avvizzimenti e disseccamenti di foglie, germogli e grappoli e profonde alterazioni del cilindro legnoso che ricordano in qualche modo i sintomi di legno riccio. La malattia ha di solito esito fatale.
42685265|Leaf eaxtracts from cereal plants with barley yellow dwarf (BYD)-like symptoms were collected in Saudi Arabia, Turkey, Iran and China and examined in ELISA tests using antisera raised against barley yellow dwarf virus (BYDV) isolates representative of serotypes described from the U.S. and the U.K. BYDV was detected in none of 21 symptomatic samples collected in Turkey and in only five of 41 other samples. DAS- and TAS-ELISA tests combined to differentiate three variant serotypes among these five: two in samples from China and one in samples from Saudi Arabia and Iran. Test results suggest that BYDV serotypes exist that are difficult to detect or are not detectable with the antisera used. Further investigation of the causes of BYD-like diseases in Asia is required for reliable assessment of the extent to which BYDV may pose problems in Asian cereal crops.

42685545|Viene descritto un nuovo Ascomicete associato ad un cancro corticale osservato su piante di Olivo, nella Liguria centro-orientale, in ambienti umidi o non adatti alla loro buona vegetazione. Vengono descritti la sintomatologia ed i caratteri microscopici del fungo. L'ascomicete viene riferito al genere Massariella Speg. (Loculoascomycetes, Pleosporales, Pleosporaceae) come nuova specie: M. oleae, della quale viene data la diagnosi latina. The finding of a new Ascomycete associated with a bark canker in Ligura (Italy) is reported. The disease occurs only on olive orchards grown under humid unfavorable environmental conditions. The morphologic features of the fungus as well as the symptoms of the disease on olive twigs are described in detail. This fungus is referred to the genus Massariella Speg. (Loculoascomycetes, Pleosporales, Pleosporaceae) as M. oleae n. sp. The latin diagnosis of the fungus is given.

42685877|Fagus sylvatica L. plants that showed abnormally brittle twigs were compared anatomically with trees with twigs of normal elasticity. The xylem of brittle trees was richer in pores and had shorter fibres that were shorter, with thinner walls and less cellulose. A slightly reduced water content could in part explain the observed brittleness. However, because brittle beech also presented typical manifestations of decline, namely: early leaf yellowing and curling, accumulation of starch in the leaves, and alterations in the stomata, it seems likely that there is some relation between twig brittleness and decline in this species.
42685920|The isolates of Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. melonis (Leach, et Currence) Snyd. et Hans. examined came from areas where melon (Cucumis melo L.) is usually cultivated. All the twentyeight isolates examined were classified. Fifteen of them resulted to be non-pathogenic and the other thirteen showed different degree of pathogenicity on six different varieties (Amarillo sel. Mondo, Pancha, Aril, Accent, Nun 8732 and Nun 2001). The four races of the pathogen (R0;R1;R2; and R1,2) were also identified. The twentyeight isolates, cultured on two media amended with KClO (PDC and MMC), gave rise 1239 nitrate nonutilizing mutants (nit). Three types of nit were classified (nit1, nit3 e nitM) on the basis of phenotype. Nit1 mutants were the most frequent (71.35%), followed by nitM (21.15%) and nit3 (7.5%). VCGs were established on the basis of heterokaryon formation. Four groups were identified. Finally, the absence of a relationship between VCGs and pathogen races, the incompatibility between pathogenic and non-pathogenic isolates and the self-incompatibility of three isolates were shown.
42684548|Infection of Rice by Pyricularia oryzae and Sclerotium oryzae were found to be widespread during disease surveys carried out in Las Marismas (Sevilla, southern Spain) in 1977 and 1978. All cultivars used in the area are susceptible to both pathogens. P. oryzae most frequently caused necrosis in the uppermost culm nodes and rachis, originating severe yield losses. Infections by P. oryzae occurred in all fields sampled and conidia were captured from the air through the entire crop season. Conidia from sporulating lesions were divided into four types, according to size and morphology, and differences in virulence were found among them in artificial inoculations. Prevalence and incidence of infections by S. oryzae varied among the eight sampled zones in the area. Nakataea sigmoidea, the conidial stage of the pathogen, was isolated from necrotic spots in leaf blades and proved to be pathogenic in artificial inoculations. Leaf spots were only found in one of the sampled zones, with low incidence and severity values. Conidia of the pathogen were trapped from the air in low number at the end of the crop season, in the first weeks of September. 42685893|The main aim of this work was to set up a method of analysis for the detection of Xylella fastidiosa in grapevine propagation material produced and/or imported in the EEC member States. The method, suitable for any woody grapevine material and, in particular, for one-year-old cuttings, is based on the extraction of the bacteria from xylem tissue by vacuum washing and their final concentration by centrifugation. The final pellet is used for indirect immunofluorescence staining (IFAS) and enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA), using polyclonal antisera. The specificity of the antisera and the sensitivity threshold of the vacuum washing system were evaluated for each assay combination. The results of this experimental approach allowed us to suggest the possible phases for the method of analysis of asymptomatic cutting samples.
42684897|This paper reports the results of a comparative serological study using indirect immunofluorescence staining (IFAS) and indirect solid-phase immunosorbent assay (ELISA) on a collection of 22 Agrobacterium strains belonging to biovars 1,2 and 3 to test the specificity of monoclonal antibody Ab F21-1D3G7C8 (anti A. tumefaciens biovar 3) and the polyclonal antisera FC14 (anti biovar 3) and 2150bA (anti biovar 1). None of the bacterial strains tested reacted with the monoclonal antibody using IFAS, whereas the polyclonal antiserum, FC14, was quite specific for biovar 3 strains. However, with ELISA, the monoclonal serum was shown to be highly specific for all biovar 3's, and all biovars were serologically indistinguishable with the polyclonal antisera. This study clearly reveals the differences in reactivity of antibodies depending on the serological assay used. In reference to serological indexing of asymptomatic grapevine material, a mixture of monoclonal antibodies specific for biovars 1 and 2 may be needed in some cases. In questo lavoro si riportano i risultati di uno studio sierologico comparativo mediante colorazione di immunofluorescenza (IFAS) e saggio indiretto immunoenzimatico (ELISA) di una collezione di 22 ceppi di Agrobacterium appartenenti ai biovar 1,2 e 3 effettuato per saggiare la specificit dell'anticorpo monoclonale Ab F21-1D3G7C8 (anti A. tumefaciens biovar 3) e degli antisieri policlonali FC 14 (anti-biovar 3) e 2150bA (anti biovar 1). Al saggio IFAS l'anticorpo monoclonale non ha interagito con nessuno dei ceppi batterici usati e l'antisiero policlonale FC 14 ha mostrato un apprezzabile grado di specificit verso il biovar 3. Al saggio ELISA, l'anticorpo monoclonale ha dimostrato la sua alta specificit verso gli agrobatteri biovar 3, mentre con gli anticorpi policlonali tutti i biovar apparivano sierologicamente indistinguibili. Da questo studio sono chiaramente emerse differenze nella reattivit degli anticorpi in funzione del saggio sierologico usato. In alcuni casi, per un eventuale indessaggio sierologico dei materiali viticoli di propagazione asintomatici, pu essere necessario usare una miscela di anticorpi monoclonali specifici per i biovar 1 e 2.

43871747|A survey was conducted in Qazvin province in the North of Iran, to determine the incidence of tomato viruses including: Tobacco mosaic virus (TMV), Tomato yellow leaf curl virus (TYLCV), Tomato chlorotic spot virus (TCSV), Tomato bushy stunt virus (TBSV), Tomato spotted wilt virus (TSWV), Tomato ring spot virus (ToRSV), Tomato aspermy virus (TAV), Potato virus Y (PVY), Beet curly top virus (BCTV), and Cucumber mosaic virus (CMV). A total of 742 tomato symptomatic samples were collected during the summer of 2007 in five regions of Qazvin province (Qazvin, Takestan, Boeen-Zahra, Alborz and Abiyek) and tested by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA). TSWV was detected in Alborz (4.4 %) and Abiyek (3.57%) regions but TMV and CMV were detected in all five regions. The greatest and least incidence of tomato viruses were recorded in Alborz (40.7 %) and Takestan (11.1 %), respectively. The presence of these viruses was also evaluated in the weed hosts as natural sources of plant viruses. The greatest and least incidence of tomato viruses in weed hosts were recorded in Boeen-Zahra (25.6 %) and Qazvin (12.8 %), respectively. TSWV was not detected in weeds. Transmission tests demonstrated that Thrips tabaci acts as TSWV carrier and Myzus persicae and Aphis gossypii were CMV carriers. Seed transmission tests positive for TMV (13 tomato seedlings from 100 seedlings), but no TSWV transmission was observed through the seeds of infected tomato fruits.
42684673|Verticillium wilt (VW) of olive trees, caused by Verticillium dahliae kleb., was found in 47 of 122 orchards with about 350.000 trees surveyed in Andaluca, southern Spain, in 1980, 1981 and 1983. The disease occurred in four of seven provinces surveyed, being more prevalent in Crdoba and Jan than in Sevilla and Granada. Disease incidence and severity was higher in irrigated orchards and also in orchards previously cropped or actually intercropped to cotton or vegetables. The disease syndromes, namely apoplexy and slow decline, were observed in two experimental plots at the INIA Research Station, Crdoba, where VW-affected trees had been found previously. Apoplexy, wich develops by late winter to early spring, was characterized by a quick dieback of twigs and branches or death of the entire tree. Slow decline was characterized by leaf clorosis and necrosis, necrosis of flower clusters and dieback of twigs, and developed gradually from late spring to early summer. Incidence of apoplexy was higher in trees affected the year before. Overall disease incidence and severity decreased over the years indicating that trees recovered from disease. La Verticilosis del olivo (VO), causada por Verticillium dahliae Kleb., fue diagnosticada en 47 de 122 olivares, con alrededor de 350.000 rboles, que fueron inspeccionados en Andaluca en 1981 y 1983. La enfermedad occurri en cuatro de siete provincias prospectadas, siendo ms prevalente en Crdoba y Jan que en Granada y Sevilla. La incidencia y distribucin de la VO fue mayor en olivares de regado que en los de secano, y en olivares que siguieron a, o estuvieron cultivados intercalarmente de, algodonero o plantas hortcolas. Dos sndromes, denominados apopleja y decaimento lento, fueron observados en dos parcelas experimentales del CRIDA-10, INIA, Crdoba, en las que se haban encontrado previamente rboles afectados de VO. La apopleja se caracteriz per la muerte rpida de brotes y ramas, o del rbol completo, ocurriendo al final del invierno o principio de primavera. El decaimiento lento caracterizado por la clorosis y necrosis de hojas, la necrosis de inflorescencia, y la muerte regresiva de brotes, ocurri gradualmente desde final de primavera hasta principio del verano. La incidencia de apopleja fue mayor en los rboles afectados de VO el ao anterior, y en general, la incidencia y severidad de la enfermedad disminuy ao tras ao, indicando que los rboles se recuperaron de aqulla.
42685961|Representative strains from each of the six host species (Olive, Oleander, Ash, Privet, Jasmine, Phillyrea sp.) of Pseudomonas syringae subsp. savastanoi were assayed for the bacteriocin production. Thirty-nine out of 78 (50%) strains produced bacteriocins on nutrient-yeast extract agar (NYA). Production in liquid medium (NYB) was poor and not increased or induced by treatment with mitoycin C or UV irradiation. The majority (75%) of the 31 olive strains and all the ash (13 strains) and jasmine (3 strains) strains assayed produced the bacteriocins; in contrast, oleander, privet or Phillyrea strains were negative in tests for bacteriocin production. Bacteriocinogenicity seems therefore related to the host origin of the strains. The bacteriocins produced by P.s. subsp. savastanoi ("savastanoicins") are substances of apparent high molecular weight, sensitive to heat (20 min at 80C) and proteolytic enzymes. They inhibited the growth of strains belonging to the same subspecies and did not inhibit strains of the related pathovars including P.s. pv. syringae, pv. glycinea and pv. phaseolicola. The relationship between bacteriocinogenicity and survival of the pathogen on the host phylloplane is discussed.
42684726|La maladie du bois stri de la Vigne est propage par les bois utiliss pour la production de plantes, au moyen du bouturage ou du greffage, dans les cas o l'un au moins des bois provient d'une souche de Vigne malade. On constate d'abord une mortalit des plantes lie  la maladie. Celle-ci est plus forte lorsque le bois de provenance malade est employ comme greffon que comme porte-greffe. Sur les plantes survivants, les symptmes  la surface du bois (cannelures) se dveloppent en premier lieu sur les bois d'origine malade eux-mmes, mais davantage lorsqu'ils sont dans le sol (porte-greffe) que dans l'air (greffons). Des symptmes apparaissent en outre sur les bois d'origine saine lorsqu'ils sont greffs  un bois malade. Ce phnomne est expliqu en admettant que le bois malade (donneur) transmet l'agent infectieux au bois sain (receveur). Ce dernier montre davantage de symptmes lorsqu'il se trouve en position de greffon (arien) que de porte-greffe, suggrant une progression plus active de l'infection de bas en haut que dans le sens inverse. Le nombre relativement lev de vignes sans symptmes rsulterait d'un phnomne de latence ou d'une rpartition irrgulire du virus dans les bois, compliquant la mise au point d'un test d'indexage de la maladie par greffe sur indicateurs. Des observations directes de la maladie du bois-stri sur le terrain effectues dans une vaste collection de vignes de l'Institut de Pleven, ont montr que des symptmes sont prsents chez de nombreux cultivars de vignes  fruits, dans leur partie arienne (tige du greffon), montrant qu'ils sont directement sensibles. D'autres cultivars sont d'aspect normal alors qu'ils sont greffs sur des porte-greffe ayant des symptmes attestant qu'ils sont infects. Tout ces cultivars peuvent efre considrs comme insensibles par eux-mme  la maladie (tolerance) ou rsistants (immunit). Ils mritent une attention particulire pour la slection de la Vigne. Stem pitting of Grapevine spreads in nature through infected material used for propagation (cuttings) and grafting. Affected vines may die, especially if the infected wood originally used is that of the scion rather than the rootstock. On the surviving vines, grooving or pitting develop first on the wood originating from the infected mother (donor) plant, especially if it is a rootstock. Symptoms, however, appear also on the wood from healthy parent vines (receptors) since the infectious agent moves from the infected donor. This is more obvious when the healthy receptor is the scion, thus indicating that a more active transport takes place acropetally. Many graft combinations do not show symptoms even though at least one of the members came from an infected symptom-showing plant. This may be explained by admitting that the causal agent of the disease, thought to be a virus, is either latent in certain varieties or irregularly distributed within infected vines. In any case, this behaviour has a bearing on the reliability of indexing tests making them not full proof. Possible cases of resistance or tolerance have been observed during a survey for stem pitting symptoms in the large varietal collection of the Institute of Viticulture and Enology at Pleven. These cultivars should be considered in selection programmes.
