42685277|A new strain of tobacco mosaic virus (TMV-P), able to overcome in tomato both Tm-2 and Tm-2 resistance aleles of Tm-2 locus, is described. This is the first report of a strain virulent against both Tm-2 and Tm-2 alleles, whereas different isolates overcoming Tm-1 and either Tm-2 or Tm-2 are known. The biological, morphological and serological features of TMV-P have been compared with those of Tm-2 and Tm-2 resistance breaking strains. Some of the mechanisms possibly involved in the overcoming of both Tm-2 and Tm-2 genes are indicated.
42683904|Sono state indagate le variazioni indotte dalle infezioni di Fusarium oxysporum f. lycopersici (Sacc.) Hansen et Snyder nella capacita di estratti di foglie, fusti e radici e di sezioni di fusti di Pomodoro di degradare e di produrre l'ABIA (acido -indolil-acetico) in vitro. L'attivit di degradazione dell'ABIA  risultata nulla o quantitativamente trascurabile in piante sane o malate cultivate in luce artificiale, nello stesso ambiente utilizzato in un precedente lavoro (Matta e Gentile, 1964). Essa  stata riscontrata in piante cultivate in luce naturale, nelle quali per non ha presentato variazioni significative in funzione della gravit dei sintomi. Gli estratti dei fusti delle piante cultivate in luce artificiale hanno inibito in notevole misura l'ABIA-ossidasi di radiei di Lenticchia: gli estratti di piante sane hanno dato maggior inibizione di quelli di piante malate. L'incapacit di queste piante a distruggere l'ABIA pu essere attribuita alia presenza di inibitori. L'attivit di conversione del triptofano in ABIA ha subito notevoli variazioni in seguito alle infezioni di F. oxysporum f. lycopersici. Con l'aggravarsi dei sintomi detta attivit  aumentata nettamente nelle foglie e nei fusti, mentre  diminuita lievemente nelle radiei. Nei fusti essa  risultata correlata con l'indice fogliare di malattia. L'attivit di conversione del triptofano in ABIA  stata in tutti i casi inibita dalla dialisi e stimolata dall'acido clorogenico. Il fenolo ha esercitato un effetto stimolante maggiore sugli estratti di piante malate che su quelli di piante sane. In presenza di acido clorogenico gli estratti di piante sane, al contrario di quelli di piante malate, sono stati pi attivi dopo la dialisi che prima. I risultati ottenuti indicano che l'iperauxinia indotta nelle parti aeree di Pomodoro dalle infezioni di F. oxysporum f. lycopersici non  dovuta ad inibizione dei processi di degradazione dell'ABIA ma bensi ad attivazione della sua biogenesi. Si suggerisce che la conversione del triptofano in ABIA da parte delle piante di Pomodoro in vitro sia mediata dai fenoli e dalla polifenolossidasi secondo la sequenza di reazioni proposta da Gordon e Paleg (1961). L'iperauxinia e la maggior attivit nel convertire il triptofano in ABIA delle piante malate rispetto alle sane sono correlabili all'attivazione della polifenolossidasi ed all'aumento del contenuto in ortodiidrossifenoli e/o nei corrispondenti chinoni conseguenti alle infezioni. The variations induced in the ability of leaf, stem and root extracts and stem slices of Tomato plants to destroy or form IAA (-indolilacetic acid) in vitro by infections with Fusarium oxysporum f. lycopersici (Sacc.) Hansen et Snyder, have been investigated. IAA destruction rate has been assayed in plants grown under artificial or natural light. Only plants grown under natural light degraded IAA in an appreciable quantity but the disease did not affect consistently their activity. Stem extracts of plants grown under artificial light inhibited IAA-oxidase from Lentil roots: stem exctracts of healthy plants gave higher inhibition than those of diseased ones. The failure to detect IAA destruction by these plants may be ascribed to the presence of inhibitors. The activity of the plants in producing IAA from tryptophan in vitro was affected by the infections with F. oxysporum f. lycopersici. After infection the IAA production rate markedly increased in leaves and stems and slightly decreased in roots. In the stems it was well correlated with the severity of foliar symptoms. The ability of stem extracts to convert tryptophan to IAA was inhibited by dialysis and enhanced by chlorogenic acid (CGA). The effect of CGA on undialysed stem extracts of diseased plants was stronger than on those of healthy ones. This phenol activated the dialysed extracts of healthy plants more than the undialysed ones. These results indicate that accumulation of IAA in Tomato plants infected with F. oxysporum f. lycopersici does not depend on inhibition of its destruction but is a consequence of the activation of its biogenesis. The conversion of tryptophan to IAA by Tomato plants in vitro seems to be mediated by ortho-dihydroxy-phenols and polyphenol oxidase according to the sequence proposed by Gordon and Paleg (1961). The hyperauxiny of diseased Tomato plants is therefore correlated with their higher polyphenol oxidase activity and with their higher content. L'on a tudi les variations dtermines par les infections de Fusarium oxysporum f. lycopersici (Sacc.) Hansen et Snyder dans le pouvoir que les extraits de feuilles, de tiges et de racines et les coupes de tige de plantes de Tomate ont de dgrader et de produire l'ABIA (acide -indolil-acetique) in vitro. La capacit de dgrader l'ABIA a paru tre nulle chez les plantes soit saines soit malades qui avaient t cultives  la lumire artificielle dans les conditions indiques dans une prcdente publication (Matta et Gentile, 1964). Cette capacit a t trouve dans les plantes cultives  la lumire naturelle, mais on n'a pas observ  ce regard des differences remarquables entre les plantes saines et celles malades. Les extraits des plantes cultives  la lumire artificielle, en particulier ceux des plantes saines, ont inhib l'ABIA-oxidase des racines de Lentille, ce qui laisse penser que leur incapacit de dtruire l'ABIA soit due  la presence d'inhibiteurs. Les infections de Fusarium provoquent des variations trs remarquable du pouvoir de produire ABIA du tryptophane: au fur et  mesure que les symptomes deviennent plus vidents, ce pouvoir augmente d'une faon bien nette dans les feuilles et dans les tiges tandis qu'il diminue lgrement dans les racines. La conversion du tryptophane en ABIA est toujours inhibe par la dialyse et stimule par l'acide chlorognique dont l'effet est plus fort sur les extraits des plantes malades. En presence de ce phnol les extraits des plantes saines, au contraire de ceux des plantes malades, sont plus actifs aprs qu'avant la dialyse. 42685430|In a recent survey of olive groves in the Canosa di Puglia, Cerignola and Foggia areas of southern Italy a serious decline of olive trees was seen. The symptoms comprised a general decline of the trees beginning with foliar browning and leaf drop, wilting of apical shoots, die-back of twigs and branches, and brown streaking under the bark of the trunk, branches and twigs. In more advanced stages of the disease necroses and cankers were observed on the bark. The symptoms were similar to those caused by Verticillium wilt, but morphological and molecular analyses revealed the presence of Pleurostomophora richardsiae, Phaeoacremonium aleophilum and genera and species in the Botryosphaeriaceae. Pathogenicity tests carried out on young shoots showed that Pl. richardsiae, Pm. aleophilum and Neofusicoccum parvum were pathogenic and capable of causing brown wood streaking. Since Pl. richardsiae was the most aggressive of these three fungi and frequently it was the only one isolated from diseased trees it was considered to be a primary cause of the decline. To our knowledge, this is the first report of Pl. richardsiae as a pathogen of olive trees.

Florida Market and Bari-12) and "slow-wilting" resistant eggplants ('R1', 'R2', ' R3' and 'R4' selected lines) were determined in a field in southern Italy. Eggplants were grown in two adjacent soils, one of them was infested with V. dahliae and the other one was not. In the two years, Verticillium wilt caused a yield decrease of 54-57% in 'Bari-12', and of 62-85% in 'Florida Market' when compared with healthy plants grown in non-infested soil. Verticillium wilt caused a moderate decrease of yield in eggplants 'R3' (26,8% and 13,3% in the first and second year, respectively) and 'R4' (34,1% and 42,5% in the first and second year, respectively). A nonsignificant decrease of yield was observed in 'R1' and 'R2' eggplants grown in Verticillium-infested soil. The effect of wilt on yield components (i.e.weight and number of fruits) varied with the cultivare of eggplant; in susceptible cultivare the disease caused a decrease of both, whereas in resistant eggplants decreases occurred in either weight and number of fruits.

42685990|Inoculations of Magnaporthe grisea isolates from Morocco on differential varieties of rice showed that the virulence of the isolates varied according to the rice host variety. None of the isolates attacked all rice varieties studied, but each isolate was virulent on at least one variety. Moreover, none of the isolates possessed virulence genes that could overcome the resistance genes Pi-kh, Pi-zt, Pi-ta and Pi-1, contained in rice varieties K3, Tridel, K1 and C101LAC respectively. A virulence dendrogram of M. grisea isolates on the differential varieties of rice permitted identification of 12 pathotypes within the Moroccan population of M. grisea.
42685518|The cytology of Phaseolus vulgaris L. leaf tissues infected with three isolates of Pelargonium zonate spot virus (PZSV) was investigated with the electron microscope. Cell response to infection was severe but no differences were observed in the cytopathology induced by the three virus isolates. Major cell organelles were variously affected. Chloroplasts showed profound modifications of the shape and the internal structure. Virus particles were readily discernible in the cytoplasm and the nucleus. Intranuclear virions were often associated with the nucleolus. In the cytoplasm, virus particles were scattered at random or occurred in fairly large clusters or were contained in single rows within tubular structures. Vesicular stuctures of two kinds, i.e. relatively large, bound by two membranes or small and single-membraned, both enclosing fibrillar material, were seen in the cytoplasm, perinuclear position or inside the nucleus (larger vesicles) or in the cytoplasm only (smaller vesicles).Cell wall thickenings and outgrowths the latter containing virions within tubules, were of very frequent occurrence. The differentiation of these alterations from those found in members of the como-, nepo-, tombus-, and luteovirus groups is discussed. However, PZSV does not belong to any of the above groups. Uno studio al microscopio elettronico  stato effettuato su tessuti fogliari di Phaseolus vulgaris L. infetto dal virus della maculatura zonale del Geranio (PZSV). Nessuna differenza  stata osservata nel tipo di risposta citologica indotta dai tre virus considerati. I principali organuli cellulari sono apparsi danneggiati in vario modo. I cloroplasti in particolare mostravano alterazioni della forma e della struttura interna. Particelle virali sono state osservate sia nel nucleo che nel citoplasma, nel primo, associate spesso al nucleolo, nel secondo, distribuite a caso o in gruppi compatti ovvero dentro tubuli in singola fila. Vescicole di due tipi (relativamente grandi e circondate da doppia membrana o pi piccole e dotate di una unit di membrana) entrambe contenenti materiale fibrillare sono risultate presenti nel citoplasma, in posizione perinucleare o internamente al nucleo (vescicole grandi) ovvero solo nel citoplasma (vescicole piccole). Ispessimenti ed estroflessioni della parete cellulare, questi ultimi contenenti particelle virali e tubuli, sono apparsi frequentissimi. Tutte queste alterazioni citologiche sono tipiche delle infezioni indotte da como-, nepo-, tombus-e luteovirus delle quali esse rappresentano aspetti caratterizzanti. Tuttavia PZSV non appartiene ad alcuno dei gruppi tassonomici di virus di cui sopra.
42685348|Abutilon theophrasti (velvetleaf) is a new weed in Croatia, increasing and spreading rapidly since 1980. Owing to the significant damage it can cause to arable crops, it is now considered an aggressive weed and a potentially serious problem in Croatia. Resistance to atrazine has been reported in velvetleaf, and other herbicides vary in effectiveness to control this plant. Management of this weed may include or indeed come to center around the development of microbial biological control agents. Since 1995, we have surveyed velvetleaf in Croatia and identified the fungi that infect it as an initial step in developing a biological control strategy. Results of this survey are given, including descriptions of three common fungi from diseased velvetleaf in Croatia, Colletotrichum coccodes, Plasmopara skvortzovii, and Phoma exigua var. exigua.

42685989|Sharka caused by Plum pox potyvirus (PPV) is one of the main limiting factors in apricot production in the areas affected by this disease. The few Spanish cultivars evaluated so far were all found to be susceptible to PPV but in most cases, the work was done in uncontrolled field conditions and with isolates that do not exist in Spain. The aim of this work was to evaluate, under controlled conditions, the susceptibility of 15 apricot cultivars from the south-east of Spain to the PPV isolate RB3.30, a Dideron-type isolate representative of the Spanish PPV population. Blida and Chicano cvs did not show any symptoms during two consecutive growth cycles after being grafted onto an inoculated rootstock, whereas the cvs Cortos and Salvajes showed very slight symptoms. The other cvs assayed, Canino, Carrascal, Currot, Guillermo, Morenos, Pacorros, Palau, Pimentonero, Uleano, Valenciano-4 and Velzquez Tardo proved to be highly susceptible.

From Walnut (Jugions regia L.) plants showing chromatic alterations of the leaves consisting of chlorotic ringspot and line pattern or of bright yellow discolorations, two viruses (CLRV-WRS and CLRV-WYM) were isolated by inoculation of sap. Differences were found in the reaction of herbaceous hosts to infection and in the stability of the viruses in crude sap. However both viruses had similar particles (isometric, about 30 nm in diameter) and physico-chemical properties. In sucrose density gradient and in analytical ultracentrifugation virus preparations separated into two components (M and B) sedimenting at 113 and 128 S and having buoyant density of about 1.48 (M) and 1.50 (B). Occasionally a lighter component sedimenting at about 45-50 S was observed. Two functional species of RNA were present which, when elect rophoresed under non reducing conditions, showed a molecular weight of 2.4-2.5 x10 (RNA-1) and 2.0-2.110 (RNA-2). A single polypeptide of about 54,000 daltons was found. CLRV-WYM and CLRV-WRS were serologically related to one another and more distantly to the Golden Elderberry strain of Cherry leaf roll virus. Serological differences were ascertained by dilutionend points of homologous and heterologous antisera, spur formation in gel double diffusion tests and intragel cross absorption tests.

42684126|Des inoculations exprimentales de Tomate par le Colletotrichum coccodes (Wallr.) Hughes ont permis d'etablir que ce champignon est capable de penetrer et de se dvelopper assez rapidement dans des racines jeunes. Le taux de fixation des conidies augmen te depuis l'apex jusqu' la base subrifie des racines, et le pourcentage de fragments de racines coloniss est d'autant plus lev que ces racines sont plus anciennes. Le poids des racines formes par un plant de tomate crot d'une fagon exponentielle jusqu'au dbut de la fructification, puis il devient  peu prs stationnaire. Le C. coccodes, quant  lui, progresse sur les racines d'une faon reguliere (linaire dans certains cas). Le rapport entre le poids de racines malades et le poids total des racines augmente done brusquement au dbut de la phase stationnaire. L'ablation des fruits, en faisant disparatre cette phase stationnaire, supprime cette intensification apparente de la maladie. Infezioni artificiali eseguite con Colletotrichum coccodes (Wallr.) Hughes hanno permesso di stabilire che il fungo  capace di penetrare e di svilupparsi assai rapidamente entro giovani radici di Pomodoro. La percentuale di conidi fissati aumenta mano a mano che ci si allontana dall'apice verso la base suberificata delle radici. Pi vecchia  la radice, pi alta  la percentuale di frammenti di radici colonizzate. In condizioni normali, il peso dell'apparato radicale di una pianta di pomodoro aumenta secondo una curva esponenziale fino all'inizio della formazione dei frutti; dopo tale fase l'aumento di peso  pressoch costante. La colonizzazione delle radici ad opera di C. coccodes  d'altra parte riiolto regolare (la curva di sviluppo puo essere talvolta una linea retta). Il rapporto tra peso di radici malate e peso totale delle radici aumenta perci bruscamente quando ha inizio la fase stazionaria di crescita e cio quando i frutti cominciano a formarsi. L'asportazione precoce dei frutti determina la scomparsa della fase stazionaria e di conseguenza anche l'apparente intensificarsi della malattia. Colletotrichum coccodes (Wallr.) Hughes has been proved able to penetrate into and to grow rather quickly in young tomato roots. The percentage of fixation of germ-tubes appressoria on the roots rises from the apex to the origin of the roots. The older is the root, the higher is the percentage of root fragments actually colonized a few days after inoculation. In normal conditions, the weight of the root system of a tomato plant grows following an exponential pattern until the beginning of fruit setting, and then becomes almost constant. On the other hand, root colonization by C. coccodes is performed in a regular way (the development curve may be a straight line in some instances). The ratio between the weight of diseased roots and the total weight of roots therefore suddenly rises at the beginning of the stationary phase, at fruit setting. Preventing fruit to develop by early cutting, suppresses this stationary phase and consequently suppresses this apparent increase of the disease.

42685420|It can be difficult to predict the outcome when a newly introduced crop is challenged by a specialized obligate phytopathogen. This case study explores the potential of Albugo candida, which causes white blister (WB) of Brassicas, to evolve into a major challenge to the broad acre crop Brassica juncea in the Western Australian (W.A.) agricultural landscape. Brassica juncea is currently emerging as a viable replacement oilseed crop to B. napus, especially in parts of W.A. with diminishing rainfall. WB is known to be a greater threat to B. juncea than to B. napus. Studies to date indicate significant genetic diversity of A. candida populations in this region, with many pathotypes evolving on exotic and native weed flora, and these may result in the development of strains that pose increased threats to B. juncea crops than those already encountered. Information gathered on pathogenic behaviour and defense mechanisms will assist understanding the nature of the appearance of novel pathotypes, and enable development of strategies to enhance host resistance to A. candida in B. juncea. Strategies to manipulate agronomic practices, such as weed control, may also help to reduce the hazards posed by newly evolving pathotypes in this region.

42685315|During the spring of 1996, 57 isolates of Blumeria graminis f. sp. tritici (Bgt) were collected in Italy from different wheat growing areas. Each isolate was tested on detached leaves of wheat variety or near isogenic lines having single or more known resistance genes and on a set of differentials used by researchers in China. Only resistance gene Pm21 was effective against Bgt isolates. Genes Pm3b, Pm4b, Pm2+6, Pm2+Mld, Pm5+6 were moderately effective, and completely ineffective were the genes Pm1 and Pm6. Among the 57 Bgt isolates, 30 different phenotypes were observed, of which 16 with a very low frequency. The predominant virulent phenotype was /1,2,3a,3c,3f,5,6,7,8,17 with a frequency of 19,3%. All the isolates had at least 7 known virulence genes and 73.7% of the isolates had from 9 to 11 known virulence genes. On a set of wheat differentials used in China, 16 races were detected, and among these, race 017 appeared the most prevalent. The results showed that the Italian Bgt population seem to be very heterogenic in terms of virulence.
42685674|A rust species that can be referred to Melampsora pulcherrima (Bub.) Maire, has been observed at the uredial-telial stage on Populus alba L. and at the pycnio-aecial stage on Mercurialis annua L. on the outskirts of Florence. Some peculiarities in the life-cycle of this rust were observed. The teliospores germinated in their natural environment immediately upon formation and did not go into dormancy, even though dormancy is a characteristic of the Melampsora genus; the natural infection on Mercurialis annua occurred from November through the beginning of spring. In order to confirm these observations, the development of the natural uredial-telial stage on P. alba was followed and periodic tests of telia germinability were carried out. The natural telial material was then used to inoculate M. annua in a controlled environment, and aeciospores from natural infections on M. annua were used to inoculate P. alba in a controlled environment. The morphological features of aeciospores, urediniospores and teliospores from natural infections were compared with those known in the literature for Melampsora pulcherrima. Una specie di ruggi ne ehe pu essere riferita a Melampsora pulcherrima (Bub.) Maire  stata osservata nei dintorni di Firenze nella fase uredo-teleutosorica su Populus alba L. e in quella picno-ecidica su Mercurialis annua L. Aspetti particolari notati nel ciclo biologico di questa ruggine sono stati: la germinazione dei teleutoconidi in ambiente naturale subito dopo la loro formazione, senza il periodo di dormienza che  caratteristico dlie specie del genere Melampsora', e la comparsa dell'infezione naturale su M. annua a cominciare da novembre fino all'inizio della primavera. Inoltre teleutoconidi germinanti sviluppatisi naturalmente su P. alba sono stati usati per inoculare M. annua in ambiente controllato; e, d'altro lato, ecidioconidi provenienti da infezioni naturali su M. annua sono stati usati per inoculare, sempre in ambiente controllato, P. alba. Infine  stata confrontata la morfologia degli ecidioconidi, uredoconidi e teleutoconidi con quanto noto nella bibliografia per Melampsora pulcherrima.

42685756|The concentration of free indole-3-acetic acid (IAA) in tap-root tissues of rhizomania-infected and healthy sugar beets of a susceptible 'Monomassa' and a moderately resistant 'Rizor' cultivar was determined using the immunoenzymatic method. Samples for free IAA determination were collected 8 and 16 weeks after emergence from portions of the tap-root affected by rootlet proliferation for the infected beets and from the same areas in control. In the uninfected beets, the concentration of free IAA in the roots of the susceptible beets was doubled that of the moderately resistant cultivar. In the rhizomania-altered tissues, free IAA content was higher than in unaffected tissues for both cultivars. The increase in free IAA caused by the disease was about three fold in the moderately resistant cultivar and less than two fold in the susceptible cultivar 8 weeks after emergence and 4.1 and 3.5 fold 16 weeks after emergence. Il contenuto di acido 3-indol-acetico (IAA) libero in fittoni di bietole sane e affette da rizomania della cv. Monomassa, suscettibile alia malattia, e della cv. Rizor, moderatamente resistente,  stato determinate mediante il metodo immunoenzimatico. Nelle bietole non affette da rizomania della cv. suscettibile il contenuto di IAA libero  risultato pi del doppio rispetto a quello delle bietole moderatamente resistenti. Nelle bietole rizomani il contenuto di IAA libero  risultato superiore a quello delle piante sane in entrambe le variet. L'incremento di IAA libero  risultato, 8 settimane dopo l'emergenza, di circa 3 volte nelle bietole moderatamente resistenti e di circa 2 volte in quelle suscettibili e rispettivamente di circa 4,1 e 3,5 volte 16 settimane dopo l'emergenza.
42685208|In relation with apricot resistance to plum pox virus (PPV) the localization of the virus in tissues has been studied. Apricot cultivars with different levels of susceptibility to the disease, and the indicators "GF305" peach seedling and Nicotiana benthamiana were used. Representative leaves, stem and root fragments were taken from each plant. On these samples transversal cuttings were made. Tissue printings were achieved on nitrocellulose membrane. The resulting imprints were subsequently probed with a specific antibody for plum pox virus in order to localize this virus within the tissues. Large differences were shown between and within species with regard to tissue infection. In Nicotiana benthamiana virus was present in most tissues at a high concentration and with a homogeneous distribution, whereas in apricot and peach cultivars virus was much less abundant and was distributed unevenly. Virus was present mainly in young organs, less so in lignified ones.
42684713|High-lights that influenced research on Grapevine virus diseases include: nematode transmission of the pathogen of soilborne fanleaf, mechanical sap-transmission of fanleaf and yellow mosaic virus from diseased grape leaf tissues to herbaceous plants, identification of Grapevine fanleaf virus (GFV), production of virus disease-free clones by heat treatment and meristem tip culture, high performance of virus disease-free clones, association of a mycoplasmalike organism with flavescence dore, discovery anf proof of a fastidious xylem bacterium to be the pathogen of Pierce's disease. Unresolved are: the identity of pathogens of some virus-like diseases, the interactions of viruses in disease complexes, unraveling the basics of cross protection between virus strains, producing virus disease resistant and immune (R&E) grapevines, for which plasma occurs in Vitis. R&E should be developed through concomitant interdisciplinary research on the genetics of the viruses, the Grapevine and nematode vectors and elucidating their interactions. GFV and arabis mosaic virus (ArMV) may have a common ancestor or GFV is the mother virus and change in the coat protein took place to form ArMV. GFV was likely taken to Europe in Roman times on rootings of Grapevine along with the nematode vector, perhaps Xiphinema italiae or X. index from which X. diversicaudatum and X. italiae developed. On philosophy, many scientists  do what has already be done . Excitement is in exploring the unknown and enlarging concepts. The new pathogen is the prion. Ancora irrisolti sono: la identificazione degli agenti di alcune malattie virus-simili, le interazioni dei virus nelle infezioni miste, i meccanismi che presiedono alla protezione incrociata tra virus e la produzione di viti resistenti ed immuni (R&F) alle virosi, per cui in Vitis esiste plasma appropriato. Purtroppo molti studiosi continuano a fare  ci che  gi stato fatto . Il progresso  nell'esplorazione dell'ignoto e nell'ampliamento dei concetti. Il prion  il nuovo patogeno.

Da seme pretrattato, furono isolati 25 ceppi di F. equiseti, 9 di F. proliferatum, 2 di F. moniliforme, 2 di F. oxysporum e 2 di F. tricinctum; F. solani,  stato trovato una sola volta. Utilizzando le cultivar Bianca di Lisbona, Exibition e Rotonda Piatta,  stata fatta una valutazione delle potenzialit patogenetiche sia sui semi ed i germinelli in laboratorio, sia su giovani piante in serra, opportunamente inoculati. Sul seme si sono rilevate azioni: a) sul vigore, espresso come rallentato sviluppo del germinello; b) sulla germinazione, con l'invasione del seme prima del processo fenotipico; c) sul successivo sviluppo del germinello con l'aggressione allo stesso ed il suo collasso. Le plantule inoculate al piede hanno mostrato progressivamente ingiallimento fogliare, avvizzimento e morte. In generale, gli isolati di ciascuna specie hanno mostrato sulle piante una gamma abbastanza ampia di virulenza, senza apprezzabili differenze fra le cultivar. F. equiseti ha mostrato comportamento erratico nel senso che gli isolati pi attivi sui semi ed i germinelli spesso non lo sono stati sulle piante e viceversa. Al contrario, quelli di F. proliferatum e F. moniliforme hanno dato risposta pi uniforme e con intensit generalmente alta. Quasi tutti gli isolati di F. proliferatum hanno determinate riduzione di vigore, ammuffimento dei semi e marciume dei germinelli. Lo stesso dicasi per F. moniliforme, il cui effetto sulle piante  stato marcato per entrambi i ceppi. Di due isolati di F. oxysporum uno si  mostrato moderatamente attivo sia sulle piante che sul seme, l'altro affatto. Tuttavia, i due ceppi hanno mostrato pari attivit nella riduzione di vigore del seme. Quelli di F. tricinctum hanno rivelato attivit medio-bassa.Questa specie  trovata qui per la prima volta in seme di cipolla. L'unico isolato di F. solani  stato inattivo in tutte le prove. Per le specie pi frequentemente isolate si conclude che: a) F. equiseti, per il suo comportamento erratico e a meno di una prevalenza dei ceppi pi virulenti, pu essere confermato corne debolmente patgeno sulla cipolla; b) al contrario, le specie delia Sezione Liseola potrebbero probabilmente assumere un ruolo importante per la loro marcata attivit verso i semi e i germinelli, con incremento dell'inoculo primario tale da influire in modo determinante sull'andamento della malattia in campo. In 1986-87, 43 commercial seed samples of onion from Italian seed crops were tested for the presence of Fusarium species. Twentyfive isolates of F. equiseti, 9 of F. proliferatum, 2 of F. moniliforme, 2 of F. oxysporum, 2 of F. tricinctum, and 1 of F. solani were isolated from pretreated seed. An evaluation of pathogenic potentialities was made on inoculated seeds in the laboratory and young plants in the glasshouse. Inoculated seeds showed: a) lowering of vigour as a decrease of growth of seedlings; b) mouldiness of ungerminated seeds; c) rotting of seedlings. Infected plants appeared yellowed, wilted and collapsed progressively. Within each fungus species, isolates generally showed various degrees of virulence on plants, regardless of the host cultivar. Isolates of F. equiseti showed a similar behaviour towards seeds and seedlings, but often not in agreement with the response towards plants. Almost all isolates of F. proliferatum caused a decrease in seedlings growth, as well as mouldiness of seeds and rotting of seedlings. The two isolates of F. moniliforme behaved similarly and their effect on plants was high. Of F. oxysporum, one isolate proved to be able to kill plants, invading seeds and rotting seedlings, while the other one was inactive in all these respects. However both these isolates appeared to be equally active in slightly reducing the growth of seedlings. F. tricinctum is found here for the first time in onion seed. Virulence of the two available isolates can be considered low in all. The only isolate of F. solani was inactive. Concerning species most frequently found, it is concluded that: a) F. equiseti, due to its erratic behavior and unless virulent strains are prevalent, can be confirmed as weakly pathogenic to onion; b) on the contrary, the species of the Liseola Section are maybe more threatening than expected. Activity towards seeds and seedlings is regarded here as particularly important as primary inoculum can be possibly increased and disease severity enhanced.
42685346|Ten fungicides belonging to the benzimidazole, triazole, guanidine, pyrimidine and isoxazole family showed in vitro an important fungitoxic activity against three stages of Magnaporthe grisea development: mycelial growth, spore germination, and sporulation; the EC concentrations were relatively low. Differences in efficacy were shown between fungicides. M. grisea isolates appeared generally more sensitive to triazoles and displayed a similar range of sensitivity to the other fungicides tested.
42684088|Two virus diseases affecting cultivated Cardoon (Cynara cardunculus L.) in Piedmont are described. An isolate of Cucumber mosaic virus with characteristics similar to those of other isolates collected in Northern Italy and serologically indistinguishable from a strain from Carnation, causes mosaic and mild reduction of growth. A Tobacco mosaic virus strain, serologically indistinguishable from an isolate of the typical Tomato-TMV strain was also isolated. Cardoon plants infected with this virus were almost symptomless both in field and glasshouse conditions. Cardoon is a new natural host of these viruses. Il secondo virus ottenuto da Cardo  un isolato del virus del mosaico del Tabacco, che risult essere sierologicamente indistinguibile dal ceppo Pomodoro del virus del mosaico del Tabacco. Questo virus  quasi latente in Cardo, sia nelle infezioni naturali che in quelle sperimentali. Il Cardo  un nuovo ospite naturale di questi due virus. 42685392|Root rot and plant wilting caused by Phytophthora nicotianae is a severe disease of chili pepper (Capsicum annuum L.) in open fields and under greenhouse production in Tunisia. Chili pepper grafting for disease management is attracting increased interest in recent years. Using the tube grafting technique, different compatible scion/rootstock combinations were obtained with the wild-type pepper SCM334 and the local chili pepper cultivars 'Beldi' and 'Baker'. SCM334 was resistant to P. nicotianae, while the cultivars Beldi and Baker were susceptible. Plant inoculations were performed with P. nicotianae zoospores, and severity of root rot was rated 30 days postinoculation using a 0 (healthy plant) to 5 (dead plant) severity score. On SCM334 rootstock and with 'Beldi' or 'Baker' scions, the intensity of root rot was very low (mean score 0.1-0.2) and plants were healthy. However, with Baker or Beldi rootstocks and SCM334 scions, root rot was severe (mean score 3.1-4.6), leading to high numbers of wilting and dead plants. This severe root rot was similar to that observed on non-grafted plants of 'Baker' and 'Beldi' inoculated with the pathogen. Under greenhouse conditions, measurements of agronomic characters indicated non-consistent improvement of these features on the scion cultivar when SCM334 was the rootstock. Since plant foliage is not attacked by this pathogen, these results show that susceptible chili pepper scions grafted onto SCM334 rootstocks could be used for root rot management and improvement of pepper yields in P. nicotianae infested soils.
42685937|Barley, bread wheat, durum wheat, maize, sorghum, oat, sugar cane, and triticale samples with virus like symptoms were collected from seventeen locations in Upper, Middle and Lower Egypt including the North Coast, during the 1990 and 1991 growing seasons. Barley yellow dwarf viruses (BYDVs) were detected by enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay in most samples tested. All five BYDV serotypes (PAV, MAV, SGV, RPV, and RMV) were detected, though not in all locations. The PAV serotype was the most common, and was detected in barley, bread wheat, durum wheat, oat and sorghum samples. The RMV serotype was also common, especially in maize, and was detected in sugar cane, maize, barley, bread wheat, durum wheat, oat and sorghum samples. The MAV serotype was detected in about 6% of bread wheat and barley samples. The RPV serotype was uncommon, except in maize, while the SGV serotype was rare, being detected in less than 1% samples. Mixed infections containing more than one BYDV serotype were also detected. Plants of all eight of the wild gramineous species tested were infected with one or more BYDV serotypes.
42684429|Transmission by inoculation of sap of the rhabdovirus associated with vein clearing of Pittosporum tobira (Thunb.) Ait. in several Mediterranean countries was successfully carried out. Except for Chenopodium amaranticolor Coste et Reyn. and Gomphrena globosa L., only solanaceous plants were susceptible to infection. In expressed sap of Nicotiana spp. Pittosporum vein clearing virus (PVCV) lost infectivity at dilution of 10, after heating for 10 min between 50 and 55 C and after 2 h storage at room temperature. No transmission through aphids was obtained. In thin-sectioned cells accumulations of PVCV particles were seen in perinuclear position or in the ground cytoplasm within membrane-bounded enclaves. PVCV is a typical rhabdovirus with nuclear maturation.  stata ottenuta la trasmissione per sueco del rhabdovirus associato agli schiarimenti nervali del Pittosporo (Pittosporum vein clearing virus, PVCV) in diversi Paesi del bacino del Mediterraneo. Il virus ha infettato numerse solanacee, una chenopodiacea ed una sola amarantacea e ha perso l'infettivit in sueco estratto da due specie di Nicotiana a diluizioni di oltre 10, dopo 10 min di riscaldamento tra 50 e 55 C e dopo permanenza superiore aile due ore a temperatura ambiente. Non  stata ottenuta alcuna trasmissione del virus mediante afidi. In sezioni sottili di cellule infette sono stati osservati ammassi di particelle virali tra le membrane nucleari e nel citoplasma; in questo ultimo caso gli stessi aggregati erano sempre circondati da una membrana. PVCV  un tipico rhabdovirus a maturazione nucleare.
42683684|A new sooty blotch was found in Israel on various Citrus species and varieties. The fungus causing the sooty blotch was described as Caenothyrium citri n. sp. of the Microthyriaceae family. The fungus produces dimidiate perithecia which are attached to the substrate by a narrow marginal membrane not developing any air mycelium. The walls of the perithecia are hyaline and radiate, the upper half of which is covered by darker hyphae and by two to three alternate rows of setae. The asci are bottle-necked, and contain 4-8 four-celled spores. The spores are hyaline, elliptical, 10-18  5-7. The generic and specific taxonomy of Caenothyrium citri was discussed and verified. Attention was drawn to the fact that the Microthyriaceae family which has a tropical distribution, developed two species in the Mediterranean region: the above described Caenothyrium in Israel and an other species of Microthyrium in Italy. This being a phytogeographical phenomenon noticed many times in other fungous groups of tropical distribution. Una nuoya fumaggine  stata reperita in Israele su diverse specie e variet di Agrumi. Il fungo che produce tale fumaggine, appartenente alla famiglia delle Microthyriaceae  descritto come Caenothyrium citri n. sp. I peritetici dimidiati del fungo aderiscono all'ospite mediante una stretta fascia marginale completamente priva di micelio aereo. Le pareti dei periteci, jaline e radiate, nella loro parte superiore sono coperte da ife pi scure e da due o tre file alternate di sete. Gli aschi lageniformi contengono 4-8 ascospore 4-settate. Le ascopore sono ialine, ellittiene e misurano 10-18  5-7. Dopo aver discusso la tassonomia genrica e specifica di Caenothyrium citri, viene messo in evidenza che della famiglia delle Microthyriaceae, che ha diffusione tropicale, due specie sono state trvate nella regione mediterrnea: la qui descritta specie di Caenothyrium in Israele e una specie del genere Microthyrium in Italia. Tale fenmeno fitogeografico  stato segnalato pi volte per altri gruppi di funghi di diffusione tropicale. Une nouvelle fumagine a t trouve en Isral sur plusieurs espces et varits d'Agrumes. Le champignon qui produit cette maladie appartient  la famille des Microthyriaceae et est dcrit comme Caenothyrium citri n. sp. Les prithces dimidis du champignon adhrent  l'hte par une troite bande marginale, compltement dpourvue de myclium arien. Les parois des prithces, hyalines et radies, sont recouvertes dans leur partie suprieure d'hyphes plus sombres et de deux ou trois files alternes de soies. Les asques lageniformes contiennent 4-8 ascospores  5 loges. Les ascospores sont hyalines, elliptiques et mesurent  10-18  5-7. Aprs avoir discut la taxonomie du genre et de l'espce de Caenothyrium citri, il est mis en evidence que pour la famille des Microthyriaceae, qui a une expansion tropicale, deux espces ont t trouves dans la rgion mditerranenne: l'espce de Caenothyrium ci-dessus dcrite en Isral et une espce du genre Microthyrium en Italie. 42684288|Parmi les Septoria signals sur le Bl, le S. tritici Desm. prdomine par le fait qu'il peut causer des dgts importants sous des conditions particulires. Le rle de la paille, des dbris de vgtaux, des plantes htes et des semences dans la transmission de S. nodorum Berk et S. tritici est trait. Les conditions mtorologiques conduisant aux pertes en rendements ainsi que les moyens de contrle sont tudis. Tra le specie di Septoria segnalate su Grano, Septoria tritici Desm.  da considerare la pi importante poich, in particolari condizioni, pu causare gravi danni alla coltura. Nel corso delle osservazioni condotte in Marocco  stato preso in esame il ruolo della paglia, dei residui della vegetazione precedente, delle piante ospiti e della sement nella trasmissione di S. tritici e di Septoria nodorum Berk. Sono stati anche messi in relazione i gravi danni che la septoriosi arreca alia produzione di grano, con le condizioni climatiche. Sono infine consigliati alcuni intervenu di lotta chimica. In years with temperate winters and regular precipitations, Septoria tritici Desm. is the only one of the three species isolated from Wheat, which can be of importance especially on high yield mexican varieties. Contrary to S. nodorum Berk., S. tritici apparently does neither develop saprophytically on its host or any other plant tissue nor is it transmitted by seed. Moreover, no other host plants could be detected. It appears that the only source of new contamination for the following year lies in the old host debris. Thus, the inoculum potential of S. nodorum in the field during the initial plant growth stages is much higher than that of S. tritici. Both species, however, may infest the plant at an early growth stage with S. nodorum being at the beginning dominant in number and its symptoms appearing sooner. On the other hand S. tritici appears 3.5 to 4 months after sowing, irrespective of the sowing date. In spite of the high inoculum potential of S. nodorum, no important damage to the seedlings were observed. In 1968-1969 weather conditions were extremely favorable for S. tritici. Since then, such losses were not observed. Normally, the dry and sunny season beginning in April prevents the infestation of the upper part of the plant, which is decisive for grain yield; losses here are then minimal. An estimation of Septoria damage is possible by determining the percent infested surface of the upper two leaves during milk ripening. With one treatment just after ear emergence the most important plant parts are protected. Here, yield increases of ca. 18% up to 6.4 tons/ha were attained. Particularly in rainy years a treatment at that growth stage with a systemic fungicide e.g. Benomyl or Methylthiophanate in combination with Maneb or Mancozeb is warranted. The new moroccan high yield variety Nesma is tolerant to Septoria and other major diseases.

The influence of some nutritional factors on the production of phytotoxic metabolites by a strain of Fusicoccum amygdali Del. has been studied in submerged cultures. The fungus was grown in 500 ml Erlenmeyer flasks (containing cc 100 medium), which were incubated at 24 C on a rotary shaker (at 220 revolution per minute). The inoculum was taken from a submerged seed culture on potato infusion. It was equal to one tenth of the volume of the medium to be inoculated. Young tomato cuttings cv  Super Marmande  , were used in the phytotoxic tests. The conditions which more favoured toxin production were the following: Initial Hydrogen ions concentration of synthetic media: pH 6,7 or 7 (if CaCO is present); final pH: 6,4; Carbon sources: 2 % glucose for potato infusion; 3 % glucose or sucrose for synthetic media; Nitrogen sources: 0,25 % diammonium phosphate (or other ammonium salts, in an amount equivalent to mg 500 N per liter); Phosphorus sources: 0,30% dipotassium phosphate [if (NH) HPO is used as a N source] or 0,5-0,75 % (if other ammonium salts are used); N : P : C ratio of synthetic media, about: 1 : 2 : 25; Microelements: Fe (mg 10/1), Mn, Cu, Zn (mg 5/1) sulphates; Buffer material (only if ammonium salts are used) 0,5 % calcium carbonate; Organic extracts for adding to synthetic media: 0,5 % malt extract. Phytotoxic materials seem to be secreted by the actively growing mycelium of the fungus. Therefore, they are not autolytic products. The phytotoxic activity of cultural filtrates reaches its maximum when the colonies are 3 to 5 days old, when the sources of energy are just exhausted, and when the pH of the medium does not yet show a tendency to rise toward higher values. In the best conditions tested, culture filtrates induced wilt symptoms in Tomato cuttings, even if diluted with water: 1 : 150. On a tudi l'influence de certains facteurs nutritifs sur la production de mtabolites phytotoxiques par des cultures submerges de Fusicoccum amygdali Del., soumises  une rotation continue (220 tours/minute). Temprature d'incubation: 24 C. Pour les essais de phytotoxicit, on a utilis de jeunes plants de Tomate cv  Super Marmande . Parmi les conditions de culture qui ont t essayes, les plus favorables  la production de phytotoxines sont les suivantes: Concentration en ions Hydrogne des liquides nutritif synthtiques: initiale: pH 6,7 ou pH 7 (avec tampon de CaCO); finale: pH 6,4; Sources de Carbone: glucose: 2 % (bouillon de pomme de terre); glucose ou saccharose: 3 % (liquides synthtiques); Sources d'Azote: phosphate biammonique 0,25 % (ou autres sels d'ammonium, en quantit quivalente  mg 500 de N par litre); Sources de Phosphore: phosphate biopotassique 0,3 % (si, comme source de N, on utilise du phosphate biammonique), ou 0,5-0,75 % (si on utilise d'autres sels d'ammonium); Rapport N : P : C des substrats synthtiques: 1 : 2 : 25; Microlments: sulfates de Fe (mg 10/1), Mn, Cu, Zn (mg 5/1); Composs-tampons (si on utilise des sels d'ammonium): CaCO 0,5 %; Extraits organiques ( ajouter aux substrats synthtiques): extrait de malt 0,5 %. Les composs phytotoxiques semblent tre scrts par le champignon pendant les phases de croissance active du myclium. Ce ne seraient donc point des produits lysiens. L'activit phytotoxique des filtrats de culture atteint la valeur maximum entre le 3 et le 4 jour de l'ensemencement, quand les sources nergtiques son  peine puises et quand le pH des liquides ne tend pas encore  remonter vers les valeurs plus leves. Meno consistenti risultarono le differenze ottenute con l'arsenito sodico; assolutamente insufficienti quelle fornite dal Captan durante l'inverno e dal polisolfuro di bario. Con la seconda prova si conferm il miglior risultato gi ottenuto col Phaltan l'anno precedente, in somministrazioni limitate al periodo vegetativo della Vite. Con la terza prova, infine, si dimostrss l'ottimo comportamento del naftenato di fenilmercurio (alla dose dello 0,1 %) saggiato comparativamente col cloruro di fenilmercurio e con l'arsenito sodico, in una ulteriore serie di trattamenti invernali. The results of control trials carried out in Sardinia during 1967-68 using various chemicals against Phomopsis viticola Sacc., the agent of dead arm disease of the Grapevine, are reported. In a first trial in 1967, the plants treated with five different chemicals wnen dormant, were in part subsequently protected with Captan during spring, The results show that the two organic mercury compounds tested (phenylmercuric chloride and pnenyimercuric acetate poth 0.1 %) greatly reduced the percentage of infected shoots, independently of the action of Captan applied during vegetation. Also remarkable has been the efficacy of sodium arsenite, which is however, significantly improved by tne spring treatments. Captan, given in winter, and barium sulphide, although decreasing the percentage of infected shoots, were less effective than the former compounds. A second trial carried out in the same year demonstrated the excellent effects of Phaltan applied in the early stage of spring growth and tne satistactory results obtained with the other compounds tested (Captan, Difolatan and Euparen). In 1968 three distinct trials were conducted. In the first one an interesting residual action of the organic mercury compounds given the foregoing year (particularly phenyimercuric chloride), was evidenced. This may indicate the possibility of limiting winter treatments to every other year. The protection given by sodium arsenite was limited whereas that of Captan (in winter) and barium sulphide was totally insufficient. The second trial confirmed the very good results already yielded by Phaltan in the preceding year, with applications restricted to the vegetative period of the plants. In this trial it appeared of basic importance to carry out protective spraying during the early growth stage of the shoots. Finally, the third trial, based on a further series of winter treatments, showed the good performance of phenyimercuric naphtenate (0.1 %) tested in comparison with phenyimercuric chloride and sodium arsenite. 42685240|Strains of Botryotinia fuckeliana near-isogenic with each of two reference strains, and differing only for alleles at selected gene loci, were used in order to evaluate pleiotropic effects of the mating type MATI gene, the Mbcl gene of resistance to benzimidazoles, and the Dafl gene responsible of resistance to dicarboximides. Near-isogenic strains carrying the opposite aleles, MAT-1 or MAT-2, at the mating type gene locus did not differ in vegetative vigour, production of conidia and sclerotia, and aggressiveness when inoculated to cucumber cotyledons. Strains carrying alleles of the Mbcl gene which cause low or high resistance to benzimidazoles and no hypersensitivity to N-phenylcarbamates showed a slightly reduction in vegetative vigour and sporulation, but similar virulence, as compared to wild-type strains and benzimidazole-resistant N-phenylcarbamates-hypersensitive mutants. Strains carrying different aleles of the Dafl gene showed that their vegetative vigour and osmotolerance were negatively correlated with the level of resistance to dicarboximides. Sporulation and virulence of strains carrying alleles of high resistance were very poor. The results obtained are briefly discussed from the viewpoint of fungicide-resistance epidemiology.
42685389|Tejocote (Crataegus mexicana), a small pome crab-apple-like fruit, is becoming economically important in California with increasing production, so consideration of diseases that hinder the yield is important. Diseased trees of tejocote were observed in four orchards of Riverside and San Diego Counties of California. Ten symptomatic/asymptomatic samples were studied from each of the orchards. Five most frequently isolated fungi were identified on the basis of morphological characters and sequence data of the internal transcribed spacer ITS1-5.8SITS2 and partial -tubulin gene. Three isolates were identified as Neofusicoccum luteum and two as Phomopsis sp. Pathogenicity tests were conducted by inoculating detached shoots of healthy tejocote trees. Significant lesions were observed on all shoots inoculated with the three N. luteum isolates (designated UCR1190, UCR1191, and UCR1192), but not on the shoots inoculated with other isolates or the non-inoculated controls. Results indicated that all three N. luteum isolates are aggressive pathogens on tejocote. This pathosystem should be further studied with a goal of designing appropriate disease management strategies.
42685268|The ability to produce cell wall degrading enzymes (CWDE) in liquid culture was investigated in several strains of Phytophthora capsici Leon. Differences in activity levels of polygalacturonase (PG), pectate lyase (PL), cellulase (Cx), xylanase (Xyl) and -glucosidase (-Gluc) were detected within the chosen set of strains. No correlation was found between degree of virulence and CWDE production, except in the case of -Gluc. Isoforms of these enzymes were detected and partially characterized. The potential role of CWDE in the pathogenesis of P. capsici seems to be rather limited, given their overall low or very low production level. Nevertheless, the possibility that pectolytic and xylanasic enzymes (directly and/or through the products of their activity) are involved in the exchange of signals between fungus and plant cannot be ruled out. The possible pathogenetic role of -Gluc is also discussed.
42684070|Aucune contamination des parties ariennes de la Tomate par le Colletotrichum coccodes (Wallr.) Hughes n'a t constate au Liban, bien que l'infection soit possible exprimentalement. Les conditions climatiques sont vraisemblablement dfavorables  ce mode d'infection. Le mode de transmission ilormal est constitu par les sclrotes provenant des fragments vgtaux infects des cultures prcdentes. Les conidies vhicules par les eaux d'infiltration peuvent galement contaminer les racines. Exprimentalement, toutes les plantes marachres et les Solanaces testes,  l'exception respectivement de la Carotte et du Ptunia, ont pu tre infectes en trempant leurs racines dans une suspension de conidies. Seuls l'Aubergine, le Piment, la Pomme de terre et la Tomate peuvent tre considrs comme sensibles. Les autres ne sont que des htes secondaires, dont l'infection n'est possible qu'en prsence d'un fort potentiel infectieux; dans la pratique, nous n'avons pas rencontr le C. coccodes sur ces plantes, et nous pensons que leur maintien dans la rotation ne presente pas de danger, tout au moins dans les sols peu ou moyennement contamins. In Libano non sono state osservate in natura infezioni di Colletotrichum coccodes (Wallr.) Hughes sulla parte aerea di piante di Pomodoro, nonostante sia stato possibile ottenere infezioni sulle foglie e sui frutti nel corso di prove sperimentali. La normale propagazione del fungo e affidata agli sclerozi rimasti sui residui della coltura precedente. E anche possibile per che le radici possano essere infettate da conidi trasportati dall'acqua. Nelle condizioni della prova sperimentale, tutte le piante ortensi e le Solanacee, ad eccezione rispettivamente di Carota e Petunia, hanno subto l'infezione quando sono state immerse per le radici in una sospensione di conidi. Delle specie saggiate, soltanto Melanzana, Peperone, Patata e Pomodoro sono da considerare come ospiti suscettibili; le altre specie sono da considerate come ospiti di secondaria importanza la cui infezione occorre soltanto in presenza di una gran massa di inoculo. In natura, C. coccodes non  stato trovato su tali specie per cui si ritiene che esse possano essere coltivate neirambito delle normali rotazioni, almeno nei terreni poco contaminati dal fungo. In Lebanon, no aerial contamination of Tomato by Colletotrichum coccodes (Wallr.) Hughes has been observed, although infection of foliage and fruit was experimentally possible. Climatic conditions are presumably unfavourable to this kind of infection. The normal way of transmission is secured by sclerotia coming from previous crops infected debris. Roots may also be contaminated by water-transported conidia. In experimental conditions, the whole of the vegetable crops and Solanaceae tested, excepting respectively Carrot and Petunia, might be infected by dipping their roots in a suspension of conidia. Only Egg-plant, Pepper, Potato and Tomato may be regarded as susceptible. The other plants are but secondary hosts and a high inoculum potential is needed to succeed in their infection. In practical conditions, we did not find C. coccodes on these plant roots, and using them in a crop rotation does not seem to present any danger, at least in moderately contaminated soils.
42685516|Viene descritta una malattia del Peperone (Capsicum annuum L.) cv. Giallo di Nocera, Rosso di Nocera e Marconi caratterizzata da macule necrotiche sul fusto ed imbrunimento dei frutti che divengono successivamente flaccidi. Le foglie manifestano leggero mosaico oppure non hanno sintomi. La malattia  causata da un ceppo del virus del mosaico del Pomodoro identificato sulla base delle reazioni di ospiti differenziali, delle caratteristiche sierologiche e delle osservazioni al microscopio elettronico. La malattia  stata sperimentalmente riprodotta con inoculazioni meccaniche oppure per innesto di corteccia. Le alterazioni sui frutti sono favorite da abbassamenti di temperatura dell'ordine di circa 5C. Questo isolato di Tom MV  risultato trasmissibile per seme di Peperone. Sono state eseguite indagini istopatologiche su piante di peperone naturalmente o artificialmente infette e si  accertato che le necrosi sul fusto iniziano a differenziarsi a livello del cambio e del metaxilema. A disease of Pepper (Capsicum annuum L.) cv. Giallo di Nocera, Rosso di Nocera and Marconi characterized by necrotic spots on stems and fruits, which subsequently turn flaccid, is described. Leaf symptoms range from light mosaic to latency. The disease is caused by a strain Tomato mosaic virus (Tom MV) identified on the basis of its morphological, biological and serological characteristics. The disease has been experimentally reproduced by mechanical or graft inoculations. The response in fruits may be considered a shock reaction of the plants to the infection. The necrotic spots on stems and fruits are enhanced by lowering the temperature of about 5C for 10-12 hours. This virus strain is seed-transmitted in Pepper. Histological investigations with the light-microscope on naturally infected peppers have shown the necrosis on stems to begin in the cambium and metaxilem.
42683896|A survey of research carried out in Israel on Phytophthora infestons has yielded information on the following points: At least 6 races of the fungus were found present on Potatoes, and 4 races on Tomatoes. P. infestans occurs in all parts of Israel in which potatoes and tomatoes are grown. It occurs at all season except midsummer; the summer gap in its occurrence ranges from 10-12 weeks in the coastal plain to 20-24 weeks in the Jordan Valley. Potatoes are generally affected by blight only in the last half or third of their growing period, and infections of fields at the sprouting stage is very rare. Tomatoes and Eggplants are affected in seedbeds, but in the field Eggplants are not affected and Tomatoes usually only 3040 days after planting. Rainfall is not a prerequisite for autumn appearance of blight, except in the Jordan Valley. Nor is the amount of rainfall in winter and spring closely connected with the intensity of blight attacks. In the Negev region, with its low day-time humidity, the presence or absence of dew failed to affect blight development, whereas overhead irrigation (but not irrigation by furrows) greatly favoured blight. Temperatures, except in mid-summer, usually do not limit blight development in Israel. In one instance, (1959) unusually low maxima in October probably contributed much towards an unusually early onset of blight in the Negev. Low elevations have ot been found to affect blight, which affected tomatoes on the shores of the Dead Sea ( 400 metres). Tuber transmission of blight to spring potatoes has been shown to be possible, but is rare. Six wild solanaceous species, as well as Petunia hybrida, have successfully been inoculated with P. infestans, but have not been found affected naturally; their rle in blight transmission is therefore not clear. The chances of reliably forecasting blight occurrence under semi-arid conditions are considered doubtful, but it has been possible to establish the sequence in which blight appears in various parts of Israel in autumn. Cultural measures practiced in Israel for blight control are briefly reviewed. Chemical control measures are popular, in particular since low volume fungicide application has proved effective. 42685609|In 1985 in Northen Italy, stunting, chlorosis, mosaic and crinkle symptoms were observed in commercially grown samples of the vegetatively propagated plant Stachys tubifera Naudin, imported the previous year from The Netherlands. A potyvirus was isolated from the plants, and we report on its range and in vitro properties. Most of the virus, particles were 720-750 nm in lenght. Immunoelectron microscopy showed that the virus is serologically related, but not very closely, to carnation vein mottle virus, watermelon mosaic virus-2 and zucchini yellow mosaic virus. There was no evidence of serological relationship to bean yellow mosaic, henbane mosaic, plum pox, potato Y or turnip mosaic viruses. It is noted that the Stachys foundation stock may have been exported from The Netherlands when already virus-infected, in violation of EEC quarantine regulations. Nel 1985 sintomi da virus quali: nanismo, ingiallimento fogliare, mosaico e bollosit sono stati osservati su piante di Stachys tubifera Naudin in coltivazioni sperimentali dell'italia del Nord. Da tali piante  stato ripetutamente isolato un potyvirus. Tale virus  stato trasmesso a 11 piante test e soprattutto a Chenopodiaceae e Solanaceae, mentre non sono risultate infette Cucurbitacee ed Amaranthaceae. Questa  la prima segnalazione di infezione naturale di un potyvirus su Stachys sp.
42684144|Tumourous tissues of Peach leaves infected by Taphrina deformans, both at the beginning of the disease (end of April) and after maturation of the asci (end of May), have been investigated at the electron microscope. During the first phase of the disease the content of infected nuclei becomes more dense and homogeneous than normal. This change slowly decreases in intensity and disappears immediately before death. The hypertrophied cells actively multiply by means of amitotic divisions. The nucleus first loses its envelope and its mass becomes mixed with the surrounding cytoplasm. Then, both nucleus and cytoplasm are partitioned by a septum which, like the mitotic cell plate, originates from the fusion of small electronically empty vesicles covered by a single membrane. The two new nuclei then reacquire an individuality and a new envelope forms around them. At no time during nuclear amitotic scission were microtubules observed. There is a considerable increase in free ribosomes in the cytoplasm of the hypertrophied cells. This phenomenon, that may be correlated with metabolic activation tends to disappear after maturation of the asci, when the cytoplasm appears emptier and more vesiculated than normal. There is a gradual process of regression of the chloroplasts from the first stages of disease onwards. The chloroplasts decrease greatly in volume, lose starch, assume elongated forms and sometimes divide. Their lamellar system is drastically reduced. It was not possible to prove with certainty whether any of the chloroplasts regressed to the status of propias tids. However, it is certain that, by the time cellular necrosis had occurred, the greater part of these organelles had not reached the proplastid stage. Precipitates, dense to electrons and probably formed of polyphenols, were observed in the vacuole of several tumour cells especially during the first phases of infection. With the gradual advance of the disease, granular deposits, very dense to electrons, become evident in the mitochondria, while the matrix of these organelles becomes more opaque and their cristae expand slightly. After maturation of the asci some infected cells appear necrotic. Their cytoplasm becomes more and more vesiculated, concurrent with some activation of the Golgi. The matrices of the mitochondria and plastids become very electron-dense as also do their membranes and that of the endoplasmic reticulum. All these elements are visibly thicker. Finally, the cytoplasm coagulates and degenerates, while flaky precipitates appear in the vacuole. Sono state effettuate osservazioni al microscopio elettronico di tessuti bollosi di foglie di Pesco attaccate da Taphrina deformans (Berk.) Tul., sia all'inizio della malattia (fine di aprile), che dopo la maturazione degli aschi (fine maggio). Il contenuto dei nuclei delle cellule tumorali diventa omogeneo nelle prime fasi del processo morboso. Tale alterazione va poi diminuendo di intensit fino a scomparire nello stadio premortale. Le cellule ipertrofiche proliferano attivamente mediante divisioni amitotiche. Dapprima il nucleo perde l'involucro e la sua massa si mescola col citoplasma circostante, quindi nucleo e citoplasma vengono divisi in due da un setto che, come la placca equatoriale miotica, ha origine dalla fusione di numerose vescicoline elettronicamente vuote e rivestite da una membrana unitaria. I due nuclei figli riacquistano poi la loro individualit e attorno ad essi si forma nuovamente l'involucro. In nessuna fase della scissione nucleare amitotica si osservano i microtubuli. Nel citoplasma delle cellule ipertrofiche si ha un notevole aumento dei ribosomi liberi, probabilmente correlato con l'attivazione metabolica, il quale tende a scomparire dopo la maturazione degli aschi, quando il citoplasma appare in genere pi vuoto e vescicolato del normale. Fin dalle prime fasi della malattia si assiste ad un graduale processo di regressione dei cloroplasti, i quali diminuiscono fortemente di volume, perdono l'amido, assumono forme allungate e talvolta si dividono mentre il loro sistema lamellare si riduce drasticamente, in qualche caso fino a scomparire. Non si  potuto stabilire con certezza se qualche cloroplasto regredisca fino allo stadio di proplastidio;  certo comunque che quando sopravviene la necrosi cellulare la maggior parte di questi organiti non ha ancora raggiunto tale stadio di regressione. Nel vacuolo di alcune cellule tumorali, specie nelle prime fasi, si osservano precipitati elettronicamente densi aderenti al tonoplasto, costituiti probabilmente da polifenoli. Con l'avanzare della malattia intanto si vanno evidenziando nei mitocondri dei depositi in forma di granuli elettronicamente molto densi mentre la matrice di questi organiti si fa pi opaca e le loro creste si rigonfiano leggermente. Dopo la maturazione degli aschi molte cellule infette appaiono necrotiche. Il loro citoplasma diviene sempre pi vescicolato, in concomitanza con una certa attivazione del Golgi, le matrici di mitocondri e plastidi diventano elettronicamente molto dense come pure le loro membrane e quelle del reticolo endoplasmico, tutte visibilmente inspessite; il citoplasma coagula e degenera mentre nel vacuolo si formano tenui precipitati fioccosi. Les cellules hypertrophies prolifrent activement par divisions amitotiques. D'abord le noyau perd la membrane et sa masse se mlange au cytoplasme environnant, puis noyau et cytoplasme sont spars par une cloison qui, comme la plaque equatoriale mitotique, a son origine dans la fusion de nombreuses petites vsicules lectroniquement vides et revtues d'une membrane unitaire. Ensuite, les deux noyauxfils acquirent de nouveau leur individualit et autour d'eux se reforme la membrane. On ne voit pas de microtubules dans aucune phase de la division nuclaire amitotique. The enzymes had on the contrary no effect on the polyphenoloxidase activity and on the phenol and protein content. 42685214|La production de toxines de type isoquinolines (pyrenoline A et pyrenoline B) par Pyrenophora teres Drechs. en milieu liquide M-1-D modifi est tudie pendant 25 jours chez six isolats de forme teres et un isolat de forme maculata originaire du Maroc. Production of toxines of isoquinoline type (pyrenoline A and pyrenoline B) by Pyrenophora teres Drechs. in modified M.1.D liquid medium has been studied during 25 days for one f. maculata and six f. teres isolates, all of Moroccan origin. Isoquinolines concentration in culture medium varied in time following a repetitive cycle of production and degradation. However, pyrenoline B was always produced in large quantities compared to pyrenoline A. Biosynthesis processes of the two toxins seemed to interfere with each other, but the fluctuation of culture medium pH is not correlated with the cyclic variation of the isoquinolines in the fungus culture.
42685803|An unusual morphotype was detected among isolates of Botryotinia fuckeliana (Botrytis cinerea) deriving from single ascospores. 42685963|An empirical model was developed to describe an observed relationship between fire blight and yield loss in pear. Data used to develop the model were obtained from 310 trees located in two areas from 1991 to 1992. A diseaseindex based on visual symptoms of the disease was derived and yield of each tree was weighed. The data were analysed in four ways that provided four equations, from which a quadratic equation was better fitted giving very good approach of predicted to observed losses. The proposed model has potential application, providing a support for disease control decision and further management of the orchard.
42685804|The effect of ToMV infection, on the production of processing tomato (cv. UC 82), has been determined in trials carried out at Anzola dell'Emilia (Bologna) in 1985 and 1989. Plots with different initial levels of ToMV infection were estabilished, and the spread of infection was monitored after transplanting and before harvesting. After transplanting the infections was twice as much as the initial infection, whereas before harvesting the infection was slightly less then twice the infection after transplanting, both being linearly correlated to the initial level of infection. The production was inversely and linearly correlated to the level of final infection. Every 10% increase of infection, a 4.4% average decrease of the production occurred: in the local conditions, an average 396,000 Lit loss/ha. The importance of transplanting in virus spread, and the need of resistant cultivars to control the disease are pointed out. Nel primo caso essa risultava circa raddoppiata, e nel secondo era meno del doppio dell'infezione al trapianto; in entrambi i casi si verificava una correlazione lineare con il grado di infezione finale. La produzione  risultata inversamente correlata in maniera lineare al grado di infezione finale; per ogni 10% di incremento di questa era constatabile un decremento medio del 4,4% ehe, nelle condizioni locali (anno 1989), corrispondeva a una perdita di circa 396.000 Lit/ha. Sono messi in evidenza l'importanza del trapianto nella diffusione del virus e l'utilit dell'impiego di cultivar resistenti per evitare la malattia.

43871741|Black foot is an important disease of grapevines, affecting vines in nurseries as well as in young plantations. In recent years the disease has increased in incidence and severity throughout the world. Black foot is associated with at least two Campylocarpon and 12 llyonectria species, most of which have only recently been The recognition of previously unknown species, together with published reports of variability in virulence between and within species identified as I. macrodidyma and I. liriodendri, underlined the need to compare virulence of isolates from these complexes. A further objective of this work was to determine the cross-infection potential of isolates of these species from other hosts to grapevine. Results from this study revealed recently described species such as I. lusitanica, I. estremocensis and 1. europaea to be more virulent to grapevine than the previously accepted as the main causal agents of black foot, such as I. liriodendri and I. macrodidyma. Furthermore, these results also provided support for isolates obtained from non-grapevine hosts to be as virulent to grapevines as isolates obtained from grapevine, underlying the cross-infection potential of these pathogens.
