42685934|In trials assessing the control of the most important postharvest disease of kiwifruit, i.e., storage rot (Botrytis cinerea ), fruits were cured at temperatures between 5 and 30C with 95-98% RH for 24-96 h before being stored at 0C. At 15C, the fruits were also cured in the presence of low RH (40-45%). Pedicel scars, where most infections start, and artificial wounds were inoculated with the pathogen. All the tested curing temperatures induced a significant decrease in storage rot of fruits inoculated either on artificial wounds or on pedicel scars, the lowest number of infections being obtained in the fruits cured at 15C. The percentage of infected fruits was significantly lower in fruits cured for 48 h rather than for 24 h; longer curing durations did not induce any further significant reduction of infection. Lower infections were obtained in high RH-cured fruits with respect to low RH. The enzyme phenylalanine ammonia-lyase (PAL) was assayed in the tissues close to the artificial wounds and pedicel scars of cured and uncured kiwifruit. PAL activity as a whole showed increasing values in cured fruits where under blue light a certain accumulation of phenolics was evident.
42685952|Putrescine, spermidine and spermine were qualitatively and quantitatively analyzed by HPLC in tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) type-strain. The polyamine content of highly purified virus suspensions (expressed as number of molecules per virus particle) showed no significant difference between the control samples and the dialyzed ones, whereas the sonication allowed a three-fold recovery of total polyamines only due to spermidine. Dialysis experiments and virus purification in the presence of either C-putrescine or C-spermidine led to results which support the hypothesis that detected polyamines are intrinsic components of TMV particles. The possible role of these molecules in TMV RNA conformation is discussed.
42684200|An accurate description of the fertilization tube in P. infestans is given. The structure seems to consist of two well distinct parts. The former, the proximal one, is usually tubuliform, 10-15 long by 2-3 thick, membranaceous and rarely persistent, originating from the antheridium, above the plug, and localized in the oogonial lumen. The latter, the distal one, is rather expanded, rigid and thick walled, tendentially spherical to pyriform in shape, 12-20 long by 10-15 wide, with one face usually bent inward and firmly attached to the oospore. Viene accuratamente descritto il tubo di fertilizzazione in P. infestans. Questa struttura sembra consistere di due parti ben distinte. La prima parte, prossimale,  slitamente tubuliforme,  10-15 di lunghezza e  2-3 di diametro, membranacea, raramente persistente, avente origine dall'anteridio e localizzata nel lume oogoniale. La seconda parte, distale, presenta una parete rigida e piuttosto spessa, e di forma tendenzialmente sferica o piriforme, misura  12-20  10-15, ed ha una zona leggermente depressa con cui si attacca saldamente all'oospora. On dcrit avec prcision le tube de fertilisation en P. infestans. Cette structure parat tre constitue par deux parties bien distinctes. La premire, la partie bsale, est, en gnral, tubiforme, 10-15  de longueur et 2-3  de diamtre, membraneuse, rarement persistante, qui tire son origine de l'anthridie et elle est localise dans la cavit oogoniale. La deuxime, la partie distale, prsente une parois rigide et assez paisse; a une forme qui varie de sphrique  pyriforme, 12-20  10-15 , et un cte lgrement inclin vers l'intrieur, par lequel elle s'attache solidement  l'oospore.
42685636|Alternaria alternata turned out to be the main fungal species occurring on tomatoes affected by blackmold in the field, in Apulia. Besides this species, a rather low incidence of A. tenuissima was also observed. Samples of infected tomatoes were found contaminated by tenuazonic acid (up to 7.2 mg/kg). All the fifteen tested strains of A. alternata from blackmold tomatoes, produced high amounts of tenuazonic acid when grown on rice (from 589 to 4,200 mg/kg), and to lesser extent on tomato; while the only assayed isolate of A. tenuissima was a very poor producer (2 mg/kg). Tenuazonic acid induced severe chlorosis and necrosis of leaves on tomato cuttings, and its minimal dose was estimated to be 130 mg/kg fresh plant weight. When tested on tomato seedlings, tenuazonic acid caused inhibition of root and shoot elongation. A. alternata  risultata la pi importante specie fungina agente di marciume nero dei pomodori, nelle colture pugliesi. Assieme ad A. alternata era a volte presente anche A. tenuissima. Campioni di pomodori affetti da marciume nero sono stati trovati contaminati fino a 7,2 mg/kg di acido tenuazonico.Tutti i 15 isolati di A. alternata da pomodori infetti hanno prodotto elevate quantit di acido tenuazonico su riso (da 589 a 4.200 mg/kg) e in minor quantit su pomodori; mentre un isolato di A. tenuissima ha prodotto pochissime quantit di tossina (2 mg/kg). Somministrato a piantine recise di pomodoro, l'acido tenuazonico ha causato clorosi e necrosi fogliari, e la dose minima  risultata di 130 mg/kg di peso fresco di pianta. L'acido tenuazonico ha anche inibito l'accrescimento delle radici e dei germogli delle plantule di semi germinanti di pomodoro.
43872366|A total of 68 cereal products (48 breakfast cereals and 20 infant cereals) were collected from supermarkets and pharmacies in the Rabat-Sal area of Morocco and the content of fumonisins (FB, FB and FB) was analysed. Samples were extracted with a mixture of acetonitrile/water (85/15, v/v) by using an ultra-turrax homogenizer. Mycotoxins were then identified and quantified by liquid chromatography/tandem mass spectrometry. Results snowed that fumonisins were detected in 20 samples (18 breakfast cereals and 2 infant cereals) with a frequency of contamination of 29.4% of total samples. The most contaminated products were cornflakes (maize) and breakfast cereals (rice, maize and cacao) with 10 and 4 positive samples respectively. The highest value was found in a breakfast cereal with 228 g kg of total fumonisins.
42685307|During the years 1992, 1993 and 1994, extensive field surveys of wheat and barley diseases were conducted in the Central Anatolian Plateau (CAP). A total of 299 wheat fields and 79 barley fields, representing the main growing areas, were checked systematically for fungal and viral diseases as well as for nematodes. The most frequently occurring disease of wheat was foot and root rot, and Fusarium spp. were the predominant pathogens isolated. In barley, the most frequently occurring disease was barley leaf stripe, followed by foot and root rot. Cochliobolus sativus was the main pathogen causing foot and root rot. The incidence of these wheat and barley diseases was around 10% in infested fields and this can be equated to the actual losses caused. Other foliar diseases of wheat encountered were leaf spot, septoria blotch, yellow, leaf and stem rusts, cereal cyst and seed gall nematodes, head and glume blotch, powdery and downy mildews, and tan spot. Other barley diseases found were scald, net blotch, powdery mildew, leaf and stem rusts, leaf spot, and cereal cyst nematode. Among bunts and smuts, loose smut of wheat was the most frequently occurring and at high incidence, up to 36% in some fields. Losses due to loose smut are equated to percentage incidence. Common bunt of wheat and covered smut of barley were also frequently observed. Flag smut of wheat was found in one location. Pathogens recorded for the first time on the CAP are Wojnovicia graminis causing root rot, Leptosphaeria nodorum causing septoria nodorum blotch, and Sclerophthora macrospora causing downy mildew. Among the viral diseases, barley yellow dwarf (PAV and RMV serotypes) was found at extremely low incidence (less than 1%); wheat streak mosaic virus (WSMV) and barley yellow striate mosaic virus (BYSMV) were only detected in specific regions and with very low incidence.
42685288|The random amplified polymorphic DNA (RAPD) method was used to assess genome variability in 27 hypovirulent, dsRNA containing, isolates of Cryphonectria parasitica which were isolated from chestnut trees in a restricted area of Sicily and in different spots of Calabria (southern Italy). RAPD polymorphisms were found to be more common among the isolates from Calabria. Unweighted pair group method with arithmetic mean (UPGMA) analysis of RAPD data pooled by five primers revealed a very low genomic distance of the isolates tested. However, one temptative cluster included all the isolates from Sicily, with the exception of one.
42685273|A rugose wood (RW)-affected clone of the cv. Grappello (Vitis vinifera) was subjected to indexing tests by graft-inoculating woody indicators for virus and virus-like diseases. The findings indicated that the selected RW inoculum source induced xylem grooving and pitting on the stem of 'Kober 125AA' and 'Kober 5BB' (V. berlandieri  V. riparia), 'St. George' (V. rupestris) and '110 Richter' (V. berlandieri  V. rupestris). This last indicator also showed the presence of vein necrosis disease. In addition, the rootstock hybrid 'Kober 125AA' reacted with severe leaf and cane symptoms, similar to those reported for grapevine corky bark (CB) disease. No wood abnormalities, however, were observed on the recipient 'LN-33' (Couderc 1613  Thompson Seedless) indicator vines. These only showed typical symptoms of grapevine leafroll (GLR) disease. GLR also developed on 'Cabernet franc' (V. vinifera). The 'Grappello' clone was tested by ELISA, with antisera to various grapevine viruses, and on herbaceous indicator plants. The results of the serological assays showed that the clone contained grapevine leafroll-associated virus 1 (GLRaV-1) and grapevine trichovirus A (GVA). Filamentous, flexuous, virus-like particles were mechanically transmitted from 'Grappello' tissue extracts to seedlings of Nicotiana benthamiana and N. occidentalis. In ISEM tests, the viruses were decorated with antibodies prepared against GVA and grapevine trichovirus B (GVB), respectively. The results of the study are discussed on the basis of current knowledge of the grapevine RW complex.
42683778|In prove sperimentali condotte in due diverse localit della Puglia: in agro di Cerignola (Foggia) in zona pianeggiante poco elevata sul mare e in agro di Ruvo (Bari) in collina a 410 m sul mare,  stato possibile mettere in evidenza i periodi dell'anno nei quali si verificano in natura le pi gravi infezioni di Fusicoccum amygdali Del. su Mandorlo. Le prove hanno previsto l'impiego di piante in vaso di due cultivars suscettibili che, allevate a Bari in condizioni di sanit, sono state prtate in gruppi, ogni mese, dal 15 aprile 1966 al 15 aprile 1967, nelle due localit sopra dette e ivi esposte per trenta giorni alle infezioni na-turali al di sotto o al di fuori della chioma di alberi di Mandorlo infetti. In entrambe le localit gli esiti delle infezioni (cancri) rilevati sulle piante a 4 mesi dalla fine del periodo di esposizione non sono stati influenzati dalla posizione di esse al disotto o al di fuori della proiezione della chioma e rispetto ai punti cardinali.  sembrato pertanto che, nei periodi pi favorevoli alle infezioni, il fungo pu essere spostato nell'aria e che tali spostamenti son tali da rendere simili tra di loro i punti di un mandorleto infestato. In entrambe le localit le infezioni son state scarse o nulle nei mesi pi caldi e in quelli invernali mentre son state consistenti in autunno e in primavera. Di tali due stagioni, la primavera  sembrata la pi favorevole essendo occorso in essa il massimo delle infezioni (dal 15 aprile al 15 maggio a Cerignola e dal 15 maggio al 15 giugno a Ruvo). Circa i meccanismi di diffusione del fungo in natura, escludendo la possibilit di infezioni ascosporiche, si  formulata l'ipotesi che, a parte una modesta influenza degli insetti come vettori, i conidi siano principalmente spostati dal vento che si associerebbe o interverrebbe successivamente alla disgregazione dei cirri e delle masserelle conidiche da parte dell'acqua. Non  stata inoltre esclusa la possibilit che il vento possa trasportare anche a distanza interi cirri gi secchi e fragili e brandelli infetti di periderma o di foglie. In trials carried out from April 15th 1966 through April 15th 1967 in two orchards located in different Apulian areas, it has been possible to ascertain the periods in which the heaviest infections by Fusicoccum amygdali Del. occur on Almond. Groups of two years old healthy plants of the susceptible cultivars  Tuono  and  Occhiorosso  were placed under the projection of an infected tree and between two adjacent rows of trees. These plants were kept in situ for a month. Then they were removed and replaced with another series of similar plants. After the set period of exposure to natural infections the plants were brought back in laboratory and observed for development of infections. The results were evaluated by counting the number of canckers developed on plants after four months from the end of the exposure in the infected Almond orchard. From the data obtained the following conclusions can be drawn. The number and severity of the infections in both localities have not been influenced by the position of the bait plant respect to the infected tree. It seems therefore that in the period most favourable for the onset of infections the fungus spreads trough the air. In particular its movements are such that any point of the orchard presumably is exposed to an equal level of inoculum. In both localities (Cerignola and Ruvo) light infections occurred in connection with the summer and winter months, whereas severe infections developed on spring and autumn. However the most severe attacks were recorded in spring time (from April 15th to May 15th at Cerignola and from May to June at Ruvo). Informations on the biology of the pathogen seem to rule out ascosporic infections. Therefore it is conceivable that picnospores are spread by the wind which completes the disgregating action of water on the cirrhi and conidial masses. The possibility that wind is able to transport for some distance dried-out cirrhi and fragments of infected periderm and leaves cannot be excluded. Finally some insects may play a role, although secondary, in the spreading for conidia. 42685412|Black foot disease causes death of infected grapevines but management of this soil-borne disease by preventative measures such as pre-planting fungicide dips has not been totally effective. Hot water treatment (HWT; 50C for 30 min) of young dormant grapevine plants has been shown to significantly reduce infection. However, it has been reported to cause unacceptable damage to young vines in cooler climate countries like New Zealand, so this study examined the effects of different HWT protocols on the New Zealand black foot isolates. In vitro testing of different HWT protocols was conducted on conidia, mycelium and detached, inoculated grapevine canes using three isolates each of the species I. liriodendri ("C". liriodendri) and the complexes, I. radicicola ("C". destructans) and I. macrodidyma ("C". macrodidymum). Heat treatments greater than 40C for 5 min killed all conidia (P<0.001), and treatments greater than 47C for 30 min inhibited (P0.003) further growth of treated mycelium plugs for all but one isolate. Within cane pieces, infection by Ilyonectria ("Cylindrocarpon") isolates was significantly reduced (P<0.001) by 30 min at 48.5 and 50C. Additionally, these studies showed different responses to the different treatments for the three isolates of each species complex and differences between species. In field trials, HWT of 48.5 and 50C for 30 min significantly reduced disease incidence in dormant plants to 0% (P0.001). This study confirmed that HWT of 48.5C for 30 min could be used to eliminate black foot disease in dormant nursery grapevines grown in New Zealand prior to their use for establishing new vineyards.
42684441|Em Fevereiro de 1978 foi reconhecida pela primeira vez a presena do Vrus do Emanjericado do Tomateiro (Tomato bushy stunt virus = TBSV), em Portugal, em Tomateiros em cultura forada. A identificao baseou-se nos sintomas sistmicos em tomateiro, pimenteiro e Datura tatua L. e nas lesoes locais neste hospedeiro e em Ocimwn basilicum L., Tetragonia expansa Murr., Gomphrena globosa L. e Nicotiana glu tinosa L. obtidas por inoculao mecnica, nas provas de difuso em agar e de sero-microscopia electrnica com soro especifico para a estirpe B-3 de TBSV e ainda na observao dos viries quer pelo mtodo de Brandes quer em suspenses purifcadas. No decorrer do ano verificou-se forte influncia das condies de ambiente na severidade dos sintomas. A ultrastrutura de clulas do mesfilo de pimenteiro revelou a existncia de grande acumulao de viries bem ordenados no citoplasma, frequentemente junto ao ncleo. Tomato bushy stunt virus (TBSV) was for the first time recorded in Portugal in February 1978 in a protected tomato crop. Identification was based on: systemic symptoms in Tomato, Pepper and Datura tatula L., local lesions in this host and in Ocimum basilicum L., Tetragonia expansa Murr., Gomphrena globosa L. and Nicotiana glutinosa L., induced by sap inoculation; gel-diffusion serology and immune-electron microscopy with TBSV serum, strain B-3; observations of isometric virions by dip method and in purified suspensions. Symptom severity all over the year revealed to be strongly dependent on environmental conditions. Ultrastructural aspects of mesophyll pepper cells showed great accumulation of orderly arranged virions in the cytoplasm, frequently near the nucleus.

Eight peanut (Arachis hypogaea ) genotypes were evaluated for resistance to A. flavus, A. terreus and other fungi in three field trials (irrigated, drought stressed and at rainy season). In irrigated and drought stressed trials, soil was inoculated with A. flavus and A. terreus. Seed colonization by these fungi was determined by placing them on malt salt agar medium. The resistant checks ('PI-337394' and 'PI-337409') were more resistant to A. flavus than any other genotype under field conditions. The behaviour of 'Florgiant', 'Criollo de Cocorote' and 'Erecto con reposo' was erratic. Under drought stress, the cultivar 15-607 was only inferior to the resistant check 'PI-337394'. As for resistance to A. terreus, 'Florunner' was the least colonized cultivar and showed low variability among essays. 'Florigiant' and 'Erecto con reposo' also showed low variability but high colonization values. Resistance to other fungi was stable only in 'PI-337409'. Lowest colonization average was observed in the "at rainy season" trial.
42684618|A virus (GBLV-CM112) manually transmitted from Portuguese vines cv. Borracal was distinct from Grapevine Bulgarian Latent Virus (GBLV-type strain) serologically and in herbaceous host range. It causes systemic symptoms in Nicotiana megalosiphon and latent systemic infection in N. tabacwn cv. Xanthi. Purified virus preparations contained three virus components sedimenting at 52S (T), 124S (B) and 127S (B ) and four additional nucleoproteins (S to S) with sedimentation coefficients of 63S (S), 84S (S), 87S (S) and 106S (S). GBLV-CM112 nucleic acid occurs as two functional RNA species of mol. wt 2.2  10 and 1.95 X 10, respectively and a third satellite-like RNA with mol. w of ca. 0.5  10. Lack of nucleoproteins in addition to ordinary components in purified preparations of GBLV-type strain, RNA recovery from different nucleoproteins and differences in buoyant densities, suggest that components S-S contain one, two, three and four molecules of satellite-like RNA, respectively. GBLV-CM112 was distantly serologically related to both GBLV-type strain and blueberry leaf mottle virus. 43872365|Mycotoxins are becoming an increasingly important topic in both human and animal fields. With the improvement of analytical methods it is possible to identify a great number of known and unknown toxic metabolites. However, even for the most well studied mycotoxins, namely aflatoxins, deoxynivalenol, zearalenone, fumonisins and ochratoxin A, several questions remain unanswered. In which commodities are they most commonly found and at which levels? Which worldwide regions are more prone to mycotoxin occurrence and how severe is the contamination? In an attempt to answer these questions, a worldwide mycotoxin survey has been been carried out. A total of 6,058 feedstuffs and finished feed samples were analyzed between January 2009 and December 2010 for the presence of the aforementioned mycotoxins. 1,695 samples were analyzed by Enzyme Linked Immunosorbent Assay (ELISA) and 4,363 samples were analyzed by High Performance Liquid Chromatography (HPLC). This paper presents the results of these analyses from a geographical point of view (by world region) and by commodity type, separated by analytical method. The outcome is clear and mycotoxins are reported to be ubiquitously present as 24, 21, 65, 48 and 17% of analyzed samples tested positive for aflatoxins, deoxynivalenol, zearalenone, fumonisins and ochratoxin A, respectively in the case of ELISA-analyzed samples and 31, 44, 50, 56 and 27% of HPLC-analyzed samples tested positive for the same mycotoxins.

42685264|The potential for the use of geostatistics in geophytopathology was examined, considering the distribution of Cercospora leaf spot epidemics over a four-year period (1990-1993) in an area of 9,500 km, that is the sugarbeet-growing area of the Emilia Romagna region (northern Italy). Leaf spot intensity (expressed as the area under disease progress curve) was considered as a regionalized variable measured at 50 points of a limited area; therefore the theory of regionalized variables was applied to model and identify the spatial structure of the variable and to estimate its values everywhere in the area studied. Then estimated data were used to obtain disease maps by means of the kriging interpolation. The results showed that Cercospora leaf spot intensity can be considered as a regionalized variable and that the use of geostatistics led to the drawing of satisfactory disease maps. The region was found to have 3 areas with different disease occurrence: the north-eastern area, where disease intensity is high with low variation among years; the western area, where epidemics are on average lower but have a wide variability among years; the central area, where both leaf spot intensity and its variability are intermediate.

A series of investigations on the metabolism of Peach leaves (cv  Elberta  ) either invaded by Taphrina deformans (Berk.) Tul. or healthy and located at various distances from the affected ones, have been carried out. Particular attention has been payed to Nitrogen metabolism separating and evaluating free and protein amino acids on ion-exchange resins. The following results were obtained: A) Infected tissues: 1) strong diminution of dry matter especially noticeable in the final stages of the disease; 2) an initial increase of Nitrogen per g of dry matter followed by a remarkable decrease of the same element in the final stages of the diesase; 3) a marked increase of glycolysis; 4) an increase of respiration especially at the beginning and at the end of the disease; 5) the total amount of free amino acids is generally higher than in the healthy control (sometimes more than double), but shows a clear flection at the time of differentiation of the asci; 6) in the free amino acids pool it has been noticed a strong decrease of alanine and glutamic acid, especially in the last stages of the disease; an increase of proline and ornithine; an initial decrease and a very strong final increase of glutamine-asparagine-threonine group. Also valine, tyrosine, phenylalanine, -aminobutyric acid, ammonia nitrogen, histidine and arginine, generally increased although less considerably. Other amino acids (tyrosine, phenylalanine, ornithine and histidine) which, during the incubation period occur in quantities percentually higher than the corresponding values found in the control, exhibit a drop in the 5th collection, that is in the phase of advanced sporulation, due to the strong increase of the glutamine-asparagine-threonine group; 7) considering all the samplings with the exception of the first one, it has been noticed at first an increase and then a drop of the total amount of free aminoacids in respect to the control; 8) the changes of the percentual composition of the protein amino-acids pool consist mainly in a diminution of alanine, glycine and phenylalanine whereas there is an increase of ammonia nitrogen. Other amino-acids value are rather close to those of the check. These changes in the quantitative ratio of protein amino acids suggest the occurrence of an alteration in the protein complex of the diseased plant. B) In the non-invaded parts of the infected leaves and in the non-infected leaves of the attacked twigs, it was noticed what follows: 1) the dry matter content per g of fresh weight, is close to the values of the control; 2) total nitrogen values do not significantly differ from those of the control; 3) the glycolysis is generally higher than the control and shows a light flection at the end; 4) the respiration, which is lower at the beginning of the disease, becomes higher than in the control at the time of differentiation and maturation of asci; 5) the free amino acids content is generally lower than in the control, but shows a higher value at about the middle of the parasitary cycle; 6) although percentage variations in the free amino acids pool do occur, these are generally less noticeable than in the infected tissues; 7) the total content of the protein amino acids per g of dry matter is generally higher than in the control during the incubation period and decreases at the time of sporulation; 8) changes in the percentage composition of the pool of the protein amino acids are modest and without a well-defined trend. However indications are that some action of the pathogens on protein metabolism seems to involve also areas located at a distance from the invaded zone. These results are generally in agreement with those obtained in  Red Haven  Peach (Raggi, 1966), under the same conditions with only a three-day difference in time of sampling. The response of the Olive (Olea europaea L.) cultivars Nocellara del Belice, Leccino and Coratina to Pseudomonas syringae pv. savastanoi (Smith) Young et al., was studied by inserting a droplet (2,5 l) of a bacterial suspension containing 10, 10, 10, 10, 10, 10 or 10 viable bacteria/ml into slits through the bark of the stem. The results confirm the different reactivity of the three Olive cultivars ('Nocellara del Belice' is more reactive than 'Leccino' and, especially, than 'Coratina') and indicate that the response time decreases with the increasing of dose of inoculum and that the minimal effective dose is less than 2,5 viable bacteria per inoculation site. It seems that these results may be explained according to the hypothesis of independent action, if its validity for this host-pathogen system will be verified. The weight of knots, formed 135 days after the inoculation, significatively varied with the cultivar, but not with the dose of inoculum.
42684040|The three cultivars of Cucumber ' Beit Alpha mosaic resistant ', ' Beit Alpha F hybrid mosaic resistant ', and ' CMV resistant 268 ' were resistant to the predominant Cucumber mosaic virus (CMV) strain in the Beqa'a plain of Lebanon. Both yield and fruit quality compared very favorably with those of susceptible Cucumber cultivars in the absence of CMV. We highly recommend these resistant (CMV-R) Cucumber cultivars for cultivation under conditions similar to those in the Beqa'a plain. The three CMV-R cultivars also had a high degree of tolerance to a hitherto unidentified virus, which caused a mosaic similar to CMV on the leaves but not on the fruits. Considerando l'inomogeneit di questo gruppo del MMV che comprende anche ceppi del mosaico del Cocomero di Anderson (virus di forma allungata) e la forma sferica delle particelle del nostro virus, esso ci sembra pi accostabile alio SMV; non possiamo per escludere si tratti di un'entit infettiva non ancora segnalata dalla letteratura sulle Cucurbitacee. A virus causing distortion and mosaic on plants of Cucurbita pepo L. cultivated in the Emilia district has been studied in its symptomatological behaviour on 22 differential hosts. It has resulted to be easily transmissible through mechanical inoculation to most plants belonging to the family of the Cucurbitaceae; on the other hand, the plants belonging to other families have mostly resulted to be uninfectable. For the virus concerned the following physical properties have been established:  thermal inactivation point: 50-55C;  diluition end point: 10-2.10;  longevity in vitro: 3 to 5 days;  electron-microscope observation: no elongated particles. Furthermore, all seed -transmission tests made with the virus have given negative results. An extensive collection of bibliographical references has also been made, in order to compare the properties of the virus concerned with those of all viruses previously recorded for Cucurbitaceae. From this comparison our virus has emerged to be very similar to the groups of the Squash mosaic virus and of the Melon mosaic virus mentioned by Lindberd et al. and by Cohen and Nitzany, although differing from both of them in its capacity of infecting Gomphrena globosa L. Taking into account the non-homogeneity of the group of Melon mosaic virus, which also includes strains of Watermelon mosaic virus (elongated particles), and the spherical form of this particles, our virus appears to be very similar to the Squash mosaic virus, although the possibility exists that it has not yet been mentioned in the literature on Cucurbitaceae. On a tudi, dans son comportement symptomatologique sur 22 htes diffrentiels, un virus qui produisait la mosaque et des malformations sur des plantes de Cucrbita pepo L., cultives dans la rgion milienne. On a constat qu'il se transmet facilement par inoculation mcanique  la plupart des plantes de la famille des Cucurbitaceae; au contraire les plantes appartenant  d'autres familles sont pour la plupart difficiles  infecter. Pour cette entit infectieuse on a tabli les caractristiques physiques suivantes:  temprature d'inactivation: 50-55C;  point limite de dilution: 10-2.10;  dure de conservation in vitro: 3-5 jours;  observations au microscope lectronique: pas de particules allonges. En outre, tous les essais de transmission du virus par la graine ont atteint des rsultats ngatifs. On a aussi recueilli un gran nombre de rfrences bibliographiques aufin de comparer les caractristiquesSiu virus en question avec ces des entits infectieuses qu'on a retrouves jusqu'ici sur les Cucurbitaceae. De cette comparaison on a pu constater que ce virus ressemble plutt aux groupes des virus de la mosaque de la Courge et de la mosaque du Melon, mentionns par Lindberg et al. et par Cohen et Nitzany; pourtant il se diffrencie de tous les deux par sa capacit d'infecter la Gomphrena globosa. Compte tenu de la non-homognit du groupe de la mosaque du Melon, qui comprend aussi des souches de la mosaque du Melon d'eau (virus de forme allonge), et de la forme spherique des particules de notre virus, celui-ci semble s'approcher plutt du virus de la mosaque de la Courge; toutefois il existe la possibilit qu'il s'agit d'une entit infectieuse non encore mentionne dans la littrature des Cucurbitaceae.

42685275|To export citrus fruit to the European Union, extra-European countries must guarantee the absence of xanthomonads pathogenic to Citrus, including groups A, B, C, D and E of Xanthomonas campestris pv. citri. The occurrence of lots of imported fruit with bacterial spot or epiphytic bacteria raises the problem of detecting X.c. pv. citri and identifying the isolates. PCR, according to a modified protocol of Hartung et al., and total protein gel electrophoresis was applied to cultures of groups A, B, C, D and E of X.c. pv. citri and other X. campestris pathovars as well as a collection of pathogenic and unidentified Citrus-associated bacteria. PCR was also applied to extracts of leaf spots and fresh isolates. The protein-electrophoregrams for X.c. pv. citri indicated the presence of a single cluster (correlation index 0.79) including all the groups except for a culture labelled as X.c. pv. citrumelo (group E). PCR was highly specific for group A, although 3 out of 12 cultures of this group did not give the typical amplification band. PCR applied to extracts of spots from naturally infected material also made it possible to detect the presence of X.c. pv. citri group A. Visual inspection and protein-electrophoregrams allowed the strains of X.c. pv. citri to be distinguished from the other bacteria associated with Citrus, but did not differentiate between the infra-subspecific groups. PCR was a rapid method for identifying group A strains, but was insufficient for detecting X.c. pv. citri associated with spots due to the risk of false negative reactions and its group A specificity.

Four GCMV isolates were obtained by mechanical transmission to herbaceous hosts using the upper leaves of four different field-grown vines originating from three traditional Hungarian grapevine-growing regions. The symptoms induced by the four virus isolates in the test plants were similar. In gel double diffusion tests the antigens of the four isolates reacted with the GCMV BYM-50 antiserum as the homologous antigen. Grapevine leaves for ELISA tests were collected from diseased grapevines at three different heights and five different times during the vegetative period. GCMV BYM-50 antiserum (titre 1:512) conjugated with horse radish peroxidase (HRPO) was used. One gram leaf tissue was homogenized in a mortar in PBS-Tween (1:10 w/v) containing 2% PVP (m.w. 24,000). Nicotine (1%) was added just before use and the pH was adjusted to 8.2. Leaf extracts were diluted 1:10 and 1:30. The detection of GCMV was successful and the absorbance values at 492 nm showed that the virus concentration was high in May and June but in July it decreased in some cases below the threshold of detection, possibly because of the high temperature and the persistent drought. In August and September the virus concentration increased again. In the critical summer periods leaf extract dilutions 1:10 were more reliable. In the majority of cases the virus concentration was higher in the upper leaves. Under Hungarian climatic conditions the use of ELISA for the detection of GCMV in field-grown vines is recommended. Tests, however, should be carried out in May-June. Il virus del mosaico giallo cromo della vite (GCMV)  stato originariamente isolate da viti ungheresi. 42684292|La scarsit di acqua dal momento della fioritura del primo grappolo al momento del raccolto determina nei Pomodoro ' San Marzano ' la massima percentuale di frutti con marciume apicale. Se l'acqua manca precedentemente o successivamente il fenmeno non appare o  notevolmente ridotto. Contrariamente a quanto altri hanno osservato sperimentando con soluzioni nutritive, nelle prove in campo da noi condotte non  risultato che la Ca-carenza abbia un'importanza di rilievo nei determinare il fenmeno. Sembra invece che la carenza idrica durante il periodo suddetto induca l'alterazione di alcune reazioni metaboliche fondamentali, allontanandole pi o meno nettamente dalla norma. Vediamo quelle alterazioni che abbiamo potuto finora determinare. (1) La traspirazione viene ridotta a livelli che non possono pi garantir alcun benfico abbassamento trmico dei tessuti durante la stagione calda. (2) La respirazione e la fotosintesi risultano diminuite entrambi, ma il loro equilibrio viene rotto, perch la fotosintesi subisce una diminuzione assai pi forte che la respirazione, determinando fra le due funzioni quello squilibrio, gi tante volte osservato nelle malattie parassitarie tra reazioni di sintesi e reazioni di demolizione. (3) Alcuni enzimi ossidanti (perossidasi, catecolo ossidasi, malico-deidrogenasi) vengono notevolmente stimolati non solo nei frutti malati, ma anche, seppure meno intensamente, nei frutti che non presentano alcun sintomo di marciume prelevati dalle piante trattate (tesi 2). Anche questi dati dimostrano una forte tendenza al prevalere, ben oltre la norma, dei processi demolitivi. Infatti le piante hanno un accrescimento stentato e producono 1/5-1/6 del normale. (4) I fenoli crescono moho nella parte marcia del frutto, mentre diminuiscono nella parte ancora verde. (5) Gli enzimi che sono all'origine della formazione e del metabolismo dei fenoli, SDH e PAL, sembrano perdere il loro potere di autoregolazione; nella pianta normale, la fenilalanina prodotta dal SDH viene subito trasformata in gran parte dalla PAL in acido trans-cinnamico, da cui prende ayvio la sintesi dei fenoli. E' un equilibrio che viene garantito, nelle piante normali, da un delicato meccanismo di autoregolazione. Perch l'equilibrio dell'attivit dei due enzimi rimanga fisiolgico  necessario che entrambi gli enzimi siano stimolati nella stessa misura e nei giusti tempi; se uno dei due viene stimolato pi dell'altro, o fuori tempo, l'equilibrio fra i prodotti si sposta, portando disturbi pi o meno gravi anche nei metabolismo successivo, che dipende strettamente da questa prima fase. (6) E' COS che tutta la fenilalanina che si forma dalla stimolata attivit della SDH non trova assorbimento da parte della PAL, che  meno stimolata della SDH, per cui una certa quantit di fenilalanina, superiore alia norma e quindi antifisiologica, si accumula e viene poi in buona parte tolta dal mezzo fissandola nelle protine, che ne contengono infatti dosi nettamente superiori al normale. (7) Anche altri amminoacidi subiscono notevoli alterazioni nei loro rapporti quantitative fra i liberi la glutammina diminuisce insieme a tirosina, lisina, arginina mentre aumentano, oltre alia fenilalanina, la prolina e la valina; fra i proteici si ha aumento di fenilalanina, metionina, isoleucina, leucina, arginina; diminuzione di serina e prolina, per cui molti degli equilibri quantitativi fra amminoacidi, sia liberi che proteici, subiscono alterazioni consistenti, di cui non possiamo finora precisare la portata, ma che con ogni probabilit hanno il loro peso nei determinare il marciume della parte apicale del frutto, che sembra essere la pi esposta e la pi sensibile della pianta. Nelle foglie si osservano, meno accentuati, gli stessi fenomeni visti nei frutti acerbi. Nei frutti maturi, invece, tali fenomeni tendono ad attenuarsi fino a scomparire. Abbiamo inteso esporre i risultati di una sperimentazione che dura ormai da sei anni, pur essendo tuttora aperta, corredandola di una interpretazione dei risultati forse un po' audace, ma stimolante, pensiamo, ad ulteriori ricerche che dovranno stabilire quali parti debbano restare e svilupparsi e quali cadere. The water deficency from the moment of flowering of the first inflorescence to the moment of harvest determines in ' San Marzano ' Tomato plants the highest percentage of fruits with end rot. If there is a previous or subsequent lack of water the phenomenon either does not appear or is notably reduced. Contrary to other experiments with nutritive solutions, in the field tests we carried out the Cadeficency did not result as being very important in determining the phenomenon. On the other hand, it would seem that the water shortage during the above mentioned period leads to the alteration of some fundamental metabolic reactions changing them more or less distinctly. These are the alterations that we have been able to determine to date. (1) Transpiration is reduced to levels that can no longer guarentee any beneficial thermic drop in the tissues during the hot season. (2) Respiration and photosynthesis both diminished but photosynthesis underwent a much stronger decrease than respiration with a consequent breakage of the balance between the two activities, causing a phenomenon similar to that observed in parasitic diseases. (3) Some oxidative enzymes (peroxidases, catechol oxidases, malic dehydrogenases) are notably stimulated not only in the diseased fruits but also, even if less intensively, in the fruits collected from the treated plants (treatment 2) but without symptoms of end rot. This data also shows that the breakdown processes have a strong tendency to prevail. In fact the plants have a stunted growth and produce 1/5 - 1/6 of normal. (4) The phenols increase considerably in the rotten part of the fruit, while they diminish in the still green part. (5) The enzymes which are involved in the synthesis and metabolism of the phenols, SDH and PAL, seem to loose their self-regulation power: in the normal plant the phenylalanine produced by SDH is transformed for the most part by PAL into cinnamic acid giving way to the synthesis of the phenols. It is a delicate balance which in normal plants is guaranteed by a delicate mechanism of self-regulation. In order to keep a physiologic balance of the two activities, it is necessary for both the enzymes to be stimulated to the same extend and at the right times; if one of the two is stimulated more than the other, or at the wrong time, the balance between the products changes creating more or less serious disorders even in the subsequent metabolic reactions which are closely dependant on this first phase. (6) Thus all the phenylalanine formed by the stimulated activity of SDH is not absorbed by PAL that is less stimulated than SDH. In this way a quantity of phenylalanine, above norm and therefore antiphysiologic, accumulates and is then mostly removed from the medium fixing it in the proteins which in fact contain doses distinctly superior to the norm. (7) Other amino acids also undergo notable changes in their quantitative ratios: among the free amino acids glutamine decreases together with tyrosine, lysine, arginine while phenylalanine, proline ad valine increase among the protein amino acids there is an increase in phenylalanine, methionine, isoleucine, ieucine, arginine, and a decrease in serine and proline. Therefore many of the quantitative balances between the amino acids, both free and proteic, undergo considerable alterations, whose level we cannot yet express, but that probabily contribute in determining the rot of the end part of the fruit which seems to be the most esposed and sensitive part of the plant. In the leaves we observed the same but less acentuated phenomenon seen in the green fruits. In the ripe fruits on the other hand, such phenomena tend to attenuate until they disappear. We wanted to show the results of a research that we have been carryng out for 6 years now, accompanying it with an interpretation of the results which is rather daring perhaps, considering the reserved habits of the experimenters, but in our opinion stimulating for other researches aimed at establishing which parts must remain and be developed and which are to fall. 42685689|Botrytis cinerea Pers. causes spreading lesions on leaves and epicormic shoots of Rosa hybrida plants, whereas restricted lesions or spreading necrosis are formed on rose petals, depending on incubation conditions. One hundred conidia per ml with no added sugar of phosphate and four hours of wetness over the petals were sufficed to develop infection. Relative humidity above 80% was required, and significant disease developed at temperature range of 10-30 C. The infecting hyphae on rose petals were thin (~3 m diam). Penetration occured in between cells of the host or from branched appresoria attached to the cuticle. Depressed localized lesions with collapsed host cells are formed in response to attack, but only few hyphae could be seen in these restricted lesions and no secondary growth of the pathogen originated from the infected tissue. Leaves were infected mainly through stomata, but penetration of the cuticle also occurred in leaf surface wrinkles. The epicormic shoot was infected by penetration through the cuticle. Lysis of host tissue occured around the penetration site and the penetrating hyphae showed typical swellings of irregular shape. Emergence of hyphae from infected tissue occurred through natural openings. 42685233|Five isolates of olive latent virus 1 (OLV-1) from different geographical origins (Italy, Jordan and Turkey) and hosts (olive and citrus) were comparatively studied with one another and with the A and D serotypes of tobacco necrosis necrovirus (TNV-A and TNV-D). OLV-1 isolates had the same biological behaviour (reaction of herbaceous hosts), physico-chemical and serological properties, so as to be indistinguishable from one another. They also shared major physico-chemical properties, such as size of genomic RNA, number and size of subgenomic and dsRNAs, mol. wt of coat protein subunits (though with a minor difference) with TNV serotypes, but differed from them serologically. Immunodiffusion tests and ELISA revealed a very distant serological relationship and none of 40 hybridoma lines secreting OLV-1-specific monoclonal antibodies recognized either TNV-A or TNV-D. The present results confirm the necrovirus nature of OLV-1 and the fact that it represents a novel species in the Necrovirus genus.
42683966|From 1962 to 1967 a research sponsored by the Crops Research Division, Agricultural Research Service, U. S. Department of Agriculture, and supported by P.L. 480 funds, was carried out at the Plant Breeding Department of the University of Perugia, Italia, to test Alfalfa varieties for resistance to Verticillium wilt. The research concerned first the development of suitable methods for artificially infecting Alfalfa with V. albo-atrum Reinke et Berth, and V. dahliae Kleb., and for scoring the infected materials for resistance. The best method for artificial infection of the seedlings was that of dipping the roots in a spore suspension obtained from culture grown on corn kernels. A spore suspension spraying on the crowns was the best method for infecting established plants in the field. Rating plants for resistance was done first by conventional methods of scoring for degree of wilting, but this was found not to be a reliable criterion under the climatic conditions of Central Italy. Better information was obtained by rating the extent of discoloration in roots. The study also showed that only V. dahliae and strains of V. albo-atrum isolated from Alfalfa could infect Alfalfa. None of the Alfalfa lines tested was highly resistant but some plants were found which appeared to have a low level of resistance. They were, in decreasing order, Rhopalosiphum padi, Sitobion avenae, Rhopalosiphum maidis and, only in 1983, Schizaphis graminum. 42685397|A global collection of 43 chickpea (Cicer arietinum L.) genotypes, resistant and susceptible to Ascochyta blight caused by Ascochyta rabiei was evaluated for the disease under controlled conditions. In this study three known pathotypes (P-I, P-II, and P-III) were used to evaluate the reactions of this collection. The chickpea genotypes were also characterized using 14 microsatellite markers flanking the genomic regions associated with Ascochyta blight resistance quantitative trait loci (QTLs). Phenotyping results indicated that 27 genotypes were resistant to P-I, 14 to P-II, and five to P-III, revealing the possible erosion of resistance through the evolution of virulent pathogen pathotypes. The genetic diversity analysis revealed 67 aleles at 14 microsatellite loci with an average of 4.8 alleles per locus among the genotypes tested. Genetic similarity estimates differentiated four subclusters (A, B, C, and D) of the genotypes. However, none of sub-clusters were separated into resistant genotypes for a specific pathotype. The genetic diversity ranged from 0.48 to 0.80 which indicated that there is considerable variation in QTL regions associated with Ascochyta blight resistance among the collections of chickpea genotypes studied, as assessed using the hyper-variable microsatellite markers.
42683905|Sevin insecticides showed appreciable effect in decreasing the incidence of Alternaria leaf spot disease on Cotton plants when applied as a foliar spray at the rate of 0,7 % of the wettable powder formulation. Alternaria tenuis, the causal agent of Alternaria leaf spot disease of Cotton, as well as Rhizoctonia solani, the causal agent of Cotton soreshin, and Stemphylium sp. isolated from spotted Mango leaves, were found sensitive to Sevin concentration as low as 0,25 % when incorporated in PDA medium. The boll rotting fungi, Rhizopus nigricans and Aspergillus niger were highly resistant to Sevin. Since boll infections by these two fungi usually follow boll worm infestations, the damage they may cause could be indirectly lessened by controlling boll worm infestation through Sevin application at the rate of 0,7 %. Piricularia oryzae, the causal agent of Rice blast disease, which was found moderately reistant to Sevin, could breakdown Sevin in culture. The limited resistance of this fungus to Sevin could not be attributed to its ability to break down this insecticide, since the end product (s) of such breakdown seemed to be more toxic to the fungus than Sevin itself. The nature of growth inhibitory action of Sevin to sensitive fungi was proved fungistatic. Concentrations of Sevin required to prevent spore germination of sensitive fungi were higher than that required for checking linear growth of the same fungi, and within the limits recommended for excellent insecticidal effect. Results included in this study indicate that the fungistatic effects of Sevin are to an extent comparable to those of the widely used fungicide  Dithane Z-78 . However, Sevin is less effective in this respect than  Dithane M-22  and  Dithane M-45 . 43871742|Leaf blight and defoliation caused by Teratosphaeria species is one of the most important leaf diseases of Eucalyptus globulus. Due to the importance of this tree species for the production of pulp and paper, and recent reports of severe leaf disease symptoms in Brazil, the present study was conducted to identify the pathogen(s) involved. Symptomatic leaves were collected in the Brazilian states of Paran and Rio Grande do Sul, single ascospore cultures established, and isolates were investigated using DNA-based molecular tools. A species-specific PCR and sequence data from the nuclear ribosomal DNA operon were used for species identification. The following seven species were identified: Mycosphaerella scytalidii, Dissoconium dekkeri (=M. lateralis), Teratosphaeria ohnowa, T. perpendicularis, T. pseudafricana, T. flexuosa and T. nubilosa. Of the recorded species, T. nubilosa is regarded most serious threat to the cultivation of E. globulus in the states surveyed.

42685773| nota la possibilit che Phoma tracheiphila (Petri) Kane, et Ghik., agente del mal secco degli agrumi, passi dalle foglie infette al ramo, rendendo sistemica l'infezione. Burm.). The ability of Phoma tracheiphila (Petri) Kane, et Ghik., the causal agent of citrus mal secco, to pass from infected leaves to the stem, thereby inducing systemic infection, is well known. Growth chamber trials have been carried out to investigate factors influencing the phenomenon. The tested temperatures were three (15,20 and 25C), the inoculated leaves were young (about one month old) and mature (about six months old) and the citrus hosts were Sour orange (Citrus aurantium L.) and 'Femminello' and 'Monachello' lemon (Citrus limon (L.) Burm.). Percentage of successful inoculations, number of inoculated fallen leaves, falling time of 50% of the inoculated leaves and percentage of leaves from which the pathogen passed into the stem were recorded during the trial. The results indicate that the passage of the fungus from leaves to stem occurred most frequently at 15C, the lowest temperature tested. Similar high frequence transfer of P. tracheiphila from leaves to stem was recorded in the highly suscettible 'Femminello' lemon and whenever leaves were young.
42685631| stata esaminata, mediante osservazioni al microscopio ottico ed elettronico in trasmissione, la condizione nucleare del tallo di Phoma tracheiphila (Petri) Kanc. et Ghick., l'agente del mal secco degli agrumi. Nel micelio di questo fungo vi sono sia cellule mono-che plurinucleate. Le ife giovani e le cellule apicali delle ife sono, in genere, plurinucleate, mentre le cellule conidiogene del pienidio e le fialidi sono, nella maggioranza dei casi, mononucleate. La presenza di due nuclei in alcune fialidi sembrerebbe associata alla conidiogenesi. I pienoconidi e i fialoconidi sono in prevalenza mono-nucleati; sono stati osservati, per, anche conidi con due o tre nuclei. Nelle colture su vetrino e nelle colonie sviluppatesi su substrato agarizzato si osservano anastomosi tra elementi ifali e conseguente migrazione di nuclei. Sono anche abbastanza frequenti le anastomosi tra tubuli germinativi dei conidi. La condizione nucleare del tallo di P. tracheiphila fa ritenere probabile che nel fungo del mal secco esistano i meccanismi che consentono la formazione, la perpetuazione o il ripristino dell'eterocariosi; quella delle cellule conidiogene del pienidio e delle fialidi fa ritenere probabile che le colture di origine monoconidica siano omocariotiche. Sembrerebbe quindi di poter escludere che la variabilit osservata in discendenze agamiche monocitogenetiche sia dovuta alla dissociazione di eterocariosi. The nuclear condition of Phoma tracheiphila (Petri) Kanc. et Ghick., the causal agent of Citrus mal secco disease, has been examined by light and transmission electron microscopy. The mycelial cells are either mono-or polynucleate. Usually, the young hyphal cells and the hyphal tips are polynucleate, whereas the conidiogenous cells of the pyenidium and the hyphal phyalides are mononucleate. The occasional occurrence of two nuclei in a single phyalide can be referred to conidiogenesis. Most pyenospores and phyaloconidia are mononucleate, although conidia bearing two or three nuclei have been observed. Anastomoses between hyphae or tubules of germinating conidia can be easily seen in cultures on microscope slides and in colonies grown on agar plates. The nuclear condition of P. tracheiphila indicates that this fungus has the mechanisms through which heterocaryosis can be established, perpetuated, and restored. On the other hand, the nuclear condition of both the pyenidial conidiogenous cells and the hyphal phyalides suggests that monocitogenetic cultures are homocaryotic. Consequently, the variability showed by monoconidial progenies is not likely related to segregation of heterocaryon.
42685269|In the Campania region (southern Italy), diseased grapevine plants showing typical symptoms of grapevine yellows such as leaf roll, veinal yellowing and necrosis, withering of flower clusters, incomplete lignification of shoots, and black pustules along the shoots, were examined for phytoplasma infection using polymerase chain reaction (PCR) technology. All affected plants examined tested positively. Using specific primers and restriction fragment length polymorphism analysis of PCR-amplified ribosomal DNA sequences, the detected organism was identified as a phytoplasma of the stolbur group. Comparisons of the restriction profiles obtained following digestion with AluI, RsaI, Sau3AI, Hhal, MseI, and TaqI, showed that phytoplasmas infecting grapevine in Campania are genetically uniform and similar to the phytoplasma causing Vergilbungskrankheit in Germany. Also, several other phytoplasmas, which were transmitted in the Emilia Romagna region by dodder from diseased grapevine to periwinkle or collected in a vineyard and were previously classified as members of aster yellows group, were identified as stolbur phytoplasma. This is the first report on the occurrence of phytoplasmas in diseased grapevine in Campania.

42685979|The effect of powdery mildew on squash yield was studied in the open field experiment. Total yield was negatively correlated with disease severity. The total yield dropped sharply at 45% disease severity and more. Disease severity was negatively correlated with air temperature and positively correlated with relative humidity. Air temperature had a great role in disease development and seems to be the limiting factor. The optimum disease severity was observed at 16C and 68% R.H.

42684490|Si riportano i risultati di un'indagin biennale sulla presenza e sulla diffusione dei pi comuni virus del Tabacco in alcune zone dell'Umbria. Occurrence and prevalence of the most common viruses of Tobacco have been investigated during two years in Umbria (Central Italy). The viruses have been isolated and identified by inoculation on test plants, serological assays and electron microscopy. TMV appears as one of the most important pathogens of Tobacco in the surveyed area, its incidence on the crop reaching sometimes values of 80% or more. PVY is also very frequent, especially as necrotic strains (PVY-N), which induce severe veinal necrosis on Tobacco. Mixed infections, e. g. attacks by TMV + PVY or PVY-N + CMV, have been commonly recorded; PVY-N + CMV infections, found mainly in 1977, were normally associated with very severe symptoms (growth reduction, epinasty, vein necrosis and vein etching, leaf rolling with faint vein mosaic and rugosity of the limb). In some cases TMV, PVY and CMV were recovered together from the same host plant. Especially in 1978, CMV attacks were less frequent than either TMV or PVY infections.

42685274|In greenhouse tests, onion plants cv Baia Periforme were inoculated with Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. cepae at transplanting, 25, 65 or 105 days after transplanting 60-days-old sets. Symptom evaluations were made on the 15th, 45th and 75th days after transplanting. Only plants inoculated at transplanting showed yellowing and stunting up to 45 days. Plants inoculated at later stages exhibited normal growth without any apparent disease symptoms of disease. However, the fungus was recovered from plants inoculated at all stages. When plants were inoculated at earlier growth stages, large amount of the fungus was recovered from both root and stem plate tissues of harvested bulbs. This coincided with the highest amount of basal rot of the bulbs in storage. Fresh-bulb weight was reduced at harvest and the development of disease symptoms occurred during the storage of bulbs. Implications of these results in the disease development and in plant protection are discussed.

Organismi micoplasma-simili erano presenti nel floema di piante di Giuggiolo con scopazzi.

42685386|Recently, it has been shown that the stem nematode, Ditylenchus dipsaci (Nematoda: Anguinidae), is genetically more related to the gall-forming nematodes from genera Anguina, Heteroanguina, and Mesoanguina than to other members of the genus Ditylenchus. This finding was provided by molecular data written in the evolutionary variable, non-coding internal transcribed spacers (ITS1 and ITS2) of the ribosomal DNA (rDNA). In the current paper, we analyze the nucleotide sequences and predict the secondary structures of two expansion segments (D2, D3) of the 28S ribosomal RNA (rRNA)-coding gene for the plant-parasitic nematodes from the genus Ditylenchus and their related anguinids. In general, the expansion segment D2 appeared to be more variable than the segment D3 illustrating their different evolutionary constraints. Comparative analysis of the aligned sequences and predicted secondary structures revealed similar trend showing the tight relationships between the stem nematodes (D. dipsaci, D. gigas, D. weischeri) and gall-forming nematodes from the subfamily Anguininae. Phylogeny reconstructions disjoined the family Anguinidae into two monophyletic clusters (Clade 1 and 2). Clade 1 constitutes the stem nematodes (D. dipsaci, D. gigas, etc) and gall-forming nematodes from the genera Anguina, Heteroanguina, Subanguina and Mesoanguina, while clade 2 includes other Ditylenchus species like D. destructor and D. halictus. Collectively, deciphering the exact phylogenetic relationships within the family Anguinidae (Nematoda: Tylenchida) with respect to our results should provide a framework for a taxonomic revision in order to reflect biological history of these nematodes. In addition, we provide novel molecular data, which may be exploited in diagnostic tools for phytosanitary control of these economically important plant parasites.

42685359|Survival of Botrytis fabae Sard, on crop debris in field soils between crop seasons was studied for three years at Holetta where there are two distinct rainy seasons a year. Mean recovery percentage of the fungus was 13.2% from samples stored above ground but only 1.9% when crop debris was buried in soil. These two values are significantly (P = 0.05) different when subjected to statistical analysis. B. fabae survived more than a year under Holetta conditions on the surface of the soil and died in four months when buried to 20 cm deep. The pathogen did not survive more than two years outdoors. Spores collected from stubble were infective when inoculated to a susceptible faba bean cultivar (Local-H). Spore survival was affected by temperature and moisture. Occurrence of other microorganisms such as Penicillium spp. and Rhizopus spp. had a negative correlation with the recovery percentage of B.fabae but the correlation with Fusarium spp. was positive. Soil type also affected the survival of this pathogen. B. fabae survived very well between crop seasons on faba bean debris as hyphae and/or sclerotia under Holetta conditions, and produced primary inoculum ready to infect new crops in March and July. Since B. fabae does not survive long in soils, deep plowing of the fields immediately after crop harvest is recommended to bury infected faba bean debris which otherwise can still furnish inocula to a new crop early in the next growing season.

43872356|Identification of species and virulence groups of potato cyst nematodes (PCN), Globodera pallida and G. rostochiensis, present in field populations is important in the control of these nematodes by means of resistant cultivars. In order to characterize the virulence of Globodera spp. isolates from Portugal, 43 G. rostochiensis and three G. pallida isolates were evaluated by measuring their multiplication rates on a susceptible potato cultivar and five differential potato genotypes in a growth chamber pot experiment. Principal Component Analysis and Hierarchical Cluster Analysis showed that the reproduction rates were different in terms of both the numbers of eggs and the numbers of cysts produced. Portuguese isolates of PCN were more virulent on genotypes derived from Solatium vernei than on genotypes derived from other Solatium resistance sources, and there was a significant nematode isolate  host genotype interaction. The virulence bioassay clearly distinguished the two PCN species but failed to differentiate isolates into pathotypes. There was a wide and continuous range of virulence to the resistant genotypes, especially in G. rostochiensis isolates.
43871733|A disease of pea characterized by browning in veins, leaves and stems, mostly in growing tips, and brown circular spots on pods, was recorded in four districts of Uttar Pradesh, India. The causal agent of this disease was detected by reverse transcription-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) using primers pair HRP 26/HRP 28 and identified as Groundnut bud necrosis virus (GBNV) on the basis of nucleocapsid protein (NP) gene sequence. Virus isolates from Bareilly (BRY), Kanpur (KNP), Udham Singh Nagar (USN) and Shahjahanpur (SJP) were designated as GBNV-[Pea_ BRY], GBNV-[Pea_ KNP], GBNV-[Pea_ USN] and GBNV-[Pea_ SJP] and their NP genes sequenced. The sequence data of each isolate were deposited at NCBI database (JF281101-JF281104). The complete nucleotide sequence of the NP genes of all the GBNV isolates had a single open reading frame of 831 nucleotides and 276 amino acids. The isolates had among them 2% variability at amino acid level and 2-3 variability at nucleotide level, but had variability with other GBNV isolates of fabaceous hosts in the range of 0-6% at amino acid level and 1-8% at nucleotide level. Though this variation in nucleotide sequences of GBNV isolates from fabaceous hosts is within the limits of species demarcation for tospoviruses, formation of a separate cluster within the GBNV isolates indicates the possibility of distinct variants in GBNV.
42684198|In lesioni locali su foglie di Chenopodium amaranticolor Coste et Reyn. inoculate con un virus isodiametrico isolato da radici di Fragola era presente, oltre a particelle virali complete, anche acido ribonucleico (RNA) libero infettivo, fino a 7 giorni dopo l'inoculo. Dischi prelevati dalle foglie infette sono stati immersi per 12 ore in luce continua in sospensione di actinomicina D (AMD) (50 g/ml) o puromicina (Pur) (100 g/ml) e macera ti parte in sospensione bentonitica (che preservava l'infettivit dovuta a virus pi quella dovuta ad RNA libero) e parte in tampone fosfato (che preservava solo l'infettivit dovuta a virus). Dairinoculazione di mezze foglie opposte di C. amaranticolor con i diversi preparati,  risultato che entrambi gli antimetaboliti determinavano un aumento di infettivit virale fino a 7 giorni dopo l'inoculo. Parallelamente la percentuale di RNA libero infettivo diminuiva nei tessuti trattati. Tale azione era esplicata pero dalla AMD fino a 7 giorni dall'inoculo, mentre la Pur agiva solo entro 3 giorni dall'inoculo. Pensiamo quindi che, almeno in parte, la presenza di RNA libero nelle cellule infette possa attribuirsi a meccanismi inibitori cellulari la cui insorgenza sarebbe impedita dai trattamenti con i due antimetaboliti. Tali meccanismi potrebbero ridurre sia la sintesi delle proteine virali che il fenomeno di maturazione. In local lesions on leaves of Chenopodium amaranticolor Coste et Reyn. infected by an isodiametric virus isolated from Strawberry roots, it has been found, besides complete virus particles, a free infective iribonucleic acid (RNA), up to 7 days after inoculation. To establish whether the presence of such RNA was in part due to some cellular mechanisms interfering with the viral replication, infected tissues were treated with antimetabolites at different times after inoculation. Disks sampled from infected leaves were floated for 12 hours under continuous light, either in actynomycin D (AMD) (50 g/ml) or Puromycin (Pur) (100 g/ml). Part of the disks were then ground in a bentonite suspension (which preserved both the infectivities due to the virus and to the free RNA), and part in phosphate buffer (which preserved only virus infectivity). By inoculating opposite half-leaves of C. amaranticolor with the different grindates, we were able to show that both the antimetabolites caused an increase of virus infectivity up to 7 days after the inoculation. At the same time the percentage of free infective RNA decreased in the treated tissues. Such effect was carried out by AMD up to 7 days after the inoculation while Pur acted for only 3 days. We think that the presence of free RNA in infected cells could be attributed, at least in part, to some cell inhibitory mechanisms, the arise of which would be prevented by the treatments with the 2 antimetabolites. Such mechanisms could reduce both the synthesis of virus protein and the maturation of virus particles. Des disques prlevs de feuilles infectes ont t plongs, pendant 12 heures en lumire continue, dans une suspension d'actynomicine D (AMD) (50 g/ml) ou puromicine (Pur) (100 g/ml). On a fait macrer une partie des disques dans une suspension de bentonite (qui prserve plus l'infectivit due  un virus que celle rsultant du RNA libre) et une partie en tampon phosphate (qui ne prserve que l'infectivit due au virus). En mme temps, le pourcentage de RNA libre infectieux diminuait dans les tissus traits. Toutefois, cette action tait dveloppe par l'ADM jusqu' 7 jours de l'inoculation, alors que la Pur n'agissait que jusqu' 3 jours de l'inoculation. On pense donc que la prsence de RNA libre, en partie au moins, dans les cellules infectes pourrait tre attribue  des mcanismes inhibiteurs cellulaires dont l'apparition semble tre empche par les traitements effectus avec les 2 antimetabolites. Ces mcanismes pourraient rduire aussi bien la synthse des protines virales que le phnomne de maturation.
42685590|In recent years, tobacco mosaic virus (TMV) has caused severe losses of yield in greenhouse pepper crops. Typical pepper strains of the virus, capable of overcoming the resistance of commercial varieties, have been described. In the present work we investigate a possible alternative to resistant varieties: i.e. cross protection. A nitrous acid-induced attenuated mutant (which is expected to have cross-protecting potential) was obtained from a TMV pepper strain overcoming all three resistance genes (L , L and L). The mutant, called M-1, induces very mild and tran`sient symptoms on pepper varieties. Its host range and its serological behaviour are identical to those of the parent strain. Recentemente il virus del mosaico del tabacco (TMV) ha causato gravi perdite di produzione nelle coltivazioni in serra di peperone. I ceppi del virus, appartenenti al patotipo peperone, sono in grado di superare la resistenza di cui  dotata la maggior parte dlie cultivars commerciali. Nel presente lavoro viene analizzata una possibile soluzione alternativa: la protezione crociata.  stato ottenuto un mutante attenuato da un ceppo di TMV peperone, usando acido nitroso. Il mutante denominato M-1, induce sintomi molto deboli sulle variet di peperone; il suo spettro patogenetico ed il suo comportamento sierologico sono identici a quelli del ceppo originario.
42685230|A review of the literature on oak decline in Europe makes it possible to draw a picture of the chronological and geographical progression of the decline in European countries. By 1989 oak decline had been reported in almost every country in Europe where oaks are found. This continent - wide spread of the phenomenon has led researchers to look for a single universal cause, whether biotic or abiotic, but such a cause has not been found. Reported data on fungi, bacteria, MLOs and viruses associated with oak decline were examined; only the fungi have been studied to a limited extent; little is known about the others. Research on oak decline in Europe is in need of a different approach. Individual declining stands should first be exhaustively studied in their own right, the focus should not be immediately on the decline. Only when the decline has thus been placed securely in its context in the individual stands can general conclusions be drawn at more comprehensive levels, first about one oak species in a given area, then about all oak species in that area, and so on, until the elements of oak decline overall may be expected to fall into place.

42685750|Dal 1985 al 1988, sono state compiute osservazioni epidemiologiche sulle principan" malattie fogliari del frumento duro in Puglia e Basilicata. L'oidio (Erysiphe graminis f. sp. tritici) e la ruggine bruna (Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici), sono stati presenti tutti gli anni, meggiormente nelle zone cerealicole dell'arco ionico; mentre l'Alternaria titicina  stata presente soprattutto nelle zone collinari interne come a Gravina (Bari). La ruggine gialla (P. striiformis f. sp. tritici)  stata sempre assente; mentre la ruggine nera (P. graminis f. sp. tritici)  stata presente quasi tutti gli anni ed in tutte le localit, ma solo in tracce. In questi anni sembra si sia avuto un progressivo aumento di virulenza tra le popolazioni di E. graminis, P. recondita e P. graminis. Infatti tutti i frumenti duri saggiati sono risultati suscettibili a detti patogeni. Solo 'Belvedere' ha mostrato di possedere una resistenza durevole verso la ruggine bruna. I dati ottenuti indicano che attualmente, qualora le condizioni climatiche e ambientali siano favorevoli, la cerealicultura italiana pu subire con facilita delle epidemie. Pertanto sarebbe opportuno esercitare una selezione stabilizzante sui suddetti patogeni e, qualora necessario, intervenire con la lotta chimica o integrata. Epidemiological observations were carried out on the most important leaf diseases of durum wheat in Apulia and Basilicata during 1985 to 1988. Powdery mildew (Erysiphe graminis f. sp. tritici) and brown rust (Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici) were present in all years much more so in the cereal areas on the Ionian coast while Alternaria triticina was present mostly in the hilly hinterland area of Gravina (province of Bari). Stripe rust (P. striiformis f. sp. tritici) was always absent, while stem rust (P. graminis f. sp. tritici) was present in traces almost each year and in all localities under investigation. The collected data showed a progressive increase of virulence in the population of E. graminis, P. recondita and P. graminis during these years. In fact, all the tested durum wheats were susceptible to those pathogens. Only 'Belvedere' showed a durable resistance to brown rust. These data indicate that if the climatic conditions are favourable, Italian cerealgrowing is exposed to a high risk of epidemics. Therefore it would be opportune to practise a stabilizing selection on the above mentioned pathogens and, if necessary, to carry out a chemical or integrated control.

42685266|A homothallic species of Phytophthora isolated from myrtle roots, originally classified as P. iranica, was re-examined and compared with an ex-type isolate of P. iranica and isolates of other homothallic species of Phytophthora, including P. cactorum, P. citricola, P. idaei and P. pseudotsugae. Other species of Phytophthora, such as P. cinnamomi, P. cryptogea, P. drechsleri, P. erythroseptica and P. palmivora, were included in this study as well. The isolates from myrtle produced non-deciduous, markedly papillate sporangia and sexual structures in single culture on agar-media. The antheridia were paragynous and averaged about 7 mm in diameter (range 5-11 mm); the oogonia ranged between 14 and 30 mm in diameter; the oospores, markedly aplerotic, ranged between 11 and 25 mm in diameter, with modal values of 19 and 21 mm on V-8 juice agar and cornmeal agar, respectively. The optimum growth temperature on potato-dextrose agar was 26C. Both the total protein and esterase electrophoretic patterns of the isolates from myrtle were considerably different from the patterns of the other species of Phytophthora examined, indicating a high level of genetic divergence. The isolates from myrtle could not be referred to any of the species of Phytophthora so far described and, because of their peculiar characters, were described here as a new species, P. italica, which can be included in Waterhouse's taxonomic group I.

42683964|Fifteen isolates of Agrobacterium tumefaciens (Smith et Townsend) Conn were obtained from several fruit and ornamental plants, collected from various localities of the Northern region of the Nile Delta. The natural occurrence of the disease on Rose (Rosa sp.), Apricot (Pru nus armeniaca L.), Olive (Olea europaea L.) and Pelargonium (Pelargonium zonale L.) is recorded for the first time in Egypt. Moreover, Roselle (Hibiscus sabdariffa L.), Chinese Date (Zyzphus jujuba Mill.) and Poinciana (Pqinciana regia Boi.) are listed as new host plants of the crown gall pathogen. While all the isolates were similar morphologically and physiologically, and could initiate the production of tumorous tissues on carrot slices, they were classified into two serologically different groups, one consisting of eight isolates, and the other of the remaining seven. Inoculation experiments using eight differential hosts revealed that only the serolosically related isolates were pathologically identical as they infected similar hosts with similar virulence. The serologically unrelated isolates, on the other hand, varied in their pathogenicity, for they showed different host ranges. The serological tests performed for studying the possible reaction between antigens from susceptible or resistant hosts and an antiserum for one of the eieht patholoeicallv and serologically identical isolates, revealed the presence of host plant antigens common to those of A. tumefaciens in both the susceptible and the resistant host plants. Only ten out of the fifteen isolates of A. tumefaciens developed red colonies when grown on Congo red medium, while the other five gave colorless ones. The red isolates dissociated into colonies of both types, while the colorless isolates consistently developed colorless colonies. The ability of Congo red absorption could not, therefore, be considered as a differential tech niaue in case of A. tumeiaciens. Serological reaction and Congo red absorption appeared to be strain related and also bare some connection with virulence and specificity to host plants. 42684596|Nel triennio 1979-81 nelle regioni dell'Italia meridionale, ove maggiormente si  operato, sono state isolate 21 razze fisiologiche di Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici, alcune delle quali, come le razze 13, 31, 99 e 128, risultano nuove per l'Italia. Mentre la frequenza della razza 77  apparsa in graduale diminuzione, la razza 21  stata trovata in percentuale sempre maggiore. Con l'impiego di 8 frumenti addizionali si  messa in evidenza la presenza di diversi  biotipi  in seno alle razze 21, 31, 57, 77, 130 e 220. Saggiando alcune linee quasi-isogeniche, verso tutti gli isolati, ottimo comportamento hanno mostrato i geni Lr 9 ('Transfer'), Lr 19 ('Agatha') e Lr 24 ('Agent W 3564'). Twenty one physiological races have been identified from 392 isolates of Puccinia recondita f. sp. tritici, collected in Italy (mostly in Southern areas) during three years (1979-81). The races 13, 31, 99 and 128 were isolated for the first time in Italy. The races 21, 77, 130 and 220 showed the highest frequency. The occurrence of race 77 was gradually reduced during the 3 years, while race 21 was increasing. Using 8 additional differential varieties, the presence of several biotypes of races 21, 31, 57, 77, 130 and 220 was shown. By testing some near-isogenic lines towards all isolates, the resistance genes Lr 9 ('Transfer'), Lr 19 ('Agatha') and Lr 24 ('Agent W 3564') showed high efficiency. The resistance gene Lr 1 ('Malakof' and 'Centenario') confirmed its low efficiency already showed in the past years.

42685897|Trials on chemical control of fire blight on pears were carried out under natural and experimental conditions during the years 1990-1991. Pear trees of the cultivar Santa Maria, in palmette, were sprayed three times during bloom and four times post-bloom in 1990 and 1991. The chemicals streptomycin and flumequine gave the best results, followed by phosetyl-al in 1990. There were no disease symptoms in the orchard in 1991. In the trials with experimental inoculations, the flowers of adult trees at 80% bloom in two pear orchards (cv.Krystalli and Santa Maria) were sprayed with different chemicals 24 h before (as preventive) or 24 h after (as curative) inoculation with a water suspension of Erwinia amylovora. The chemicals SO208 (oxolinic acid), flumequine and streptomycin gave very good results. The copper compounds gave some protection compared with the control only at the higher dose of 1000 ppm in some experiments. The chemicals, phosetyl-al, hexachlorophen and quazative triacetate were ineffective.
