42685363|One hundred and eighty-one chestnut stands were examined for blight presence in various regions of Turkey and different levels of blight damage were observed. Turkish strains of Cryphonectria parasitica (265) were obtained and their morphology characterised in agar culture to detect the presence of hypovirulent strains. The vegetative compatibility (v-c) of the Turkish isolates was examined in the laboratory by pairing with common Italian and European testers of the parasite. The presence of European v-c groups was recorded. Four isolates of C. parastica collected in two different chestnut stands in the eastern Black Sea region of Turkey had colony morphology and consistently possessed dsRNA. Artificial inoculation tests showed that these isolates only produced cankers of intermediate severity. Further investigations into chestnut blight in the eastern Black Sea region of Turkey are desirable, with particular reference to the natural spread of hypovirulence to other regions of the country.
42685678|A backcross program was carried out to obtain new tomato genotypes resistant to bacterial speck caused by Pseudomonas syringae pv. tomato and suitable for mechanical harvesting. The Canadian variety  Ontario 7710 , carrying the resistance gene Pto, and some susceptible California cultivars ( UC 82 B ,  UC 90 ,  UC 134 ,  UC 105 J ) were used as donor and recurrent parents respectively. Six F4BC3 selected lines deriving form  UC 82 B , three from  UC 90 , two from  UC 134  and one from  UC 105 J , together with the recurrent and the donor parents, were field tested at Cadriano (Bologna). Rows of  UC 82 B  plants (diffusors), experimentally contaminated with a mixture of four local P. syringae pv. tomato strains before transplanting, were used to assure diffuse bacterial infection. The California varieties confirmed their high susceptibility to bacterial speck in the leaves, and to a lesser extent in the fruits, whereas all the backcross lines showed a resistance level higher than the recurrent parents and similar to that of  Ontario 7710 . These backcross lines also exhibited satisfactory agronomic traits: in the case of an intense attack, the marketable yield of nine of these was higher than that of the recurrent susceptible varieties and also than that of the resistant parent. A negative correlation was observed between the marketable yield and the degree of leaf infection. Al fine di ottenere nuovi genotipi resistenti a Pseudomonas syringae pv. tomato ed idonei alia raccolta meccanica,  stato awiato un programma di reincrocio per trasferire il gene di resistenza Pto dalla variet canadese  Ontario 7710  in alcune delle piu diffuse variet di origine californiana ( UC 82 B ,  UC 90 ,  UC 134 ,  UC 105 J ) . Sei linee selezionate FBC derivanti da  UC 82 B , tre derivanti da  UC 90  due da  UC 134  ed una da  UC 105 J , unitamente ai parentali ricorrenti ed al donatore, sono state valutate, nel 1987, in condizioni di inoculo sperimentale a Cadriano (Bologna). Una sufficiente ed uniforme diffusione del patogeno  stata garantita dall'impiego di piante  UC 82 B  (diffusori) contaminate con una miscela di 4 ceppi locali di P. syringae pv. tomato prima del trapianto. Le variet ricorrenti hanno confermato un elevato grado di suscettibilit al patgeno sia delle foglie che, anche se in minor grado, dei frutti. Tutte le progenie derivanti da reincrocio hanno evidenziato un elevato grado di resistenza, anlogo a quello di  Ontario 7710  ed hanno inoltre fomito prestazioni agronomiche soddisfacenti. In condizioni di elevata intensit di attacco, infatti, la produzione commerciale di nove di esse  risultata significativamente superiore a quella delle variet californiane suscettibili ed a quella del genitore resistente. L'analisi delle correlazioni ha messo in evidenza una associazione significativa e negativa fra resa e grado di infezione fogliare.
43871732|Full-length cDNA clones of an Olive mild mosaic virus (OMMV) isolate were constructed in order to find infectious cDNA clones. The sequencing of three individual full-length clones revealed some differences between them. In vitro transcription of these clones was performed and the effect of spontaneous mutations in the biological behaviour of the in vitro transcripts was evaluated by symptomatology, RNA accumulation and virus replication in inoculated plants. In vitro synthesized RNA from one of these clones was found to mimic the wild-type OMMV, making it useful in future studies on protein structure and function by site directed mutagenesis of individual genes. This is the first report on constructing full-length cDNA clones of OMMV from which infectious RNAs can be transcribed in vitro.
42685838|In june 1990, young Scaphoideus titanus Ball, captured in vineyards of the Friuli-Venezia Giulia (F-VG) Region were placed on potted grapevines of three different varieties, i.e. Chardonnay, Gray Pinot and Perera, grown in a screenhouse and which had shown clear symptoms of yellows (GYD) in the previous years and were exhibiting incipient symptoms on the new growth. After 35 days the three groups of leafhoppers, collected from the three sources of inoculum, were transferred for the transmission phase, to separate outdoor cages, each containing three healthy grapevines of the two indicators, Chardonnay and Perera. After an additional 40 days the 128 surviving S. titanus were placed in a new cage containing one Chardonnay grapevine and three young periwinkle (Catharanthus roseus L.) plants. Fifteen days later the 38 surviving leafhoppers were collected and used for the serological and Western-blot tests with the antibodies obtained from a French isolate of flavescence dore (FD 70). In the ELISA assays (indirect double sandwich technique) 11 out of the 38 S. titanus adults of Udine, individually tested, reacted unambiguously with the polyclonal antiserum against the mycoplasma (MLO) isolate FD 70, proving the presence in the leafhopper extracts of antigens closely related to those of the French isolate. The Western-blot patterns of antigens, detected with rabbit anti FD 70 MLO antibodies, in the extracts of FD 70 and FD 88-infected leafhoppers were characteristic; in contrast the ELISA positive leafhoppers from Udine exibited a mixed pattern of the two French MLO reference isolates. The number and intensity of the bands detctable in each individual extract depended on the level of the corresponding ELISA response, which in turn was related to the level of infection of the leafhopper. The data acquired indicate a relationship between FO-sensu stricto and the form of GYD present in the F-VG Region. On the other hand although 29% of the S. titanus surviving the transmission trials reacted positively to the serological assays, only one out of the 19 indicator grapevines showed GYD symptoms in 1991, and none of the 81 grapevines used in the transmission trials carried out during the previous three years reacted positively. In spite of the fact that S. titanus captured in GYD affected vineyards and forced on grapevines showing the typical symptoms of the disease contain a MLO closely related to the FD agent, the question remains if this species of leafhopper can be the main vector of the agent of GYD. Dopo 40 giorni di inoculazione i 128 individui sopravvissuti vennero introdotti in una nuova gabbia, contenente una vite Chardonnay e tre piante di vinca (Catharanthus raseus L.). Dopo ulteriori 15 giorni i 38 adulti superstiti vennero utilizzati per le prove condotte con l'antisiero ottenuto da un isolato francese di flavescenza dorata (FD). Malgrado si sia dimostrato che S. titanus catturati in vigneti affetti da GYD e confinati successivamente su viti con sintomi tipici della malattia ospitino un MLO strettamente correlato con l'agente di FD, non sembra che tale specie di cicalina sia il principale vettore dell'agente di tale malattia nella regione F-VG.

42684562|An extensive survey of olive orchards in Greece has shown that several weed species harbor Verticillium dahliae Kleb., either as susceptible hosts or as symptomless carriers. Isolations were attempted from 81 weed species belonging to 30 families. The fungus was isolated from the vascular system of 14 species, 13 of which are new hosts for Greece. Six species (Avena sativa, A. fatua, Calendula arvensis, Geranium dissectum, Malva sylvestris, Xanthium strumanum) have not been reported as hosts in the searched literature. These results indicate that weeds growing in olive orchards might be of major importance for the perpetuation and increase of inoculum, and affect disease incidence. Una vasta indagine svolta negli oliveti ha indicato che molte piante erbacee ospitano Verticillium dahliae Kleb., con o senza sintomi di malattia. Gli isolamenti sono stati tentati da 81 specie appartamenti a 30 famiglie. Il fungo  stato isolato dai vasi legnosi di 14 specie, 13 delle quali sono nuovi ospiti per la Grecia. Dell'esame della letteratura sembra risultare che 6 di esse (Avena sativa, A. fatua, Calendula arvensis, Geranium dissectum, Malva sylvestris, Xanthium strumanum) non siano mai state ricordate come ospiti di V. dahliae. E possibile che le erbe infestanti in oliveti siano di notevole importanza ai fini della perpetuazione del fungo e del livello di inoculazione e agiscano sulla incidenza della malattia.
42685029|Rhabdovirus-like particles were found associated with a leaf vein yellowing disease of Laburnum anagyroides occurring in Italy. Most of the particles in preparations made using glutaraldehyde and negatively stained with PTA, were bacilliform. They appeared well preserved, with structural details typical of rhabdoviruses. In thin sections a few enveloped particles within vesicles, were occasionally detected in the cytoplasm of vascular parenchyma cells. On the other hand, unenveloped tubular bullet-shaped particles up to 400 nm long, were frequently found in the nucleoplasm. They were randomly oriented not associated with cell membranes, and were morphologically similar to the nucleocapsids of particles seen in negative-stain. The virus was not mechanically transmitted by sap inoculation to 23 herbaceous indicator plant species but transmission of the disease and the associated rhabdovirus-like particles was obtained by grafting to L. anagyroides and L. alpium seedlings. Particelle simili ai rhabdovirus sono state ritrovate in associazione a un giallume nervale di Laburnum anagyroides presente in Italia. Molte delle particelle, in preparati ottenuti usando glutaraldeide e colorati con PTA, erano bacilliformi. Esse apparivano ben presrvate con tipici dettagli strutturali. In sezioni ultrasottili, single particelle prowiste di involucro perifrico, incluse in una vescicola, venivano occasionalmente osservate nel citoplasma di cellule del parenchima vascolare. Al contrario, particelle tubolari a proiettile sprowiste di involucro, di lunghezza fino a 400 nm, erano frequentemente evidenziate nel nucleoplasma. Esse risultavano orientate a caso, non associate a membrane cellulari e morfolgicamente simili al nucleocapside delle particelle viste nei preparati in colorazione negativa. Il virus non era trasmissibile meccanicamente a 23 specie di piante indicatrici erbacee. Trasmissione della malattia e delle particelle rhabdovirus-simili a questa associate, erano invece ottenute mediante inoculazione per innesto a semenzali di L. anagyroides e L. alpinum.
42685950|A survey for faba bean viruses was conducted in Egypt during spring of 1993 and 1994. Field observations and sample collections were made twice during 1993 in February and March and once in February during 1994. A total of 69 (February) and 83 (March) fields during 1993 and 64 fields during 1994 were visually inspected. On the basis of symptoms, observations made during 1993 indicated that virus incidence in 70% of the fields inspected was 5% or less, in 17% of the fields it ranged from 6 to 20%, whereas 13% of the fields had a virus incidence of more than 20%. A little increase in virus disease incidence was noticed in the March survey. During 1994, virus incidence in 53% of the fields inspected was 5% or less, in 17% of the fields ranged from 6-20%, whereas it was higher than 20% in 30% of the fields. Laboratory tests by DAS-ELISA of 1414 samples with symptoms suggestive of virus infection collected during the 1993 first survey and 1069 similar samples collected in the second survey showed that faba bean necrotic yellows virus (FBNYV) was the most frequently encountered virus (50.6%), followed by bean yellow mosaic potyvirus (BYMV) (24.5%) and broad bean wilt fabavirus (BBWV) (4.6%). Other viruses such as bean leaf roll luteovirus (BLRV), cucumber mosaic cucumovirus (CMV) and alfalfa mosaic alfamovirus (AMV) were less frequently detected (less than 1%). During 1994, FBNYV was again the most common, where it was detected in 62.1% of the 1166 samples tested followed by BYMV (31.2%), AMV (2.5%), BBWV (2%), BLRV (1.7%7 and PSbMV (1.1%).

42685284|Mineral nutrition is an important aspect of plant physiology and physiopathology. The relation between nutrition and virus disease is little known because of experimental difficulties and of poor interest on this subject. Critical evaluation of the available data does not lead to any clear conclusion, either about the effect of nutrition on virus disease, or on the effect of disease on the mineral metabolism of the host.

Le infezioni sono dunque possibili durante tutto l'anno, ad eccezione di luglio ed agosto. In alcune zone montane, dove sono anche coltivati Farro e Spelta, la forma conidica pu essere osservata fino ad agosto, poich questi cereali maturano in ritardo rispetto al Grano. Le infezioni autunnali nei seminativi di Grano possono provenire da conidi originatisi su piantine di Grano sub-spontaneo, dalle ascospore espulse dai periteci in novembre e dicembre e da conidi differenziatisi su graminacee prative infette. In definitiva, nelle condizioni ambientali dell'Italia meridionale lo svernamento dell'E. graminis tritici avviene mediante la forma conidica, mentre con la forma ascosfora il fungo supera i mesi pi caldi dell'anno (luglio e agosto). The results of experiments on the biology of powdery mildew of Wheat (Erysiphe graminis DC. f. sp. tritici Marchal) conducted in some areas of Southern Italy are reported. The first conidial infections in the field start in December. Such infections are light till February, become heavier in March and April, then they decrease in May and June, to stop completely in July. During March and April spore-traps carried by small aircrafts flying at 300 and 500 meters above sea level were able to detect viable conidia of E. graminis tritici. Such spores carried by air currents, may cause infections at distance. Perithecia were observed at the beginning of April, their differentiation continued till June, when the cycle of the host plant was completed. Ascospores were first seen in July after the summer rains. Most of them, however, were formed during September, October, and November when rains occurred after the summer drought. On perithecia mantained in the field till April, ascospores were no longer found after February. Infection trials were carried out both in the greenhouse and in the field. The beginning of infections on wheat seed lings in the field were observed, according to the area, either in September, or in October, or at the beginning of November. Therefore, infections occur during the whole year except for July and August. In some mountain areas, it is possible to observe conidia till August, mainly where Triticum dicoccum and Triticum spelta are cultivated, due to their late ripening. The autumn infections may originate from conidia differentiated on wild wheat seedlings, or from ascospores liberated during November and December, or from conidia differentiated on infected grasses. In conclusion, in the environmental conditions of Southern Italy, it seems that the conidial form represents the overwintering stage of E. graminis tritici, whilst the ascigerous state assists in the aestivation (July and August). Par des recherches executes pendant trois ans sur la biologie de l'oidium du Bl (Erysiphe graminis DC. f. sp. tritici Marchal) dans quelques localits de l'Italie du Sud, on a pu montrer que les premires infections conidiennes se manifestent, dans les champs ds le mois de dcembre, en se maintenant toujours trs lgres jusqu'au mois de fvrier. 42685953|The usefulness of Random Amplified Polymorphic DNA (RAPD) was examined as a potential tool to differentiate Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. albedinis from other F. oxysporum associated with wilted date palm. A molecular study was carried out on a set of 17 isolates of F. oxysporum from wilted palms or from the rhizosphere, collected in three palm groves. Three out of the twenty primers tested revealed scorable polymorphisms between the strains, indicating that isolates could be separated into three groups. The first one, RAPD1, only grouped isolates of F. oxysporum f. sp. albedinis. The two others, RAPD2 and RAPD3, contained all F. oxysporum isolates collected from date palm roots or the rhizosphere, regardless of their origin. These data showed that the RAPD technique allows differentiation of F. oxysporum f. sp. albedinis from other F. oxysporum associated with wilted date palms. DNA random amplification is thus a promising tool for evaluating genetic diversity within F. oxysporum populations in infested palm grooves.

43872336|Eleven samples of the most important pistachio rust (caused by Pileolaria terebinthi (DC.) Cast.,), which causes disease on Beneh (Pistacia atlantica Desf. subsp. mutica (Fisch. & Mey.) Rech. F) and Kasoor (Pistacia khinjuk Stocks.), were collected from herbarium specimens and pistachio fields at the Pistachio Research Institute in Rafsanjan, Iran. The complete sequences of ribosomal DNA internal transcribed spacers ITS1 and ITS2 (rDNA ITS) from the samples were determined and analysed. In general, very little rDNA ITS sequence variation was observed between rDNA ITS sequences of P. terebinthi samples. The length of the PCR fragments was 621 bp (for ITS1F-ITS4) and 1177 bp (for ITS1F-rust1), and consisted of 67 bp at the 3' end of 18S rDNA, 93 bp of ITS1 region, 154 bp of 5.8S rDNA, 246 bp of the ITS2 region, 57 bp (for ITS1F-ITS4) and 613 bp (for ITS1F-rust1) at the 5' end of the 28S rDNA. Restriction fragment length polymorphisms (RFLPs) of the rDNA-ITS region were used to identify Pileolaria terebinthi. Three strong bands of 105, 134 and 381 bp and five bands of 105, 134, 200, 301 and 437 bp are observed for the fragment of "ITS1F-ITS4" and "ITS1F-rustl", respectively. A PCR-RFLP diagnostic technique provided effective identification of the species by a unique pattern with the specific restriction enzyme Xapl (ApoI).
42684202|Vengono riportati i risultati di osservazioni microscopiche eseguite su sezioni di fusto di portinnesti appartenenti agli ibridi Vitis Berlandieri  V. riparia 34E, Kober 5BB, 225 e 420A, e V. Berlandieri  V. rupestris 1103, 17/37 e 779, tutti innestati con varie cv. di V. vinifera e presentanti sintomi riferibili al  legno riccio . Da essi si rileva che le anomalie istologiche sono molto varie e complesse ed interessano tanto lo xilema, quanto il libro. Nel legno i sintomi si riscontrano gi in profondit a partire dalla terza deposizione (raramente dalla quinta) e si evolvono poi in forma sempre pi accentuata negli anelli pi gioyani. Essi consistono principalmente in un disordine istologico a carico sia dei raggi midollari, sia dei settori legnosi radiali. Tale disordine pu essere accompagnato da una pi o meno rilevante riduzione dello xilema e da una prevalenza dei parenchimi. Queste alterazioni possono essere seguite, oppure no, da una parziale o totale compensazione da parte delle nuove deposizioni. Quando non si verifica alcuna compensazione, si formano nella parte alterata profonde insenature che risultano spesso isolate nel-Tambito del tessuto per il resto normale. I tessuti liberiani, corrispondenti alle zone del legno alterato, appaiono anch'essi profondamente disorganizzati. La presenza dei diversi sintomi  stata accertata sulla quasi totalit dei soggetti provati, anche se questi Ultimi hanno mostrato una diffrente frequenza ed intensit di talune manifestazioni. Sotto questo aspetto si  tentato di distinguere alcuni gruppi di ibridi in rapporto alla costante presenza o di estese parenchimatosi (come per esempio in V. Berlandieri  V. riparia 34E e Kober 5BB), o di insenature profonde (come per esempio il V. Berlandieri  V. rupestris 779, 1103 e 17/37). Gli eventuali rapporti tra sintomi interni e comportamento delle piante colpite e le eventuali relazioni tra innesto e comparsa nei soggetti dei sintomi di rugosit anche in rapporto alla presunta presenza di qualche ceppo virale, vengono ampiamente discusse. Infine viene sottolineata l'importanza delle osservazioni microscopiche quale utile mezzo di diagnosi, anche precoce, della malattia. The results of microscopic observations of stems of Vitis Berlandieri  V. riparia 34E, Kober 5BB, 225 and 420A, and V. Berlandieri  V. rupestris 1103, 140, 17/37 and 779 rootstocks, all grafted with various local Grapevine varieties and showing symptoms of  legno riccio  (rugose wood), are reported. The histological abnormalities observed are very various and complex, and occur in both the xylem and phloem. In the wood the symptoms start already from the third annual ring (rarely from the fifth) and they develop in a serious form in the younger ones; they consist mainly in an histological disorder of the medullary rays and of the radial woody sectors. Such a disorder can be accompanied by a more or less considerable reduction of the xylem and by a prevalence of parenchyma. These alterations may or may not be followed by a partial or total compensation from the new woody rings. When no compensation occurs, the altered part shows deep creeks which often result isolated in the remaining normal tissue. The phloematic tissues, corresponding to the altered wood, are also deeply disorganized. The presence of these symptoms have been ascertained in almost all the rootstocks examined, though some have showed a different frequency and intensity of some alterations. From this point of view, some groups of hybrids have been distinguished on the basis of the constant presence of either a wide parenchymatosis (in V. Berlandieri  V. riparia 34E and Kober 5BB) or deep creeks (in V. Berlandieri  V. rupestris 779, 1103 and 17/37). The possible relationships between internal symptoms and behaviour of the diseased plants, and between graft and appearance of wood pitting, also in connection with the supposed presence of some virus strain, are debated. In conclusion, the importance of microscopic observations as a useful mean of diagnosis, or early diagnosis, of the disease, is emphasized. 42685900|Seventeen accessions of five species of Lycopersicon, and 12 tomato cultivars, were artificially inoculated with two strains of Pseudomonas corrugata, the causal agent of "tomato pith necrosis". One month after the inoculation the severity of the disease was assessed. Some accessions (L. hirsutum sel. INRA, L. hirsutum f. glabratum LA 2124, L. cheesmanii LA 1139, L. esculentum var. cerasiforme LA 1321) were found resistant to both strains and in both sites of inoculation (collar and insertion of the 2nd true leaf). 42685331|A fast and simple method for preparing RNA template for single-tube RT-PCR amplification of citrus exocortis (CEVd) and citrus cachexia (CCaVd) viroids was developed. Crude sap from bark tissue was spotted on different solid supports before release of RNA template by boiling in buffer (spot-PCR). For cDNA synthesis, viroidal RNA releasing buffer was tested at different dilutions. Efficient amplification was obtained at dilutions of 1:10 to 1:20. Alternatively, RT-PCR was performed either on total nucleic acids (TNA) extracts from infected plants, or on viroidal template released by direct boiling of small tissue pieces. Single-tube amplification of citrus viroids, from 0.15 ng TNA from infected plants, spotted on nylon N+ membrane and released in glycine-NaCl buffer, proved to be successful. Nylon membranes were pre-wetted in a NaOH-EDTA solution to increase the amplification efficiency. For the analysis of CEVd-infected samples, new primers were selected which yielded reproducible and effective amplification.
42684496|The ultrastructure of epidermal cells of Gomphrena globosa was examined shortly after mechanical inoculation with Carborundum, either with or without tomato bushy stunt virus. No ultrastructural difference was noticed between the two series of samples: the cytological alterations seemed to depend only on the severity of the wound made in the outer cell wall, and varied from a quasi-normality to a complete collapse of cell contents, leading to necrosis. Virus particles were seldom seen inside the epidermal cells, and only after necrotization. The cytopathic effects of mechanical inoculation are discussed. L'ultrastruttura di cellule epidermiche di foglie di G. globosa  stata esaminata a tempi brevi dopo inoculazione meccanica con Carborundum, sia in presenza ehe in assenza di TBSV. Nessuna differenza ultrastrutturale  stata notata fra le due serie di campioni: le alterazioni citologiche osservate sembrano dipendere unicamente dalla gravita delia ferita prodotta nella prete cellulare esterna, e variano dalla quasi normalit al completo collasso delle strutture cellulari con conseguente necrosi. Il virus  stato evidenziato raramente all'interno delle cellule epidermiche, e solo in cellule necrotiche. Vengono discussi gli effetti citopatici dell'inoculazione meccanica.

Ne deriva che neanche l'imbrunimento vascolare puo costituire un elemento sicuro per la scelta del materiale propagativo. In the Riviera Ligure, 2 to 8 % of apparently healthy Carnation cuttings of mediterranean cultivars sampled from January through March, proved to be already infected by Phialophora cinerescens (Wr.) van Beyma. It was ascertained that the pathogen may invade the stem of symptomless plants for a length of over 30 cm. However, the vascular discoloration ends at approximately 10-20 cm below the area from which the fungus can still be isolated. Vascular discoloration, therefore, is not a valuable criterium for the selection of the cuttings. At the temperature of 18-22 C the symptoms of the disease appear earlier than at 11-15 C. The highest percentage of symptomless but infected cuttings produced during January, February and March is, therefore, related to the comparatively low temperatures of the months following the autumn infections. Such low temperatures slow down the appearance of external symptoms of the disease, whithout inhibiting to any great extent the growth of the pathogen in the stem and in the branches. Since a sufficient number of cuttings cannot be produced in the spring months only, the use of cuttings obtained from controlled mother plants, free of P. cinerescens, is suggested also for the mediterranean Carnation cultivars. Il apparat donc ncessaire mme pour les varits mditerranennes d'employer des boutures qui proviennent de plantes mres srement exemptes de P. cinerescens.
42685335|Surveys were conducted in commercial vineyards and in mother plant plots in the main grapevinegrowing areas of Jordan (highlands, Jordan valley, desert areas) to assess the presence and the incidence of virus diseases. Field inspections for symptom observation and the collection of samples were made in autumn 1997. Biological (sap inoculation to herbaceous plants and graft-transmission to woody indicators) and serological (different ELISA procedures) assays were performed for virus identification. About 60% of the ELISA-tested vines (562 out of 938) were infected by one (17.4%) or more (42.5%) viruses. Conversely, only one rootstock out of the 30 tested was infected. GVA was the most widespread virus (47.5%), followed by GLRaV-1 (37%), GFkV (18.2%) and GLRaV-3 (15.8%). GFLV, GVB and GLRaV-7 were also detected to a lesser extent, their incidence ranging between 4.8% and 0.3%. Vein necrosis symptoms were observed on graft-inoculated 110R plants, whereas no mechanically transmissible viruses other than GFLV were recovered from inoculated herbaceous hosts.

( Aflatoxinproducing ability medium , APA) e di Lin e Dianese ( Coconut-agar medium , CAM) per il riconoscimento degli isolati aflatossigeni. Eighty-four strains isolated from agricultural commodities, and twenty cultures from international collections (CBS, NRRL) were assayed. The results were compared with those previously obtained on aflatoxins production by the same strains, and with those on chemical nature of pigments produced by some Aspergillus species on ADM. The ADM method allows to distinguish the species belonging to A. flavus and A. ochraceus groups, which form yellow-orange colonies, from those of other Aspergillus groups. On this medium, such species produce aspergillic acids that form complexes containing ferric ions, responsible of the characteristic pigmentation of the colonies. The CAM method, though less selective than APA, allowed with more probability to distinguish the aflatoxigenic strains. Therefore, it is more reliable than APA, out require further identification of af latoxin in fluorescing cultures.
42684756|The results are reported of indexing on woody indicators for four graft-transmissible Grapevine disease (i.e. vein necrosis, fleck, leafroll and corky bark) in visually selected and heat-treated wine and table grapes from Southern Italy. In visually selected stocks vein necrosis had the highest incidence (slightly more than 70% infection) followed by leafroll (50% infection) and fleck (ca. 46% infection). Corky bark was rarely found (less than 1% infection). None of these diseases was completely eliminated by heat therapy. However, a reduction of their incidence was obtained, especially for fleck whose incidence dropped to 12%, and to a lesser extent, for vein necrosis (ca. 36% infection) and leafroll (ca. 34% infection). 42684353|Sono stati studiati lo sviluppo e la struttura anatomica di tubercoli di  rogna  indotti artificialmente, mediante inoculazione del batterio Pseudomonas savastanoi (E. F. Nocellara del Belice in periodi di riposo (estate e inverno) e di attivit cambiale (primavera) della pianta. Dalle osservazioni fatte 1, 3, 5, 7, 10, 13, 18, 23, 30, 45 e 60 giorni dopo le inoculazioni  risultato che lo sviluppo e la struttura anatomica dei tubercoli primaverili e di quelli estivi e invernali non differiscono in maniera sostanziale. Differenze di struttura sono state invece osservate tra i tubercoli sviluppatisi nella corteccia interna e quelli sviluppatisi nella corteccia esterna o indotti mediante inoculazioni con ago ipodermico. In ogni caso, la prima reazione dei tessuti lesi e messi a contatto dei batteri  consistita in un pronto risveglio, in estate e in inverno, e in una accelerazione, in primavera, dell'attivit del cambio. Si sono prodotti, in taie maniera, di qua e di l ai bordi della ferita, due cercini di nuovi tessuti i quali, come risultato dell'attivit del cambio e di un nuovo fellogeno differenziatosi lungo il fronte dei cercini in sviluppo, sono andati aumentando di volume sino a chiudersi a diaframma sulla superficie di taglio e assumere l'aspetto di un'unica escrescenza. All'interno della massa parenchimatica che costituisce il tubercolo, si originario strutture meristematiche che producono elementi xilematici e floematici irregolarmente distribuiti o organizzati in noduli ciclici. Nei tubercoli adulti, si originario cavit pi o meno ampie contenenti molti batteri. Da queste cavit, si dipartono successivamente delle fen diture che raggiungono la superficie del tubercolo. Per questa via i batteri, nei tubercoli ancora integri, raggiungono la superficie esterna. In questa fase di sviluppo dei tubercoli, sembrano cominciare processi che avviano il loro disfacimento. The development and anatomical structure of olive knots were studied after artificial inoculation of the causal bacterium, Pseudomonas savastanoi (E. F. Smith) Stevens, into slits through the bark of the stem of young olive plants (cv. Nocellara del Belice), while the cambium was active (spring) or not (winter and summer). Observations carried out 1, 3, 5, 7, 10, 13, 18, 23, 30, 45 and 60 days after inoculation showed that the development and anatomical structure of spring, summer and winter knots did not differ substantially. Structural differences were detected between knots developed in the inner cortex and those developed either in the external cortex or induced by inoculating the bacteria into the bark with a hypodermical syringe. In all instances the first reaction of the inoculated tissues became apparent in the form of either a quick renewal (in summer and winter) or an acceleration (in spring) of the cambial activity. Two masses of new tissues were thus produced at both edges of the injury. As a result of continuing cambium activity and of the activity a new phellogen differentiated at the growing front of the newly developed tissues, the latter increased progressively until they closed together like a diaphragm at the surface of the cut area. Further growth resulted in the appearance of a typical knot. Inside the parenchymatous tissue, that formed the bulk of the knot, some cambial zones were formed. These produced xylem and phloem elements irregularly distributed or organized in true bundles or cyclic nodules. Irregular cavities containing many bacteria were formed in old knots. Fissures were later found to originate from these cavities and reach the surface of the knot. The bacteria thus reached the external surface of intact knots. Initial signs of decay seem to appear at this stage of knot development. 42684482|Observations in nature of Cronartium flaccidum on 8-year-old Pinus pinea revealed that the time from pine infection to aeciospore production (biological cycle) usually required 2 growing seasons. These observations were confirmed by large experimental field tests. Eight-year-old plants of P. pinea were exposed to germinating telia occurring naturally on Vincetoxicum officinale leaves. The inoculations were made on September 18, 1974 on the new growth of 69 leaders and 86 lateral branches, and July 1, 1975 on 16 leaders and 27 lateral branches, the percentages of infection developing from the September and July inoculations on current season twigs were 90% and 95%, respectively. One infection developed on a second year internode from the latter set of inoculations. The biological cycle of the fungus is usually completed in two years. In some rare cases it is completed in one year, and occasionally in three years. Da osservazioni fatte in natura, Moriondo (1975) aveva concluso che il ciclo biologico di Cronartium flaccidum su piante di Pinus pinea di et compresa fra i 6 ed i 15 anni si doveva completare per lo pii dopo 2 stagioni vegetative. Queste osservazioni furono confermate da un'ampia serie di esperienze in natura. Piante di P. pinea di 8 anni d'et furono esposte a libera caduta di basidiospore da foglie di Vincetoxicum officinale Moench. infette, in pi riprese: I o Settembre 1974 su 69 assi principali e 86 assi secondari; 1 Luglio 1975 su 16 assi principali e 27 secondari. Le inoculazioni furono effettuate sulle intere branche comprendenti i palchi di vegetazione dell'anno in corso e delle due annate precedenti. Circa il 90% ed il 95% degli assi inoculati rispettivamente nel Settembre 1974 e nel Luglio 1975  risultato infetto. Comunque, solamente gli internodi che al momento dell'inoculazione costituivano i getti dell'anno. Questi, quindi, son da considerare praticamente le uniche parti delle piante adulte suscettibili alla ruggine. Dal secondo blocco di inoculazioni (Luglio 1975) una infezione si  sviluppata su un internodo di 1 anno. Il ciclo biolgico del fungo comprende quindi, nella maggior parte dei casi, 2 stagioni vegetative. In alcuni casi si completa in 1 anno o, occasionalmente, in 3 anni. In definitiva, su P. pinea le basidiospore di G flaccidum posssono produrre infezioni sui getti dell'anno, in massima parte, e sugli internodi di 1 anno, cio solo su quelle parti dlia pianta provviste di aghi.

43871744|Ascochyta blight of faba bean, caused by Ascochyta fabae, is one of the most destructive diseases of faba bean (Vicia faba) in Tunisia. Yield losses caused by the disease can reach 35% under conditions favourable for disease development. Despite its widespread occurrence, only the asexual part of Ascochyta life-cycle has been recovered in Tunisia. However, the sexual stage of the fungus is suspected to play an important role in the epidemiology of the disease, given the distribution of the primary infection symptoms. Pseudothecia of Didymella fabae, the teleomorph of A. fabae, were first observed in autumn-winter 2010-2011, on faba bean debris collected from the region of Beja (Tunisia) and placed in three different locations. Mature pseudothecia were first observed 2 months after the debris placement, with the typical characteristics of Didymella fabae. Isolation from ascospores resulted in typical cultures of A. fabae which produced typical symptoms of the disease when used to inoculate faba bean seedlings. This is the first report of D. fabae in Tunisia. The occurrence of the teleomorph has important implications for epidemiology of Ascochyta blight and therefore, on its management in faba bean crops.

In a crop of Shasta daisy (Chrysanthemum maximum Ram.) near Forl an epidemic blight was observed, just before or at the same time of the appearing of the first capitulum. The picture of the disease included two different syndromes:  foot rot  and  pith rot . The lesions, consisting in soft rot of the parenchymas, concerned the pith and the bark of the root and of the stem, and they had an upward spreading. In the affected plants there were yellowing and downwards wilting of the leaves and, in an advanced stage of the disease, the collapse and the rotting of the whole plant. The microscopic and microbiological examination of the tissues at the beginning of the lesions showed the presence of bacteria. Most of the isolated organisms were referred to E. chrysanthemi Burk. [E. carotovora var. chrysanthemi (Dye, 1969)]. However, pseudmonads of the group IVa described by Lelliott et al. (1966) were also present. The pathogenicity of the former bacteria was demonstrated in inoculation tests by hypersensitive reaction on Tobacco leaves, and by typical lesions with chlorotic halo on young leaves of Dieffenbachia. Their virulence has been ascertained on young plants of C. maximum on which they reproduced the characteristic symptoms of the disease. The causal organism was reisolated from artificially inoculated plants. The soft rot pseudomonads should have the role of secondary invaders. The re-isolation of E. chrysanthemi from the xylem of the artificially inoculated plants suggests that Shasta daisy blight is a systemic bacterial disease with chronic course. The taxonomic position of the causal organism is discussed. 42685965|Enzymes and their combinations were tested along with different osmotic stabilisers to produce protoplasts from mycelium of Botryotinia fuckeliana. Observations on cell wall regeneration and reversion to mycelial state were carried out on protoplasts plated on different media. Novozym 234, lysing enzyme and lyticase, especially in combinations including cellulase or -glucoronidase, resulted the most effective enzymes in KCl. Maximum release of protoplasts was achieved after 2-3 hours of treatment. Magnesium sulphate enhanced the effectiveness of novozym 234 + cellulase but reduced that of lyticase + -glucoronidase + cellulase + driselase. Proportion of colony-forming protoplasts (20-30%, generally) was similar on minimal or complete media but was influenced by protoplast origin, plating method and osmotic stabiliser contained in the medium.
42684435|Amaranthus leaf mottle virus (ALMV) found in Morocco in 1977 is similar to isolates previously found in Italy and Spain. It was confirmed that ALMV infects plants belonging to 6 families; the virus does not react with sera against 10 potyvirus but is distantly related to Bean yellow mosaic virus and Plum pox virus. The Moroccan, Spanish ant two Italian isolates have the same host range, but there are differences in virulence. Variation in host range induced by subculturing seems a common feature. The geographical distribution of ALMV together with data on the capacity of aphid vectors to retain infectivity for 12 hours suggest that ALMV could have moved naturally from Africa to Europe or vice versa. ALMV has never been found in cultivated plants but its host range and its variability suggest that it may be a potential pathogen for cultivated plants, mainly Leguminosae and Chenopodiaceae. ALMV trovato in Maroc co nel 1977  simile agli isolati precedentemente raccolti in Italia e Spagna. Viene confermato che ALMV infetta piante appartenenti a 6 famiglie, ma  facilmente soggetto a variare relativamente alio spettro degli ospiti. ALMV, lontanamente correlato, sierologicamente, con Bean yellow mosaic virus e Plum pox virus, non reagisce con sieri contro altri 10 potyvirus. Gli isolati marocchino, spagnolo e due italiani hanno infettato le stesse piante indicatrici con alcune differenze nell'intensit dei sintomi. La distribuzione geografica di ALMV insieme ai dati che questo virus pu persistere nel vettore per 12 ore, suggeriscono che ALMV pu aver migrato, in condizioni naturali, dall'Africa all'Europa o viceversa. ALMV non  stato mai trovato in piante coltivate, ma il suo spettro degli ospiti e la facilita con cui produce varianti suggerisce che esso deve essere considerato un patageno Potenziale per piante coltivate, principalmente Leguminosae e Chenopodiaceae.

42685930|The CERCODEP (CERCOspora Development of EPidemics) model simulating development of Cercospora leaf spot epidemics on sugarbeet is shown. Disease severity is calculated daily as the summation of the amount of disease severity of the previous day and the daily increase of disease severity, both expressed as percentage of diseased leaf area. The daily increase of disease severity depends on the infection rate, on the infectious leaf area and on the affectable leaf area. Infection rate is calculated as a function of some weather (hourly values of temperature and relative humidity and rainfall) and cultural factors (cultivar susceptibility and sugarbeet growth stage). The validation of the model, using data not used for model development, was made by subjective (visual comparison) and objective tests (Kolmogorov-Smirnov test and regression analysis). A comparison was made between field observations and simulations produced by CERCODEP. Visual comparison and Kolmogorov-Smirnov test always showed agreement of model simulations with field observations, while regression analysis showed one case of a significant difference.
42685738|Nicotiana tabacum L. cv. Burley 21 plants were twice exposed to ozone pulses (350 ppb for a 4-hour-period, daily). Leaf damage was more evident in older leaves and was essentially unrelated to peroxidase activity increase. Starch-gel electrophoresis of crude extracts obtained from ozone-treated plants showed a new anodic peroxidase isoform possibly related to the stress response of the plant to the gaseous pollutant. No difference was observed in the cathodic isoform pattern. Piante di Nicotiana tabacum L. cv. Danni fogliari visibili macroscpicamente sono stati rilevati subito dopo i trattamenti con ozono in particolare nelle fcglie pi vecchie. Tale fenomeno sembra non essere correlato all'aumento dell'attivit perossidasica. 42685400|Chickpea (Cicer arietinum) is an edible legume grown widely for its nutritious seed, which is rich in protein, minerals, vitamins and dietary fibre. It's a new crop in Kenya whose potential has not been utilized fully due to abiotic and biotic stresses that limit its productivity. The crop is affected mainly by Ascochyta blight (AB) which is widespread in cool dry highlands causing up to 100% yield loss. The objective of this study was to evaluate the resistance of selected chickpea genotypes to AB in dry highlands of Kenya. The study was done in 2 sites (Egerton University-Njoro) and Agricultural Training centre-ATC-Koibatek) for one season during long rains of 2010/2011 growing season. Thirty six genotypes from reference sets and mini-core samples introduced from ICRSAT were evaluated. There were significant (P<0.001) differences in AB responses and grain yield performance in test genotypes in both sites. AB was more severe at Egerton-Njoro (mean score 5.7) than ATC-Koibatek (mean score 4.25), with subsequent low grain yield. Genotypes ICC7052, ICC4463, ICC4363, ICC2884, ICC7150, ICC15294 and ICC11627 had both highest grain yield in decreasing order (mean range 1790-1053 Kg ha) and best resistance to AB. Further evaluation is needed in other multi-locations and their use in breeding program determined especially because of their undesirable black seed color. Commercial varieties (LDT068, LDT065, Chania desi 1, and Saina K1) were all susceptible to AB, but with grain yield >1200 Kg ha. The findings of the study showed that chickpea should be sown during the short rains (summer) in the dry highlands of Kenya when conditions are drier and warmer and less favorable for AB infection. However yield could be increased by shifting the sowing date from dry season to long rain (winter) thus avoiding terminal drought if AB resistant cultivars with acceptable agronomic traits could be identified.
42685719|The susceptibility of cotton (Gossypium barbadense) was high in juvenile and senescent plants and low in middle-aged plants. The age-conditioned changes in susceptibility were temperature-dependent and accelerated by growth under hot conditions. The susceptibility of individual leaves was also modified by the age of mother plants. It was higher in leaves present on senescent plants than in those present on middle-aged plants. The regimes of nutrition affected yield more than they affected disease. In non-fertilized plants the effect of nutrition on yield superceded the effect of disease. In the fertilized plants defoliation by disease affected the yield more than defoliation by mechanical means. Growth under conditions of high soil moisture increased the yield and the resistance of plants to disease. La suscettibilit del Cotone  generalmente elevata allo stadio giovanile e di senescenza della pianta e bassa in quello intermedio. Questa correlazione risulta influenzata dalla temperatura: accelerata dagli elevati livelli termici. La suscettibilit delle singole foglie risulta anch'essa modificata in rapporto all'et della pianta;  pi elevata nelle foglie presenti sulle piante senescenti rispetto a quelle delle piante di media et. Il regime di nutrizione incide sulla produttivit della pianta pi che l'intensit della malattia. In piante fertilizzate la defogliazione causata dalla malattia incide maggiormente sulla produttivit che la defogliazione meccanica. Il vegetare delle piante in condizioni di elevata umidit nel suolo comporta un incremento di produttivit e di resistenza alla malattia.

I risultati confermano la teoria secondo la quale la tolleranza dell'ospite pu essere spiegata dalla presenza di strutture simili a quelle dei polisaccaridi alla superficie della cellula del patogeno.

43871736|A study was undertaken to investigate whether inactivation of Pythium by mefenoxam takes place as soon as it comes in contact with the fungicide. Laboratory experiments were conducted which involved three sensitive isolates of P. aphanidermatum (EC<1g mL), three sensitive isolates of P. spinosum (EC<1g mL) two resistant isolates of P. aphanidermatum (EC>100g mL). In liquid cultures, inactivation of the sensitive pythium isolates by mefenoxam took place between 12 hr and > 96hr at concentrations from 1 to 100 g mL. The time required for inactivation was negatively correlated with the concentration of mefenoxam (P < 0.05). Colonization of cucumber seeds placed at different distances from the sensitive Pythium inoculum in soil amended with 1 and 5 g mL mefenoxam occurred in the first 12 hr. However, colonization was reduced after 24 hr and was completely inhibited after 96 hr. Efficiency of colonization in the sensitive Pythium populations was found to have a negative correlation with the concentration of mefenoxam used. Growth and colonization by the resistant Pythium isolates were not found to be affected with mefenoxam. This study appears to be the first report of presence of a lag period between application of mefenoxam and time taken to inactivate Pythium.
42683933|Molti au tori hanno stabilito che infezioni di microrganismi vari (funghi, bacteri, virus) inducono le piante, come risposta alie infezioni stesse, alla produzione di una sorta di  anticorpi  ad azione aspecifica, che bloccano o riducono l'effetto di infezioni virali successive. Noi abbiamo voluto esaminare se era vero anche il contrario e cio se un'infezione virale provocava nell'ospite una variazione metablica con produzione, da parte di quest'ultimo, di sostanze capaci di inibire lo sviluppo di miceti. Si  proceduto paragonando l'azione del sueco di foglie di Tabacco cv  White Burley  infettate localmente con un ceppo di TMV, a quella di sueco dello stesso tipo di foglie Inoculate solo con tampone, su due miceti: Alternaria solani (Ell. et Mart.) Jones et Grout, e A. tenuis Nees. Si sono fatti tre tipi di prove. In un primo tipo si ponevano le colonie del fungo al centro di scatole Petri (una per seatola) riempite di agar malto e, lateralmente a queste, secondo i vertici di un esagono o di un triangolo regolari, dischetti di carta bibula imbeyuti o di sueco sano o di sueco malato. Si misurava poi la differenza di sviluppo della colonia del fungo nelle scatole trattate con sueco sano e in quelle trattate con sueco malato. In un secondo tipo di prove, invece, una sospensione conidica di A. tenais veniva unita ad un ugual volume di agar-agar al 2 % a circa 45 C di temperatura e la mescolanza era distesa su lastre di vetro piane. Su queste, dopo consolidamento dell'agar si ricavavano pozzetti (disposti in quadro) ed in essi si poneva o sueco malato o sueco sano. Si misurava in seguito il cosiddetto  alone di inibizione  del fungo attorno ai pozzetti stessi. Infine in un terzo tipo. di prove si univano direttamente, e a volumi uguali, soluzioni conidiche di A. tenais e succhi malati o sani e si determinava poi al microscopio il numero dei conidi germinad. Mentre dai due primi tipi di prove non si sono ricavati risultati significativi, col terzo si  visto che, considerando 100 % i conidi germinati nelle miscele sueco sano-conidi, in quelle sueco malato-conidi erano germinati, dopo 22 ore, il 65,6 % dei conidi, dopo 26 ore il 76,8 % e dopo 36 ore il 75,7 %. Da ci si deduceva che il sueco malato aveva effettivamente un'azione inibitrice sulla germinazione dei conidi di Alternaria, ma esplicava anche una semplice azione di ritardo su di essa. Infatti, mentre all'inizio la differenza delle percentuali di germinazione delle due miscele era del 34,4 %, essa poi si riduceva, fino a mantenersi costante, intorno al 23-24 %. Many authors have ascertained that infections of various microorganisms (fungi, bacteria, viruses) lead the plant as an answer to the infections themselves, to the production of a sort of  antibodies  with aspecific action, which stop or reduce the effect of successive virus infections. We wanted to establish if the contrary too was true, that is to say that a virus infection may cause a metabolic reaction in the host plant with the subsequent production, on the part of this latter, of substances able to prevent the growth of the fungi. To this end a comparison was made between the action carried out on the two fungi: Alternaria solani (Ell. et Mart) Jones et Grout e A. tenuis Nees by the juice of Tobacco leaves cv  White Burley  locally infected with a TMV strain, and the one exercised by the juice of leaves of the same kind only inoculated with buffer. Three types of tests have been carried out. In the first type of test, the fungus colonies were placed in the center of Petri dishes (one for each dish) full of malt agar. At the sides of the colonies, according to the vertices of a regular triangle or hexagon, we also put small dishes of filter paper soaked either in healthy or in diseased juice. Then the different development of the fungus colony in the dishes treated with healthy juice and in those treated with diseased juice was measured. In a second type of test, on the contrary, a conidial suspension of A. tenuis was mingled with an equal quantity of 2 % agar at a temperature of 45 C approximately and the mixture was then spread on flat glass slides. After the agar solidification, we could obtain on these latter small (squarely located) wells where we poured either diseased or healthy juice. We furtherly measured the so-called  inhibition halo  of the fungus around the wells themselves. Finally, in a third type of test we directly and equally mingled conidial suspensions of A. tenuis with diseased or healthy juices, then calculating at the microscope the number of conidia germinated. Whereas the first two types of test did not give significant results, the third one has helped to ascertain that taking 100 % as the percentage of conidia germinated in the healthy juiceconidia mixtures, in the diseased juice-conidia ones 65,6 % of conidia had germinated after 22 hours, 76,8 % after 26 hours and 75,7 % after 36 hours. Hence it could be deduced that the diseased juice actually had an inhibiting action on the germination of conidia of Alternaria, also, car rying out a simple delaying action on it. In fact, whereas the initial difference of the germination percentages of the two mixtures was equal to 34,4 %, it gradually diminished until it remained constant around 23-24 %. Nous avons voulu tablir si c'tait vrai pour le contraire, c'est--dire qu'une infection de virus peut provoquer chez l'hte une variation mtabolique avec production, de la part de ce dernier, de substances capables d'inhiber le dveloppement de myctes. On a effectu trois genres d'essais. Dans un premier essais, on plaait la colonies du champignon au centre de botes de Petri (une par bote) remplies de agar malt et latralement  ces dernires, selon les sommets d'un hexagone ou d'un triangle rgulier, des rondelles de papier buvard, imbibes de suc sain ou bien de suc malade. Ensuite, on mesurait la diffrence de dveloppement de la colonie du champignon dans les botes traites avec suc sain et dans celles traites avec suc malade. Dans un deuxime essai, au contraire, on mlangeait une suspension conidienne d'A. tenuis avec une quantit gale d'agar-agar au 2 %  une temprature de 45 C environ et le mlange tait tendu sur des plaques de verre planes. Sur ces dernires, aprs la consolidation de l'agar, on obtenait des petites puits (placs en carr) o l'on versait du suc malade ou du suc sain. Ensuite on mesurait ce qu'on appelle le  halo d'inhibition  du fungus autour des puits mmes. En fin, dans un troisime essais, on mlangeait directement et en quantits gales, des solutions conidiennes d'A. tenuis et des sucs malades ou sains et on calculait au microscope le nombre des conidies germines. Tandis que les deux premiers essais n'ont pas donn de rsultats significatifs on a vu pour le troisime qu'en considrant 100 % les conidies germines dans les mlanges suc sainconidies dans ceux suc malade-conidies le 65,6 % des conidies avaient germine aprs 22 heures, 76,8 % aprs 26 heures et 75,7 % aprs 36 heures. D'o on concludait que le suc malade avait effectivement une action inhibitrice sur la germination des conidies d'Alternaria mais il exerait aussi une simple action de retard sur elle. En effet, tandis qu'au dbut la diffrence des pourcentages de germination des deux mlanges montait  34,4 %, elle se rduisait ensuite jusqu' se maintenir constante autour de 23-24 %.

42685704|A study was made of leaf reactions of 7 Tomato genotypes to 2 Italian strains  Xanthomonas campestris pv. vesicatoria. Assessment parameters were: tissue electrolyte loss within 24h, appearance and evolution of visible symptoms at different times after inoculation with known concentrations of bacteria. Inoculations were made by intercellular injection, vacuum infiltration or spraying. The two strains were used individually and mixed (1:1; v:v). Only genotypes 'HW 7998' and Ohio 4013-3' differed from the susceptible genotype 'UC 82' used as a control. The reaction of 'Ohio 4013-3' was not hypersensitive because there was no significant variation in tissue electrolyte loss at 24h. The response of 'HW 7998' was hypersensitive-like for the tissue electrolyte loss at 24 h and collapse at 8h; the subsequent enlargement of necrosis did not, however, fit the pattern of a typical hypersensitive resistance for a breeding programme. 42684594| stata studiata la capacit di sopravvivenza in terreni non sterili e in diverse condizioni di temperatura e umidit di due pseudomonadi pectolitiche fluorescenti, Pseudomonas marginalis (S6) e P. fluorescens biotipo G (3TS), agenti di un marciume molle su piante di Sedano. Le due entit batteriche, isolate rispettivamente da piante infette e da terreno ad esse adiacente, sono state inoculate alla dose di 1  10 batteri vivi/g di terreno secco in due terreni, uno argilloso limoso e l'altro sabbioso, contenuti in matracci conici di Erlenmeyer da 500 ml (200 g di terreno/matraccio) incubati poi alle temperature di 8, 18 e 30C con umidit controllata al 5, 10, 15, 20 e 30% per il terreno sabbioso e 7, 10, 20, 30 e 40% per il terreno argilloso limoso. I potenziali idrici (pF) corrispondenti alle umidit controllate erano 4, 1, 2, 9, 2, 0, 1, 5 e 0 per il terreno sabbioso e 5, 4, 5, 0, 3, 7, 1, 1 e 0 per il terreno argilloso limoso. In generale  risultato che la sopravvivenza di P. marginalis e di P. fluorescens biotipo G dipende principalmente dalla temperatura e dalla umidit, mentre risente assai poco del tipo di terreno. Inoltre l'isolato S6 ha rivelato una migliore sopravvivenza rispetto all'isolato 3TS. Alla temperatura di 30C, mentre il ceppo 3TS si  immediatamente estinto, il ceppo S6  sopravvissuto per 21 giorni in entrambi i terreni. Complessivamente migliore  stata la sopravvivenza a 18C e, ancor pi, a 8C sia nel terreno sabbioso che in quello argilloso limoso. In queste ultime condizioni il ceppo S6 si  conservato per pi di 4 mesi in entrambi i terreni, e il ceppo 3TS per circa 1 mese nel terreno limoso e per circa 2 in quello sabbioso. Per quanto riguarda l'umidit, si  constatato che le condizioni pi favorevoli per la sopravvivenza dei ceppi batterici aggiunti ai terreni, sono state quelle intermedie (15-30%). Si  cos accertato che, nelle condizioni sperimentali adottate, entrambi i ceppi batterici hanno avuto difficolt a sopravvivere in condizioni di temperatura e umidit del terreno quali si verificano durante l'estate. L'azione deprimente esercitata sulla sopravvivenza degli isolati S6 e 3TS dalle basse umidit associate a un'alta temperatura potrebbe trovare pratico impiego per il controllo di questi batteri. The Survival of two pectolytic strains of Pseudomonas fluorescens was measured in two soils under different conditions of water soil content and temperature of incubation. The two pathogenic strains, P. marginalis (S6) and P. fluorescens byotipe G (3TS), isolated from soft-rotted celery plants and from the rhizosphere respectively, were inoculated separately at 1  10 cells/g of non-sterile clay loam or sandy dry soil in 500 ml Erlenmeyer flasks (200 g of soil/flask). The temperatures of incubation of both soils were 8, 18 and 30C, while the sandy soil water contents were 5, 10, 15, 20 and 30% and those of the clay loam soil were 7, 10, 20, 30 and 40%. The soil water potential at these water contents were 4.1, 2.9, 2.0, 1.5 and 0 for the sandy soil and 5.4, 5.0, 3.7, 1.1 and 0 for the clay loam soil. The numbers of surviving bacteria were estimated 7, 14, 21, 28, 45, 60, 90 and 120 days after incubation in the dark. The results indicated that the survival of P. marginalis and P. fluorescens byotipe G was conditioned by the temperature, soil moisture and type of bacteria. The type of soil had very little if any influence. At 30C the isolate 3TS died in less than one week, while the isolate S6 survived for 21 days in both soils. A comparatively better survival was observed at 18C and, even more, at 8C. Under the latter conditions the isolate S6 survived for more than 4 months in both soils. The isolate 3TS, on the contrary, survived for about 1 month in the sandy soil and for about 2 months in the clay loam soil. In regard to the moisture content the most favorable survival conditions were those of 15-30% of water content at almost all the temperatures tested. At 5-10% of water content and at 8, 18 and 30C both bacteria died in less than one week. The detrimental effects of low soil moisture at high temperature may be applicable in the field for cultural control of these bacteria.
42685225|Etiologies of elm diseases consisting of yellowing, witches'-broom, and/or decline symptom(s) that occur in central and northern Italy were investigated. Direct and nested-PCR assays using universal R16F2/R2 and phytoplasma group specific R16(I)F1/R1, R16(III)F2/R1, and R16(V)F1/R1, primer pairs derived from phytoplasma 16S rRNA gene sequences were employed to detect and classify phytoplasmas present in samples of symptomatic and asymptomatic Ulmus spp. or hybrids. Direct PCR assays using the R16F2/R2 (universal) or R16(V) F1/R1 (group V specific) primer pair, but not R16(I) F1/R1 or R16(III) F2/R1, detected phytoplasmas from these samples. Based on collective restriction fragment length polymorphism (RFLP) profiles of 16S rDNA sequences the Italian elm yellows associated phytoplasmas (EYIta) were identified as members of phytoplasma 16S rRNA group V (elm yellows phytoplasma and related strains), closely related to the representative American EY phytoplasma strains. However, the EYIta phytoplasma appears to be distinct from the American EY phytoplasma, since the primer pair EY11-F1/R1, which is specific to American EY phytoplasmas, did not prime amplification of DNA from any of the Italian elm samples tested. Nested-PCR assays using R16F2/R2 followed by amplification using one of the phytoplasma group-specific primer pairs revealed that minor or secondary phytoplasmas belonging to 16S rRNA group I (aster yellows phytoplasma and related strains) were also present in many samples, indicating occurrence of mixed-infection. A phytoplasma associated with rubus (Rubus fruticosus L.) stunt, a disease frequently occurring in the areas where the elm samples were collected, was detected and characterized. RFLP analyses of 16S rDNA sequences indicated that this phytoplasma was closely phylogenetically related to the one associated with the Italian EY disease.
42685555|Si segnala per la prima volta la presenza su Frumento duro di periteci di Phaeosphaeria nodorum (Mll.) Hedjaroude (anamorfo: Septoria nodorum Berk.) nell'Italia meridionale. Hed. (Anamorph: Septoria nodorum Berk.) have been found on durum Wheat for the first time in Southern Italy. 42685425|Severity of disease caused by the fungus Zymoseptoria tritici throughout world cereal growing regions has elicited much debate on the potential evolutionary mechanism conferring high adaptability of the pathogen to diverse climate conditions and different wheat hosts (Triticum durum and T. aestivum). Specific mitochondrial DNA sequence was used to investigate geographic distribution of the type 4 haplotype (mtRFLP4) within 1363 isolates of Z. tritici originating from 21 countries. The mtRFLP4 haplotype was detected from both durum and bread wheat hosts with greater frequency on durum wheat. The distribution of mtRFLP4 was limited to populations sampled from the Mediterranean and the Red Sea region. Greater frequencies of mtRFLP4 were found in Tunisia (87%) and Algeria (60%). The haplotype was absent within European, Australian, North and South American populations except Argentina. While alternative hypotheses such as climatic adaptation could not be ruled out, it is postulated that mtRFLP4 originated in North Africa (e.g. Tunisia or Algeria) as an adaptation to durum wheat as the prevailing cereal crop. The specialized haplotype has subsequently spread as indicated by lower frequency of occurrence in the surrounding Mediterranean countries and on bread wheat hosts.
42685424|Muskmelon vine decline is considered the most important factor limiting muskmelon production in Oman. This study was conducted to characterize incidence, development, causal agents and response of muskmelon cultivars to this disease. A survey showed that incidence of the disease ranged from 0 to 15% (mean 5%) in spring 2011, 1 to 80% (mean 18%) in autumn 2011 and 0 to 15% (mean 10%) in spring 2012. Isolations from 168 affected plants yielded Pythium aphanidermatum (56% of diseased plants sampled), Fusarium spp. (46%), Monosporascus cannonballus (27%), Rhizoctonia solani (22%) and Macrophomina phaseolina (1%). In pathogenicity tests, R. solani, M. cannonballus and P. aphanidermatum were found to be pathogenic to muskmelon. In another experiment over three seasons, M. cannonballus, P. aphanidermatum and R. solani were consistently isolated from muskmelon plants on a weekly basis from 14 days after sowing until the end of the season. However, symptom development only began with the onset of fruiting, which suggests that fruiting stress may be a factor in vine decline disease development. Field assessment of 11 muskmelon cultivars showed that 'Shahd F1' was one of the cultivars least susceptible to vine decline and was relatively high yielding. This is the first record of M. cannonballus as a causal agent of muskmelon vine decline in Oman.
42684474|Expressions of anatomical resistance to Southern fusiform rust occur as resistance-zones in certain resistant slash pine progenies. Although initial reaction to rust infection in primary resistant and susciptible slash pine seedlings is similar, by 15 days after inoculation distinct differences between resistant and susceptible became obvious. By thirty days after inoculation a resistance-mechanism had become operable as resistance-zones in the resistant plants. These zones, which isolated the rust fungus, were initiated by the reaction to rust infection by the base meristem cells of the primary cambium. Sebbene i programmi di miglioramento gentico del pino per la resistenza alla ruggine fusiforme siano ormai una realt, i meccanismi di resistenza sono in genere poco studiati e compresi. Precedenti ricerche di Jewell misero in evidenza che alcuni semenzali derivati da genitori resistenti presentarono un meccanismo di resistenza consistente nel recupero dell'infezione. L'Autore concluse che la resistenza era dovuta ad un particolare meccanismo anatmico nel tessuto dell'ospite, indicato come  zone di resistenza . Questa nota riferisce di ulteriori indagini compiute sull'istologia a cominciare dalle prime fasi di sviluppo delle  zone di resistenza  in giovani semenzali di 42 giorni inoculati con Cronartium quercuum f. sp. fusiforme. Inizialmente le reazioni iniziali alia ruggine fusiforme sono risultate moho simili in semenzali suscettibili e resistenti, ma dopo 15 giorni dall'inoculazione le differenze tra i semenzali resistenti e suscettibili sono risultate significative. Trenta giorni dopo l'inoculazione un meccanismo di resistenza  operante nelle piante resistenti come  zone di resistenza . Esse isolano il micelio del fungo a seguito della reazione all'infezione dovuta alie cellule meristematiche basali del cambio primario.
42685033|Selected strains of Pseudomonas amygdali, ranging from highly to moderately or weekly virulent, were examined for plasmid-DNA content. All the strains contained three or four plasmids ranging from 79 to 31 kb in size. In all the strains the heaviest and the lightest plasmids, whose molecular masses ranged respectively from 79 to 77 kb and from 37 to 36 kb, seem to be highly conserved, as restriction endonuclease digestion patterns appear to indicate. Only in one strain did the lightest plasmid have the size of 31 kb. The other plasmids varied in size ranging from 70 to 44 kb. No apparent relation has been observed between the presence of a particular plasmid and the virulence and/or the phytohormone production ability of the strains. In base ai profili di digestione con endonucleasi di restrizione, i plasmidi pi pesanti e pi leggeri, le cui masse variano rispettivamente da 79 a 77 kb e da 37 a 36 kb, sembrano altamente conservati nel batterio. Soltanto in un ceppo il plasmide pi leggero  di 31 kb. Gli altri plasmidi hanno masse variabili da 70 a 44 kb. Nessuna apparente relazione  stata osservata tra la presenza di un particolare plasmide e la virulenza e/o la produzione di fitormoni dei ceppi esaminati.
42684071|L'effetto tossico della fusicoccina (prodotta da Fusicoccum amygdali Del.) su piantine recise di Pomodoro e inversamente proporzionale all'intensit dell'illuminazione durante la somministrazione della tossina: esso  maggiore al buio e diminuisce con l'aumentare della luce, nelle condizioni saggiate (fino a 4.000 lux). Le piantine allevate in stagioni diverse presentano una  soglia  diversa alia quale tale  effetto luce  si manifesta. Tale soglia sembra correlata alia lunghezza media del giorno nel periodo di accrescimento delle piantine. Di conseguenza, viene messa in dubbio l'opportunita di valutare gli effetti tossici della fusicoccina mediante la  dose minima  , se le piante di saggio sono allevate in condizioni di illuminazione diurna (serre a yetri). Nei saggi condotti in condizioni di elevata umidita relativa (90%). i danni prodotti dalla fusicoccina alle piantine recise di Pomodoro si manifestano con ritardo e sono meno intensi di quelli che si ottengono a valori inferiori di umidita (70% o 50%). The toxic effect of fusicoccin (produced by Fusicoccum amygdali Del.) on Tomato cuttings is inversely proportional to light intensity during toxin supply: it is greater in the dark and smaller with light increase, under experimental conditions (up to 4,000 lux). The plants grown in different seasons show a different  limit  at which the above mentioned  light effect  occurs. Such limit seems to be correlated with the average lenght of the day during the growth season of test plants. Consequently, the evaluation of fusicoccin toxic effects by the  minimal dose  is debated, under the daylight growing conditions of the test plants (glasshouses). In the trials carried out at high relative humidity (90%), the damages produced by fusicoccin to Tomato cuttings appear with a certain delay and are less serious than those produced at lower humidity values (70% or 50%). L'effet toxique de la fusicoccine (produite par le Fusicoccum amygdali Del.) sur plantes coupes de Tomate est inversement proportionnel  l'intensit de lumire pendant l'apport de la toxine: cet effet est plus grand dans la obseurit et plus rduit avec l'augmentation de lumire, dans les conditions exprimentales (jusqu' 4.000 lux). Les plantes cultives en priode diffrente montrent une  limite  diffrente  laquelle cet  effet lumire  se produit. Cette limite parat tre en corrlation avec la dure moyenne du jour pendant la priode d'accroissement des jeunes plantes. Par consquent, on discute sur l'opportunit d'valuer les effets toxiques de la fusicoccine en  dose minimale , quand les plantes essayes sont cultives dans les conditions de lumiere du jour (serres). Dans les essais effectus avec une humidit relative leve (90%), les dommages causs par la fusicoccine aux plantes coups de Tomate se produisent en retard et ils sont moins srieux que ceux qu'on observe  une valeur riuite d'humidit relative (70% ou 50%).
42685947|Surveys were carried out in different vineyards of Apulia to assess the incidence of infection by the following grapevine viruses: virus A (GVA), leafroll-associated I (GLRaVI), leafroll-associated III (GLRaV III), fanleaf (GFLV) and fleck (GFkV). These studies were aimed especially at establishing possible correlations of rugose wood with closterolike viruses. Of 1828 vines checked individually, 88.3% were infected by at least one of the five viruses. GLRaV III (67.3%), GVA (55.7%) and GFkV (59.3%) were the most widespread. GLRaV I (11.8%) and GFLV (7.1%), which prevailed in older vineyards, were detected less frequently. The consistent presence of closterolike viruses in vineyards established with certified material was interpreted as a consequence of their possible spread by mealybug vectors. GVA appeared to be the key factor for the development of wood abnormalities and to interact with GLRaV I and GLRaV III in the enhancement of the incidence of rugose wood.
42685876|Wheat plants of the cv. Castio, Celta and Tenor cultivated in the district of vora were checked for the presence of barley stripe mosaic hordeivirus (BaSMV) and brome mosaic bromovirus (BrMV). 42685303|An accession of the wild pepper Capsicum baccatum L., pen 1 15421, was tested for resistance to an Italian isolate of cucumber mosaic cucumovirus (CMV) in greenhouse and field experiments. When sap inoculated with the virus in the greenhouse, C. baccatum reacted with few chlorotic/necrotic lesions which were normally followed by systemic symptoms. The latter consisted of chlorotic mottling, often associated with lesions similar to the local ones, sometimes with browning and wilting of the apical shoot. Thus, although this response differed from that of the susceptible cultivars Yolo Wonder and Cuneo (typical systemic mosaic with general stunting and leaf narrowing), the C. baccatum accession did not behave as resistant in these experiments. A commercial C. annuum hybrid indicated as CMV resistant (CM-R) also developed systemic infection regularly, with the same symptoms as those of the susceptible cultivars. A field experiment was conducted by allowing the CMV isolate to spread by aphid transmission from inoculated (source) tobacco plants to Capsicum plants to be tested. Infection in C. baccatum was mostly associated with a minute mild mosaic and/or few brown spots on the apical leaves. Interestingly, when compared to 'Yolo Wonder' (100% infected plants) C. baccatum showed a 31-39% reduction in CMV incidence (% infected plants) indicating that this accession bears some resistance to the virus when the transmission is mediated by aphids. A similar resistance (33% incidence reduction) was observed with the commercial hybrid which, in addition, seems to possess some tolerance to the virus, as in the same experiment 24% of CMR plants had latent infection. The possibility of using C. baccatum pen 1 15421 as a new source of moderate field resistance to CMV for breeding peppers should be taken into account in future research.
43872340|The presence and diversity of Diatrypaceae species occurring on grapevines in Eastern Spain were investigated. Several species were identified on the basis of morphological characters and phylogenetic analyses of the complete sequence of the internal transcribed spacers of the ribosomal DNA and part of the -tubulin gene. Five species of Diatrypaceae isolated from the wood of diseased grapevines, pruning debris and/or perithecia were identified, including Anthostoma decipiens, Cryptovalsa ampelina, Eutypa lata, Eutypella citricola and Eutypella microtheca. Additionally, four taxa could not be identified to the species level but were closely related to Eutypa tetragona based on phylogenetic analyses. Eutypa lata was the most prevalent species and showed the greatest degree of genetic diversity. Cryptovalsa ampelina and E. microtheca ranked second in the frequency of isolations, while all the remaining species were less frequently isolated. Eutypella citricola and E. microtheca are reported for the first time as occurring on grapevine in Spain and this is the first report of A. decipiens occurring on grapevine.
