42685914|Antiviral factors (AVFs) extracted from various plants infected by different viruses using HCP, and partially purified by DEAE-column chromathography, were active in the system Chenopodium amaranticolor /TNV. Crude AVFs preparations electrophoresed on denaturing 5-15% gels (SDS-PAGE) showed band patterns normally differing from those of crude preparations of buffer-rubbed plants. The AVFs of C. amaranticolor gave two peaks of antiviral activity when electrophoresed on 7.5% non denaturing acrylamide gels (PAGE), showing that probably more than one molecular species or polymeric forms were present. AVFs from TNV-infected C. amaranticolor showed several characteristics similar to those of interferons (,); their production was elicited by poly (I:C) treatments, they stimulated the formation of a oligoadenylate synthetase polymerizing ATP into antivirally-active nucleotides, which inhibited TNV synthesis as did 2'-5' A nucleotides. Furthermore, AVFs was inhibiting TNV protein synthesis in a reticulocyte lysate system. Spray applications of AVFs from C. amaranticolor on both C. amaranticolor and Gomphrena globosa plants, 30 min after virus inoculation (respectively with TNV and PVX) significantly inhibited virus infections. Considerations on the practical utilization of the AVFs mechanism against virus infections, are reported.
43872352|Cucumber mosaic virus (CMV) has been reported from potato production areas in Europe, USA, Japan and more frequently in regions with warm climates such as Egypt, India, Saudi Arabia and Syria. As it is considered as an uncommon virus in potato, the characterization of potato isolates of CMV is far behind those from other hosts. In addition to potato, CMV is a common virus infecting many crops in Syria, but nothing is known about its molecular characteristics. The present study aimed to characterize Syrian CMV isolates collected from potato and neighboring tobacco fields. All potato isolates of CMV (total of four) co-infected potato plants with Potato virus Y (PVY) which is the most frequent potato virus in Syria. According to the sequence analyses of the coat protein (CP) coding region, three potato and three tobacco CMV isolates were found to be closely related regardless of the host species or geographic origin, and all belonged to the IA strain subgroup of CMV. A potato CMV isolate, PoCMW-5, readily infected solanaceous plants in which it induced systemic infection, but was less infectious to other hosts including those of heguminosae and Cucurbitaceae. When inoculated on potato plants, PoCMV7-5 or with various PVY strains was able to cause local but not systemic infection in all potato cultivars inoculated. PoCMV7-5 contained heterogeneous variants of satellite RNA which varied in length due to A or/and T deletion/insertion at approximate nucleotide position 225-240. This is the first report on CMV satellite RNA from potato.
42685428|Experiments were conducted in pots and an irrigated rice (Oryza sativa) field to determine the impact of mixed or single nematode inoculations with Aphelenchoides besseyi and Ditylenchus angustus on nematode population dynamics and yield attributes of rice cv. BR3. The reproduction rates were greater in a single nematode species inoculated with either A. besseyi or D. angustus compared to their mixed inoculation. This was probably due to competition between the two nematode species. Greater incidences of white-tip and ufra diseases were observed with single nematode species inoculations compared to mixed species inoculations. Total yield losses ranged from 24 to 47% from mixed inoculations (different ratios) of D. angustus and A. besseyi, compared to 62% from inoculation with D. angustus and 16% from A. besseyi. Single species inoculations (with either D. angustus or A. besseyi) gave greater disease incidence and greater yield reductions than mixed inoculations with both nematodes.

Other investigation confirm delayed bud opening and slow shoot development in all affected plants; this effect is notably more marked where enations are present; it is less apparent when healthy vines are compared with those which have not shown enations in the last one or two years. Besides, results of tests indicate that stem grooving occurs more frequently in enation-diseased 'Italia' and 'Moscato d'Amburgo' vines than healthy ones and that the incidence of plants showing stem grooving is apparently positively related to the duration of enation symptoms. 42685250|In order to produce ToMV-resistant genotypes, a back-cross program for Tm-2 and Tm-2 gene introduction into processing tomato was carried out. 42685492|The Pittosporum [Pittosporum tobira (Thunb.) Ait.] vein clearing disease described in Italy and the Pittosporum dendritic vein yellowing disease found in Yugoslavia have very similar symptoms. On the basis of this resemblance it is possible to suppose that they represent one and the same disease. In this paper the authors communicate that they found a bacilliform virus also in infected Pittosporum [Pittosporum tobira (Thunb.) Ait.] plants from Italy which suffered from vein clearing disease. This virus had the same diameter and similar morphology as the bacilliform virus from Yugoslav Pittosporum plants affected by the dendritic yellowing disease. It seems therefore that the Italian Pittosporum disease is similar or identical to the Yugoslav disease not only by reason of symptoms but also in probable causative agent. 42684731|'White Riesling' grapevines in four locations in New York expressed flavescence dore-like symptoms (FD) during the 1983 growing season. The number of vines showing symptoms ranged from one to five in the four vineyards. The percentage of affected shoots on diseased vines ranged from 24 to 98%. Shoots with FD-like symptoms lacked fibers in the secondary phloem. Phloem necrosis, but no microrganism or virus particles, was observed in thin sections of diseased shoots, petioles and leaf veins. The FD-like symptoms followed an unsually mild winter of 1982-83 and occurred in an exceptionally dry, warm summer. Although most symptom-bearing shoots died during the 1983-84 winter, new growth from affected vines showed FD-like symptoms during the 1984 growing season. 43872371|The effect of triazole-based treatments on Fusarium head blight (FHB), grain yields and the accumulation of deoxynivalenol (DON) in harvested wheat kernels was evaluated by means of twenty multi-site field experiments performed during five consecutive growing seasons (from 2004-2005 to 2008-2009) in Italy. Fungicide treatments were carried out on different cultivars of common wheat (cv. Serio, Blasco, Genio and Savio) and durum wheat (cv. Orobel, Saragolla, San Carlo, Levante, Duilio, Karur and Derrik) after artificial inoculation with a mixture of toxigenic Fusarium graminearum and F. culmorum strains. The application of fungicides containing prothioconazole (Proline or Prosaro) at the beginning of anthesis (BBCH 61) resulted in a consistent reduction of FHB disease severity (by between 39 and 93%) and DON levels in wheat kernels (by between 40 and 91%) and increased wheat yields (from 0.4 to 5.61 ha, average 2.21 ha), as compared to the untreated/inoculated control. Fungicides containing tebuconazole (Folicur SE) and cyproconazole plus prochloraz (Tiptor Xcell) showed a reduced effectiveness compared with prothioconazole-based treatments. All fungicide treatments were more effective in reducing DON and increasing grain yields of common wheat than durum wheat. Results showed that the application of fungicides containing prothioconazole at the beginning of anthesis provided a strong reduction of FHB disease, allowing both an increase in grain yields and a considerable reduction of DON content in wheat kernels.
42685461|Four Wheat streak mosaic virus (WSMV) isolates were obtained by sap transmission from Wheat and wild grasses in 1969-1970 in Western Turkey. The severity of the symptoms caused by the isolates in Wheat, Barley and Oats varied from very mild to very strong. The mildest symptoms were caused by the isolate from Cynodon dactylon (L.) Pers. Its incubation time in Wheat was also the longest, varying from 10 to 15 days, whereas the incubation time of the other three isolates was 5-7 days in Wheat at the same temperature. The thermal inactivation point of all isolates was 56C. Dilution end-point of the isolates varied from 10 to 10, being lowest for the isolate from C. dactylon. The host ranges of the isolates were principally the same, they all infected Wheat, Barley and Oats, but only one did not infect Rye. The same grass species were usually susceptible or resistant to all isolates. No isolate infected Agropyron repens (L.) Beauv. or A. caninum (L.) Beauv. From the data of the literature WSMV seems to be quite a uniform virus in spite of its occurrence in different countries of different continents. 43871749|In Portugal, in 2010, after the first recorded occurrence of Pseudomonas syringae pv. actinidiae (Psa) in a few kiwifruit orchards, and following subsequent records of suspected symptoms at the beginning of 2011, an extensive survey concerning Psa was carried out. 42684919|Since 1983 a potyvirus was repeatedly isolated from Ranunculus asiaticus crops growing in Liguria (Northern Italy). The infected plants had more or less marked leaf chlorosis and deformations, depending on the combinations with other viruses, or appeared symptomless. The potyvirus was transmitted to six species belonging to two different families: Chenopodiaceae and Solanaceae. In fact it induced local lesions in C. amaranticolor, C. quinoa and C. album; it produced systemic mottling in Solanum tuberosum and Physalis floridana and occasional symptomless infection in Nicotiana tabacum 'White Burley'. TIP was between 70 and 73C, DEP between 10 and 10, LIV at room temperature was between 4 and 5 days, and at 4C approximately 3 weeks. The virus was purified from C. amaranticolor infected leaves by clarifiction with 30% chloroform and using an extraction buffer with a basic pH. The purified virus had a nucleoprotein UV absorption profile with a maximum at 260 nm, and a minimum at 244 nm. The modal length of the flexuous particles was close to 750 nm. Pinwheels, scrolls, tubes, laminated aggregates and bundles were observed in cytoplasm of infected Ranunculus and C. amaranticolor plants. In the immunoelectronmicroscopy test the potyvirus strongly reacted with PVY antiserum; partial decoration occurred with bearded iris mosaic virus (BIMV) serum. This is the first report of PVY in Ranunculus. In coltivazioni di Ranunculus asiaticus della Liguria  stato ripetutamente isolato dal 1983 un virus flessuoso appartenente al gruppo Poty. Le piante infette mostravano clorosi pi o meno evidenti, deformazioni a livello fogliare ed in alcuni casi apparivano senza sintomi. La gravit delle alterazioni osservate era sovente in rapporto con la presenza di altre entit virali associate a quella in oggetto. Il virus  risultato trasmissibile meccanicamente solo a Chenopodiacee e Solanacee: ha indotto infatti sintomi locali su C. amaranticolor, C. quinoa e C. album, ha infettato in maniera sistemica Solanum tuberosum e Physalis floridana ed ha sporadicamente prodotto infezione in Nicotiana tabacum 'White Burley'. TIP  risultato compreso fra 70 e 73C, DEP compreso fra 10 e 10, LIV a temperatura ambiente  stato di 4-5 giorni ed a 4C di circa tre settimane. Il virus  stato purificato da foglie di C. amaranticolor mediante chiarificazione con 30% di cloroformio utilizzando un tampone di estrazione a pH basico; la lettura in UV ha permesso di individuare un massimo a 260 nm ed un minimo a 244 nm. La lunghezza media delle particelle virali  risultata essere di 750 nm. Osservazioni ultrastrutturali di sezioni di foglie di Ranuncolo e di C. amaranticolor infette con questo virus hanno confermato la sua appartenenza al gruppo del virus Y della Patata per la presenza di inclusioni proteiche tipiche dei virus di questo gruppo (pinwheels, scrolls, tubes, bundles e laminated aggregates). Le prove di IEM, oltre ad evidenziare la forte affinit sierologica del virus con PVY, hanno permesso di individuare anche correlazioni con BIMV.  questa comunque la prima segnalazione di PVY in Ranuncolo ed una delle prime di questo virus in una pianta ornamentale.

Da essa il fungo  stato isolato fin dai primi stadi di vegetazione e la sua presenza  divenuta sempre pi evidente fino alla formazione della spiga le cui cariossidi sono risultate infette. Le ascospore provenienti dai periteci ehe si trovano a livello dei nodi pi bassi o anche sui residui non bene interrati della coltura precedente, potrebbero tuttavia infettare direttamente le spighe o altri organi, specie se lesi da insetti o da altre cause. Observations carried out on Maize (Zea mays L.) grown in low valleys of Abruzzi have shown the occurrence of severe Fusarium moniliforme infections on roots, stalks, and ears. On the basal nodes, single or aggregated blueblack perithecia constituting the perfect stage of the fungus, Gibberella fujikuroi (Saw.) Ito were also observed. Macroconidia were produced in less than 10 days on and around boiled wheat or maize kernels placed in water agar, which proved the best medium, among those tested, for obtaining macroconidia. Infected seeds, previously soaked for 7 hours in tap water and then heated at 53-56 C for 10 minutes retained germinability but were not freed from the fungus. Greenhouse tests confermed seed transmissibility of the fungus. F. moniliforme was always isolated from internal tissues of plants originating from infected seeds at any growth stage (seedling to ear formation). Newly produced kernels proved also infected. Ascospores from perithecia differentiated on lower nodes or perhaps also those occurring on plant residues emerging from the soil, may infect directly ears or other organs mainly if injured by insects or other agents. Les observations effectues sur de grandes cultures de Mas (Zea mays L.) dans les basses valles des rivires des Abruzzes ont mis en evidence de graves infections des racines, du chaume et des pis causes par Fusarium moniliforme Sheld. Sur le chaume au niveau des noeuds infrieurs il y avait aussi la forme parfaite du champignon, Gibberella fujikuroi (Saw.) Ito sous forme de prithces isols ou agrgs de couleur bleu fonc. Parmi les milieux ordinaires sur lesquels le champignon isol en culture a t lev, celui de geloseeau additionn de caryopses de bl ou de mas pralablement bouillis pendant 20 minutes, a favoris la diffrenciation de macroconidies en moins de 10 jours. Des semences infectes, tout d'abord regonfles dans l'eau et ensuite traites avec la chaleur humide (53-56 C pendant 10 minutes) ont gard leur capacit de germination mais n'ont pas t guries. Des essais effectus en serre ont confirm que la semence infecte transmet la maladie  la plante toute entire. De cette plante on a isol le champignon ds les premiers stades de vgtati et sa prsence est devenue toujours plus vidente jusqu' la formation de l'pi dont les caryopses se sont dmontrs infects. Les ascospores provenant des prithces situs au niveau des noeuds les plus bas ou bien sur les dchets mal enfouis de la culture prcdente pourraient infecter directement les pis ou d'autres organes surtout s'ils sont lss par les insectes ou par d'autres causes.
42684905|In recent years an epidemic leaf spot was observed in spinach crops for the frozen food industry in the provinces of Caserta (Campania region) and Foggia (Puglia region). Numerous black spots, frequently with a water-soaked border and a wide yellow halo, were observed on the diseased plants. The infections occasionally turned systemic causing blackening of the veins and localized wilting. A non-fluorescent pseudomonad with physiological characteristics and fatty acid profiles similar to those of Pseudomonas syringae pv. maculicola (Me Culloch) Young et al., was isolated from infected tissues. Comparative experimental inoculations carried out on other crop plants and on various crucifers did not confirm that the virulent spinach isolates belonged to this taxon. For the moment this bacterial leaf spot of spinach can be considered a new disease caused by a non-fluorescent member of P. syringae van Hall. But the possibility that this bacterium may be a new pathovar invites further investigation. Una maculatura fogliare epidemica  stata osservata in questi ultimi anni in coltivazioni di spinacio da industria delle province di Caserta (regione Campania) e Foggia (regione Puglia). Nelle piante malate si notavano numerose maculature nerastre, spesso con diffuso alone clorotico. Le infezioni pote vano divenire occasionalmente sistemiche causando annerimento delle nervature ed awizzimenti localizzati. Dai tessuti infetti  stata isolata una pseudomonade non-fluorescente con caratteri fisiologici e profilo degli acidi grassi simili a quelli di Pseudomonas syringae pv. maculicola (Me Culloch) Young et al., agente di una maculatura fogliare delle crucifere. Le inoculazioni sperimentali comparative effettuate anche su altre piante agrarie ed in particolare su diverse crucifere non permettono tuttavia di considerare gli isolati virulenti da spinacio come appartenenti a tale taxon. Attualmente, la maculatura batterica dello spinacio pu essere considerata una nuova malattia causata da ceppi non-fluorescenti di P. syringae van Hall., ma non viene esclusa l'ipotesi che possano costituire un nuovo pathovar.
43872370|Fusarium culmorum, a pathogenic fungal species associated with Fusarium Head Blight (FHB) of wheat, can produce the mycotoxin deoxynivalenol (DON) that is frequently found as contaminant in cereals. Wheat haulms, as decomposing plant material, are an important inoculum source of F. culmorum for subsequent crops. In the present work we exploited the mycobiota of haulms buried in natural soil as a source of potential antagonists of F. culmorum and evaluated the role played by DON in determining the composition of such mycobiota. DON was added to wheat haulm pieces that were incubated in three natural soils, namely sandy, clayey and mixed, all with a previous history of wheat cultivation. Composition of mycobiota associated with DON-treated cultural debris was evaluated and compared with mycobiota from control haulms, in order to evaluate the effect of soil type and of the presence of the mycotoxin. Our results showed that DON affected neither the number nor species profile of fungal isolates. Among fungi associated with cultural debris, thirty-nine Pythium spp. isolates were collected and five of them, both from treated and not treated haulms, were tested for their antagonistic ability against F. culmorum. The two strains showing the highest antagonistic activity were further tested against F. oxysporum, a species considered a major competitor of F. culmorum for wheat residues, and frequently recovered from haulms in our experiments. The two Pythium spp. isolates showed a positive antagonistic and mycoparasitic activity against F. culmorum, without affecting the growth of F. oxysporum. Mycobiota of haulms buried in soil represents an interesting source of potential antagonists and competitors for future exploitation in a multitrophic approach for biocontrol of FHB.

L'agente patgeno  stato riferito a Xanthomonas vesicatoria (Doidge) Dows. in base ad alcuni saggi microbiologici e alla sua patogenicit, saggiata sperimentalmente. Sembra che questa sia la prima segnalazione del batterio sul Peperone in Italia. Symptoms of a leaf spotting of Pepper not previously recorded in Italy are described. Xanthomonas vesicatoria (Doidge) Dows. proved to be the causal organism of the disease. The bacterium has been identified on the basis of morphological, microbiological and pathological tests. 42685491|We analyzed the protein and free amino acids of the mycelium of Spaerotheca pannosa var. persicae gathered from leaves of Prunus persicae (L.) Batsch cv. Elberta. We also examined free amino acids of mycelium, infected mycelium free peach leaf tissues, uninfected nearby tissues and healthy leaves. The protein hydrolyzate of the mycelium contained aspartic acid (10.7% of total), glutamic acid (10.3%), glycine (9.1%), alanine (8.4%), serine (7.8%), the amino sugar glucosamine (6.6%), and the other amino acids of plant protein. Among the free amino acids we found very high amounts of glutamine (33.3% of total), glutamate (14.4%), asparagine (11.7%), serine (9.1%) and alanine (8.3%). These amino acids constitute 3/4 of the entire pool. Aspartic acid (3.3%), threonine (2.2%) and leucine (1.9%) were also represented. The variations of the free amino acids from the infected tissues (lacking mycelium), nearby tissues and other tissues of the leaf, have given results substantially similar to those found for other hostparasite complexes: 1) increase in total content of free amino acids (198, 173 and 109% of control), especially in the infected tissues, as well as an increase (in % of totals), of the amides (asparagine and especially glutamine) and arginine 2) decrease in glutamic and aspartic acid, serine and other amino acids. Micelio di Sphaerotheca pannosa (Wallr.) Lv. var. persicae Wor. raccolto su Prunus persicae (L.) Batsch cv. Elberta  stato analizzato nella frazione amminica combinata (proteine) e libera, unitamente alla frazione degli amminoacidi liberi dei tessuti infetti privati di micelio, dei tessuti vicini, degli altri tessuti della foglia infetta e di quelli delia foglia sana (controllo). Dall'idrolisi degli amminoacidi combinati del micelio si  ottenuto un quadro amminico simile a quello dell'ospite e delle piante superiori in genere: acido aspartico (10,6% del totale), acido glutammico (10,3%), glicina (9,1%), alanina (8,4%), serina (7,7%). Nel micelio  stato rinvenuto anche l'aminozucchero glucosammina (6,6%) derivante, con ogni probabilit, dalla idrolisi della chitina della prete irale. Tra gli amminoacidi liberi sono stati trovati tutti quelli normalmente presenti nelle piante superiori, piu tracce di sarcosina, non raro nei funghi. Molto elevato il contenuto, in percento del totale, di glutammina (33,2%), che unitamente ad acido glutammico (14,4%), asparagina (11,7%), serina (9%), alanina (8,3%), costituiscono i 3/4 dell'intero  pool  ; discretamente rappresentati anche acido aspartico (3,3%), treonina (2,1%), leucina (1,9%). In base alla letteratura  stato ipotizzato che gran parte degli amminoacidi trovati nel micelio vengano sintetizzati da azoto inorganico e che parte sia assorbita dal substrato, specie nella fase di sporulazione. L'indagine sulle variazioni del  pool  degli amminoacidi liberi dei tessuti infetti privi di micelio, dei tessuti vicini e di altri tessuti della foglia ha dato risultati sostanzialmente analoghi a quelli ottenuti con altre coppie ospite-parassita: aumento del contenuto totale di amminoacidi liberi (198, 173 e 109% del controllo rispettivamente); specie nel  pool  dei tessuti infetti, si aveva inoltre aumento percentuale delle ammidi (asparagina e glutammina) e soprattutto di arginina e istidina, nonch forte diminuzione di ac. glutammico e aspartico, di serina e altri amminoacidi. On a analys les concentrations des aminoacides libres et protiques contenus dans le myclium de Sphaerotheca pannosa (Wallr.) Lv. var. persicae Wor. recueilli sur des feuilles de Prunus persicae L. (Batsch.) cv. Elberta. On a aussi examin les aminoacides libres dans les tissus infects de l'hte (sans mycelium) et des tissus de la feuille situs  des distances diffrentes de la zone infecte. Dans le  pool  des aminoacides protiques du mycelium on a trouv de l'acide aspartique (10,7% du total), de l'acide glutamique (10,3%), de la glycine (9,1%), de l'alanine (8,4%), de la serine (7,8%), de la glucosamine (6,6%), et d'autres aminoacides des proteins vgtales. Dans le pool des aminoacides libres on a relev beaucoup de glutamine (33,3%), de l'acide glutamique (14,4%), de l'asparagine (11,7%), de la serine (9,1%), de l'alanine (8,3%) et en outre de l'acide aspartique (3,3%), de la threonine (2,2%), de la leucine (1,9%), etc. Dans le pool des aminoacides libres des tissus infects de l'hte on remarques: 1) une augmentation du contenu total des aminoacides libres (198, 173 et 109% du tmoin), particulirement dans les tissus infects, et aussi une augmentation (en % du tmoin) des amides (asparagine et spcialement glutamine) et de l'arginine; 2) une forte diminution de l'acide glutamique et aspartique, de la serine et d'autres aminoacides.
42684375|Cytokinins are secreted exogenously by Helminthosporium avenae Eidam in the synthetic liquid medium supporting its growth. Application of cytokinin extract (obtained from culture filtrates) on oat leaves created green islands beneath infection drops. These green islands acted as localized metabolic sinks toward which nutrients (sugars) were mobilized from the surrounding regions. It is hypothesized that cytokinins may play a role in providing nutrients to the pathogen during pathogenesis in the host tissue. Helminthosporium avenae Eidam secerne esogenamente citocinine nel liquido sintetico in cui esso cresce. L'applicazione di estratto contenente citocinina (ottenuto dai filtrati colturali) su foglie di avena (Avena sativa L.) ha provocato la formazione di isole verdi sotto la goccia. Queste isole verdi agivano corne catini metabolici verso i quali venivano richiamate sostanze nutritive (zuccheri) mobilizzate nei tessuti circostanti. Si formula l'ipotesi che le citocinine abbiano una parte nel rifornimento di sostanze nutritive al patgeno nel corso dlia patogenesi nei tessuti dell'ospite.
42684023|The polyphenoloxidases (PPO) of Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici (Sacc.) Sn. et Hans. infected Tomato plants stem were more sensitive to enzyme inhibitors (DIECA, phenylthiourea and cystein) than those of healthy ones. No significant difference was observed to this respect among different fractions obtained by ammonium sulphate precipitation or centrifugation. Anionic wetting agents SLS and Aerosol OT enhanced the PPO activity of the extracts of both healthy and diseased plants but activation was more pronounced in the former than in the latter case. Increased PPO activity was also observed in healthy Tomato cuttings treated with the same detergents as well as with indoleacetic acid and chlorogenic acid. A higher sensitivity towards DIECA, phenylthiourea and cystein was always associated in this plant with the increase of activity induced in the cuttings. Enzyme preparations from healthy and infected plants showed no differences in substrate specificity, pH curve, Km and isoenzyme pattern on disc polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. It is suggested that infection itself activates previously latent forms of the enzyme rendering them more labile and sensitive to the inhibitory action of copper-chelating agents. The fact that the increase of PPO activity can be induced by different chemical, mechanical and infectious factors and is constantly accompanied by increased sensitivity of the enzymes towards chemical inhibitors is emphasized and discussed. Le polifenolossidasi (PPO) di fusti di piante di Pomodoro infette da Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyd. et Hans. sono risultate pi sensibili ad inibitori enzimatici quali l'acido dietilcarbammico (DIECA), la feniltiourea e la cisteina di quelle di fusti di piante sane. Nessuna differenza significativa  stata a questo riguardo riscontrata tra diverse frazioni ottenute per precipitazione con solfato d'ammonio o per centrifugazione. Le sostanze bagnanti anioniche lauril solfato sodico (SLS) e dioctilsolfosuccinato sodico (Aerosol OT) aumentano l'attivit polifenolossidasica sia negli estratti delle piante sane, sia in quelli delle piante malate, ma nei primi in misura maggiore che nei secondi. Aumentata attivit polifenol-ossidasica  stata anche osservata in fusti recisi di Pomodoro previamente trattati con gli stessi due detergenti. In tali fusti recisi, l'incremento di attivit indotta  apparso sempre associate a una maggior sensibilit dell'enzima nei confronti del DIECA, della feniltiourea e della cisteina. Nessuna differenza  stata riscontrata tra i preparati enzimatici di piante sane e malate per quanto concerne specificit per il substrato, curve di attivit in funzione del pH, Km e mappe degli isoenzimi separati per elettroforesi su disco. Si suppone che le infezioni di Fusarium agiscano attivando forme latenti dell'enzima, rendendole nei contempo pi labili e sensibili all'azione inibente degli agenti chelanti il rame. Anche l'acido 3-indolacetico (IAA) e l'acido clorogenico (CGA) inducono aumenti di attivit polifenolossidasica e contemporanei aumenti di sensibilit verso gli inibitori. Ci  particularmente interessante, in quanto il contenuto di dette sostanze sale vistosamente nelle piante in seguito all'infezione. D'altra parte si deve considerare che un simile efetto, anche se in misura pi limitata,  prodotto dalla semplice recisione. L'aumento di attivit polifenolossidasica nei Pomodoro sembra perianto essere una risposta non specificamente indotta da diversi fattori chimici, meccanici ed infettivi. Les polyphenol oxydases des tiges de plantes de Tomate infectes par le Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. lycopersici (Sacc.) Snyd. et Hans, sont plus sensibles aux inhibiteurs enzymatiques acide diethylcarbamique, phenylthioure et cisti ne que celles des tiges de plantes saines. Aucune diffrence significative n'a t observe  ce propos entre les differentes fractions obtenues par prcipitation avec le sulphate d'ammonium ou par centrifugation. Les substances tensioactives anioniques sodium lauryl-sulphate (SLS) et sodium dioctilsulphosuccinate (Aerosol OT) augmentent l'activit polyphenol oxydasique soit dans les extraits de plantes saines, soit dans ceux des plantes malades, mais d'une faon plus vidente dans le premier cas que dans le second. Une activit polyphenol oxydasique plus leve a t aussi observe dans des plantes coupes de Tomate pralablement traites avec les mmes dtergents ainsi qu'avec les acides 3-indoleacetique et chlorogenique. Dans ces plantes l'augmentation d'activit a t constamment associe  une sensibilit plus leve de l'enzyme  l'gard du DIECA, de la phenyl thioure et de le cystine. Aucune diffrence n'a t observe entre les preparations enzymatiques des plantes saines et de celles malades, en ce qui concerne la spcificit pour le substrat, les courbes d'activit en fonction du pH, Km et les isoenzymes spars par lectrophorse sur disque. On suggre que les infections de Fusarium agissent en activant des formes latentes de l'enzyme qui en mme temps, deviennent plus sensibles  l'action inhibitrice des chelateurs du cuivre. On a soulign le fait que l'augmentation de l'activit polyphenol oxydasique, induite par les diffrents facteurs chimiques, mecaniques et infectieux, est accompagne dans tout les cas d'une sensibilit plus leve de l'enzyme aux inhibiteurs.
